input: name: spinach with chickpeas ; ingredients: olive oil, garlic, onion, cumin, cayenne pepper, turmeric, canned chick-peas, baby spinach, pimientos, salt and pepper ; preparation:Heat the oil in a large, lidded skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and cook for 2 minutes, or until golden, but not brown. Remove with a slotted spoon and discard. Add the onion and cumin, turmeric and cayenne and cook, stirring for about 5 minutes or until soft. Add the chickpeas and stir until coated with the oil and spices. Stir in the spinach with just the water clinging to it, cover and cook for 4-5 minutes until wilted. Uncover, stir in the pimientos and continue cooking, stirring gently until the liquid evaporates. Season to taste and serve. ; name: ww raspberry balsamic chicken ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, flour, low-fat chicken broth, cornstarch, low-sugar raspberry preserves, balsamic vinegar ; preparation:Cut chicken into bite sized pieces. Salt and pepper to taste. Dredge in flour, shaking excess flour from the meat. Cook chicken in a nonstick skillet or wok on medium heat approximately 15 minutes. Remove chicken from skillet. Mix broth, cornstarch and preserves in skillet over medium heat. Stir in vinegar. Add chicken. Cook approximately 10 minutes, turning after 5. ; name: copycat pancho s cheese dip ; ingredients: american cheese, cumin powder, garlic powder, rotel tomatoes & chilies ; preparation:Melt cheese until smooth in a double boiler or microwave, stirring throughout. Puree rotel in blender or small processor. Stir into the cheese the rotel, cumin and garlic. If too thick, add a little water. Serve with tortilla chips. Enjoy. ; name: aloha cheesecake ; ingredients: vanilla wafer crumbs, margarine, cream cheese, sugar, milk, eggs, macadamia nuts, pineapple, kiwi ; preparation:Combine crumbs and margarine. Press onto bottom of 9-inch springform pan. Bake at 350 f, 10 minutes. Combine cream cheese, sugar and milk, mixing at medium speed on electric mixer until well blended. Add eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Stir in nuts. Pour over crust. Bake at 350 f, 45 minutes. Loosen cake from rim of pan. Cool before removing rim of pan. Chill. Before serving, top with fruit. ; name: almost fat free tuna helper healthy ; ingredients: whole wheat pasta, garbanzo beans, salt, tuna, pepper, onion, olive oil ; preparation:Puree cooked garbanzo beans in a blender -- add water if necessary to get the blender to work. Chop onions and fry in olive oil. Add pureed beans, salt, crushed pepper, and tuna to fried onions. Add water until the mixture is of sauce consistency and simmer 10 minutes. Boil pasta as directed on package and drain -- add to sauce mixture. ; name: duk guk authenitc korean rice cake and beef soup ; ingredients: korean rice cake, beef shoulder, water, dashida, salt, sesame oil, garlic clove, soy sauce, green onion ; preparation:Fill a large pot with the water and stir in the salt and add the beef. Boil fifteen minutes. As the beef is boiling, foam will rise up to the top of the pot. Simply scrape it off with a shallow, large spoon and dump into a bowl. Add the duk, dashida, sesame oil, garlic, and soy sauce and boil 15 more minutes. Add all the other ingredients and heat about 5 more minutes. Traditionally topped with carrot strips, fried egg cut into strips, and kim. ; name: ritzy cookies ; ingredients: smooth peanut butter, semisweet chocolate morsel, butterscotch chips, ritz cracker ; preparation:Spread peanut butter on crackers and top with another cracker. Prepare several. Slowly melt morsels on low heat. Dip cookies in melted morsels, place on wax paper. Cool. Place in container and refridge. ; name: mocha almond bars ; ingredients: flour, sugar, butter, egg, instant coffee granules, sliced almonds, powdered sugar, almond extract, milk ; preparation:

name: blueberry grape salad ; ingredients: grape jell-o, boiling water, crushed pineapple, blueberry pie filling, cream cheese, sour cream, sugar, vanilla, nuts ; preparation:Dissolve jell-o in water. Add pineapple and pie filling. Pour into 9x13 inch glass dish and chill until set. Stir together cream cheese and sour cream. Add sugar and vanilla. Blend well. Spread cream cheese mixture over chilled jell-o. Sprinkle with chopped nuts. Chill. ; name: chicken egg pie ; ingredients: crescent roll dough, cheddar cheese, bacon, cooked ham, eggs, milk, salt and pepper ; preparation:Unroll crescent dough. Separate into triangles. Arrange in a greased 9 inch pie plate, forming crust. Seal seams and perforations. Sprinkle with 1 cup cheese, bacon and ham. In a bowl, beat eggs, milk, salt and pepper. Pour over the ham. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Cover edges of crust loosely with foil. Bake at 350 for 20 to 25 minutes. Remove foil. Bake 20 minutes longer or until a knife inserted comes out clean. ; name: crab stuffed red snapper ; ingredients: onion, butter, crabmeat, fresh breadcrumb, fresh parsley, heavy cream, lemon thyme, red snapper, salt and pepper, dry white wine ; preparation:Saute onion in butter until golden. Remove from heat and mix in the crab meat, bread crumbs, parsley, heavy cream, and lemon thyme. Sprinkle cavity of fish lightly with salt and pepper. Stuff the fish and skewer edges securely. Mix wine and butter together. Place fish in a greased baking pan, pour wine-butter mixture over fish. Bake in 400f oven, uncovered for 30 minutes or just until the flesh is opaque, basting frequently with wine sauce. ; name: baked lemon pudding ; ingredients: sugar, flour, salt, lemon juice, lemon, zest of, eggs, butter, milk ; preparation:In a medium mixing bowl, combine sugar, flour and salt. Stir in lemon juice, zest, beaten egg yolks, butter and milk. In a separate bowl, beat egg whites until stiff but not dry. Fold into lemon mixture. Pour into buttered 6 cup casserole dish. Place this casserole inside a large pan. Pour hot water into the 9x13 pan to a depth of about 1 inch. Bake at 350 degrees for about 40 minutes or until the topping is set and golden brown. During baking this separates into a cake-like topping with a lemon sauce beneath. ; name: fat free sour cream pound cake ; ingredients: nonfat sour cream, egg whites, vanilla, unbleached flour, splenda sugar substitute, baking powder, baking soda ; preparation:Preheat oven to 325f. Oil and flour a loaf pan. In a mixing bowl, combine sour cream, egg whites, and vanilla. In another mixing bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder, and baking soda. Combine wet and dry ingredients until just moistened. Pour into pan and bake for 1 hour or until a knife inserted into the center comes out clean. ; name: basil spinach tomato pork strips ; ingredients: boneless pork chops, basil, pepper, salt, frozen chopped spinach, white onion, diced tomatoes, butter ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350. Cut the pork chops into strips. Sprinkle with basil, pepper, and salt. Top with veggies, and pats of butter or margarine. Cover with aluminum foil and bake for 40 minutes, or until pork is fully cooked. ; name: buffalo style chicken nachos recipe ; ingredients: cooked chicken, hot sauce, butter, tortilla chips, cheddar cheese, green onions, ranch dressing ; preparation:In a bowl, toss chicken with hot sauce and butter. Layer chips, chicken mixture and cheese in baking dish. Sprinkle with green onions. Bake nachos at 350f for 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Splash on more hot sauce to taste. Serve with ranch dressing on the side for dipping. ; name: mushroom sausage stuffing ; ingredients: bread cubes, sausage, mushrooms, celery, onion, butter, chicken broth, salt, black pepper, sage ; preparation:

name: homemade soft taco shells ; ingredients: flour, cornmeal, salt, egg, cold water ; preparation:Combine all ingredients and beat until smooth. Fry slowly on a griddle or in large frypan in small amounts of cooking oil. Using a ladle, pour and swirl into a desired size circle. Let fry until the top is dry, then flip for a minute or so to set the other side. If they turn out like crepes, make the shells thicker. Fill with your favorite ingredients. We use seasoned hamburger, tomato, onion, lettuce, cheese, green peppers, olives. ; name: all day mushrooms ; ingredients: button mushrooms, butter, burgundy wine, worcestershire sauce, garlic, dried dill, pepper, chicken bouillon cubes, beef bouillon cubes ; preparation:Wet a paper towel and wipe any dirt from the mushrooms. Place the mushrooms in a large stockpot. Add the remaining ingredients to the pot. The liquid will not cover the mushrooms at first. Cook, covered, over very low heat for 4 hours. Stir occasionally so that all of the mushrooms are completely coated with the cooking liquid. Remove the cover and cook for an additional 4 hours. The mushrooms will shrimk by half and become saturated with cooking liquid. Remove with a slotted spoon and serve in a bowl. ; name: nana s sugar cream pie ; ingredients: sugar, flour, salt, whipping cream, milk, vanilla, cinnamon, butter, unbaked pie shell ; preparation:Mix sugar, flour and salt together. Add cream, milk and vanilla. Pour mixture into a 9 inch unbaked pie shell. Sprinkle with cinnamon and dot with butter. Bake in 425 f oven for 10 mins. Reduce heat to 350 f and bake for 1 hr 15 mins. ; name: ham fried rice ; ingredients: cooked rice, oil, garlic, onion, soy sauce, eggs, ham, teriyaki sauce, peas ; preparation:In a wok or frying pan heat 2 tbsp oil. Add onions and garlic. Saut until onions are tender. Add rice, soy sauce, eggs, teriyaki sauce and ham. Let sit 10-15 minutes stirring occasionally. The less you stir it the more crunchiness there will be. Add peas, cover and let stand 5 minutes. Garnish with green onions and sesame seeds. ; name: roasted figs with prosciutto and gorgonzola ; ingredients: fresh figs, gorgonzola, prosciutto, rocket, extra virgin olive oil, salt, cracked pepper ; preparation:Heat oven to 200oc. Make a small cut at the top of each fig and push in a little piece of gorgonzola. Wrap each fig in a slice of prosciutto. Bake in the oven for 15 minutes. The cheese will melt and the prosciutto will be crisp. Serve immediately on rocket leaves dressed in olive oil and salt, and finish with a little finely cracked pepper. ; name: canadian living corn chowder ; ingredients: bacon, onion, celery ribs, flour, chicken stock, potato, milk, corn, salt and pepper ; preparation:In large heavy saucepan, cook bacon until crisp. Add onion and celety cooking until soft, but not brown. Stir in flour and them slowly adding in chicken stock. Add potatoes and simmer 10 minutes or until tender. Add milk and cream corn. Simmer about 10 minutes. Add salt and pepper to taste. Do not boil. ; name: cucumber tomato salad ; ingredients: tomatoes, cucumber, green onion, italian salad dressing, vinegar, fresh basil, salt, pepper, garlic salt ; preparation:In a serving bowl, layer half of the tomatoes, all of the cucumber, then remaining tomatoes. Sprinkle with onion. Combine remaining ingredients in a jar with a tight fitting lid and shake well. Pour over salad. Cover and chill for 25 to 30 minutes or until ready to serve. ; name: turkey and stuffing ring ; ingredients: dry bread cubes, cooked turkey, swiss cheese, dry onion, eggs, milk, salt, pepper, poultry seasoning ; preparation:

name: mexican grilled cheese sandwiches ; ingredients: bread, jalapeno jack cheese, taco seasoning mix, salsa, butter ; preparation:Heat a griddle, sandwich maker, or a skillet over medium heat. In small bowl, mix butter and taco seasoning mix. Spread half of mixture on one side of each piece of bread. Put cheese slices onto bread and top with remaining bread slices. Place the sandwiches, buttered sides down, on hot griddle. Spread top sides with remaining butter mixture. Cook until golden brown on both sides and cheese is melted. Serve with salsa as a dip. ; name: greek red snapper ; ingredients: red snapper, onion, green pepper, garlic cloves, whole tomatoes, white wine, parsley, basil, greek olives ; preparation:Saute onion, pepper, and garlic in hot oil. Add tomatoes. Simmer 15 minutes. Brush a shallow baking dish with olive oil and place fish in dish. Pour wine over top. Pour hot tomato mixture over fish. Dot with a little butter. Bake at 350f for 45 minutes to 1 hour. Combine parsley, basil and olives and sprinkle over fish. ; name: chicken wings in honey bbq sauce ; ingredients: chicken wings, salt and black pepper, honey, soy sauce, barbecue sauce, oil, garlic cloves ; preparation:Cut off and discard wing. Cut each wing at joint to make two sections. Season wings with salt and pepper, to taste. Place wings on broiler pan and broil about 6 inches from heat for 10 minutes on each side or until brown. Transfer wings to slow cooker. Combine remaining ingredients in a bowl. Pour over chicken wings. Cover and place slow cooker on high for 2 hour or low for 4 hours. ; name: vegetarian mushroom gravy ; ingredients: vegetable oil, mushroom, tamari soy sauce, fresh ground black pepper, hot water, cornstarch ; preparation:Saut mushrooms, tamari and black pepper in oil until mushrooms are tender. Add water and bring to a boil. Slowly add cornstarch and cook at a low boil, continuing to stir until the gravy is thick and clear. Adjust seasoning as necessary. Serve. ; name: spinach ham quiche ; ingredients: 9 inch pie shell, eggs, heavy whipping cream, tabasco sauce, tarragon, chicken base, fresh spinach, swiss cheese, parmesan cheese, ham ; preparation:In a large bowl combine eggs, whipping cream, tabasco, tarragon& chicken base. Whip until smooth. Arrange the pie shell in a 9 inch pie pan. Add the grated swiss cheese, spinach, ham and parmesan cheese. Pour the egg mixture over all and bake at 350 for 40-45 minutes. ; name: pig eatin good cake ; ingredients: yellow cake mix, mandarin oranges, eggs, oil, cool whip, crushed pineapple, instant vanilla pudding ; preparation:Mix cake mix with undrained mandarin oranges, eggs and oil. Bake in 13 x 9 inch greased and floured pan at 350 for 30-35 minutes. Let cool mix coolwhip, drained pineapple and instant pudding together. Frost cooled cake. Store in refrigerator. ; name: slow cooker crock pot swiss steak ; ingredients: round steaks, flour, salt & pepper, onion, carrot, celery rib, tomato sauce ; preparation:Cut round steak into serving pieces. Season flour with salt & pepper. Dredge meat in seasoned flour. Place onions in bottom of slow cooker. Add meat. Top with carrots & celery & cover with tomato sauce. Cover & cook on low 8-10 hours. ; name: peanut szechuan pasta ; ingredients: spaghetti, broccoli florets, chunky peanut butter, vegetable stock, soy sauce, seasoned rice vinegar, oil, garlic cloves, dry crushed red pepper ; preparation:

name: pineapple garlic pork chops ; ingredients: pork loin chops, unsweetened pineapple juice, dry sherry, brown sugar, dried rosemary leaves, garlic cloves ; preparation:Combine all ingredients, except pork chops, mix well. Place chops in shallow dish and pour marinade over them. Cover a refrigerate overnight, turning occasionally. Remove pork from marinade. Broil 5-6 minutes on each side basting once with the marinade or grill and marinade once during cooking. ; name: blueberry sauce ; ingredients: blueberries, grape juice, ground cinnamon, lemon, rind of, cornstarch, water ; preparation:Combine first 4 ingredients in a medium saucepan& bring to a boil. Reduce heat& simmer gently for 3 to 4 minutes until blueberries become tender. Combine cornstarch& water in a small bowl until smooth. Add to blueberry mixture& cook, stirring until thickened, about 5 more minutes. Serve warm or cold. ; name: oven barbque country pork not ribs ; ingredients: country pork strips, brown sugar, garlic, apple juice concentrate, dried chipotle powder, black pepper, kosher salt ; preparation:Mix everything and coat both sides of pork. Lay the coated strips on a parchment covered sheet pan with sides. This worked for me and avoided that messy cleanup. Let marinade room at temp for half an hour. Bake in a 275 oven for about 90 min, turning once. Remove the meat, pour off any grease, put a flat rack on the pan, return meat laying now on the rack. Run the oven up to 450f bake for about 10 minutes more to crisp. ; name: crock pot beef teriyaki ; ingredients: lean beef, crushed pineapple in juice, water, low sodium soy sauce, brown sugar, ground ginger, garlic powder, cornstarch, white rice ; preparation:Add the pineapple with juice, water, soy sauce, sugar, & spices to a crock-pot. Stir to melt the sugar then add in the beef cubes. Cover with a lid then cook on high for 4 hours. Mix the cornstarch with 2 tbsp of warm water then stir into the sauce. Recover & cook for another 20-30 minutes, until the sauce thickens. Serve over rice. ; name: french green beans sauted with mushrooms and almonds ; ingredients: olive oil, garlic cloves, button mushrooms, whole almond, frozen french-cut green beans, soy sauce ; preparation:Heat oil over medium heat. Saut garlic until soft, being careful not to let it burn. Add sliced mushrooms and saut until they look fairly cooked and shiny. Add almonds and saut for a couple more minutes. Finally, add frozen green beans and splash of soy sauce. Stir frequently until beans are just cooked and, of course, no longer frozen. If not on the south beach diet or watching sugar intake, you could add oyster sauce or other asian condiment to the mixture. ; name: lemon berry pie ; ingredients: raspberries, frozen lemonade, cool whip topping, sweetened condensed milk, yellow food coloring, graham cracker pie crusts ; preparation:Set aside 1 cup berries for garnish. In a large bowl and using a rubber spatula, carefully mix lemonade concentrate and whipped topping. Fold in condensed milk, food coloring and remaining berries. Refrigerate covered up to six hours. Fold mixture into crust. Place reserved berries in a decorative manner on top of filling. Refrigerate until ready to serve. ; name: tropical rainfall ; ingredients: orange juice, apple juice, light hawaiian punch, cracked ice, carbonated lemon-lime beverage ; preparation:Pour the juices into a pitcher. Stir. Pop in the fridge to chill. Serve over ice or make an ice ring. If you add any soda, do not add until just before serving. ; name: vegan macaroni and yeast ; ingredients: small elbow macaroni, vegan mayonnaise, nutritional yeast, non-dairy milk substitute, salt and pepper, breadcrumbs ; preparation:

name: coconut or pina colada cake ; ingredients: white cake mix, egg whites, oil, water, coconut, cream of coconut, cool whip ; preparation:Prepare cake mix according to package directions adding coconut to the batter. Bake in a greased, floured 13x9x2 inch pan. When done, remove from oven and punch deep holes in cake with a fork. Pour the cream of coconut into holes. Let sit until cool before icing. For icing, mix cool whip, coconut, and liquer if desired. Spread icing on cake and store refrigerated. ; name: brandy walnut sauce microwave ; ingredients: dark brown sugar, unsalted butter, half-and-half, light corn syrup, brandy, walnuts ; preparation:Combine first four inrgedients in a 4 cup microwaveable dish. Cook, uncovered on high for 2 minutes. Stir. Cook again on high 1-3 minutes or more until boiling. Stir in brandy and walnuts. Cook one minute more. Spoon warm over icecream or whatever desired. ; name: real somali tea ; ingredients: water, black tea bags, ginger, whole cloves, cardamom pods, cinnamon stick, nutmeg, milk ; preparation:Peel and crush about a thumb sized amount of fresh ginger. Crush cardemon and cloves. Add all ingredients to pot of water except milk. Boil for 30 mins or until spices permeate tea. Add milk to each serving cup to taste. ; name: smoked sausage primavera ; ingredients: spaghetti, frozen broccoli florets, sweet red pepper, onion, smoked sausage, water, evaporated milk, butter, italian seasoning, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Cook spaghetti according to package directions adding the vegetables during the last 4 minutes. Meanwhile, in a large skillet, bring sausage and water to a boil. Reduce heat, cover and simmer for 8 minutes or unti heated through. Add milk, butter and italian seasoning. Cook and stir until butter is melted. Drain spaghetti & vegetables and return them to the pan. Add parmesan cheese and sausage mixture to the pasta & veggies - toss to coat. Serve immediately. ; name: larb ; ingredients: ground chicken, fish sauce, lime juice, green onion, red onion, rice powder, lettuce, chili pepper, mint leaf ; preparation:Cook the ground meat until done and drain. Mix the meat with the lime juice, fish sauce, red onions, chili peppers, roasted rice powder and mix well. Serve on bed of lettuce and top with sliced green onions and mint leaves. May add additional red peppers if you desire it hotter. Enjoy. ; name: borani kadu roasted butternut squash verrines in the afghan man ; ingredients: butternut squash, olive oil, ground turmeric, ground coriander, ground cumin, greek yogurt, sea salt, dried mint ; preparation:Preheat your oven to 400 f. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Place the squash in a large bowl and give it a healthy drizzle of olive oil. Toss to coat, then season with turmeric, coriander, cumin and tods again. Arrange squash on the prepared baking sheet and place in oven for 20 minutes. Season with sea salt and let cool to room temperature, about 15 minutes. Spoon yogurt into individual glasses, then layer in squash slices. If you prefer, you can dollop the yogurt onto small plates and top with squash. Sprinkle with dried mint and drizzle with olive oil. Serve with pillowy bread like nan-e-barberi or pita bread. ; name: watercrest salad ; ingredients: crushed pineapple, pistachio pudding mix, cool whip, nuts, miniature marshmallow, mandarin oranges, bananas, cherries ; preparation:Mix pudding with cool whip. Fold in fruit. Add nuts and fold gently to mix. Add marshmallows and fold gently again. Chill 1 hour. Serve. ; name: sausage vegetable casserole ; ingredients: sausages, onion, bacon, french onion soup mix, water, frozen mixed vegetables, fresh parsley ; preparation:

name: tasty one pan potatoes romanoff with beef and veggies ; ingredients: ground beef, condensed cream of mushroom soup, au gratin potatoes, boiling water, vegetables ; preparation:Brown meat in 10-inch skillet. Drain off excess fat. Add potato slices and cheese sauce mix. Stir in cream of mushroom soup and boiling water. Simmer for 20 minutes or until slices are tender, stirring occasionally. Stir in the veggies and serve. Makes 6 to 8 servings. ; name: duchess potatoes ; ingredients: mashed potatoes, butter, salt, eggs ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450f and butter a baking dish. Combine the mashed potatoes, butter and salt with the beaten egg yolks. Pipe into balls, hearts, or other shapes using a pastry bag. Place in dish and brush with slightly beaten egg whites. Brown in oven. ; name: peach shortcake muffins ; ingredients: flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, ginger, margarine, milk, peaches, cinnamon ; preparation:Combine first five ingredients in large bowl. Cut in margarine with pastry blender until mixture is crumbly. Add milk and peaches, stirring just until blended. Spoon into greased muffin cups. Sprinkle with topping mixture. Bake at 400f for 20-25 minutes or until set and golden. ; name: ginger lime melon balls ; ingredients: fresh lime juice, water, crystallized ginger, lime zest, melon balls, of fresh mint ; preparation:In small saucepan, combine juice, water, ginger and zest. Set pan over medium-high heat and bring to boil. Boil 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until mixture reduces to 2 tablespoons. Strain mixture though fine sieve to remove zest. Place melon in bowl, toss with ginger-lime mixture. Let sit for 15 minutes. You can drain the sauce or serve it with the melon. Garnish with mint. ; name: roasted ratatouille with butternut squash ; ingredients: red onions, zucchini, bell peppers, butternut squash, garlic, cheddar cheese, olive oil, tomatoes, fresh thyme ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 400f. Place all the ingredients, except 3 garlic cloves and cheese slices, in a large, deep roasting tin. Roast in the oven for about 40 minutes or until the vegetables are beginning to soften and turn golden brown. Stir occasionally as they cook. While the vegetables are cooking, place 3 garlic cloves and cheese slices in a food processor or blender and pulse into rough breadcrumbs. When the vegetables are ready, remove from the oven and season with freshly ground black pepper. Sprinkle the crumbs over the ratatouille and return to the oven for a further 15 minutes or until the crumbs are golden and crispy. ; name: peach royale ; ingredients: peaches, nonfat milk, pineapple-orange juice concentrate, sugar, vanilla, ice cubes ; preparation:If desired, set aside four fruit slices for garnish. In blender, combine milk and juice concentrate. Add remaining fruit, sugar and vanilla. Cover and blend until smooth. Add ice cubes. Cover and blend until nearly smooth. If desired, garnish each serving with reserved fruit. ; name: pacific pesto grilled halibut ; ingredients: fresh cilantro, garlic clove, lime zest, fresh lime juice, jalapeno, soy sauce, vegetable oil, halibut steaks, new potatoes ; preparation:Preheat broiler. In a food processor or blender, combine the cilantro, garlic, lime zest and juice, jalapeo, and soy sauce. Blend until mixed. With processor or blender running, gradually pour in the oil and process until thickened. Place the fish steaks on a greased broiler pan. Brush top of each steak with the sauce. Coat the potatoes with remaining sauce. Place in broiler pan with the fish. Broil about 10 minutes, or until fish flakes with a fork. ; name: goldfish checkerboard sandwiches ; ingredients: white bread, crunchy peanut butter, whole wheat bread, grape jelly, goldfish crackers ; preparation:

name: tin foil chicken veggies ; ingredients: barbecue sauce, boneless skinless chicken breast, green pepper, red pepper, new potatoes, frozen corn, frozen peas, onion, canned mushroom slices ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350f. Tear off four sheets of foil, each about 12 by 15 inches. Smear about a tablespoon of barbecue sauce in a rough rectangular shape in the middle of each sheet. Divide the chicken slices among the four sheets atop the barbecue sauce. Add the peppers, potatoes and any other vegetables. Drizzle another tablespoon of barbecue sauce over top. In half-inch pleats, fold the foil over itself first lengthwise and then crosswise to create tightly sealed packets. Place on a baking sheet and bake for 50 minutes or until chicken is fully cooked. Carefully cut open the packets. ; name: lucerne onion salad luzerner zwiebelsalat ; ingredients: onions, oil, garlic cloves, wine vinegar, rosemary, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Prepare a marinade of vinegar, rosemary, coriander, salt, pepper. Cut the peeled onions and garlic slices. Fry onions in oil until golden brown. Drain and while still hot, add to the marinade. Refrigerate. ; name: creamy cheddar potatoes ; ingredients: butter, potatoes, salt, fresh ground black pepper, milk, cheddar cheese, parsley ; preparation:In large, nonstick skillet, melt butter. Add potatoes and cook over medium heat until almost tender and lightly browned. Add salt, pepper, and milk, continuing to cook until milk is absorbed and potatoes are tender. Sprinkle with cheese, heating until melted. Stir well, sprinkle with chopped parsley and serve. ; name: lime and lemonade ; ingredients: frozen lemonade concentrate, ice cubes, lime juice, limes, carbonated lemonade ; preparation:Place ice cubes, lime juice and frozen lemonade concentrate in a blender, and blend until ice is very fine. Place this lemon slush in a freezer safe tray, cover and freeze for at least two hours. Slice the 8 limes very thin, reserve a few for glasses and the top of the pitcher. Put the remaining limes in a large pitcher. Layer the slush over the sliced limes. Just before serving add the carbonated lemonade. ; name: super creamy and cheesy mac and cheese ; ingredients: elbow macaroni, milk, flour, salt and pepper, butter, cheese ; preparation:Cook the macaroni and set aside. In a pot, melt the butter and mix in salt and pepper. Slowly add in the flour, stirring continuously. Gradually add the milk and stir the mixture until smooth. Add the cheese on a low heat and melt into the mixture. Once the mixture is at your desired consistency, mix in the drained macaroni. ; name: light pancakes ; ingredients: low-fat biscuit mix, skim milk, splenda sugar substitute, lemon juice, baking powder ; preparation:Stir all ingredients together until well blended. Let stand 10 minutes. Using ladle, spoon on to hot griddle until edges are dry and middle is bubbly. Turn. Cook until golden. ; name: smoked shrimp with poblano tomatillo sauce ; ingredients: tomatillo, poblano chiles, whipping cream, shallot, butter, salt, charcoal, hickory wood chunks, jumbo shrimp ; preparation:Using a blender puree tomatillos and chilies. Transfer pureed mixture to a skillet and add cream and shallot, cooking over medium high heat, stirring until thickened. Strain sauce. Over low heat whisk in butter 1 tablespoon at a time and season with salt. Keep warm. In a barbecue, heat the mesquite charcoal and hickory chunks until coals are white. Add more hickory chunks. As soon as smoke rises, push coals and chunks to one side of barbecue. Oil grill well. Arrange shrimp on side of grill not over heat source. Cover and smoke for 6-8 minutes or until shrimp is opaque. Serve shrimp with sauce. ; name: hawaiian chicken white rice made simple ; ingredients: chicken breast halves, flour, soy sauce, sugar, pineapple chunk, parsley, white rice, parsley sprig ; preparation:

name: salmon with mozzarella ; ingredients: salmon fillets, salt, black pepper, butter, tomatoes, sun-dried tomatoes packed in oil, mozzarella cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 225c. Remove skin and bones from the salmon. Season with salt and pepper on both sides and cut into four pieces. Thinly slice tomato and mozzarelle cheese. Cut sun-dried tomatoes into strips. Heat butter in a non-stick coated frying pan and cook salmon pieces, 2-3 minutes per side. Place cooked salmon in an oven-proof dish. Layer tomato slices, sun-dried tomato strips and finally mozzarella slices over the salmon. Sprinkle some black pepper on top. Bake in the preheated oven for about 5 minutes, or until mozzarella has melted. ; name: chorizo chowder ; ingredients: butter, onion, garlic cloves, floury potatoes, leek, cayenne, vegetable stock, chorizo sausages, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Heat the butter in a large pan and cook the onion, garlic and potatoes for 5 minutes until lightly golden. Add the leek and cayenne and cook for a further 1 minute. Add the stock, bring to the boil and simmer for 20 minutes until the potatoes are very soft and beginning to break up into the soup. Using a potato masher, roughly mash the potatoes into the soup. Stir in the chorizo and simmer gently for 5 minutes until the orange coloured oil from the chorizo rises to the surface of the soup. Check the seasoning, ladle into bowls and garnish with a sprig of flat leaf parsley. Serve with lots of crusty bread for mopping up. ; name: grilled ham cheese quesadillas ; ingredients: tortillas, dijon mustard, ham, sweet green pepper, cheddar cheese, green onion, jalapeno, salsa ; preparation:Lay the tortilla on a work surface, spread it with the mustard. Lay the ham on top to cover the whole tortilla. On one side of the tortilla lay the peppers, sharp cheddar and sprinkle the chopped green onion and jalepeno over. Fold the tortilla in half. Have the grill very hot, lay the folded quesadilla on the grill and press it down. Grill for about 6 or 8 minutes until the cheese melts, then flip it and grill the other side. Use a panni press if available and no need to flip. Remove to plate and slice in half. Spread half the salsa on each tortilla half. ; name: veal chops victor ; ingredients: veal chops, olive oil, onion, carrot, dry sherry, diced tomato, sliced mushrooms, green pepper, fresh parsley ; preparation:Season& brown chops in olive oil with onions. Add sliced carrots, dry sherry, diced tomatoes. Cover& simmer 1 hour. Saute sliced mushrooms and green pepper in butter until tender. Add to chops with parsley just before serving. ; name: bacon cucumber and cream cheese sammies ; ingredients: pumpernickel bread, cream cheese, good seasonings italian salad dressing mix, cucumber, bacon ; preparation:Cook bacon in a 400 degree oven until crisp, being careful not to burn it, about 10-14 minutes. If you prefer, you could fry it in a pan or on the griddle. Drain well and let cool. In a bowl, mix the cream cheese and seasoning packet together. Thinly slice the cucumber and set it aside. Spread 2 slices of pumpernickle with a thin layer of the cream cheese mixture. On one slice, layer the cucumber and bacon, and top with the other slice of bread. Cut the sandwich into triangles and serve. ; name: pecan liqueur pralines ; ingredients: sugar, light brown sugar, salt, cream, pecans, praline liqueur ; preparation:Combine sugars, salt and milk. Cook to soft ball stage. Add pecans and liqueur. Beat until stiff. Drop quickly onto wax paper. ; name: queen of puddings ; ingredients: fresh white breadcrumbs, butter, caster sugar, lemon, rind of, milk, eggs, raspberry jam ; preparation:Set oven to 350f or mark 4. Butter a 1 pint pie dish. Put the breadcrumbs, butter, 1 oz of the sugar, and the lemon rind into a bowl and mix together. Heat the milk in a pan and pour over the breadcrumb mixture. Beat the egg yolks and mix into the breadcrumbs. Pour into the pie dish and bake for about 35 minutes until set. Remove from the oven and spread the jam on top of the pudding. Reduce the oven to 300f or mark 2. Whisk the egg whites stiffly and fold in the remaining caster sugar. Pile this meringue on top of the jam layer and sprinkle with caster sugar. Bake for about another 30 minutes until the meringue is firm and brown on top. ; name: kennedy family chocolate chip cookies ; ingredients: unsalted butter, light brown sugar, sugar, eggs, vanilla, flour, baking soda, salt, water, semi-sweet chocolate chips ; preparation:

name: tomato and basil soup ; ingredients: vegetable oil, onion, dried thyme, tomatoes, flour, sugar, chicken stock, tomato paste, fresh basil, plain low-fat yogurt ; preparation:Heat the oil in a saucepan or stockpot. Add the onion and thyme. Saut until the onion is soft, but not brown. Add the tomatoes and stir briefly. Add the flour, and stir for about 3 minutes, or until the flour is fully incorporated into the mixture. Stir in the sugar, chicken stock, and tomato paste. Simmer, partially covered, for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking. Puree the soup mixture in a food processor and return ro the pot. Season with salt and pepper, to taste. Just before serving, add the basil. Serve with a dollop of yogurt, if desired. ; name: easy bake oven english muffin pizza ; ingredients: english muffin, tomato sauce, mozzarella cheese, pepperoni, sliced mushrooms ; preparation:Separate the english muffins and place on a baking sheet. Top each with about 1 tbs. Of prepared sauce. Top with any additional pre-cooked toppings. Top with shredded cheese. Bake in your easy-bake oven for about 15-20 minutes. ; name: crock pot cranberry chicken low carb ; ingredients: onion, fresh cranberries, boneless skinless chicken breasts, catsup, brown sugar substitute, dry mustard, cider vinegar, salt ; preparation:In a 3-quart or larger electric slow cooker, combine onion, cranberries. Arrange chicken on top. In small bowl, mix c water with catsup, sugar substitute, mustard and vinegar and pour over chicken. Cover. Cook at low setting until chicken is very tender when pierced. ; name: confetti latkes ; ingredients: eggs, zucchini, yellow squash, carrot, onion, salt, pepper, matzo meal, frying oil ; preparation:Combine all ingredients. Mixture should be thick enough to hold its shape. Add more matzoh meal if needed. Drop by tablespoonfuls into very hot oil. Flatten slightly with the back of the spoon. Fry until golden. Drain on paper towels. ; name: spinach pie with muenster crust ; ingredients: frozen chopped spinach, muenster cheese, onion, low fat cottage cheese, eggs, parmesan cheese, salt, pepper, pimiento strips ; preparation:Drain spinach well, pressing between layers of paper towels and set aside. Cut 2-3 cheese slices into small triangles, and reserve for garnish. Cover bottom and sides of a lightly greased 9 or10-inch pieplate with remaining muenster slices, overlapping cheese as needed. Combine spinach, onion and next 5 ingredients. Spoon into cheese-lined pieplate. Bake 350 for 45 minutes or until set. Cool 10 minutes before serving. Garnish with reserved cheese triangles and pimiento strips, if desired. ; name: stir fried spinach with garlic and lemon zest ; ingredients: spinach, olive oil, lemon zest, garlic cloves, kosher salt, ground pepper ; preparation:Carefully rinse the spinach in several changes of water. Discard the tough stems and any damaged leaves, drain briefly in a colander, shaking off excess water. Over medium-high heat, in a deep saut pan or wok, combine the olive oil, lemon zest and garlic. After about 30 seconds, the garlic should begin to sizzle. Immediately stir in the damp spinach and using tongs or 2 wooden spoons, toss and stir quickly until wilted, 2 to 3 minutes. Transfer the spinach to a warmed serving dish and sprinkle with a pinch of salt and a few grinds of fresh pepper. Serve at once. ; name: quick fettuccine carbonara ; ingredients: bacon, dry fettuccine, eggs, parsley, dried italian herb seasoning, parmesan cheese, fresh ground pepper ; preparation:Saute the bacon in a small skillet until crisp. Remove with a slotted spoon and drain well on a paper towel. Cook fettuccini noodles according to package instruction until firm and tender. Meanwhile, beat the eggs thoroughly in a large bowl suitable for serving. Have the cooked bacon and the chopped parsley ready at hand. When the pasta is done, drain it immediately in a colander, and pour into the bowl of eggs and immediately begin tossing it. As the strands of pasta become coated with the beaten eggs, their heat will cook the eggs. Sprinkle the bacon, italian seasoning and parsley on, and serve immediately. Top with lots of freshly grated parmesan cheese and freshly ground black pepper. ; name: greyhound in the pink ; ingredients: grapefruit, maraschino cherries, white sugar, lime, vodka, ruby red grapefruit juice, ice ; preparation:

name: chicken quesadillas low fat ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breast, chicken broth, bell pepper, onion, garlic clove, salsa, taco seasoning, fat-free refried beans, light cheese, whole wheat tortillas ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Saute chicken in broth for 2 minutes. Add peppers, onions, garlic, salsa and taco seasoning. Cook until veggies are soft. Place tortillas on a baking sheet and spread refried beans onto half of each trotilla., top with chicken and veggie mixture and shredded cheese. Fold each tortilla over and bake at 350 degrees for 10-15 minutes. Serve with fat free sour cream and salsa. ; name: fiesta chili mac ; ingredients: lean ground beef, garlic clove, enchilada sauce, black beans, elbow macaroni, water ; preparation:Cook meat and garlic in 3-quart saucepan over medium heat 8 to 10 minutes or until meat is evenly browned. Drain. Add remaining ingredients. Mix well. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover. Simmer 15 minutes, stirring occasionally. ; name: quick and easy apple crisp ; ingredients: apples, butter, yellow cake mix, quick oats, sugar, cinnamon ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Peel, core and slice apples. Place in a well greased 8x8-inch baking pan. Mix cake mix, oats, sugar and cinnamon in a large bowl. Melt butter and pour over the top of the dry cake mixture and mix until crumbly. Sprinkle this over apples. Bake 35-40 minutes until golden. ; name: oh my goodness yummy very low cal chocolate cupcakes ; ingredients: egg whites, cream of tartar, splenda granular, salt, cornstarch, vanilla, cocoa powder, self rising flour ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 400f. Beat egg whites and cream of tarter while slowly adding splenda, vanilla, and salt. In another bowl sift the rest of the dry ingredients. Slowly add dry ingredients into the egg whites. Pour into 6 muffin cups. Bake for 15 minutes or until done. ; name: cheater almost kolaches ; ingredients: biscuits, american cheese, cocktail franks, butter ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Either mix up a batch of your favorite biscuit dough and cut into 16 pieces or open a can of biscuits and separate each biscuit into half. Take the 2 slices of cheese, cut each into 4 strips, and then cut those in half the other direction, giving you 16 short strips. Place 1 strip of cheese and 1 sausage onto each biscuit piece and wrap dough around them. Place seam side down on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 15-20 minutes, until golden brown. Brush the tops with melted butter and serve warm. You can of course, substitute any of your favorite kolache fillings. ; name: president reagan s favorite macaroni and cheese ; ingredients: macaroni, butter, egg, salt, dry mustard, sharp cheddar cheese, milk ; preparation:Boil macaroni in water until tender and drain thoroughly. Stir in butter and egg. Mix mustard and salt with 1t hot water, and add to milk. Add cheese, leaving enough to sprinkle on top. Pour into buttered casserole. Add milk, sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350f for about 45 minutes or until custard is set and top is crusty. ; name: loquat jam ; ingredients: loquats, sugar, water, cinnamon stick, liqueur ; preparation:Boil together the sugar, water, cinnamon stick, bermuda gold and fruit, along with a handful of pits for color until thickened. Remove cinnamon stick and rub through a sieve and cool. Store in very clean jars. Seal, label and date. Keeps for 2 months in the refrigerator. ; name: hot orange almond drink ; ingredients: sugar, water, frozen orange juice, lemon juice, almond flavoring, vanilla, ground cloves, allspice, cinnamon ; preparation:

name: fajita wings ; ingredients: honey, lime juice, chili powder, soy sauce, chicken wings ; preparation:In a large plastic bag, mix honey, lime juice, chili powder, and soy sauce. Add wings. Seal bag and mix to coat. Chill, turning occasionally, at least 1 hour or up to a day. Lift out wings and place in a single layer on racks in 2 broiler pans, each about 10 by 15 inches. Bake in a 450f oven for 15 minutes. Turn the pieces over and continue baking for another 25 to 30 minutes. ; name: sausage stroganoff korv stroganoff ; ingredients: smoked sausage, yellow onions, paprika, butter, tomato puree, mustard, bouillon cube, water, salt & pepper, sour cream ; preparation:Slice sausage into strips. In a skillet, brown over high heat. Add chopped onion and paprika to the skillet. Add tomato puree, mustard, bouillon cube, and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to simmer and let simmer briefly over low heat. Season with pepper and salt to taste. Garnish with sour cream just before serving. Serve with rice. ; name: chocolate toffee snacks ; ingredients: chocolate graham crackers, butter, brown sugar, slivered almonds, maraschino cherry ; preparation:Heat oven to 350. Place graham crackers close together on large cookie sheet. Mix butter and brown sugar in a 1 quart saucepan. Stir over low heat until butter and sugar are melted together. Stir in almonds and cherries. Spoon mixture over crackers. Bake 8 minutes. Cool about 5 minutes. Remove from pan and cool completely. ; name: green bean stir fry ; ingredients: green beans, sunflower oil, ground star anise, garlic cloves, soy sauce, clear honey, tabasco sauce ; preparation:Heat the oil in the wok until very hot. Stir fry beans for 2 to 3 minutes. Add star anaise and garlic then fry for 1 minute. Add remaining ingredients then fry for 1 minute. Serve immediately. ; name: fatback gravy ; ingredients: salt pork, flour, milk, water, salt and pepper ; preparation:Fry the salt pork. Drain on paper towels. Reserve for eating with breakfast. Pour all but 3 tablespoons of the grease out of skillet. Add flour to make a roux. When browned to a caramel color, add the can milk and water and stir well over low heat until thick. ; name: kale with tomatoes and green chiles ; ingredients: kale, garlic, yellow onions, olive oil, tomatoes and green chilies, salt, pepper ; preparation:Rinse the kale and remove the fibrous middle rib, slice the leaves into ribbons. Over medium heat, saute the garlic in the olive oil until fragrant. Then add the onions and saute together, stirring constantly until the onions are limp. Do not allow the garlic or onions to brown. Add the kale and saute for 15-20 minutes or until tender, stirring frequently to prevent the greens from scorching. Add the tomatoes and green chiles and salt and pepper to taste, stirring everything together and cooking until heated through--about 1-2 minutes. Serve over rice or combine with blackeyed peas or refried beans and rice to make a tasty and hearty filling for vegetarian wraps. ; name: better squash casserole no bread crumbs crackers or stuffing ; ingredients: yellow squash, onion, butter, egg, cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Chop yellow squash and onion into small, uniform pieces. Add the squash and onion to a medium sized pot and cook in the butter over medium heat until soft and mushy. Season cooked mixture to taste. Beat the egg with a fork and add it to the squash mixture. Add one cup of shredded cheese to the mixture and stir until melted and mixed. Pour mixture into casserole dish and top with remaining cheese. Bake for 30 min or until cheese lightly browned. ; name: cheesy scrambled eggs with green onions ; ingredients: eggs, milk, cheddar cheese, green onions, salt, pepper, jalapeno ; preparation:

name: mom s chicken livers ; ingredients: chicken liver, bacon, mushrooms, onion, garlic cloves, chicken stock, marsala wine, balsamic vinegar, butter, olive oil ; preparation:Slice the mushrooms and onion and chop the bacon. Heat the oil and butter in a skillet. Add the bacon, onion and garlic and cook until onion is tender. Add the mushrooms and cook until browned. While the bacon, onion and mushrooms are cooking clean the chicken livers and chop into small pieces. Add the chicken livers. After the chicken livers have had time to cook and get brown add the wine, balsamic vinegar and stock. Simmer, uncovered until the livers are done. Serve alone or with with egg noodles. ; name: orange glaze ; ingredients: sugar, cornstarch, orange juice, lemon juice, salt, butter ; preparation:Mix sugar& cornstarch in pan. Add juices, stirring well. Add salt& butter. Cook over low heat til thick& clear. Cool& frost. ; name: hot faux crab dip ; ingredients: cream cheese, albacore tuna in water, mayonnaise, old bay seasoning, garlic, onion ; preparation:Mix all. Pour into a heatproof dish and top with breadcrumbs or cheese. Bake at 350 degrees f. For 15 to 20 minutes or until bubbly. Serve with crackers or thin slices of french bread. ; name: homemade italian salad dressing ; ingredients: salad oil, wine vinegar, salt, sugar, dried oregano leaves, dry mustard, paprika, garlic clove ; preparation:Combine all ingredients in a jar with a lid. Cover and shake to mix thoroughly. Let stand at least 2 hours to blend seasonings. Shake well before using. Wonderful on italian lettuce salad. ; name: easy rice main dish ; ingredients: onion, garlic cloves, ground beef, stewed tomatoes, garbanzo beans, tomato juice, water, long-grain white rice ; preparation:Cook ground beef with onions and garlic in skillet till cooked through. Drain fat. Add all other ingredients except rice and heat to boiling. Add rice and cover. Allow to simmer for 15 minutes until the rice is tender. ; name: three cheese spinach lasagna ; ingredients: ricotta cheese, mozzarella cheese, cheddar cheese, pasta sauce, baby spinach leaves, lasagna sheets ; preparation:Pre hear oven to 180c. Grease lasagne pan. Spread some of tomato sauce on bottom of dish. Lay lasagne sheets on top of sauce. Spread half riccotta cheese on top. Spread a third of the mozzarella and a third of the cheddar cheese. Lay half of the spinach on top of cheeses. Spread some more of the tomato sauce on top and repeat. Finish with lasagne sheets and top with remaining mozzarella and cheddar cheese. Bake in oven for 40 minutes. ; name: grilled halibut with thyme ; ingredients: halibut steaks, olive oil, chicken broth, scallions, garlic cloves, dried thyme, lemon-pepper seasoning ; preparation:Place fish in a shallow dish. In a small mixing bowl, combine the rest of the ingredients and mix well. Pour the mixture over the fish and marinate about 30 minutes at room temperature, or refrigerate, covered, 1-2 hours. Remove fish from the marinade, reserving marinade. Put marinade in a saucepan and heat to boiling. Reduce heat and let simmer until needed. Place fish on a gas grill over medium heat or on charcoal grill for 4-6 inches from medium coals. Cook, turning once and basting with heated marinade, 8-12 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Serve immediately and discard remaining marinade. ; name: chilled berry soup ; ingredients: fresh strawberries, ginger ale, milk, sugar, lemon juice, vanilla extract, sour cream ; preparation:

name: super simple sausage sliders ; ingredients: refrigerated biscuits, italian sausage, fresh basil, egg, corn, salt, black pepper, swiss cheese, vidalia onion, spinach ; preparation:Follow directions on biscuit can to make biscuits, remove from oven let cool then slice or pull apart in half i used the buttermilk grande size. In a bowl mix together sausage, basil, s&p corn flake crumbs, and egg. Make 8 mini patties just a tad larger than the biscuits and fry in a grill pan or grill on grill top til done approximately 4 min per side for well done. Once patties are done, place onto bottom half of biscuit, top with slice swiss cheese, spinach, onion slice, and any garnish you choose. We like horseradish mustard or mayo, tomatoes and the onion. Serve with a side salad or a baseball game and a smile. ; name: velveeta broccoli cheese soup ; ingredients: butter, onions, flour, reduced-sodium fat-free chicken broth, milk, velveeta cheese, frozen broccoli ; preparation:Melt butter in medium saucepan on medium-high heat. Add onions. Cook 3 to 5 minutes or until crisp-tender, stirring frequently. Whisk in flour until blended. Add broth and milk. Cook on medium-high heat 2 minutes or until heated through, stirring frequently. Add velveeta and broccoli. Cook and stir 5 minutes or until velveeta is melted and broccoli is heated through. ; name: nanny s southern pecan pie ; ingredients: eggs, pecan halves, light corn syrup, vanilla extract, sugar, salt, pie crusts ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine eggs, corn syrup, vanilla, sugar, and salt in a large mixing bowl. Arrange pecans evenly in the bottom of the pie crust. Pour egg mixture over pecans in the shell. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes or until puffy and crust is golden brown. ; name: greek ribs ; ingredients: pork rib rack, garlic salt, onion salt, salt, oregano, lemon juice, lemon pepper ; preparation:Cut ribs into serving size pieces. Place on cookie sheet in single layer. Sprinkle spices and lemon juice on top. Turn over and repeat the process. Bake at 375 degrees for about 20 minutes. Turn ribs. Cook another 20 minutes or until nicely done. ; name: yummy rice pilaf ; ingredients: butter, orzo pasta, scallions, long grain rice, reduced-sodium chicken broth, water, salt, pepper ; preparation:Melt butter in medium sauce pan over medium high heat. Add orzo and saute until golden brown. Add scallions and saute quickly. Add chicken broth, water, salt & pepper. Bring to a boil. Stir in rice. Reduced heat to low. Cover and cook for 17-20 minutes. I finished by adding a little extra butter and salt and pepper to taste. ; name: fudgie scotch squares ; ingredients: sweetened condensed milk, graham cracker crumbs, chocolate chips, butterscotch chips, walnuts ; preparation:Mix condensed milk, graham cracker crumbs, chocolate chips, butterscotch chips, and walnuts together well. Press into pam sprayed then well buttered 9 inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees fahrenheit for 30 minutes. Cool 45 minutes. Cut into squares. ; name: slow roasted tomato sauce ; ingredients: extra virgin olive oil, balsamic vinegar, garlic, basil, roma tomatoes, maple sugar, sea salt ; preparation:Preheat oven to 300 degrees. Whisk together the olive oil, vinegar, garlic, and basil. Pour half of this mixture onto a cookie sheet and spread it around. Place tomatoes cut-side down on cookie sheet on top of the oil blend. Drizzle tomatoes with remaining oil, then sprinkle with the maple sugar and salt. Bake slowly in oven at 300 degrees for 3 hours. Blend or process when done. Serve hot over pasta, rice, or white beans. ; name: hoisin salmon ; ingredients: orange juice, hoisin sauce, honey, salmon fillets ; preparation:

name: cheese and chili pepper squares ; ingredients: cheddar cheese, monterey jack cheese, green chili peppers, eggs, milk ; preparation:Layer half of the cheeses in a greased 9x13 pan. Sprinkle on peppers, then other half of cheeses. Mix eggs and milk together. Drizzle over cheese. Bake at 350 for 30-35 minutes. Cool 15 minutes before cutting. ; name: sloppy joe pasta skillet dinner ; ingredients: pasta, water, sloppy joe meat, frozen corn, tomatoes and green chilies, mexican blend cheese ; preparation:In a 10 inch non-stick skillet over medium heat add water. When water reaches boiling point add pasta, and cook until desired doneness is reached. Drain and return to skillet. Add meat, rotel, corn and 1 cup of cheese. Stirring until meat is heated through and cheese is melted. Sprinkle remaining cheese on top and serve. ; name: crab stuffed eggs ; ingredients: eggs, white crab meat, mayonnaise, relish, tabasco sauce, fresh chives, salt and pepper, mixed salad greens ; preparation:Spoon out the egg yolks and put them into a large bowl, keeping the egg whites on the side. Mash the yolks with a fork and mix well with the crab meat, mayonnaise, relish and tabasco. Adjust seasoning as necessary. Spoon the mixture back into the egg whites, piling it up. Sprinkle the chives over the eggs. Arrange salad leaves on a plate and place the eggs on top. Chill for about 1 hour until ready to serve. ; name: farfalle with prosciutto spinach pine nuts and raisins ; ingredients: golden raisin, boiling water, olive oil, garlic cloves, baby spinach, pine nuts, farfalle pasta, prosciutto, parmesan cheese, salt and pepper ; preparation:Plump raisins by soaking in boiling water, about 10 minutes, then drain. Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Add spinach and cook, stirring for about 2 minutes or until just wilted. Cook farfalle as directed on package and drain. Toss with pine nuts, raisins, garlic, spinach and prosciutto. Add parmesan cheese. Add salt and pepper to taste. ; name: cuban potato salad ; ingredients: small red potato, black beans, green onions, sour cream, fresh lemon juice, salt, fresh ground white pepper, mayonnaise, fresh chives ; preparation:Boil the potatoes in salted water until tender, about 10 minutes. Drain, then combine with black beans in a small bowl. Allow to cool. Meanwhile, in a blender combine green onions, sour cream and lemon juice. Puree until smooth. Add salt, pepper and mayonnaise. Blend until combined. Pour over potatoes and beans. Toss until well coated. Garnish with chives. ; name: asian barbecue chicken ; ingredients: brown sugar, low sodium soy sauce, fresh lime juice, crushed red pepper flakes, curry powder, garlic cloves, chicken thighs, cooking spray, lime wedge, green onion top ; preparation:Combine first 6 ingredients in a large ziploc plastic bag, add chicken. Seal and marinate in refrigerator for 4 hours or overnight, turning ocacsionnally. Prepare grill. Remove chicken from bag, reserving marinade. Place marinade in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil, cook 1 minute. Place chicken on grill rack coated with cooking spray. Grill 20 minutes or until done, turning and basting frequently with cooked marinade. Garnish with lime wedges and green onion tops, if desired. ; name: gai choy ; ingredients: gai choy, canola oil, dark sesame oil, onion, garlic, fish sauce, sugar ; preparation:Trim stems and slice thin and long. Coarsely chop leaves separately from stalks. Add oil to hot skillet over medium high heat then add sesame oil, onion and garlic. Stir and cook 1 minute. Stir in sugar and fish sauce. Add stalks and cook 2-3 minutes until crisp-tender. Stir in leaves and cook and stir 1 minute or just until they wilt. ; name: grilled chicken skewers with red pepper pesto ; ingredients: roasted red peppers, fresh cilantro leaves, balsamic vinegar, garlic clove, dry mustard, ground coriander, ground cinnamon, olive oil, whole almond, chicken breasts ; preparation:

name: smoky sweet pepper shrimp ; ingredients: butter, large shrimp, sweet pepper flakes, white wine ; preparation:Melt butter in large nonstick skillet on low heat. Add shrimp. Cook and stir on medium heat 5 minutes or just until shrimp turn pink. Stir in seasoning blend and wine until shrimp are well coated. Serve over cooked rice, if desired. ; name: atkins cauliflower potato salad ; ingredients: cauliflower, mayonnaise, lemon juice, sugar substitute, dried mustard, green onions, jalapeno peppers, salt and pepper ; preparation:Cook cauliflower in a large pot of boiling water 10 minsutes or until tender. Drain and rinse with cold water. In a large mixing bowl, mix mayonnaise, lemon juice, sugar substitute and mustard. Add cauliflower, green onions and pepper. Mix well until vegetables are evenly coated with dressing. Add salt and pepper to taste. Chill 30 mins. ; name: mini snack pizzas ; ingredients: refrigerated dinner rolls, pizza sauce, mozzarella cheese, pepperoni ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375. Place rolls on ungreased baking sheet try to flatten rolls so they resemble flat circles. Take a spoonful of sauce and spread ontop of each rolls. Then cut up cheese into small bits and garnish. Add meat ontop of cheese and then place remaining cheese ontop of meat. Cook for about 15 min of until rolls are golden. ; name: grilled soy honey glazed chicken breasts ; ingredients: chicken breasts, scallion, garlic, honey, dry sherry, fresh ginger, soy sauce ; preparation:Combine scallions, garlic, honey, sherry, ginger and soy sauce. Place chicken in a resealable plastic bag and pour the sauce over the chicken. Close the bag and marinate at room temperature for 30 minutes to 1 hour. Or, refrigerate it overnight. Turn occasionally to keep sauce distributed evenly on the chicken. Remove chicken from bag and pour sauce into a small saucepan. Bring sauce to a boil and let boil for one full minute. Grill chicken over hot coals, turning as needed to prevent charring and to cook evenly. Grill until just done, about 25 minutes. Brush with sauce as needed to keep moist. Serve chicken with remaining sauce and hot cooked rice. ; name: quaker punch ; ingredients: of fresh mint, ginger, tea bags, boiling water, water, sugar, lemons, juice of, oranges, juice of ; preparation:Bruise the mint. Add the ginger and teabags. Pour over the boiling water, cover and steep for 6 or 7 minutes. Strain and discard the solids. Meanwhile, heat the remaining water and sugar just until the sugar is dissolved. Mix with the tea brew. Add the juice of the lemons and oranges, and strain. Serve chilled, over ice. ; name: nourishing traditions waffles grain soaking method ; ingredients: whole wheat flour, buttermilk, egg yolks, pure maple syrup, butter, sea salt, egg whites ; preparation:Soak flour in buttermilk in a warm place for 12-24 hours. Stir in egg yolks, syrup, butter, and salt. In a clean bowl, beat egg whites with a pinch of salt until stiff. Fold into batter. Cook in a hot, well-coted waffle iron. Serve with melted butter and maple syrup. ; name: stuffed shell pierogies ; ingredients: potatoes, cheddar cheese, salt, pepper, onions, butter, jumbo pasta shells ; preparation:Cooks potatoes until soft, drain. Add cheese, salt & pepper and mash until smooth. Melt margarine or butter in large skillet. Add onions and cook 10 to 15 minutes until tender but not browned. Spread half the onions over the bottom of a 13x9 baking dish. Stuff each shell with heaping tablespoon of the potato mixture, close edges. Arrange in single layer over onions, spread remaining onions on top. Bake at 350 degrees uncovered 15 to 20 minutes or until heated through. ; name: grilled vegetable medley with blue cheese butter ; ingredients: blue cheese, unsalted butter, fresh lemon juice, salt and pepper, olive oil, fresh basil, garlic cloves, vegetables ; preparation:

name: gf cheeseburger pasta ; ingredients: onion, lean ground beef, cream of mushroom soup, beef broth, water, ketchup, gluten-free pasta, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Brown ground beef & onion. Use a large skillet for a single recipe, or a stock pot for a double recipe. Add other ingredients and heat to a boil. Cook over medium heat 10 to 20 minutes or until pasta is done, stirring often. Add cheese. Turn off heat and cover until cheese melts. Sauce will thicken a bit as it cools. Serve & enjoy. ; name: buttermilk ranch oven fried chicken ; ingredients: chicken thighs, buttermilk ranch dressing, butter, bisquick ; preparation:Heat oven to 425f melt butter in rectangular baking dish, 13x9x2 inches, in oven. In a gallon plastic bag, mix together bisquick, and hidden valley buttermilk ranch dressing. Coat chicken one piece at a time, but placing in bag and shaking. Place skin sides down in dish. Bake 35 minutes. Turn chicken. Bake about 15 minutes longer or until juice is no longer pink when centers of thickest pieces are cut. ; name: flank steak with teriyaki marinade ; ingredients: flank steaks, garlic, fresh lemon juice, soy sauce, honey, olive oil ; preparation:Make inch slits in one side of the steak with a sharp paring knife. Fill slits with garlic and put steak in a shallow dish large enough to hold it. Whisk together remaining ingredients until emulsified. Pour over steak, turning steak to coat well, let marinate, covered, turning occasionally, for 1 hour at room temperature and up to 10 hours, chilled. Let steak come to room temperature and discard garlic. Broil 4 inches from heat, turning once, 10-12 minutes for medium-rare meat and reserve pan juices. Alternatively, remove steak from marinade and grill over hot coals, brushing occasionally with marinade for the same amount of time as the broiler. Transfer to a platter and let stand 10 minutes. Slice thin across the grain and serve with reserved pan juices. ; name: cointreau melt in your mouth cake ; ingredients: yellow cake mix, vanilla instant pudding mix, eggs, vegetable oil, orange juice, cointreau liqueur, sugar, butter, fresh raspberries, orange rind ; preparation:In a large mixing bowl, combine cake mix, pudding mix, eggs, oil, orange juice and cointreau. Beat well for 10 minutes. Pour into lightly greased bundt pan. Bake at 350 for 45- 60 minutes until done. Let stand 10 minutes. Turn out of pan. While cake is baking, boil sugar, butter, orange juice and cointreau for roughly 5 minutes. Pour over cake while cake is still warm. To serve, top each slice with fresh raspberries and a sprinkle of orange peel. ; name: no peek skillet chicken ; ingredients: olive oil, chicken, whole canned tomatoes, fresh mushrooms, garlic clove, lipton recipe secrets onion soup mix, cooked noodles ; preparation:In a 12 inch skillet, heat oil over medium high heat and brown chicken. Drain. Stir in tomatoes, mushrooms and garlic combined with onion soup mix. Reduce heat to low and simmer covered 45 minutes or until chicken is done. Serve over hot noodles and sprinkle, if desired, with chopped fresh parsley. ; name: parmesan pull apart mini bundts ; ingredients: buttermilk biscuits, butter, italian seasoning, garlic cloves, parmesan cheese, cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray mini bundt pan with cooking spray. Combine butter, garlic, italian seasoning and cheeses in bowl. Cut each biscuit into quarters and dip in butter. Fill each bundt half full with biscuit pieces and bake 10-15 minutes in preheated oven, until just starting to brown. ; name: potatoes on the half shell ; ingredients: baking potatoes, milk, butter, egg, salt, pepper, green onion, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 f degrees. Scrub the potatoes and place them in the oven until done, about 1 hour. Cut each potato in half, lengthwise. Carefully, scoop out the potato and place in a bowl. Set the potato shells aside to use later. While still hot, mash the potatoes with the milk, beaten egg, and butter. Beat until fluffy. Season with salt and pepper, to taste. Add in the onion. Spread the potato shells with butter and fill each shell with the potato mixture. Sprinkle the tops with parmesan cheese. Bake until tops are browned. ; name: roasted pork tenderloin with garlic ; ingredients: pork loin, garlic, salt, pepper, butter, onion, olive oil ; preparation:

name: dijon chicken fettuccine ; ingredients: spinach fettuccine, heavy cream, dijon mustard, cooked chicken, roasted red pepper ; preparation:Cook fettuccine as directed on package. Drain well and return the pasta to the pot. Add the cream and mustard to the pasta in the pot. Cook over medium heat, mixing well, about 2 minutes or until hot. Add chicken and red peppers and heat through. ; name: mango and chilli sorbet ; ingredients: mango pulp, lemon juice, caster sugar, water, egg white, hot chili pepper ; preparation:In a small stainless steel saucepan, stir the sugar and water with a wooden spoon. Heat on medium until the sugar has dissolved, then boil the mixture for about 1 minute. Remove from the heat and allow to cool. Chop the chilli very finely, then thoroughly bruise in a small mortar and pestle. Place the mango flesh, sugar mixture and chilli in a blender. Use the lemon juice to rinse the last little bit of chilli juice from the mortar and pestle and add that to the blender too. Blend the mango mixture until smooth. Beat the egg white in a large bowl until almost stiff. Stir the mango mixture into the egg white until well mixed. Freeze the sorbet in an icecream maker. Remove from the icecream maker when thick and store in an airtight container in the freezer for up to 3 days. The sorbet may need to stand at room temperature for a few minutes before serving, but this time will be minimised if the sorbet is made less than a day before it will be served. ; name: peppered shrimp ; ingredients: butter, shrimp, salt, garlic, black pepper ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. In a glass baking dish, melt the butter in the oven. Remove the dish from the oven and add the salt, garlic and black pepper. Meanwhile, wash the shrimp, leaving the shells on. Add the shrimp to the butter mixture and stir well to coat. Bake for 15-18 minutes. ; name: pepperoni angel hair ; ingredients: angel hair pasta, cucumber, green pepper, pepperoni, italian salad dressing, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Cook the pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, combine the cucumber, green pepper and pepperoni in a large bowl. Drain pasta and add to pepperoni mixture. Top with the salad dressing and parmasean cheese. Toss to coat. Serve. ; name: phil s italian sausage ; ingredients: pork, sage, garlic powder, onion powder, mace, black pepper, allspice, clove, fennel seeds ; preparation:Mix well. Shape into patties. Wrap individually to freeze if desired. To prepare, fry as any pork sausage. Will make 24 patties. ; name: cinnamon apple syrup from peel ; ingredients: water, sugar, cinnamon, apples ; preparation:Bring all four ingredients to a boil in a large stockpot. Stir until sugar dissolves. Reduce heat to medium and simmer until peels lose their bright color. Remove apple peels with tongs or a slotted spoon. Continue simmering until mixture has reduced by half. Test consistency by dipping a spoon into the mixture and then rubbing your finger across it. You will be able to tell when it has thickened. Cooking time will vary. You may can this in sterile jars or let it cool and keep in the refrigerator. ; name: three bean tortilla soup ; ingredients: tomatoes, onion, garlic, chili beans, black beans, small white beans, chicken broth, 6-inch corn tortillas, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Heat a small non-stick skillet over medium-high heat until hot. Add whole tomato to skillet and heat until skin is blistered and slightly charred, turning frequently. Cool tomato slightly and coarsely chop. In a large saucepan, combine tomato, onion, and garlic. Cook over medium heat until onion and garlic are softened, about 5 minutes. Stir in beans and broth, and bring to a boil. Reduce heat, simmer 15 to 20 minutes. Meanwhile, heat oven to 425f cut tortillas into strips and place in a single layer on a large baking sheet. Bake for 5 to 8 minutes or until crisp. To serve, ladle soup into bowls and top with tortilla strips and cheese. ; name: pumpkin figs pie ; ingredients: unbaked 9-inch pie crust, pears, pumpkin puree, dried fig, brown sugar ; preparation:

name: orange flavored quinoa ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, orange juice, salt, quinoa, fresh parsley, of fresh mint, currants, orange zest ; preparation:In a medium nonstick saucepan, heat oil over medium heat. Add onion and cook until soft. Add orange juice, 1 cup water and salt. Bring to a boil. Add quinoa and stir once. Quickly return to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer 15-20 minutes, until water is absorbed and quinoa is tender. Remove from heat and let stand 3 minutes. Add parsley, mint, currants and orange zest. Stir with a fork to combine and fluff up grain. ; name: cheddar mushroom macaroni ; ingredients: cheddar cheese, cream of mushroom soup, mayonnaise, mushrooms, onion, garlic clove, elbow macaroni, salt and pepper ; preparation:In a large bowl, combine the first six ingredients. Mix well. Stir in macaroni. Mix well. Transfer to a greased 9 inch baking dish. Cover and bake at 325 degrees f for 30 minutes or until heated through and cheese is melted. ; name: baked geel rys yellow rice ; ingredients: basmati rice, turmeric, cinnamon, salt, white sugar, lemon slices, butter, boiling water ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f in large casserole dish, combine rice, tumeric, cinnamon, salt, sugar. Stir to distribute spices even. Pour boiling water over rice, add butter, stir to mix, and add 2 lemon slices, thickly sliced, on top. Make sure there are no seeds in lemon slices. Cover dish and put in oven, bake for 25 to 35 minutes until water is absorbed and rice is tender. You can also make this with brown rice, just increase amount of water to 6 cups and increase cooking time to 45 to 60 minutes. ; name: kickn quesadillas ; ingredients: cheese, vegetables, hot sauce, chicken, garlic, jalapeno, tortillas ; preparation:Take your tortillas and drop in all of your ingredients on top of it. Cheese will normally go first. If you would like to add your hot sauce, drop a tsp. Of it on top of every thing. Put into a hot pan and let cook until cheese starts to melt. Next add your second tortilla on top and flip. Let cook for about 3-8 minutes until serving. ; name: ranch chicken nuggets ; ingredients: chicken tenders, ranch dressing, butter, garlic salt, pepper, potato chips ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f. Rinse chicken and pat dry. Stir together dressing, butter, garlic salt and pepper in a medium bowl. Add chicken and toss well to coat with mixture. Roll each piece in crushed chips and place on a shallow baking sheet. Sprinkle with any remaining chips. Bake for 30 minutes or until crispy and lightly browned. ; name: beto s tender pork chops ; ingredients: pork chops, oil, onion, chicken bouillon cube, water ; preparation:Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees f. Saute pork chops in oil over medium heat until fairly brown. Place chops in roasting pan and sprinkle with onion and chicken cube. Pour over cold water, cover with lid and roast for 1 hour. If your chops are thin you may need to add more water or not cook them as long. ; name: creamy mashed potatoes ; ingredients: potatoes, cream cheese, sour cream, garlic, butter, paprika ; preparation:Peel and boil potatoes until soft. Drain potatoes, and mash. Add cream cheese, sour cream, and minced garlic to potatoes and mix until smooth. Grease a 13x9 baking dish and add mashed potatoes. Set the 4 pats of butter in various spots on top of potatoes, sprinkle with paparika. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. ; name: rocky road s mores bars ; ingredients: butter, brown sugar, vanilla, flour, graham cracker crumbs, mini marshmallows, semi-sweet chocolate chips, walnuts ; preparation:

name: baked cornflake chicken strips ; ingredients: corn flakes, all-purpose flour, seasoning salt, black pepper, poultry seasoning, eggs, water, boneless chicken breasts, olive oil ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f. Finely crush cornflakes. Mix together cornflakes, flour, seasoning salt, pepper and poultry seasoning. Beat eggs with water. Dip chicken strips in egg mixture and then roll in cornflake mixture. Press mixture firmly onto chicken to coat well. Lay chicken strips on baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Drizzle with olive oil. Bake for 30 minutes or until chicken is tender and cooked throughly. Baking time varies depending on size of strips. Serve with your favorite dipping sauce. These can also be fried in oil for 6-8 minutes but i prefer baking to keep them healthier. ; name: cinnamon peach brown betty ; ingredients: brown sugar, oatmeal, flour, butter, peaches, cinnamon ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 and butter a 9x9 baking dish. Layer peaches on the bottom of the dish. Mix the rest of the ingredients in a bowl, forming a crumble topping. Sprinkle on top of peaches and bake for 40 minutes. Let cool for at least 10 minutes before serving. ; name: simmered sirloin with gravy ; ingredients: boneless beef top sirloin steaks, onion, sliced mushrooms, garlic, butter, beef stock, worcestershire sauce, all-purpose flour, cold water ; preparation:In large nonstick skillet, cook beef, onions, mushrooms and garlic in butter over medium heat for 5-7 minutes or until meat is brown and no longer pink. Add the beef broth, worcestershire sauce and bring to boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for one hour. Combine flour and water until smooth. Add to beef mixture. Bring to a boil. Cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened. ; name: crock pot chicken ala king ; ingredients: cooked chicken, green pepper, dried onion, celery, pimiento, cream of chicken soup, sliced mushrooms, frozen peas, uncooked rice ; preparation:Combine all ingredients in a crock pot. Stir to mix well. Cover and cook on low 6-9 hours. Cook rice as directed. Serve chicken a la king over a mound of rice. ; name: chocolate chip pecan pie muffins ; ingredients: pecans, brown sugar, flour, eggs, butter, chocolate chips, sugar ; preparation:Combine pecans, brown sugar, flour and chocolate chips. Make a well in center of mixture. Beat eggs until foamy. Stir together eggs and butter. Add to dry ingredients. Stir until moistened. Spoon batter into cups, makes 4 large muffins, or 6 smaller muffins. Mix topping ingredients together. Sprinkle on top of each muffin. Bake at 350f 20-25 minutes. Remove from pan immediately. Serve warm. ; name: smoked cabbage ; ingredients: butter, salt, pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, cabbage ; preparation:In a small bowl combine first 5 ingredients. Core cabbage, cutting out a good size cavity and then place the seasoned butter in the cavity. Wrap cabbage with heavy duty aluminum foil. Place cabbage, cored end up, on top rack of grill, close lid and smoke until soft. Unwrap cabbage and discard any blackened leaves and then cut the cabbage into wedges. ; name: mini cheddar meatloaves ; ingredients: egg, milk, shredded cheddar cheese, oats, onion, salt, ground beef, ketchup, brown sugar, prepared mustard ; preparation:In a bowl beat eggs and milk, stir in cheese, oats, onion, and salt. Crumble beef over mixture and mix well. Shape into 8 loaves place in 13x9x2 baking dish, i normally make my loaves bigger and can get about 4-5. In separate bowl, combine ketchup, brown sugar, and mustard, mix well. The original recipe says to spoon over loafs and bake 45 minutes or until no longer pink and meat thermometer reads 160 degrees, uncovered at 350 degrees. However, i bake mine without the sauce until the last 10 minutes or so and then spoon the mixture over the loaves, replacing them back in oven to finish cooking. ; name: power granola ; ingredients: oats, almonds, wheat germ, honey, cinnamon, nutmeg, vanilla, craisins, raisins, dried apricot ; preparation:

name: orange delight salad ; ingredients: fat-free sugar-free instant vanilla pudding mix, sugar-free orange gelatin, crushed pineapple, mandarin oranges ; preparation:Drain and reserve liquid from fruit. Add enough water to make two cups of liquid. Pour pudding mix & liquid into a pan. Cook until thickened, stir in dry jello. Mix in pineapple and oranges. Chill. ; name: quick tomato and beef macaroni and cheese ; ingredients: ground beef, onion, salt and pepper, tomatoes, water, elbow macaroni, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Brown ground beef and onion, drain. Add salt, pepper, tomatoes, and water. And bring to boil. Stir in macaroni and cover and simmer for 10 minutes or until macaroni is tender. Stir in cheese and garnish with sour cream if desired. ; name: cheesy beans rice ; ingredients: velveeta reduced fat cheese product, diced tomatoes, black beans, instant rice, tortillas, sour cream ; preparation:Gather up all ingredients, a knife, a can opener, measuring cups, a crock pot, and a spoon. Turn crock pot on high. Cube velveeta. Add all ingredients except tortillas to crock pot. Simmer until cheese is melted, stirring regularly. Warm tortillas. Add sour cream if desired and spoon into tortillas. ; name: fiesta yellow squash ; ingredients: margarine, fresh onion, green pepper, yellow squash, salt, pepper, thyme, lemon juice ; preparation:Melt butter in skillet. Add onion and green pepper. Cook until tender. Add squash and seasonings. Mix well. Cook, covered, over moderately low heat for 10 to 15 minutes until crisp-tender. ; name: hearty mexican spaghetti ; ingredients: ground chicken, onion, low-sodium taco seasoning, diced tomatoes, chilies, angel hair pasta, cheddar cheese ; preparation:In a large saucepan, cook chicken and onions until chicken is no longer pink. Add taco seasoning mix, tomatoes, corn, and chiles. Cook over medium heat until heated through. Fold in cooked spaghetti and cheese. Mix well and serve. ; name: fire baked bananas ; ingredients: bananas, cream, amarula cream liqueur, dark baking chocolate, walnuts, honey ; preparation:Heat up the bar-b-que grill. Whip the cream until stiff peaks are formed. Fold the amarula liqueur into the mixture. Cover and refrigerate until needed. Over medium coals place the bananas, still in peel, onto the grill. Heat bananas until the peel turns black. Remove the bananas from the grill and split the skin of the banana open. In a saucepan, melt the chocolate over medium heat. Once melted, add the walnuts and honey stirring constantly.
