Pour chocolate sauce over bananas and top with whipped cream mixture. ; name: white bean guacamole with cumin dusted chips ; ingredients: whole wheat tortillas, olive oil, salt, small white beans, red onion, avocado, lime, jalapeno, cilantro ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cut the tortillas into 8 triangles each. Brush each side with olive oil and sprinkle with salt, pepper and cumin to taste. Arrange in a single layer on two baking sheets and bake until golden brown and crispy, about 10 minutes. While the chips are baking, combine the remaining ingredients in a mixing bowl and mash with a potato masher until you reach a desired consistency. ; name: liqueur oranges ; ingredients: oranges, caster sugar, vanilla bean, orange-flavored liqueur, brandy ; preparation:

name: tom yum spicy thai soup ; ingredients: shrimp, kaffir lime leaves, tomatoes, mushrooms, water, lemongrass, fish sauce, lime juice, red chili peppers, chili paste ; preparation:Pour water into medium saucepan and place over high head on stove. Bring to boil and add kaffir lime leaves & lemon grass. Cook for 2 minutes. Reduce to low heat, add fish sauce, lime juice, fresh ground red chili, and chili paste in soy bean oil. Add mushrooms & tomatoes. Cook for several minutes. Add shrimp or chicken. Turn heat to high, do not stir. When shrimp or chicken is cooked, continue to cook for 2 minutes more. Serve with hot rice. ; name: peach pie ; ingredients: pastry for double-crust pie, brown sugar, white sugar, cornstarch, ginger, cinnamon, vanilla, peaches, lemon juice ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400-degrees f. Prepare pastry or use pre-packages pastry and put bottom crust in a 9-inch pie pan. In a large skillet combine sugars, cornstarch, ginger, cinnamon and vanilla. Fold in peaches and simmer for 5 minutes or until filling thickens slightly. Remove from heat and stir in lemon juice. Spoon filling into prepared pie pan. Fit top crust on top of filling. Crimp and seal edges. Cut slits in dough on top of pie. Place pie on baking sheet and cover loosely with foil. Bake for 15 minutes, remove foil and bake for 45 more minutes or until crust is brown and filling is bubbly. ; name: german chocolate sauce ; ingredients: butter, sweet baking chocolate, granulated sugar, vanilla extract, salt, evaporated milk ; preparation:In a small saucepan, melt butter and chocolate over low heat, stirring constantly until melted. Stir in sugar, vanilla, salt, and milk. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Cook 7 minutes, stirring constantly. Serve warm over ice cream or pound cake. The amount of time will vary with the amount of sauce being reheated. ; name: ham stroganoff ; ingredients: cooked ham, onion, butter, mushrooms, cream of mushroom soup, sour cream, flour, medium egg noodles ; preparation:Saute onion butter and ham until onions are clear. Add mushrooms and flour. Add mushroom soup and sour cream. Hheat thru but do not boil. Cook noodles as directed drain but do not rinse. Add to sauce. Let set for about 10 minutes with cover on before serving. ; name: easiest chicken pot pie ; ingredients: mixed vegetables, cream of mushroom soup, cream of celery soup, cooked chicken breasts, crescent rolls, butter ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cut chicken into small cubes. In large pot mix vegetables, soups, butter and chicken. Cook on medium heat for 10 minutes. Put soup mixture in 10 x 13 inch baking dish. Unroll cresent rolls and cover mixture with unrolled cresents. Bake for 20 minutes or until cresent cover is golden brown. Let cool pie cool down for about 5 minutes before serving. ; name: smoked salmon and chopped egg sandwiches ; ingredients: eggs, mayonnaise, horseradish, rye bread, radishes, mixed sprouts, scallions, smoked salmon, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:In a small saucepan, cover the eggs with cold water and bring to a rolling boil. Cover, remove from the heat and let stand for 8 minutes. Drain the eggs and cool under running water, shaking the pan to crack the shells. Drain again and pat dry, then peel and coarsely chop. Meanwhile, in a small bowl, mix the mayonnaise and horseradish and spread on the bread. Arrange the radishes on 4 of the slices and top with the sprouts, scallions and salmon. Spoon the eggs on top, season with salt and pepper and close the sandwiches. Press gently, cut the sandwiches in half and serve. ; name: potato carrot kugel ; ingredients: russet potatoes, carrots, onion, eggs, oil, matzo meal, salt, pepper ; preparation:Grate vegetables, place in large bowl. Preheat oven to 400. Beat eggs in small bowl, add with remaining ingredients. Grease a 13x9 baking dish, add ingredients. Bake aprox 1 hour until top is brown. ; name: silver state brownies ; ingredients: margarine, sugar, eggs, vanilla, cocoa, flour, nuts, mini chocolate chip ; preparation:

name: secret ingredient curried cauliflower soup ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, tart apple, curry powder, garlic clove, cauliflower, vegetable broth, honey, rice wine vinegar ; preparation:Saute onions in oil in large stock pot for 5-7 minutes or until soft and golden. Add apple, curry powder and garlic and cook 2 minutes more or until curry powder turns deep yellow. Add cauliflower and vegetable broth and bring to a simmer. Cover, reduce heat to medium low and simmer 20 minutes. Cool 20 minutes then blend in food processor or blender until smooth. Stir in honey and vinegar. Season with salt to taste. Reheat or serve cool. ; name: stout corned beef ; ingredients: brown sugar, corned beef brisket, guinness stout, potato, carrot ; preparation:Discard the seasoning packet from the corned beef. Rub the brown sugar over the corned beef and place in a slow cooker. Pour the beer over the top. Cook, covered, on low for 8 to 10 hours. Add chopped potatoes and baby carrots, if desired, and increase the heat to high. Cook until the vegetables are tender and the corned beef is cooked to the desired doneness. Serve with cooked cabbage or over mashed potatoes. ; name: roasted chickpeas ; ingredients: olive oil flavored cooking spray, canned chick-peas, garlic powder, red pepper flakes ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly coat a rimmed cookie sheet with the pam. Spread chickpeas on baking sheet. Mix the seasonings and sprinkle it on the chickpeas, toss to coat. Roast on the bottom rack of the oven, shaking pan every 15 minutes or so, until brown and crunchy, about 45 to 50 minutes. Store in a tight lidded container. ; name: mini mignon s velveeta meat dip ; ingredients: ground beef, velveeta cheese, tomato soup, hot peppers, salt and pepper ; preparation:Brown the ground beef. Add tomato soup and chilies or peppers. Let this simmer for 40 minute. Stir in velvetta cheese and continue to stir until melted. Serve warm with tortilla chips. ; name: chicken cheddary fajitas ; ingredients: light italian dressing, boneless skinless chicken breasts, cheddar cheese soup, salsa, flour tortillas, green onions, red pepper ; preparation:Pour dressing into shallow nonmetallic dish. Add chicken and turn to coat. Cover and refrigerate 30 minutes, turning occasionally. Remove chicken from marinade. Discard marinade. Grill or broil chicken 15 minutes or until done, turning once. Mix soup and salsa in saucepan. Heat through. Slice chicken and red pepper into thin strips and place down center of each tortilla. Top with onions, avocado and soup mixture. Fold tortilla around filling. ; name: mom s mixed vegetable casserole ; ingredients: margarine, cream of celery soup, mixed vegetables, water chestnuts, ritz cracker, velveeta cheese ; preparation:Pour half of margarine into 9x13 pan. Add vegetables, celery soup, and water chestnuts. Place sliced cheese on top, enough to cover all. Sprinkle with cracker crumbs. Pour the rest of margarine over all. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes. ; name: vanilla fruit dip ; ingredients: light cream cheese, brown sugar, lemon juice, vanilla essence ; preparation:Beat cream cheese and sugar together until well combined and smooth. Blend in lemon juice and vanilla essence. Spoon into a serving dish. Refrigerate until needed. Serve with any fruit you choose. ; name: amazing pineapple bread ; ingredients: butter, splenda sugar substitute, sugar, egg substitute, crushed pineapple, flour, whole wheat flour, baking soda, salt, vanilla ; preparation:

name: bbq jalapeno poppers ; ingredients: jalapenos, cream cheese, cheddar cheese, green onion, bacon, barbecue sauce ; preparation:Preheat oven to 275f. Cut jalapenos in half lengthwise and scrape out seeds. In a bowl, combine cheeses and onion and mix well. Stuff each hollowed jalapeno half with cheese mixture. Wrap bacon slices around each half, cover as much of the surface as possible. Brush bacon surface with bbq sauce. Secure with toothpicks and pop into oven for 1 hr. ; name: spicy peanut dipping sauce ; ingredients: smooth peanut butter, garlic, tamari, water, rice vinegar, chili paste, sugar, fresh cilantro leaves ; preparation:Combine peanut butter, garlic, tamari, water, vinegar, chili paste, and sugar in small bowl or food processor until well blended. Taste and adjust seasonings accordingly. Add more water to thin the sauce if necessary. Use immediately or cover and refrigerate until ready to use. Stir in cilantro just before serving. Stored properly, this sauce keeps for 4 to 5 days. ; name: magic spread ; ingredients: butter, sugar, eggs, citric acid, water ; preparation:Dissolve the citric acid and the water in a microwave proof bowl. Beat together sugar, eggs and citric acid in water. Stir in the melted butter. Mix well. Cook on high, stirring well ever 30 seconds until mixture thickens. Makes about 2 cups. Store in the refrigerator for up to two weeks. ; name: chava s thin and crispy potato kugel ; ingredients: potatoes, onion, eggs, matzo meal, baking powder, salt and pepper, oil ; preparation:Grate potatoes in the food processor. If you can grate with a large hole, use the largest. Grate onion. Place in large bowl. Add eggs, beat them first. Add rest of ingredients including oil. Mix well. Place in a greased, large pan in a thin layer. Bake at 375 till brown and crispy. For extra crunchy kugel, add about 2 extra tablespoons of oil to the pan and place the pan in the oven to heat the oil, then put in the kugel. ; name: pasta with beans basil corn ; ingredients: fresh corn, pasta, great northern beans, fresh basil, salt, extra virgin olive oil, balsamic vinegar, red pepper, yellow pepper ; preparation:Cut the kernels off the uncooked cobs and set aside. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions for al dente. Add the corn kernels to the pot for the last 30 seconds. Drain pasta. And corn in a colander and transfer to a large bowl. Add the beans, basil, salt, olive oil, vinegar and peppers and gently toss. Until blended. This can be served warm or at room temperature. Sprinkle with additional. Fresh chopped basil for an extra color and flavor splash. ; name: green grilled chicken ; ingredients: chicken breasts, curds, coriander leaves, mint leaves, green chilies, garlic, gingerroot, olive oil, salt ; preparation:Clean and wash the chicken breasts. Make slits in them with a knife. Hang the curds to drain in a muslin cloth for about 20 mins. Grind the coriander leaves, mint leaves, ginger, garlic and green chilli to a coarse paste. Mix this paste into the hung curd. Add salt and oil and mix well. Marinate the chicken breasts in this paste for 2 hours or more. Pre-heat the oven to 160c and grill the chicken till it is cooked. You can baste with the marinade at regular intervals and turn the chicken breasts over when they are cooking. Serve hot. ; name: raspberry lime pie ; ingredients: sweetened condensed milk, lime juice, cool whip, red food coloring, fresh raspberry, graham cracker pie crust ; preparation:In a bowl, combine milk and lime juice. Mix well. Mixture should thicken. Add cool whip and food coloring if desired. Fold in raspberries. Spoon mixture into pie crust. Refrigerate at least 2 hours before serving. ; name: deliciously sinful fudge brownies ; ingredients: butter, sugar, dutch-processed cocoa powder, salt, baking powder, vanilla, eggs, all-purpose flour, chocolate chips ; preparation:

name: steph s chicken tortilla soup ; ingredients: chicken breast, mexican seasoning, black beans, rotel tomatoes, hot water, chicken bouillon, cheese, sour cream, tortilla chips ; preparation:Cut and brown chicken breast, season with mexican seasoning. Add beans, rotel, hot water and bouillions in large pot. Let cook about 20 min. To mix flavor. Even better next day. Serve over crushed tortilla chips top with cheese and sour cream. ; name: green beans with herbs ; ingredients: green beans, water, butter, onion, celery, garlic, rosemary, basil ; preparation:Place beans and water in sauce pan and bring to a boil. Cook for 6-8 minutes or until crisp-tender. Drain and return to pan. Add remaining ingredients to pan. Cover and cook for 4-6 minutes or until vegetables are tender. ; name: mom s blonde brownies blondies ; ingredients: flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, margarine, brown sugar, eggs, vanilla, chocolate chips ; preparation:Cream shortening and sugar well, until fluffy. Add eggs and vanilla. Stir in dry ingredients. Fold in chocolate chips. Spoon into a greased 9x13 pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 25-30 minutes. ; name: mr jim s louisiana barbecued shrimp ; ingredients: unsalted butter, garlic cloves, fresh rosemary, fresh lemon juice, worcestershire sauce, hot sauce, large shrimp, coarse salt, fresh ground pepper ; preparation:Heat a 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat. Add butter, and cook until melted and foamy. Add garlic, rosemary, and lemon juice and rinds. Stir in worcestershire and hot sauces, and bring to a simmer. Season shrimp with salt and pepper. Add to skillet. Cook until pink and firm to the touch, 3 to 4 minutes. Season with pepper. Serve in a shallow serving bowl with bread. ; name: blue stuffed mushrooms ; ingredients: blue cheese, cream cheese, half-and-half, mushrooms, pecan halves, fresh basil leaves ; preparation:In a medium bowl, combine the blue cheese and the cream cheese. Beat them together with an electric mixer so that they are smooth. Add the half & half and beat it in so that the mixture is fluffy. Fill the mushroom caps with the cheese mixture. Top each with a pecan half and a basil leaf. ; name: peanut pecan pie ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, sugar, butter, eggs, cinnamon, vanilla, pecans, semi-sweet chocolate chips, peanut butter morsels, graham cracker crust ; preparation:Combine first seven ingredients in a large bowl. Stir well. Stir in pecans and all the chocolate and peanut butter morsels. Pour filling into graham cracker crust. Bake at 325f for 1 hour or until set. Cool on rack. ; name: one pan sausage tortellini ; ingredients: hot italian sausage, roasted garlic, onion, refrigerated cheese tortellini, tomato and basil pasta sauce, extra virgin olive oil, water, garlic salt ; preparation:Place onions, garlic and olive oil in large saucepan over medium-high heat. Squeeze sausage from casing into pan. Cook until meat is brown and no pink remains, stirring frequently and breaking meat up as it cooks. Stir in remaining ingredients. Bring to boil and cook 12 minutes, stirring occasionally, until pasta is tender and sauce thickens. ; name: summer broccoli salad ; ingredients: sugar, vinegar, miracle whip, bacon, cheddar cheese, broccoli, onion ; preparation:

name: sweet sour glaze chicken wings ; ingredients: chicken wings, ketchup, brown sugar, rice vinegar, soy sauce, sesame oil, garlic ; preparation:Rinse and drain chicken wings. Combine remaining ingredients to make glaze. Add chicken wings and stir gently to coat. Cover bowl and refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Line a baking pan with aluminum foil and arrange wings on pan. Bake for 25 minutes, turn wings and bake for another 25 minutes until golden brown. Serve immediately. ; name: new twist for mushrooms on toast ; ingredients: extra virgin olive oil, fresh mushrooms, fat-free cottage cheese, parmesan cheese, salt and pepper, 8-grain bread, margarine, tomatoes ; preparation:In a frypan heat the oil and brown the mushrooms. Add the cottage cheese. Sprinkle the parmesan cheese over. Add salt and pepper to taste. Stir and turn over and over so it does not stick. When cottage cheese becomes liquid, let it bubble for 2 or 3 minutes. Meanwhile toast bread crisp. Lightly spread with a very little margarine. Place tomato slices on toast. Sprinkle salt and pepper over. Pour mushrooms and cheeses over tomatoes. Serve immediately. ; name: crispy chicken casserole ; ingredients: chicken breasts, chicken broth, sour cream, cream of chicken soup, frozen mixed vegetables, ritz crackers, butter, garlic, pepper ; preparation:Boil your chicken in a pot of water with the chicken broth. When the chicken is done let it cool. Then debone the chicken and remove the skin. Cut chicken meat into bite size pieces. Cook the vegetables and drain liquid. In a large bowl mix chicken meat, vegetables, sour cream, can of soup, and spices. Place chicken mixture in 13x9 casserole dish. In another bowl crush ritz crackers into small pieces and spread over chicken mixture. Place dots of butter all over the crackers. Place in oven preheated at 350 for about 45 minutes or until bubbly in the middle. If crakers start to get too brown before done place a piece of tin foil over the top of chicken. ; name: bacon crescent rollups ; ingredients: crescent rolls, sour cream, onion powder, bacon, swiss cheese ; preparation:Unroll crescent rolls and separate into triangles. Spread with sour cream. Sprinkle with onion powder. Top with bacon and small amount of cheese if desired. Cut each wedge into 2 equal wedges. Roll up. Place on foil lined cookie sheet. Bake 375 for 12-15 minutes until golden. ; name: frangelico coconut cake ; ingredients: frangelico, yellow cake mix, sugar, eggs, water, almond extract, heavy cream, frosting, shredded coconut ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Combine frangelico, cake mix, eggs, water, and almond extract. Pour batter into two prepared 8 inch cake pans. Bake for 25 - 30 minutes. Turn onto a cooling rack. Beat cream with the sugar until stiff. Split the cake layers in half. Spread with whipped cream and stack on a serving plate. Frost the top and sides of the cake with your choice of frosting or frangelico frosting. Sprinkle with coconut. ; name: lamb cubes in spicy yogurt marinade ; ingredients: plain yogurt, butter, lemon, juice of, garlic, ground cumin, ground coriander, mustard seeds, cayenne pepper, salt, lamb sirloin ; preparation:Combine all ingredients except the meat in a medium bowl. Place the meat in a shallow glass or ceramic dish in one layer. Pour marinade over and turn meat to coat well. Marinate at room temperature for at least 2 hours. Drain meat. Thread on 6 skewers and grill 10 to 12 minutes, turning to cook all sides. ; name: quick sticky buns ; ingredients: unsalted butter, banana, pecans, brown sugar, refrigerated buttermilk biscuits ; preparation:Heat oven to 375 drgrees. Drop a piece of butter in the bottom of each of 10 compartments of a muffin tin. Arrange the banana slices on top. Sprinkle the pecans and brown sugar over the bananas. Top each compartment with a biscuit. Bake until golden, about 8-10 minutes. Remove from oven. Place a baking sheet on top of the buns in the muffin tin while they are atill hot. Carefully flip the tin over, tapping the bottom to release the buns. Transfer to a platter, serve warm. ; name: barcardi limon lemonade ; ingredients: ice, bacardi limon, lemonade, lemon concentrate, lime, lemon ; preparation:

name: paula deen s fiery cajun shrimp ; ingredients: butter, worcestershire sauce, fresh lemon juice, ground pepper, hot sauce, garlic cloves, salt, medium shrimp, lemons, french bread ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 400 degrees f. Stir together the butter, worcestershire sauce, lemon juice, pepper, hot sauce, garlic, and salt. Pour half this mixture into a large heatproof dish. Layer half the shrimp and half the lemon slices in the dish. Then form a second layer with the remaining shrimp and lemon slices, and pour remaining sauce into the dish. Bake, uncovered, for 20 minutes, or until the shrimp are pink, stirring twice. Pour off the sauce into individual serving dishes. Serve the shrimp with plenty of french bread for dipping in the spicy butter sauce. ; name: smoked cheese gouda or alps potato salad ; ingredients: potatoes, deli ham, smoked cheese, eggs, celery ribs, green onions, mayonnaise, lemon juice, salt & pepper ; preparation:Mix first 6 ingredients together. Mix lemon juice, mayo and salt and pepper. Mix into salad. Chill for 1 hour. Enjoy. ; name: ground beef stuffing casserole ; ingredients: onion, celery, poultry seasoning, dry bread, cream of mushroom soup, milk, ground beef, prepared mustard, worcestershire sauce ; preparation:Mix onion, celery, poultry seasoning and bread cubes. Add one can of the soup and the milk. Set aside. In a large bowl mix the ground beef and the mustard and worcestershire. Add the bread mixture. Mix thoroughly. Spread into a 9x13 pan. Spread the other can of cream of mushroom soup over the top. Bake at 375 for about 1 hour. If this starts to get brown on top or looks too dry, cover with foil. ; name: shitake miso soup ; ingredients: scallions, tofu, soy sauce, shitake mushroom, water, miso ; preparation:In a sauce pan combine soy sauce, tofu and scallions. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, cover and let simmer for 15 minutes. Add mushrooms and water, bring to a boil. Once boiling vigorously, bring down to a simmer and add mushrooms. Simmer until mushrooms reach desired tenderness. Add miso, mix until dissolved, serve. ; name: high protein no guilt skinny cheesecake ; ingredients: low fat cottage cheese, eggs, low-fat sour cream, whey powder, splenda granular, lemon, juice and rind of, vanilla extract ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 deg f. Put the cottage cheese, eggs, sour cream, whey powder, splenda, lemon rind an juice, and vanilla extract in a blender, and blend until very smooth. Pour mixed into a sprayed pie pan. Place the cake on the top rack of the oven and place a flat pan of water on the bottom rack. Bake for 30-40 minutes. Cook, then chill well before serving. ; name: chocolate mint cookies ; ingredients: flour, baking soda, cocoa powder, brown sugar, sugar, butter, applesauce, vanilla, mint extract, egg white ; preparation:Combine flour, baking soda and cocoa together in a bowl and combine. In a separate bowl, combine brown sugar, sugar, butter, applesauce, vanilla, mint extract and egg white. Beat with a hand mixer until well blended. Combine flour mix with sugar mix to form dough. Roll into a log and cover with plastic wrap. Place in freezer for about 1 hour until firm. Slice into quarter inch pieces and place on a baking sheet that has been sprayed with baking spray. Bake at 350 for about 10 minutes. Cool on wire rack. ; name: cheezy popcorn vegan ; ingredients: popped popcorn, olive oil flavored cooking spray, nutritional yeast, chili powder, salt, garlic powder, onion powder ; preparation:Place warm popcorn in a large bowl and mist it with olive oil. Toss gently and mist again. Repeat until all kernels are lightly coated with oil. Combine remaining ingredients in a zippered plastic bag. Seal bag and shake until well mixed. Drop in popcorn, a little at a time, seal bag, and shake and turn bag to coat. Continue to add a little amount of popcorn to the bag until all kernels are well coated. Store zippered bag. Shake gently again before serving. ; name: layered berries in port ; ingredients: red currant jelly, port wine, orange rind, cherries, red currants, blueberries, strawberries, raspberries, blackberries, mint ; preparation:

name: tomato soup spaghetti sauce ; ingredients: tomato soup, garlic powder, oregano, basil, vinegar, hamburger, onion, water ; preparation:Cook hamburger and onion til burger is done. Add everything else but water - combine. Add water until slightly thinner than you want sauce and simmer until desired thickness. Serve. Once you try this, adjust spices to suit your own taste. ; name: easy cornbread 4 ingredients ; ingredients: cornmeal mix, skim milk, egg, oil ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425. You can use butter spray to grease skillet, but it works best if you put a little oil in the skillet and put it in the oven while it is preheating. Remove skillet and tilt to coat pan bottom with oil right before you pour in the batter. Mix cornmeal, milk, egg and oil in bowl. Pour batter into hot skillet and return skillet to oven. Bake for 20-30 minutes depending on your oven. Cornbread is done when the top is nice and brown and the sides have pulled away from the pan. Turn over the pan and it should slide right out. Cut into wedges and serve hot. ; name: c hudson s ham potato casserole ; ingredients: cooked ham, potatoes, butter, green peppers, onion, flour, milk, mustard powder, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Saute the onion and green pepper in the butter. Gradually add flour, milk and mustard. Cook until thickened, stirring constantly. Put the ham and potatoes in a casserole dish. Pour sauce over. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Top with cheese. Bake uncovered in a 350 degree fahrenheit oven for 25 to 30 minutes. ; name: feta topped broiled chicken ; ingredients: no-added-salt tomato paste, red wine vinegar, dried rosemary, dried oregano, paprika, salt, fresh ground black pepper, boneless skinless chicken breasts, tomatoes, feta cheese ; preparation:In a small bowl, stir together the tomato paste, vinegar, rosemary, oregano, paprika, salt, and pepper. Rub the mixture onto the chichen breasts and set aside. Preheat the broiler. Broil the chicken 6 inches from the heat, turning once. Broil for 6 min or until chicken is cooked through. Top the chicken with tomato slices and broil for 1 minute. Top with the feta and broil for 1 min, or untill the cheese is melting. Place the chicken breasts on 4 plates and serve. ; name: easy italian pasta salad ; ingredients: pasta, monterey jack cheese, peas, red onion, miracle whip, italian dressing, italian seasoning, red pepper, cucumber, carrot ; preparation:Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. Mix seasoning, italian dressing and miracle whip in large bowl. Add remaining ingredients. Mix well. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve. ; name: creamy chicken enchiladas low carb ; ingredients: chicken breasts, green chilies, onion, cream cheese, cheddar cheese, heavy whipping cream, butter ; preparation:Saut onion in small amount of butter. When transparent, add chicken pieces and can of green chilies. Mix well and add cream cheese. Cook over low heat until cream cheese melts. Put mixture in a 13 x 9 baking pan, top with 1 cup of grated cheese pour the whipping cream over the top and then put the last cup of grated cheese over that. Bake at 350 for 35 minutes or so, checking to make sure the cheese gets bubbly, not burnt. ; name: make ahead swiss chicken ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breast halves, swiss cheese, reduced-fat cream of chicken soup, light sour cream, white wine, garlic powder, dry mustard, cayenne pepper, crouton ; preparation:Grease a 9x13 disposable foil pan with non-stick cooking spray. Place chicken pieces in dish. Sprinkle with swiss cheese. Mix together remaining ingredients and spread over cheese. Cover dish with foil. Place croutons in a ziploc bag and crush with a rolling pin. Tape bag of crushed croutons to dish. Freeze. When ready to bake, thaw in refrigerator overnight. Uncover dish and sprinkle with croutons. Bake at 350 degrees for 50 minutes or until bubbly. Cover with foil mid-way through cooking if croutons start getting too brown. ; name: mango frappe ; ingredients: mangoes, orange juice, lime juice, club soda, ice cubes ; preparation:

name: apple crisp a la mode ; ingredients: apples, rolled oats, brown sugar, flour, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt, butter, whipped cream ; preparation:Heat oven to 375 and lightly butter a 8 or 9 inch baking pan. Peel, core and slice the apples and arrange them evenly in the prepared pan. Place the oats, brown sugar, flour, spices and salt in a sealable bag, close and shake until combined. Cut the butter into 1 inch pieces and add to the oat mixture. Close the bag again and knead or squeeze until the mixture holds together. Open the bag and crumble the topping over the apples. Bake the apple crisp 40 to 45 minutes or until the toping is golden and juices are bubbling around the sides. Serve with ice cream, or whipped topping. ; name: old ladies on a bus chicken ; ingredients: chicken pieces, orange marmalade, barbecue sauce, worcestershire sauce, lemon juice ; preparation:Skin chicken, if desired. Arrange chicken on a foil-lined 13x9x2-inch baking pan. Set aside. In a small bowl, combine marmalade, barbecue sauce, worcestershire sauce, and lemon juice. Pour over chicken. Bake, uncovered, in a 350 degree oven for 45 minutes, spooning sauce over chicken occasionally. Increase oven temperature to 400 degrees. Bake for 15 minutes more or until chicken is tender and no longer pink. ; name: eier in gruner sosse eggs in green sauce ; ingredients: mayonnaise, sour cream, lemon, eggs, salt, pepper, sugar, fresh herbs ; preparation:Blend mayonnaise, sour cream and lemon juice. Finely chop 1 hard-cooked egg and stir into mayonnaise mixture. Season with salt, pepper, and sugar. Thoroughly rinse herbs, pat dry, and chop. Blend with the sauce. Slice rest of the hard-cooked eggs in half and arrange in the sauce and serve. ; name: mom s skillet macaroni and beef ; ingredients: extra lean ground beef, elbow macaroni, onion, ground black pepper, reduced-sodium tomato sauce, water, worcestershire sauce ; preparation:Brown beef in a large skillet and drain. Add macaroni, onion, and pepper. Cook, stirring, until macaroni is transparent. Add tomato sauce, water, and worcestershire sauce. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes. Stir, turn off heat, and allow to sit on warm burner for another 5 minutes. ; name: mini fusilli with creamy chicken and spinach ; ingredients: fusilli, extra virgin olive oil, onion, chicken breast, baby spinach, heavy whipping cream, parmesan cheese, salt and pepper ; preparation:Saut the onion in olive oil for 3 minutes on medium heat then increase to medium-high and add the chicken pieces. Season. When chicken is cooked add spinach and cream. Simmer 5 minutes. Meanwhile, cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and toss with sauce. Stir in cheese before serving. ; name: sweet pea salad ; ingredients: frozen sweet peas, sliced water chestnuts, celery, red onion, smoked gouda cheese, low-fat sour cream, sugar, salt and pepper, cashews ; preparation:Place peas, chestnuts, celery, onion, and cheese in a large salad bowl. In a small mixing bowl, stir together the sour cream and sugar until well blended. Add the sour cream mixture to the salad, then season with salt and pepper. Toss thoroughly with a large spoon. Place in refrigerator for several hours. Add the cashews just before serving, and toss well to thoroughly blend all ingredients. ; name: cheesy shredded chicken bites ; ingredients: chicken breasts, cream cheese, creole seasoning, chili powder, italian seasoning, kosher salt, shredded cheddar cheese, cracked black pepper, butter flavored cracker ; preparation:Place swanson white premium chunk chicken breast into a medium, microwave safe bowl. Shred. Add cream cheese, creole seasoning, chili powder, italian seasoning and kosher salt to the chicken. Stir together until blended. Place in a microwave for 2-3 minutes, stopping half way through to stir. Remove bowl from the microwave and add shredded cheddar cheese. Stir together until well blended. Place 1 tablespoon cheesy chicken mixture onto a cracker. Top with freshly cracked black pepper. Serve warm or cold. If serving cold, place in the refrigerator until ready to serve. ; name: merry mountain trail mix ; ingredients: honey-nut flavor toasted oat cereal, sunflower seeds, sliced almonds, flaked coconut, dried sweetened cranberries, dried apple, golden raisin, sweetened condensed milk ; preparation:

name: healthy salad ; ingredients: artichokes, cucumbers, cilantro leaf, laughing cow cheese, cherry tomatoes, pita bread, lemon juice, olive oil, ground black pepper, chives ; preparation:1preheat the oven 325 degrees f. Toast the pita cubes for five minutes. Let it cool completely. 2in a salad bowl, combine the baby cucumbers, canned artichokes, cilantro, cherry tomatoes, and cheese and toss. Add the pita cubes, which should not be hot or it will melt some of the cheese and warm the vegetables, which should not happen. 3in a small bowl combine the lemon juice, olive oil, black pepper and chives. Add to the salad and combine well. 4refrigerate for 30 minutes before serving. ; name: crock pot chops ; ingredients: pork chops, oil, minced garlic clove, soy sauce, chicken broth, brown sugar, cornstarch, water, rice ; preparation:Brown pork chops in oil if desired. I never do this step. Place chops in crock pot. Add to crock pot- garlic, soy sauce, broth, brown sugar. Cook in crock pot on low for 6 hours. Remove the chops carefully as they will fall apart quite easily. Combine cornstarch and cold water. Gradually stir cornstarch into the sauce in crock pot. Put the chops back into the crock pot and cook 20 to 30 minutes longer until sauce thickens. Serve over rice, if desired. ; name: capirotada ; ingredients: piloncillo cones, water, cinnamon sticks, green onions, french bread, soft margarine, raisins, pecans, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Combine water, piloncillos, cinnamon sticks and green onions in large pot or dutch oven. Bring to a boil and cook until the piloncillos are dissolved and the syrup is dark from the spices. Taste- you may want to add additional brown sugar or spices depending on your personal tastes. Remove from heat and take out onions and cinnamon sticks. Toast the french bread. Spread margarine liberally on both sides of toast. Layer toast, cheese, raisins, and nuts in 2 9x13 pans, repeating until both pans are full, ending with a layer of cheese, raisins and nuts. Pour the syrup over the top, dividing evenly between both pans, and making sure that all the bread is moistened. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 30 to 40 minutes. Serve hot or cold. Store in the refrigerator. ; name: delicious parmesan cheese italian bread crumbs ; ingredients: bread, garlic, ground thyme, oregano, poultry seasoning, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Heat oven to 400 degrees f. Place bread on pan and put into oven for approximately 6 minutes leave oven on. Remove from oven and let bread cool slightly. Then add to food processor along with spices ground until desired consistantcy. Return crumbs to oven, spreading evenly, for approximately 5-6 minutes. Or until lightly toasted. Remove from oven and let cool. Add parmesan cheese and stir until evenly mixed. ; name: szechuan chicken and vegetables ; ingredients: light sesame oil, chicken breast tenders, dried red pepper flakes, stir fry vegetables, low-sodium teriyaki sauce ; preparation:Heat oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken, and sprinkle with pepper flakes. Stir fry 3 minutes. Add vegetables and teriyaki sauce. Stir fry 5 minutes or until vegetables are crisp-tender and chicken is thoroughly cooked. ; name: ice wine infused peaches ; ingredients: fresh peaches, sugar, ice wine, water ; preparation:In a sauce pan combine water, sugar and ice wine. Simmer over low heat and until the sugar has dissolved. Cook syrup for 3 additional minutes, take off the heat and set aside until needed. In a glass bowl, place peach halves and pour ice wine syrup on top and refrigerate to allow the flavors to mix. Serve chilled in a small bowl and garnish with a drizzle of icing sugar. ; name: yummy low fat mac and cheese ; ingredients: elbow macaroni, low fat cottage cheese, butter, garlic, low-fat cheddar cheese, spinach, sriracha sauce, salt, pepper, boiling water ; preparation:Combine all ingredients except water in oven proof 2 quart casserole dish. Mix well. Pour boiling water over mixed ingredients. Bake at 350f for an hour. Allow to sit for 10 minutes before serving. ; name: beer hush puppies ; ingredients: yellow cornmeal, all-purpose flour, baking powder, sugar, salt, eggs, beer, onion, jalapeno pepper, vegetable oil ; preparation:

name: rob morrison s meatloaf ; ingredients: onion, garlic cloves, ketchup, egg, ground pork, ground beef, italian seasoned breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese, bacon ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place the onion, garlic, ketchup and egg in a large bowl. Stir to combine. Add meat and mix until well combined. Add breadbrumbs and cheese and continue mixing until thoroughly incorporated. Transfer meat mixture to a loaf pan. Top with bacon strips, if desired, and cover with aluminum foil. Transfer to oven and bake until meat is no longer pink, about 55 minutes. Uncover, and continue baking an additional 30 minutes. Let meatloaf stand, loosely covered, about 10 minutes, before slicing and serving. ; name: asparagus with tomato vinaigrette ; ingredients: asparagus, olive oil, red wine vinegar, plum tomatoes, scallions, fresh parsley, coarse salt, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:Bring a large stockpot filled with salted water to a boil over high heat. Prepare an ice-water bath and set aside. Add the asparagus to boiling water and cook until just tender, about 5 minutes, depending on thickness. Drain and transfer to ice-water bath for 5 minutes. Drain well and transfer to shallow serving platter or long serving dish. Meanwhile, in a small bowl, whisk together the oil and vinegar. Stir in the tomatoes, scallions, parsley, salt and pepper. Add the sauce to the asparagus, tossing gently to combine. Serve at room temperature. ; name: perfect prawns ; ingredients: king prawns, garlic-infused olive oil, butter, garlic cloves, chili bean sauce ; preparation:Shell raw prawns. Heat olive oil and butter in a non stick frypan, add crushed garlic clove and the chilli bean sauce, while still cool to allow everything to be mixed without cooking. Heat oil and add the prawns. Stir constantly for 3-4 minutes serve with simple salads. This recipe does not work with pre cooked prawns. ; name: cream curry chicken ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, margarine, heavy whipping cream, curry powder ; preparation:Melt margarine in nonstick frying pan. Add chicken to pan, cover, cook for 15 minutes over low heat. Combine whipping cream with curry powder in small bowl, set aside. Turn chicken over, pour curry mix over chicken. Cover and cook an additional 20 minutes. Serve over cooked brown rice. ; name: banana sweet potato puff casserole ; ingredients: mashed sweet potatoes, banana, curry powder, sour cream, salt, egg ; preparation:In a large bowl, combine all ingredients. Beat with electric mixer until light and very fluffy. Turn into 1 quart casserole dish. Bake at 350 degrees f. In the oven for 20 minutes or until puffed and lightly browned. ; name: kerrie s burritos ; ingredients: black beans, kidney beans, onion, green pepper, garlic cloves, chili powder, cumin, crushed tomatoes, cheddar cheese, tortillas ; preparation:Sautee onion, pepper and garlic until soft. Add the can of tomatoes, mix in spices then add beans. Simmer on low, until sauce thickens a little. This usually takes 30 minutes to an hour. Put mixture into a strainer and separate the bean mixture from the sauce. In a 9x13 pan, put a little sauce in the bottom of the pan to prevent the tortillas from sticking. Spoon bean mixture into tortillas, sprinkle with a little cheese, roll the tortilla and place in the pan. You should have enough space for 8 large tortillas in this size pan. Once the pan is full, pour sauce over the top and sprinkle with cheese. Cover with aluminum foli and bake for 20 minutes at 350 degrees. ; name: cheese and apple scones ; ingredients: cheddar cheese, apple, all-purpose flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, baking soda, butter, buttermilk ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450. Grease a baking sheet. In a bowl, mix the cheese and apples together. In another larger bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, and baking soda. Cut in butter with a pastry blender until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add in buttermilk and mix together just until blended and moistened. Fold in cheese-apple mixture. Place dough on a floured work surface and knead 10 times. With the palm of your hand, pat dough into a 9-inch circle, then cut into 8 wedges. Separate the wedges and place them on the prepared baking sheet. Bake in preheated oven for 15 minutes, or until golden brown. Cool slightly on wire rack and serve warm. ; name: buenos aires press sandwich ; ingredients: challah, brie cheese, fresh basil, tomatoes, butter ; preparation:

name: tater dipped veggies from the oven ; ingredients: instant potato flakes, parmesan cheese, garlic salt, butter, eggs, vegetables ; preparation:In shallow bowl, mix potato flakes, parmesan cheese, garlic salt and melted butter. In another bowl, beat the eggs. Dip veggies in egg, then in potato mixture. Place on baking sheet. Bake at 400 degrees fahrenheit for 20 to 25 minutes. ; name: spiced broccoli and tomatoes ; ingredients: fresh broccoli, tomatoes, gingerroot, red pepper, salt and pepper ; preparation:Separate the broccoli heads into small florets. Peel and slice the stems. Blanch the florets and stems in boiling salted water 3-4 minutes until crisp-tender. Drain thoroughly and set aside. Cut tomatoes lengthwise into eighths. Set aside. Stir-fry ginger for a few seconds. Add broccoli, tomatoes, and red pepper. Stir fry 2-3 minutes or till vegetables are heated through. Add 1-2 tbsp water and continue to stir fry for about 30 seconds. Serve hot, room temperature, or chilled. ; name: dark chocolate semifreddo ; ingredients: dark chocolate, superfine sugar, eggs, cream ; preparation:Melt the chocolate in the microwave in 30 second increments and stir well until melted. Set aside. Whip the egg whites in a medium size bowl, until medium-stiff peaks. Whip the cream to soft peaks in another medium sized bowl. Whip together the sugar and egg yolks in a large bowl, until pale. Scrape the chocolate into the bowl, and whip for several minutes until the mixture is very thick and smooth. Fold in the egg whites and then the cream. Scrape the mixture into a cake pan, loaf pan or individual molds and freeze for at least 4 hours. To unmold onto a plate, dip the bottom of the mold into hot water and then run a knife around the sides. It should pop out easily. Let sit at room temperature for 15-20 minutes to soften before serving. ; name: slammin salmon ; ingredients: salmon fillets, sesame dressing, panko breadcrumbs, roasted unsalted peanuts, sweetened flaked coconut ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400. Place fish in plastic bag or glass dish with marinade. Let sit in fridge for at least 1 hour. Mix panko, peanuts and coconut in a shallow dish. Dredge on side of the fillets in the panko mixture. In an oven safe skillet, heat 1 tbsp olive oil on medium high heat. Place fish in skillet, panko side down, but be careful--it will splatter a bit. Leave the fish to sizzle away for 3 minutes. Do not move it. Flip the fish over and place entire pan in the oven for 15 minutes. Enjoy. ; name: broccoli casserole jane and michael stern ; ingredients: white bread, eggs, milk, butter, cheddar cheese, kosher salt, sugar, broccoli florets ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350 and butter an 8-inch square baking dish. Cover the bottom of the dish generously with the torn bread. Combine the eggs, milk, melted butter, cheese, salt, and sugar in a bowl. Mix until combined. Stir in the broccoli and pour the mixture over the bread. Cover with aluminum foil and bake for 35 minutes. For a chewier top, remove the foil during the last 10 minutes of baking time. ; name: lemon crumble squares ; ingredients: flour, coconut, butter, white sugar, lemon flavor instant pudding and pie filling ; preparation:Combine butter, coconut, sugar, flour until mixture is crumbled. Press half of the crumble in a long ungreased pan. Prepare lemon pie filling as directed on box then pour over the pressed crumble. Add the remaining crumble over the lemon filling. Put in oven at 325f for a few minutes until the top of the squares are golden brown. Take out and let cool in refrigerator. Cut into squares and serve. ; name: shredded salsa verde beef crock pot ; ingredients: boneless beef chuck roast, salt, pepper, garlic powder, salsa verde ; preparation:Place roast in crock pot. Sprinkle with salt, pepper and garlic salt. Pour salsa verde over roast. Cover, and cook on low for 8 hours. When done, the roast should shred easily with a fork. ; name: marinated lemon lamb cutlets or chops ; ingredients: lamb chops, balsamic vinegar, olive oil, lemon juice, rosemary ; preparation:

name: smoothie quick sob no dairy ; ingredients: tangelo, strawberries, splenda sugar substitute, banana, ice cubes ; preparation:Peel tangelo, section, and remove white strings. Place in blender. Hull strawberries and cut in quarters. Place in blender. Add splenda or sugar to blender. Peel banana and place 1 inch chunks in blender. Place ice cubes in blender. Blend for 30-40 seconds until smoothie reaches desired consistency. The blender may need to be jiggled at the beginning as there is no liquid in the bottom. ; name: tangy cranberry relish ; ingredients: cranberries, orange juice, sugar, walnuts, orange, rind of, ground ginger ; preparation:Bring orange juice to a boil. Add washed cranberries and sugar. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer for 10-15 minutes. Remove from heat. Mash berries with a potato masher. Stir in remaining ingredients. Chill for several hours and serve. ; name: sam s loaded nachos ; ingredients: hamburger, garlic, dried chili pepper flakes, nacho chips, refried beans, black olives, chunky salsa, cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Fry hamburger with garlic and chili peppers. Drain. Meanwhile spread nacho chips around on a large cookie sheet. Top with refried beans. Sprinkle olives on top. Add salsa. Sprinkle as much or as little cheese as you want. Place in oven and heat for 15 mins. ; name: chicken pasta salad with pesto ; ingredients: farfalle pasta, cooked chicken, sun-dried tomato packed in oil, bell pepper, zucchini, red onion, basil pesto ; preparation:Cook pasta per package directions. Drain, rinse with cold water, then drain again. In a large bowl, mix pasta, chicken, tomatoes, bell pepper, zucchini, and onion. Stir in pesto. Season to taste with salt and pepper. ; name: fried jack ; ingredients: monterey jack cheese, milk, flour, seasoned bread crumbs, vegetable oil, salsa ; preparation:Cut cheese into rectangular sticks or one inch cubes. Place the cheese pieces in a bowl and pour the milk over the cheese, coating thoroughly. Remove cheese from milk and coat with flour. Quickly dip in milk again and roll each piece in bread crumbs. In a medium to large saucepan, heat 2 to 3 inches of oil to med-high heat. Quickly fry a few pieces of cheese at a time, about 1 minute or until golden. Remove with slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Serve with salsa, if desired. ; name: salisbury steak or round steak ; ingredients: ground beef, heinz 57 steak sauce, garlic powder, black pepper, worcestershire sauce ; preparation:Form salisbury steaks into patties if using. Brown steaks in skillet. While steaks brown combine remaining indgredients in a bowl. Transfer steaks to a 13x9 baking dish. Pour sauce over meat. Cover and bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour and 15 minutes. ; name: cream cheese chicken ball ; ingredients: cream cheese, dry ranch dressing mix, chicken meat, cheddar cheese, pecans ; preparation:Combine cream cheese and ranch dressing mix. Add chicken and cheddar cheese. Mix well. You can shape this into a ball and roll it in chopped pecans or just serve as a spread. Can be served immediately or can be refrigerated until ready to serve. Serve with crackers. ; name: summer squash with toasted garlic and lime ; ingredients: zucchini, salt, chicken broth, garlic cloves, lime juice, black pepper, dried oregano, flat leaf parsley ; preparation:

name: shred s margarita on the rocks ; ingredients: fresh lime juice, fresh lemon juice, agave nectar, tequila, grand marnier, lime wedge, salt ; preparation:Combine tequila, juices, agave nectar, and grand marnier in a shaker with ice. Sprinkle kosher salt onto a small plate. Wet edge of cocktail glass with lime wedge and press glass into salt. Drop a pinch of salt into the bottom of the glass, add ice and pour contents of shaker into the glass. Garnish with lime wedge. ; name: drunken sloppy joes ; ingredients: extra virgin olive oil, onion, extra lean ground beef, ketchup, southern comfort, light brown sugar, dijon mustard ; preparation:Heat the olive oil in a large and deep pan. Add the onions and fry gently until they have started to go tender. This takes about 5 minutes, stirring often. Crumble in the ground beef and cook, stirring when needed, until all of the meat is browned. This took me about 8 minutes. Add the ketchup, southern comfort and brown sugar and stir until everything is combined with the meat. Bring to a boil and then reduce to a simmer and continue to simmer for about 15 minutes, stirring now and then. Stir in the dijon mustard and then let simmer for another 15 minutes or until the sauce is the thickness you like with a sloppy joe. Serve on buns. ; name: festival berry parfaits ; ingredients: strawberries, blackberry, raspberries, sugar, mascarpone cheese, heavy whipping cream, vanilla, powdered sugar, of fresh mint, berries ; preparation:Place all the berries in a large bowl and sprinkle with the sugar. Stir to combine and leave to macerate for about 30 minutes. Using a mixer, beat the mascarpone, heavy whipping cream, powdered sugar and vanilla extract just until soft peaks form. Take four wine or parfait glasses and layer the berries with the cream. Garnish with a sprig of fresh mint and a few fresh berries. The parfait can be made about an hour or two before serving. Cover and store in the refrigerator. ; name: cheesy bacon and vegetable slice ; ingredients: vegetable oil, bacon, onion, garlic, zucchini, carrots, self-raising flour, eggs, cheese, chili sauce ; preparation:Grease a 19cm square cake pan, line base with baking paper. Heat oil in large pan, add bacon, onion and garlic, cook, stirring until onion is soft. Add vegetables and cook, stirring, about 5 mins or until any liquid is evaporated. Cool. Combine vegetable mixture with sifted flour and remaining ingredients in a medium bowl. Mix well. Spread mixture into prepared pan. Bake in moderate oven for about 30 mins or until firm. ; name: mint iced tea ; ingredients: water, peppermint tea bags, orange pekoe tea bags, orange, zest of, mint leaves, whole cloves, superfine sugar, pink grapefruit juice, ice cube, mint sprig ; preparation:Bring water to boil in a tea kettle. In a large tea pot, place tea bags, orange zest, mint leaves and cloves and then pour boiling water over all. Add sugar and stir until dissolved. Cover and let steep until cool. Strain tea through mesh strainer into a large pitcher filled with ice. Stir in grapefruit juice. Serve over ice in large glasses, garnished with mint sprigs, if desired. ; name: easy jamaican pot roast ; ingredients: roast, vegetable oil, sea salt, paprika, dried thyme, garlic cloves, onion, tomatoes, scotch bonnet pepper ; preparation:Put oil into dutch oven or cast iron pot and heat on high until hot and smoking. Add roast beef and sear on all sides, till well browned. Lower heat and season roast with sea salt, paprika and thyme. Add garlic, onions, tomatoes and hot peppers together, mix well and add to pot with roast. On top of roast and along the sides. Cover and cook on top of the stove on low heat for 3-4 hours, baste often with juice in pot until meat is tender and falls apart with fork. Thicken spicy gravy and serve over hot rice or roasted potatoes and slices of the pot roast. ; name: pollo al ajillo garlic chicken yummy ; ingredients: whole chickens, garlic cloves, olive oil, salt, bay leaves, white wine ; preparation:Start by peeling the garlic cloves and slicing them roughly. Ppour olive oil until the bottom of the frying pan is covered and wait until it just starts to smoke. While you wait you can add salt to all the chicken bits. Then add all the garlic pieces and just when they start to brown add the chicken, inserting the bay leaves in between. You will need to cook it for aproximately 30 minutes or until all the pieces are crispy and brown, taking care to turn the pieces over so they get equally brown all over. If you want to have a bit of sauce, towards the end of the cooking lower the heat to minimum, remove the excess oil from the frying pan and add a glass of white wine. Cook for another 5 minutes and serve. ; name: mustard dill pretzel dip ; ingredients: sugar, olive oil, mayonnaise, stone ground mustard, prepared mustard, garlic powder, dill weed ; preparation:

name: traditional senoran potatoes grande ; ingredients: potatoes, diced green chilies, onion, oil ; preparation:Slice peeled potatoes. Chop onion. Heat oil to medium high. Add potatoes to hot oil and saute about 3 minutes. Add onions and saute about 3 minutes. Add green chili and cover. Turn burner to simmer and simmer about 20 minutes, or until done. ; name: southwestern pan seared corn ; ingredients: vegetable oil, corn, red bell pepper, red onion, poblano pepper, ground cumin, black olives, cilantro, fresh lime juice, salt ; preparation:Heat oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add corn before oil smokes and saute 2-3 minutes until lightly browned. Place corn in a mixing bowl and set aside. Add peppers and onions to skillet and cook 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add cumin and cook another 1-2 minutes. Turn heat to low, stir in remaining ingredients. Toss with corn and serve. ; name: spinach cheese patties ; ingredients: low fat cottage cheese, egg yolks, flour, wheat germ, fresh spinach, olive oil, salt and pepper ; preparation:Mix together the first four ingredients. It gets thick and gooyey. Add spinach and mix again. Pour olive oil in a skillet. I use about 2 t. Get it hot. Fry the patties until golden brown. ; name: tomato lentil stew ; ingredients: lentils, onions, oil, chopped tomatoes, water, oregano, basil, black pepper, salt ; preparation:Cook lentils in the water. Meanwhile, chop the onions. Saut onions in a little oil. Add the tomatoes when the onions are translucent. Cook 5-10 min then add the lentils. Cook 5 more minutes. ; name: julie s chicken and greens soup for sickies ; ingredients: water, instant chicken bouillon, garlic, angel hair pasta, mixed salad green ; preparation:Combine the water, bouillon, garlic, and pasta pieces. Let simmer for 5 minutes. Add greens and simmer for another 3 to 5 minutes or until greens are to the texture you like. Serve to the sickie and try to get them to eat as much as they can. Makes about 2 servings. ; name: mango rum cake ; ingredients: mango, butter recipe cake mix, eggs, butter, light rum, water ; preparation:Spray the bottom of a 10 inch tube pan or bundt pan with a non-stick vegetable spray and dust with flour. Arrange mango cubes in the bottom of the pan. Blend together rum, water, eggs, butter, and pureed mango. Add cake mix and beat at medium speed for 4 minutes. Pour batter into prepared pan and bake at 375f for 45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the cake comes out clean. Cool cake 20 minutes in the pan. Loosen and remove from pan onto serving plate. ; name: carrot pecan casserole ; ingredients: baby carrots, sugar, butter, pecans, milk, eggs, all-purpose flour, orange rind, vanilla extract, ground nutmeg ; preparation:In a large saucepan, add carrots. Add water to cover. Bring to a boil. Cook for 25 minutes or until carrots are tender. Drain and cool slightly. Process carrots in a food processor until smooth. Pour carrots into a mixing bowl. Add in remaining ingredients. Stir to combine. Transfer mixture into a greased 11x7 inch baking dish. Bake, uncovered, at 350 degrees for 40 minutes. ; name: field greens with roasted bacon wrapped pears ; ingredients: bacon, pears, mixed salad greens, pecans, parmesan cheese, vinaigrette ; preparation:

name: summer peach salad ; ingredients: cream cheese, mayonnaise, heavy cream, fresh peaches, pecans, lemon juice ; preparation:Beat cream cheese and heavy cream until fluffy. Stir in mayo and lemon juice. Fold in peaches and pecans. Pour into 9x9x2 glass dish and freeze for 3-4 hours. Using warm knife, cut into squares. ; name: easy baked asparagus ; ingredients: asparagus, olive oil, kosher salt, black pepper, lemon, juice of ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375-400f. Remove fibrous end pieces of the asparagus. Lay asparagus across shallow baking dish and add oil, salt, lemon juice, and pepper. Roll and toss to coat well. Arrange the oiled asparagus in the pan so they do not overlap. Bake in oven 20 minutes. ; name: polenta sos style ; ingredients: cornmeal, water, salt, cooked turkey, turkey gravy mix ; preparation:To cook the polenta boil 6 cups salted water. Add cornmeal slowly while stirring with a wisk. Turn to low and cook until thick and creamy. Pour polenta onto a greased cookie sheet and cool for several hours. When cool, cut into squares. Individual squares can be grilled or pan fried. Mix gravy according to package. Plate the polenta then top with turkey and gravy and its ready to serve. ; name: beer buns ; ingredients: bisquick, egg, sugar, beer ; preparation:Blend all ingredients with a fork. Do not beat. Heat oven to 400 degrees. In 12 muffin cups put a dab of solid shortening. Place in oven for shortening to melt. When melted, remove muffin pan from oven and swirl the melted shortening in the cups. Drop batter by spoonfuls into prepared muffin cups. Bake 12-15 minutes. ; name: potato fries with onion and chilli ; ingredients: potatoes, vegetable oil, onion, garlic, chili powder, salt, black pepper, lime ; preparation:Bring water to boil in pot and cook potatoes until they are just tender. Cool to handle and then cut each quarter into thick slices. Heat oil in large skillet and add potatoes and onion. Turn until the vegetables are pale gold. Add garlic and cook until the garlic turns golden. Add chilli powder, salt and pepper. Cook, stirring to coat the potatoes and lightly toast chilli powder. Sprinkle with lime juice before serving. ; name: aunt marie s peas ; ingredients: mushrooms, peas, onion, celery, butter, pimientos, salt, pepper ; preparation:Drain mushrooms, reserve liquid. Cook peas in amount of mushroom liquid called for on pea package. Cook onions& celery in butter until soft. Add pimentos& mushrooms, heat thoroughly. Add peas, salt& pepper. Refrigerate until next day. Heat to serve. ; name: zaney s sesame chicken ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breast halves, red hot sauce, sesame oil, sugar, flour, salt, pepper, sesame seeds ; preparation:Marinate chicken breasts in sesame oil, redhot sauce and sugar. Let sit, covered, in the fridge 30 minutes. Add salt and pepper to flour in a shallow dish. Dredge chicken in flour. Spray baking dish with pam. Put the chicken in the baking dish and sprinkle with the sesame seeds if using. Bake at 350 for 30-40 minutes or until chicken juices run clear. ; name: peppy egg strata ; ingredients: white bread, jalapeno jack cheese, cheddar cheese, bacon, eggs, milk, salt, pepper ; preparation:

name: carolina ham cheese melt ; ingredients: butter, dijon mustard, prepared horseradish, worcestershire sauce, onions, poppy seeds, kaiser rolls, cooked ham, cooked turkey, swiss cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix the butter, mustard, horseradish, worcestershire, onions and poppy seeds in a small bowl. Lightly spread the mixture on both sides of the cut roll. Place ham on bottom slices, add a little more dressing to the top of the ham and top with mounds of grated cheese. Put the tops on each one. Wrap the sandwiches individully in foil and place in a 350 degree oven for 25-30 minutes or until cheese melts. ; name: chunky hawaiian spread ; ingredients: cream cheese, sour cream, crushed pineapple, mango chutney ; preparation:Beat cream cheese, sour cream, pineapple and chutney in medium bowl until blended. Spoon cream cheese mixture into medium serving bowl. Cover and chill 1 hour or overnight. Serve with low fat of fat free crackers. Refrigerate any leftover spread in airtight container up to 1 week. ; name: crispy baked fish ; ingredients: vegetable oil cooking spray, whole wheat bread crumbs, fresh ground black pepper, parsley, reduced-calorie mayonnaise, water, hot pepper sauce, fish fillets, lemon wedges ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Lightly spray a baking sheet with vegetable oil spray and set aside. Sprinkle crumbs onto an ungreased baking sheet and allow to bake 5-7 minutes or until lightly browned. Combine bread crumbs, black pepper and parsley in a shallow pan and set aside. Raise oven temperature to 400f. Combine mayonnaise, water and hot pepper sauce in shallow bowl, mixing well. Dip fish in mayonnaise mixture and then dredge in bread crumbs. Place fish on greased baking sheet and bake in oven 17-18 or until fish flakes easily. Serve with lemon wedges. ; name: thai flavoured fish packets ; ingredients: sesame oil, leek, bok choy, plaice fillets, lime juice, chili pepper, light soy sauce, sugar, coriander ; preparation:Preheat oven to 200 degrees celsius heat oil in a small frying pan and stir fry leek and bok choy until just starting to wilt. Cut 4 large squares of kitchen foi. Divide veg between them, and lay 2 pieces of fish on top of each square. In small bowl, mix together fish sauce, lime juice, chilli, soy sauce, and sugar. Pour over fish. Seal foil together and place on baking tray. Place tray in oven and cook 10 minutes. Let packets sit for a couple of minutes before opening to prevent steam burns. Open and scatter fish with coriander. Serve with noodles. ; name: easy canned green beans ; ingredients: cut green beans, white vinegar, beef bouillon cube, water, vegetable oil ; preparation:Pour green beans into small cooking pot. Add water, vinegar, boulion cube and oil. Bring to a boil. Turn down to medium. Simmer for approximatly 45 minutes, or until most all the liquid has evaporated. ; name: lemon roasted asparagus gratin ; ingredients: asparagus spears, butter, garlic clove, lemon zest, pepper, salt, fresh breadcrumb, swiss cheese, lemon juice ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425f spread asparagus even in a 13x9-inch glass baking dish. In a small bowl, mash together butter, garlic, lemon zest, pepper and salt. Drop in small dots over asparagus spears in a baking dish. Roast for about 15 minutes, shaking dish haflway to coat asparagus in butter, or until asparagus is just tender-crisp and starting to brown. Meanwhile, in a bowl, combine breadcrumbs, cheese and lemon juice. Sprinkle over asparagus and bake for about 3 minutes or until cheese is melted. Broil 1-2 minutes or until golden brown. Cooking. Trimmed green beans. Increase roasting time to 25 minutes. ; name: lost souls poached salmon ; ingredients: salmon fillets, sliced mushrooms, green onion, honey, sugar, vinegar, garlic powder, onion powder, butter ; preparation:Melt butter in skillet. Add mushrooms and green onions. Saute for about 1 minute. Add vinegar, garlic, onion powder, sugar, and honey. Mix well and bring to a boil. Turn heat down to med. Add salmon filets and let poach for about 15 min or until fish is flakey. ; name: fish fillet and scallops in green peppercorn sauce ; ingredients: fresh boneless fish fillets, butter, lemon rind, scallops, green peppercorn, lemon juice, salt and black pepper ; preparation:

name: steve s garlic and lime sauce ; ingredients: canola oil, garlic, limes, juice and zest of, salt, pepper ; preparation:Heat the oil in a small saucepan until very hot. Add the garlic and cook, swirling the pan, until just golden. Remove from heat and whisk in the lime zest and juice. Season with salt and pepper. Drizzle over cooked fish. ; name: jg house vinaigrette ; ingredients: chicken bouillon cube, sugar, black pepper, garlic powder, cider vinegar, olive oil ; preparation:Place the bouillon cube in a bowl with 2 tbsp water. Microwave on high for 30 seconds to dissolve cube. Place sugar in a bowl and add pepper, garlic powder, and vinegar. Stir and let set 5 minutes. Whisk in the dissolved bouillon and gradually add oil in a slow steady stream while whisking vigorously. Whisk again before serving. ; name: prawns shrimp in garlic sauce ; ingredients: olive oil, garlic cloves, dried red chili, prawns, salt ; preparation:Pour the olive oil into a heatproof earthenware ramekin. Heat the ramekin on a hob until hot. Add the garlic and chilli and cook, stirring often, until the garlic is fragrant. Take care not to let the garlic burn,. Add the prawns, mixing in well, and season with salt. Cover the ramekin, cook for half a minute then remove from the heat. Serve at once. ; name: oven dried tomato parmesan bread ; ingredients: dried tomatoe, water, milk, extra virgin olive oil, white bread flour, whole wheat flour, parmesan cheese, salt, sugar, bread machine yeast ; preparation:Put the ingredients into the bread machine per your bread machine instructions. Mine calls for adding the liquid ingredients first and then adding the flours on top. Save the tomatoes for later. Put the salt in one corner of the flour, the sugar in another. Sprinkle the parmesan cheese over the flour. Make a well for the yeast and add it. Set the bread machine for basic and medium crust and start the machine. After 5 minutes of kneading add the tomatoes or when the machine beeps. This makes a one pound loaf. ; name: caesar orzo with asparagus ; ingredients: reduced-sodium chicken broth, water, orzo pasta, fresh asparagus, parmesan cheese, caesar salad dressing ; preparation:In a large saucepan, bring broth and water to boil. Add orzo. Cook and stir for 5 minutes. Add asparagus. Cook, uncovered, over medium heat 4-6 minutes or until pasta and asparagus are tender, stirring frequently. Drain. Stir in parmesan cheese and caesar dressing. ; name: maple chicken wings ; ingredients: chicken wings, teriyaki sauce, light soy sauce, garlic, garlic powder, onion powder, black pepper, pure maple syrup ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Remove wing. Place in disposable large baking pan. Add the maple syrup, soy sauce, teriyaki sauce, garlic, garlic powder, onion powder, and black pepper. Toss to coat. Place pan on baking sheet and bake for approximately 1 hour, tossing every 15 to 20 minute the liquid will gradually evaporate the longer you cook it. After 1 hour, increase the oven temperature to 425. Turn wings to coat evenly and cook on additional 45 minute. ; name: ferrycarrig traditional irish brown bread ; ingredients: natural bran, white flour, whole meal flour, baking soda, salt, oatmeal, sugar, buttermilk ; preparation:Mix all dry ingredients together. Add buttermilk. Place mixture into greased loaf pan. Bake 475 degrees for 15 minutes. Reduce temp 350 degrees. Bake 60 minutes. Remove bread from oven. Wrap loaf in damp cloth. Allow to stand for 3 hours before cutting --. ; name: chocolate chip cookies 10 ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, baking soda, salt, granulated sugar, brown sugar, unsalted butter, egg yolks, vanilla extract, chocolate chips ; preparation:

name: chicken stuffed with smoked salmon ; ingredients: chicken breasts, oil, onion, red pepper, chicken soup, smoked salmon, sweetcorn, water, salt, pepper ; preparation:Pre heat oven to gas 4, 350f, 180c. Make a pocket in the chicken breasts and stuff with smoked salmon leaving a little of the salmon left over for the sauce. Place in a ovenproof dish. Fry onions in oil until golden, then add red pepper and cook for a further minute. Add soup, water, remainding salmon and sweetcorn and mix well. Pour over the chicken. After 20 mins cooking in oven give the sauce a stir and baste chicken breasts with the sauce, cook for further 20 mins and serve. ; name: peasant girls in the mist scandinavian apple and cream pudding ; ingredients: cooking apples, caster sugar, unsalted butter, rye breadcrumbs, soft brown sugar, ground cinnamon, whipping cream, icing sugar, lemon juice, toasted hazelnuts ; preparation:Put the cubed and peeled apple chunks into a large saucepan with the caster sugar and 2 to 3 tablespoons water. Cook them over a gentle heat until they are completely tender - stirring them every so often to mash them down. Put them into a bowl to cool. Melt the butter in a frying pan and add the breadcrumbs and brown sugar. Saute, stirring constantly over a medium heat until the breadcrumbs are golden brown. Add the cinnamon and stir well. Remove from the heat and allow to cool. Whip the cream and add the icing sugar & lemon juice. Take a large glass bowl or 4 individual glass bowls and layer the stewed apples, breadcrumbs and cream - ending with a layer of cream. Scatter with the chopped hazelnuts and serve. ; name: nanay s filipino fried chicken ; ingredients: whole chickens, garlic cloves, bay leaves, whole black peppercorn, soy sauce, distilled white vinegar, water, oil ; preparation:In a large pan combine the chicken, garlic, peppercorns, bay leaves, soy sauce, vinegar and water and bring to a boil. Simmer uncovered over low heat until chicken is cooked through. Remove chicken from pan and pat dry. In a large skillet heat the oil over medium heat until it is hot but not smoking. Then deep fry the chicken in batches until it is brown and the skin looks crispy. Serve with rice. Enjoy --. ; name: skewered mustard beer shrimp ; ingredients: large raw shrimp, garlic powder, cayenne pepper, spicy brown mustard, light beer ; preparation:Peel and de-vein shrimp, leaving tails intact. Thread 6 shrimp onto each of 8 skewers. Sprinkle shrimp with garlic powder and pepper. In a bowl, combine mustard and beer. Stir to combine. Coat grill rack with cooking spray. Place rack on grill over med-hot coals. Place skewers on rack. Grill, uncovered, 5 minutes on each side, basting shrimp often with mustard mixture. ; name: old fashioned homemade lemonade concentrate ; ingredients: citric acid, tartaric, epsom salts, lemons, juice of, lemons, zest of, granulated sugar, boiling water ; preparation:Mix all ingredients together well. Pour boiling water over mixture. Stir shortly. Let stand overnight. Strain mixture and then bottle. When you wish to drink it, add the concentrate to water to taste. ; name: mock crock pot roast ; ingredients: beef eye round, root beer, garlic powder, lemon pepper, cornstarch, water ; preparation:Mix the root beer, garlic powder and lemon pepper in a small pot. Add the steak and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for one hour to an hour and a half. Remove steak. Mix cornstarch with a little bit of water. Add to the leftover sauce and stir on medium heat until thickened. Serve over noodles or rice. ; name: pancho villa baked tilapia ; ingredients: olive oil, tilapia fillets, diced tomatoes, diced green chilies, lime, juice of, fresh cilantro, salt and pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Coat 4 pieces of aluminum foil with olive oil and center fillets in them. Spoon diced tomatoes with juices over fish and do the same with the chilies. Sprinkle with lime juice and cilantro. Add sprinkling of salt and pepper if preferred. Close and seal foil packets, and place on a baking tray. Bake for approximately 20 minutes, or until fish flakes easily with a fork. ; name: no bake cherry cheesecake pie ; ingredients: prepared graham cracker crust, cream cheese, sugar, frozen dessert topping, cherry pie filling ; preparation:

name: boulevard gourmet s shrimp mojito ceviche ; ingredients: red onion, garlic cloves, of fresh mint, fresh lime juice, salt & freshly ground black pepper, shrimp, french baguettes, extra virgin olive oil ; preparation:Combine the onions, 1 clove minced garlic, chopped mint, lime juice, salt and pepper in a nonreactive container. Add the shrimp, toss, cover and refrigerate 12 hours, tossing periodically to coat shrimp. Meanwhile, cut 1 garlic clove in half and rub the bread slices with the garlic. Place bread on a baking sheet and bake in a 350f oven 15 minutes or until toasted. Serve each shrimp, tail up, on a bread round. Drizzle with olive oil and garnish with a fresh mint leaf. ; name: white chocolate potato chip cookies ; ingredients: shortening, granulated sugar, brown sugar, eggs, vanilla, white chocolate chips, flour, baking soda, potato chips ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cream shortening and sugars. Add eggs and vanilla. Beat well. Sift flour and baking soda and stir into creamed mixture. Add crushed potato chips and white chocolate chips. Stir to integrate fully. Drop by heaping spoonfuls onto greased cookie shhet. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes. ; name: sauteed sirloin and mushrooms ; ingredients: boneless beef sirloin, herb seasoning mix, butter, beef broth, hoisin sauce, onion, fresh mushrooms ; preparation:Cut steak into 4 servings-size pieces. Sprinkle with herb pepper or garlic pepper. In a 10-inch skillet cook steaks in hot butter over medium heat for 8 to 10 minutes or to desired doneness, turning once. Remove steak from pan. Cover and keep warm. For mushroom glaze, carefully add beef broth and hoisin, teriyaki, or worcestershire sauce to skillet. Cook until bubbly, scraping brown bits from bottom skillet. Stir in onoin wedges and sliced mushrooms. Cook over medium-high about 8 minutes or until vegetables are tender and the glaze is reduced to half its volume. Transfer warm steak to dinner plates and spoon glaze on steaks. ; name: fruit and mascarpone italian cheesecake pie ; ingredients: graham cracker pie crust, mascarpone cheese, powdered sugar, whipping cream, kiwi, strawberry ; preparation:Combine mascarpone, powdered sugar, and whipping cream in a medium bowl. Beat until creamy. Spread mixture evenly onto crust. Chill thoroughly in the refridgerator for at least 1 hour. Arrange sliced fruit over pie before serving. ; name: dreamsicle bars ; ingredients: instant tang orange drink, sugar, vanilla chips, all-purpose flour, baking soda, baking powder, butter, eggs, vanilla, water ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl, cream the butter, eggs, vanilla, and water. Add the remaining dry ingredients and stir until the mixture is well blended. Spread batter into a lightly greased 9x12 pan. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes. Cool in pan. Cut into 2-inch squares. ; name: oatmeal spelt brown bread ; ingredients: quick oats, boiling water, butter, warm water, salt, molasses, spelt flour, instant yeast ; preparation:In a medium bowl, combine oats and boiling water. Let cool to lukewarm. Add butter, warm water, salt and molasses. Stir and pour into bread bucket. Add both flours and yeast. Start machine on dough cycle. When cycle ends, dump out dough on floured board. Knead several times and place in greased loaf pan. Let rise in warm place until doubled. Bake at 375f for 20-30 minutes. ; name: squash snackers ; ingredients: yellow squash, olive oil, balsamic vinegar, fresh garlic, fresh basil, celery salt, asiago cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Coat the bottom of a casserole dish with olive oil. Line the bottom of the dish with the squash making sure that they are laid out evenly and sprinkle with vinegar. Top with even amounts of garlic, basil and celery salt. Bake uncovered at 350 for 20 minutes. Remove from oven and add about one cube of cheese per slice. Cook for another 15 minutes remove and let cool for five minutes and serve on crackers or eat by themselves. ; name: copycat sizzler rice ; ingredients: orzo pasta, butter, chicken bouillon powder, garlic powder, onion powder, long-grain rice, lemon juice, warm water ; preparation:

name: mini turkey loaves ; ingredients: ground turkey, apple, onion, old fashioned oats, dijon-style mustard, dried rosemary, poultry seasoning, salt, cranberry sauce ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425f. Grease 12 muffin cups. Combine turkey, apple, onion, oats, mustard, rosemary, poultry seasoning and salt in large bowl. Press into prepared muffin cups and bake 20 minutes or until lightly browned and no longer pink in center. Top with cranberry sauce. ; name: andreas fault bagel sandwich ; ingredients: bagel, egg, avocado, sun-dried tomatoes, red onions, monterey jack cheese, alfalfa sprout, cooked bacon, salt & pepper ; preparation:Split bagel in half and toast lightly. Meanwhile, scramble eggs and cook in a small frying pan sprayed with nonstick cooking spray until done, trying to keep the eggs in one large piece. Butter bagel if desired and place cooked egg on top of one half. Top with a sprinkling of cheese, a slice of red onion, some avocado slices, and the sun-dried tomatoes. Top with bacon strips and alfalfa sprouts if desired. Season to taste with some salt and pepper. Place remaining bagel half on top and cut into two halves. Serve warm. ; name: arugula salad with shaved manchego ; ingredients: honey, white balsamic vinegar, olive oil, coarse salt, fresh ground black pepper, slivered almonds, arugula, sun-dried tomato packed in oil, manchego cheese ; preparation:In a large bowl, whisk honey and vinegar until combined. Whisk in oil. Season with salt and pepper. Add arugula, sun-dried tomatoes and almonds to the dressing. Lightly toss. Using a vegetable peeler, thinly shave the manchego. Add half to the bowl, and toss to combine. Divide among four serving or salad plates. Top with remaining manchego. Serve immediately. ; name: lemon herb duck breasts ; ingredients: fresh parsley leaves, garlic, lemon zest, coarse black pepper, dried thyme, fresh rosemary, duck breasts, extra virgin olive oil, salt ; preparation:Combine parsley, garlic, lemon zest, pepper, thyme and rosemary in a bowl. Roll duck pieces in herb mixture to coat all over. Put oil in a large saut pan, and turn heat to medium-high. When oil shimmers add duck, and reduce heat to medium. Cook, turning once or twice, until coating browns and duck is medium-rare to medium, about 10 minutes. Season meat with salt, and let it rest for a few minutes. Serve. ; name: garlicky potato puffs ; ingredients: potatoes, butter, garlic cloves, potato starch, salt, fresh ground black pepper, eggs, parsley, paprika ; preparation:Pre-heat oven to 400f. Add the minced garlic to the melted butter and allow to stand until needed. Peel, dice, and boil potatoes till tender. Mash with a potato masher. Add all ingredients to the potatoes and mix well. Place large tablespoons of the mixture in a buttered baking dish or on a cookie sheet. Sprinkle each with paprika, if desired. Bake in the oven for about 10 to 12 minutes, or until golden brown. ; name: crock pot chicken over pasta ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, low sodium chicken broth, season-all salt, italian seasoning, onion powder, garlic powder, salt & pepper, cream of chicken soup, cream cheese, medium egg noodles ; preparation:Pour the broth into a crock pot then add the chicken & spices. Cook on high for 2. 5 hours or on low for 5 hours. Remove the chicken & shred, place back in the pot. Mix in the soup & cream cheese, stir until melted.
