Cover with the lid & continue to cook on low for 30 minutes. During the last 10 minutes cook the noodles as directed on the package. Once done, drain & add to the chicken mixture. Serve hot. ; name: pan sauteed sole flounder parmesan ; ingredients: sole fillets, eggs, parmesan cheese, vegetable oil, salt, white pepper, paprika, lemon juice ; preparation:Season the grated cheese with pepper and paprika to taste. Dip fish in the eggs and then coat in the parmesan. Heat oil in frying pan and add fish cooking about 2 minutes on each side, depending on thickness, over medium-high heat,. Season with salt and pepper during cooking. Serve with lemon juice. ; name: sweet and spicy coleslaw ; ingredients: green cabbage, carrots, yellow onion, mayonnaise, mustard, apple cider vinegar, sugar, black pepper, cayenne, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:

name: slow cooker cranberry sauce ; ingredients: fresh cranberries, sugar, water, lime zest ; preparation:Combine the cranberries, sugar and water in the slow cooker. Cover and cook on high for 2 to 2. 5 hours. The cranberries will have popped open. Stir the zest into the hot sauce. Turn off the cooker, remove the lid, and let cool in the crock to room temperature. When cooled store covered in the refrigerator for up to 3 weeks. Serve chilled or at room temperature. If you use frozen cranberries, add 30 to 45 minutes cooking time. ; name: lemon tomato salmon ; ingredients: salmon fillets, lemon, juice of, tomatoes, zucchini, yellow squash, extra virgin olive oil, salt, fresh coarse ground black pepper ; preparation:Preheat the over to 325 degrees f. Slice zucchini and yellow squash into thin slices. Dice the tomato. Place the salmon fillet in a glass or ceramic oven-safe casserole dish. Drizzle about a tablespoon of olive oil onto the fillet, season with salt and pepper lightly. Lightly cover the fillet with slices of zucchini and yellow squash. Place excess around the fillet. Place the remaining olive oil, lemon juice and diced tomato in a small bowl. Lightly crush the tomato and mix everything together. Pour tomatoes, lemon juice and olive oil mixture over the fillet and vegetables. Season lightly and let bake for about 15-20 minutes. ; name: bow ties with sausage and peppers ; ingredients: bow tie pasta, hot italian sausage, sweet pepper, vegetable broth, coarse black pepper ; preparation:Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, cut sausage into bite-size pieces. In a large skillet cook sausage and peppers over med-high heat until sausage is brown. Drain off fat. Add broth & pepper to skillet. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer uncovered for 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Drain pasta and toss with sausage mixture. ; name: best of all macaroni cheese ; ingredients: macaroni, egg, small curd cottage cheese, sour cream, cheese, salt and pepper, basil ; preparation:Combine egg, cottage cheese, sour cream, cheese, salt, and pepper in a large bowl. Add cooked pasta and mix together. Place in any casserole dish. Cook at 350 degrees for a half an hour. Sprinkle with basil for extra flavor. ; name: italian scalloped potatoes ; ingredients: potatoes, onion, mozzarella cheese, parmesan cheese, cream of mushroom soup, milk, italian seasoning, garlic ; preparation:In greased cassarole arrange half the potatoes, onions, mozzerella and parmesean cheese. Repeat the layers. In a small bowl, combine soup, milk, seasoning and garlic. Pour over the layered potatoes and cheese. Cover and bake at 400 f or 200 c for 1 hour. Uncover and bake 10 more minutes or until potatoes are tender. ; name: apple cider pork chops ; ingredients: boneless pork loin chops, butter, yellow onions, salt, apple cider, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:Brown chops on both sides in a large skillet, remove and set aside. Melt butter in same large skillet. Thinly slice onion and cook in butter for 15 minutes or until caramelized. Add apple cider to onion and then nestle chops down in the onion and cider. Cook over medium heat for 10 minutes until chops are cooked through and cider reduces by a little more then half. ; name: oven fried fish ; ingredients: orange roughy fillets, butter, all-purpose flour, paprika, lemon juice, parsley, worcestershire sauce ; preparation:Place fish on a broiler rack that has been coated with a non-stick cooking spray. Brush tops of fish with 3 tablespoons of the butter or margarine. Dust with flour. Sprinkle with paprika. Broil 5-6 inches from the heat for 5 minutes or until fish just begins to brown. Combine lemon juice, parsley, worcestershire sauce and remaining butter. Pour over the fish. Broil 5 minutes longer or until fish flakes easily with a fork. ; name: japanese soy glazed sweet potato ; ingredients: brown sugar, low sodium soy sauce, mirin, dark sesame oil, garlic cloves, sweet potatoes, toasted sesame seeds, nori ; preparation:

name: soya tomato cheese casserole ; ingredients: soybeans, cream-style corn, tomatoes, sugar, seasoning salt, soft breadcrumbs, cheese, paprika ; preparation:Lighty grease a shallow casserole dish. Arrange beans in alternate layers with corn. Mix tomatoes, sugar, and salt. And pour over bean mix. Top with buttered crumbs, mixed with cheese, and sprinkle with paprika. Bake uncovered 180c for about 40-45 minutes. ; name: mom s shoofly pie ; ingredients: boiling water, baking soda, molasses, flour, brown sugar, shortening, salt ; preparation:Pour boiling water over soda, in a bowl. Stir in molasses. Mix crumbs. Mix half of crumbs into filling and pour into pie shells. Sprinkle rest of crumbs over the two pies. Bake at 350f degrees for 30-40 minutes. ; name: pommes de terre avec udon ; ingredients: potatoes, cherry tomatoes, green pepper, yellow onion, olive oil, rice vinegar, fresh udon noodles, salt, pepper ; preparation:Heat olive oil in large skillet and add chopped onions. Salt the onions to bring out flavor. Cook until slightly golden. Salt potatoes, add to skillet and cook until potatoes begin to soften and turn brown around the edges. Add rice wine vinegar to help the onions caramelize and bring out the natural flavor of the vegetables. Add chopped pepper, tomatoes and fresh udon noodles. Mix together and season with salt and pepper as needed. ; name: cheesy sour cream herb chicken ; ingredients: herb seasoned stuffing mix, parmesan cheese, butter, sour cream, boneless skinless chicken breasts ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a bowl, combine stuffing, cheese and butter. Stir well to combine and moisten, breaking up any large stuffing pieces. Transfer to a plate or pie pan. Lightly spread sour cream over chicken and coat with stuffing mixture, pressing well to adhere. Place on a lightly oiled, foil-lined 13-by-9-inch baking sheet. Put any extra mixture on top of chicken. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes, or until the coating is crisp and the chicken is cooked through. ; name: orzo with parsley and lemon ; ingredients: orzo pasta, coarse salt, olive oil, lemons, zest of, black pepper, parsley ; preparation:Cook orzo in salted water 12 min, to al dente. Drain well, but do not rinse. Transfer to a serving bowl. Drizzle with oil, and season with salt and pepper. Toss with zest and parsley, and serve. ; name: california turkey burger ; ingredients: ground turkey, cilantro, breadcrumbs, yellow mustard, egg, salt, black pepper, monterey jack cheese, red bell peppers ; preparation:Combine first seven ingredients in a large bowl. Shape into 4 patties. Grill over high heat for 15 minutes or until no longer pink in center. Top with cheese during last few minutes of grilling. Grill pepper rings for two minutes. Place burgers on bun, top with pepper rings. ; name: white beans with garlic crumb crust ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, garlic, balsamic vinegar, tomatoes, zucchini, red bell pepper, white kidney beans, breadcrumbs ; preparation:I just flavoured this with a bit of salt, but if you had fresh basil, thatd be good, too. The recipe called for one bay leaf and some thyme, but i dont have any around. Heat oil in a sauce pan, add onions and garlic. Add balsamic, zucchini and pepper, cook until softened. Add tomatoes, lower heat and simmer 20 min. Heat oven to 350 f, and grease a baking dish. Combine the beans with the tomato mixture and pour into the pan. Mix together crust ingredients and sprinkle overtop. Bake 30 min. ; name: clams with cherry tomatoes ; ingredients: olive oil, cherry tomatoes, dry white wine, littleneck clams, garlic cloves, lemon, fresh parsley, french bread ; preparation:

name: black forest cake mix ; ingredients: chocolate cake mix, eggs, almond extract, cherry pie filling, semi-sweet chocolate chips ; preparation:Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Pour cake batter into a well greased bundt pan. Bake in a preheated 350 oven for 45 minutes or until a tester comes out clean. Cool for 25 minutes in the pan before turning out onto a rack to cool completely. Wonderful served with vanilla icecream or whipped cream. ; name: smooth golden fudge ; ingredients: evaporated milk, sugar, salt, vanilla extract, water, golden syrup, margarine, liquid glucose, nuts, chocolate ; preparation:Heat the milk, water, syrup, glucose, salt, margarine and sugar in a heavy based pan, untit the sugar has dissolved, and the margarine has melted. Stir constantly. Bring to the boil, and boil rapidly. Stir constantly, otherwise it will catch on the bottom of the pan. Boil until the sugar thermometer reads 115oc, which is the soft ball stage. Remove from heat, and add vanilla, but do not stir in. Leave the pan on a side to cool to 45oc. This could take quite a while. Beat until thick, and it looses its gloss. Scrape into a prepared tin to cool. Leave in the fridge for 3 hours, or until firm. Dip in melted chocolate and roll in chopped nuts for an added touch. ; name: joanne s spicy shrimp salsa ; ingredients: tomatoes, red onion, jalapeno pepper, bay shrimp, fresh cilantro, cumin, garlic, lime juice, salt, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:Drop the fresh tomatoes into a small pan of boiling water for about 2 minutes or until the skins blister. Remove from the water, cool, and peel. Coarsely chop the fresh or canned tomatoes and place in a large bowl. Stir in the remaining ingredients. Cover and refrigerate at least 4 hours. Serve with baked tortilla chips or as a side dish. For a thicker salsa, combine all the ingredients except shrimp in a food processor. Pulse 3 times or until desired consistency. Stir in shrimp. ; name: white chocolate oat cranberry cookies ; ingredients: butter, brown sugar, eggs, rolled oats, all-purpose flour, baking soda, salt, dried cranberries, white chocolate ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375. Witch a electric mixer, beat butter and sugar in medium mixing bowl until light and fluffy. Add eggs, mixing well. Combine the oats, flour, salt and baking soda in a separate mixing bowl. Add to butter mixture in several additions, mixing well after each addition. Stir in cranberries and the white chocolate chunks. Drop batter by rounded teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake 10-12 minutes or until golden brown. ; name: anzac slice ; ingredients: rolled oats, plain flour, caster sugar, desiccated coconut, chocolate chips, golden syrup, butter, bicarbonate of soda, hot water ; preparation:Preheat oven 160 degrees c. Grease and line a 20cm x 30cm baking tin. Combine oats, flour, sugar, choc chips and coconut in a large bowl. Melt the butter and golden syrup over medium low heat in a small saucepan. Combine bicarb and hot water and add to golden syrup mix. Pour golden syrup mix into bowl and mix together well, choc chips will probably melt from heat of golden syrup mix. Press into tin and bake 20-30 min or until cooked through, do not overcook or it will be tough instead of chewy. Cool in tin for 10 min the turn onto wire rack to cool before cutting into squares. Can omit the choc chips. Can melt 300g dark chocolate and pour on top of cooled slice. ; name: honey and orange glazed chicken ; ingredients: boneless chicken breasts, vegetable oil, green onions, garlic clove, honey, orange juice, orange, soy sauce ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 375. Place the chicken, with the skins on, in a single layer in a shallow roasting dish and set aside. Heat the oil in a small saucepan and gently fry the green onions and garlic for about 2 minutes, until softened, but not browned. Add the honey, orange juice, orange segments and soy sauce to the pan, stirring well and cook until the honey has completely dissolved. Pour the sauce over the chicken and bake, uncovered, for about 45 minutes, basting once or twice until the chicken is cooked. ; name: herb marinated ostrich ; ingredients: ostrich steak, balsamic vinegar, olive oil, garlic, fresh rosemary, fresh thyme leave, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:Combine marinade ingredients in plastic bag. Add meat, turning to coat. Close bag securely and marinate in refrigerator one hour, turning occasionally. Preheat oven broiler. Remove meat from marinade. Discard marinade. Place meat on rack in broiler pan so that surface of meat is three to four inches from heat. Broil 12 to 16 minutes per side for medium-rare to medium doneness. Carve into slices and serve. ; name: crusty fried chicken ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, garlic salt, salt, celery salt, pepper, paprika, chicken pieces, canola oil ; preparation:

name: tagine of onions ; ingredients: red onions, olive oil, ground ginger, fresh ground pepper, cinnamon, sugar ; preparation:Place the onions in a shallow baking dish and spread them out evenly. Mix the remaining ingredients in a small bowl, then pour over the onions and stir gently to coat. Set aside for 2 hours. Preheat oven to 325f. Cover dish with foil tightly, then the lid and bake for 45 minutes, until the onions are very soft. Increase the oven temp to 400f, remove lid and foil and bake for 5-10 minutes more until the onions are lightly glazed. Serve with grilled meats. ; name: marinated olives with lemon and fresh herbs ; ingredients: green olives, fresh thyme, fresh parsley, fresh rosemary, garlic cloves, lemon juice, fresh ground pepper, olive oil, fresh lemon zest ; preparation:In a food processor or blender, mix all the herbs, garlic and lemon juice. Slowly add olive oil and blend. Add zest. Pour marinade over olives. They can be served immediately but will improve with a day to marinate. ; name: bacon and mushroom chowder ; ingredients: bacon, chicken broth, mushrooms, potatoes, onions, cream of mushroom soup, milk ; preparation:In a soup pot, fry bacon- set aside. With bacon drippings, fry onions until clear, add mushrooms. Stir for about 5 minute add chicken stock and potatoes. Cook until potatoes are tender. Return bacon to pot. Just before serving add milk, salt and pepper, to taste, and mushroom soup. Stir well and serve. ; name: guinness brined pork chops ; ingredients: water, guinness stout, dark brown sugar, light molasses, salt, garlic cloves, black pepper, sage leaves, pork chops ; preparation:For brine, combine water, guinness, brown sugar, molasses and salt. Soak the pork chops in mixture for at least 4 hours overnight is fine. Combine garlic, pepper, salt and sage to create rub. Remove pork chops from brine and pat dry. Rub with the rub mixture on both sides. Grill chops until they are done to your satisfaction. Serve and enjoy. ; name: grandma katies famous sausage rice ; ingredients: jimmy dean sausage, celery, onions, lipton soup secrets noodle soup mix, boiling water, long grain rice, soy sauce, salt, pepper ; preparation:Use a food processor to finely chop the onion and celery. Brown sausage, celery and onions in a large skillet, drain off fat. Place in large casserole dish. Mix dry soup mix with the 9 cups of boiling water and cook for 5 minutes. Mix all ingredients together and bake covered at 325f for 1-2 hours. ; name: coleslaw with raisins ; ingredients: coleslaw mix, pine nuts, raisins, onion, mayonnaise, malt vinegar, sugar, mustard, salt, pepper ; preparation:Open the bag of coleslaw cabbage into a large mixing bowl. Add raisins, onions and nuts. Combine gently. In a small bowl, whisk together the remaining ingredients until very well blended. Pour the dressing over the cabbage mixture and gently combine until evenly blended. Refrigerate for a minimum of 2-hours. Garnish with a sprig of cilantro or parsley leaf. ; name: chipotle lime chicken wings ; ingredients: chicken wings, chipotle barbecue sauce, honey, lime, zest of, lime juice, flour, cornstarch, seasoning salt ; preparation:Combine barbecue sauce, honey, lime juice and zest and set aside. Combine flour, corn starch and seasoning salt in a bowl. Dust each wing with flour mixture and set aside on wax or parchment paper. Heat deep fryer or potted oil to 325 - 350f. Dust a few wings at a time- second time and fry for 7 - 8 minutes - let cool on wire rack. When all the wings have been fried - heat 2 -tablespoons of butter in a deep pan. Add the sauce mixture and combine well with the butter. Add the wings and mix to make sure each wing is completely saturated with sauce & rewarmed. Serve --. ; name: baked pears with raisins ; ingredients: pears, raisins, maple syrup, butter, vanilla extract, cinnamon ; preparation:

name: baked sweet savory mashed potatoes ; ingredients: baking potatoes, salt, sweet potatoes in syrup, cream cheese, bacon, sour cream, chicken broth, pepper ; preparation:Bring potatoes, 1 teaspoon salt, and water to cover to a boil. Cook 30 minutes, or until tender. Drain. Return potatoes to pan. Add sweet potatoes and cream cheese. Mush until smooth with potato masher. Stir in bacon, next 3 ingredients, remaining 2 teaspoons of salt. Spoon mixture into lightly greased 11x7-inch baking dish. Bake uncovered at 350f for 20 minutes. Garnish with the rest of the bacon. ; name: dad s iced tea ; ingredients: tea bags, boiling water, water, sugar ; preparation:Warm your teapot or glass or ceramic saucepan by rinsing it with boiling water. Place place tea bag in pot. Pour boling water over bags. Cover and steep 3-5 minutes. Remove tea bags, add sugar, stir until sugar dissolves. Stir in 2 cups of water. ; name: spinach and feta omelet ww ; ingredients: egg, egg whites, spinach, oregano, salt, feta cheese ; preparation:In a small bowl combine first 5 ingredients. Spray a small skillet with pam and head over medium heat. Add egg mixture to skillet, cooking until bottom of eggs is firm. Flip omelet and cook other side until set. Put cheese on one half of omelet and flip over other half. Cut in half to serve. ; name: spiced wassail ; ingredients: cinnamon sticks, cloves, whole allspice, apple cider, cranberry juice, granulated sugar, orange bitters, oranges, rum extract ; preparation:Break the cinnamon stick into pieces, &--along with the whole cloves & whole allspice--tie the cinnamon pieces in a cheesecloth bag. Cut each orange in half. In a large covered saucepan, combine the cider, cranberry juice, sugar & orange bitters. Add the spice bag, oranges & rum extract, & simmer, covered, for 10 minutes. Remove spices & pour into a warm serving bowl, leaving the oranges to float on top. ; name: rogene s yummie potatoes ; ingredients: potatoes, butter, sour cream, cream of chicken soup, green onion, chicken stock, cheddar cheese, breadcrumbs, salt, pepper ; preparation:Cook potatoes till tender, peel and grate. Heat the butter with soup and chicken stock. Blend in sour cream, onion, and most of the cheese. Mix with the potatoes. Add salt and pepper to taste. Spread into a 9x13 baking dish. Mix the bread crumbs with the melted butter and then place on top of the potatoe mixture. Sprinkle with the remaining cheese. Bake for 45 min at 350 degrees or until bubbly. ; name: sesame chicken penne pasta ; ingredients: sesame seeds, boneless skinless chicken breast, low-sodium instant chicken bouillon granules, hot water, low sodium soy sauce, sesame oil, dry white wine, fresh mushrooms, onion, penne pasta ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spread sesame seeds in baking pan and toast in oven 5-10 minutes, or until lightly browned. Roll chicken strips in toasted seeds and place in single layer in baking pan. Combine chicken stock, soy sauce, sesame oil and wine. Pour over chicken. Let stand 30 minutes at room temperature. Top with sliced mushrooms and onion rings. Bake 45 minutes. Toss with pasta. ; name: mujadara ; ingredients: olive oil, sweet onions, green lentil, brown basmati rice, water, salt ; preparation:Saute onion in oil until caramelized. While onions are cooking place lentils in saucepan and cover with water by an inch. Bring to boil over medium heat. Reduce to a simmer and cook for 20 minutes. Drain lentils and set aside. When onions are ready stir in rice, lentils, salt and 2 cups water. Bring to a boil, cover and reduce heat to a simmer. Simmer for 40 minutes or until rice is tender. ; name: mashed garlic carrots ; ingredients: carrots, garlic, vegetable stock, dried thyme, salt and pepper ; preparation:

name: peanut butter breakfast sandwiches ; ingredients: reduced-fat peanut butter, french bread, honey, bananas, eggs, milk, ground cinnamon, butter, fruit preserves ; preparation:Spread peanut butter evenly onto one side of each slice of bread snd drizzle honey over the peanut butter. Cut each banana in half lengthwise and then cut in half crosswise. Arrange 2 banana pieces on 4 of the prepared bread slices. Top with remaining bread slices, peanut butter-sides down. In a shallow bowl combine eggs, milk, and cinnamon. Carefully dip sandwiches into egg mixture, coating both sides. Melt butter in a large skillet or on a large griddle over medium heat. Cook sandwiches in hot butter about 2 minutes on each side or until golden. Meanwhile, in a small saucepan heat fruit preserves over medium-low heat until melted, stirring frequently. To serve, cut warm sandwiches in half crosswise. Drizzle with warm fruit preserves. ; name: patent leather icing glossy chocolate ; ingredients: chocolate, egg, evaporated milk, water, sugar, vanilla ; preparation:Melt the chocolate in the top of a double boiler. Combine the egg, milk, water and sugar and stir into the chocolate. Cook the icing over hot water for 20 minutes, stirring often. Remove it from the steam. Beat it with a rotary beater for 1 minute or until well blended. Stir in the vanilla. Cool the icing before spreading it. Tightly covered and stored in the refrigerator it will keep for several days. ; name: weight watchers chocolate chip blondies 3 points ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, baking powder, table salt, brown sugar, light butter, egg whites, vanilla extract, mini chocolate chip, water ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f in a small bowl, combine flour, baking powder and salt. In a large bowl, beat brown sugar and butter until fluffy. Add egg whites and vanilla. Gradually beat in flour mixture alternating with water. Stir in chips. Spread into a foil-lined 9- x 13-inch baking pan. Bake until golden, about 20 to 25 minutes. Cool on wire rack. Remove foil and cut into 24 two-inch squares. ; name: garlic basil chicken with red roasted pepper alfredo spaghetti ; ingredients: chicken breasts, butter, garlic cloves, fresh basil leaves, alfredo sauce, spaghetti noodles ; preparation:Pre-heat oven 350. Mix half of chopped fresh basil, melted butter and garlic together in baking casserole dish. Place chicken breasts on top of mixture and top with remaining fresh chopped basil. Bake covered for 45 minutes. Bake uncovered for 15 minutes. Prepare spaghetti noodles boil for 7-10 minutes to preferred taste. Over low heat warm alfredo sauce, stir often. Be careful not to scorch. Serve. Pepper to taste. ; name: field salad with snow peas grapes and feta ; ingredients: white wine vinegar, fresh orange juice, extra virgin olive oil, sugar, salt, fresh ground black pepper, gourmet salad greens, snow peas, red seedless grapes, feta cheese ; preparation:Combine first 6 ingredients in a small bowl. Stir well with a whisk. Combine remaining ingredients in a large bowl. Drizzle dressing over salad. Toss well. ; name: bacon wrapped hot dogs with avocado ; ingredients: hot dogs, bacon, vegetable oil, hot dog buns, hass avocado, sour cream, salsa ; preparation:Pat the hot dogs and bacon dry with paper towels. Wrap each hot dog with a slice of bacon in a spiral. Secure the bacon at each end with a toothpick. In a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil until shimmering. Add the hot dogs and cook over moderate heat, turning, until the bacon is crisp, about 5 minutes. Transfer the hot dogs to paper towels to drain. Discard the toothpicks. Tuck the hot dogs in the buns. Top with the sliced avocado, sour cream and salsa and serve. ; name: italian rice and peas ; ingredients: fresh peas, long grain rice, onion, celery, dry white wine, boiling water, chicken stock cubes, butter, parmesan cheese, salt and pepper ; preparation:Melt 2 oz of butter in a saucepan. Add chopped onion and celery, cook until just translucent. Add rice, cook a few minutes more, stirring to coat the rice with butter. Add wine, 1 cup of boiling water and crumbled stock cubes. Bring to a boil, add peas. Reduce heat, simmer uncovered until the water has evaporated. Add another cup of boiling water, cook until evaporated. Add the final cup of boiling water. Keep cooking until the water is almost absorbed. Overall cooking time is about 20 minutes. Stir in the parmesan cheese and 1 oz butter. Add salt& pepper to taste. ; name: cream cheese dessert wedges ; ingredients: refrigerated buttermilk biscuits, cream cheese, sugar, egg, all-purpose flour, ground cinnamon ; preparation:

name: marshmallow fruit salad ; ingredients: mini marshmallows, mandarin oranges, fruit cocktail, sour cream ; preparation:Drain liquid from canned fruit. Dump everything into large bowl. Mix really well. Chill at least 1 hour. Serve. ; name: honey balsamic chicken satay great for camping ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, garlic cloves, honey, balsamic vinegar, olive oil, crushed red pepper flakes, ranch dressing ; preparation:Cut each chicken breast into 3 or 4 long strips. Combine all other ingredients in a small bowl and whisk until combined. Place chicken in ziploc bag and add marinade. Marinate for at least one hour. Thread chicken onto bamboo skewers. Grill over medium to hot coals or fire until juices run clear. ; name: salmon with lemon capers and rosemary ; ingredients: salmon fillets, extra virgin olive oil, salt, fresh ground black pepper, fresh rosemary leaf, lemon slices, lemon juice, marsala wine, capers, aluminum foil ; preparation:Brush top and bottom of salmon fillets with olive oil and season with salt, pepper, and rosemary. Place each piece of seasoned salmon on a piece of foil large enough to fold over and seal. Top the each piece of salmon with 2 lemon slices, 1 tablespoon of lemon juice, 2 tablespoons of wine, and 1 teaspoon of capers. Wrap up salmon tightly in the foil packets. Place a grill pan over medium-high heat or preheat a gas or charcoal grill. Place the foil packets on the hot grill and cook for 10 minutes for a 1-inch thick piece of salmon. Serve in the foil packets. ; name: chipotle copycat recipe cilantro lime rice ; ingredients: long grain white rice, water, bay leaf, cilantro, olive oil, lime, salt ; preparation:Rinse rice well until water runs clear. Combine rice, water and bay leaf in a pot, cover it and bring it to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer about 18 minutes. Fluff with a fork and stir in cilantro. Add oil, lime juice and salt together, stir well. Taste and adjust- might need more lime or salt. ; name: carolyn s easy cheesy macaroni cheese ; ingredients: elbow macaroni, butter, velveeta cheese, milk, pepper ; preparation:Prepare the macaroni according to package directions. While the macaroni is cooking melt the butter in a large saucepan on low to medium heat. Cut the velvetta in cubes and add to the butter and stir constantly. When the cheese starts to melt add the milk and stir to combine until smooth. Drain the macaroni and add to the cheese mixture. Pepper can be used at the table, but i would not use too much if a child is eating this. If putting in a crockpot to keep warm, you might need to add a little milk to it right before serving. Just use your judgement and how your family likes their mac & cheese. ; name: elana s paleo banana bread ; ingredients: bananas, eggs, vanilla, honey, palm oil shortening, almond flour, sea salt, baking soda, chocolate chips ; preparation:Pulse bananas, eggs, vanilla, honey and shortening in a food processor. Pulse in almond flour, salt and baking soda. If desired, pulse chocolate chips into batter. Scoop batter into a greased 7. 5 x 3. 5 inch loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 55-60 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool. ; name: south of the border strata ; ingredients: white bread, monterey jack cheese, green chili, ham, milk, eggs, green onions, tabasco sauce, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Spray 9x13 inch casserole dish. Place bread on bottom and top with monterey jack cheese, green chiles and ham. Mix eggs, milk, green onion& tabasco and pour over bread. Top with cheese and cover over night. Bake 325 for 40 minutes. ; name: low carb taco potatoes ; ingredients: aluminum foil, onion, red potatoes, taco seasoning, olive oil, mexican blend cheese ; preparation:

name: garlic basil chicken with red roasted pepper alfredo spaghetti ; ingredients: chicken breasts, butter, garlic cloves, fresh basil leaves, alfredo sauce, spaghetti noodles ; preparation:Pre-heat oven 350. Mix half of chopped fresh basil, melted butter and garlic together in baking casserole dish. Place chicken breasts on top of mixture and top with remaining fresh chopped basil. Bake covered for 45 minutes. Bake uncovered for 15 minutes. Prepare spaghetti noodles boil for 7-10 minutes to preferred taste. Over low heat warm alfredo sauce, stir often. Be careful not to scorch. Serve. Pepper to taste. ; name: roasted red potatoes ; ingredients: small red potatoes, olive oil, italian seasoning, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Spray 13x9 dish with cooking spray. Slice potatoes fairly thin and place in dish. Drizzle with olive oil. Toss to coat. Sprinkle italian seasoning and parmesan cheese on top. Bake for 45 minutes or until golden brown. ; name: praline french toast bake ; ingredients: eggs, half-and-half, brown sugar, vanilla extract, french bread, butter, maple syrup, pecans ; preparation:In a small bowl, combine eggs and next 3 ingredients and pour half into a 13x9x2 inch pan. Cover with bread slices, top with remaining egg mixture. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Heat oven to 350f degrees. In a glass 13x9x2 inch baking dish, melt 1 stick of butter and stir in remaining ingredients. Cover butter mixture with soaked bread pieces and bake 30-35 minutes until puffed and brown. Cut into squares and invert onto plates to serve. ; name: light wheat beer bread ; ingredients: whole wheat flour, bread flour, baking powder, salt, sugar, splenda sugar substitute, beer, butter ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375. Mix dry ingredients and beer. Pour into a greased loaf pan. Pour melted butter over mixture. Bake 1 hour, remove from pan and cool at least 15 minutes before slicing. ; name: tomato basil side dish ; ingredients: cherry tomatoes, garlic cloves, basil leaves, olive oil ; preparation:Heat oil in a saute pan over medium heat. Add garlic and stir for around 5 minutes until golden, but not burned or bitter. Remove pan from heat, let cool. Place tomatoes and basil in serving bowl, pour cooled oil and garlic over. Toss well. ; name: chicken and artichoke bake ; ingredients: artichoke hearts, fresh spinach, shallot, garlic, chicken broth, white wine, chicken thighs, cream of chicken soup, milk, diced green chilis ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Drain and cut the artichokes into smaller pieces and place in a medium size bowl. Add the spinach, garlic and shallots. Mix the chicken broth and wine and pour over spinach and artichokes mixture. Mix well and set aside. Skin the thighs and remove any fat. Place in a 9 inch square baking dish. Mix the chicken soup, milk and green chilies together and set aside. Spread spinach mixture over the chicken. Pour soup mixture over spinach mixture. Cover with a lid or foil. Put it in the oven and bake for 1 hour or until chicken is done and juices are hot and bubbly. ; name: lemon chicken with olives ; ingredients: boneless chicken thighs, olive oil, onion, garlic cloves, diced tomatoes, lemon, brown sugar, oregano, kalamata olive, salt & pepper ; preparation:Fry off chicken until browned, about 5 minutes. Put aside and keep warm. In the same fry pan, fry off onions and garlic. Cook til transparent or soft, about 3 minutes. Stir often. Add chicken back to the pan. Add tomatoes, lemon slices, sugar and oregano. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer uncovered 40 minutes. It is ready when the sauce is thickened and the chicken is cooked through. Stir in olives in the last few minutes. Season with salt and pepper, if needed. ; name: crunchy banana cinnamon oatmeal ; ingredients: oatmeal, milk, cinnamon, banana, cereal ; preparation:

name: champagne chicken salad ; ingredients: mayonnaise, sugar, champagne, white vinegar, cooked chicken, red apple, pear, lettuce, feta ; preparation:Combine the mayonnaise, sugar, champagne, and vinegar. Whisk together until blended. Combine the salad dressing, chicken, apples, pears in a bowl, and mix well. Serve over lettuce. Sprinkle with feta cheese. ; name: pasta with salmon ; ingredients: shallot, dill, salmon fillets, butter, dry white wine, frozen shrimp, pasta, fish stock, cream, salt and pepper ; preparation:Cut the shallot and the dill. Cook the shrimp. In a deep skillet, heat the butter, add the shallot and the dill then fry the salmon fillets. When the shrimp is cooked add to the skillet. Then in the same skillet where the salmon and shrimp are -- add the fish stock, the cream and the white wine. Add salt and pepper to your taste and leave in low heat from 2-3 minutes, moving every now and then to mix well. Cook the pasta in water with salt. When the pasta is al dente, drain it and add it to the deep skillet where the salmon and shrimp are. Mix well and serve hot. ; name: reverse cordon bleu ; ingredients: boneless chicken breasts, bacon, swiss cheese, italian seasoning, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Slice each breast on the horizontal to create a small pocket for stuffing. Lightly pound each to tenderize. Place the swiss cheese in each. Wrap the breasts with approximately 2 slices of bacon each. Place in a cold fry pan, and turn the heat to medium. Fry until bacon turns crispy, and the chicken is cooked through, turning once. Sprinkle with italian seasoning, and parmesan cheese. ; name: penzey s no bake peanut butter bars ; ingredients: graham crackers, cinnamon, butter, pure vanilla extract, peanut butter, powdered sugar, chocolate chips ; preparation:Crush the graham crackers into fine crumbs. One third of a box is usually one cellphane wrapped package. Mix in the cinnamon and set aside. Melt butter in a large saucepan. Remove from heat and add peanut butter and vanilla and mix well. Add the powdered sugar and graham crackers, stir until well combined. Pat the mixture into an ungreased 9x13 pan. Melt the chocolate over low heat in a heavy saucepan, or spread evenly in a glass pie plate and microwave 30 seconds at a time, stirring after each 30 seconds, until melted. Spread the melted chocolate over the peanut butter layer. Refrigerate for one hour, bring to room temperature, and cut into bars. ; name: mashed potatoes swirled with pesto ; ingredients: potatoes, milk, butter, salt, pepper, pesto sauce, basil, pine nuts ; preparation:Cover and cook potatoes in boiling salted water for 15 to 20 minutes, until potatoes are fork tender. Drain potatoes. Mash potatoes in a large mixing bowl until no lumps remain. Add butter and milk, salt, and pepper mashing in to blend together. Fold in pesto very lightly just to streak the potatoes. Garnish with pine nut and basil. ; name: carolina panthers cheese dip ; ingredients: ground beef, onion, garlic cloves, pepper, velveeta cheese, cream of mushroom soup, pace picante sauce, jalapeno pepper ; preparation:Cook beef, onion and garlic in large skillet until well browned. Drain grease. Add remaining ingredients. Cook on medium till cheese is melted and mixture is heated through. Stir often. Serve warm with corn chips, nachos, potato chips, etc. This same recipe may be made in a crock pot. ; name: makeover honey french dressing ; ingredients: ketchup, honey, onion, cider vinegar, apricot nectar, garlic cloves, paprika, celery seed, salt, canola oil ; preparation:In a blender or food processor, combine the first nine ingredients. Cover and process until blended. While processing, add oil in a steady stream. Process until thickened. Store in the refrigerator. ; name: world s easiest chili ; ingredients: vegetable oil, onion, ground turkey, cumin seed, tomatoes, kidney beans, red chili powder, black pepper, sazon goya, salt ; preparation:

name: super easy sausage peppers ; ingredients: sweet italian sausage links, olive oil, sweet onion, green bell peppers, tomato sauce ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400. Bake cut up sausages for about 20 minute while sausage is cooking put onion and oil in large skillet saute onion till translucent. When sausage is done add to skillet with the onions and add the tomato sauce. Cook for 20 minutes then add the peppers and cook 20 minutes more. Serve over rice. ; name: baby spinach omelet ; ingredients: eggs, baby spinach, parmesan cheese, onion powder, ground nutmeg, salt and pepper ; preparation:In a bowl, beat the eggs, and stir in the baby spinach and parmesan cheese. Season with onion powder, nutmeg, salt, and pepper. In a small skillet coated with cooking spray over medium heat, cook the egg mixture about 3 minutes, until partially set. Flip with a spatula, and continue cooking 2 to 3 minutes. Reduce heat to low, and continue cooking 2 to 3 minutes, or to desired doneness. ; name: monroeville s favorite shrimp casserole ; ingredients: shrimp, cream of mushroom soup, mayonnaise, diced pimentos, garlic, worcestershire sauce, salt and pepper, hard-boiled eggs, breadcrumbs, slivered almonds ; preparation:Combine all ingredients except the bread crumbs and almonds. Pour in a greased casserole dish. Combine the bread crumbs and almonds. Sprinkle over the top of the casserole. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. ; name: chocolate dipped krispies peanut butter balls ; ingredients: butter, chunky peanut butter, vanilla, powdered sugar, rice, paraffin wax, chocolate chips ; preparation:Melt butter and while hot, stir in peanut butter. Mix well and add vanilla, powdered sugar and rice krispies. Work in with hands until it will form balls. If using paraffin shred on a box grater then add to the chocolate in a double boil and heat till melted and combined. Dip into melted chocolate and paraffin or shortening with toothpick. Cool on waxed paper. ; name: shaker pumpkin muffins ; ingredients: brown sugar, molasses, butter, egg, pecans, pumpkin puree, baking soda, salt, all-purpose flour ; preparation:Cream sugar, molasses, and butter in a mixing bowl. Add pumpkin and egg and mix well. Mix the dry ingredients into the pumpkin batter and fold in nuts. Grease muffin tins and fill half full. Bake at 375 degrees for 20 minutes. ; name: gunflint walleye ; ingredients: butter, garlic cloves, fresh lemon juice, walleyed pike fillet, salt & freshly ground black pepper, romano cheese, fine dry breadcrumb, green onion ; preparation:Spray a 15x10x1 baking pan with nonstick cooking spray. In small saucepan, melt butter and stir in garlic and lemon juice. Rinse fillets. Cut into 6 servings, if necessary. Place fillets in a single layer in baking pan. Brush with garlic-lemon butter. Season lightly with salt and pepper. Sprinkle fish with romano cheese and cover with bread crumbs. Drizzle the fish with any remaining garlic-lemon butter. Bake in 450 oven for 10 to 12 minutes or until flakes easily. Transfer fillets to warm serving platter and garnish with green onion. ; name: quinoa corn and tomato salad with chive infused oil ; ingredients: water, quinoa, fresh corn kernels, cherry tomatoes, fresh flat-leaf parsley, oil, fresh lime juice, white wine vinegar, salt, garlic clove ; preparation:Combine water and quinoa in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer 10 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Remove from heat. Let stand 10 minutes. Fluff with a fork to separate and let cool a bit if time. While quinoa is cooking, combine corn, tomatoes, and parsley in a medium bowl. In a small bowl, whisk together oil and remaining ingredients. After quinoa has stood for 10 min., add to vegetable mixture, toss to combine, then drizzle dressing over it. Toss well to coat. Let stand 10 minutes before serving. ; name: crunchy cheese potatoes ; ingredients: sour cream, milk, chives, salt, pepper, potatoes, sharp cheddar cheese, corn flakes ; preparation:

name: grand marnier or kahlua or rum or whatever truffles ; ingredients: butter, cocoa, sweetened condensed milk, vanilla extract, grand marnier ; preparation:In heavy saucepan over low heat melt butter. Add cocoa. Stir until smooth. Blend in milk. Stir constantly until mixture is thick, smooth and glossy, about 4 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla and grand marnier. Chill 3 - 4 hours until firm. Shape into 1-inch balls. Roll in cocoa or confectioners sugar. Chill until firm, 1-2 hours. Store covered in refrigerator. ; name: basil pesto lighter version ; ingredients: pine nuts, garlic, extra virgin olive oil, fresh basil leaves, parmesan cheese, salt ; preparation:Add nuts and garlic to blender and pulse until minced. Add olive oil, pulse a few time more. Add basil leaves, cheese, salt and blend until smooth. Scrape sides of blender as you go to make sure everthing mixes well. Serve with your favorite pasta. ; name: crustless crab quiche ; ingredients: onion, butter, salt, parmesan cheese, crab, feta cheese, eggs, milk ; preparation:Heat oven to 400f. Saut onions in butter until caramelized. Add salt to taste. Beat eggs and milk together in small bowl. Sprinkle parmesan in bottom of well greased muffin trays or pie dish. Layer onions, then crab, then feta cheese. Pour egg mix over top. Cook 20 minute. Let cool 8-10 minutes. If it is sticking, scrape the edges with a knife to help release. ; name: pasta salad with chicken and artichokes ; ingredients: pasta shells, oil, mayonnaise, lemon juice, parsley, dried basil, chicken, artichokes, tabasco sauce, toasted almond ; preparation:Cook pasta in large pot of boiling, salted water until tender, but firm, 8 to 12 minutes, stirring often. Drain well and rinse with cold water. Shake out excess water and toss pasta with oil. Combine mayonnaise, lemon juice, parsley and basil. Place pasta in large bowl. Add mayonnaise mixture, chicken, artichokes and tabasco. Toss well. Garnish with almonds. For a decorative presentation, serve in avacado halves, in tomato cups or on lettuce leaves. ; name: honey and orange glazed chicken ; ingredients: boneless chicken breasts, vegetable oil, green onions, garlic clove, honey, orange juice, orange, soy sauce ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 375. Place the chicken, with the skins on, in a single layer in a shallow roasting dish and set aside. Heat the oil in a small saucepan and gently fry the green onions and garlic for about 2 minutes, until softened, but not browned. Add the honey, orange juice, orange segments and soy sauce to the pan, stirring well and cook until the honey has completely dissolved. Pour the sauce over the chicken and bake, uncovered, for about 45 minutes, basting once or twice until the chicken is cooked. ; name: chocolate tube cake ; ingredients: yellow cake mix, instant chocolate pudding mix, eggs, oil, water, powdered sugar, milk ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Blend cake mix and pudding in a large bowl. Add eggs, oil and water. Start on low speed, then 10 minutes at medium speed once ingredients are throughly mixed. Turn batter into a 10 inch tube pan. Bake 50 minutes at 350 or until toothpick is clean. Cool in pan on rack do not turn upside down. Using a 2 tined fork, poke holes 1 inch apart in the entire cake. Prepare glaze mixing powdered sugar and milk til smooth. Pour glaze over cake immediately and allow to cool in the pan. ; name: colombian red beans frijoles colombianos ; ingredients: bacon, tomatoes, scallion, cumin, red kidney beans, sugar, water, chicken bouillon cubes, cilantro ; preparation:Saut the bacon until crispy. Remove bacon and reserve for another use, but leave the bacon drippings in the pan. Add the chopped tomatoes, chopped scallions, and cumin to the pan. Saut them in the bacon fat until they are soft, about 5 to 8 minutes. Add the beans to the pan. Add sugar, water, and the chicken bouillon. Bring to a boil, and simmer for 10 minutes more, until most of the water has evaporated and the beans have thickened. Remove from heat and stir in the chopped cilantro. Serve with rice. ; name: fakes salata lentil salad ; ingredients: french lentils, bay leaves, olive oil, oranges, salt, fresh ground black pepper, red onion, orange ; preparation:

name: bran muffins low cal ; ingredients: natural bran, buttermilk, raisins, unsweetened applesauce, splenda granular, molasses, eggs, whole wheat flour, salt, baking soda ; preparation:In medium bowl stir together bran, buttermilk and raisins, let soak for 10 minutes. Spray muffin tins with non stick cooking spray, preheat oven to 350. In mixing bowl add splenda, molasses, applesauce, eggs and mix on low speed till well blended. Add buttermilk mixture and mix on medium speed for 1 minute. Add flour, baking soda and salt and mix on low speed till incorporated. Increase speed to medium and mix for 3 minutes. Divide mixture into 12 muffin tins, bake for 15 - 20 minutes. ; name: chicken and white bean stew ; ingredients: bacon, onion, garlic cloves, red potatoes, chicken broth, rotisserie-cooked chicken, small white beans, baby arugula, salt and pepper ; preparation:In a large soup pot or dutch oven, cook the bacon over medium heat until cooked, but not crisp. Add the onion and garlic. Cook, stirring, until softened. Add the potatoes and chicken broth. Simmer until the potatoes are just tender. Meanwhile, pull the meat off the rotisserie chicken, discarding skin and bones. Add the chicken and white beans to the stew. Cook until heated through. Just before serving, stir in the arugula and season to taste with salt and freshly ground black pepper. ; name: roasted asparagus with browned butter ; ingredients: asparagus spear, olive oil, kosher salt, black pepper, butter, lemon juice, garlic, lemon zest ; preparation:Preheat over 450 degrees. Place asparagus in a roasting pan. Drizzle iwth olive oil. Sprinkle evenly with salt and pepper. Bake for 8 minutes or until tender-crisp. In the meantime, melt butter and minced garlic in a small skillet over medium-high heat. Cook 3 minutes or until lightly browned and foamy, shaking pan occasionally. Do not burn. Remove from heat. Stir in lemon juice. Drizzle butter mixture over roasted asparagus, toss well to coat. Srinkle lemon zest over asparagus. ; name: spritz cookies ii ; ingredients: flour, baking powder, butter, sugar, egg, vanilla, almond extract ; preparation:Stir together flour and baking powder. Beat butter for 30 seconds. Add sugar and beat until fluffy. Add egg, vanilla and almond extract. Beat well. Gradually add dry ingredients to beaten mixture, beating till well combined. Do not chill. Force dough through a cookie press onto an ungreased cookie sheet. If desired, sprinkle with colored sugars or with ground almonds dyed red or green with food coloring. Bake in a 400 oven for 7-8 minutes. Cool on wire rack. ; name: goulash heart healthy version ; ingredients: ground turkey, whole wheat elbow macaroni, onion, light cheese whiz, garlic powder, diced tomatoes, salt and pepper ; preparation:Cook macaroni until al dente, drain and reserve. Brown ground turkey. Add onion and garlic powder, cook until onion is translucent. Add tin of tomatoes, with their juices. Return cooked macaroni to pot, heat through. Add cheez whiz, stir until melted. Season with salt and pepper, to taste. ; name: cheddar shrimp nachos ; ingredients: cooked shrimp, cheddar cheese, green chilies, green onion, sliced ripe olives, mayonnaise, ground cumin, tortilla chips ; preparation:Combine the shrimp, cheese, chilies, onions and olives. Combine the mayo and cumin. Add to shrimp mixture and toss to coat. Place about a tablespoon of the shrimp mixture into each tortilla scoop and place on baking sheets. Bake at 350 for 5-10 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve warm. ; name: cheese ravioli with grape tomatoes ; ingredients: cheese ravioli, olive oil, spinach, grape tomatoes, onion powder, parmesan cheese, salt and pepper ; preparation:Add ravioli to a pot of boiling water. Cook 3-5 minutes or until ravioli floats to the surface. Remove from heat, drain and set aside. Heat oil in a oversized skillet on medium heat, add spinach, tomatoes, onion powder, salt and pepper, and saute for about 7 minutes or until spinach and tomatoes wilt. Add ravioli to skillet and cook for 3 more minutes. Serve hot and sprinkle with parmesan cheese. ; name: peanut butter and chocolate chip bars ; ingredients: flour, baking powder, salt, butter, sugar, eggs, vanilla, walnuts, chocolate chips, peanut butter ; preparation:

name: caramel popcorn snack ; ingredients: butter, white sugar, brown sugar, corn syrup, salt, vanilla, baking soda, popped popcorn, pecans ; preparation:Bring butter, sugars, syrup, and salt to a boil over medium heat. Boil 5 minutes. Remove from heat and add vanilla and soda. Stir well. Pour over popcorn and nuts. Spread on 2 cookie sheets. Bake for 1 hour at 250f stirring every 20 minutes. Cool and store in airtight containers. ; name: quick taco bake ; ingredients: ground beef, onion, taco seasoning mix, tomato sauce, whole kernel corn, cheddar cheese, bisquick baking mix, milk, eggs ; preparation:Heat oven to 350. Cook beef and onion until beef is brown, drain. Spoon into ungreased 13x9x2 inch baking dish. Stir in taco mix, dry, tomato sauce and corn. Sprinkle with cheese. Stir remaining ingredients until blended, pour over beef mixture. Bake 35 minute or until light golden brown. Serve with sour cream, chopped tomato and shredded cheese, if desired. ; name: brenda s hidden valley ranch chicken wings ; ingredients: chicken wings, louisiana hot sauce, vinegar, hidden valley ranch dressing mix ; preparation:Put wings, hot sauce and vinegar in a large bowl. Toss together. Marinate for at least 30 minutes. While marinating heat oven to 400f. Line jelly roll pan with parchment paper or foil. Lay marinated wings, skin side up on shallow pan. Sprinkle with the dressing mix. Bake for 40 minutes or until done. The more crowded the wings are, the juicier they are. The more separated the wings are, the crispier they are. Drain wings on paper towels, then place in serving dish. Either keep warm or place in fridge and heat at a later time. ; name: mama s beef a roni ; ingredients: ground beef, green pepper, onion, celery, garlic powder, italian seasoning, small shell pasta, mozzarella cheese, pasta sauce ; preparation:Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. While pasta is cooking, on medium heat brown ground beef in large skillet. Add onions, peppers, celery, italian seasoning and garlic powder, stirring until vegetables are tender. Drain and return to skillet. Stir in pasta sauce. Add pasta and mix thoroughly. Sprinkle cheese over top. Cover with lid and let cheese melt. Let sit for about 5 minutes then serve and enjoy. ; name: 2blueberry pineapple ring ; ingredients: berry gelatin, water, blueberries in light syrup, crushed pineapple ; preparation:Completely dissolve gelatin in boiling water by gently stirring for 3-4 minutes. Let cool to room temperature. Stir in blueberries and crushed pineapple. Pour into a bundt pan sprayed with non-stick cooking spray. Refrigerate for 4 hours or longer to congeal. To loosen ring from mold, place mold in larger bowl of hot water for a few seconds, then remove by placing the serving platter on top, and flip over. ; name: spirited mincemeat pie ; ingredients: frozen pie crusts, raisins, brandy, mincemeat, apple, walnuts, brown sugar, lemon rind, lemon juice, egg ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Combine raisins with brandy in large bowl and let sit at room temperature for 30 minutes. Combine raisin mixture with remaining ingredients and spoon into pie crust. Top with remaining pie crust and make several small slits on top of crust. Brush top with egg mixture. Bake for 35 to 45 minutes. ; name: fried chicken drumsticks southern style ; ingredients: chicken legs, eggs, vegetable oil, flour, cayenne pepper, paprika, salt ; preparation:Before frying, boil chicken legs in a pot of water for 10 minutes. In a large saucepan, heat vegetable oil on medium heat. On a large plate, combine flour, cayenne pepper, paprika, and salt. Keep beaten eggs in a separate bowl. Take 1 chicken leg and cover it is flour mixture. Place the chicken leg in eggs and cover it in egg. Place the chicken leg back into the flour mixture and cover it again in flour. Once oil is hot and ready for frying, place chicken leg into the oil for frying. Repeat steps 5-8 for each chicken leg allowing up to 3 legs to fry at one time. Once legs are fried to a golden brown, remove from oil and place on a double-folded paper towel on a plate. Allow plenty of time to cool before serving. ; name: super easy cheese enchiladas ; ingredients: extra-sharp cheddar cheese, corn tortillas, vegetable oil, onion, enchilada sauce, chili without beans ; preparation:

name: curried zucchini ; ingredients: butter, zucchini, onion, tomatoes, brown sugar, curry powder, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Melt butter in a large skillet, that is coated with cooking spray. Add zucchini and onion. Saute until tender. Stir in tomato, brown sugar, and curry powder. Cover and cook 1 minute, sprinkle zucchini mixture with parmesan cheese, serve warm. ; name: rick s pork chops in gravy ; ingredients: pork chops, cream of mushroom soup, beef gravy, water, onion, salt, ground black pepper, all-purpose flour ; preparation:Season pork chops with salt and black pepper. Brown pork chops in olive oil. Add onion and cook until translucent. Add soup, gravy, and water. Simmer for 1 hour. Add flour and water mixture. Heat until thickened. Serve with potatoes or rice. ; name: scalloped potatoes chicken supper ; ingredients: scalloped potatoes mix, poultry seasoning, boiling water, condensed cream of chicken soup, cooked chicken, carrot, celery, onion ; preparation:Set the potatoes aside. Place the contents of the sauce mix in a large bowl. Sprinkle with poultry seasoning. Whisk in the water & soup. Stir in the chicken, carrots, celery, onion and potatoes. Transfer to a greased 2 quart baking dish and bake uncovered at 400 degrees for 45-50 minutes or until vegetables are tender. ; name: bacon mushroom chicken ; ingredients: butter, chicken breast halves, seasoning salt, garlic clove, bacon, mushroom, heavy cream ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Pour melted butter into a 9x13-in baking dish. Add chicken, skin side down, sprinkle with seasoning salt and garlic. Turn chicken over, season and lay bacon strips on top. Sprinkle with mushrooms. Bake in the preheated oven for 45-60 minutes, or until chicken is no longer pink and juices run clear. Remove chicken, bacon and mushrooms to a platter and keep warm. Pour juices from baking dish into a small saucepan and whisk together with cream over low heat until thickened. Pour sauce over chicken and serve warm. ; name: peppermint meringues ; ingredients: egg whites, peppermint extract, cream of tartar, sugar, peppermint candy ; preparation:Preheat oven to 300 f. Beat egg whites, peppermint extract and cream of tartar on high speed with an electric mixer until soft peaks form. Gradually add sugar, one tablespoonful at a time, while continuing to beat until stiff peaks form. Drop by spoonfuls onto lightly greased cookie sheet. Sprinkle with crushed peppermint candies. Bake for 20 minutes, or until meringues are firm and their bottoms are very lightly browned. Cool to wire rack. ; name: crazy oven fried fish filets nutty that is ; ingredients: fine breadcrumbs, peanuts, eggs, lite olive oil, fish fillet, salt and pepper ; preparation:Combine peanuts and bread crumbs, salt& pepper. Mix oil with beaten eggs. Pat the fish filets dry. Dip filets in the eggs then the crumbs. Place on a greased baking sheet. Bake uncovered in 450f degrees oven for 6 minutes turn over and bake a further 1-3 minutes. ; name: cabrito goat and red gravy ; ingredients: goat meat, onion, cumin, red chili powder, flour, salt and pepper ; preparation:Brown cabrito in a large pot, use a little oil if it sticks. Add salt and pepper and enough water to cover and cook until about half done. Add chili powder, onion and comino seed to the mixture. When completely done and tender, mix flour in a bit of water to make a paste. Stir into pot with cabrito mixture to make a gravy. ; name: boy scout foil dinner ; ingredients: hamburger, lipton onion soup mix, onions, red potatoes, baby carrots, olive oil, salt and pepper ; preparation:

name: vegan whole wheat peanut butter pancakes ; ingredients: whole wheat flour, baking powder, banana, soymilk, peanut butter, light brown sugar, nonstick cooking spray ; preparation:Combine flour, baking powder, and sugar. In a separate bowl, mash the banana and add the soy milk and peanut butter. Combine flour mixture and peanut butter mixture. Let batter sit for 5 minutes while spraying the griddle and heating it. Pour 3 inch pancakes and cook for 2 minutes on each side. Serve with maple syrup, fruit spread, bananas, etc. ; name: hearty german farmer s breakfast bauernfruhstuck ; ingredients: bacon, potatoes, green pepper, onions, salt and pepper, cheddar cheese, eggs, milk ; preparation:In a skillet over low heat, cook bacon until crisp. Remove to paper towel. Reserve 2 tablespoons drippings. Add potatoes, green pepper, onion, salt and pepper. Cook and stir over medium heat until the potatoes are golden brown. Stir in eggs and milk, and cook and stir until eggs are almost set, about 2 minutes. Reduce heat to low. Add cheese and bacon, stirring gently until heated through and eggs are set. Serve immediately. Leftovers are tasty the following day. Good wrapped in a flour tortilla for a breakfast burrito, breakfast on the go. Serves 4 to 6. ; name: herb marinated ostrich ; ingredients: ostrich steak, balsamic vinegar, olive oil, garlic, fresh rosemary, fresh thyme leave, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:Combine marinade ingredients in plastic bag. Add meat, turning to coat. Close bag securely and marinate in refrigerator one hour, turning occasionally. Preheat oven broiler. Remove meat from marinade. Discard marinade. Place meat on rack in broiler pan so that surface of meat is three to four inches from heat. Broil 12 to 16 minutes per side for medium-rare to medium doneness. Carve into slices and serve. ; name: gold rush sauce french s mustard recipe ; ingredients: butter, prepared mustard, sugar, dry onion, worcestershire sauce, ketchup, salt, garlic powder, cayenne pepper ; preparation:Allow butter to come to room temperature. This time is not included in prep time. Combine all other ingredients. Add gradually to butter mixing throughly. Grill steaks or hamburgers on one side, turn, spread cooked side with butter mixture. When other side is cooked, spread with mixture. Store in refrigerator. ; name: chocolate waffle pudding ; ingredients: frozen waffles, dark chocolate, eggs, caster sugar, milk, buttermilk, vanilla essence, icing sugar, vanilla ice cream ; preparation:Preheat oven to 160c lightly grease a 22cm square ovenproof dish. Arrange the waffles in the prepared dish. Sprinkle with the chocolate. Whisk the eggs, sugar, milk, buttermilk and vanilla essence in a large jug until well combined. Pour half the egg mixture over waffles. Set aside for 5 minutes, then pour over the remaining egg mixture. Place the dish in a large roasting pan and fill with enough boiling water to come halfway up the sides of the dish. Bake for about 50 minutes or until the custard has just set. Set aside for 5 minutes before serving. Dust with icing sugar and serve with ice cream if desired. ; name: baked chicken lemon and pea risotto ; ingredients: olive oil, chicken breast fillets, leeks, lemon zest, arborio rice, chicken stock, frozen peas, lemon juice, parmesan cheese, mint ; preparation:Preheat oven to 200c 400f. Heat a fry pan over high heat add oil and chicken and cook for 3 mins each side or until well browned, set aside. Add leeks and zest to the pan and cook for 5 mins until leeks are golden. Place leek mix, rice and stock in a baking dish, cover tightly with lid or foil and bake for 20 mins. Add chicken and peas to the risotto and cover tightly and bake for further 20 mins. The risotto will be quite liquid at this stage. Stir the parmesan, lemon juice, mint and salt and pepper through the risotto. Stir for 2 mins to thicken then serve. ; name: roquefort cream quiche ; ingredients: pastry crust, cream cheese, roquefort cheese, butter, eggs, cream, parsley, chives, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 265f. In a bowl, blend cream cheese, roquefort and softened butter until smooth. Add well beaten eggs, cream and melted butter. Blend thoroughly. Stir in finely chopped herbs. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Fill the pastry case evenly with cheese mixture. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until filling is puffed and a light golden colour. Serve hot, lukewarm or cold, cut in wedges. ; name: extra sharp cheddar oven omelet ; ingredients: bacon, green onions, eggs, light cream, seasoning salt, extra-sharp cheddar cheese, sweet onion ; preparation:

name: polpette and orzo in broth ; ingredients: white bread, milk, beef stock, orzo pasta, ground sirloin, onion, fresh parmesan cheese, parsley, salt and pepper, carrots ; preparation:Soak the bread in the milk for about 4 or 5 minutes, until soggy. Bring a pot of water to boil and cook pasta until done. Drain and rinse. Heat stock. Squeeze the bread to get out the extra milk. Combine the meat, onion, half the cheese and half the parsley. Add sallt and pepper. Shape into 1-inch meatballs. Season stock and add the carrots. Gently lower meatballs into stock and simmer for about 10, until carrots are tender. Add orzo and cook for 2 more minutes. Adjust seasoning and sprinkle with remaining parmesan cheese. ; name: home style chicken and ham soup ; ingredients: bacon, cooked ham, onions, thyme leaves, cream of chicken soup, chicken noodle soup, milk, hard-cooked eggs, green beans ; preparation:In large saucepan cook bacon until crisp. Remove and crumble. Brown ham and cook onion with thyme in drippings until tender. Add remaining ingredients except bacon. Heat. Stir occasionally. Garnish with bacon. ; name: pumpkin pie milkshake ; ingredients: milk, butterscotch pudding mix, vanilla ice cream, pumpkin pie spice ; preparation:Place all ingredients in large pitcher with tight-fitting lid. Cover. Shake vigorously 1 minute or until well blended. Pour evenly into 4 glasses. Serve immediately. ; name: orange scented couscous ; ingredients: water, orange juice, olive oil, orange zest, couscous ; preparation:Mix the the water, 2 tablespoons of the juice and the next two ingredients in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Stir in couscous. Cover and remove from heat. Let stand until water is absorbed. Fluff with a fork, adding more juice by tablespoons to taste. ; name: laurie s potato curry ; ingredients: onions, curry paste, potatoes, fish sauce, coconut milk, chicken, brown sugar ; preparation:Saute onions in oil until soft. Add curry paste. Peel and cut potatoes. Put onions and potatoes in crock pot with fish sauce, coconut milk and meat. Add brown sugar, stir and cook on low for 5 hours. Serve over rice with a dollop of sour cream. ; name: emeril s crunchy pralines ; ingredients: light brown sugar, butter, water, pecan pieces ; preparation:Combine the sugar, butter, and water in a heavy saucepan over medium heat. Stir to dissolve the sugar. Continue to stir for 3 to 4 minutes. The mixture will begin to boil. Add the pecans and continue to stir for about 5 minutes. Remove from the heat. Drop by the spoonful onto wax paper. Let cool. Remove from the paper with a thin knife. ; name: zucchini chayote and yellow squash ; ingredients: butter, white onions, garlic, chayotes, zucchini, crookneck yellow squash, chives, fresh cilantro ; preparation:Melt butter in large pot over medium heat. Add onion and garlic. Saut 2 minutes. Add all squash. Reduce heat to medium-low. Cover. Cook until just tender, stirring occasionally, about 25 minutes. Mix in herbs. Season with salt and pepper. ; name: white chocolate chip brownies ; ingredients: margarine, sugar, eggs, flour, cocoa powder, white chocolate chips ; preparation:

name: cherry sorbet ; ingredients: cherries, water, sugar, fresh lemon juice, almond extract ; preparation:Stem cherries and remove the pits. In a medium saucepan, warm the cherries over medium heat with the water, sugar, and lemon juice until they start becoming juicy. Cook for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the cherries are very soft and cooked through. Remove from heat and let stand until they reach room temperature. Puree the cherries and their liquid with the almond extract or kirsch in a blender until smooth. Chill the mixture thoroughly, then freeze it in an ice cream maker according to manufacturers directions. ; name: sweet and sour cabbage and carrots ; ingredients: butter, green cabbage, carrots, onion, brown sugar, reduced sodium soy sauce, cider vinegar, pepper ; preparation:In a large skillet over medium-high heat, melt butter. Add to the skillet the cabbage, carrots, onion and brown sugar. Cook, stirring often, for about 10-12 minutes until the veggies are well-browned and softened. Remove from heat and stir in the soy sauce, vinegar and pepper. Serve hot. ; name: tomatoes and peppers for lunch ; ingredients: whole wheat bread, balsamic vinaigrette, tomatoes, red pepper, fat free mozzarella cheese ; preparation:Toast your bread. Douse with a balsamic vinaigrette add thinly sliced tomatoes. Add a layer of roasted peppers, any color. Add mozzarella. Sprinkle with herbs and salt and pepper. If you want melted cheese, place in broiler for a few minutes, do not nuke it, this will make it soggy. ; name: apple cinnamon cheese ball ; ingredients: cream cheese, cheddar cheese, cinnamon, dried apple, nuts, cinnamon stick, bay leaf ; preparation:In medium to large bowl, combine cream cheese, cheddar cheese, and cinnamon. Beat until well blended. Stir in apples until evenly distributed. Shape mixture into a ball by rolling it around inside the bowl. Once ball is formed, pour crushed nuts into a second bowl, and roll cheese ball in the crushed nuts until the outside is covered. Presenting the cheese ball on a plate, place cinnamon stick and bay leaf in the top of the ball to make it look like an apple. ; name: rosemary apricot chicken ; ingredients: salt, dried rosemary, black pepper, garlic cloves, chicken quarters, apricot jam, lemon juice, dijon mustard ; preparation:Heat oven to 350. Mix salt, rosemary, pepper and garlic. Rub mixture into chicken. Place chicken, meaty side up, in pan and bake for 25 minutes. Meanwhile, mix apricot jam, lemon juice, and mustard. Brush apricot mixture over chicken. Bake for 20 minutes longer or until juices run clear. Serve. ; name: yellow summer squash bread ; ingredients: flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, ground cinnamon, eggs, sugar, vegetable oil, vanilla, yellow squash ; preparation:Combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt and cinnamon in a medium bowl. Combine the eggs, sugar, oil and vanilla in a separate large bowl. Beat well. Stir in the shredded yellow summer squash. Add the dry ingredients to the squash mixture. Stir until moistened. Pour or spoon into a greased and floured loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees f for 50 minutes or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool for about 10 to 15 minutes and remove from pan. ; name: cucumbers with mint vinaigrette ; ingredients: cucumbers, olive oil, champagne vinegar, salt & freshly ground black pepper, of fresh mint ; preparation:Peel the cucumbers and slice them in half lengthwise. Scoop out the seeds with a spoon and discard. Cut the cucumbers into thin slices and combine in a bowl with the oil, vinegar, salt, and pepper. Marinate for at least 30 minutes in the refrigerator or at room temperature. Add the mint immediately before serving. ; name: chef boy i be illinois ligurian pasta ; ingredients: pasta, french style green beans, potatoes, pesto sauce ; preparation:

name: grilled pork rub ; ingredients: brown sugar, garlic powder, chili powder, ground black pepper, oregano leaves, salt, pork tenderloin ; preparation:Mix seasonings in small bowl. Coat pork evenly with the rub. Refrigerate 30 minutes or up to 3 hours for extra flavor. Grill over medium heat 25 to 30 minutes or until desired doneness, turning occasionally. Let pork stand 5 minutes before cutting into thin slices. Test kitchen. ; name: homemade eggnog ; ingredients: evaporated milk, water, powdered milk, sugar, egg yolks, egg whites, whiskey ; preparation:In large pot, heat up all ingredients except whiskey and eggs. Separate eggs. Return yellows to milk mixture. Beat egg whites with a little sugar to form peak. Return to milk mixture. Add whiskey to taste. ; name: taco meatballs ; ingredients: ground beef, taco seasoning mix, green onion, eggs, garlic clove, sharp cheddar cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425f. Mix all ingredients except the cheese together in a bowl. Mold a tbs of meat around a cube of cheese to form a small shaped meatball. Repeat with all of the meat. Spray an edged cookie sheet with nonstick cooking spray and place meatballs on the cookie sheet. Bake for 7-10 min or until meat is done and cheese is melted. ; name: sesame tofu with spinach ; ingredients: firm tofu, sesame seeds, dark sesame oil, soy sauce, hot pepper sauce, olive oil, garlic cloves, baby spinach, salt, pepper ; preparation:Slice the tofu lengthwise into 4 rectangular slabs, than half each piece to get squares. Spread the sesame seeds on a plate. Press all surfaces of each tofu square into the seeds to coat. Heat the sesame oil in a large skillet on medium heat. Arrange the tofu in a single layer and cook about 5 minutes carefully turn and cook 5 minutes on other side. Add soy sauce and tabasco, turn the squares over, and cook another minute. Transfer squares to a plate. Add the oil and garlic to the pan and saut for about 30 seconds, until golden. Add the still damp rinsed spinach and cook for 1-2 more minutes, stirring constantly. Cook until wilted but still bright green. Season to taste with salt & pepper. Serve the tofu on top of the spinach. ; name: raspberry currant jam ; ingredients: red currants, water, red raspberries, sugar ; preparation:Wash the currants and put them in a sauce pan with the water. Cover the pot and bring to a boil, stirring gently, until the currants are all popped. Press them through a sieve, and reserve the puree. Discard the skins, stems and seeds. Gently rinse the raspberries and drain them well. Mix the currant puree, raspberries and sugar in a large pot. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly, until the sugar dissolves. Boil hard until the mixture almost reaches the gell stage, about 20 minutes. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking. Remove from the heat and skim. Seal in sterilized jars. Put in a boiling water bath for 5 minutes. ; name: mom s old fashioned cream pie ; ingredients: sugar, flour, whipping cream, half-and-half, egg whites, unbaked 9-inch pie crust ; preparation:In a two-quart bowl, mix the first 4 ingredients together. Fold the beaten egg whites in until all are well mixed. Pour into unbaked pie shell of 9inch pan. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and bake at 325 degrees for 1 hour. When taken from oven, filling will seem a little shaky, but when cooled, will be creamy. Prep time does not include making pie crust. ; name: ham squares ; ingredients: cream cheese, deviled ham, pepper, onions, pillsbury refrigerated crescent dinner rolls ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In medium bowl, blend cream cheese, ham, pepper and onion together. Separate the two cans of dough into 8 rectangles. Firmly press together perforations to seal. Roll out to make more square. Spoon mixture into the center of each square. Fold up the corners and twist at the top, seal any open edges. Bake 20-25 minutes until golden brown. Allow 2 per serving. ; name: southern macaroni pie ; ingredients: elbow macaroni, egg, flour, salt, milk, shredded cheddar cheese ; preparation:

name: super easy sausage peppers ; ingredients: sweet italian sausage links, olive oil, sweet onion, green bell peppers, tomato sauce ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400. Bake cut up sausages for about 20 minute while sausage is cooking put onion and oil in large skillet saute onion till translucent. When sausage is done add to skillet with the onions and add the tomato sauce. Cook for 20 minutes then add the peppers and cook 20 minutes more. Serve over rice. ; name: pumpkin fudge ; ingredients: milk, sugar, light corn syrup, pumpkin, salt, cinnamon, allspice, margarine, vanilla ; preparation:Combine the first 5 ingredients in a heavy pot and bring to a boil over medium high heat. When it comes to a full rolling boil that cannot be stirred down, reduce heat and simmer until it comes to the softball stage or 236f on a candy thermometer. Remove from heat and stir in cinnamon, allspice, margarine, and vanilla. Cool, then beat until thick and mixture looses its gloss. Pour into buttered square dish and let cool before cutting. ; name: crock pot pork roast and stuffing ; ingredients: herb-seasoned stuffing cubes, chicken broth, dried apricot, onion, boneless pork loin roast, apricot jam, balsamic vinegar ; preparation:Grease the inside of a crock pot. Mix together the stuffing, broth, apricots and onions in the crock pot. Place pork roast on stuffing mixture. Mix jam and balsamic vinegar and brush over the pork. Cover and cook on low for 7-8 hours, or until meat is tender. Slice the meat and serve with the stuffing. ; name: sesame butterfly pork chops ; ingredients: boneless center cut pork chop, sesame oil, sesame seeds, ginger, soy sauce, dry white wine, mushroom, green onions, butter ; preparation:Heat sesame oil in large nonstick pan over medium. Add chops and sprinkle with sesame seed and ginger. Cook until browned on both sides. Add soy sauce and white wine to skillet, then add mushrooms and onions. Stir gently 1 to 2 minutes to saute vegetables. Remove chops to serving platter. Add butter to pan, stirring constantly to deglaze pan. Pour mushroom-onion sauce over chops. ; name: southwestern grilled catfish ; ingredients: paprika, chili powder, ground cumin, ground coriander, cayenne pepper, garlic powder, salt, catfish fillets ; preparation:Combine the first 7 ingredients. Stir well. Rub spice mixture over catfish fillets. Coat gill rack with nonstick cooking spray. Grill fillets over medium heat for 5 minutes per side or until fish flakes easily. Serve with fresh salsa. ; name: cheesy tuna pasta ; ingredients: pasta, cream cheese, cheddar cheese, milk, granulated garlic, tuna ; preparation:Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, melt cream cheese in milk in med saucepan over low heat. Add cheedar and garlic. Add tuna and mix well. Once pasta is cooked, drain and pour tuna mix on top. Mix well and serve. ; name: pineapple cookies ; ingredients: shortening, brown sugar, white sugar, crushed pineapple, vanilla, eggs, salt, baking soda, all-purpose flour, baking powder ; preparation:Cream shortening and the sugars. Add egg and pineapple. Stir in vanilla. Sift flour, then measure it. To the flour, add salt, soda, and baking powder. Add dry mixture to the wet mixture. Drop by rounded tsps. Onto a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake 10-12 minutes at 350f, or until done. ; name: ground beef soup ; ingredients: ground beef, onion, carrots, potatoes, corn, tomato paste, water, beef bouillon, garlic ; preparation:

name: caramelized chicken drumsticks ; ingredients: skinless chicken drumsticks, soy sauce, sugar, water, fresh ginger, garlic, sesame oil, pepper, sesame seeds ; preparation:In a small bowl, combine soy sauce, sugar, water, ginger, garlic, sesame oil, and pepper. Place drumsticks on non-stick skillet and pour the soy sauce mixture on top. Cover with lid and bring to boil. Reduce the heat to low and cook for 15 min until they are cooked through. Remove the cover, turn up the heat to mid-high. The sauce will get thicken and start to caramelize in a few minutes. Continue to cook drumsticks turning them around so the sauce can cover them evenly, about 5 more minutes. When you see the sauce becomes like dark brown glaze and stick on to the meat, it is done. Remove from the heat, sprinkle sesame seeds all over them. Serve with hot rice and my steamed broccoli. ; name: cran fizzy iced tea ; ingredients: green tea bags, frozen cranberry juice concentrate, water, club soda ; preparation:Steep 4 tea bags in 2 cups boiling water according to package directions. Discard tea bags. Stir in can of frozen cranberry juice concentrate. Cover and chill. To serve, fill a glass of ice one-quarter full with tea mixture. Top off with chilled club soda. You may also add fresh berries as a garnish. ; name: taco meatballs ; ingredients: ground beef, taco seasoning mix, green onion, eggs, garlic clove, sharp cheddar cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425f. Mix all ingredients except the cheese together in a bowl. Mold a tbs of meat around a cube of cheese to form a small shaped meatball. Repeat with all of the meat. Spray an edged cookie sheet with nonstick cooking spray and place meatballs on the cookie sheet. Bake for 7-10 min or until meat is done and cheese is melted. ; name: baked haddock in cream sauce iceland ; ingredients: butter, flour, salt, pepper, nutmeg, milk, cheddar cheese, haddock fillets, sherry wine, paprika ; preparation:Melt butter in pan over medium heat and stir in flour, salt, pepper, and nutmeg whisking until smooth. Add milk slowly, whisking to get out any lumps and make smooth. Add the cheese, stirring until melted. Place haddock in greased baking dish. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Pour sauce over haddock. Drizzle over sherry and sprinkle with paprika. Bake at 325f. For 45 minutes. Serve and enjoy. ; name: cold dill pea salad ; ingredients: frozen tiny peas, sour cream, dried dill weed, dried chives, curry powder, lemon, juice of, salt and pepper, crisp salad green ; preparation:Cook the peas according to directions on package. Drain thoroughly. In a bowl, mix together sour cream, dill, chives, curry powder, lemon juice and salt and pepper to taste. Carefully combine with peas. Chill and serve on a bed of crisp salad greens. Garnish with more dill or chives, if desired.
