Sometimes i add some julienned carrots or broccoli to this. ; name: cajun oven fried potato chips ; ingredients: russet potatoes, butter, coarse salt, cajun seasoning ; preparation:

name: biscotti regina sesame seed cookies ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, unsalted butter, eggs, vanilla extract, orange zest, sesame seeds ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. Butter two baking sheets, or place silicon baking sheets on them. In a large bowl, stir together the flour, sugar, baking powder and salt. With an electric mixer on low speed, add the butter until blended. Whisk together the eggs, zest and vanilla, and add this to the flour mixture, and continue beating on low until you have a smooth dough. Pinch off a small piece of dough about the size of a small golf ball and roll it into a log about 2 inches long. Roll the log into the sesame seeds, pressing them so seeds stay on. Place the cookie on the prepared baking sheets keeping the cookies two inches apart. Bake for 25 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool, and store in airtight containers. ; name: penne pasta with tomatoes and cheese ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, garlic, plum tomatoes, dried basil, ground red pepper, chicken broth, penne pasta, havarti cheese, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Heat 3 tbsp oil in pan. Saute onion and garlic. Mix in tomatoes, basil and ground red pepper. Bring to a boil, breaking up tomatoes. Add broth and boil. Reduce heat and simmer about 1 hour. Cook pasta and drain. Toss with 3 tbsp oil. Mix pasta with sauce and then mix in havarti cheese. Put into 9x13 baking dish and sprinkle top with parmesan cheese. Bake in 375 oven about 30 minutes. Of this recipe will easily serve 4. ; name: heartbeet salad ; ingredients: beets, olive oil, lemon juice, salt, black pepper, arugula, frisee, fresh chives ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 375. Wrap the beets in a large piece of aluminum foil and bake for an hour, or until tender. Let cool slightly and then peel and slice inch thick. Using a 1-inch heart cookie cutter, cut out as many hearts as possible from each slice. In a large glass bowl, whisk the oil with the lemon juice, salt and pepper. Add the arugula, frisee and the beet cut outs and toss. Mound on salad plates and sprinkle with the chives and serve. ; name: french toast strata ; ingredients: french bread, cream cheese, eggs, half-and-half cream, butter, maple syrup ; preparation:Grease a 9x13x2 rectangular baking dish. Place half the bread cubes in the dish. Sprinkle with cream cheese cubes and then remaining bread cubes. Combine eggs, cream, melted butter and syrup. Mix well and pour over bread and cheese cubes. Using a spatula, press layers down to moisten. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 2 hours, or overnight. Remove plastic wrap and bake uncovered for 35- 40 minutes at 350f, or until set and golden brown. Let stand about 10 minutes before cutting. Top with your favorite syrup, or apple cider syrup, or a big dollop of whipped cream. ; name: chili roasted peanuts ; ingredients: vegetable oil, garlic, dried red pepper flakes, salted peanuts, chili powder ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350-degrees f. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and pepper flakes and cook one minute. Add peanuts and stir to combine. Transfer peanuts to baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with chili powder and toss. Cool and then transfer to airtight containers. Store at least 8 hours before serving. ; name: southwestern mushroom casserole ; ingredients: mushrooms, beef broth, flour, heavy cream, cayenne pepper, salt, fresh breadcrumb, parmesan cheese, butter ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place the mushrooms in a 2-quart pie pan. In a medium bowl, combine the beef broth and flour. Microwave at low power until slightly thickened, 2-3 minutes. Stir in the heavy cream and cayenne. Season with salt. Immediately pour the sauce over the mushrooms. In a medium bowl, mix together the breadcrumbs and parmesan. Sprinkle on top of the mushrooms. Top with the butter and bake until browned, about 45 minutes. ; name: southern style honey barbecued chicken ; ingredients: roasting chickens, salt and pepper, onion, tomato sauce, honey, vinegar, worcestershire sauce, paprika, hot pepper sauce ; preparation:Place chicken, skin side down, in a large baking dish. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Combine remaining ingredients. Mix well. Pour mixture over chicken. Bake, uncovered, at 375 degrees for 30 minutes turn pieces and bake 20 minutes longer or until chicken is glazed and no longer pink. ; name: asparagus bundles ; ingredients: fresh asparagus, bacon, worcestershire sauce, brown sugar, butter, fresh garlic ; preparation:

name: spinach and cheese mashed potatoes ; ingredients: potatoes, sour cream, salt and pepper, green onions, butter, spinach, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Set oven to 400 degrees. Butter a 2-quart casserole dish. In a large bowl, combine all ingredients, except the grated cheddar cheese. Spoon into prepared baking dish. Bake, uncovered for 15 minutes. Remove from oven, top with grated cheddar, bake for 5 minutes longer. If desired, roasted garlic may be added to mixture. ; name: berry breakfast rolls ; ingredients: cinnamon roll dough, fresh blueberries, blueberry preserves, lemon peel, pecans, milk ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Grease 16 muffin cups. Cut each cinnamon roll in half crosswise to create 2 short round rolls. Press each half roll into one muffin cup, forming it into a cup shape. Mix together ther blueberries, preserves and lemon peel, and spoon some of the mixture into each muffin cup. Sprinkle each cup with pecans. Bake 12 minutes at 375 degrees until golden brown. Cool for 10 minutes in the muffin tin, then remove and place on wire rack. Drizzle icing over rolls. ; name: wendy s no bake peanut butter bars weight watchers ; ingredients: reduced-fat creamy peanut butter, brown sugar, honey, light butter, vanilla extract, crispy rice cereal, bran buds ; preparation:Spray a 9 x 13 inch baking pan with non-stick spray. Combine the peanut butter, brown sugar, honey and butter in a large saucepan. Cook over medium-low heat, stirring occasionally until smooth, about 3-4 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in the vanilla. Add the cereals and stir well to coat. Spoon the cereal mixture into the baking pan. Cover with wax paper or plastic wrap and gently press to form an even layer. Let cool completely. Refrigerate, covered, until firm. Uncover and cut into 24 bars. ; name: 24 hour crock pot barbecue ; ingredients: onions, boston butt, water, cloves, onion, hickory flavored barbecue sauce, tabasco sauce ; preparation:The night before serving, put 1 sliced onion in crock pot. Add meat, water and cloves. Top with 1 sliced onion. Cover and cook on low 10-12 hours, or until the meat falls off the bone. Drain contents of crock pot in a colander. Remove bone and fat from meat. Discard onions and cloves. Return meat to crock pot. Add chopped onion, barbecue sauce and tabasco pepper sauce. Cover and cook remainder of day on low, or 1-3 hours on high. Serve on warm buns. ; name: super low fat turkish apple cake ; ingredients: cooking apples, lemon, juice of, mixed nuts, sultanas, brown sugar, plain flour, salt, baking powder, vanilla essence ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 180 degrees celcius. Put the chopped apples into a large bowl and sprinkle with the lemon juice. Combine the nuts, sultanas, sugar, flour, salt and baking powder and mix well. Stir this mixture into the apples. Add in the vanilla essence and mix again. Pour the mixture into a lightly oiled cake tin and bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes, or until lightly browned on top. Serve hot or cold. For a moister cake. Add to the ingredients a little fruit juice or water. ; name: zesty italian crescent casserole ; ingredients: ground beef, onion, spaghetti sauce, mozzarella cheese, sour cream, crescent rolls, parmesan cheese, butter ; preparation:Heat oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit. In large skillet, brown beef and onion then drain. Return meat to pan. Add spaghetti sauce. Meanwhile, in a medium bowl combine mozzarella cheese and sour cream. Pour hot meat into an ungreased 12 x 8 inch dish. Spoon cheese mixture over meat. Unroll crescent roll dough over the top of the mixture. Mix parmesan cheese and butter together, then spread over the top of the dough. Bake 18-25 minutes or until golden brown. ; name: chocolate madeleines ; ingredients: eggs, caster sugar, plain flour, baking powder, cocoa powder, butter ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 180 degrees celsius. Place the eggs and sugar in a bowl and whisk to combine. Sift the flour, baking powder and cocoa powder over the egg mixture and fold through with the melted butter. Spoon the mixture into greased large madeleine tins until two-thirds full. Bake for 10 minutes or until the madeleines are set. ; name: fudge frosting ; ingredients: sugar, light corn syrup, milk, unsweetened chocolate, butter, vanilla ; preparation:

name: hot and creamy cocoa with gooey toasted marshmallows ; ingredients: heavy cream, sugar, semisweet chocolate, marshmallows ; preparation:Place the cream in a heavy-bottomed saucepan and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce the heat slightly so the cream remains at a low boil, and boil for 3 to 4 minutes, until it begins to thicken. Stir in the sugar and chocolate and continue to simmer, stirring constantly, until the sugar dissolves and the chocolate melts. Remove the saucepan from the heat and set aside to keep warm. Place the marshmallows on a small cookie sheet. Place under your broiler in the oven for 2 to 3 minutes, until toasted or charred. The charred flavor, as we all know from campfires, is ideal. If necessary, reheat the hot chocolate over low heat, stirring constantly. Pour the hot chocolate into four demitasse cups. Top each with a toasted gooey marshmallow and serve immediately with spoons. ; name: apple butterscotch macadamia pie ; ingredients: eggs, light corn syrup, tart apples, butter, vanilla extract, salt, ground cinnamon, macadamia nuts, nestl toll house butterscotch flavored morsels, unbaked 9-inch pie shell ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f. Combine eggs, corn syrup, apple, butter, vanilla extract, salt and cinnamon in large bowl. Mix well. Stir in nuts and morsels. Pour into pie shell. Bake for 45 to 50 minutes or until edge is set but center still moves slightly. Cool on wire rack for 2 hours. Serve immediately or cover and refrigerate. ; name: western wagon wheels ; ingredients: lean ground beef, wagon wheel macaroni, stewed tomatoes, water, frozen corn, barbecue sauce, salt and pepper ; preparation:In large skillet cook beef for about 5 minutes till well browned. Stir in pasta, tomatoes, water, corn and bbq sauce. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer 15- 20 minutess or untill pasta is tender, stirring occasionally. Season with salt and pepper. ; name: popeye s fried chicken copycat ; ingredients: chicken, white pepper, cayenne pepper, salt, tabasco sauce, vegetable oil, all-purpose flour, paprika, eggs, milk ; preparation:Mix all ingredients except the oil, flour, paprika, and eggs & milk, marinate overnight in an airtight container. In a large bowl, combine flour, salt, peppers, and paprika. Break the eggs into a separate bowl and beat until blended slowly adding the milk. Dip each piece of chicken into the egg and milk mixture, then coat generously with the flour. Once the chicken is coated, place on a rack to allow the pieces to dry, 20 to 30 minutes. Allowing the pieces to dry will provide for more even browning of the chicken. To fry, heat oil in dutch oven or deep fryer to medium. Place the chicken pieces in the oil, skin side down, one piece at a time. Leave enough space between pieces so that they are not crowded. This allows the pieces to cook and brown more evenly. Continue to cook over a medium heat, turning until all sides are golden brown and the meat is cooked thoroughly. When the pieces finish cooking, they should be removed and placed on a paper towel to allow grease to drain. ; name: peanut butter and banana oat cookies ; ingredients: bananas, peanut butter, rolled oats, oat flour, raisins, butter, salt, vanilla extract ; preparation:Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Let sit for 30 minutes. Preheat oven to 350. Drop by spoonfuls onto parchment lined or lightly greased baking sheet. Bake for 15-20 minutes until lightly golden. ; name: raspberry topped lemon pie ; ingredients: 9-inch graham cracker crust, frozen raspberries in light syrup, cornstarch, egg yolks, eagle brand condensed milk, realemon juice, yellow food coloring, whipped topping ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 deg. In saucepan, combine raspberries and cornstarch. Cook and stir until thickened. In bowl, beat egg yolk. Stir in sweetened condensed milk, realemon juice and food coloring if desired. Pour over crust. Bake 8 minutes. Spoon raspberry mixture over top. Chill 4 hours. Spread with whipped topping. Garnish as desired. Refrigerate leftovers. ; name: instant rice pudding ; ingredients: white rice, milk, sugar, salt, vanilla extract, cinnamon, nutmeg ; preparation:Combine cooked rice, milk, sugar and salt in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil, then lower the heat to a simmer and stir in the vanilla. Cook until just about all of the milk is absorbed, stirring occasionally. Stir in cinnamon and nutmeg. Serve warm or chilled. ; name: swiss chard or spinach with pine nuts and raisins ww ; ingredients: raisins, hot water, olive oil, garlic clove, spinach, pine nuts, salt, black pepper ; preparation:

name: hungry jack casserole ; ingredients: ground beef, salt, pork & beans, barbecue sauce, brown sugar, instant minced onion, flakey biscuits, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Brown ground beef and strain. Add next 5 ingredients and heat til bubbly. Pour into 2 quart casserole dish. Peel biscuits in half and lay across top. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 25-30 minutes. ; name: parmesan and garlic fries ; ingredients: russet potatoes, olive oil, garlic cloves, thyme, seasoning salt, parmesan cheese, fresh parsley ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425. In a large mixing bowl, place the cut potatoes and pour the olive oil over the top. Sprinkle on the garlic, thyme and seasoned salt. Mix well until the potatoes are evenly coated. Spread the potatoes on a baking sheet in a single layer. Do not throw away the oil that is left in the bowl. Bake 30 minutes, turning the fries over halfway through. After 30 minutes of baking, return the fries to the bowl with excess oil and sprinkle with the parmesan cheese and parsley. Toss to coat and return to baking sheet and bake for another 10 minutes. If desired, sprinkle fries again with a few shakes of parmesan and a few shakes of seasoned salt. ; name: u wing it pork loin chops ; ingredients: pork loin chops, olive oil, onion, garlic cloves, sour cream, horseradish, grainy mustard, ranch dressing, dry red wine ; preparation:Brown chops in oil in a frying pan. Remove to casserole dish. Saute onion and garlic over high heat for 2 minutes. Add sour cream, horseradish, mustard, dressing and wine. Heat for 3 minutes. Pour over chops. Bake in preheated 350f oven for 1 hour or until done. ; name: cilantro jasmine rice ; ingredients: jasmine rice, olive oil, onion, garlic clove, knorr cilantro minicube, swanson chicken broth, table salt, black pepper, ground cumin ; preparation:In a high sided skillet, saute the rice in oil over medium high heat until the rice is solid white, then add onion and saute until onion is translucent, add garlic and saute just a little. Rice should be lightly tanned. Pour the broth slowly into the skillet. Add cilantro seasoning minicube, salt, cumin, and pepper, stir and bring to a boil then lower it to a simmer on low heat. Make sure minicube has dissolved. Cover & cook on low until the water is absorbed and the rice is tender. Do not uncover and do not stir while rice is cooking. About 20-25 minutes. ; name: bea s garlic potatoes ; ingredients: garlic cloves, pepper, salt, dried thyme, savory, olive oil, fingerling potatoes ; preparation:Preheat oven to 475 degrees. Finely chop garlic, and sprinkle with salt. Mash into a paste with back of spoon. Place in bowl with thyme, savory and oil. Toss potatoes with garlic mixture. Place on foil lined baking sheet and bake until browned, about 20 to 25 minutes. ; name: swiss cheese appetizer ; ingredients: cream cheese, swiss cheese, green onions, mayonnaise, bacon ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix first 4 ingredients. Pour into pie plate or similar small baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes. Sprinkle the bacon on top. Bake for additional 5 minutes. Serve with crackers or crusty bread. ; name: grilled ham n jack cheese sandwiches ; ingredients: butter, texas toast thick bread, sharp cheddar cheese, deli ham, red onions, ranch dressing, monterey jack pepper cheese ; preparation:Butter one side of each slice of texas toast. On the unbuttered sides of four slices, layer cheddar cheese, half of the ham, onion if desired and remaining ham. Spread with ranch dressing. Top with pepper jack cheese and remaining toast, buttered side up. On a hot griddle, cook sandwiches for 3 - 4 minutes or until bottoms of sandwiches are browned. Carefully turn. Cook 2 minutes longer or until cheese is melted. ; name: arby s jamocha shake copycat recipe fat free version ; ingredients: coffee, milk, granulated sugar, fat free vanilla ice cream, fat free chocolate syrup ; preparation:

name: grilled lime chicken thighs ; ingredients: chicken thighs, fresh lime juice, extra virgin olive oil, dry tarragon, onion, hot sauce, salt and pepper ; preparation:Place olive oil, lime juice, onion, tarragon, salt, and hot sauce into a large, resealable plastic bag. Shake to mix. Add chicken thighs, coat with marinade, squeeze out air, and refrigerate for at least 4 hours. Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat and lightly oil grate. Remove chicken from marinade, and shake off excess. Discard remaining marinade. Season with salt and pepper. Grill chicken for about 30 minutes, or until no longer pink in the center. ; name: gourmet grouper ; ingredients: grouper fillets, lemon, juice of, season salt, white pepper, mayonnaise, crabmeat, parmesan cheese, slivered almonds ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Wash fish and lay on bottom of foil-lined broiler pan. Sprinkle lemon, season salt and white pepper over fish. Season to your taste. Bake 20-25 minutes until fish flakes easily. Drain off juices. Combine mayonnaise, crab, and cheese. Spread over fish. Place under broiler until just starting to brown. Sprinkle with almonds. ; name: brie and cranberry pizza ; ingredients: refrigerated crescent dinner rolls, brie cheese, whole berry cranberry sauce, pecans ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish. Unroll the crescent rolls and press into baking dish pinching seams together. Bake 5 minutes, or until lightly brown. Remove from the oven and sprinkle with pieces of brie cheese. Spoon the cranberry sauce over the cheese. Top with pecans. Bake an additional 8 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and the crust is golden brown. Cool 5 minutes and cut into squares. ; name: grandma s mac n cheese ; ingredients: macaroni noodles, sharp cheddar cheese, milk, butter, salt, pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. In a 1. 5 quart baking dish put half of the macaroni in bottom of dish, followed by half the milk and half the butter. Season with salt and pepper. Cover with half the cheese. Repeat above direction for a second layer. Bake uncovered for 30 min or until cheese is thoroughly melted. ; name: fresh fig compote ; ingredients: sugar, water, orange juice, orange zest, fresh figs, curacao ; preparation:In a saucepan over medium heat, add the sugar, water, orange juice, and orance zest. Stir to combine. Simmer for 5 minutes. Add in the figs and cook for about 2 minutes or until soft, turn once. Add curacao and stir to mix. Cool and serve in sherbert dishes. ; name: homemade apple butter bars ; ingredients: brown sugar, all-purpose flour, butter, quick-cooking oats, baking soda, almond extract, salt, apple butter ; preparation:Mix the first 7 ingredients together until crumbly. Spread half the mixture into a lightly greased 13x9 inch pan. Spread apple butter on top. Cover with remaining crumb mixture. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 20-25 minutes. Cool and cut into squares. ; name: shakshuka ; ingredients: tomatoes, margarine, onion, flour, eggs, salt, pepper ; preparation:To peel the tomatoes, drop them into a saucepan of boiling water for 1 minute. Then plunge into cold water. The skins will slip off easily. Puree the tomatoes in a blender or food processor. In a large skillet, melt the margarine and saut the onion until golden. Add the flour and stir until combined. Stir in the tomatoes and simmer uncovered for 1 hour until thick. In a medium bowl, beat the eggs with the salt and pepper and add to the tomatoes just before serving. Heat and stir, but do not boil. ; name: asparagus ham potato topper ; ingredients: potatoes, cooked ham, cream of asparagus soup, cheddar cheese ; preparation:

name: dump macaroni and cheese ; ingredients: elbow macaroni, extra-sharp cheddar cheese, butter, eggs, evaporated milk, salt and pepper, dry mustard, paprika ; preparation:Cook pasta according to package directions. Mix cooked pasta and all ingredients in a sprayed casserole dish. Sprinkle paprika on top for color if desired. Bake in 350 degree fahrenheit oven for 30 to 45 minutes until done. Serve hot. ; name: creamy cheddar potatoes ; ingredients: butter, potatoes, salt, fresh ground black pepper, milk, cheddar cheese, parsley ; preparation:In large, nonstick skillet, melt butter. Add potatoes and cook over medium heat until almost tender and lightly browned. Add salt, pepper, and milk, continuing to cook until milk is absorbed and potatoes are tender. Sprinkle with cheese, heating until melted. Stir well, sprinkle with chopped parsley and serve. ; name: rockin cheddar ranch turkey burgers ; ingredients: lean ground turkey, ranch dressing mix, cheddar cheese, green onion ; preparation:Mix all ingredients together in bowl. Form into 4 patties. Cook in skillet or on grill until cooked through, appox. 6-7 minute per side. Serve on buns with lettuce and tomato. ; name: quick lemon curd ; ingredients: white sugar, eggs, fresh lemon juice, lemons, zest of, unsalted butter ; preparation:In a microwave bowl, whisk together the sugar and eggs until smooth. Stir in lemon juice, lemon zest, and butter. Cook in the microwave for one minute intervals, stirring after each minute until the mixture is thick enough to coat the back of a metal spoon. It will be quite liquid but will set up somewhat overnight. Remove from the microwave, and pour into sterile jars. Store for up to 3 weeks in the refrigerator. ; name: hot herbed tomatoes ; ingredients: cherry tomatoes, soft breadcrumbs, onion, fresh parsley, garlic, fresh basil, fresh thyme, salt, pepper, olive oil ; preparation:Place cherry tomato halves in a lightly greased 11x7 baking dish. Combine breadcrumbs and next 7 ingredients in a medium bowl, stirring well. Sprinkle breadcrumbs mixture evely over cherry tomatoes. Drizzle with olive oil. Bake, uncovered, at 400 degrees for 7-9 minutes, or until thoroughly heated. Serve immediately. ; name: stuffed crust pepperoni pizza ; ingredients: pizza dough, mozzarella string cheese, pizza sauce, pepperoni, mozzarella cheese, butter, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Heat oven to 425 degrees fahrenheit. Grease a 13x9x2 inch pan. Unroll dough. Press in bottom and 1 inch up sides of greased pan. Place pieces of string cheese along the inside edges of dough. Fold the 1 inch of dough over and around the cheese. Press dough edges to seal. Brush edge with melted butter and parmesan cheese. Top the crust with sauce, pepperoni and cheese. Bake at 425 degrees fahrenheit for 15 to 18 minutes or until crust is golden brown and cheese is melted. ; name: french clafouti ; ingredients: fruit, eggs, flour, sugar, milk, vanilla extract, rum ; preparation:Grease and flour circular deep dish glass pie plate. Beat together eggs, sugar and flour. Add the vanilla and milk gradually. Arrange the fruit in the bottom of the pan. Pour the batter mixture over the fruit. Optional, strew dots of unsalted butter over the clafouti halfway though baking. Bake at 400 degrees f, for 30 to 40 minutes. ; name: blue corn chile bacon muffins ; ingredients: flour, blue cornmeal, sugar, baking powder, salt, buttermilk, egg, butter, bacon bits, jalapenos ; preparation:

name: bacon potato bundles ; ingredients: baking potatoes, onions, green peppers, bacon, salt and pepper ; preparation:Place the potatoes on four pieces of greased heavy duty aluminum foil. Place onion and green pepper between potatoes to quarters. Top with bacon. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Wrap in foil. Grill, covered. Over med-high heat for 40-50 minutes or until potatoes are tender, turning once. ; name: peanut butter dreams ; ingredients: cereal, dry roasted peanuts, rice krispies, mini marshmallows, white chocolate, chunky peanut butter ; preparation:Melt chocolate in double boiler, do not cover. Add chunky peanut butter and stir until melted. Place cereals, peanuts, and marshmallows in large mixing bowl. Pour melted chocolate over cereal mixture and mix so all is coated. Drop by tablespoon onto wax paper and allow to set. ; name: egg tomato leftover rice ; ingredients: oil, eggs, tomatoes, soy sauce, cooked rice, salt, pepper, chili sauce ; preparation:Heat oil, then scramble eggs until set. Add tomatoes and mix with eggs for 1 minute to steam. Add soy sauce. Cover and let steam for 1 minute. Mix in leftover rice. Add salt, pepper, chili sauce to taste. ; name: italian meringue ; ingredients: egg white, granulated sugar, corn syrup, water ; preparation:Bring sugar, corn syrup and enough water to wet to a boil. Remove from heat at softball stage. Pour into a heatproof measuring cup. Meanwhile whip egg whites to stiff peaks. Continue whipping whites while very slowly pouring sugar syrup into mixer bowl. Be careful not to pour on whisk as it will splatter on to the sides of the bowl when sugar is fully incorporated, whip on low speed until cool. ; name: drunken sloppy joes ; ingredients: extra virgin olive oil, onion, extra lean ground beef, ketchup, southern comfort, light brown sugar, dijon mustard ; preparation:Heat the olive oil in a large and deep pan. Add the onions and fry gently until they have started to go tender. This takes about 5 minutes, stirring often. Crumble in the ground beef and cook, stirring when needed, until all of the meat is browned. This took me about 8 minutes. Add the ketchup, southern comfort and brown sugar and stir until everything is combined with the meat. Bring to a boil and then reduce to a simmer and continue to simmer for about 15 minutes, stirring now and then. Stir in the dijon mustard and then let simmer for another 15 minutes or until the sauce is the thickness you like with a sloppy joe. Serve on buns. ; name: orange strawberry and kiwi salad ww ; ingredients: orange juice, honey, oranges, strawberries, grapes, kiwi fruits, mint leaves ; preparation:In a nonmetallic bowl, combine orange juice and honey. Add the fruits. Toss to coat. Refrigerate, covered, until chilled, at least 1 hour. Sprinkle with mint before serving. ; name: miso shiitake breakfast soup ; ingredients: fresh shiitake mushrooms, boiling water, light miso, tofu, scallion ; preparation:If using dried mushrooms, soak in warm water for 20 minutes then drain. Slice the mushrooms thinly. Pour the boiling water into a saucepan, stir in the miso. Add the mushrooms and simmer for 5 minutes. Divide the tofu between 4 warmed soup bowls. Ladle in the broth. Scatter chopped scallions on top and serve. Try this with my chanterelle croissants. ; name: crispy eggplant aubergine fingers ; ingredients: eggplant, seasoned bread crumbs, parmesan cheese, salt, celery salt, pepper, eggs, milk, olive oil ; preparation:

name: garlic roasted potato salad ; ingredients: new potato, extra virgin olive oil, garlic cloves, mayonnaise, creole mustard, parsley, scallions, lemon, juice of, salt and black pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a bowl, toss potatoes, garlic, and olive oil together to coat. Place potatoes in a single layer on a baking sheet. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Place in 350 degree oven for 15-20 minutes, or until tender, allow to cool for 10 minutes. Combine mayonnaise, creole mustard, lemon juice, parsley, and scallions. Add to potatoes. Add salt or pepper to taste. Serve cold or room temperature. ; name: angus barn s chocolate chess pie ; ingredients: unbaked pie shell, butter, semi-sweet chocolate baking squares, sugar, eggs, vanilla, salt ; preparation:Melt butter and chocolate. Mix with other ingredients which have been blended together. Pour into pie crust,. Bake 35 minutes, at 350. Top with whipped cream. ; name: spinach feta rice and ham ; ingredients: rice, chicken broth, water, onion, garlic cloves, lemon juice, oregano, frozen chopped spinach, feta cheese, cooked ham ; preparation:Combine rice, broth and water in saucepan. Bring to boil. Reduce heat, cover and simmer 15 minutes or until tender. Saute onion and garlic in another pan. Add to rice along with remaining ingredients. Heat until heated through. ; name: dump it in rhubarb cake ; ingredients: rhubarb, strawberry gelatin, sugar, cinnamon, yellow cake mix, water, whipped topping, flour ; preparation:Spread rhubarb in an 9x13 pan. Sprinkle with sugar and dry jello powder. Sprinkle dry cake mix over sugar. Pour a cup of water evenly over mixture. Cover tightly with foil. Bake 350 f for 30 minutes or so until cake is done. ; name: great eggplant dip ; ingredients: eggplant, onion, breadcrumbs, plain yogurt, cloves, parsley, cider vinegar, lemon juice, olive oil ; preparation:Place whole eggplant on oven tray. Bake in a hot oven for one hour or till soft. Remove from oven, cool slightly. Peel eggplant, chop flesh roughly. Combine flesh with remaining ingredients in food processor. Process till smooth. Refrigerate mixture overnight. ; name: beef and bean burrito filling ; ingredients: oil, onion, garlic, ground beef, chili powder, cumin, salt and pepper, tomato sauce, refried beans ; preparation:Saute the onion in the oil until tender. Add the beef and garlic and cook until meat is no longer pink. Add the chili powder, cumin and other seasonings. Stir in tomato sauce and simmer for five minutes. Add refried beans and cook and stir until well blended. ; name: mexican rice easy ; ingredients: vegetable oil, long-grain white rice, garlic salt, ground cumin, taco seasoning, onion, tomato sauce, chicken broth ; preparation:Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add rice and cook, stirring constantly. Sprinkle with salt, cumin, and taco seasoning. Cook stirring constantly, until slightly translucent. Stir in onions and cook until tender. Stir in tomato sauce and chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 20 to 25 minutes. Fluff with a fork. ; name: spicy sun dried tomato and feta sauce ; ingredients: sun-dried tomatoes packed in oil, garlic, crushed tomatoes, kalamata olive, sugar, fresh basil, feta cheese, parmesan cheese, dry pasta ; preparation:

name: sparkling peach splash ; ingredients: peaches, peach schnapps, fresh lime juice, champagne, peach slices ; preparation:Combine first 3 ingredients in a blender. Process until smooth. Freeze 1 hour. Pour champagne into a pitcher. Spoon peach mixture into pitcher. Stir to combine. Garnish with peach slices, if desired. Serve immediately. ; name: low country red rice ; ingredients: bacon, onion, black pepper, tomato juice, salt, long grain rice, tabasco sauce ; preparation:Fry the bacon pieces until they are crisp, then remove the cooked bacon from the frying pan and reserve. In the bacon drippings fry the onion until limp. Add the tomato juice or v8, salt, pepper, and tabasco sauce and bring up to a boil. Put in the rice and stir until it comes up to a boil again. Cover the pan and turn the heat down to very low. Cook the dish for 20 minutes without disturbing. At the end of this time remove the cover and stir up the contents of the pan. Cover again, remove from heat, and let stand 15 minutes. Add the reserved bacon and serve. ; name: chicken wild rice chowder ; ingredients: fresh carrots, onion, celery, butter, all-purpose flour, chicken broth, cooked chicken breasts, long grain and wild rice blend, half-and-half cream, pepper ; preparation:In a large saucepan, saute the carrots, onion and celery in butter til tender. Stir in flour til blended. Gradually add broth. Bring to a boil. Cook and stir for 2 minutes or til thickened. Stir in chicken, rice, cream and pepper. Heat through. ; name: grilled citrus salmon ; ingredients: diana honey garlic sauce, lemon juice, chives, butter, honey, lemon zest, salt, pepper, hot pepper flakes, boneless salmon fillets ; preparation:Preheat the grill to medium-high and grease well. Pierce a piece of nonstick foil several times with a skewer and place on a baking sheet. Stir the sauce with the lemon juice, chives, butter, honey, lemon zest, salt, pepper, and hot pepper flakes,. Set the salmon, skin-side-down, on the prepared foil. Brush half of the sauce mixture over the salmon fillet. Slide the foil onto the grate. Cook, covered and without turning, for 15-17 minutes or until the salmon is cooked but still slightly coral in the center. Brush with the remaining glaze during the last 5 minutes of cooking. To serve, slice salmon into portions. Use a thin metal spatula to lift each portion off the foil, leaving the skin behind. Garnish with additional chives. ; name: meat lovers pizza casserole ; ingredients: ground beef, onion, pizza sauce, elbow macaroni, mozzarella cheese, pepperoni slices, salt ; preparation:In a large skillet cook the beef and onion over medium heat until meat is no longer pink. Drain. Stir in remaining ingredients. Transfer to a greased 2 quart baking dish. Bake uncovered at 350 for 40-45 minutes or until heated through. ; name: grilled radicchio ; ingredients: radicchio, olive oil, salt and pepper, honey, balsamic vinegar ; preparation:Preheat a gas barbeque or indoor grill. Brush radicchio with oil and season with salt and pepper. Grill until it wilts and begins to brown. Stir together the honey and balsamic and toss with the radicchio. Adjust seasoning. ; name: sweet chunky mango sauce ; ingredients: mangoes, ground nutmeg, ground cinnamon, allspice, caster sugar ; preparation:Separate mango slices from syrup and do not throw away the syrup. Mash mangoes until chunky. Place mangoes, mango syrup, nutmeg, cinnamon, allspice and caster sugar in mixing bowl. Mix the mixture and place in a saucepan. Place saucepan over high heat and stir ingredients slowly but constantly. When the mixture begins to simmer, turn down the heat to medium. Cook mixture until it is hot, but not boiling hot. Serve on ice-cream, pancakes or in a bowl. ; name: salmon with orange marmalade ; ingredients: orange marmalade, low sodium soy sauce, garlic cloves, salmon fillets, salt ; preparation:

name: parmesan rice pilaf ; ingredients: butter, white rice, chicken broth, garlic powder, parsley flakes, ground black pepper, parmesan cheese, sliced almonds ; preparation:Melt butter in a medium sauce pan on medium heat. Add rice, cook and stir three minutes. Stir in chicken broth, garlic powder, parsley flakes and pepper. Bring to a boil, reduce to low, cover and simmer 20 minutes or until rice in tender. Stir in parmesan cheese and sliced almonds. ; name: honey roasted vidalia onions ; ingredients: vidalia onions, water, honey, butter, paprika, salt, curry powder, ground red pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Peel onions and cut in half crosswise. Place onions, cut sides down, in an 8 inch square baking dish, drizzle with water. Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes. Combine honey and remaining ingredients. Turn onions over. Brush half of the honey mixture over the onions. Bake, uncovered, an additional 30 minutes or until tender, basting with remaining honey mixture after 15 minutes. ; name: spicy beer brined rotisserie pork loin ; ingredients: boneless pork loin, beer, dark corn syrup, green onions, prepared mustard, vegetable oil, chili powder, fresh garlic, black pepper ; preparation:Place the pork loin roast in a heavy large plastic ziploc bag. In a bowl whisk together beer, corn syrup, onions, mustard, chili powder, garlic and black pepper. Pour the marinade over the pork. Seal the bag tightly and turn to coat the meat. Place the bag in a large bowl and place in the refrigerator for 8-24 hours. When ready to cook prepare the rotisserie. Remove the roast from the marinade and bring to almost room temperature before cooking. Place the pork on the spit then set over heat and baste every 10-15 minutes or the internal temperature reads 155-160f. Discard any remaining marinade. Remove the roast from the spit and let rest for 15 minutes before slicing. ; name: simple baked chicken drumsticks ; ingredients: chicken drumsticks, garlic powder, pepper, salt, olive oil, rosemary, parsley ; preparation:Put some olive oil in the bottom of a 9x13 pan. Add drumsticks. Sprinkle generously with pepper and garlic powder. Sprinkle lightly with salt. Add rosemary to the chicken, if desired. Bake at 375 f for half an hour. Turn drumsticks over and add more garlic powder, pepper and salt. Top with the parsley. Bake another half an hour, or until cooked until 160f. ; name: garlic spinach stir fry ; ingredients: spinach, tomatoes, black bean sauce, garlic cloves, vegetable oil, chili sauce, fresh lemon juice, salt and black pepper ; preparation:Heat oil in a wok. Add tomatoes, garlic, black bean sauce, stir fry for 1 minute. Stir in the spinach, chili sauce, and lemon juice, and mix well. Keep stirring for about 3 minutes, until spinach gets wilted. Season with salt and black pepper. Serve immediately. ; name: wilted cabbage ; ingredients: bacon, onion, sugar, vinegar, salt, pepper, cabbage ; preparation:Cook bacon in large skillet until crisp. Remove bacon, reserving drippings in skillet. Crumble bacon, set aside. Add onions and next 4 ingredients to drippings in skillet, stirring until blended. Stir in cabbage. Cook over medium heat, uncovered, 15 minutes, stirring occasionally. Sprinkle with reserved bacon. ; name: southwestern shells with chicken and corn ; ingredients: shell pasta, olive oil, boneless skinless chicken breast, flour, milk, monterey jack cheese, frozen corn, thick & chunky salsa, green chilies ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cook and drain pasta according to package directions. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Cook chicken until lightly browned. Sprinkle with flour and stir while cooking for 1 more minute. Reduce heat, slowly add the milk and cook for about 5 minutes or until milk is slightly thickened. Remove from heat, add one cup cheese, corn, salsa and green chilies. Add in hot pasta and mix well. Place in lightly greased baking dish. Sprinkle the remaining cheese on top and bake 20-25 minutes. ; name: sauteed sweetbreads lamb or veal ; ingredients: lamb sweetbreads, salt, vinegar, bacon, flour, garlic powder, butter, oil ; preparation:

name: uncle don s relish ; ingredients: green tomatoes, onions, sweet red peppers, salt, sugar, celery seeds, mustard seeds, vinegar, turmeric powder ; preparation:Wash tomatoes, and cut into wedges to grind. Grind the tomatoes, onions, and peppers. Put together in a big container or pan, and put the salt over these 3 ingredients, and let. Stand for 5 hours. Drain off all liquid, and then add sugar, celery seed, mustard seed, vinegar, and tumeric powder. Boil all for 25 minutes. Put in hot jars while relish is hot, and process in a hot water bath for 15 minutes. Make sure the seal is down on top of canning jar when completed. ; name: sauteed shrimp with lemon and garlic ; ingredients: lemons, large shrimp, garlic, olive oil, kosher salt, pepper ; preparation:Peel, devein and rinse shrimp. Set aside. Grate the zest of both lemons, then juice both lemons. Keep zest and juice separate. In a large bowl, place shrimp then add lemon zest, garlic and half of the olive oil. Toss well to coat evenly and season with the salt and pepper. Heat remaining oil in a large saute pan over medium heat. Saute shrimp in single layer for about 1 minute on each side until cooked through. After all shrimp is cooked and removed from pan, deglaze pan with 3 t of lemon juice, stirring up any browned bits. Pour sauce over shrimp and serve. ; name: chicken feta baguettes ; ingredients: feta cheese, scallions, cherry tomatoes, baguette, balsamic vinegar, extra virgin olive oil, cooked chicken ; preparation:In a small bowl, combine feta and scallions and mix well. Add tomatoes and toss gently. Slice open baguette or rolls and drizzle vinegar and oil over cut sides of bread. Arrange sliced chicken on bottom half and cover with feta mixture. Close bread, slice and serve. ; name: garlicky steak marinade ; ingredients: fresh parsley, of fresh mint, fresh rosemary, garlic cloves, fresh lemon juice, soy sauce, olive oil, kosher salt, black pepper ; preparation:Combine parsley, mint, rosemary and garlic in food processor and pulse until finely chopped. Add lemon juice, soy sauce, salt & pepper and process until smooth. With the motor running, add olive oil in a thin stream. Pour marinade over steak and turn to coat. Cover and refrigerate at least 4 hours or overnight, turning occasionally. ; name: perfect blintz batter ; ingredients: eggs, water, half-and-half cream, vanilla, salt, sugar, flour, baking powder, butter ; preparation:In a medium bowl lightly beat eggs, then whisk in water, milk, salt, 2 teaspoons sugar and vanilla until well blended. Sift the flour and baking powder, then stir into the egg ingredients. Whisk until thick. Stir in melted butter. Let the batter sit out at room temperature for 20 minutes or until it comes to room temperature and the bubbles settle. Lightly butter a 8-inch skillet on medium heat. Add in about 3-4 tablespoons batter and swirl to coat the bottom of the skillet. Cook until the bottom is set and light browned. Flip the blintz over and cook for about 30 seconds. Repeat with remaining batter. ; name: lemon dijon green beans ; ingredients: green beans, butter, fresh lemon juice, dijon mustard, dill weed, slivered almonds, salt and pepper ; preparation:I usually steam the green beans for 5-7 minutes to get them a bit tender. Melt butter or margarine in large frying pan. Add green beans and cook on medium hight heat until coated with butter. Add lemon juice, mustard and dill. Toss with beans until coated well and heated through. Check taste, add salt or pepper if desired. Sprinkle with toased almonds before serving. ; name: sonoma diet hummus ; ingredients: garbanzo beans, tahini, water, lemon juice, extra virgin olive oil, garlic clove, kosher salt, cumin seed, cayenne pepper, fresh flat-leaf parsley ; preparation:In a food processor combine garbanzo beans, tahini, the water, the 2 tablespoons lemon juice, the oil, garlic, kosher salt, cumin seeds, and cayenne pepper. Cover and process until smooth. Transfer to a medium bowl. Stir in the 1 tablespoon parsley. If desired, stir in additional lemon juice to taste. Garnish with additional parsley. Serve with baked pita chips or vegetable dippers, or use as a spread in a grilled vegetable sandwich. Add seeds. Cook about 2 minutes or until toasted and aromatic, shaking skillet frequently. Place toasted seeds in a spice grinder and process until finely ground. ; name: spiced pork chops squash and apples ; ingredients: boneless pork chops, cooking apple, acorn squash, apple juice, maple syrup, cinnamon, nutmeg, brown rice ; preparation:

name: rack of lamb mustard crusted ; ingredients: rack of lamb, salt, fresh ground black pepper, extra virgin olive oil, dijon mustard, garlic, fresh rosemary, seasoned bread crumbs, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Season rack of lamb well on all sides with salt and pepper. Heat a medium skillet over high heat and, when hot, add the oil. When the oil is almost smoking, add the rack of lamb and brown well on all sides, about 6 minutes. Transfer the lamb to a plate and set aside to cool slightly before proceeding. Preheat oven to 450 degrees f. Using the back of a spoon, spread the mustard evenly over all sides of the lamb. Spread the minced garlic over the lamb in the same manner. In a small mixing bowl combine the breadcrumbs and grated cheese and toss to thoroughly combine. Using your hands or a spoon, spread the breadcrumb mixture evenly all over the lamb, pressing so that the crumbs adhere to the meat. Place the rack of lamb on a baking sheet and bake for 12 to 15 minutes for medium-rare. Allow lamb to sit for 5 to 10 minutes before carving into chops to serve. ; name: crock pot teriyaki wingers ; ingredients: chicken wings, onion, low sodium soy sauce, brown sugar, ground ginger, garlic cloves, dry sherry ; preparation:Rinse the wings and pat them dry. Cut off and discard the wing. Cut each wing at joint to make two sections. Place the wing parts on a broiler pan. Broil 4-5 inches from the heat for 10 minutes on each side or until chicken is brown. Transfer the wings to a crock pot. Mix together the onion, soy sauce, brown sugar, ginger, garlic and sherry in bowl. Pour over the chicken wings. Cover and cook on low for 5-6 hours. Stir the wings once to ensure that they are evenly coated with sauce. Serve from the crock pot. ; name: blue plate beef patties ; ingredients: egg, green onions, seasoned bread crumbs, prepared mustard, ground beef, beef gravy, water, prepared horseradish, fresh mushrooms ; preparation:Beat egg, stir in onions, crumbs, and mustard. Add ground beef, mix well. Shape into 4 patties. In ungreased skillet, cook patties for 5-6 minutes per side, until no longer pink. Drain. Mix gravy, water and horseradish. Add mishrooms. Pour over patties. Cook, uncovered, for 5 more minutes. ; name: potato nuggets with dill cream ; ingredients: potatoes, fresh dill, butter, heavy cream, salt & pepper ; preparation:Steam or boil your new potatoe nuggets until cooked. Melt butter in a skillet, add potatoes, toss to coat. Mix dill into the cream. Pour dilled cream over the potatoes and continue cooking over medium-low heat until the cream has turned into an almost golden sauce, stir frequently. Season to taste. ; name: candy corn ; ingredients: carrots, potato, bacon, olive oil, onion, maple syrup, corn ; preparation:Cook carrots and potatoes in boiling salted water until done. Drain. Fry bacon until golden. Add olive oil to 1 tablespoon bacon drippings and cook onion 10 minutes over medium low heat. Add maple syrup and cook 5 minutes. Stir in corn, bacon, carrots and potatoes and season to taste. Cook until warmed through. ; name: 7 up chocolate chip pound cake ; ingredients: butter, sugar, vanilla, eggs, all-purpose flour, cocoa, 7-up soda, semi-sweet chocolate chips ; preparation:Cream butter with an electric mixer. Add sugar and vanilla. Beat until light and fluffy. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in flour and cocoa, blending thoroughly. Stir in 7up. Fold in chocolate chips. Spoon into a well greased 10-inch tube pan. Bake at 350 for 1 hour. Cool in pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes. Remove from pan, cool completely. ; name: blueberry dream cake ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, granulated sugar, baking powder, butter, egg whites, vanilla, fresh blueberries, low-fat plain yogurt, egg, lemons ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 f. Combine flour, sugar, baking powder, butter, egg whites, and vanilla. Mix well. Press onto bottom of 10 inch springform pan. Layer blueberries on base. In large bowl combine flour, yogurt, egg, sugar, vanilla, and lemon rind. Mix until smooth. Pour over blueberries. Bake 60-70 minutes or until cake is firm and golden. ; name: southwestern scrambled eggs ; ingredients: butter, country ham, red bell pepper, eggs, heavy cream, salt, pepper, chili powder, garlic powder, cheddar cheese ; preparation:

name: cheesy pinwheel rolls ; ingredients: lipton recipe secrets savory herb with garlic soup mix, cream cheese, mozzarella cheese, parmesan cheese, milk, pizza dough ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425. In medium bowl, combine all ingredients except pizza crust. Set aside. Unroll pizza crusts, then evenly top with filling. Roll, starting at longest side, jelly-roll style. Cut into 32 rounds. On baking sheet sprayed with nonstick cooking spray, arrange rounds cut side down. Bake 13 minutes or until golden brown. ; name: sauteed zucchini and mushroom with sun dried tomatoes ; ingredients: extra virgin olive oil, garlic, zucchini, white button mushrooms, sun-dried tomato, vegetable broth, fresh basil, salt, fresh ground pepper ; preparation:In a large nonstick skillet. Heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and zucchini and cook, tossing and stirring often for 3 minutes. Add mushrooms, sundried-tomatoes, broth and basil, if using. Cook, tossing and stirring constantly, until zucchini are crisp-tender and the mushroom are sofened and have just begun to release their liquid, about 2 minutes. Remove skillet from the heat and season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately. ; name: apple jack quesadilla rachael ray ; ingredients: extra virgin olive oil, whole wheat tortillas, pepper jelly, monterey jack pepper cheese, mcintosh apple ; preparation:Preheat oven to 250f. Wrap tortillas in a damp kitchen towel and cook in the microwave for a minute. Lay the warm, pliable tortillas out on a clean, flat, work surface. Spread one tablespoon of jelly over each tortilla. Sprinkle a small handful of cheese over on half of the tortilla and top that with an even layer of sliced apples. Top the apples with more cheese and fold the quesadillas in half to create half moons. In a skillet over medium to medium-high heat, drizzle some evoo. Place the quesadillas one at a time in the hot pan and heat them on both sides until they are crispy and golden brown, and the cheese has melted, about 1-2 minutes per side. Transfer each cooked quesadilla to a baking tray in the oven to keep warm as you finish the others. Cut each quesadilla into quarters and serve. ; name: open faced omelet ; ingredients: broccoli floret, sweet red pepper, green onion, ham, frozen hash brown potatoes, egg substitute, pepper, cheddar cheese ; preparation:In a 9inch or 10inch skillet coated with non-stick cooking spray, saute broccoli, red pepper and onions until tender crisp. Add ham and hash browns. Cook for 2 minutes, stirring frequently. In a bowl whisk together egg substitute and pepper. Pour over vegetable mixture. Reduce heat. Cover and cook for 10-12 minutes or until set. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with cheese. Cover and let stand for 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Cut into wedges. ; name: tuna and corn fritters ; ingredients: tuna in water, creamed corn, onion, flour, egg, cheese, fresh parsley ; preparation:Mix all the ingredients together in a bowl. Heat up a frying pan. When the pan is hot, spoon the mixture in heaped spoonfuls into the pan. Cook in batches for about 3 minutes each side, or until both sides are golden brown. Remove from the pan, and continue cooking in batches. ; name: chocolate orange tart ; ingredients: butter, dark chocolate, digestive biscuits, cream, eggs, orange zest, orange curd ; preparation:Heat the oven to 180 degrees celsius. In the microwave or in a pan, melt the butter and dark chocolate together until liquid. Add the biscuit crumbs, mix well to combine and spoon into a 22cm fluted round, loose-bottomed tin. Press up the side to form the lip first, then press into the base, making sure there are no gaps where they join then put into the fridge to chill. Using a fork or a hand whisk, mix together the cream, eggs, orange zest and orange curd and pour into the crust in the tin. Bake in the oven for 30-35 minutes until just set. Leave to cool. Remove from the tin and drizzle with the melted chocolate. Leave to cool completely. Chill in the fridge before serving. ; name: hot and creamy cocoa with gooey toasted marshmallows ; ingredients: heavy cream, sugar, semisweet chocolate, marshmallows ; preparation:Place the cream in a heavy-bottomed saucepan and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce the heat slightly so the cream remains at a low boil, and boil for 3 to 4 minutes, until it begins to thicken. Stir in the sugar and chocolate and continue to simmer, stirring constantly, until the sugar dissolves and the chocolate melts. Remove the saucepan from the heat and set aside to keep warm. Place the marshmallows on a small cookie sheet. Place under your broiler in the oven for 2 to 3 minutes, until toasted or charred. The charred flavor, as we all know from campfires, is ideal. If necessary, reheat the hot chocolate over low heat, stirring constantly. Pour the hot chocolate into four demitasse cups. Top each with a toasted gooey marshmallow and serve immediately with spoons. ; name: flapjacks ; ingredients: light muscovado sugar, butter, golden syrup, honey, porridge oats ; preparation:

name: instant fruit salad ; ingredients: instant lemon pudding, pineapple chunk, mandarin orange, fruit cocktail ; preparation:Open and drain liquid from all cans except pineapple. Place all fruit in serving container. Pour lemon pudding powder onto fruit and stir. Add can of pineapple with liquid. Refridgerate until ready to serve. ; name: fried potatoes without the fry ; ingredients: russet potatoes, onion flakes, oregano, garlic cloves, paprika, salt and pepper, olive oil ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f degrees. Put a sheet of tinfoil on a cookie sheet. Spray cookie sheet with lite olive oil or other veggie oil. In a small bowl combine. Onion flakes, oregano, garlic, paprika, salt& pepper, mix well. Brush cut sides of the potato wedges with olive oil and sprinkle with the spice mixture. Place potato pieces cut side down on the prepared cookie sheet. Bake until underside are golden brown, about 30 minutes. Gently turn the wedges so the other side is on the cookie sheet. Bake for another 15-20 minutes or until the potatoes are tender and golden. Serve while they ar piping hot. ; name: karin calloway s crock pot sweet and sour meatballs ; ingredients: tomato paste, water, crushed pineapple, cider vinegar, salt, black pepper, onion, brown sugar, crushed red pepper flakes, meatballs ; preparation:Combine all ingredients in a 4-quart or larger crock pot. Cover and cook on low for 8 hours. Stir once or twice during cooking. To serve as an entree, spoon over hot cooked white rice or egg noodles. Sauteed sugar snap or snow peas make a good side dish. ; name: mom s oat griddle cakes ; ingredients: milk, quick oats, flour, baking powder, salt, sugar, eggs, butter ; preparation:Pour the milk over the oats and let stand 5 minutes. Stir the flour, baking powder, sugar and salt together. Add the beaten eggs to the oat and milk mixture. Add the melted butter. Mix the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients just until moistened. You may keep this in the refrigerator for several days or make immediately. Fry on griddle until brown. These are thick and take a little longer to cook than regular pancakes. Serve warm with your favorite toppings. ; name: to die for truffles ; ingredients: whipping cream, sweet chocolate, butter, vanilla, nuts, unsweetened cocoa, powdered sugar ; preparation:In 2 quart saucepan, combine whipping cream and chocolate. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly until chocolate is melted and mixture is smooth. This should take between 2-4 minutes. Stir in butter until melted. Cool to room temperature. Stir in vanilla. Cover and refrigerate until firm enough to shape. To make truffles, shape teaspoonful size mixture into 1 inch balls. Roll in optional topping. Refrigerate until firm. ; name: smucker s caramel topping pecan pie ; ingredients: pie crusts, sugar, butter, eggs, caramel topping, pecan halves ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f in a mixing bowl, beat eggs slightly with fork. Add sugar, stirring until dissolved. Stir in caramel topping and butter. Mix well. Stir in pecan halves. Pour filling into pie shell. Bake at 350f for 45 minutes or until knife inserted off-center comes out clean. Cool thoroughly on rack before serving. Cover and chill to store. ; name: old south corn pudding ; ingredients: cream-style corn, sugar, salt, butter, eggs, milk, cornstarch, cold water ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine corn, sugar, salt, butter, eggs, and milk. Dissolve cornstarch in water and stir into corn mixture. Pour into a greased, shallow 2-quart baking dish. Bake for 1 hour or until mixture sets. ; name: amy s special raspberry jam bars ; ingredients: sugar cookie mix, egg, oil, water, white chocolate chips, milk, cream cheese frosting, sugar-free raspberry jam ; preparation:

name: cuervo gold chicken wings ; ingredients: tequila, low sodium soy sauce, honey, dijon mustard, cloves, hot sauce, chicken wings, coarse salt, fresh ground pepper, fresh cilantro ; preparation:Preheat over to 450 degrees f. In a large bowl, whisk together jose cuervo tequila, soy sauce, honey, mustard, garlic and hot sauce. Wash chicken wings and pat dry. Season with salt and pepper. Add wings to the marinade and stir to coat. Transfer to refrigerator for 2-3 hours. Drain chicken and arrange on baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 375 degrees f and continue baking for an additional 20 minutes. Transfer to platter and sprinkle with fresh cilantro. ; name: english hop picker s oast cakes ; ingredients: flour, baking powder, lard, caster sugar, currants, lemon juice, wine, mixed spice, oil ; preparation:Sift the flour and baking powder into a bowl. Rub in the lard or butter until the mixture resembles breadcrumbs. Add the sugar and currants before mixing in the lemon juice with the wine, sherry or beer until the dough is soft but not wet. Roll out thinly and cut into rounds. Shallow fry in a little oil until golden brown on both sides. You may deep fry the balls if you wish, but you will probably need to drain them on kitchen paper. Eat immediately. For vegetarian do not use lard. ; name: hot chocolate and toast ; ingredients: bread, milk, hot cocoa, margarine ; preparation:Toast your bread. Butter it. Prepare hot chocolate. Dunk you toast in the hot chocolate. Eat and enjoy. ; name: frozen lite chocolate cheesecake ; ingredients: light corn syrup, half & half light cream, semi-sweet chocolate chips, cocoa powder, sugar substitute, sugar, fat free cream cheese, vanilla extract, reduced-calorie whipped topping, chocolate cookie pie crust ; preparation:Heat syrup and half and half in a microwave-safe container for 1 minute. Stir in chocolate chips and heat for 30 seconds. Stir until smooth and well blended. Pour mixture into blender or food processor. Add cocoa, sucralose, sugar, cream cheese and vanilla. Blend on medium speed in blender until very smooth. Add whipped topping and mix until uniformly blended. Pour into crust. Cover and freeze for at least 6 hours. Remove from freezer and thaw for 15 to 30 minutes before serving. Garnish with additional whipped toopping and cocoa, if desired. For a mocha pie, stir 2 teaspoons instant coffee granules into the syrup mixture before it is microwaved. ; name: california consomme ; ingredients: chicken broth, avocados, lemons, sherry wine, fresh parsley ; preparation:Heat broth to near boiling in a medium pot. Divide the avocado slices between bowls. Place 2-3 lemon slices over the avocados. Pour heated broth into the bowls. Add 1 tbsp sherry to each bowl. Sprinkle parsley over the broth in each bowl. ; name: aloha pizza ; ingredients: pizza dough, extra virgin olive oil, salt & pepper, mozzarella cheese, pineapple, onion, prosciutto, frisee ; preparation:Stretch dough to fit a lightly oiled baking sheet. Brush with evoo and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Scatter mozzarella, pineapple, onion and prosciutto evenly over dough. Bake at 500 degrees on bottom rack until crust is crisp and cooked through, about 15 minutes. Top with frisee and cut into squares. Serves 4. ; name: pizza with honey caramelized onions cheese and mushrooms ; ingredients: olive oil, onions, honey, balsamic vinegar, fresh mushrooms, boboli pizza crusts, feta cheese, dried thyme ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Heat olive oil over medium heat, add onions and saute until tender, about 10 minutes. Add honey and vinegar, reduce heat and saute until onions are golden brown, about another 8 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Place pizza crust on pizza stone or baking sheet, sprinkle with cheese and thyme. Top this with onion mixture, then mushrooms. Cook for about 15 minutes or until cheese is melted. ; name: grandmothers famous cranberry bread ; ingredients: flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, baking soda, butter, eggs, orange peel, orange juice, cranberries ; preparation:

name: easy cheddar bay biscuits like red lobster ; ingredients: bisquick baking mix, old bay seasoning, milk, cheddar cheese, butter, garlic powder, parsley flakes ; preparation:Combine bisquick, milk, first old bay seasoning, and cheese. Beat with a wooden spoon for about 30 seconds. Spoon onto a lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake in oven at 450 degrees for 8 to 12 minutes. Melt butter. Add garlic powder, parsley and last old bay seasoning to melted butter. Brush on hot buscuits. May use more or less seasoning for taste. ; name: grandpa s strawberry lemonade ; ingredients: water, sugar, lemon peel, fresh lemon juice, fresh strawberries, sparkling water, ice, strawberry ; preparation:In a medium saucepan, bring the water and sugar to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer, stirring occasionally until the sugar dissolves. Add lemon peel and lemon juice, stir and remove from heat. Let cool completely, then strain into a clean pitcher. In a blender, puree the pint of strawberries and add to the lemon juice. Stir well and refrigerate. Add sparkling water and stir well when ready to serve. ; name: mexican grill chicken taquito enchiladas ; ingredients: chicken taquitos, red enchilada sauce, evaporated milk, sour cream, monterey jack cheese ; preparation:Heat up the taquitos according to the instructions on the package and keep warm. Combine enchilada sauce and milk in a heavy bottom sauce pan and bring to a simmer. Stir in sour cream and keep warm. In a casserole dish pour enough sauce on bottom to just cover the bottom of the casserole dish. Arrange taquitos on top of sauce. Pour remaining sauce over the taquitos. Sprinkle cheese over each taquito and melt in a preheated 375 degree oven for 1-2 minutes. Optional-garnish each serving with a teaspoon of sour cream, an avocado slice, chopped green onions, fresh diced tomatoes, and black olives. ; name: grandma s fruit cobbler ; ingredients: flour, crisco, salt, butter, sugar, fruit ; preparation:Work flour and crisco in a millie dough. Add cold water a little at a time until you get firm dough. Roll into a ball. Cut in half and roll out on a floured surface. Line the bottom of a baking pan, 9 x 13 inches. Add fruit then roll out second half of dough and put on top. Pinch to seal sides. Cut up butter and sprinkle on top. Add sugar. Bake at 350-375 for 30 minutes or until golden brown. ; name: coconut macaroon ice cream biscuit tortoni ; ingredients: sugar, water, egg yolks, whipping cream, vanilla, macaroons ; preparation:Boil sugar and water together to form a syrup which spins a thread when dropped from the. Beat egg yolks well. Add syrup slowly, beating eggs during addition. Cook for 5 min. In double boiler. Remove from heat and beat well. Add the 1 c. Macaroons and cool. Whip the cream and fold into cooled egg mixture. Fold in vanilla. Spread in a shallow container and top with the powdered macaroons to give a brown crust appearance. Freeze overnight. ; name: mom s clam chowder ; ingredients: minced clams, onion, celery, potatoes, butter, flour, half-and-half, salt, pepper, sugar ; preparation:Dice celery, onion, and potatoes. Place in saucepan. Drain juice from clams and pour over the vegetables. Add enough water to cover the vegetables. Cook on medium heat until potatoes are tender. In another medium to large pot melt butter. Add flour and half & half. Cook mixture stirring constantly until thick and smooth. Add the vegetables with the juice and clams to the cream sauce. Add salt, pepper, and sugar. Cook a few minutes longer until heated through and serve. ; name: chicken pistachio sandwich ; ingredients: cooked chicken breast, celery rib, pistachios, coriander, mayonnaise, bread, butter, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Cut chicken into small pieces. Combine celery, pistachios, coriander and lime mayo in a small bowl. Add the chicken and stir through until well coated with the mayo. If using, lightly butter the bread. Spread chicken mixture onto 2 slices of bread, season with salt & pepper, then top with remaining bread slices. ; name: kahlua crunch coconut cake ; ingredients: semi-sweet chocolate chips, pecan pieces, yellow cake mix, kahlua, half-and-half, egg, egg substitute, sweetened flaked coconut ; preparation:

name: barbara s chicken dish ; ingredients: chicken tenderloins, olive oil, onion, chopped tomatoes, garlic, white wine, chicken stock, sour cream ; preparation:Heat the olive oil in a large fry pan. Add the chicken, and the chopped onion. Stir for about 2 minutes. Add the garlic, and continue cooking till the chicken is golden. Add the white wine. Add the tomatos. Add the stock or water. Simmer until chicken is cooked and the sauce is reduced. When done, salt and cracked pepper to taste, turn off heat and cover. When ready to serve, re-heat, stir in the sour cream, but dont re-boil. Serve over pasta, with a green salad. ; name: fried perch ; ingredients: perch fillet, flour, cornmeal, light beer, salt, pepper, old bay seasoning, oil ; preparation:Heat skillet fryer with hot oil. Mix flour, cornmeal, beer, salt pepper and seasonings until a batter consistency. Coat filets with batter. Deep fry til golden brown. Approx 3 minutes per side. ; name: carrot salad with black mustard seeds ; ingredients: carrot, red bell peppers, cashews, salt, vegetable oil, black mustard seeds, cilantro ; preparation:If very moist, press shredded carrots dry before mixing the salad. Mix carrots, bell pepper, cashews and salt. In a small pan heat oil over medium heat until hot. Add mustard seeds and fry until they sputter and turn grey. Pour oil and seeds over salad, add herbs and toss to mix. Serve. ; name: basted eggs ; ingredients: butter, eggs, salt, pepper, water ; preparation:Heat butter until melted. Add eggs. Fry until white is starting to set. Salt and pepper to taste. Add water and cover immediately. Some people add less water but i like a little more. The steam will cook the top of eggs. It takes just a minute or so, depending on how well done you like your eggs. Hard will be just like hard boiled eggs, that yellow color. I serve these with toast and fried potatoes, just like over easy eggs. ; name: king prawns with thai dipping sauce ; ingredients: thai fish sauce, rice vinegar, caster sugar, lime juice, sunflower oil, king prawns, mint leaf ; preparation:Place fish sauce, vinegar and caster sugar in a saucepan with 4. 5 fl oz water and bring gently to boiling point. Allow to cool and stir in lime juice. Heat a frying pan and add the oil. When hot, add prawns and toss gently for 2-3 minutes, until they are completely pink. Dish on to a large plate and scatter with mint leaves and some sea salt. Serve with the dipping sauce. ; name: hillshire farm autumn country fondue ; ingredients: smoked sausage, french bread, white wine, dry onion soup mix, lemon juice, swiss cheese, american cheese ; preparation:Combine onion soup mix, 1 cup of wine and lemon juice in heavy saucepan over medium heat. Turn setting to low and add cheeses in small amounts, stirring until cheese is melted. Add remainder of wine as needed. Transfer sauce to heating dish or fondue pot. Serve fondue with smoked sausage and bread chunks. Dip in the pieces of smoked sausage with fondue forks, allowing to sit for a few seconds to heat through. If you prefer, you could quickly fry the sausage before serving. ; name: bacon and bagels low fat ; ingredients: miniature bagels, turkey bacon, fat-free cream cheese, whole tomato, cooking oil ; preparation:Add a bit of oil in a frying pan at medium high heat. Fry the turkey bacon to desired crispiness, you can also cook the bacon in the microwave is you wanted to. While cooking the bacon, slice and open the bagels and toast in toaster or toaster oven. When bacon is done to desired crispiness, drain off excess grease. Cut bacon strips in half. Spread cream cheese, on one or both halves. Add 1 slice of tomato and both bacon halves and make in to sandwiches and they are ready to serve. ; name: asparagus with toasted almonds ; ingredients: asparagus, almonds, extra virgin olive oil, garlic cloves, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:

name: avocado dip spread ; ingredients: avocados, tomatoes, jalapeno, lemon juice, cilantro ; preparation:Chop the avocados. Chop the tomatoes. Cut jalapeo in half and remove seeds. Dice the jalapeo. Add the lemon juice. Add cilantro. Allow to sit in fridge for one hour. Eat same day made. ; name: back ribs casserole ; ingredients: beef back ribs, sauerkraut, caraway seed, onion, tomatoes, granulated sugar ; preparation:Heat oven to 350 degrees f. Cut back ribs into serving size pieces. Sprinkle both sides of pieces with seasoned salt and pepper. Mix caraway seed into sauerkraut, then place into a shallow 2-quart casserole. Arrange onion slices over sauerkraut. Cover with the tomatoes and their juice, cutting any whole tomatoes into pieces. Sprinkle with sugar. Place back ribs over entire surface. Cover. Bake for 1 hour. Uncover and continue to cook about 1 more hour. ; name: microwave acorn squash ; ingredients: acorn squash, brown sugar, butter, honey, salt, pepper ; preparation:Cut squash in half. Discard seeds. Place squash cut side down in a microwave-safe dish. Cover and microwave on high for 10-12 minutes or until tender. Turn squash cut side up. Fill centers with brown sugar, butter and honey. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cover and microwave on high for 2-3 minutes or until heathed through. ; name: fatback gravy ; ingredients: salt pork, flour, milk, water, salt and pepper ; preparation:Fry the salt pork. Drain on paper towels. Reserve for eating with breakfast. Pour all but 3 tablespoons of the grease out of skillet. Add flour to make a roux. When browned to a caramel color, add the can milk and water and stir well over low heat until thick. ; name: apricot and brandy jam ; ingredients: dried apricot halves, water, orange, sugar, almond extract, brandy ; preparation:Combine apricots and water in a bowl, cover, and let stand overnight, or until soft and well plumped. Combine apricots and their soaking water in saucepan with the orange peel and juice and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the sugar and bring to boil, while stirring. Boil gently, stirring often, until the mixture is thick and shiny and begins to clear the sides of the pan when stirred. While mixture thickens, be sure to stir it continually but gently, so that the fruit does not burn or get squashed. Do not allow the mixture to cook down to a puree. It should retain good-sized bits of apricot. Remove the preserve from heat and stir in almond extract and brandy. Ladle into 3 half-pint canning jars, prepared in usual manner and seal with sterilized 2 piece screw-on lids. Cool and let mellow several weeks or more before serving. ; name: ww 6 points roast beef sandwiches with caramelized onions ; ingredients: olive oil, vidalia onion, honey mustard, rye bread, roast beef ; preparation:Heat large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Swirl in the oil, then add the onion. Cook, stirring occasionally, until softened. Reduce heat to low and cook until onion is golden brown, about 20 minutes. Divide and spread the mustard on 3 sliced of bread. Layer the beef and onions over the top. Cover each with the other slice of bread. 6 points per sandwich. ; name: basil pesto lighter version ; ingredients: pine nuts, garlic, extra virgin olive oil, fresh basil leaves, parmesan cheese, salt ; preparation:Add nuts and garlic to blender and pulse until minced. Add olive oil, pulse a few time more. Add basil leaves, cheese, salt and blend until smooth. Scrape sides of blender as you go to make sure everthing mixes well. Serve with your favorite pasta. ; name: granny s rice pudding ; ingredients: cooked rice, eggs, sugar, milk, flour, margarine, vanilla ; preparation:

name: lolly s french toast casserole ; ingredients: butter, brown sugar, karo syrup, eggs, milk, challah ; preparation:In a saucepan, melt together, butter, brown sugar, karo syrup. Pour mixture into a 9-by-12 inch pyrex dish that has been greased with butter. Lay french bread slices 1 inch thick in dish. Mix eggs and milk. Pour mixture over the bread. Top with cinnamon. Soak overnight. In morning bake at 340 degrees for 45 min to 1 hour. ; name: elaine s rice pilaf ; ingredients: long grain rice, vermicelli, butter, chicken broth, salt, pepper ; preparation:Break vermicelli into 1 inch pieces. Melt butter in medium saucepan. Add vermicelli and stir until lightly browned. Add rice and chicken stock and stir to combine. Bring to a boil. Cover and cook over low heat 20 minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Enjoy. ; name: prawn and bacon fried rice ; ingredients: cooking spray, eggs, lean bacon, green onions, garlic clove, snow peas, prawns, cooked basmati rice, soy sauce ; preparation:Spray a hot non-stick wok with oil spray. Pour in eggs. Swirl to cover the base of the wok and cook until set. Remove from the wok. Roll up and slice. Set aside. Spray the wok again and add bacon, stir-frying for 4 to 5 minutes until golden. Add the green onions, garlic and snow peas and stir-fry a further 2 to 3 minutes. Add the prawns to the wok along with the rice, egg, and soy sauce. Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes or until hot. Serve immediately. ; name: baked rolled sole ; ingredients: breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese, fresh parsley, oregano, lemon zest, salt and pepper, flounder fillets, lemon juice, olive oil ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 400. In a small bowl, combine the bread crumbs, parmesan, parsley, oregano, lemon zest, salt and pepper. Place the fish, smooth side up, on a work surface. Sprinkle the mixture over the fish and roll up from one short end. Place the rolls seam-side down in a 9 inch square glass baking dish. Drizzle the lemon juice over the fish. Bake uncovered for 10 minutes or until the fish is just cooked through and the filling is hot. ; name: crunchy topped cod ; ingredients: cod fish fillets, tomatoes, whole wheat bread crumbs, fresh parsley, sunflower oil, lemon, salt and pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400. Arrange the cod fillets in a wide ovenproof dish. Arrange the tomato slices on top. Mix the bread crumbs, fresh parsley, oil, lemon zest and juice. Season to taste. Spoon the crumb mixture evenly over the fish, then bake for 15-20 minutes. Serve. ; name: zesty potato soup ; ingredients: potatoes, water, garlic clove, salt, pepper, milk, american cheese, chicken bouillon granule, butter, dried parsley ; preparation:In large sauce pan, combine first 5 ingrediants. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 15 minute do not drain-- mash potatoes in liquid until almost smooth. Add remaining ingredients. Cook until cheese is melted. Stir continuously. I sprinkle with crumbled bacon and shredded cheddar cheese. Enjoy. ; name: southwest chicken and bacon rollups ; ingredients: cream cheese spread, chunk chicken, bacon, salsa, 8-inch flour tortillas ; preparation:In a bowl, combine cream cheese, chicken, bacon and salsa. Gently stir until well combined. Spread chicken mixture on each tortilla. Roll up and wrap in plastic wrap. Refrigerate until serving time. To serve, cut tortillas into 1 inch pieces. If desired, serve with additional salsa for dipping. ; name: homemade chicken shake bake coating ; ingredients: fine breadcrumbs, flour, paprika, margarine, salt, poultry seasoning, pepper ; preparation:

name: chicken and chickpea salad ; ingredients: cooked chicken, cherry tomatoes, chickpeas, flat leaf parsley, red onion, feta, olive oil, lemon juice, baby spinach ; preparation:Combine chicken, tomatoes, chickpeas, parsley, onion and feta in a large bowl. Season with black pepper. Toss gently to combine. Whisk oil, juice and salt and pepper together in a small bowl until well combined. Add spinach to chicken, drizzle with dressing and toss again to combine. Serve with crusty bread. ; name: one for all marinated beef ; ingredients: orange juice, reduced sodium soy sauce, brown sugar, prepared mustard, canola oil, garlic cloves, beef flank steak ; preparation:In a large resealable plastic bag, combine the first six ingredients. Add flank steak. Seal bag and turn to coat. Refrigerate for 4 hours or overnight. Coat grill rack with nonstick cooking spray before starting the grill. Drain and discard marinade. Grill steak, covered, over medium heat for 6-8 minutes on each side or until meat reaches desired doneness. Let stand for 10 minutes before slicing. ; name: spicy tex mex chicken breasts ; ingredients: cumin, chili powder, garlic salt, boneless skinless chicken breast halves ; preparation:Heat grill to medium heat. In a small bowl mix together the spices and then sprinkle over both sides of the chicken. Spray the chicken with non stick cooking spray and place on preheated grill. Cover. Grill 7-10 minutes or until no longer pink in the center, turning once. Serve with avocado salsa or on a salad. I like to pound the chicken to an even thickness for faster and more even cooking. ; name: pumpkin bread from a cake mix ; ingredients: yellow cake mix, solid pack pumpkin, eggs, molasses, cinnamon, nutmeg, pecans, raisins ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Grease two 9x5-inch loaf pans. Combine all ingredients in a large bowl and mix well. Beat for an additional 2 minutes. Pour into pans and bake for an hour or till a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. ; name: red snapper with lemon butter ; ingredients: red snapper fillets, flour, salt and pepper, vegetable oil, butter, lemon juice, parsley ; preparation:Roll the fish lightly in flour mixed with salt and pepper. Heat oil in skillet. Cook fish until brown on both sides. Remove fish to platter and keep warm. To skillet add butter and lemon. Allow to simmer 1 minute. Pour over the fish. Sprinkle with parsley. ; name: crock baked soybeans ; ingredients: dried soybeans, water, yellow onion, light brown sugar, molasses, salt, dry mustard, toasted sesame oil ; preparation:Rinse beans in colander under cold water. Pick over for damaged beans and small stones. Transfer to the slow cooker. Cover with cold water by 2 inches, soak overnight, and drain. Cover with the 4 cups water. Cover and cook on high until tender, about 4 hours. The beans need to be covered with liquid at all times to cook properly. Drain the cooked beans and return to the slow cooker.
