Drain tomatoes, reserve some of the oil. Cut tomatoes into strips. Cook bacon in a skillet over medium high heat until crisp. Drain and crumble. Drain pasta and place in a large bowl. Add tomatoes and pesto. Toss. Add bacon and cheese. Toss. If necessary add the reserved oil. Season with pepper. ; name: two layer pecan pie ; ingredients: cream cheese, sugar, vanilla, egg, pecan pieces, eggs, light corn syrup, unbaked pie shell ; preparation:Beat bottom layer ingredients together until smooth. Pour into an unbaked pie shell. Mix top layer ingredients and pour gently over the cream cheese mixture. Bake in preheated 350 degree oven for 50 to 60 minutes. As it bakes, the bottom layer will rise to the top. ; name: okra in lemon butter ; ingredients: okra pods, butter, lemon juice, salt ; preparation:Wash okra weell. Trim stem end, leaving enough on the pod to keep the juice inches. Cover with boiling water and boil gently until tender, approximately 15 minutes. When half done add a little salt. To serve, drain very well, pour into a hot dish and add melted butter and lemon juice. ; name: stuffing coated chicken ; ingredients: seasoned stuffing mix, parmesan cheese, butter, garlic clove, boneless skinless chicken breast halves ; preparation:

name: creamy crock pot chicken with mushrooms ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, cream of mushroom soup, dry onion soup mix, cream cheese, onion, sliced mushrooms, garlic cloves, chicken broth, parsley flakes ; preparation:Grease the inside of the slow cooker. Place chicken breasts in the bottom of the crock pot. Combine the rest of the ingredients in a medium pot and heat on medium high. Stirring occasionally until cream cheese is incorporated. Pour sauce over chicken in crock pot, and heat on low approximately 4 hours until chicken is tender and falling apart. Sprinkle with parsley flakes. Serve over pasta, egg noodles, or rice. ; name: zingy jello salad ; ingredients: lemon jell-o gelatin, lime jell-o gelatin, boiling water, small curd cottage cheese, crushed pineapple in syrup, miracle whip ; preparation:Empty both boxes of jello into a large bowl and add boiling water. Stir to dissolve and let cool. Add miracle whip and beat to a smooth consistency. Add cottage cheese and pineapple with the syrup. Mix and refrigerate until set up. ; name: banana cookies ; ingredients: margarine, brown sugar, egg, baking powder, flour, banana, chocolate chips ; preparation:Pre heat oven to 350f. Cream together margrine and brown sugar. Add egg and beat. Then add baking powder and flour. Mash banana and add chocolate chips if using. Drop by teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheet and bake for 15 minutes ot until browned. ; name: parsnips with gorgonzola ; ingredients: parsnips, butter, green onions, gorgonzola, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:In a large pot of boiling water, cook parsnips whole in salted water until tender. This will take about 20 minutes. Drain, halve lengthwise. In a large skillet, melt butter over medium-high heat. Cook parsnips until lightly browned on both sides, about 5 - 8 minutes. In a lightly greased baking dish fit parnips snugly, arrange parsnips cut sides up. Sprinkle onions over top. Break cheese into pieces and distribute over the parsnips. Grind pepper over all. Bake 500f degrees until cheese is very lightly browned, 10 - 12 minutes. Serves 4 as a main course. 6 appetizers. ; name: caramelized french toast ; ingredients: butter, eggs, milk, salt, bread, brown sugar, water ; preparation:Melt two tablespoons of butter in a frying pan or skillet over medium high heat. Beat together eggs, milk and salt. Dip bread one at a time into egg mixture and fry until light brown and egg is cooked. After 4 slices of bread have been cooked, melt remaining 2 tablespoons butter. Cook remaining bread slices until light brown on both sides and egg is cooked. After all bread slices have been cooked and removed from pan, add brown sugar to pan. Stir until melted and sticky. Add water and stir. Place french toast in caramel sauce. Turn to coat, then remove from pan. Serve. ; name: tuna brandade ; ingredients: potatoes, skim milk, garlic cloves, shallot, tuna in water, white wine vinegar, olive oil, dill sprigs, crostini ; preparation:Peel and cut the potatoes into 1. 5cm cubes, place in a saucepan with milk, garlic and eschalot, then bring to the boil, reduce heat and simmer for 8-10 mins until potato is soft. Remove pan from heat, then add tuna to potato mixture. Mash gently with a fork but still leavequite chunky. Add the vinegar, oil and half the dill sprigs, then stir to combine. Serve on crostini with remaining dill. ; name: boat shrimp ; ingredients: butter, shrimp, onion, garlic salt, salt, basil, flour, vinegar ; preparation:Grab a cast iron pan. Set it on the stove. Melt butter on medium-high heat. Add shrimp and onion. Stir while cooking until shrimp are coated. Sprinkle on spices to taste. Sprinkle on flour. Turn and coat shrimp. Add enough water to make gravy. Add vinegar. Serve over rice. ; name: bbq herb garlic fish ; ingredients: miracle whip, dried marjoram, dried thyme, garlic, ground celery seed, fish fillet ; preparation:

name: low carb creamy onion pork chops ; ingredients: pork chops, salt and pepper, olive oil, onion, chicken bouillon cubes, hot water, sour cream ; preparation:Season pork chops to taste. Lightly brown pork chops in oil and place in crockpot. Top pork chops with onion slices in the crockpot. Dissolve boullion in hot water and pour over chops. Cook on low 7 to 8 hours. After the pork chops have cooked, stir sour cream into the cooking juices. Turn crockpot to high for about 30 minutes or until liquid is slightly thickened. ; name: super budget macaroni cheese ; ingredients: macaroni, milk, flour, salt, ground black pepper, cheese, fresh breadcrumb ; preparation:Cook pasta. Drain. Set aside. Warm milk in saucepan. When it is just warm to the touch, whisk in half the flour. Let the milk begin to simmer, whisking all the time. You be the judge of the thickness - we like it really thick. If you want it thicker, add the remaining flour and continue to whisk until smooth and thick. Stir through the cheese and the salt and pepper until the cheese is melted. Take off the heat. Pour into a baking dish and sprinkle the breadcrumbs over the top. Bake for 30 minutes at 180 degrees celcius. ; name: cucumbers with mint vinaigrette ; ingredients: cucumbers, olive oil, champagne vinegar, salt & freshly ground black pepper, of fresh mint ; preparation:Peel the cucumbers and slice them in half lengthwise. Scoop out the seeds with a spoon and discard. Cut the cucumbers into thin slices and combine in a bowl with the oil, vinegar, salt, and pepper. Marinate for at least 30 minutes in the refrigerator or at room temperature. Add the mint immediately before serving. ; name: creamy cauliflower pea medley ; ingredients: water, frozen cauliflower, frozen green peas, cucumber, ranch salad dressing, nonfat sour cream, dried dill weed ; preparation:Combine the first 3 ingredients in a saucepan. Bring to a boil. Cover and cook 5 minutes. Drain well. Combine the cauliflower mixture and the remaining ingredients in a bowl, and toss well. Serve warm or chilled. ; name: shrimp with orzo olives and feta ; ingredients: orzo pasta, shrimp, diced tomatoes, feta cheese, balsamic vinegar, lemon juice, scallion, dried oregano ; preparation:Cook orzo according to directions, drain well. In a large serving bowl, combine shrimp, tomatoes, cheese, vinegar, lemon juice, scallions, oregano, salt and pepper. Toss well. Add orzo and stir to mix. Garnish with kalamata olives, if desired. ; name: beer batter cheese bread ; ingredients: self-rising flour, granulated sugar, extra-sharp cheddar cheese, green onion, beer ; preparation:Pre-heat oven to 350-f degrees and thoroughly grease the inside of a single loaf pan. Reserve. In a large mixing bowl, sift flour and sugar together. Add grated cheddar cheese and chopped green onions. Thoroughly mix all ingredients together. Add beer and stir until the ingredients are uniformly moistened. Spoon bread dough mixture into a well-greased loaf pan. Bake for approximately 1 hour, or until the loaf is golden brown and emits a hollow sound when tapped. Cool on a wire rack, and store in an airtight container. May freeze for up to 90 days. Slice to serve. Simply sift together the ingredients and store at room temperature in an air-tight container. ; name: dutch leek soup ; ingredients: whole wheat flour, beef bouillon cubes, water, milk, ground mace, leeks, whipping cream, gouda cheese ; preparation:Blend together flour, bouillon cubes and water. Stir in milk and mace. Bring to a boil. Immediately reduce heat to simmer. Simmer 10 minutes. Add leeks and cream. Simmer 10 minutes. Serve cheese with soup at the table. ; name: simple roasted pears ; ingredients: bosc pears, butter, pumpkin pie spice, almonds ; preparation:

name: deep dish sour cream apple pie ; ingredients: 9-inch deep dish pie crust, flour, cooking apples, sour cream, brown sugar, egg yolks, butter, salt ; preparation:Use an unbaked 9-inch deep-dish pie shell, your own recipe or storebought. Sprinkle 1 tbsp of the flour in shell. Arrange apple slices in bottom. Preheat oven to 425f degrees. In a mixing bowl, combine sour cream, brown sugar, yolks, butter, salt and remaining 1 tbsp flour. Blend well and spoon over apples. Bake for 15 minutes, then reduce heat to 350f degrees and bake for 40 more minutes, or until apples are tender. ; name: nutella blondies ; ingredients: unsalted butter, eggs, demerara sugar, granulated sugar, kosher salt, vanilla, all-purpose flour, baking soda, baking powder, nutella ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 325 degrees. Line a 7x11 pan with parchment paper. In a pan, melt all the butter over medium heat, taking care that it doesnt burn. Set aside to cool slightly. In a mixing bowl, stir together the eggs, demerara sugar, and granulated sugar. Stir in the melted butter, salt, vanilla, flour, baking soda, and baking powder. Spoon the batter into the prepared pan in an even layer. Dollop the nutella over the surface of the batter, and swirl the. Bake for 25-30 minutes, checking frequently to make sure the blondies dont overbake. The blondies are done when the batter is puffed and golden, and is still a little moist in the middle. The blondies will collapse slightly once they come out of the oven, and will harden into slice-able pieces in about an hour. ; name: smoked salmon tea sandwiches with dill cream cheese ; ingredients: bread, unsalted butter, fresh dill, cream cheese, smoked salmon ; preparation:Spread one teaspoon of butter on one side of each slice of bread. Mix the dill into the cream cheese. Spread the cream cheese on the buttered sides of bread. Layer the salmon on the cream cheese on one slice of bread, and cover with other bread slice. Cut the sandwich on the diagonals to create four triangles. ; name: willy wonka bars ; ingredients: margarine, peanut butter, powdered sugar, graham crackers, chocolate chips ; preparation:Combine margarine, peanut butter, powdered sugar and graham crackers. Press mixture in pan. Melt chips and 2 tablespoons of margarine or milk. Spread over graham cracker crust. Refrigerate. Cut when cool. ; name: whole wheat rolls ; ingredients: whole wheat bread flour, white bread flour, salt, sugar, non-fat powdered milk, yeast, vegetable oil, egg, warm water ; preparation:Combine ingredients in the order your bread maker calls for on dough cycle. Check on dough half way through needing adding a bit more flour or water as needed so dough is fairly tacky. Turn out onto greased cutting board and work with greased hands. Shape into 15 rolls and place in greased 9x13 pan making 5 rows of 3. Let rise 30-45 minutes or until doubled in size. Bake at 350 for 15-20 minutes. ; name: asparagus crab dip ; ingredients: sour cream, cream cheese, asparagus spears, parmesan cheese, green onions, prepared horseradish, dijon mustard, crabmeat ; preparation:Combine sour cream, cream cheese and asparagus. Add parmesan cheese, onions, horseradish, mustard and crabmeat. Spread in ungreased 1 quart baking dish. Bake 375 20-25 mins till thoroughly heated. Serve warm with crackers and cut up fresh vegetables. ; name: bermuda johnny bread caribbean ; ingredients: sugar, flour, salt, baking powder, egg, milk, butter ; preparation:Mix sugar, flour, salt, and baking powder. Add egg and milk and mix until batter consistency. Melt butter in frying pan. Spoon a third of the batter into the pan. Fry on low heat until brown. Turn and brown the other side. Repeat twice with the remaining batter. Split bread in half and serve with plenty of butter and jam. ; name: sausage sweet potato bake ; ingredients: bulk sausage, sweet potatoes, apples, sugar, flour, ground cinnamon, salt, water ; preparation:

name: habanero jerk chicken ; ingredients: onion, dried thyme leaves, sugar, salt, ground nutmeg, tabasco sauce, boneless skinless chicken breasts, butter, vegetable oil ; preparation:Mix onion, thyme, sugar, salt, nutmeg and tabasco sauce in a small bowl. Remove fat from chicken and stab a couple of times with a fork. Spoon or rub seasoning mixture over both sides of each breast half and let it marinate for 20 minutes. Heat butter and oil in large skillet over medium heat. When bubbling, add chicken and cook for 5 to 10 minutes on each side until brown and cooked through. ; name: lazy man s version of pharris peanut cookies ; ingredients: peanut butter cookie dough, wheat flakes cereal, salted peanuts, unbleached cane sugar ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Break up cookie dough in a large mixing bowl. Stir in the crushed wheaties cereal. Stir in the chopped peanuts. Roll dough into 1-inch balls. Place sugar in separate small bowl. Dip balls in sugar. Place balls of cookie dough 2-3 inches apart on baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Flatten balls of cookie dough with the bottom of a glass. Bake cookies for 10-12 minutes, until edges are browned. Cool on wire rack. Store in air-tight container. ; name: spicy ginger orange chicken ; ingredients: orange marmalade, orange juice, fresh ginger, dijon mustard, tabasco sauce, salt & pepper, boneless skinless chicken breasts ; preparation:Heat oven to 350f. Blend together all the ingredients except the chicken. Brush the breasts all over with the marmalade mixture. Place in a baking dish lined with foil. Bake for 20-25 minutes until done, basting every 8 minutes. If there is any sauce left, heat, and serve along side the chicken. Serve. ; name: grilled ham cheese sandwich ; ingredients: bread, ham, cheese, butter ; preparation:Put butter on one side of each piece of bread. Put ham and cheese onto the bread then cook like you would grilled cheese. In a pan with butter, or stick on an electric grill. Cook on each side till brown. Open sandwich on side without cheese and add your condiments. ; name: frozen jello pops ; ingredients: boiling water, gelatin, sugar, water ; preparation:Stir boiling water into gelatin and sugar in medium bowl at 2 minutes until completely dissolved. Stir in cold water. Pour into pops molds or plastic or paper cups. Freeze about 2 hours or until almost firm. Insert wooden spoon or stick or plastic spoon into each for handle. Freeze 8 hours or overnight until firm. Press firmly on bottom of mold to release pop. Store leftover pops in freezer. ; name: stir fried chicken in black bean sauce ; ingredients: boneless chicken thighs, shallots, garlic cloves, black bean sauce, ginger and shallot sauce, vegetable oil, white pepper, rice ; preparation:Wash rice and steam in rice cooker. Season chicken with white pepper. Add ginger and shallot sauce and leave to marinate for 10 minutes. Heat 2 tbsps oil in a wok and lightly fry garlic over medium heat, until golden. Add chicken and brown on all sides, turning pieces over once or twice. Remove and drain off excess oil, leaving about 1 tbsp of the cooked oil in the wok. Fry the shallots until beginning to soften. Add black bean sauce and stir fry on high heat until sauce starts to bubble. Return chicken to wok and stir fry on high heat until cooked through. Serve immediately with steamed white rice. ; name: anise pears ; ingredients: water, sugar, lemon juice, anise seed, pears ; preparation:In a saucepan, combine water, sugar, lemon juice, and aniseed. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally. Add pears. When water returns to a boil, reduce heat slightly, cover saucepan, and simmer until pears are just tender, about 6 to 10 minutes. Cool slightly, then place in a shallow bowl and chill. ; name: zesty italian baked salmon ; ingredients: salmon fillets, italian dressing, tomatoes, sliced mushrooms, green onions ; preparation:

name: mushroom skewer ; ingredients: harissa, olive oil, balsamic vinegar, dried oregano, portabella mushrooms ; preparation:Whisk the harissa, olive oil, balsamic vinegar, and oregano together in a medium bowl. Add the halved mushrooms and toss well to coat. Marinate for 30 minutes. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit or. Preheat the grill, if grilling. Thread the mushrooms onto pre-soaked bamboo skewers. Roast them in the oven for 10-12 minutes, or grill them, 5 minutes per side. ; name: speedy chocolate drop candy ; ingredients: chocolate chips, chunky peanut butter, peanuts, crisp rice cereal ; preparation:Microwave the chocolate chips and peanut butter on high for 1 minute. Stir and continue to heat at 30 second intervals until completely melted. Stir in peanuts and cereal. Drop onto cookie sheets lined with waxed paper and place in freezer. Freeze for about 1 hour or until firm. Remove from pans and place in plastic storage containers. Keep refrigerated until ready to serve as they do melt quickly. This recipe is forgiving so you can easily change up the flavour of chocolate chips and nuts. ; name: cucumber carrot salad ; ingredients: cucumbers, seasoning salt, carrot, rice wine vinegar, sesame oil, sugar, red pepper flakes ; preparation:Combine cucumbers and salt in large mixing bowl. Toss to coat. Let stand at room temperature 15 minutes. Rinse salt off of cucumbers and return to bowl. Add carrot. In a small bowl mix together remaining ingredients. Pour over cucumber mixture and toss well to coat. Cover and refrigerate at least four hours. ; name: moist vegan cornbread ; ingredients: maple syrup, canola oil, plain soymilk, whole wheat flour, cornmeal, baking powder, kosher salt ; preparation:Heat oven to 350 degrees. Stir first three ingredients together. In another bowl whisk together the flour, cornmeal, baking powder and salt. Regular salt will work as well. Mix wet and dry ingredients together and pour into a greased 9x9 square pan. Bake for 35 minutes at 350, until tester comes out clean. ; name: porcupine meatballs w rice a roni ; ingredients: ground beef, rice-a-roni, egg, brown gravy mix ; preparation:Mix ground beef with egg and rice-a-roni, reserving seasoning packet. Shape into balls. Brown in frying pan, on all sides. Drain grease. Sprinkle seasoning packet on top. Mix brown gravy mix and pour on top. Cover and simmer for 15 minutes. Serve over mashed potatoes. ; name: strawberry cheese parfaits ; ingredients: cottage cheese, egg white, whipping cream, salt, vanilla, sugar, frozen strawberries ; preparation:Beat egg white until soft peaks are formed. Blend with cottage cheese, whipped cream, salt, vanilla, and sugar. In parfait gasses, alternate spoonfuls of cheese mixture with strawberries. Freeze. Remove from freezer 20 minutes before serving. ; name: sausage and green pea pie ; ingredients: olive oil, sweet italian turkey sausage, sun-dried tomato alfredo sauce, water, frozen green peas, refrigerated breadstick dough ; preparation:Heat the oil in a large skillet. Add sausage and crumble. Saute over medium heat until cooked through. Add pasta sauce, water, and peas and bring to a boil. Pour into a pie plate. Unroll and separate breadsticks. Place 6 of the breadsticks across the pie plate over the sausage mixture, twisting each one and spacing evenly. Place the remaining 6 breadsticks over the first in the opposite direction, creating a lattice pattern. Trim ends if needed. Bake at 375 degrees for 25 minutes. ; name: shrimp scampi low fat ; ingredients: medium shrimp, olive oil, fresh parsley, lemon juice, salt, green onions, garlic cloves, parmesan cheese ; preparation:

name: hot apple pie sandwiches ; ingredients: apples, cinnamon, white bread, medium cheddar, butter ; preparation:Combine apples and cinnamon. Place cheese on the outside of 4 slices of toast. Spoon apples onto cheese. Top with remaining bread slices. Brush outside with butter. Broil on each side until golden brown. ; name: kid friendly tuna noodle casserole ; ingredients: spaghetti noodles, condensed cream of mushroom soup, milk, tuna in water, onion, garlic cloves, cheddar cheese, parmesan cheese, salt and pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a large bowl, combine mushroom soup, milk, tuna, onions, garlic and cheddar cheddar cheese. Toss with cooked pasta. Transfer to greased 9-inch square casserole pan. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake uncovered for 30-45 minutes. ; name: easy skillet corn frittata ; ingredients: butter, green onion, corn, eggs, milk, oregano, pepper, tomatoes, green pepper, swiss cheese ; preparation:In 8 or 9- inch skillet, melt butter. Saute onions until tender. Stir in corn. In a medium bowl, combine eggs, milk. Pour egg mixture over vegetables. Cover. Cook over medium low heat for 10 to 12 minutes or until mixture is set. Arrange tomato and green pepper on top of cooked egg mixture, sprinkle with cheese. Cover and cook until cheese melts, about 5 minutes. Cut unto wedges to serve. ; name: blue stuffed mushrooms ; ingredients: blue cheese, cream cheese, half-and-half, mushrooms, pecan halves, fresh basil leaves ; preparation:In a medium bowl, combine the blue cheese and the cream cheese. Beat them together with an electric mixer so that they are smooth. Add the half & half and beat it in so that the mixture is fluffy. Fill the mushroom caps with the cheese mixture. Top each with a pecan half and a basil leaf. ; name: dirt cake ; ingredients: oreo cookies, cream cheese, powdered sugar, margarine, whipped topping, instant vanilla pudding, milk, vanilla ; preparation:Mix cream cheese, sugar, margarine and whipped topping. Set aside. Mix pudding, milk and vanilla according to pudding directions. Combine mixtures to make filling. Layer crumbs, filling, crumbs, etc. In 9 x 13 inch dish. Refrigerate overnight. ; name: lentil and ginger soup ; ingredients: red lentils, water, carrots, ginger, miso ; preparation:Rinse lentils and add to the pan with water. Bring to the boil and then reduce to a simmer for 15 minutes. Spoon off any scum or froth from the surface. Add the carrot and ginger and continue to cook for a further 15 minutes. Mix the miso paste in half a cup of water until smooth and pour into the soup. Return to the boil then turn off. Serve immediately. ; name: hot tuna buns ; ingredients: mayonnaise, sweet pickle relish, prepared mustard, tuna, cheddar cheese, celery, green onion, onion rolls ; preparation:In a bowl, stir together mayo, relish and mustard. Add tuna, cheese, celery and onions, stir until well combined. Spread tuna mixture evenly over bottom halves of rolls and top with remaining roll halves. Wrap each sandwich in foil. Place on a baking sheet into a pre-heated 350 oven for 15-20 minutes or until cheese is melted. Unwrap and serve immediately. ; name: baked leek casserole ; ingredients: butter, leeks, eggs, flour, nutmeg, milk, paprika, salt, black pepper ; preparation:

name: weight watchers grilled green shrimp ; ingredients: parsley, basil, garlic cloves, extra virgin olive oil, salt, fresh ground pepper, large shrimp ; preparation:To prepare the marinade, combine the parsley, basil, garlic, oil, salt and pepper in a zip-close plastic bag. Add the shrimp. Refrigerate, turning the bag occasionally, 1 hour to overnight. Spray a nonstick ridge grill pan with nonstick spray and set over medium-high heat. Working in batches, if necessary, grill the shrimp until they are just opaque in the center and lightly browned on the outside, 2-3 minutes on each side. ; name: bed and breakfast sausage egg casserole ; ingredients: sausage, eggs, milk, salt, dry mustard, bread, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Brown sausage and drain. Beat the eggs with milk, salt, and mustard. Layer bread cubes in the bottom of a buttered 9 by 13-inch casserole dish. Crumble the sausage over the bread and top with cheese. Pour the egg mixture over all. Refrigerate overnight. Bake in 350 degree oven for 30-40 minutes. When using a glass casserole, bake in 325 degree oven for 45-60 minutes. This is really good with a little bit of maple syrup on top. ; name: sauteed pear salad ; ingredients: boston lettuce, olive oil, bosc pears, cider vinegar, dijon mustard, sugar, salt, black pepper ; preparation:In large serving bowl, place lettuce. In 12-inch nonstick skillet, heat oil on medium-heat 1 minute. Add pears and cook 10 to 15 minutes or until they begin to soften and turn golden. Meanwhile, in cup, stir vinegar, dijon mustard, sugar, salt, and pepper. Add vinegar mixture to pears in skillet, and cook 1 minute or until liquid begins to thicken. Pour pears and liquid from skillet into bowl with lettuce, toss to coat. Serve immediately. ; name: hot chocolate espresso ; ingredients: hot coffee, sugar, cream, unsweetened cocoa, whipped cream, milk chocolate, cinnamon stick ; preparation:In 2 large cups or glass mugs, mix the coffee and sugar. In a small saucepan over low heat, warm the cream. Add the cocoa and mix well. Add the cream mixture to the coffee and top with a dollop of whipped cream and the grated chocolate. Serve with a cinnamon stick. ; name: mexican chicken tortilla skillet ; ingredients: olive oil, boneless skinless chicken breast, campbells condensed creamy verde soup, water, mexicorn, 8-inch flour tortillas, cheese ; preparation:Heat oil in a skillet over medium high heat. Cook chicken until browned stirring often. When done cut into strips. Place back into skillet and add soup, water, corn& tortillas. Bring to a boil. Cover, cook over low heat for 5 minutes or until hot. Top with cheese and serve. ; name: hausfreunde friends of the house cookies ; ingredients: eggs, sugar, baking chocolate, almonds, raisins, flour, baking powder, milk, powdered sugar ; preparation:Preheat oven to 300 degrees. Beat the eggs with the sugar till foamy. Add the remaining ingredients one by one, ending with the flour and baking powder together. Spread dough into a large greased 11 inch baking pan. Bake for 28-32 minutes. The top should look dry and crusty with some nice cracks. When done, ice with a mixture of milk and powdered sugar. Let cool 2 hours or more and cut into small squares. Stored in a cookie tin and refrigerated, these bars keep for quite a while. ; name: calzone with three cheeses ; ingredients: pizza crusts, romano cheese, ricotta cheese, fontina cheese, prosciutto ham, basil, pepper, garlic clove ; preparation:Roll dough into a 14-inch square and cut into quarters. Sprinkle each quarter with 1 t romano cheese. In a bowl combine the remaining ingredients and spoon one quarter of each mixture onto center of each dough square. Bring corners of dough up over cheese. Pinch seams to seal. Place on ungreased cookie sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake 15 minutes at 450 degrees. ; name: quick pickled ginger ; ingredients: fresh ginger, salt, sugar, rice vinegar, water ; preparation:

name: salmon burgers ; ingredients: salmon, lemon juice, dijon-style mustard, dry breadcrumbs, green onion, egg whites ; preparation:Drain and flake salmon. Combine lemon juice and mustard. Blend flaked salmon with breadcrumbs, green onions, and lemon juice-mustard mixture. Mix in egg whites until well blended. Form mixture into 4 patties and cook on a lightly oiled grill or saut in skillet until golden brown on both sides. Serve each burger on a bun with lettuce, tomato slices. ; name: illusion from fiji ; ingredients: vodka, midori melon liqueur, triple sec, lime juice, lemonade ; preparation:Pour vodka, midori, triple sec and lime juice in a shaker with ice. Shake and strain in a tulip glass with ice or in an empty pineapple. Complete with lemonade. Stir and garnish with slices of melon, lemon and cherries on a stick. Serve with long straws. ; name: basic garam masala indian spice ; ingredients: cinnamon, bay leaves, cumin seeds, coriander seeds, green cardamom seeds, black peppercorns, cloves, ground mace ; preparation:Break the cinnamon sticks into pieces. Crumble the bay leaves. Heat a heavy frying pan and after 2-3 minutes put in the whole spices. Dry roast over a medium heat until the color darkens, stirring or shaking the pan frequently to prevent burning. Leave to cool, then grind and blend with the mace. In an airtight container, the mixture will keep for 3-4 months. To make a mild and subtle moghul masala, use only green cardamoms, cinnamon, black peppercorns, mace and a few cloves. For a hot gujerati masala, add sesame seeds, fennel seeds, ajowan seeds and chiles. For a mildish kashmiri masala, use black cumin seeds, green cardamoms, black peppercorns, cloves, cinnamon, mace, and add a little grated nutmeg. For a hot parsi dhansak masala, add fenugreek seeds, mustard seeds, chiles and ground turmeric, and double the amount of coriander seeds. ; name: cucumber basil martini ; ingredients: sugar, hot water, fresh ginger, cucumber, basil leaves, gin, fresh lime juice, ice ; preparation:In a small bowl, dissolve the sugar in the hot water. Press the grated ginger through a fine strainer set over the bowl, releasing the juice. In a cocktail shaker, muddle the diced cucumber with the 2 torn basil leaves. Add the ginger syrup, gin, lime juice and a handful of ice. Shake well, then strain into a martini glass. Garnish the martini with a cucumber slice and the remaining whole basil leaf and serve. ; name: nutty carrot cumin soup ; ingredients: onions, garlic cloves, carrots, celery, low-sodium vegetable bouillon granules, cumin, water, ground almonds, black pepper ; preparation:Bring onions, garlic, carrots, celery, stock and water to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until vegetables are tender. Remove from heat, strain vegetables. Blend vegetables in a food processor or blender until smooth. Stir in ground almonds and enough stock to make desired soup consistency. Add cumin and black pepper. ; name: perfect pulled pork ; ingredients: boneless pork butt, smoked paprika, black pepper, cayenne, dried thyme, garlic powder, salt, water, sandwich buns ; preparation:Combine all the seasonings in a small bowl and rub evenly over roast. Place meat in a 6-quart slow cooker. Add water. Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours or high for 4-5 hours or until pork is very tender. Remove pork to a large cutting board or platter and let rest for 10-15 minutes. Pull, slice or chop to serve. Serve in buns with barbecue sauce. ; name: pastrami and pickle pan fried sandwich ; ingredients: mayonnaise, dijon mustard, rye bread, butter, swiss cheese, dill pickles, pastrami ; preparation:Place the mayonnaise and custard in a bowl and mix well to combine. Spread one side of each slice of bread with butter and the other side with the maonnaise mixture. Divide the cheese, pickle and pastrami between 4 slices of bread, ensuring the buttered side is on the outside, and sandwich with the remaining bread, once again ensuring buttered side is on the outside. Heat a large non stick frying pan over low heat. Cook the sandwiches, in batches for 3-4 minutes each side or until golden and cheese is melted. ; name: country women s association delicious date and ginger cake ; ingredients: dried dates, soft brown sugar, crystallized ginger, butter, bicarbonate of soda, self-raising flour, egg ; preparation:

name: mom s fried green tomatoes ; ingredients: green tomatoes, flour, salt, pepper, oil ; preparation:Slice the green tomatoes in thin slices. Dip the tomatoes in the flour. Heat the oil until hot. Fry until golden brown on each side making sure to season each side with salt & pepper. Remove from the oil when browned and season again with salt & pepper. ; name: orange soak cake ; ingredients: orange cake mix, water, vegetable oil, eggs, powdered sugar, orange juice, butter ; preparation:Just add 1 tbs of orange extract and 1 tbs grated orange peel to the batter before mixing preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease and flour a 13x9-inch pan. Prepare and bake cake mix according to package directions. While cake is baking, combine powdered sugar, orange juice, melted butter, and water in a medium bowl. When cake is done, remove from oven and immediately poke holes in top with a fork or toothpick. Pour glaze slowly over top of hot cake, allowing it to soak in. Cool completely on a wire rack. ; name: buttered herb noodles ; ingredients: egg noodles, water, salt, butter, fresh parsley, fresh chives, fresh rosemary, pepper ; preparation:Cook noodles in boiling water and salt in dutch oven for 10-12 min, stirring occasionally, until tender but firm. Drain well. Turn into large bowl. Add remaining 6 ingredients. Toss until well coated. ; name: ww 3 points bean cheese nachos ; ingredients: baked corn tortilla chips, fat-free refried beans, reduced-fat monterey jack cheese, salsa ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Layer tortilla chips on ovenproof platter or baking sheet. Spread beans evenly over chips and sprinkle with cheese. Bake until beans are hot and cheese is melted, about 5 minutes. Top with salsa. ; name: penne with chicken and pesto ; ingredients: penne pasta, butter, olive oil, boneless skinless chicken breast halves, garlic cloves, salt and pepper, heavy cream, pesto sauce, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente. Drain. Heat butter and oil in large skillet over medium heat. Saute chicken and garlic until chicken is almost cooked through. Reduce heat and stir in salt, pepper, cream, pesto, and parmesan cheese. Cook until chicken is no longer pink inside,. Stir in cooked pasta. ; name: peanut brittle ; ingredients: sugar, white corn syrup, dry roasted salted peanut, butter, vanilla, baking soda ; preparation:In 2 quart microwave safe bowl stir together the sugar & corn syrup. Microwave on high for 4 minutes. Stir in peanuts and microwave on high for another 4 minutes. Add butter & vanilla, stirring well. Microwave on high for additional 2 minutes. Stir in baking soda until light and foamy. Quickly pour mixture onto a lightly greased cookie sheet or slab marble. Let cool for 1 hour - break into pieces and store in tight container. ; name: kabocha spinach soup ; ingredients: kabocha squash, onion, garlic, water, baby spinach leaves, sea salt, pepper, sour cream, crusty bread ; preparation:Bring kabocha squash, onion, and garlic to a boil in 4 cups of water or stock. Simmer at a low boil until squash is completely soft, about 15 minutes. Mash the squash, onion, and garlic with a potato masher in the soup pot. Add the spinach and cook for just a couple more minutes. Season to taste with sea salt and pepper. Garnish with organic sour cream, mozzarella cheese, or crumbled feta. Serve with a thick slice of crusty bread for a warm, satisfying meal. ; name: turkish pilaf ; ingredients: butter, green bell pepper, sliced mushrooms, tomatoes, long-grain rice, garlic powder, salt, pepper, condensed chicken broth, water ; preparation:

name: l m prawns ; ingredients: oil, hot chili peppers, lemon, juice of, garlic clove, parsley, salt, prawns ; preparation:Mix all ingredients except prawns. Pour half of mixture into another bowl to reserve for use as a sauce. Marinate prawns with rest of mixture for at least a few hours or longer. Remove prawns and set aside. Pour the used marinade into a pan and quickly bring to a boil on the stove. Thread the prawns on skewers. Cook over hot grill, turning once and basting with the cooked marinade until pink and done,. Serve immediately with the reserved sauce for dipping. ; name: roast beef bruschetta ; ingredients: french baguette, olive oil, plum tomatoes, chive & onion cream cheese, roast beef, fresh coarse ground black pepper, green onions ; preparation:Heat oven to 375 degrees. Brush both sides of bread slices with oil. Place on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake about 5 minutes or until crisp. Cool 5 minutes. Meanwhile, cut each tomato into 6 slices. Set aside. Spread cream cheese over each bread slice. Top with beef. Sprinkle with pepper. Top with tomato slices and onion. ; name: marcy s noodle kugel ; ingredients: eggs, sugar, salt, apples, margarine, vanilla, cinnamon, apricot jam, wide egg noodles ; preparation:Cook and drain noodles. Place in large bowl. Add all ingredients, except jam. Mix well. Add jam and mix thoroughly. Place in baking dish. Add more jam, if you want. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes, or until lightly browned. ; name: marinara marcaroni salad ; ingredients: salad macaroni, mayonnaise, chili powder, marinara sauce, sweet pickle relish, celery, onion, olive, salt and pepper ; preparation:Boil macaroni to al dente. Rinse with cold water and set aside to dry. Combine mayo, marinara, relish, celery, onion and olives. Add macaroni to mixture. Add salt and pepper to taste. Refrigerate 3-4 hours. ; name: broccoli pasta salad ; ingredients: medium pasta shells, mayonnaise, white vinegar, sugar, broccoli florets, red onion, golden raisin, bacon, sunflower seeds ; preparation:Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and rinse under cold running water. Combine mayonnaise, vinegar and sugar in mixing bowl. Mix well. Add pasta, broccoli, onion, raisins, bacon and sunflower seeds. Mix gently. Cover. Refrigerate at least 2 hours to allow flavors to blend. ; name: breakfast bagel sandwich ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, eggs, hot sauce, provolone cheese, turkey, bagels ; preparation:Heat oil in a medium skillet over medium. Add onion and cook until softened, stirring occasionally, about 3 minutes. Whisk eggs and hot sauce in a small bowl. Add to hot skillet and cook until eggs set, about 2 minutes. Top with cheese and cook until melted, about 1 minute. Place egg mixture evenly over 4 bagel halves. Top with remaining bagel halves and serve. ; name: big moist banana bread ; ingredients: sugar, shortening, eggs, milk, banana, flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, walnuts ; preparation:Mix together sugar, shortenign and eggs. Stir in milk and bananas. Sift together and stir in flour, baking powder, soda and salt. Blend in chopped nuts. Pour into well greased 9 x 5 x3 inch pan. Let stand for 20 minutes before baking. Bake at 350 degrees until it tests done. ; name: southern style spinach ; ingredients: frozen spinach, bacon, brown sugar, onion, garlic cloves, jalapenos, apple cider vinegar, salt, black pepper ; preparation:

name: garlic dill rice ; ingredients: minced garlic cloves, olive oil, rice, chicken broth, dill weed, salt, onion powder ; preparation:In a large skillet, saute garlic in hot olive oil until softened. Add rice and saute for 2 minutes over high heat. Add broth and seasonings and bring back to a boil. Lower heat, cover and simmer for 20 minutes or until done. Fluff and mix rice and allow to stand uncovered for a few minutes before serving. ; name: picante chicken ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breast halves, picante sauce, brown sugar, prepared mustard, cooking spray, cooked rice ; preparation:Place chicken in a shallow 2 quart baking dish sprayed with nonstick cooking spray. In a small bowl, combine the picante sauce, brown sugar and mustard. Pour over chicken. Bake, uncovered at 400 degrees for 30 to 35 minutes or until juices from the chicken run clear. Serve over rice. ; name: bacon fried carrots ; ingredients: carrots, onions, pepper, sugar, accent seasoning, bacon ; preparation:Peel carrots, cut in half and slice lengthwise. Chop onion into small pieces. Cook bacon until crisp. Remove and blot. Using all the bacon grease, add carrots, onions and seasonings. Mix well and cook covered on low heat for 15-20 minutes. Cook uncovered about 45 minutes or until lightly browned. Stir occasionally. Crumble bacon and add to carrots. ; name: 4 cheese spinach dip ; ingredients: cream cheese, garlic powder, parmesan cheese, romano cheese, sweet red pepper, green onion, frozen chopped spinach, medium cheddar, cayenne pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f. Mix first 4 ingredients with hand or stand mixer on medium until softened and well mixed. Add next two ingredients and mix on med-low until just incorporated. Add spinach and mix on low until just incorporated. Transfer mixture to a small ovenproof dish and sprinkling cayenne on top to taste. Top with cheddar. Bake for 15 - 18 minutes or until bubbling around the edges. Remove from oven and allow to set for 5 - 7 minutes before serving. Serve with fried or baked pita wedges and tortilla chips. ; name: broccoli and tortellini salad ; ingredients: bacon, cheese-filled tortellini, mayonnaise, white sugar, cider vinegar, fresh broccoli, raisins, sunflower seeds, red onion ; preparation:Place bacon in a large, deep skillet. Cook over medium high heat until evenly brown. Drain, crumble and set aside. Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook tortellini in boiling water for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente. Drain, and rinse under cold water. In a small bowl, mix together mayonnaise, sugar and vinegar to make the dressing. In a large bowl, combine broccoli, tortellini, bacon, raisins, sunflower seeds and red onion. Pour dressing over salad, and toss. ; name: pork teriyaki ; ingredients: teriyaki sauce, water, all-purpose flour, pork tenderloin, vegetable oil, cooked rice ; preparation:In a small bowl, combine teriyaki sauce mix and water until dissolved. Set aside. Place flour in a large resealable plastic bag. Add pork and shake to coat. In a large skillet, brown pork in oil until juices run clear. Add teriyaki sauce. Bring to a boil. Cook and stir for 1-2 minutes or until slightly thickened. Serve with rice. ; name: cool raspberry soup ; ingredients: frozen raspberries, water, white wine, cranberry-raspberry juice, sugar, cinnamon, whole cloves, lemon juice, raspberry yogurt ; preparation:In a blender, puree raspberries, water and wine. Pour into a large saucepan, add the cranberry-raspberry juice, sugar, cinnamon and cloves. Bring just to the boil over a medium heat. Strain into a large bowl, and let cool. Whisk in the lemon juice and yogurt, then chill several hours before serving. ; name: brussels sprouts with balsamic vinegar ; ingredients: fresh brussels sprouts, olive oil, garlic, yellow onion, balsamic vinegar, butter, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:

name: healthy egg salad sandwich ; ingredients: hard-boiled eggs, scallions, dijon mustard, lettuce, whole grain bread, salt and pepper ; preparation:With the back of a fork, mash egg yolk with mustard to make a thick paste. Stir in chopped scallions and chopped egg white. Mix in salt and pepper as desired. Divide mixture on top of 2 slices of bread. Top with lettuce leaves, and cover with remaining slices of bread. Makes 2 sandwiches. ; name: broccoli and cauliflower gratin ; ingredients: broccoli florets, cauliflower florets, mayonnaise, cheddar cheese, parmesan cheese, green onions, dijon mustard, ground red pepper, breadcrumbs, oregano ; preparation:Steam broccoli and cauliflower until crisp-tender. Drain. Put in greased 9x9 oven proof baking dish. Mix up next five ingredients and pour over veggies. Sprinkle with bread crumbs and crumble oregano over. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until brown. ; name: honey garlic meatloaf ; ingredients: ground beef, egg, dry breadcrumbs, honey, lemon pepper seasoning, garlic cloves, ketchup ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease an 8x10 glass baking dish. Set aside. In a bowl, combine all ingredients then transfer to bakind dish. Top with desired amount of ketchup. Bake at 350 for 1. 25 hours. Let stand for 3-5 minutes before serving. ; name: new england scalloped oysters and scallops ; ingredients: butter, breadcrumbs, oyster, celery seed, salt and pepper, cream, scallops ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f. Mix the melted butter and bread crumbs together and put one third of them in a thin layer in the bottom of a buttered baking dish. Cover with half of the oysters and seasonings. Add some of the cream. Layer half of the scallops next, seasonings, and another third of buttered crumbs. Add the remaining oysters and cream. Top with the final half of scallops and top with remaining buttered crumbs. Bake for 30 minutes. Serve hot. ; name: kickn quesadillas ; ingredients: cheese, vegetables, hot sauce, chicken, garlic, jalapeno, tortillas ; preparation:Take your tortillas and drop in all of your ingredients on top of it. Cheese will normally go first. If you would like to add your hot sauce, drop a tsp. Of it on top of every thing. Put into a hot pan and let cook until cheese starts to melt. Next add your second tortilla on top and flip. Let cook for about 3-8 minutes until serving. ; name: quick easy tuscan bean soup ; ingredients: baby carrots, onion, olive oil, cannellini beans, reduced-sodium chicken broth, dried italian seasoning, baby spinach, cracked black pepper ; preparation:In a dutch oven, cook and stir carrots and onion in 1 tablespoon olive oil over medium-high heat 3 minutes. Add beans, broth and seasoning. Bring to boiling. Slightly mash beans. Reduce heat. Simmer, uncovered, 8 minutes, stirring occasionally. Meanwhile, in large skillet, heat remaining oil over medium-high heat. Add spinach and toss 1-2 minutes, just until wilted. Remove from heat. Ladle soup, top with the spinach and sprinkle with the pepper. ; name: three cheese garlic bubble bread ; ingredients: frozen dinner rolls, asiago cheese, cheddar cheese, parmesan cheese, butter, garlic powder, garlic clove ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 9x13 pan with cooking spray. Put thawed rolls in pan and cover with plastic wrap sprayed with cooking spray. Let rise for 1 hour. Melt butter in microwave with cracked clove of garlic. Mix cheeses together in a bowl. Remove garlic clove from butter. Dip each roll in butter then roll it around in the cheese mixture. Put each roll back in pan and sprinkle entire top with garlic powder. Sprinkle any remaining cheeses over top of rolls. Bake at 350 for about 30-45 min or until golden brown. ; name: how to make your own sunflower seed butter ; ingredients: sunflower seeds, sunflower oil, sugar, sea salt ; preparation:

name: cherry tomato crisp ; ingredients: sandwich bread, parmesan cheese, fresh parsley, olive oil, garlic, sea salt, fresh pepper, cherry tomatoes ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Put the first 7 ingredients into a food processor bowl. Pulse until bread is very coarsely chopped, 4-6 times. Grease an 8 inch square baking dish and arrange the cherry tomatoes in a single layer. Sprinkle with the bread crumb mixture. Bake until crust is browned and tomatoes are tender, about 20 minutes. ; name: a homemade sundae ; ingredients: vanilla ice cream, hersheys chocolate syrup, chocolate ice cream, marshmallow creme, nuts, whipped cream ; preparation:In tall sundae glass start with a drizzle of chocolate syrup. Place 1 scoop vanilla ice cream and drizzle liberally with chocolate syrup. Place 1 scoop chocolate ice cream next and add generous scoop of marshmallow creme. Sprinkle with 1-2 tablespoons finely chopped assorted nuts. Garnish with canned whipped cream around the edge only. For best results, gently warm the chocolate syrup and marshmallow creme before placing in sundae. ; name: overnight eggnog french toast ; ingredients: eggs, half-and-half, sugar, nutmeg, vanilla, rum extract, french bread, powdered sugar ; preparation:Grease two 15x10 inch baking pans. In a large bowl combine the eggs, half-and-half, sugar, nutmeg, vanilla and rum extract. Beat until well blended arrange bread slices in greased baking pans. Pour egg mixture over the bread in the pans. Lift and move bread slices until all egg mixture is absorbed. Cover with foil and refrigerate overnight or freeze up to 1 week. Heat oven to 500 degrees. Remove pans from refrigerator or freezer. Remove foil. Bake one pan at a time for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Sprinkle with powdered sugar. ; name: so easy cheese sauce microwave ; ingredients: butter, all-purpose flour, half-and-half cream, tabasco sauce, cheddar cheese, ground black pepper ; preparation:In a large microwave-safe bowl microwave the butter for 30 seconds on high. Add in the warmed cream or milk, tabasco and flour. Whisk vigorously until completely combined. Add in the shredded cheddar cheese. Microwave on high for about 2 minutes removing a few times during cooking to stir. Cook until the cheese has melted and the mixture is thick. If desired season with ground black pepper to taste. ; name: sage rub for roast turkey ; ingredients: turkey, butter, salt, pepper, rubbed sage, paprika ; preparation:Clean turkey, removing giblets. Pat dry and put aside. Combine the butter, salt, pepper, sage, and paprika. Rub the sage mixture over the outside and inside of the turkey. Truss turkey as usual. Bake turkey at 350f until meat thermometer reads 180f. Baste the turkey occasionally with drippings. Cover loosely with foil if turkey browns too quickly. ; name: maple and orange glazed chicken ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, plain flour, salt and pepper, olive oil, maple syrup, whole grain mustard, orange, zest of, orange, juice of, soy sauce ; preparation:Pick any visible fat from off the chicken and wash and dry. Dredge the pieces of chicken in the seasoned flour, patting to remove excess flour. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet. Pan fry the chicken, presentation side first, in the hot olive oil until nicely browned on both sides. While the chicken is browning, combine the remaining ingredients in a measuring cup. Remove the browned chicken from the pan and place in a shallow casserole dish. Add the sauce ingredients, scraping to deglaze the pan, then pour over the chicken in the dish. Bake in a 350f oven for 20 minutes until nicely glazed and the chicken is cooked through. ; name: crackling cornbread ; ingredients: yellow cornmeal, all-purpose flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, milk, eggs, butter, pork rinds ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Grease 8x8 inch sqare baking pan. In a large bowl, stir together the cornmeal, flour, baking powder, and salt. Set aside. In another large bowl, beat together the milk, eggs, and butter. Add the cornmeal-flour mixture and stir until just combined. Stir in the pork rinds. Pour into the prepared pan and bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in the pan and cut into 9 squares. ; name: mel s caramel corn ; ingredients: microwave popcorn, nuts, butter, vanilla, corn syrup, sugar ; preparation:

name: strawberry n cream roll ups ; ingredients: strawberry preserves, cream cheese, refrigerated crescent dinner rolls, powdered sugar ; preparation:Add the preserves and cream cheese to a small bowl. Stir to mix well. Separate the crescent roll dough into 8 triangles. Spread the cream cheese mixture evenly over each triangle. Roll up each triangle from the wide end to the point and place seam side down on an ungreased cookie sheet. Curve into crescents. Bake at 375 for 12-15 minutes or until golden. Let cool slightly. Sprinkle with powdered sugar and serve warm. ; name: sweet mango preserves ; ingredients: mangoes, red chile, gingerroot, lemons, juice and zest of, water, light brown sugar, sultanas, balsamic vinegar ; preparation:Place the mangoes, chilies, and ginger in a large pan. Add the lemon rind and juice, and stir in the water. Bring to a boil, and simmer for 20 minutes. Add the sugar, and heat gently until the sugar has completely dissolved. Bring to a boil, and boil for 10 minutes or until a thick consistency is reached. Stir in the sultanas and balsamic. Cook for an additional 5 minutes. Let cool slightly, and pour into warm sterilized jars. Seal according to manufacturers directions. ; name: danish aebleskiver ; ingredients: egg whites, all-purpose flour, baking powder, white sugar, baking soda, salt, butter, buttermilk, vegetable oil ; preparation:Beat the egg whites until stiff. In a separate bowl, mix together the flour, baking powder, salt, baking soda, sugar, melted butter and buttermilk at one time and beat until smooth. Gently fold in the egg whites last. Put about 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in the bottom of each aebleskiver pan cup and heat until hot. Pour in about 2 tablespoons of the batter into each cup. As soon as they get bubbly around the edge, turn them quickly. Continue cooking, turning the ball to keep it from burning. ; name: tomato treat 3 ; ingredients: pita bread, pesto sauce, cheese, tomatoes, fresh ground pepper, salt, onion ; preparation:Spread pesto on flatbread, english muffin or split crusty roll. Top with your favourite shredded cheese. Add thick slices of tomato. Sprinkle with salt and freshly ground pepper. Top with thinly sliced onion. Broil about 6 inches from heat until tomato is soft and cheese is melted. About 5 minutes. Serve immediately. ; name: just plain carrot cake ; ingredients: eggs, vegetable oil, sugar, vanilla, flour, ground cinnamon, baking soda, salt, baking powder, carrots ; preparation:Combine eggs, oil, sugar, and vanilla. Mix well. In a separate bowl, combine and mix dry ingredients. Add to wet mixture, mixing well. Stir in finely crated carrot. Pour batter into 13x9 cake pan that has been sprayed with nonstick cooking spray. Bake at 350 degrees for 50-60 minutes. Allow to cool before frosting with your favorite cream cheese frosting. ; name: tropical punch sugar free ; ingredients: sugar-free strawberry gelatin, hot water, lemon juice, pineapple juice, bananas, equal sugar substitute, water, sugar free 7-up, strawberry ; preparation:Dissolve jell-o in hot water. Mash bananas in bowl. Add jell-o and remaining ingredients, except 7-up. Chill. Garnish with strawberries or other fresh fruit. Before serving add chilled 7-up. ; name: spinach feta orzo ; ingredients: garlic clove, red pepper, olive oil, orzo pasta, chicken broth, dry white wine, fresh spinach, feta cheese, salt ; preparation:Saute garlic and pepper flakes in olive oil in a large saucepan for 30 seconds over medium heat. Add orzo, stirring 2 minutes to coat with oil to prevent sticking. Add chicken broth and wine. Cover, reduce heat to low and cook 10 minutes. Add spinach and feta to the hot pasta to wilt the spinach. Season with salt to taste. ; name: cheddar cheese pie quiche ; ingredients: sharp cheddar cheese, flour, eggs, milk, cooked ham, salt, pepper, unbaked 9-inch pie shell ; preparation:

name: bratwurst kabobs ; ingredients: light soy sauce, frozen apple juice concentrate, hot mustard, bratwursts, onion, yellow squash, red pepper, green pepper, skewers ; preparation:Soak wooden skewers in water at least 30 minutes before placing on the grill. In a resealable plastic bag or bowl, combine soy sauce, apple juice and hot mustard. Add onions, yellow squash and peppers and refrigerate for one hour. Drain and reserve marinade. Thread bratwurst and vegetables alternately on skewers. Brush with reserved marinade. Grill over medium heat, turn and baste often, until vegetables are soft and bratwurst is cooked, approximately 15 to 20 minutes. ; name: red onion borscht ; ingredients: butter, red onions, beets, red wine vinegar, flour, chicken broth, port wine, salt & freshly ground black pepper, sour cream, fresh chives ; preparation:Melt butter in a large pot, add onions, beets and vinegar. Cook vegetables over low heat, 25-30 minutes or until soft. Add flour, cook and stir 1-2 minutes until flour is incorporated. Remove pot from heat, gradually add broth while stirring. Return pot to stove, increase heat to medium high and bring to a boil. Reduce heat, simmer 10 minutes, add port and season with salt and pepper. Ladle into soup bowls and top with sour cream and chives. ; name: turnaround turkey and rice ; ingredients: butter, celery, onion, cooked turkey, water, turkey gravy mix, milk, flour, season-all salt ; preparation:In a saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Add celery and onion and cook for 5 minutes or until tender, stirring occassionally. Add cooked turkey. Blend water, gravy mix, milk, flour, and season-all. Pour over turkey mixture. Stir. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 5 minutes. Serve over rice. ; name: blueberries n cream jello ; ingredients: sugar-free blackberry gelatin, boiling water, blueberries, crushed pineapple in juice, cream cheese, splenda granular, sour cream, vanilla extract, pecans ; preparation:Dissolve gelatin in boiling water. Drain the blueberries and pineapple, reserving 1 cup of liquid. Stir blueberries, pineapple and juice into the dissolved gelatin. Pour into a 2 quart jello mold. Refrigerate until firm. Mix together the cream cheese, splenda, sour cream and vanilla until fluffy. Carefully spread over the jello. Sprinkle the pecans over the cream cheese layer. Refrigerate for approximately 30 more minutes. Invert and serve immediately. ; name: salmon paprikish ; ingredients: fresh salmon, paprika, oil, mushrooms, butter, garlic, sour cream, lemon juice ; preparation:Dredge salmon in paprika. Place in hot oil skin side down. Fry for about 2-4 minutes turn, fry til cooked, 2 to 4 minutes. While salmon is cooking, saute mushrooms, garlic, in butter in separate pan. In bowl, mix sour cream, lemon juice or wine together. To serve place salmon on plate, put on good dollop of sour cream, top with mushrooms and garnish with paprika. ; name: zucchini and grape tomatoes in pesto with feta ; ingredients: pesto sauce, feta cheese, extra virgin olive oil, lemon, juice of, salt & freshly ground black pepper, zucchini, grape tomatoes ; preparation:In a small bowl, combine pesto, oil and lemon juice. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Arrange zucchini slices, overlapping slightly, on a platter. Top with grape tomatoes and feta and drizzle pesto mixture on top. Cover and let stand at least 1 hour for flavors to blend. Meanwhile, sit on the porch with a fly swatter and put some grey goose in your lemonade. ; name: bacon wrapped venison tenderloin with portabella mushrooms ; ingredients: venison tenderloin, bacon, yellow onion, portabella mushrooms, olive oil, garlic cloves, ground pepper, salt, water ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Combine t olive oil, garlic, pepper, and salt. Rub seasonings onto the tenderloin. Wrap the tenderloin in bacon and place into the roaster. Add the remaining oil to a frying pan and cook the onions and mushrooms until theyre tender. Put onions and mushrooms into the roaster with the tenderloin and add the water. Bake for 30-40 minutes. ; name: cranberry coolers ; ingredients: cranberry juice cocktail, frozen orange juice concentrate, lime juice, vodka ; preparation:

name: grilled honey garlic pork chops ; ingredients: ketchup, honey, soy sauce, garlic, boneless pork chops, salt and pepper ; preparation:Combine ketchup, honey, soy sauce and garlic. Set aside. Lightly season pork with salt and pepper. Brush each chop with sauce to coat. Cook chops on greased grill 4 to 6 inches from medium-hot coals or on medium setting, basting with sauce often, for about 5 minutes on each side or until meat is cooked through. ; name: wine marinade for poultry and pork ; ingredients: dry white wine, olive oil, rosemary, thyme, marjoram, parsley, salt, pepper, pork ; preparation:Combine the marinade ingredients in a large non-reactive bowl or one gallon food storage bag. Add the meat or poultry. Turn to coat all sides. Cover or seal tightly. Marinate for at least 6 hours or overnight, turning occasionally. Cooked in preferred method. ; name: low fat roasted potatoes ; ingredients: red potatoes, parmesan cheese, onion, fat-free italian salad dressing, fresh ground pepper, salt, cooking spray ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400-425. Spray cooking dish with spray if using fat free dressing. Put all ingredients into large zip bag and toss. Put in dish and bake for 15 minute then toss and bake. 20-25 min cooking time. Keep your eye on them. The thinner the slice the faster it cooks. Check in and toss to keep from over drying and baking. If you use a fattier dressing then it is less checking time. ; name: venison steak marinade ; ingredients: canola oil, lemon juice, worcestershire sauce, soy sauce, garlic, ground pepper, venison steak ; preparation:Mix all marinade ingredients together in a small measuring cup. Place venison steaks in a large zip lock bag. Pour marinade over steaks and seal bag. Place bag in a flat casserole dish so that the steaks are in a single layer. Refrigerate and marinate at least 4 hours, turning every half hour to marinate each side. Drain marinade and grill steaks to desired doneness. I double or triple this recipe for each addition package of steak. Any wild game steak can be used in this recipe. ; name: glazed ginger carrots ; ingredients: carrot, butter, light brown sugar, ground ginger, soy sauce, orange juice ; preparation:Cook carrots in boiling salted water for 2 minutes. Drain and set aside. In a large skillet, cream the butter with the brown sugar and ginger. Cook over medium heat until mixture melts and begins to bubble slightly. Add drained carrots and stir well. Saute 2 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add soy sauce and orange juice and cook 1-2 minutes over high heat until liquid is almost completely reduced and carrots are glazed. ; name: polenta sos style ; ingredients: cornmeal, water, salt, cooked turkey, turkey gravy mix ; preparation:To cook the polenta boil 6 cups salted water. Add cornmeal slowly while stirring with a wisk. Turn to low and cook until thick and creamy. Pour polenta onto a greased cookie sheet and cool for several hours. When cool, cut into squares. Individual squares can be grilled or pan fried. Mix gravy according to package. Plate the polenta then top with turkey and gravy and its ready to serve. ; name: mary helen s bruschetta di pomodori ; ingredients: tomatoes, fresh basil leaves, olive oil, balsamic vinegar, salt, country bread, garlic cloves ; preparation:Preheat broiler. In a bowl combine the tomatoes, basil, olive oil vinegar and salt. Toss well. Place the bread on a baking sheet and broil both sides lightly. Remove and rub one side with slice of garlic clove. Arrange bread garlic side up and spoon on topping. Serve at once. ; name: white bean blondies ; ingredients: garbanzo beans, eggs, granulated sugar, canola oil, vanilla extract, baking powder, salt, ground cinnamon, old fashioned oats, semisweet mini chocolate chips ; preparation:

name: potato fries with onion and chilli ; ingredients: potatoes, vegetable oil, onion, garlic, chili powder, salt, black pepper, lime ; preparation:Bring water to boil in pot and cook potatoes until they are just tender. Cool to handle and then cut each quarter into thick slices. Heat oil in large skillet and add potatoes and onion. Turn until the vegetables are pale gold. Add garlic and cook until the garlic turns golden. Add chilli powder, salt and pepper. Cook, stirring to coat the potatoes and lightly toast chilli powder. Sprinkle with lime juice before serving. ; name: prawns shrimp in garlic sauce ; ingredients: olive oil, garlic cloves, dried red chili, prawns, salt ; preparation:Pour the olive oil into a heatproof earthenware ramekin. Heat the ramekin on a hob until hot. Add the garlic and chilli and cook, stirring often, until the garlic is fragrant. Take care not to let the garlic burn,. Add the prawns, mixing in well, and season with salt. Cover the ramekin, cook for half a minute then remove from the heat. Serve at once. ; name: to die for chocolate mud cake ; ingredients: unsalted butter, dark chocolate, sugar, hot water, plain flour, self-raising flour, cocoa, eggs, cream ; preparation:Melt butter & chocolate with sugar and cocoa in large pan. Heat gently till well combined. Stir in hot water. Cool. Sift flours together and stir in beaten eggs. Bake in a lined cake tin in oven at 170 degrees celcius for 1 hour. Stand 5 - 10 minutes before turning out from cake tin. Melt dark chocolate over gentle heat, stir in cream and mix well to make icing. Ice mudcake when cool. ; name: greek roasted beans in tomato sauce gigantes plaki ; ingredients: butter beans, tomatoes, garlic cloves, onions, tomato paste, olive oil, parsley, salt and pepper ; preparation:Soak the beans overnight, the longer, the better. Preheat oven at 350 farenheit. Drain and rinse the beans and boil in water for about 40 minutes to an hour, until they are soft but not mushy. Make sure you boil them enough. Otherwise the beans will be too hard to eat even after baking. Sauce - saut the onion in a bit of olive on low heat until soft and add the garlic cloves whole. If you want a stronger garlic flavor you can mince the garlic. Add the tomato, the tomato paste, parsley, salt and pepper to taste and about cup olive oil. Let it simmer until sauce thickens, about 10 minutes. Once the beans have boiled, drain them and put them back into the pot, add the sauce and mix gently. Pour the mixture in a pan and spread evenly and then pour about another cup olive oil over the beans and bake for about 50 minutes until beans are tender. Accompany with feta cheese and bread. ; name: lola richard s easy potato salad ; ingredients: potatoes, hard-boiled eggs, onion, sweet pickle, mayonnaise, prepared yellow mustard, salt and pepper ; preparation:Quarter the potatoes and eggs and put them in a large bowl. Mash them with a potato masher to a course consistancy. Add the onion, sweet pickles, mayo and yellow mustard and stir to combine. Add salt and pepper to taste. Sometimes i add a little finely diced cucumber if i have it. Sweet pickle relish can be substituted for the diced sweet pickles. ; name: sweet sour watermelon cucumber salad ; ingredients: cider vinegar, water, sugar, poppy seed, green onion, seedless watermelon, english cucumbers, salt and pepper ; preparation:Mix together the vinegar, water, sugar and poppy seeds in a bowl and season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir in the chopped green onion. Place the watermelon and cucumber in a serving bowl and pour the marinade over the top. Serve immediately or cover and refrigerate a couple of hours before serving. Toss gently before serving. ; name: berry mallow yam bake ; ingredients: flour, brown sugar, quick oats, cinnamon, butter, yams, whole berry cranberry sauce, marshmallows ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Mix together flour, brown sugar, oats, and cinnamon. Cut in butter. In large bowl, toss half of the crumb mixture with the yams and cranberry sauce and arrange in casserole dish. Sprinkle remaining crumb mixture on top. Bake for 35 minutes. Place marshmallows on top and put under broiler until marshmallows are golden brown and toasty. ; name: apricot pork with herb crust ; ingredients: olive oil, pork cutlets, apricot jam, breadcrumbs, flat leaf parsley, chicken stock, corn ; preparation:

name: christmas snow drop cookies ; ingredients: butter, shortening, powdered sugar, flour, vanilla, almonds ; preparation:Mix in order given. Roll into small balls, about 48, and place on lightly greased cookie sheet or parchment paper. Bake at 300 for 30 to 40 minutes. Remove from oven to cool. Cookies should not be brown but a very light tan. Roll in powdered sugar while still warm. Roll in powdered sugar again when cool. Store in an air tight container. ; name: italian spaghetti frittata ; ingredients: spaghetti, parmesan cheese, butter, fresh parsley, eggs, salt & pepper ; preparation:Drain the spaghetti and stir in the cheese, 3 tbsp butter and the parsley. Let it cool slightly. Add salt& pepper to the beaten eggs. In a large non stick skillet heat remaining butter, over medium heat until foaming but not brown pour in the spagetti mixture and spread evenly. Cook for 4-5 minutes until the bottom is brown. Loosen with a spatula and invert onto a plate. Slide the frittata back into the pan and cook the other side until golden 3-4 minutes. ; name: roasted rosemary skewered figs ; ingredients: fresh figs, fresh rosemary, maple syrup, apple cider vinegar, mustard powder ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Skewer 3 whole figs onto each sprig of rosemary. In a small bowl combine maple syrup, vinegar, and mustard. Place skewers into an oiled baking dish and roast for 30 min. Spoon maple syrup mixture over figs and continue roasting for 15 min basting occasionally. ; name: mediterranean chicken pasta salad ; ingredients: suddenly salad basil pesto pasta salad mix, water, olive oil, cooked chicken, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, feta cheese, sliced ripe olives ; preparation:Cook pasta as directed on box. While pasta is cooking, in large bowl, stir together seasoning mix, cold water and oil. Add chicken and set aside. Drain pasta. Rinse with cold water. Shake to drain well. Stir drained pasta and remaining ingredients into chicken mixture. Refrigerate at least 1 hour before serving. ; name: sausage con queso dip ; ingredients: lean ground beef, hot italian sausage, onion, mushroom soup, diced tomatoes with seasonings, velveeta cheese, jalapeno peppers, hot salsa, tortilla chips ; preparation:Brown ground beef, sausage meat and onion. Drain fat. Add the rest of the ingredients. Simmer until the cheese melts. Serve warm with tortilla chips. ; name: any flavor easy quiche ; ingredients: ready-made pie crust, eggs, nonfat milk, green onion, salt, pepper, ground nutmeg, zucchini, cheese, flour ; preparation:Heat oven to 450 degrees. Line pricked pastry shell with foil and bake 5 minutes. Remove foil and bake 5 additional minutes. Remove from oven and reduce temperature to 325 degrees. In a bowl, stir together eggs, milk, onion, salt, pepper, and nutmeg. Add vegetables or meat and stir. Toss shredded cheese with flour and add to egg mixture, stirring well. Pour into pastry shell and bake for 35 to 40 minutes. You might want to add foil around the edges to prevent over browning. ; name: indian spiced coffee ; ingredients: water, cardamom pods, cinnamon stick, nutmeg, clove, brewed coffee, milk, sugar ; preparation:In a medium-size pot, bring water to a boil. Stir in the spices, cover, and simmer over low heat for 5 minutes. Stir in the pre-brewed coffee. Meanwhile, in a saucepan, heat milk until almost boiling. Strain the coffee through a fine mesh strainer covered with cheesecloth into the milk. Add sweetener, stir, and serve in mugs. ; name: southwestern pumpkin soup ; ingredients: low sodium chicken broth, whipping cream, pumpkin puree, dark brown sugar, ground cumin, chili powder, ground coriander, ground nutmeg, sharp cheddar cheese, fresh cilantro ; preparation:

name: luau pork ; ingredients: boneless pork butt, soy sauce, worcestershire sauce, garlic cloves, fresh gingerroot, salt, liquid smoke ; preparation:Place a large sheet of heavy duty foil in a baking pan. Put roast on top and sprinkle with remaining ingredients. Seal very tightly. You might want to wrap it a second time. Turn on oven to 300or 325. Place pan on lower rack of oven and bake for 3 to 4 hours. Meat should fall apart and be very tender and juicy. To serve, shred the pork and mound on a platter and garnish. ; name: swiss tobleronemousse ; ingredients: chocolate, eggs, icing sugar, whipping cream ; preparation:Chop the chocolate up coarsely and put into a bowl or double boiler. Set bowl over boiling water to melt the chocolate. Stir in the sugar and eggs until the until the sugar has desolved and chocolate is melted and is lighter in color. Remove from heat. Whip the cream and fold into the chocolate mixture. Pour into 4 individual serving dishes or leave in bowl. Refrigerate for at least 3 hours before serving. ; name: mini reuben appetizers ; ingredients: rye cocktail bread, sauerkraut, corned beef, swiss cheese, thousand island dressing ; preparation:Drain sauerkraut. Place coctail ryes on cookie sheet in single layer. Carefully place corn beef on each slice of rye. Add 1 tablespoon saurerkraut on top of corn beef. Squeeze a dash of thousand island dressing on top of saurkraut. Top with swiss cheese. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Just before serving slide cookie sheet into oven for 5-8 minutes -- just until cheese has melted. ; name: lemon mustard chicken ; ingredients: chicken pieces, cooking oil, dijon-style mustard, lemon juice, lemon pepper seasoning, dried oregano, ground red pepper ; preparation:Skin chicken. Place chicken pieces, bone side up on unheated rack of a broiler pan. Broil 4-5 inches from the heat, about 20 minutes or until light brown. Meanwhile in a bowl stir together oil, mustard, lemon juice, lemon pepper seasoning, oregano and red pepper. Brush mustard mixture onto chicken. Turn chicken, brush with remaning mixture. Broil for 5-15 minutes more or until chicken is no longer pink. ; name: coconut and raspberry slice ; ingredients: biscuits, butter, raspberry jam, caster sugar, vanilla essence, egg, desiccated coconut, self-raising flour ; preparation:Grease a 30 x 20 x 3 cm baking tin, and line with baking paper. Preheat oven to 180 degrees celsius. For the base, place biscuits into a food processor and process to fine crumbs. Add the melted butter to the crumbs and process until combined. Press the mixture firmly into the base of the tin using the back of a spoon. Spread the base with the raspberry jam. For the topping, cream the butter, sugar and vanilla essence until fluffy. Add the egg and fold in the coconut and flour. Sprinkle over the jam but careful not to press the topping onto the base. Bake for about 20 minutes. Allow to cool at room temperature then chill overnight. ; name: spinach salad with orange vinaigrette ; ingredients: prosciutto, oranges, zest of, oranges, juice of, balsamic vinegar, honey, garlic clove, salt, fresh ground black pepper, extra virgin olive oil, spinach ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Place the prosciutto slices on a baking sheet and bake until just crisp, about 10 minutes. Let cool. Crumble the prosciutto slices into a container and store in the refrigerator. In a blender, combine the orange zest, orange juice, balsamic vinegar, honey, garlic, salt, and pepper. Blend until smooth. With the blender running, add the olive oil in a steady stream until combined. Transfer to a container and store in the refrigerator. To serve, put the spinach in a large bowl. Toss with enough of the vinaigrette to coat the spinach. Sprinkle with the crisp prosciutto crumbles, toss again, and serve. ; name: venus de milo soup ; ingredients: ground beef, chicken broth, water, french onion soup mix, diced tomatoes, celery, frozen mixed vegetables, small shell pasta, worcestershire sauce, hot pepper sauce ; preparation:In a large pot brown ground beef. Drain fat. Add broth, water, celery, soup mix and tomatoes. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer for about 5 minutes. Add pasta and frozen vegetables, along with worcestershire sauce and hot pepper sauce, and cook for 10 minutes more. Serve with parmesan cheese, if desired. ; name: pollo en crema ; ingredients: corn tortillas, monterey jack cheese, chicken breasts, cream cheese, sour cream, milk, green pepper, onion, butter ; preparation:

name: greens and apples ; ingredients: soy margarine, granny smith apples, frozen apple juice concentrate, greens, salt and pepper ; preparation:In large saucepan, melt margarine over medium heat. Add apples and cook, stirring, until lightly browned. Add remaining ingredients. Cover and cook, stirring occasionally, until greens are tender. Serve immediately. ; name: pumpkin french toast vegan ; ingredients: pumpkin puree, almond milk, cornstarch, cinnamon, ground ginger, ground cloves, pure vanilla extract, baguette, cooking oil ; preparation:Mix together all ingredients except for the bread. Spread out baguette slices on a rimmed baking pan in a single layer. Pour on pumpkin mixture and flip to coat. Let sit for 20 minutes, then flip over and soak for 10 minutes more. Preheat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Spray with cooking oil, or drizzle a little into the pan, and cook about half of the soaked breads at a time for 5 to 7 minutes on one side and about 3 minutes on the other. They should be golden to medium brown and flecked with darker spots. Keep warm on a plate covered with tin foil while you cook the second batch. If not serving immediately, cover and place in a 200f oven for up to an hour. Serve with maple syrup and margarine, of course. ; name: strawberry vanilla wafer layered torte no bake ; ingredients: butter, sugar, fresh strawberries, pecans, egg whites, vanilla wafers, strawberry, whipped cream ; preparation:Cream the butter until soft and gradually add the sugar. Cream together until smooth. Add the strawberries and pecans. Beat the egg whites in a separate bowl until stiff and then fold them into the berry mixture. Line a pyrex dish with broken vanilla wafers, add a layer of the berry mixture on top of that. Alternate the two, ending with the wafers on top. Chill 12 hours. Serve with whipped cream and garnish with fresh whole strawberries. ; name: brown sugar glazed pork chops ; ingredients: brown sugar, apple juice, canola oil, soy sauce, ground ginger, salt and pepper, cornstarch, water, boneless pork loin chops ; preparation:Preheat grill on high for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, over medium heat, combine brown sugar, apple juice, canola oil, soy sauce, ginger, salt and pepper to taste, bring to a boil. In a measuring cup or small bowl, whisk cornstarch into the water and mix into brown sugar mixture. Cook, stirring constantly until bubbling and thickened. Reduce grill to medium-high heat. Grill chops on oiled grill, brushing often with brown sugar glaze, about 6-8 minutes per side, or until digital thermometer inserted sideways into the center of each chop reads 160f do not over cook. ; name: roasted peppers with basil ; ingredients: red peppers, yellow peppers, balsamic vinegar, olive oil, salt, black pepper, fresh basil ; preparation:Quarter the peppers. Place them under a hot broiler, shiny side up, until the skin blisters and turns black. Allow to cool. Tear off the papery skin, and remove and discard the stalk and seeds. Cut the flesh into strips and place the strips in a shallow dish. Sprinkle with vinegar, oil, salt, and black pepper. Tear the basil leaves and scatter them over the top. Mix the ingredients lightly together. Serve at once, or keep in a cool place for later. If served later, mix again, and check the seasoning. ; name: warm spinach and rice chicken salad ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, italian salad dressing, chicken rice pilaf mix, fresh spinach, tomatoes, pitted ripe olives ; preparation:Brush chicken with 2 teaspoons of the salad dressing. Grill or broil chicken, turning once, for 20 to 25 minutes or until juices run clear. Meanwhile, prepare rice pilaf mix according to package directions. Combine hot cooked rice with remaining salad dressing, spinach, tomatoes and olives. Stir until spinach is slightly wilted. Spoon rice mixture onto serving plates.
