When melted, add the salsa and serve. ; name: eggless salad vegan or vegetarian ; ingredients: extra firm tofu, vegan mayonnaise, celery, onions, dijon mustard, salt and pepper ; preparation:

name: cucumber salad with rice wine vinegar ; ingredients: toasted sesame seeds, cucumbers, rice wine vinegar, distilled white vinegar, sugar, kosher salt ; preparation:In a medium bowl, toss the cucumber slices with all the other ingredients, except sesame seeds. Cover, and refrigerate for at least an hour. Sprinkle with the toasted sesame seeds just before serving. Actually, i pick up a half pound at the health food store, rinse and drain them well, and then toast them in thedry skillet. Allow them to cool completely, and store them in the freezer until needed. They will rapidly go rancid otherwise. ; name: easy ham and cheese puffs appetizer ; ingredients: refrigerated buttermilk biscuits, tomato sauce, ham, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 450 degrees. Spray a small baking sheet with nonstick spray coating. Set aside. Open the biscuit carton, and separate the biscuits. Place them on the baking sheet in a single layer without crowding together. With a small spoon, spread the tomato sauce on the biscuits, dividing the mixture evenly. Top with the ham and cheese, dividing evenly. Bake in the center of the oven for 8 to 10 minutes or until golden. Serve hot. ; name: vanilla pudding dessert ; ingredients: milk, vanilla instant pudding mix, sweetened condensed milk, cool whip, vanilla wafers, fresh strawberries ; preparation:In a large bowl, whisk milk and pudding mix for 2 minutes. Let stand for 15 minutes. Fold in condensed milk. Set aside 1 tablespoon whipped topping and 2 tablespoons wafer crumbs. Fold remaining whipped topping into pudding. In a 2 quart serving bowl, layer a third of the strawberries, wafer crumbs and pudding mixture. Repeat layers twice. Sprinkle with reserved wafer crumbs. Top with reserved whipped topping. Refrigerate until serving. ; name: finger lickin good mustard oven fried chicken ; ingredients: dijon mustard, lemon juice, garlic cloves, fresh rosemary, ground black pepper, chicken thighs, bran flakes, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Combine mustard, lemon juice, garlic, rosemary, and pepper in a bowl. In a sealable bag combine bran flakes and cheese. Crush up the bran flakes slightly with hands on the outside of the bag. Coat chicken with mustard mixture. Then transfer the chicken pieces to the bag and shake to coat with the bran flake mixture. Place the crumb coated chicken pieces in a shallow baking dish coated with non stick spray. Sprinkle any remaining bran flake crumbs on top. Cover with foil and bake for 20 minutes. Remove foil and bake another 20-30 minutes, or until juices run clear when pricked with a fork. ; name: breakfast fruit and nuts salad ; ingredients: oranges, banana, walnut halves, coconut ; preparation:Peel and slice banana, and peel and cut oranges in little bits. Cut walnut halves in bits. Mix in a bowl. Sprinkle with coconut. Eat quickly. ; name: minestre ; ingredients: smoked ham, string bean, potatoes, garlic cloves, chicken broth, dried thyme, black pepper, salt, olive oil ; preparation:Cut ham into bite-sized cubes. Peel and cut potatoes into bite-sized cubes. Remove ends from string beans and rinse. Peel and chop garlic. Heat olive oil in large pot of medium high heat. Saute meat in oil until lightly browned. Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Add string beans, potatoes, thyme, pepper and salt. Add broth and additional water to just cover. Turn heat to low and simmer for 45 minutes. ; name: delicious soft chocolate chip cookies ; ingredients: butter, brown sugar, granulated sugar, egg, vanilla extract, all-purpose flour, cornstarch, baking soda, chocolate ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Cream together butter and sugars until creamy. Add egg and vanilla. Blend well. In another bowl combine flour, cornstarch and baking soda. Add to butter mixture and then add chocolate chunks. Drop by tablespoons onto a greased baking sheet and bake for 8-10 minutes, until golden brown around the edges. ; name: garlic lover s shrimps ; ingredients: olive oil, crushed red pepper flakes, garlic cloves, raw shrimp, salt, dry sherry, fresh parsley, old bay seasoning ; preparation:

name: tuna croquettes ; ingredients: canned tuna, wheat germ, eggs, tomato juice, fresh dill, black pepper, cooking oil ; preparation:In a large bowl, combine all the ingredients. Nix well. Shape the mixture into 4 equal size patties. Heat 1 to 2 tablespoons oil in heavy frying pan add the formed patties and fry on both sides until golden brown. Drain on paper towels to absorb excess oil. ; name: chocolate chunk buckwheat cookies ; ingredients: unsalted butter, brown sugar, egg, vanilla extract, almond extract, whole wheat pastry flour, baking soda, salt, buckwheat groats, semisweet chocolate ; preparation:Preheat over to 375f. In a stand mixer or bowl, cream the butter and brown sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the egg, vanilla, and almond extract until well mixed. In a small bowl, mix the flour, baking soda, salt and buckwheat, and add to the butter mixture, beating to incorporate. When the flour is mixed in, add the chocolate and stir until combined. Drop 2-tablespoon-size balls of dough onto ungreased sheet pans, leaving 3 inches of space between the balls. The cookies will spread while baking. Bake for 6 minutes, reverse the position of the pans in the oven, then bake for 4 to 6 minutes more. A pale, soft center surrounded by golden brown cookie is the desired result. Let the cookie cool on the pans for 5 minutes, then transfer to cooling racks with a spatula. Let cool completely before storing in an airtight container for up to a week. ; name: marinated peppers and mozzarella ; ingredients: sweet peppers, olive oil, garlic cloves, lemon rind, crushed red pepper flakes, salt, mozzarella cheese, basil leaves, fresh lemon juice ; preparation:Preheat broiler to high. Arrange the baby peppers in a single layer on a foil-lined jelly roll pan, and broil peppers for 4 minutes on each side or until blackened and tender. Cool, combine peppers, olive oil, garlic cloves, lemon rind, red pepper, salt, and mozzarella balls, and toss. Cover, and refrigerate overnight, tossing after 6 hours. Let stand at room temperature for 30 minutes. Stir in basil leaves, and lemon juice before serving. Serve with a slotted spoon. ; name: creamy cheesy scrambled eggs ; ingredients: eggs, cheddar cheese, butter, light spreadable cheese with garlic and herbs, salt and pepper ; preparation:Over medium to medium low heat, melt butter in frying pan. Add the wedges of laughing cow cheese and slowly melt. In mixing bowl, crack and whisk eggs until puffy. Add eggs to pan & turn with a spatula. When the eggs are pretty well set, add the shredded cheddar and take the pan off the heat. Mix the cheddar in by folding over the eggs until cheddar is melted. Serve immediately. ; name: banana apple bread ; ingredients: margarine, apple juice concentrate, eggs, flour, baking soda, salt, milk, bananas ; preparation:With an electric mixer beat margarine till smooth. Slowly add in apple juice concentrate while mixing on high speed. Beat in eggs one at a time. Sift in the dry ingrediants, then add milk. Finally stir in the mashed bananas. Pour into a greased 9 inch loaf pan and bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for one hour. Watch after 45 min of baking, if bread seems to be getting to brown place a foil tent over the top of it. ; name: seasoned roasted asparagus ; ingredients: fresh asparagus, olive oil, lemon juice, seasoning salt, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Place asparagus in a single layer on a baking sheet or broiler pan. Drizzle with oil and lemon juice. Sprinkle with seasoned salt - coat evenly. Bake at 450 f for a total of 10 minutes or until crisp-tender. For a more even tenderness, turn each aspargus stalk after 5 minutes. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese immediately before serving. ; name: corn on the cob boiled ; ingredients: corn on the cob, water, butter, salt, ground black pepper ; preparation:In a large pot, enough to hold the corn, fill it with water to cover the corn. On a medium heat allow the pot of water to boil. Once the water is boiled, add in the corn into the pot and cover. Cook for 10-15 minutes depending on how soft you want your corn. Drain water and remove corn on the cob. Be careful as cob will be extremely hot. Top the corn with preferred seasons, herbs and spices. I prefer salt, pepper and butter. Enjoy. ; name: irish bread and butter pudding ; ingredients: dry white bread, sweet butter, nutmeg, golden raisin, eggs, heavy cream, milk, vanilla, superfine sugar, white sugar ; preparation:

name: green peas and mushrooms ; ingredients: water, green peas, vegetable oil, mushrooms, green onions, low sodium soy sauce ; preparation:In a saucepan, bring water to a boil, add peas and. Cook 5 minutes or until just tender. Drain thoroughly. While peas are cooking, heat oil in a non-stick skillet and saute mushrooms and green onions until tender. Combine with peas and toss with soy sauce. Serve immediately. ; name: umyum rings with emphasis on yum ; ingredients: sweet onion, fine dry breadcrumb, dried thyme, morton lite salt, paprika, ground pepper, egg whites ; preparation:Peel, slice and separate onions into rings. Combine crumbs and seasonings, mix well. Dip onion rings in egg whites then in crumb mixture to coat each piece. Place onions in single layer on greased baking sheet. Bake at 400f for 20 minutes or until onions are crisp and tender. ; name: green bean stir fry ; ingredients: green beans, sunflower oil, ground star anise, garlic cloves, soy sauce, clear honey, tabasco sauce ; preparation:Heat the oil in the wok until very hot. Stir fry beans for 2 to 3 minutes. Add star anaise and garlic then fry for 1 minute. Add remaining ingredients then fry for 1 minute. Serve immediately. ; name: quinoa salad with sun dried tomatoes ; ingredients: quinoa, sun-dried tomatoes, black olives, fat free feta cheese, pine nuts, fresh basil leaves, fresh garlic cloves ; preparation:Thoroughly rinse quinoa in cold water. Drain well in fine sieve. Dry roast in a large fry pan over med-high heat 10 minute or until golden brown. Stirring constantly. Add 4 cups hot water. Bring to boil. Reduce heat, cover and simmer 10 min or until liquid is absorbed. Let cool completely. In large salad bowl, add cooked quinoa and remaining ingredients. Toss and refrigerate till serving time. ; name: homemade egg substitute ; ingredients: egg whites, nonfat dry milk powder, vegetable oil, yellow food coloring ; preparation:Combine all ingredients in a mixing bowl. Whisk until smooth. Store in a glass container or jar in the refrigerator for up to 1 week and also freezes well. To make scrambled eggs. Fry slowly over low heat in a nonstick frypan. ; name: orange glazed green beans ; ingredients: water, garlic, fresh green beans, orange marmalade, dried rosemary, orange zest, salt, butter ; preparation:Trim beans and break into 1 inch lengths, wash. In medium saucepan bring water and garlic to a boil. Add green beans, reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 10 to 15 minutes or until beans are crisp tender. If any water remains at end of cooking, drain and return beans to pan. Turn up heat to medium add remaining ingredients and heat to boiling, stirring occasionally. Serve immediately. ; name: layered chocolate dessert ; ingredients: ginger biscuits, chocolate syrup, chocolate ice cream, chocolate, mint leaf ; preparation:Crush the biscuits and divide into four dessert glasses. Drizzle the sauce over the crushed biscuits. Add a scoop of ice cream to each glass. Top with the crumbled flake and a mint leaf. Serve immediately. ; name: sweet potato puffs ; ingredients: sweet potatoes, butter, milk, salt, brown sugar, pumpkin pie spice, blanched slivered almond ; preparation:

name: picante chicken ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breast halves, picante sauce, brown sugar, prepared mustard, cooking spray, cooked rice ; preparation:Place chicken in a shallow 2 quart baking dish sprayed with nonstick cooking spray. In a small bowl, combine the picante sauce, brown sugar and mustard. Pour over chicken. Bake, uncovered at 400 degrees for 30 to 35 minutes or until juices from the chicken run clear. Serve over rice. ; name: watermelon cantaloupe salad with mint basil vinaigrette ; ingredients: watermelon, cantaloupe, mint leaves, basil leaves, lemon, juice of, simple syrup, amaretto, basil ; preparation:Scoop 2 cups each from the watermelon and the cantaloupe using a melon baller. Carve the remainder of the watermelon out and reserve shell. Add to a blender the chopped mint, chopped basil, lemon juice, simple syrup and amaretto. Blend until smooth. Add the watermelon and cantaloupe balls to the carved out watermelon half. Add the vinaigrette to the balls and toss to combine. Garnish with the mint and basil sprigs and taste. ; name: easy cocoa 1 layer cake ; ingredients: flour, unsweetened cocoa powder, baking soda, salt, unsalted butter, brown sugar, eggs, vanilla, water, powdered sugar ; preparation:Stir dry ingredients together in a bowl. Cream butter and sugar in another bowl, add eggs, vanilla and water. Mix in dry ingredients. Mix well. Bake in preheated 350 oven in buttered and floured 9 inch cake pan for about an hour or til cake tests done with a toothpick. Cool in pan for an hour then remove to rack and sift powdered sugar over top. ; name: cranberry walnut crescent rolls ; ingredients: refrigerated crescent dinner rolls, sugar, dried sweetened cranberries, walnuts, powdered sugar ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375. Unroll dough. Separate into 12 triangles. Sprinkle with sugar, craisins and walnuts. Press craisins and walnuts lightly into dough. Roll up loosely towards pointed end. Place rolls point-side down, onto ungreased cookie sheet. Curve into crescent shape. Bake at 375 for 11-13 minutes or until golden brown. Sprinkle with powdered sugar and serve warm. ; name: colonel sanders lemon sponge pie ; ingredients: pie crust, flour, butter, milk, sugar, egg yolks, salt, fresh lemon juice, lemons, rind of, egg whites ; preparation:Temper butter. Cream butter and sugar thoroughly. Add remaining ingredients except egg whites. Fold in stiffly beaten egg whites. Pour into unbaked pie crust and bake slowly in oven at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Reduce oven to 300 degrees f, until tests done - about 45 minutes. ; name: crescent taco roll ; ingredients: refrigerated reduced-fat crescent rolls, ground chuck, taco seasoning, low-fat cheddar cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, green peppers, fat free sour cream, taco sauce ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375. Brown meat and drain fat. Follow taco mix preparation directions, make sure all water gets absorbed. Add cheese to meat and stir until meat sticks together and cheese is melted. On a 13-inch baking stone or large size pizza pan, arrange rolls with points outside and bases together. It helps to arrange a square with 4 of the rolls, and then arrange the rest of the rolls in a circle around the square with points facing out. Spoon taco mix over rolls, fill in and fold points over taco mix, pinch to seal. Bake for 11-13 minutes. Serve with lettuce, tomato, peppers, sour cream, taco sauce, or any taco toppings of your choosing. Can be sliced like a pie or cut into squares. ; name: chocolate toffee cheese ball ; ingredients: cream cheese, butter, vanilla, powdered sugar, brown sugar, mini chocolate chip, english toffee bits, pecans ; preparation:Mix cream cheese, butter and vanilla. Stir in sugars and fold in chips and toffee bits. Refrigerate 2 to 3 hours. Form into a ball and roll in copped pecans. Serve with graham crackers or apple slices. ; name: braised leeks ; ingredients: leeks, garlic, carrots, olive oil ; preparation:

name: lamb and sweet potato slow cooker casserole aust ww 4 pnts ; ingredients: olive oil, lean lamb, onions, garlic cloves, coriander powder, whole cardamom pods, sweet potato, hot water ; preparation:Place lamb, onions, garlic, coriander, cardamom, sweet potato and stock in a 5-litre capacity slow cooker. Season well with salt and pepper. Cover and cook on a low setting for 7 hours. Make sure to split cardamom pods down centre with a large sharp knife. This will help cardamom flavour to infuse in casserole. Unfortunately some of the black seeds may come out during the cooking process, so be careful not to eat them. They arent at all harmful to your health, just a little full-on in flavour. Serve with steamed green beans or broccoli. ; name: scottish chocolate and orange mousse with whiskey ; ingredients: chocolate, eggs, scotch whisky, heavy cream, orange, powdered sugar ; preparation:Combine chocolate, whisky and cream in a heatproof bowl and place over pan of simmering hot water, stirring until melted. Remove from the heat and allow cooling slightly. Beat egg whites to hard peaks. Beat the yolks with the finely grated orange rind. Add egg yolk mixture into the cooled chocolate cream, stir. Fold in the whisked egg whites. Spoon the mixture into six individual cups or glasses. Chill in the fridge for at least three hours. Just before serving, whip the cream for the topping with powdered sugar add the whisky and whip shortly again. Spoon cream over the mosse, top with orange zest strips and serve immediately. ; name: finger licking sesame edamame ; ingredients: frozen edamame, vegetable oil, sesame oil, fresh ginger, garlic, salt, sesame seeds ; preparation:Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add edamame and continue boiling until beans are crisp-tender, about 6 minutes. Meanwhile mix remaining ingredients together. When done, run cold water over, or put in ice water, to stop cooking. Drain well. Pat excess moisture off, and toss in the dressing. Top with seeds. To eat, hold pod by stem end, and slide the individual beans out with your teeth. Discard pod. ; name: easy awesome guacamole ; ingredients: avocados, salsa, sour cream, mayonnaise, onion powder, pepper, salt, garlic, lemon juice, fresh chives ; preparation:Cut avocados in half and take out the seed, scoop out meat with a spoon and place in bowl. Mash the avocado with a fork. Add the salsa, mayonnaise, sour cream, salt, pepper, garlic and onion powder. Mix together well. Add lemon juice, mix and serve. Garnish with fresh chives. ; name: extra rich fudge ; ingredients: milk chocolate chips, sweetened condensed milk, maraschino cherry, miniature marshmallow, vanilla extract, walnuts ; preparation:In 2-quart pyrex bowl melt chips on high or till melted. Stir. Add rest of ingredients and mix well. Spray or butter a 9x13 pan and pour fudge into pan. Refrigerate and cut into squares. ; name: brown butter pasta ; ingredients: salted butter, nutmeg, turmeric, gouda cheese, coarse unseasoned bread crumbs, pine nuts, fresh fettuccine ; preparation:Bring a large saucepan of lightly salted water to a boil. While the water heats, in a small saucepan over medium-low heat, combine the butter, nutmeg and turmeric. Heat, stirring frequently, until the butter has melted and browned slightly, about 8 to 10 minutes. Meanwhile, use a food processor to finely grate the cheese. Add the bread crumbs and pine nuts, then pulse several times, or until the mixture resembles coarse sand. Set aside. Once the water has boiled, add the pasta and cook according to package directions. Drain and return to the pot. Pour the butter mixture over the pasta and toss to coat. Transfer the pasta, along with any butter in the pan, to a large serving bowl. Sprinkle the bread crumb mixture over the pasta. ; name: maple syrup upside down cake ; ingredients: maple syrup, butter, sugar, egg, flour, baking powder, salt, cinnamon, milk, walnuts ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Measure butter, sugar, and egg into a bowl, and beat with a wooden spoon or electric mixer until creamy. Mix flour, baking powder, salt, and cinnamon together. Add the dry ingredients and the milk, a little at a time and alternating between the two, to the creamed butter mixture. Stir until well blended. Measure syrup into a small saucepan. Heat the syrup until it boils, and pour into a generously buttered 8-inch square baking pan. If using chopped walnuts, add them to the hot syrup. Scoop up the dough in four large balls and drop them into the hot maple syrup. Using two forks, stretch dough balls to the edges until the dough forms one large mass. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Serve warm with ice cream or whipped topping if desired. ; name: pineapple raisin broccoli salad ; ingredients: bacon, broccoli florets, cheddar cheese, pineapple tidbits, raisins, red onions, mayonnaise, sugar, vinegar ; preparation:

name: broccoli and bell peppers ; ingredients: soy sauce, lemon juice, toasted sesame oil, broccoli florets, red sweet peppers ; preparation:For sauce, in a small bowl stir together soy sauce, lemon juice and sesame oil. Set aside. Place a steamer basket in a 12 inch skillet. Add enough water to come just below bottom of basket and bring to a boil. Place broccoli in steamer basket and reduce heat to medium low. Cover and steam for 4 minutes. Add sweet peppers. Cover and steam for 3 to 4 minutes more or until vegetables are crisp-tender. Transfer vegetables to a serving bowl. Drizzle sauce over vegetables and toss gently to coat. ; name: basic iced coffee ; ingredients: regular grind coffee, water, milk, sugar ; preparation:Make coffee in your coffee pot with coffee & water listed under coffee cubes, and allow to cool. Pour into an ice tray and freeze. Make additional coffee. Add milk and sugar to hot coffee, if desired. You can throw everything in the blender at this point if you like a smooth consistency like i do, or you can just put the cubes in a tall glass and pour in the freshly brewed coffee. ; name: garlic pasta ; ingredients: garlic, dried basil, salt, pepper, crushed tomatoes, olive oil, spaghetti ; preparation:Combine all ingredients except pasta in small sauce pan. Cook on high heat until bubbly, stirring often. Turn down heat and cover. Simmer at least 30 minutes for best flavor. Cook pasta according to package directions. Sauce may be thinned with water reserved from pasta if desired. Serve with parmesan cheese. ; name: grilled portabella sandwiches or panini ; ingredients: portabella mushroom caps, vidalia onions, olive oil, garlic cloves, salt and pepper, italian bread ; preparation:Mix together oil, salt and pepper, and garlic. Marinate mushrooms and onions with this for about thirty minutes. Grill mushrooms and onions over medium heat until done, brushing on the oil mixture liberally throughout cooking time. Cut the bread open length-wise, brush it with the oil, then lightly toast on the grill. Layer on the onions and mushrooms. Press sandwich together for a few minutes. Cut into 6 pieces or so and serve. ; name: braised beef and tortelloni olive garden copycat ; ingredients: olive oil, boneless beef short rib, garlic clove, tomatoes, fresh mushrooms, marsala wine, flour, italian seasoning, tortellini ; preparation:Heat oil on high heat in a large nonstick pan. Toss short ribs in flour, add to pan, and sear on all sides. Reduce heat to low and add garlic. Cook and stir for about 1 min. Add tomato, mushrooms, marsala wine, and italian seasoning one at a time, allowing about 1-2 min between each for liquid to evaporate. Cover pan and braise for 3 hr or until very tender, checking and stirring every 30 min to make sure liquid has not evaporated away. Increase heat to medium high and heat thoroughly. Serve over tortelloni. ; name: fettuccine salami frittata ; ingredients: cooked fettuccine, salami, olive oil, onion, garlic cloves, zucchini, carrot, eggs, italian tomatoes, salt & pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 180c. In a frypan or saucepan heat oil and add onion, garlic, zucchini and carrot. Cook for 2-3 minutes then add salami. In a large bowl, combine pasta, vegetables, eggs and tomatoes, season well. Spoon into lightly oiled flan dish and bake for 45 mins until set. ; name: jalapeno rellenos ; ingredients: pickled jalapeno peppers, cream cheese, sharp cheddar cheese, green onion, pimiento strips ; preparation:Rinse and drain jalapenos. Slit lengthwise on one side. Remove seeds and veins, leaving stem attached. Beat cream cheese until fluffy. Beat in cheddar cheese and green onion. Stuff each pepper with part of the cheese mixture. Arrange in a heatproof serving plate or baking sheet. Bake in 350 degree oven for about 10 minutes or until cheese melts. Top each pepper with a pimiento strip. ; name: mexican coffee balls ; ingredients: chocolate wafers, blanched almond, unsweetened cocoa powder, white sugar, instant coffee, coffee liqueur, light corn syrup, cinnamon sugar ; preparation:

name: creamy white bean soup ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, carrot, garlic cloves, cannellini beans, water, italian seasoning, salt, black pepper ; preparation:Heat olive oil in a 4 quart saucepan on medium high heat. Add onion, carrots and garlic and cook, stirring occasionally until they are soft. Add beans, water, and seasonings. Stir and reduce heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes or until carrots are tender. Take half of soup and blend in blender until smooth. Return soup to bean mixture in pan and stir. Ladle into bowls and drizzle with olive oil before serving. Top with freshly grated parmesan cheese, if desired. ; name: bananas foster crunch mix ; ingredients: honey nut chex, cinnamon, pecan halves, dried banana pieces, butter, brown sugar, ground cinnamon, banana extract, rum extract ; preparation:In a large microwave-safe bowl, combine cereals, pecans and banana chips. In a small microwave-safe bowl, combine the butter, brown sugar and cinnamon. Microwave, uncovered, on high for 2 minutes, stirring once. Stir in extracts. Pour over cereal mixture and toss to coat. Cook, uncovered, on high for 3 minutes, stirring after each minute. Spread onto waxed paper to cool. Store in an airtight container. ; name: portabella and onion topping for hamburgers ; ingredients: portabella mushrooms, spanish onion, garlic, olive oil, american cheese, red wine ; preparation:Heat oil in a non stick skillet. Add garlic and saute for one minute. Add spanish onions and cook until almost translucent. Add sliced portobello mushrooms and saute until cooked and reduced, about 10 minutes on medium heat. Add optional red wine or cooking wine, mix well until reduced. Set aside once finished. When burgers are almost ready, top with portabello mushroom mixture and a slice of cheese, continue grilling or broiling until cheese is melted. ; name: amish country strawberry pie ; ingredients: pie crusts, powdered sugar, cream cheese, strawberries, sugar, white corn syrup, water, strawberry gelatin, salt, cornstarch ; preparation:Beat cream cheese with powdered sugar, spread carefully over bottom of baked pie shell. Arrange berries in shell. Berries should be sliced. Cook sugar, syrup, water, salt, and cornstarch over medium heat until thick. Add jello mix and cool. Pour glaze over berries and refrigerate. ; name: sensible linguine alfredo ; ingredients: water, all-purpose flour, garlic cloves, low-sodium instant chicken bouillon granules, ground black pepper, ground nutmeg, parmesan cheese, plain low-fat yogurt, fresh linguine, fresh parsley ; preparation:Combine water, flour, garlic, bouillon, pepper and nutmeg in large, nonstick skillet. Stir until smooth. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, for 8 to 10 minutes or until mixture boils and thickens. Remove from heat. Stir in cheese and yogurt. Prepare pasta according to package directions. Add pasta to skillet. Toss to coat. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve immediately. ; name: caramel butter pecan bars ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, brown sugar, butter, pecans, caramel ice cream topping, milk chocolate chips ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 f. Combine flour and brown sugar in a bowl. Cut in butter until crumbly. Press into bottom of an ungreased 13x9x2 inch baking pan. Top with pecans. Drizzle warmed caramel topping evenly over pecans. Bake at 350 f for 15-20 minutes or until caramel is bubbly. Place on wire rack. Sprinkle with chocolate chips. Let stand 5 minutes, then spread chocolate chips over caramel-pecan layer. Cool for at least 6 hours at room temp or until chocolate has set. Cut into bars. ; name: honey chipotle pecans ; ingredients: honey, dried chipotle powder, ground cinnamon, pecan halves, sugar, salt ; preparation:Preheat oven to 325f. In a skillet, warm honey with chipotle powder and cinnamon over low heat, then add the nuts and stir to coat evenly. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper, then spread nuts evenly in a single layer on the sheet. Bake in preheated oven until nuts are fragrant. Allow to cool slightly. In a mixing bowl, combine sugar and salt. Add the warm pecans, and toss to coat evenly. Spread out on fresh sheet of waxed paper and let dry completely. Store in an airtight container. ; name: pull apart monkey bread ; ingredients: refrigerated biscuits, butter, sugar, cinnamon, nuts ; preparation:

name: asian pea pods casserole microwave ; ingredients: frozen pea pods, sliced water chestnuts, green onions, butter, soy sauce, cornstarch, salt, ground ginger, pepper ; preparation:Microwave pea pods in 1-qt. Covered glass casserole for 2 minutes, or until thawed. Stir in remaining ingredients. Microwave, uncovered, 4 minutes, or until pea pods are crisp tender. Stir again, adjust seasonings if necessary, and serve. ; name: tuna melt potato wedges ; ingredients: frozen potato wedges, mayonnaise, onion, cheddar cheese, tuna in water, parsley, salt and pepper ; preparation:Heat oven to 220 c. Place wedges in single layer on baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes. Meanwhile mix mayo, cheese and tuna together. Place wedges into heatproof serving dish. Spoon over tuna mixture. Put back into the oven for 15 minutes till bubbling. ; name: creamy spiced mushroom soup low fat and vegan ; ingredients: extra virgin olive oil, onions, garam masala, ground cilantro, potatoes, carrots, mushrooms, vegetable stock, fresh cilantro ; preparation:Heat the olive oil in big pan and then add the onion and cook softly for about 5 minutes to allow the onions to soften. Add the garam masala and ground cilantro and stir into the onions. Add the potato and carrots and just allow to heat through for 1 minute. Add the mushrooms and the vegetable stock and bring to the boil. Reduce the heat, cover and cook for 30 minutes. Add the fresh cilantro and either transfer to a blender and blitz under smooth or use a hand held stick blender to whizz it up right there in the pan. Return to the heat and add any salt if you think it is needed and just heat through again to serve. ; name: veggie stir fry ; ingredients: broccoli florets, cauliflower florets, baby carrots, bamboo shoot, water chestnut, scallion, teriyaki marinade, garlic, olive oil, salt and pepper ; preparation:Heat olive oil, garlic, and scallions in saut pan for about 1 minute. Add broccoli, cauliflower, and carrots and saut on medium heat adding cup of water can help steam the vegetables. Cover pan for about 2 minutes. Add bamboo shoots, water chestnuts and 2 cups teriyaki marinade. Cover for 1 to 2 minutes. Then uncover and saut until done ideally 1 more minute to keep veggies crisp. Salt and pepper to taste. ; name: great turkey brine for a moist juicy bird ; ingredients: canning salt, white wine, dried sage, dried thyme, dried tarragon, dried rosemary, water ; preparation:Mix the salt, water and spices along with the wine in a large clean container such as a food grade five gallon bucket. Stir well until the salt dissolves. Take your thawed turkey, clean it under running water and remove the neck and giblets for another use. Add the turkey to the brine, putting it in so the breast side is down in the brine, be sure to fill all the cavities in the bird with the brine. Cover and refrigerate until time to cook, then drain and cook according to your package directions. ; name: sailboat sandwiches for pint size captains ; ingredients: hot dog bun, tuna salad, cheddar cheese, corn kernel, peanut butter, banana ; preparation:Cut an oval in the middle of the hot dog bun and scoop out some of the insides. Fill with tuna salad or peanut butter. Arrange corn kernels or banana slices around the outside edge of the boat for trim. Cut a slice of american cheese diagonally. Make a sail for the sailing ship by putting a cocktail stick through some sliced cheddar cheese and standing it in the middle of the boat. ; name: peas chickpeas and cumin ; ingredients: chickpeas, peas, garlic cloves, cumin, butter, black pepper ; preparation:Melt butter in a pan. Add garlic and cumin and saut for 1 minute. Add chickpeas and saut until heated through. Add peas. Season with black pepper and serve hot. ; name: browned kohlrabi karalabe fozelek ; ingredients: kohlrabi, butter, salt, sugar, parsley, flour, chicken broth ; preparation:

name: apricot pie ; ingredients: unbaked double pie crusts, ground almonds, fresh breadcrumbs, walnuts, fresh apricots, granulated sugar, egg yolk ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f. In a small bowl, combine almonds, breadcrumbs and walnuts. Sprinkle over bottom pie crust. Peel and halve fresh apricots. Spread apricot halves over nut mixture. Sprinkle sugar over apricots. Cut top crust into strips. Arrange in a lattice pattern over filling. Brush top pastry with egg yolk. Bake 30 minutes. ; name: simmered sirloin with gravy ; ingredients: boneless beef top sirloin steaks, onion, sliced mushrooms, garlic, butter, beef stock, worcestershire sauce, all-purpose flour, cold water ; preparation:In large nonstick skillet, cook beef, onions, mushrooms and garlic in butter over medium heat for 5-7 minutes or until meat is brown and no longer pink. Add the beef broth, worcestershire sauce and bring to boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for one hour. Combine flour and water until smooth. Add to beef mixture. Bring to a boil. Cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened. ; name: dressed up burger patties ; ingredients: ground beef, dry breadcrumbs, salt, pepper, egg, onion, beef broth, fresh mushrooms, water, cornstarch ; preparation:Mix first 5 ingredients. Shape into patties. Cook and brown patties, add onion, broth and mushrooms. Cover and simmer 10 minutes. Heat onion to boiling. Remove patties. Mix water and cornstarch. Add to skillet and stir until thickened. ; name: becky s popped corn ; ingredients: popped corn, cereal, salted peanuts, almond bark, peanut butter ; preparation:Mix popped corn, rice krispies and salted peanuts in a bowl. Melt almond bark in the microwave - be careful not to burn. Stir peanut butter into melted almond bark. Spread on a sheet of wax paper. After mixture cools and hardens, break up and store in covered container. ; name: vanilla almond rice krispies treats ; ingredients: margarine, mini marshmallows, crispy rice cereal, real vanilla extract, almond extract ; preparation:Melt margarine in large non-stick pan over medium-low heat. Add marshmallows and stir until melted and smooth. Turn off flame. Stir in extracts. Fold in cereal and continue folding until well coated. Spray 13 x 9 pan with cooking spray and press mixture into pan. Cool and cut into squares. ; name: favorite gingersnaps ; ingredients: shortening, sugar, molasses, egg, plain flour, baking soda, cinnamon, clove, ginger, salt ; preparation:Cream shortening and sugar. Add molasses and egg, beat well. Add sifted dry ingredients and mix. Roll into marble size balls and dip in sugar. Place 2 inches apart on greased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 15 minutes. ; name: jane and michael stern s broccoli casserole ; ingredients: white bread, eggs, milk, butter, cheddar cheese, salt, sugar, broccoli ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Butter an 8-inch square pyrex baking dish. Cover the bottom of the dish generously with the torn bread. Combine the eggs, milk, melted butter, cheese, salt and sugar in a bowl. Mix ntil combined. Stir in the roccoli and pour the mixture over the read. Cover with aluminum foil and bake for 35 minutes. For a chewier top, remove the foil during the last 10 to 12 minutes of baking. If you want a crisper crust, run the casserole under the broiler. ; name: scottish whipped shortbread ; ingredients: salted butter, icing sugar, cornstarch, flour, vanilla extract ; preparation:

name: hot roast beef sandwiches ; ingredients: chuck roast, dry onion soup mix, beef bouillon cube, sliced mushrooms ; preparation:Cook beef until tender. Pull apart into shreds, saving beef juice. Use no salt as this contains boullion. Mix all ingredients into beef mixture and reheat. Perfect in a crockput. Serve on fresh rolls. ; name: crock pot pizza ; ingredients: hamburger, rigatoni pasta, ragu pizza sauce, mushrooms, onion, pepperoni, mozzarella cheese ; preparation:Cook hamburger until done and drain off the fat. Add mushrooms and onion and fry until translucent. Add pepperoni. Add in one jar of ragu pizza sauce, and combine thoroughly. Layer this in bottom of crockpot. Meanwhile cook rigatoni noodles until el dente. Lay noodles on top of hamburger mix in crockpot. Turn crock on low and leave 4-5 hours. Pour over the remainder of pizza sauce over the noodles. Top with the cheese. ; name: braised lettuce with peas and lemon ; ingredients: olive oil, shallots, boston lettuce, chicken broth, dried thyme, sugar, frozen peas, lemon zest, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Heat the oil in a large skillet over moderate heat. Saut the shallots until tender, about 5 minutes. Add the lettuce, chicken broth. Thyme, and sugar and simmer covered over low heat for about 5 minutes, until the lettuce is tender. Add the peas and cook an additional 5 minutes. Add the lemon zest, salt, and pepper, and serve immediately. ; name: vidalia onion quiche ; ingredients: butter, vidalia onions, unbaked pie shells, swiss cheese, eggs, cream, salt, pepper, chives ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Melt butter in a large frying pan, and add sliced onions. Sautuntil transparent. Set aside to cool. Sprinkle 1 cup of cheese in the bottom of the pie plate. Add the cooled onions. Mix together eggs, cream, salt and pepper. Pour over the onions and top with remaining cheese and chives. Bake for 40 - 50 minutes, or until mixture is set. Allow to cool slightly before serving. ; name: hamburger dips ; ingredients: hamburger, french rolls, onion, swiss cheese, bacon, fresh mushrooms, au jus sauce ; preparation:In a large fry pan place patties, bacon, onion, and mushrooms fry over medium heat until patties are done. Place cheese slices on patties. Taost french rolls. Heat au jus. Assemble sandwiches pour au jus into bowls and serve. ; name: pizza by the slice ; ingredients: tomatoes, hard salami, mozzarella cheese, refrigerated crescent dinner rolls, dried oregano ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f. Remove stem end of tomato and cut tomato into several large chunks, then coarsely chop. Stack salami slices, two at a time and cut into small wedges. Unroll crescent dough on cutting board and separate into 8 triangles. Arrange the triangles on a flat baking stone or pizza pan so they do not touch. Sprinkle triangles with equal amounts of tomato, salami, cheese and oregano. Bake 15-18 minutes or until edges are golden brown. ; name: bed and breakfast sausage egg casserole ; ingredients: sausage, eggs, milk, salt, dry mustard, bread, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Brown sausage and drain. Beat the eggs with milk, salt, and mustard. Layer bread cubes in the bottom of a buttered 9 by 13-inch casserole dish. Crumble the sausage over the bread and top with cheese. Pour the egg mixture over all. Refrigerate overnight. Bake in 350 degree oven for 30-40 minutes. When using a glass casserole, bake in 325 degree oven for 45-60 minutes. This is really good with a little bit of maple syrup on top. ; name: apple cider glazed carrots ; ingredients: butter, carrot, apple cider, brown sugar, tarragon, salt, pepper ; preparation:

name: crock pot mexican chicken ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, salt & pepper, onion powder, red enchilada sauce, condensed cheddar cheese soup, black beans, chili powder, cream cheese, tortilla chips ; preparation:Place breasts in a large crock-pot then sprinkle with salt & pepper. Pour the enchilada sauce over the chicken then cover & cook on low for 4 hours. Remove the chicken & shred. Whisk in the cheese soup until smooth then add the chicken, beans, & chili powder. Continue to cook for another 2 hours. During the last 30 minutes add the cream cheese, stir to melt. Serve with tortilla chips. ; name: creole ; ingredients: kielbasa, oil, onion, red bell pepper, spanish rice mix, salsa, water, pepper ; preparation:Saute onion, bell pepper and sausage in oil in a large skillet. Add remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil, stirring well. Cover and simmer until liquid is absorbed, and rice is tneder, about 10-12 minutes. Remove from heat, and let rest 5 minutes before serving. ; name: baked potato packets ; ingredients: potatoes, butter, onion, fresh mushrooms, garlic salt, thyme ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cut 4 pieces of tinfoil big enough to wrap everything up. Slice one potato into thin slices and place on a piece of tinfoil. Top with some sliced mushrooms and onions, to your taste. Sprinkle with a pinch of garlic salt and thyme. Top with 1 tbs butter. Wrap tinfoil tightly around. Repeat with remaining potatoes. Place potato packets in oven. Bake 30-40 minutes or until potatoes are tender. ; name: cranberry pear clafouti ; ingredients: eggs, sugar, flour, half-and-half, butter, pears, cranberries, cinnamon ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375. Butter a 9 inch glass pie plate. In a medium bowl, whisk together eggs and sugar till lightly colored. Whisk in the flour and half and half. Stir in the melted butter. Pour the mixture into the prepared pie plate. Arrange the pears in the batter and surround with cranberries. If desired, dust top with sugar and cinnamon. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes, or till the pears are tender and the custard is lightly browned. Cool slightly and serve. ; name: grilled rib eye steaks ; ingredients: soy sauce, green onion, brown sugar, garlic cloves, ground ginger, pepper, salt, rib eye steaks ; preparation:In a large resealable plastic bag, combine the first 7 ingredients. Add the steaks. Seal the bag and turn to coat. Refrigerate for 8 hours or overnight. Drain and discard marinade. Grill steaks, uncovered, over medium-hot heat for 8-10 minutes or desired doneness. ; name: amish lime salad ; ingredients: marshmallows, milk, lime gelatin, cream cheese, crushed pineapple, salad dressing, whipped cream ; preparation:Melt the marshmallows and milk in a double boiler. Pour that mixture over the gelatin, stirring it until the gelatin is dissolved. Stir in the cream cheese until it dissolves. Add the pineapple and cool the mixture. Add salad dressing and whipped cream and chill until firm. ; name: spanish style potato salad ; ingredients: russet potato, mayonnaise, smoked paprika, yellow onion, salt-free garlic powder, salt, white pepper ; preparation:Wash and peel potatoes. Cut up into chunks. Bring a large pot of water to boiling and cook potatoes until fork tender. Drain. Set aside to cool briefly. Transfer potatoes to a large serving bowl. Combine the mayonnaise and smoked paprika. Add to the potatoes. Add the remaining ingredients and stir to combine. Cover and chill. Before serving, adjust seasonings if necessary and garnish with fresh parsley if desired. Tastes better the second day. ; name: broccoli and green bean polka ; ingredients: head of broccoli, french beans, olive oil, unsalted cashews, almonds, sea salt ; preparation:

name: farfalle with prosciutto spinach pine nuts and raisins ; ingredients: golden raisin, boiling water, olive oil, garlic cloves, baby spinach, pine nuts, farfalle pasta, prosciutto, parmesan cheese, salt and pepper ; preparation:Plump raisins by soaking in boiling water, about 10 minutes, then drain. Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Add spinach and cook, stirring for about 2 minutes or until just wilted. Cook farfalle as directed on package and drain. Toss with pine nuts, raisins, garlic, spinach and prosciutto. Add parmesan cheese. Add salt and pepper to taste. ; name: vegetables au gratin ; ingredients: potatoes, courgette, aubergine, tomatoes, single cream, vegetable stock cube, salt and pepper, chives, jarlsberg cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 180c and grease an oven proof dish. Bring the cream to the boil, add the stock cube and stir to dissolve. Add salt, pepper and chives. Blend in half the grated jarlsberg until it melts and the sauce is smooth. Layer all the vegetables in the dish and pour in the sauce. Sprinkle the remaining grated cheese on top. Bake in mid oven for 30 - 45 minutes. ; name: outback steakhouse outback special ; ingredients: sirloin steaks, old bay seasoning, light brown sugar, garlic powder, onion powder, ground cumin ; preparation:Heat an outdoor grill, stovetop grill pan, or broiler. Mix spice rub ingredients. Rub on both sides of steak. Grill or broil 5 minutes on each side for medium-rare. Remove to plates. Let rest 5 minutes before serving. ; name: miso glazed salmon ; ingredients: brown sugar, low sodium soy sauce, hot water, miso, salmon fillets, cooking spray, fresh chives ; preparation:Preheat broiler. Combine first 4 ingredients, stirring with a whisk. Arrange fish in a shallow baking dish coated with cooking spray. Spoon miso mixture evenly over fish. Broil 10 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork, basting twice with miso mixture. Sprinkle with chives. ; name: cinnamon applesauce easy microwave recipe ; ingredients: granny smith apples, sugar, fresh lemon juice, ground cinnamon, coarse salt ; preparation:In a 2 quart microwave- safe dish with a lid, combine apples, sugar, lemon juice, cinnamon, and a pinch of salt. Cover, and microwave on high until very tender, 10- 15 minutes, stirring halfway through. Mash apples with the back of a spoon. Serve warm. Or cover, refrigerate at least 1 hour, and serve chilled. Store, covered, in the refrigerator for up to 1 week. ; name: tunisian potato olive salad ; ingredients: baby potatoes, salt, sugar, paprika, cumin, cayenne pepper, garlic cloves, oil-cured black olives, extra virgin olive oil, lemon, juice of ; preparation:Place the potatoes in a pot with water to cover. Add 1 teaspoon salt and the sugar. Bring to a boil over high heat then reduce heat and simmer for about 15 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender. Drain the potatoes, return them to the pan and shake in the dry pan for a few minutes, until thoroughly dry. Cut the potatoes into thick slices, several per potato, or into quarters. Place in a bowl and toss with the cumin, paprika, cayenne, garlic and olives. Dress with the olive oil, lemon juice and salt. Refrigerate until ready to serve, or serve at room temperature. ; name: grilled greek chicken breasts ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breast halves, lemon, juice of, dried oregano, garlic salt, olive oil, feta cheese, tzatziki, kalamata olive ; preparation:Combine lemon juice, oregano, garlic salt in shallow dish. Whisk to combine. While wisking stir in olive oil. Add chicken turning once. Marinate 30-60 minutes turning half-way. Grill to your liking. Discard marinade. Top chicken with feta cheese, tzatziki sauce, and olives. ; name: easy homemade cookie ice cream paula deen ; ingredients: egg yolks, condensed milk, vanilla extract, chocolate sandwich style cookies, heavy cream ; preparation:

name: bacon and rice creole ; ingredients: bacon, green bell pepper, onions, salt, canned tomatoes, brown rice ; preparation:Simmer vegetables and spices in a saucepan. At the same time, fry the bacon. When bacon is done, remove from pan and crumble into small pieces. Drain off all fat. Let rice brown lightly. Add the vegetables and bacon. Let simmer over very low heat for 30 minutes. Check after 20 minutes to see if it is drying out. If so, add more tomatoes, or some water, or a combination of both. ; name: caramelized garlic chicken ; ingredients: olive oil, garlic, brown sugar, boneless skinless chicken breast halves ; preparation:Heat oven to 500 degrees. Line shallow roasting pan with foil. Spray foil with nonstick cooking spray. Heat oil in small nonstick skillet over medium-low heat until hot. Add garlic. Cook 1 to 2 minutes or until garlic begins to soften. Remove from heat. Stir in brown sugar until well mixed. Place chicken breast halves in sprayed foil-lined pan. Spread garlic mixture evenly over chicken. Bake at 500 degrees for 10 to 15 minutes or until chicken is fork-tender and juices run clear. ; name: roasted sweet potatoes with orange marmalade and balsamic glaze ; ingredients: sweet potatoes, extra virgin olive oil, honey, ground ginger, balsamic vinegar, orange marmalade, salt and black pepper ; preparation:Heat oven to 375. Lay the sweet potatoes out in a single layer on a roasting tray. Drizzle the oil, salt and pepper over the potatoes. Roast for 25 to 30 minutes in oven or until tender. In a saucepan reduce the vinegar by half, then add honey, marmelade and ginger. Stir to combine. When potatoes are roasted, remove and toss to coat with marmelade mixture. ; name: cheesy chicken pot biscuit cups low fat low cal ; ingredients: refrigerated biscuits, cooked chicken breast, reduced-fat cream of chicken soup, low-fat cheddar cheese, dried parsley flakes, black pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Separate biscuits and place each biscuit in a cup of an ungreased 12-hole muffin pan, pressing dough up sides to edge of cup. In a medium bowl, combine chicken, chicken soup, cheddar cheese, parsley flakes, and black pepper. Mix well to combine. Evenly spoon chicken mixture into prepared biscuit cups. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven. Place muffin pan on a wire rack and let set for 2-3 minutes. Serve at once. ; name: chicken chardonnay ; ingredients: boneless chicken breasts, salt, pepper, flour, butter, garlic cloves, thyme, sage, white wine, swanson chicken broth ; preparation:Cut up all chicken breasts into bite sized cubes. Melt 3 tablespoons of the butter in a large skillet. Mix together the flour and the salt and pepper meant for the batter. Carefully coat all chicken cubes and brown in skillet. Remove and place in a shallow dish and cover. Melt down the rest of the butter. Mix in garlic, and all spices. Add chicken back into the mix and coat throughly. Add in white wine, allow to come to a boil for 5-7 minute. After the wine has cooked down, add in chicken broth, bring to a boil and then simmer for an additional 5-7 minute. I reccomend serving this over pasta. Very tasty. ; name: easy quick hot turkey sandwiches ; ingredients: butter, carrot, onion, celery, thyme, salt, pepper, turkey gravy, deli turkey, french bread ; preparation:In skillet, melt butter. Add carrots, onion, celery, and spices. Cook on med until tender. Stir in gravy. Heat to boiling. Add turkey and heat through. Place bread slices on serving plates. Divide turkey and gravy evenly among bread slices. ; name: creamy cilantro salsa dip ; ingredients: mayonnaise, sour cream, chunky salsa, knorr vegetable soup mix, fresh cilantro ; preparation:In a medium bowl, combine mayonnaise, sour cream, and salsa. Blend well. Stir in vegetable soup mix and cilantro. Cover and chill for at least 2 hours. Serve with tortilla chips. ; name: french silk pie ; ingredients: butter, sugar, cocoa, extra-large eggs, salt, graham cracker crust, whipped cream, nuts, chocolate curls ; preparation:

name: lemon rice pilaf ; ingredients: yellow onion, converted rice, water, unsalted butter, kosher salt, bay leaf, cayenne, lemon, zest of, lemon, juice of ; preparation:Saute onion in oil in a large saucepan just until softened. Add rice and continue sauteing until it starts to turn golden. Stir in water, butter, salt, bay leaf, and cayenne. Bring to a boil, cover, and reduce heat to low. Cook until liquid is absorbed, 20 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in lemon zest and juice. Allow rice to steep a few minutes before serving. ; name: coconut macaroon ice cream biscuit tortoni ; ingredients: sugar, water, egg yolks, whipping cream, vanilla, macaroons ; preparation:Boil sugar and water together to form a syrup which spins a thread when dropped from the. Beat egg yolks well. Add syrup slowly, beating eggs during addition. Cook for 5 min. In double boiler. Remove from heat and beat well. Add the 1 c. Macaroons and cool. Whip the cream and fold into cooled egg mixture. Fold in vanilla. Spread in a shallow container and top with the powdered macaroons to give a brown crust appearance. Freeze overnight. ; name: buckeye candy ; ingredients: peanut butter, powdered sugar, butter, chocolate-flavored candy coating ; preparation:Mix peanut butter and powdered sugar together in mixer, then mix in the butter. Roll mixture into balls. Melt the chocolate candy coating according to package directions. Dip balls into melted chocolate leaving a circle of peanut butter showing. Place on wax paper. Store in refrigerator. ; name: pumpkin bran muffins ; ingredients: wheat flour, wheat bran, sugar, ground cinnamon, pumpkin puree, canola oil, low-fat buttermilk, soymilk ; preparation:Mix dry ingredients together in large bowl. Mix wheat bran and milk in separate bowl. Add pumpkin, canola oil, and buttermilk to wheat bran and milk. Combine dry ingredients with the other. Grease muffin pan or line with paper cups. Spoon batter into cups. Preheat oven to 400 degrees and bake for 20-25 minutes. ; name: mock liver pt green beans ; ingredients: green beans, egg whites, onions, oil, walnut pieces, salt & pepper ; preparation:Steam green beans for 12 minutes. Boil eggs. Saut onions in oil until lightly browned, 30 minutes. Pour all into food processor and pulse until thickened and pt consistency. Form and chill. ; name: countryside potato salad ; ingredients: potatoes, garlic cloves, wine vinegar, olive oil, salami, red onions, green onions, parsley, pimentos, salt and pepper ; preparation:Place garlic vinegar, olive oil in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper, whisk together for about a minute. Peel and slice potatoes thick, place in mixing bowl. Add remaining salad ingredients, and toss. Pour vinaigrette and toss again. Season again if needed, and marinate 15 minutes before serving. ; name: picante chicken ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breast halves, picante sauce, brown sugar, prepared mustard, cooking spray, cooked rice ; preparation:Place chicken in a shallow 2 quart baking dish sprayed with nonstick cooking spray. In a small bowl, combine the picante sauce, brown sugar and mustard. Pour over chicken. Bake, uncovered at 400 degrees for 30 to 35 minutes or until juices from the chicken run clear. Serve over rice. ; name: salmon braised in coconut milk ; ingredients: unsweetened coconut milk, orange juice, orange zest, thai fish sauce, asian chili sauce, garlic clove, fresh ginger, of fresh mint, fresh cilantro stems, salmon fillets ; preparation:

name: zesty baked pork chops ; ingredients: pork chops, italian tomato soup, water, vinegar, worcestershire sauce, brown sugar, hot pepper sauce ; preparation:Arrange pork chops in a single layer in a 3 quart oblong baking dish. Bake at 400 degrees fahrenheit for 20 minutes or until chops begin to brown. Spoon off excess fat. Meanwhile, in a small bowl combine soup, water, vinegar, worcestershire sauce, brown sugar, and hot pepper sauce. Spoon soup mixture over chops. Bake 15 minutes or until done and no pink remains. Stir sauce before serving. ; name: pumpkin bisque ; ingredients: pumpkin, butternut squash, chicken broth, salt, ground ginger, ground cinnamon, ground nutmeg, pepper, evaporated milk ; preparation:I a medium saucepan, combine pumpkin, cooked squash, chicken broth, salt, spices and cup water. Mix well until smooth. Stir in evaporated milk. Heat slowly to serving temperature, stirring frequently. Garnish each serving with a dash of nutmeg. ; name: one pan pasta with creamy shrimp and pesto sauce ; ingredients: dry penne pasta, cooked shrimp, pesto sauce, whipping cream, chicken broth, sun-dried tomatoes packed in oil, salt and pepper ; preparation:In a 4- to 6-quart pan over high heat, bring about 3 quarts water to a boil. Add pasta and cook, stirring occasionally, until tender to bite, 7 to 12 minutes. Drain and return to pan. Add shrimp, pesto, cream, broth, and dried tomatoes to pasta. Stir over medium heat until hot and evenly incorporated, 2 to 3 minutes. Add salt and pepper to taste. ; name: mousse au chocolat belgium ; ingredients: bittersweet chocolate, coffee, egg whites, powdered sugar, whipping cream, dark rum, chocolate ; preparation:In the top of a double boiler, combine the chopped bittersweet chocolate & the strong coffee, then set it over simmering water, stirring occasionally until chocolate has melted. Remove from heat & let cool slightly. Meanwhile with an electric mixer beat egg whites until soft peaks form, then gradually beat in the powdered sugar & continue to beat until egg whites hold a stiff peak. In a separate bowl, beat whipping cream into soft peaks. Use a spatula to fold the whipped egg whites into the chocolate, & then carefully fold in the whipping cream & the rum. Spoon the chocolate mousse into 4 glasses & cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for several hours, so that the mousse has time to firm up. Before serving, garnish with chocolate shavings. ; name: potato leek hummus soup ; ingredients: butter, leeks, potatoes, cooking onion, white wine, hummus, vegetable broth, pepper ; preparation:Melt butter in soup pot. Saut in butter the leeks and onion until opaque. Add broth and potatoes--bring to a boil then reduce heat and simmer until potatoes are cooked, stir to prevent burning. Add hummus, stir. Turn off heat and immediately add white wine, stir. Add pepper to taste and serve. ; name: crock pot sweet sour chicken ; ingredients: ketchup, water, white vinegar, soy sauce, brown sugar, boneless skinless chicken breasts, cornstarch ; preparation:Combine ketchup, water, vinegar, soy sauce and sugar in slow cooker. Whisk together well. Add chicken pieces and stir. Cover and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours or on high for 3 to 4 hours. Combine cornstarch and second amount of water in a small bowl. Stir into slow cooker when above times have been reached. Cook on high, stirring often, for 15 to 20 minutes or until thickened. For faster cooking, pour into saucepan and heat on stove, stirring often, until thickened. ; name: tomatoes and peppers for lunch ; ingredients: whole wheat bread, balsamic vinaigrette, tomatoes, red pepper, fat free mozzarella cheese ; preparation:Toast your bread. Douse with a balsamic vinaigrette add thinly sliced tomatoes. Add a layer of roasted peppers, any color. Add mozzarella. Sprinkle with herbs and salt and pepper. If you want melted cheese, place in broiler for a few minutes, do not nuke it, this will make it soggy. ; name: maple caramel sauce for ice cream served at 2013 obama inaugural ; ingredients: butter, light brown sugar, salt, maple syrup ; preparation:

name: blue cheese corn bread ; ingredients: jiffy corn muffin mix, egg, milk, blue cheese, green onions, pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f grease 8-inch square baking pan. Combine all ingredients in medium bowl and mix until blended. Spread in prepared pan. Bake until firm to touch and golden brown, about 30 minutes. Cool slightly. Cut into squares and serve hot. ; name: skordalia potato and garlic dip ; ingredients: floury potatoes, garlic cloves, lemon juice, ground almonds, extra virgin olive oil, egg, sea salt, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:Boil the potatoes in their skins until cooked - about 30 minutes. What you are aiming for in this recipe is starchy mashed potato. As soon as the potatoes are cool enough to handle, peel them and either mash them or put them through a potato ricer. Peel the garlic cloves and pound them in a pestle with the lemon juice or use a hand-blender for this step. Mix the potato, garlic and ground almonds together thoroughly in a bowl, and then beat in the olive oil gradually with a wooden spoon. Beat in the whole egg and season with salt and pepper. ; name: german pork and cabbage casserole ; ingredients: bacon, country-style pork ribs, salt, pepper, cabbage, onion, apple, carrot, apple cider, caraway seed ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Cook bacon, crumble in bowl. Season ribs with salt and pepper, cook in bacon grease 3-4 minutes on high heat, turning once. Place in greased 9x13 baking dish, leave fat in skillet. Cook cabbage and onion until softened in grease. Remove from heat and mix in other unused ingredients. Spoon over top of pork, sprinkle with bacon. Cover with foil, bake 30-45 minute until center is 160f. ; name: trio hoagie ; ingredients: hoagie rolls, mustard, roasted turkey, deli roast beef, salami, swiss cheese, lettuce leaf ; preparation:Place hoagies on a work surface. Spread one side of each roll with 1 tbsp of the mustard. Arrange turkey, roast beef, salami, cheese, and lettuce over mustard. Top with remaining bread half. Serve immediately or wrap and store in the refrigerator for up to 2 hours. ; name: cinnamon apple waffles ; ingredients: flour, salt, cinnamon, baking powder, sugar, eggs, milk, butter, apple ; preparation:Sift flour, salt, cinnamon, baking powder, and sugar together. Separate eggs. Beat egg yolks. Add milk and melted butter. Combine wet and dry ingredients. Beat until smooth. Add apples. Beat egg whites until stiff. Fold into batter. Bake until done. ; name: creamy chicken and chilies casserole ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breast halves, salt, pepper, mozzarella cheese, sliced mushrooms, cream of chicken soup, tomatoes, green chilies, cooked rice ; preparation:Sprinkle chicken breasts evenly with salt and pepper and place in a lightly greased 11x7 inch baking dish. Combine cheese and next 3 ingredients, and pour over chicken. Sprinkle with chilies. Bake, uncovered at 350 for 35 minutes. Serve over rice. ; name: baby beet salad with rocket and goats cheese ; ingredients: baby beets, rocket, red onion, goat cheese, pine nuts, light olive oil, lemon juice, caster sugar ; preparation:Place beetroot in a large saucepan. Cover with cold water, bring to the boil. Simmer 40 minutes or till tender, cool in pan. Drain beetroot. Use your hands to rub off skin. Combine beetroot, rocket, onion, cheese and pinenuts in serving bowl. Shake oil, juice and sugar together. Season to taste. Drizzle salad with dressing just before serving. ; name: breakfast casserole by loretta ; ingredients: bread, cheese, cooked sausage, eggs, milk, salt and pepper ; preparation:

name: frittata basic pasta and cheese ; ingredients: eggs, cream, cheese, pasta, fresh herbs of choice, salt, black pepper, olive oil ; preparation:In a large bowl, whisk the eggs and cream together. Gently fold in the cheese, pasta and rest of ingredients. One at a time, in that order. In a nonstick pan, heat the oil over medium heat. Pour the egg mixture into the pan and cook for 7 to 8 minutes until the edges start to brown. Flip the frittata by sliding it onto a large plate or tray then carefully inverting it back into the pan. Continue to cook for 5 to 6 minutes more. Remove from pan then cut into wedges and serve. This is delicious served warm or at room temperature. ; name: ww 6 point bacon chicken melt ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, bacon, low-fat cheese, chopped tomato ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Wrap two bacon slices around each chicken breast. In a small skillet, place the chicken breast with the bacon and cook until the bacon is done. Place the chicken into a baking dish and bake for 10-20 minutes until done. Remove from oven and sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 2-3 minutes until cheese melts. Top with tomatoes. For different versions, try adding a sauce like ranch or barbecue or add more toppings like mushrooms, green onions, etc. ; name: cinnamon basmati rice with raisins ; ingredients: butter, onion, ground cloves, cinnamon, basmati rice, golden raisin, salt, pepper ; preparation:Melt butter in medium saucepan. Saute onion, cloves, and cinammon until the onion is translucent. Rinse the uncooked rice in a sieve with cold running water. Add rice to pan, sirring to coat. Add raisins, salt, and pepper. Add 2 cups water. Increase the heat and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and cover. Cook 10-15 minutes until water has been absorbed & rice is cooked. Remove from heat and let stand, covered, for 5 more minutes. Season with additional salt and pepper if desired. ; name: pastor s delight aw heck everybody s delight ; ingredients: cherries, yellow cake mix, butter, walnuts ; preparation:Place filling in a slow cooker. Combine dry cake mix and butter. Sprinkle over filling. Sprinkle with walnuts if desired. Cover and cook on low for 2-3 hours. Serve in bowls. ; name: ada s peanut butter fudge ; ingredients: brown sugar, granulated sugar, butter, vanilla, evaporated milk, peanut butter, marshmallow cream ; preparation:Mix brown sugar, granulated sugar, butter, vanilla, and milk in a saucepan. Sir constantly until mixture begins to boil all over. Begin timing. Boil exactly 3 minutes. Remove from heat. Add more vanilla, peanut butter, and marshmallow cream. Stir well. Pour into buttered pan. Chill. ; name: boudro s famous guacamole riverwalk san antonio ; ingredients: orange, limes, avocados, roma tomato, serrano peppers, red onions, fresh cilantro, sea salt, garlic clove ; preparation:Squeeze juice of orange and lime into bowl. Scoop avocado from skin, add to bowl and coarsely chop. Add tomato, peppers, onion, garlic, and cilantro, and fold into avocado mixture. Add salt to taste. Result should be crudely chopped, not mashed. ; name: company rice ; ingredients: butter, long grain rice, consomme, green onions, water, button mushrooms, oregano ; preparation:Put washed rice in a 2 quart casserole. Add remaining ingredients and stir well. Cook, covered, at 350 for 30 minutes. Uncover and stir well. Replace lid and continue to cook for another 30 minutes. ; name: bacon wrapped jalapeno peppers ; ingredients: jalapenos, cream cheese, bacon, toothpick ; preparation:

name: caramelized onion and goat cheese pizza ; ingredients: olive oil, onions, pizza crust, pizza sauce, sun-dried tomato packed in oil, goat cheese, fresh basil ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450. Heat olive oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion. Cover and cook for 3 minutes. Uncover and cook for 11 minutes or until golden brown, stirring frequently. Place the pizza crust on a baking sheet. Combine the sauce and tomatoes. Spread sauce mixture over pizza crust. Top with onion and cheese. Bake at 450 for 10 minutes or until crust is golden brown. Sprinkle with basil. Cut into 6 wedges. ; name: old fashioned blackberry pie ; ingredients: pastry for double-crust pie, blackberries, sugar, cornstarch, fresh lemon rind, butter ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Wash the blackberries and place on paper towels to drain. Line the bottom of a pie pan with half of the pastry. Place the blackberries on top of the pastry. Sprinkle the sugar, cornstarch and lemon rind on top of the berries. Dot butter on top of the sugar, cornstarch and lemon rind. Cut the remaining pastry in strips. Place the strips in a lattice pattern on top of the pie. Bake in the preheated oven for 30-45 minutes or until the top of the pie is golden brown. ; name: mocha java my way ; ingredients: strong coffee, semisweet chocolate pieces, sugar, half-and-half ; preparation:In a small saucepan combine coffee, chocolate pieces, and sugar. Cook and stir over medium heat for 2 to 3 minutes or until chocolate is melted and sugar is dissolved. In another small saucepan heat half-and-half or light cream until steaming, stirring occasionally. Pour coffee mixture into a mug. Add warm half-and-half. If desired, stir in additional sugar to taste. Makes 1 serving. ; name: roasted brussels sprouts with mushrooms ; ingredients: olive oil, thyme, salt and pepper, whole mushrooms, fresh brussels sprouts, balsamic vinegar ; preparation:Preheat over to 450f. On a rimmed baking sheet, toss mushrooms and thyme with brussels sprouts and olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Roast on lower rack until golden brown and tender when pierced with a knife, 20 minutes. Serve hot, drizzled with balsamic vinegar, if desired. ; name: orange pineapple salad ; ingredients: orange gelatin mix, pineapple gelatin mix, mandarin oranges, crushed pineapple, cream cheese, cool whip, sugar, nuts ; preparation:Dissolve jell-o in 2 cups boiling water. Put oranges and pineapple with their juice in jell-o. Pour mixture into a 9x13 cake pan. Refrigerate until set. Beat cream cheese and sugar. Fold in cool whip. Spread over jell-o. Garnish with nuts. ; name: ham cheese and mayo sandwich ; ingredients: white bread, cheese, ham, mayonnaise ; preparation:Spread mayonnaise evenly on two pieces of the bread. Place a piece of cheese on the bread. Place a slice of ham on top of the cheese. Place the other slice of bread on top. Cut in half. Enjoy. ; name: sweet and spicy pecans ; ingredients: pecans, granulated sugar, cinnamon, paprika, cayenne pepper, honey, oil ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. In a medium bowl mix sugar, cinnamon, paprika, cayenne. Add pecans and toss well. Drizzle honey and oil over spiced nuts and mix well so they are evenly coated. Spread on greased baking sheet and bake 7 - 10 minutes until sugar is caramelized. Let it cool for 5 minutes and take it of the sheet otherwise they might stick to the bottom. If that happens put it back in oven to melt the sticky sugar. ; name: pancakes milk free ; ingredients: flour, baking powder, sugar, salt, egg, orange juice, water, vegetable oil, vegetable oil cooking spray ; preparation:

name: golden baked mini reubens ; ingredients: thousand island dressing, miniature party rye rounds, swiss cheese, corned beef, sauerkraut ; preparation:Spread the dressing over 1 side of the bread slices. Top half of the slices with half of the cheese, the corned beef, sauerkraut, and then the remaining cheese. Top with the remaining bread slices--dressing side down. Coat a cookie sheet with butter-flavored non-stick cooking spray. Place sandwiches on cookie sheet. Coat the bottom of another cookie sheet butter-flavored non-stick cooking spray. Place coated side down on top of sandwiches. Bake at 375 for 8-10 minutes or until the bread is golden and cheese is melted. ; name: cheese stuffed mushrooms ; ingredients: mushrooms, green onion, garlic cloves, butter, dry breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese, parsley, salt, basil, pepper ; preparation:Remove mushroom stems and chop finely. In a small pan, cook stems, green onions, garlic and butter over medium heat til tender, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and add all remaining ingredients except caps. Fill caps with mixture, place in baking dish. Bake 350f for 15 minutes. ; name: baked cranberry conserve ; ingredients: fresh cranberries, brown sugar, fresh lemon juice, orange marmalade, walnuts ; preparation:Set oven to 350 degrees. Grease a shallow baking dish. Place the cranberries and brown sugar in the baking dish. Toss gently to combine. Cover and bake for 1 hour, stirring the mixture after about 30 minutes of baking time. After 1 hour baking remove from oven and stir in lemon juice, marmalade and chopped walunuts. Return to oven and bake uncovered for another 15 minutes. Cool to room temperature. Store any leftover conserve covered in the fridge. ; name: scalloped potatoes curdle free ; ingredients: butter, flour, milk, salt, potatoes ; preparation:Melt butter in a sauce pan, stir in flour, salt and add milk slowly, stirring constantly until sauce boils and thicken. Add potatoes and heat, stirring until the mixture boils again. Spoon potatoes into a shallow, greased casserole. Sprinkle 1 t diced butter over top. Bake at 350 for 35 minutes. ; name: turkish sulu patates watery potatoes ; ingredients: potatoes, chicken breasts, tomatoes, onion, red pepper paste, oil ; preparation:Cut the tomatoes in half, dividing the top from the bottom. In a medium-large pot use a grader to shred the tomatoes until all that is left is the skin. Discard the skin. Adding onions, pepper paste, and oil to pot, stir over high heat until onions are soft. Add potatoes, cook 5-10 minutes stirring occasionally. Add chicken, cook until just white. Add hot water until food is covered. Cook until potatoes are done. Serve with red pepper flakes to season. ; name: cranberry and lime sparkler ; ingredients: cranberry juice, lemon lime and bitters soft drink, limes, sugar cubes, sparkling white wine ; preparation:Combine cranberry juice, soft drink and limes in a large jug. Place 1 sugar cube into each chilled champagne glass. Pour in 100ml sparkling white wine. Top with cranberry and lime mixture. Serve immediately. ; name: yellow pear tomato preserves ; ingredients: yellow pear tomatoes, lemon, sugar, salt, gingerroot ; preparation:Wash& dry tomatoes. Cut a thin slice from blossom end and press out seeds and discard. Combine tomatoes, sugar& salt, simmer until sugar is dissolved. Boil for about 40 minutes. Add thinly sliced lemon and minced or sliced ginger. Boil about 10 minutes longer. Pour into hot jars and seal at once. ; name: red wine mushrooms the easy way ; ingredients: small mushroom, olive oil, butter, garlic granules, red wine ; preparation:

name: cheddar and scallion bread ; ingredients: sharp cheddar cheese, butter, scallions, garlic cloves, kosher salt, black pepper, bread ; preparation:Place an oven rack in the center of the oven. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees f. In a food processor, combine the cheese and butter. Process until the mixture is smooth. Add the scallions and pulse until combined. Season with salt and pepper, to taste. Spread the cheese mixture on the cut sides of the bread. Place on a baking sheet and bake for 10 to 12 minutes until golden. Remove from oven and serve immediately. ; name: orange fudge sauce ; ingredients: evaporated milk, semi-sweet chocolate chips, sugar, margarine, orange-flavored liqueur ; preparation:Combine milk, chocolate chips, and sugar in saucepan. Heat just to boiling over medium heat, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Stir in butter and liqueur. Serve warm or cold. Store in airtight container in refrigerator up to 1 month. ; name: citrus shakeups ; ingredients: lemon, orange, sugar, ice cubes, water, orange wedges ; preparation:In a 16-ounce shaker, squeeze juice from the lemon and orange halves. Add sugar. Add enough ice cubes to fill two-thirds full. Add water to cover ice. Cover and shake. Serve in a tall glass. ; name: deviled ham puffs ; ingredients: cream cheese, onion juice, baking powder, egg yolk, salt, bread rounds, deviled ham ; preparation:Blend together the cheese, onion juice, baking powder, egg yolk, and salt. Toast the bread round on one side. Spread the untoasted side with deviled ham and cover each with a mound of the cheese mixture. Place on ungreased cookie sheet and bake at 350 degrees for 10 to 12 minutes or until puffed and brown. Serve hot. ; name: impossible garden pie ; ingredients: zucchini, tomatoes, mozzarella cheese, onion, milk, eggs, bisquick baking mix, parmesan cheese, salt, pepper ; preparation:Heat oven to 400 degrees. Grease a 10 inch cake pan. In a medium bowl, combine the zucchini, tomato, mozzarella cheese and onion. Sprinkle vegetable mix into cake pan. In another bowl, beat remaining ingredients 1 minute with an electric mixer on medium speed. Pour over the vegetables in the cake pan. Bake 35-40 minutes or until a knive inserted in the center of the pie comes out clean. Cool 5 minutes. ; name: lucy s zucchini slice ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, zucchini, bacon, cheddar cheese, self raising flour, vegetable oil, eggs ; preparation:Grease a 19cm x 29cm slice pan with oil. Heat oils in a small pan, cook onion, stirring until soft, you will know this when it goes a bit white and see through. Combine onion with remaining ingredients in medium bowl. Mix well. Spread mixture into prepared pan. Bake in moderate oven 35 minutes or until golden on top and firm. ; name: mexican spice cookies ; ingredients: butter, brown sugar, egg, vanilla extract, all-purpose flour, ground ginger, ground allspice, ground cinnamon, ground cloves ; preparation:Cream butter. Add sugar, beating until light and fluffy. Add egg and vanilla, beating well. Add flour, ginger, allspice, cinnamon, and cloves, stirring well. Drop batter by teaspoonfuls 3 inches apart onto a lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 degrees f for 5 to 7 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from cookie sheet. Cool on wire racks. Serve on a platter. ; name: extra tasty scrambled eggs ; ingredients: eggs, milk, salt & freshly ground black pepper, butter, cheddar cheese, bread ; preparation:

name: old england ham chowder ; ingredients: gammon steaks, carrots, celery, onion, potatoes, butter, cream, chicken stock, dried marjoram, dill ; preparation:Finely chop the onions and the celery and fry in butter. When softened and translucent add diced carrots. Cube the gammon and add to the mixture. Let simmer for a few minutes frequently stirring. Add the cubed potatoes, the chicken stock and marjoram. Let simmer for approx 30 minutes till the potatoes start breaking up. Take off the heat and add the cream. Season to taste. Garnish with chopped fresh dill. ; name: johnny cakes the bahamas ; ingredients: flour, baking powder, salt, sugar, shortening, whole milk ; preparation:Mix all the dry ingredients together, then cut in the shortening. Work the mixture with your hands until the grains are about the size of rice. Add milk until you get a soft dough. Turn out onto a floured surface and knead until smooth. Let the dough rest for 10 minutes, then transfer it to a greased 9x9 inch pan. You will have to press it down so it fills in all the corners. Poke the top of the dough a few times with a fork. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 to 25 minutes. You can tell the cake is done when it starts to turn a little golden around the edges. ; name: shrimp deviled eggs ; ingredients: hard-boiled eggs, small shrimp, mayonnaise, dijon mustard, fresh dill, lemon juice, garlic salt, pepper ; preparation:Cut peeled eggs in half lenghtwise. Scoop yolks out into a mixing bowl and mash with a fork. Add mayonniase, dijon mustard, dill, lemon juice, garlic salt, pepper and shrimp to egg yolks and stir to blend completely. Fill each egg white with yolk mixture. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve. ; name: tomato treat 3 ; ingredients: pita bread, pesto sauce, cheese, tomatoes, fresh ground pepper, salt, onion ; preparation:Spread pesto on flatbread, english muffin or split crusty roll. Top with your favourite shredded cheese. Add thick slices of tomato. Sprinkle with salt and freshly ground pepper. Top with thinly sliced onion. Broil about 6 inches from heat until tomato is soft and cheese is melted. About 5 minutes. Serve immediately. ; name: chilled cucumber avocado and shrimp soup ; ingredients: avocado, cucumber, chicken broth, plain low-fat yogurt, lime juice, salt, cooked shrimp, green onions, shrimp ; preparation:Cut the avocado in half and remove the pit.
