The vegan condensed milk is now ready for use as wished. ; name: crock pot apple and brown sugar corned beef ; ingredients: corned beef brisket, apple juice, brown sugar, prepared mustard, red potatoes, carrots, onion, cabbage ; preparation:Place all ingredients in a large crock pot. Stir to mix. Cook on high for 4 to 5 hours or on low for 8 to 10 hours. Remove meat and vegetables and some of the cooking liquid. Slice meat thinly across the grain. Serve with vegetables and some of the liquid. ; name: moist cornbread ; ingredients: white flour, cornmeal, salt, baking powder, white sugar, milk, oil, creamed corn, eggs ; preparation:Turn oven on to 300 degrees. In large bowl mix together dry ingredients, first 5 ingredients. In smaller bowl mix together wet ingredients, last 4 ingredients. Add wet ingredients to larger bowl of dry ingredients. Mix well. Grease an 8-9 inch cast iron pan with pam. Pour batter into pan and bake for 1 hour. ; name: mussels in wine sauce ; ingredients: mussels, dry white wine, shallot, garlic clove, fresh flat-leaf parsley, whole wheat baguette, mixed greens, white wine vinegar, extra virgin olive oil ; preparation:Scrub and de-beard mussels, discard any that do not close to the touch. In large pot, add wine, shallots, garlic and mussels, bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover and cook stirring occasionaly until mussels are opened. Meanwhile, pre-heat broiler, and broil whole grain baguette 3 minutes each side. Remove and wrap in aluminum foil to keep warm, set aside. Remove mussels with sloted spoon into indivikdual bowls, discard unopened mussels. Bring remaining liquid to boil, boil 2-3 minutes. Pour hot liquid over mussels. Arrange mixed greens on salad plate, drizzle with white wine vinegar and olive oil. Serve with crusty whole grain baguette. ; name: cranberry apricot truffles ; ingredients: dried apricot, dried cranberries, orange zest, dark chocolate ; preparation:

name: marinated boneless venison loin ; ingredients: venison loin, cooking oil, water, bay leaf, onion, thyme, red wine ; preparation:Place the meat in a glass dish and pour the cooled marinade over it. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours. Remove the meat from the marinade and dry on paper towels. Heat the oil in a frying pan over high heat. Add the meat and fry it quickly for 2-3 minutes on each side. Serve immediately on heated plates. Marinade------------. Place the water, bay leaf, onion and thyme, in a pan, bring to boil. Lower heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Cool slightly and add the red wine, then cool the marinade in the fridge. ; name: mom s tangy beef casserole ; ingredients: lean ground beef, onion, green beans, corn, condensed tomato soup, steak sauce, seasoned pepper, crushed red pepper flakes, potatoes ; preparation:Start potatoes to boil for mashing. Brown beef with peppers and steak sauce, add onions towards the end of the browning so they soften slightly. Drain browned beef leaving enough of the juices for flavor and place in a medium casserole dish. Add beans, soup and corn if desired and stir to mix well. Spread mashed potatoes on top of mixture. Bake covered in an oven preheated to 375 for 25 minutes. Optionally remove covering and bake for an additional 10-15 minutes to brown the potato. ; name: cabbage and sausages braised in beer ; ingredients: butter, kielbasa, mustard, beer, cabbage, salt and pepper ; preparation:Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the sausages and brown on all sides, about 5 minutes. Add the beer and mustard and simmer until slightly reduced, about 3 minutes. Add the cabbage, stir to combine, cover and simmer for 5 minutes. Stir again and cook for an additional 2-4 minutes until the cabbage is wilted but still green. Season with salt and pepper to taste. ; name: ruth s mayo chicken ; ingredients: chicken breasts, mayonnaise, apple cider vinegar, lemon juice ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Mix together all ingredients except chicken. Spread a thin layer of the mayonnaise mixture on bottom of casserole dish. Be careful the chicken must all be flat, not stacked on top of each other. Place each breast, in the casserole dish. Then spread the remaining mixture out. Bake for about 30-45 minutes will look like it is boiling. ; name: rosemary and gouda buttermilk biscuits ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, baking powder, baking soda, unsalted butter, buttermilk, gouda cheese, dried rosemary, salt, milk ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 f. Whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a large bowl. Add the butter and rub it into the flour using your finger. Crumble the rosemary needles in your hand and add them to the mixture. Add the cheese and toss to combine. Pour in the buttermilk and fold in gently with a spatula until mixture forms a sticky dough. Divide roughly into 8 and drop onto a parchment lined baking sheet. Bake for about 12 minutes until golden on top or a toothpick comes out clean. ; name: saint christopher soup ; ingredients: vegetable broth, red cabbage, lemon juice, salt and pepper ; preparation:Prepare a good vegetable broth. Place the finely chopped cabbage, lemon juice, salt, and pepper in a deep bowl. Let the mixture sit for an hour, stirring from time to time. Bring the broth to a boil, add the cabbage and all contents of the bowl, and cook for about 5 minutes. Serve immediately after. ; name: delicious and easy lentils ; ingredients: canadian bacon, butter, carrot, onion, water, lentils, salt, marjoram, dried parsley, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Lightly brown the canadian bacon over med heat. Add butter, onion, and carrots and saute for 5 minutes. Add water, lentils, salt and herbs. Cover and simmer on low for 20 minutes. Uncover and simmer for 5 more minutes. Add the parmesan cheese and serve. ; name: peanut butter chicken with chile ; ingredients: skinless chicken, olive oil, onions, garlic, natural-style peanut butter, ground coriander, red pepper flakes, tomato sauce ; preparation:

name: my favorite rice pudding ; ingredients: eggs, milk, sugar, butter, vanilla, salt, cooked rice, raisins, cinnamon, nutmeg ; preparation:Beat eggs. Add milk, sugar, rice, eggs, butter, vanilla and salt to the eggs. Pour into buttered baking dish. Sprinkle with cinnamon and nutmeg. Bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes or until set. ; name: peasant turnip slaw with sweet hot mustard dressing ; ingredients: cabbage, turnips, carrot, celery, sugar, white vinegar, canola oil, sweet-hot mustard, celery seed, salt and pepper ; preparation:Peel turnips and carrot. Shred or julienne cut all the vegetables. Toss veggies with sugar. Mix dressing ingredients, whipping with a fork or a whisk until the mustard is dissolved. Toss dressing with veggies. Chill at least one hour to blend flavors. ; name: tortilla club ; ingredients: flour tortillas, deli ham, deli turkey, medium cheddar, lettuce, tomatoes, french onion dip, guacamole, bacon bits, salsa ; preparation:Add one or all ingredients to tortilla. I spread the french onion dip. Put the meats, cheese, lettuce, tomato, bacon bits, salsa. Roll up and slice in half. Serve with tortilla chips and more salsa cold. ; name: aunt helen s green congealed salad ; ingredients: cottage cheese, crushed pineapple, evaporated milk, lime jell-o gelatin, cider vinegar, celery, nuts, boiling water ; preparation:Dissolve jellow in boiling water. Add vinegar. Chill til thickened. Whip evaporated milk. Fold into thickened jello together with remaining ingredients. Turn into buttered 8 cup mold and chill til firm. ; name: vermont cheddar potato soup ; ingredients: unsalted butter, spanish onion, cracked black pepper, potatoes, vermont sharp cheddar cheese, homemade chicken stock, bay leaves, nutmeg ; preparation:In a 6-quart pot combine the butter and saut the onions with the black pepper until the onions are tender. Add the potatoes and chicken stock and bring to a boil. Simmer for 45 minutes to 1 hour. Remove from the heat and gradually stir in the cheese until melted. Carefully ladle contents and bay leaves into a food blender and puree until creamy. Return to the pot and carefully re-heat to serve. Garnish with fresh ground nutmeg and fresh shredded vermont cheddar. ; name: the easiest ever carrot sesame salad ; ingredients: carrots, lemon juice, sugar, salt, soy sauce, dark sesame oil, parsley ; preparation:Peel the carrots and shred them with a coarse grater. Put in a bowl with the chopped parsley. Add the rest of the ingredients and mix well. The flavor mellows if you can let it rest for an hour or more. Drain off some of the juice when serving. The leftover juice is very tasty ad could be added to a green salad as dressing. Variations. Add a tablespoon or so of toasted sesame seeds. Add some julienned red chili pepper for a spicy version. If you have access to an japanese grocery, you can substitute dashi granules or konbu powder for the salt. You can substitute ponzu for the lemon juice. ; name: lime salmon fillets ; ingredients: salmon fillets, dried thyme, salt, ground black pepper, butter, green onions, lime zest, lime ; preparation:Sprinkle the side of salmon fillets without skin with thyme, salt and pepper. In a skillet, melt butter at medium-high heat. Add salmon fillets, skin side up, and cook for about 4 minutes or until the bottom of fillets is lightly golden. Flip the salmon fillets and sprinkle with green onions and lime zest. Keep on cooking for 3 to 6 minutes or until the fish flakes easily with a fork. Serve with quarters of lime. ; name: parsley soup with chive cream ; ingredients: leeks, fresh curly-leaf parsley, butter, floury potatoes, chicken stock, double cream, salt & freshly ground black pepper, chives ; preparation:

name: weeknight pasta salad ; ingredients: pasta, grilled chicken breast strips, peas, red pepper, onion, miracle whip, italian dressing ; preparation:Cook pasta as directed on package. Drain. Add remaining ingredients. Mix lightly. Cover. Refrigerate at least 1 hour before serving. ; name: creole ranch salad dressing ; ingredients: sour cream, fresh garlic clove, buttermilk, vinegar, fresh basil leaves, crushed red pepper flakes, mayonnaise, salt, black peppercorns ; preparation:Combine the sour cream, garlic, buttermilk, vinegar, and basil in a food processor or blender. Process this for 20 seconds. Add the crushed red pepper and the mayonnaise. Process for another 20 seconds. Season the dressing with salt and cracked black peppercorn to suit your taste. Process dressing another 15 seconds. If not serving immediately, place dressing in a container. Tightly seal container and keep the dressing refrigerated until use. ; name: artichoke flatbread grilled ; ingredients: whole wheat flat bread, olive oil, fresh spinach, goat cheese, marinated artichoke hearts, tomatoes, pizza seasoning, salt, pepper ; preparation:Lightly brush both sides of 4 whole wheat flatbreads with olive oil. Grill directly over medium heat for 2 minutes to toast. Remove from grill. Divide fresh spinach, garlic and herb goat cheese, marinated artichoke hearts and tomato among flatbreads. Grill about 2 minutes more or until bottoms are browned and toppings are heated through. Sprinkle with salt, pepper, and pizza seasoning. ; name: kickn shepherd s pie ; ingredients: ground beef, mashed potatoes, cheese, rotel tomatoes ; preparation:Brown ground beef with either rotel tomatoes or salsa. Drain completely. Make mashed potatoes which ever way you like them. Place ground beef in a pan and spread mashed potatoes over the top. Sprinkle as much cheese as you like over top of potatoes. Bake at 350f until cheese is melted. ; name: twice baked ham and cheese potatoes ; ingredients: potatoes, cheddar cheese, milk, ham, sour cream, onion salt, pepper, butter, paprika ; preparation:Bake potatoes at 400 degrees fahrenheit for 1 hour until soft. Slice potatoes in half lengthwise. Scoop out insides, leaving a firm shell. Place potato pulp, cheddar cheese, milk, ham, sour cream, onion salt, pepper, and butter in a mixing bowl. Beat at high speed until smooth. Fill potato shells with mixture. Bake at 350 degrees fahrenheit for 20 to 30 minutes. Garnish with paprika or parsley. ; name: atkin induction friendly crustless quiche ; ingredients: bacon, yellow onion, eggs, cream, spinach, gruyere cheese, salt, black pepper ; preparation:Heat oven to 350 and butter your deep pie pan or your muffin tins. Cook bacon until crisp, drain and coarsely chop. Use one tbsp of drippings to saute onions for 5 minutes until soft but not brown. Combine eggs, cream, spinach, cheese, salt and pepper. Stir in bacon and onion. Pour mixture into prepared pan. Bake 1 hour 15 minutes. ; name: spaghetti with basil cream sauce ; ingredients: heavy cream, basil leaves, fresh lemon juice, salt, spaghetti ; preparation:In a saucepan, gently boil the cream until it is reduced by half, about 10 minutes. Stir in the basil, lemon juice, and salt. Meanwhile, cook pasta in a large pot of salted boiling water until al dente, about 7-10 minutes. Drain. Toss pasta with cream sauce and serve. ; name: my stuffed bell peppers soup ; ingredients: lean ground beef, green bell peppers, onion, jalapenos, chopped tomatoes, tomato paste, beef broth, steamed rice, onion soup mix ; preparation:

name: banana split smoothies ; ingredients: bananas, crushed pineapple, milk, fresh strawberries, honey, ice cubes, whipped topping, chocolate syrup, maraschino cherry ; preparation:In a blender, combine the first five ingredients. Cover and process until smooth. Gradually add ice, blending until slushy. Pour into chilled glasses. Garnish with whipped topping, chocolate syrup and cherries. ; name: hot chocolate sauce ; ingredients: semi-sweet chocolate chips, butter, half-and-half, corn syrup, salt, vanilla ; preparation:Melt chocolate, butter, half-and-half, corn syrup and salt in a large heavy saucepan on low heat, stirring constantly until mixture is smooth. When mixture is smooth, take off heat and let set for 10 minutes. Then stir in the vanilla. Serve hot over ice cream for hot fudge sundae. Add a few nuts on top if desired. ; name: chewy peanut butter bars ; ingredients: butter, creamy peanut butter, sugar, all-purpose flour, eggs, vanilla ; preparation:In a large saucepan, melt the butter and peanut butter. Remove from the heat. Add sugar and flour. Stir in the eggs and vanilla. Spread into a greased 13-in. X 9-in x 2-in baking pan. Bake at 350 for 28-32 minutes or until lightly browned and edges start to pull away from sides of pan. ; name: parmesan grilled sweet onions ; ingredients: sweet onions, butter, parmesan cheese, salt, pepper ; preparation:Place each onion half, cut side up on a square of heavy-duty aluminum foil. Dot each with butter. Sprinkle with cheese, salt and pepper. Wrap onions tightly in foil. Grill 20 to 30 minutes or until tender. ; name: grandma betty s best banananut bread ; ingredients: butter, sugar, eggs, bananas, all-purpose flour, salt, baking soda, nuts ; preparation:Mix together butter, sugar, eggs, and bananas. Add the rest of the ingredients and blend. Spray a 9x5 inch pan with oil spray. Add mix to pan and bake at 350 degrees for 50 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean. After removing from oven, allow to cool for 5 minutes then let finish cooling on a cooling rack. ; name: cinnamon saffron coffee ; ingredients: ground coffee, ground cinnamon, saffron, water, honey ; preparation:Add the coffee, cinnamon and saffron to your coffee pot or ibrik. Stir the three together so that it will all brew together. Add the water and start coffee pot or boil and rest the usual 3 times for the ibrik. When done pour into your cup, sweeten as or if desired. Sit back and enjoy what may be the best cup of coffee ever. ; name: pecan crusted chicken drumsticks ; ingredients: chicken drumsticks, chicken legs, egg, corn flake crumbs, pecans, sugar, salt, onion powder, black pepper, butter ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400e toss chicken legs with egg to coat. Combine cornflakes, pecans, sugar, salt, onion powder and pepper in large resealable plastic food storage bag. Add chicken legs two at a time. Shake to coat. Place chicken on foil-lined baking sheet. Drizzle with melted butter. Bake 40 to 45 minutes or until tender. ; name: freezer orange sherbet ; ingredients: unflavored gelatin, orange juice, sugar, lemon juice, whipping cream ; preparation:

name: honey mustard glazed parsnips ; ingredients: parsnip, olive oil, honey, coarse grain mustard, salt and pepper ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 400f. Peel parsnips and halve lengthways. Place in a roasting dish with the olive oil and stir well to coat. Season and roast for 40-45 mins or until the parsnips are soft and golden. Mix honey with wholegrain mustard and pour over parsnips for the last 5 mins of cooking time. ; name: garlic balsamic and rosemary roasted potatoes ; ingredients: potatoes, olive oil, balsamic vinegar, garlic cloves, rosemary sprigs, coarse sea salt, fresh ground pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f. Combine all ingredients on a large greased baking sheet. Arrange in a single layer. Roast in preheated oven for about 50 minutes, turning once during cooking, until potatoes are tender. Serves 6. ; name: barley broth ; ingredients: vegetable stock, pearl barley, leek, celery ribs, carrots, parsnip, white wine, tomato puree, bay leaves, parsley ; preparation:Put stock in a pan with the barley and gently boil for 10 minutes. While barley is boiling finely chop the leek, celery, carrot and parsnip. Put the wine in a large pan and add the leek, covver and steam for 5 mins, stirring occasionally. Add the other veg and cook for a further 5 minutes. Stir in tomato puree, bay leaves and the barley plus stock. Lower the heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Serve with hot toast rubbed with a garlic clove or crusty bread. ; name: philadelphia meatball heroes ; ingredients: meatballs, spaghetti sauce, green bell pepper, red bell pepper, onion, hoagie rolls, cheddar cheese ; preparation:In a large saucepan, cook meatballs in spaghetti sauce over medium heat for 10 to 12 minutes or until meatballs are hot, stirring occasionally. Meanwhile, spray a medium skillet with nonstick cooking spray. Add the bell peppers and onion. Cook for 5 to 6 minutes over medium-high heat or until peppers are crisp-tender, stirring often. Split buns lengthwise, making sure not to cut all the way through. Place on an ungreased cookie sheet. Place meatballs in buns. Top each with pepper mixture. Sprinkle each with cheddar cheese. Broil 4 to 6 inches from heat for 2 to 3 minutes or until cheese has melted. ; name: ww 2 points banana mousse ; ingredients: banana, dark rum, lemon juice, fat-free whipped topping ; preparation:In medium bowl, combine banana slices, rum, and lemon juice. Let marinade 1 hour. Transfer to food processor or blender and process until pureed. Transfer to medium bowl, fold in whipped cream. Serve immediately or cover with plastic wrap and freeze. 2 points per serving. ; name: cherry cream parfaits ; ingredients: whipping cream, sugar, salt, vanilla, sour cream, cherry pie filling, nuts ; preparation:Whip cream to soft peaks. Slowly add sugar, salt and vanilla. Beat to stiff peaks. Fold in sour cream. Spoon half the pie filling in parfait glasses. Top with the cream mix. Repeat the layers. Sprinkle with nuts. ; name: oyster sauce beef ; ingredients: beef, egg white, oyster sauce, sherry wine, cornstarch, sugar, soy sauce, green onions, fresh ginger, oil ; preparation:Marinate beef in egg white, oyster sauce, sherry, cornstarch, soy sauce and sugar for 1 hour. Heat oil in frying pan until hot. Stir-fry green onions and ginger 1 minute. Add beef. Stir-fry 4 minutes. Serve hot. ; name: cajun spiced popcorn ; ingredients: popped popcorn, butter, chili powder, onion powder, garlic powder, cayenne pepper, salt, lemon pepper ; preparation:

name: super budget macaroni cheese ; ingredients: macaroni, milk, flour, salt, ground black pepper, cheese, fresh breadcrumb ; preparation:Cook pasta. Drain. Set aside. Warm milk in saucepan. When it is just warm to the touch, whisk in half the flour. Let the milk begin to simmer, whisking all the time. You be the judge of the thickness - we like it really thick. If you want it thicker, add the remaining flour and continue to whisk until smooth and thick. Stir through the cheese and the salt and pepper until the cheese is melted. Take off the heat. Pour into a baking dish and sprinkle the breadcrumbs over the top. Bake for 30 minutes at 180 degrees celcius. ; name: pork chops merlot ; ingredients: olive oil, butter, pork chops, red wine vinegar, dried rosemary, pepper, merlot ; preparation:In skillet, heat oil and butter. Add pork chops browning well on both sides. Add vinegar, rosemary, and pepper. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer 10 to 15 minutes. Remove pork. Keep warm. Add wine to pan. Heat until sauce is syrupy, about 5 minutes. Spoon sauce over pork chops when serving. ; name: easy coleslaw with a kick ; ingredients: coleslaw mix, mayonnaise, sugar, apple cider vinegar, crushed pineapple, pineapple juice, wasabi, salt, pepper ; preparation:Mix everything but the coleslaw together. Pay special attention to be sure the wasabi is well blended. A trick i learned that works very well, is to put all the ingredients but the coleslaw mix into a big ziploc bag, then squish, shake, and massage the ingredients into a nice smooth blend. Then add the coleslaw mix and the ingredients together in a large bowl and mix well. Cover and put it in the fridge for a couple hours to overnight to allow all the flavors to blend inches it will be soupy on the bottom, but the salad will be crisp. ; name: orange israeli couscous with snow peas ; ingredients: israeli couscous, chicken, snow peas, green onions, slivered almonds, orange, salt and pepper, orange, juice and zest of, seasoned rice wine vinegar, olive oil ; preparation:Heat some olive oil in a small pot. Add the couscous and toast for 2 minutes. Add the broth and simmer, covered for about 8 to 10 minutes. Take pot off heat. In a salad dressing shaker or a jar with a lid, add dressing ingredients and shake. Steam the snow peas for about 4 minutes. Put into an ice bath to stop cooking. In a medium bowl, add the couscous, snow peas, green onions, almonds, oranges and some salt and freshly ground pepper. Reshake and pour some dressing on. Mix and serve at room temperature. ; name: no crust pineapple pie ; ingredients: milk, sugar, biscuit mix, butter, eggs, vanilla, crushed pineapple ; preparation:In blender, combine first 6 ingredients. Process until smooth. Spoon pineapple over the bottom of a greased deep-dish 9 inch pie plate. Pour batter over pineapple. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes, or until knife comes out clean. ; name: zack s slow cooker baked beans and sausage ; ingredients: center-cut bacon, baked beans, smoked sausage, hickory flavored barbecue sauce, steak sauce, brown sugar ; preparation:Fry bacon and drain on paper towels. While frying bacon slice smoked sausage on the bias and place all remaining ingredients in crock pot or slow cooker. Using a small amount of the bacon grease brown the smoked sausage. Crumble bacon and place in cooker. Stir in smoked sausage. Cover and cook on low 4hrs. To save time i sometimes use the precooked bacon bits, bacon is a must for my family in this dish. ; name: the creamiest pepper parmesan dressing ; ingredients: sour cream, mayonnaise, parmesan cheese, garlic, salt, fresh coarse ground black pepper, buttermilk, red wine vinegar, fresh parsley, feta cheese ; preparation:In small bowl, combine sour cream, mayonnaise and parmesan cheese and set aside. Mash garlic and salt together until it forms a paste. Add to sour cream mixture along with black pepper. Whisk in remaining ingredients. Store covered, in refrigerator. ; name: flourless and sugar free peanut butter cookies ; ingredients: peanut butter, splenda sugar substitute, egg, vanilla ; preparation:

name: korean beef ; ingredients: soy sauce, cayenne, garlic powder, vinegar, sesame oil, black pepper, sesame seeds, green onion, boneless beef cube, long-grain white rice ; preparation:Mix all ingredients in container to marinate. Cover and refrigerate overnight. To barbeque, bbq on high heat one minute each side. Or indoors, get skillet very hot. Toss in meat and cook over high heat 2 minutes each side. Quick fry the onions and add marinade. Serve over rice cooked as usual using two cups uncooked rice. ; name: double chocolate kisses ; ingredients: almonds, chocolate frosting, butter, graham cracker crumbs, almond extract, milk chocolate kisses ; preparation:Pulse almonds in a food processor until very finely ground, like coarse sand. Pour ground almonds into a pie pan or other shallow bowl and set aside. Beat chocolate frosting and butter in large bowl with a hand mixer until well blended. Stir in graham cracker crumbs and almond extract. Shape chocolate mixture into 1-inch balls. Roll each ball in almonds to coat. Place balls on a cookie sheet. Using your finger, make a deep indentation in the center of each ball. Fill the indentations with chocolate kiss candies. Refrigerate for 30 minutes, or until cold. ; name: impossible quiche ; ingredients: mushroom, milk, cheese, eggs, onion, bisquick baking mix, salt, fresh ground pepper, thyme ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Lightly grease a 9-10 inch pie plate. Sprinkle mushrooms, cheese, and onion evenly over bottom of pie plate. Place remaining ingredients in blender, cover, and blend on high for 1 minute. Pour into pie plate. Bake until golden brown and knife inserted in center comes out clean. Let stand 5 minues before cutting. Refrigerate leftovers. ; name: hubby s chewy brownies ; ingredients: sugar, cocoa, flour, baking powder, salt, butter, eggs, water, vanilla ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f grease a 9x13-inch baking pan. Combine dry ingredients in a medium bowl. Add remaining ingredients, stir well. Pour into prepared dish. Bake for 27-35 minutes or until a toothpick comes out slightly sticky. Cool pan on a wire rack. ; name: krispie candies ; ingredients: chocolate chips, butterscotch chips, chow mein noodles, salted peanuts ; preparation:Put chocolate chips and butterscotch chips in the saucepan. Put the saucepan on the burner and turn on the stove to low. Stir and stir until the mixture is melted and smooth. Remove saucepan from heat. Turn off the burner and quickly add the chow mein noodles and the peanuts. Mix and stir until they are evenly coated. Cover the cookie sheets with wax paper. Drop the candy by teaspoonfuls onto the wax paper-covered cookie sheets. Put the cookie sheets into the refrigerator to cool the candies. When they are cool, take them off the waxed paper. Put them in plastic bags. Keep them in the refrigerator. ; name: four cheese macaroni ; ingredients: elbow macaroni, milk, butter, white pepper, salt, american cheese, sharp cheddar cheese, mozzarella cheese, ricotta cheese, crackers ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degree f. In a large pot cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain. Return to pot. Add milk, melted butter, pepper, and salt. Stir in cheeses. Transfer to a greased 2-quart casserole. Bake, uncovered, for 15 minutes. Carefully stir mixture. Sprinkle with crushed crackers. Bake 5 minutes more or until crackers are browned and mixture is just heated through. Let stand 10 minutes before serving. ; name: chilly day chicken soup stew ; ingredients: butter, potatoes, onion, carrots, chicken broth, pasta, instant rice, chicken meat, salt & pepper ; preparation:Boil fast in a little water add margarine, potatoes, onion, & carrots until 10 minutes from being done. Add chicken broth or buillion, pasta, & rice. Add chicken. Salt& pepper. Cook about 10 minutes. Until pasta and rice are done. ; name: sweet and sour kielbasa kabobs ; ingredients: brown sugar, cornstarch, apple juice, cider vinegar, orange zest, kielbasa, green bell pepper, onion, pineapple chunk ; preparation:

name: mixed pepper salad ; ingredients: green bell peppers, yellow bell peppers, red bell peppers, olive oil, garlic clove, pepperoncini peppers ; preparation:Preheat the broiler. Place peppers on a broiler pan and place under the broiler, turning occasionally, until the skins become blackened. Remove from the oven and place in a paper bag or cover with foil until cool enough to handle. Using a sharp knife, peel off and dispose of the charred skins. Core and seed the peppers. Cut each pepper into 8-10 long strip. Place in a bowl. In a small bowl stir together the oil and garlic. Seed and stem the pepperocinis, slice into thin rounds and stir into the oil. Pour oil mixture over the peppers, toss, cover and refrigerate until chilled. Refreshing with grilled or broiled meats. ; name: old fashion peanut butter roll ; ingredients: sugar, water, corn syrup, vanilla, egg whites ; preparation:First beat 3 egg whites until stiff. Prepare the surface to roll out the candy. Cover the surface with wax paper and spread a thick layer of powdered sugar. Next mix all ingredients except vanilla in a large pot and boil. Stirring continously, until ball forms. The ball should be hard and have a soft crack. Add vanilla. Slowly pour the mixture over the egg whites while mixing with a blender the whole time. Continue to mix until the candy has cooled and resembles the texture of marshmallow cream. Pour onto powdered sugar and roll thin. Spread a thin layer of peanut butter. Roll up and cut. ; name: blueberry spice sauce ; ingredients: sugar, cornstarch, cinnamon, nutmeg, hot water, lemon juice, blueberries ; preparation:Rinse and clean blueberries. If using frozen dry pack blueberries, thaw them first. In small saucepan, combine sugar, cornstarch, cinnamon and nutmeg. Gradually stir in water and lemon juice. Over medium heat, cook, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens and comes to a boil. Add blueberries. Cook and stir until mixture comes back to a boil. Serve warm over ice cream or cake or frozen pies. ; name: beet greens with bacon and balsamic vinegar ; ingredients: beet leaf, beets, bacon, olive oil, onion, water, balsamic vinegar, salt and pepper ; preparation:In a large skillet over medium high heat, cook bacon in olive oil until starting to lightly brown, about 5-7 minutes. Add chopped onion and continue to cook until onion is translucent and starts to brown lightly, another 3- 4 minutes. Add beet greens and roasted beets, water and a pinch of salt and pepper. Cover and cook for 3-4 minutes, stirring occasionally, until greens start to wilt. Add balsamic vinegar and continue to cook until greens have wilted, about another 3-4 minutes and liquid has evaporated slightly. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Transfer to serving bowl and offer additional balsamic at the table, if desired. ; name: grilled skewered sea scallops ; ingredients: fresh lime juice, olive oil, garlic clove, ground cumin, chili powder, salt, cayenne pepper, sea scallops, cherry tomatoes, lime ; preparation:Whisk lime juice, oil, garlic, cumin, chili powder, salt, and cayenne together in small bowl. Thread scallops and tomatoes alternately on 4 skewers. Place on platter and drizzle with marinade. Cover and refrigerate, basting once with marinade, about 30 minutes. Prepare charcoal for grilling or heat broiler. Grill or broil skewers, basting with marinade but not turning, just until scallops are cooked through, 5-7 minutes. Place lime wedge on each skewer and serve. ; name: grilled tuscan chicken ; ingredients: shallot, tomato paste, molasses, garlic, fresh rosemary, fresh oregano, lemon, juice and zest of, dry red wine, chicken ; preparation:In blender or food processor, combine all ingredients except chicken. Process until herbs are finely minced. Place chickens in large shallow dish and pour marinade over them. Cover and refrigerate several hours or overnight, turning several times. Grill chicken over medium-hot coals, turning several times and basting with marinade, until crisp and browned, about 40 minutes. ; name: creamy strawberry filled angel cake ; ingredients: boiling water, sugar-free strawberry gelatin, water, strawberry, fat-free whipped topping, angel food cake, berries ; preparation:Pour boiling water over gelatin in large bowl. Stir until gelatin is dissolved. Stir in cold water. Refrigerate about 1 hour or until thickened but not set. Fold 1 pint of strawberries and half of the whipped topping into the gelatin mixture. Refrigerate 15 minutes or until thickened but not set. Split cake horizontally to make 3 layers. Fill layers with gelatin mixture. Spoon or pipe remaining whipped topping onto top of cake. Garnish with extra berries. Cover and refrigerate until serving. ; name: banana cream protein pie ; ingredients: 9-inch low-fat pie shell, sugar-free fat-free banana cream pudding mix, skim milk, vanilla protein powder, banana, sugar-free cool whip ; preparation:

name: perfect divinity ; ingredients: sugar, light corn syrup, water, salt, egg whites, vanilla, pecans ; preparation:In a 2 quart saucepan combine sugar, corn syrup, water, and salt. Cook to hardball stage,, stirring only until sugar dissolves. Meanwhile, as temperature of syrup reaches 250 degrees, beat egg white till stiff peaks form. When syrup reaches 260 degrees, very gradually add the syrup to egg whites, beating at high speed with electric mixer. Add vanilla and beat until candy holds its shape, 4-5 minutes. Stir in the chopped nuts or cherries, if desired. Quickly drop candy from a teaspoon onto waxed paper, swirling the top of each piece. Let cool. ; name: butter fried rice ; ingredients: rice, butter, egg, onions, shallot, garlic cloves, star anise, salt ; preparation:Heat butter on a frying pan and fry shallot and garlic until fragrant. Then bottom part of spring onions and star anise. Continue to fry for about 2 minutes. Add rice and stir to mix. Make a hole in the middle and add egg into it. Again, stir to mix. Finally add the upper part of spring onions and some salt to taste. Continue to stir until all ingredients are thoroughly mixed. ; name: toasted orzo with parsley ; ingredients: olive oil, orzo pasta, chicken broth, butter, kosher salt, pepper, parsley ; preparation:Heat oil in l skillet over medium high heat until oil is shimmering and then add the orzo. Toast, stirring frequently, until it starts to turn golden brown. Stir in broth and bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer until orzo is tender and broth is absorbed. Remove from heat. Let stand 5 minutes. Uncover and stir in butter, salt, peper and parsley. ; name: ricotta and tomato fettuccine ; ingredients: fettuccine, butter, ricotta cheese, asiago cheese, garlic powder, tomatoes, fresh basil leaves ; preparation:Cook fettuccine as directed on package. Drain. Return to saucepan. Stir together butter, ricotta cheese, half of the asagio cheese and garlic powder. Toss with the hot cooked fettucine. Top with tomatoes and basil and remaining asagio cheese. ; name: chilean sea bass with ginger and lemon ; ingredients: sea bass steak, gingerroot, lemon, olive oil, salt, pepper ; preparation:In a baking dish, marinade for 20min up to a couple of hours. Ginger juice. Juice of 1 lemon. Drizzle with olive oil. Salt and pepper to taste. Preheat over to 450. Drain excess marinade. Cover dish with foil and bake for 20 minutes at 450. ; name: easy awesome guacamole ; ingredients: avocados, salsa, sour cream, mayonnaise, onion powder, pepper, salt, garlic, lemon juice, fresh chives ; preparation:Cut avocados in half and take out the seed, scoop out meat with a spoon and place in bowl. Mash the avocado with a fork. Add the salsa, mayonnaise, sour cream, salt, pepper, garlic and onion powder. Mix together well. Add lemon juice, mix and serve. Garnish with fresh chives. ; name: cauliflower and crab chowder ; ingredients: cauliflower florets, chicken broth, red bell pepper, lemon peel, half-and-half, all-purpose flour, imitation crabmeat, dill weed ; preparation:In a large saucepan combine cauliflower, broth, bell pepper and lemon peel. Bring to boiling, reduce heat. Cover and simmer 6 to 8 minutes or until cauliflower is crisp tender. Stir together half and half and flour. Stir into cauliflower mixture. Bring to boiling. Gently stir in crabmeat. Heat through. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle with dill weed, if desired. Serve immediately. ; name: smashed potatoes with green garlic butter ; ingredients: yukon gold potatoes, heavy cream, salt, butter, garlic, fresh parsley, salt and pepper ; preparation:

name: double layer coffee almond fudge ; ingredients: dark chocolate, condensed milk, instant coffee, cinnamon, salt, almonds, vanilla, white chocolate, sliced almonds ; preparation:Place first 5 ingredients in container and microwave on high for 1 minute, stir till smooth, it may need a further 30 seconds. Stir in chopped almonds and vanilla and pour into a foil lined 5 x 8 inch rectangular pan, place in fridge to set whilst you prepare the top layer. Place white chocolate and second lot of condensed milk in micro container and micro for 30 seconds, stir and remicro for a further 15 seconds if needed till smooth. Add flaked almonds and stir, then pour over top of dark chocolate fudge layer patting down till smooth. Place in fridge to set. ; name: japanese style sesame chicken ; ingredients: chicken breast, sesame oil, ground ginger, onion powder, garlic powder, sesame seeds, soy sauce ; preparation:Use the sesame oil to coat a wok or nonstick pan. Add chicken and cook over low heat until almost cooked through. Mix the ginger, onion powder, garlic powder, and sesame seeds in a small bowl. Sprinkle over chicken and saute over medium-high heat. Turn heat to high and add soy sauce, sauting until fully incorporated and the chicken is slightly seared. Serve immediately. ; name: santa fe style pumpkin seeds pepitas 2 ww points ; ingredients: pumpkin seeds, worcestershire sauce, liquid smoke, ground cumin, dried ancho chile powder, garlic powder, paprika, cinnamon, cayenne ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 325f line a large baking pan with parchment paper. Combine the pumpkin seeds, worcestershire sauce and liquid smoke in a large bowl. Toss to coat. Combine the remaining ingredients in a small bowl. Sprinkle over the pumpkin seeds. Stir vigorously with a wooden spoon to evenly coat. Spread the seeds out on the baking sheet. Bake, stirring twice, until dried and lightly browned, about 15 minutes. Let cool on the baking sheet on a rack about 30 minutes. Serve at once or store in a ziploc bag up to 1 month. ; name: irish coffee muffins ; ingredients: flour, baking powder, salt, sugar, instant coffee granules, coffee liqueur, irish whiskey, milk, egg, butter ; preparation:Line 12 muffin-tin cups with paper liners. Preheat oven to 375. In a bowl, combine flour, baking powder, salt and sugar. Stir well. In a 1-cup measure, dissolve coffee granules in coffee liqueur and whiskey. Add enough milk to measure 1 cup. Whisk egg in a bowl with coffee-milk mixture. Whisk in melted butter. Gently stir liquid into dry ingredients just until moistened. Spoon into muffin tin. Bake at 375 for 25 minutes, or until the top springs back when gently touched. ; name: finger lickin chicken ; ingredients: chicken drumsticks, vegetable oil, flour, cajun seasoning, cayenne pepper, salt ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Rub the oil over the chicken pieces. Place flour, cajun seasoning, cayenne pepper and salt in large bowl and mix well. Toss chicken pieces in the flour until lightly coated. Place them on a wire rack and sit rack on a baking sheet. Cook chicken for 35-45 minutes until cooked through and skin is crispy. Serve hot. ; name: honey garlic meatloaf ; ingredients: ground beef, egg, dry breadcrumbs, honey, lemon pepper seasoning, garlic cloves, ketchup ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease an 8x10 glass baking dish. Set aside. In a bowl, combine all ingredients then transfer to bakind dish. Top with desired amount of ketchup. Bake at 350 for 1. 25 hours. Let stand for 3-5 minutes before serving. ; name: mediterranean chicken w rosemary orzo ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breast, garlic, orzo pasta, fat free chicken broth, water, fresh rosemary leaves, salt, zucchini, plum tomatoes, green pepper ; preparation:Spray 10 inch skillet with cooking spray and heat over medium-high heat. Add chicken, stir-fry until browned, about 5 minutes. Stir in orzo, garlic and broth. Heat until boiling. Reduce heat, cover and simmer about 8 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Stir in remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil. Cover and simmer about 5 minutes, stirring once until pepper is crisp-tender and orzo is tender. ; name: happy hour mushrooms ; ingredients: mushrooms, butter, garlic, monterey jack cheese, dry white wine, soy sauce, fine cracker crumb ; preparation:

name: snow peas with fresh mint ; ingredients: butter, slivered almonds, snow peas, fresh mint leaves, salt, pepper ; preparation:If using frozen snow peas, thaw first. Melt butter over medium heat and lightly brown the slivered almonds. Add snow peas, fresh mint and 2 tablespoons water. Cover pan and cook 2-3 minutes or just until snow peas are crisp-tender. Season with salt and pepper to taste. ; name: hungarian cheese spread liptauer ; ingredients: cream cheese, cottage cheese, capers, caraway seed, dry mustard, paprika ; preparation:Cream together all ingredients. Place into a bowl or pretty mold covered with plastic wrap. Cover top of cheese with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours overnight is best. Unmold on to a serving plate and surround with rye bread squares, fresh veggies, or crackers. ; name: quick marinara sauce ; ingredients: extra virgin olive oil, garlic, crushed red pepper flakes, whole tomatoes, crushed tomatoes, fresh oregano, flat leaf parsley, fresh basil, salt and black pepper ; preparation:Heat deep skillet over medium-low to medium heat. Add oil and garlic and crushed pepper flakes. Let garlic begin to sizzle in oil. Add tomatoes and crushed tomatoes. Stir in herbs and spices and let sauce come to a boil. Reduce heat and let sauce simmer 10 minutes or until ready to serve. Serve over your favorite pasta. ; name: one pan sage and onion chicken and sausage ; ingredients: onions, olive oil, english mustard, dried sage, fresh ground black pepper, worcestershire sauce, lemon, roasting chickens, sausages, fresh sage leaves ; preparation:Peel and cut the onion into eighths, and put into a freezer bag with the oil, mustard, dried sage, a good grinding of pepper, and worcestershire sauce. Cut lemon in half, squeeze juice into bag, and then cut the halves into eighths and add them. Squidge everything around to mix and then add the chicken pieces. Leave to marinade in the refrigerator overnight, or for up to 2 days. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees f. Allow the chicken to come to room temperature in its marinade. Arrange the chicken pieces in a roasting tin skin side up with the marinade, including all the bits and pieces, and tuck the sausages around them. Sprinkle the fresh sage leaves over the chicken and sausages and then put the tin into the oven to cook for 1 hour and 15 minutes. Turn the sausages over half way through to color them evenly. Arrange the chicken and sausages on a large platter. ; name: rao s lemon chicken ; ingredients: fryer chickens, olive oil, fresh lemon juice, red wine vinegar, garlic, salt and pepper, fresh oregano ; preparation:Broil chicken, skin side down, then turn to char skin. Cool chicken. Cut into pieces. Arrange in pan- skin side down. Pour marinade on top. Broil 3 minutes. Turn, cook 1 minute. Arrange on serving platter& pour juices all over. ; name: strawberry rhapsody jam ; ingredients: strawberries, raspberries, unsweetened apple juice, fruit pectin, artificial sweetener ; preparation:Preheat mason jars and snap lids. Combine strawberries and raspberries and fruit pectin in a large deep stainless steel saucepan. Whisk in fruit pectin. If using sweetener, measure splenda or sugar and set aside. Stirring constantly, bring fruit mixture to a boil over high heat. If using, add sweetener or sugar, and return mixture to a boil, stirring frequently. Boil 3 minutes. Remove form heat. Skim foam. Ladle into hot jars. ; name: pan de yuca colombian cheese bread ; ingredients: cheese, tapioca starch, butter, eggs, salt ; preparation:Using your hands, combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Knead until very thick and firm, about 5 minutes. Turn out onto a dry surface and divide into 4 pieces. Shape each piece into a ball and flatten slightly. Divide each disc into six pieces. Roll each piece between palms to form a 4 inch long cylinder. Repeat with remaining discs. Rolls can be covered and refrigerated at this point up to 2 weeks. Preheat oven to 550f and arrange rolls on baking sheets. Bake until brown and crisp about 6-8 minutes. Serve warm. ; name: chris grilled jalapeno wraps ; ingredients: jalapenos, turkey bacon, cream cheese, cheddar cheese ; preparation:

name: low carb fudge ; ingredients: margarine, unsweetened chocolate, equal sugar substitute, vanilla extract, cream cheese, nuts ; preparation:Melt butter over low heat. Add chocolate and stir until melted. Remove from heat and stir in sweetener and vanilla. Combine the chocolate mixture with the cream cheese and beat until smooth. Stir in nuts and spread in lightly greased 8-inch square pan. Refrigerate until firm. ; name: cornbread low carb ; ingredients: almond flour, baking powder, eggs, cream, water, butter, splenda sugar substitute ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 combine the almond meal and baking powder. Add the cream, water, sweetener, and eggs, stir to combine. Add the melted butter, stir to combine. Spray pam into the muffin tin. Divide the batter amongst 5-6 muffins. Bake for 15-18 minutes until edges are slightly browned and the tops are firm to the touch. Really good with butter& sugar-free, low carb jam or honey. ; name: norwegian coleslaw ; ingredients: head of cabbage, salt, sugar, white vinegar, mustard seeds, celery seed, celery, green pepper, sweet red pepper, carrots ; preparation:Shred cabbage and toss with salt. Cover and refrigerate at least 2 hours. Meanwhile, in a saucepan heat the sugar, vinegar, and seeds, simmering 10 minutes. Cool completely. Add to the cabbage along with the remaining vegetables. Cover and refrigerate at least 24 hours before serving. Keeps 4-6 weeks in the refrigerator. ; name: cazuela chilean chicken stew ; ingredients: chicken drumsticks, butternut squash, potatoes, corn on the cob, carrots, chicken broth, cooked rice, hot pepper sauce, salt and pepper, fresh cilantro ; preparation:In a large soup kettle or dutch oven, place chicken, squash, potatoes, corn, carrots and broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 25 minutes or until chicken is done and vegetables are tender. Serve over rice in a shallow soup bowl. Pass hot pepper sauce, salt, pepper and cilantro or parsley. ; name: open faced cordon bleu ; ingredients: eggs, italian seasoned breadcrumbs, boneless skinless chicken breast halves, vegetable oil, butter, diced tomatoes, oregano, salt, ham, monterey jack cheese ; preparation:Beat eggs in shallow dish. Place bread crumbs in another shallow dish. Dip chicken in egg, then crumbs. Heat oil and butter in lg skillet. Brown chicken on both sides. Put chicken in baking pan. Pour tomatoes over chicken. Sprinkle with oregano and salt. Top chicken pieces with ham and then cheese. Bake at 375 for 15 minutes, or until tomato juice is bubbly. ; name: fresh cranberry muffins ; ingredients: sugar, eggs, butter, almond extract, flour, fresh cranberries, pecans ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray muffin pan with cooking spray. Beat sugar and eggs together until thickened. Add melted butter and almond extract. Beat well. Add flour. Beat well. Stir in cranberries and pecans. Fill muffin pan. Since these do not raise much fill the cups to the top. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until browned on top and done in center. Cool on wire rack. ; name: praline peach sundaes ; ingredients: brown sugar, heavy whipping cream, butter, ground cinnamon, fresh peaches, pecans, vanilla extract, ice cream ; preparation:In large saucepan, whisk the brown sugar, cream, butter and cinnamon until smooth. Bring to a boil and cook and stir for 6-7 minutes or until thickened. Remove from heat and stir in the peaches, pecans and vanilla. Cool for 10 minutes. Add ice cream of choice to sundae dishes and top with peach sauce. Garnish with additional peaches and whipped cream if desired. ; name: black eyed peas with winter squash brown rice ; ingredients: winter squash, black-eyed peas, whole grain brown rice, olive oil, garlic, bell pepper, onion, salt, pepper, hot pepper sauce ; preparation:

name: mcdonald s hot mustard sauce clone ; ingredients: prepared yellow mustard, dark corn syrup, dry mustard, white vinegar, mayonnaise, soy sauce, sugar, cayenne pepper ; preparation:In small microwave safe bowl, combine all ingredients with a fork. Mix well. Microwave on high about 30-35 seconds then mix again. Cover & refrigerate at least 6 hours to allow the flavors to meld. This makes approximately 4 packets worth of hot mustard. ; name: hot faux crab dip ; ingredients: cream cheese, albacore tuna in water, mayonnaise, old bay seasoning, garlic, onion ; preparation:Mix all. Pour into a heatproof dish and top with breadcrumbs or cheese. Bake at 350 degrees f. For 15 to 20 minutes or until bubbly. Serve with crackers or thin slices of french bread. ; name: little grilled mushroom bites ; ingredients: mushrooms, extra virgin olive oil, sea salt & fresh black pepper, garlic cloves, fresh herbs, fresh breadcrumb, cheese, sherry wine ; preparation:Prepare a medium-hot fire in the grill with a vegetable grill in place. Remove stems from mushrooms and hollow out the caps. Brush both sides of mushroom caps with olive and sprinkle inside of caps with salt and pepper. Grill mushrooms, hollow side down, until partially cooked and set aside. Combine reserved mushroom stems and trimmings with remaining olive oil and garlic and toss to coat well. Grill, tossing frequently, until lightly cooked. Finely chop the mushroom pieces and garlic, either by hand or with a food processor. Combine in medium-sized bowl with the breadcrumbs, cheese, sherry and herbs. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Stuff into the mushroom caps, mounding up the filling and pressing with your fingers to pack tightly. Grill stuffed mushrooms, stuffing side up, until the mushrooms are completely cooked and the cheese is melted. Serve hot or warm. ; name: deep dish sour cream apple pie ; ingredients: 9-inch deep dish pie crust, flour, cooking apples, sour cream, brown sugar, egg yolks, butter, salt ; preparation:Use an unbaked 9-inch deep-dish pie shell, your own recipe or storebought. Sprinkle 1 tbsp of the flour in shell. Arrange apple slices in bottom. Preheat oven to 425f degrees. In a mixing bowl, combine sour cream, brown sugar, yolks, butter, salt and remaining 1 tbsp flour. Blend well and spoon over apples. Bake for 15 minutes, then reduce heat to 350f degrees and bake for 40 more minutes, or until apples are tender. ; name: gramma s fudge ; ingredients: sugar, evaporated milk, margarine, chocolate chips, marshmallow creme, nuts, vanilla, salt ; preparation:In large pan mix sugar, milk and margarine. Boil until soft ball stage, about 8 minutes of a rolling boil. Remove from heat and quickly add remaining ingredients. Mix well. Spread in 9x13 pan greased. Let set. Makes about 5 pounds. ; name: fudgecake ; ingredients: biscuit, eggs, butter, caster sugar, cocoa powder, walnuts, sultana, vanilla, chocolate icing ; preparation:Put biscuits in to a plastic bag and seal end, with a rolling pin crush them till they are broken in to small pieces. Lightly beat eggs. In a small pot gently melt butter and stir in the sugar and cocoa. Remove from heat, cool to lukewarm and stir in the eggs. Return to the heat and stir until the mixture is smooth and thick and just starting to boil. Remove from heat and stir in walnuts, sultanas and vanilla. Then stir in biscuit crumbs. Mix well and press lightly into a lightly buttered sponge roll tin. Set aside in a cool place for a couple of hours. Ice with your fav chocolate butter icing and cut into bars. ; name: n c bean casserole ; ingredients: hamburger, sausage, hot dogs, baked beans, bacon, cheddar cheese, onion, bell pepper, ketchup ; preparation:In a saucepan, cook hamburger until fully cooked. Drain grease, and then add cut up hot dogs, onion, and bell pepper. Cook for an additional 5 minutes on medium heat. In a casserole dish, put baked beans and ketchup together and mix well. Add hamburger, hot dogs, onion, and bell pepper and stir until uniformly mixed in the dish. Take the uncooked bacon and lay them over the top of the dish side by side until dish is completely covered. If you cut up block cheese instead, go ahead and cut in thick pieces and add before putting in the oven. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Once preheated, put dish in oven uncovered for 30-40 minutes. The cheese should be slightly brown around the edges and the beans should be boiling slightly when dish is taken out of the oven. Reheats very well after being refrigerated. ; name: roasted garlic and mustard dipping sauce weight watchers ; ingredients: low sodium vegetable broth, cold water, cornstarch, malt vinegar, roasted garlic cloves, dijon-style mustard, honey, peanut oil, salt, fresh ground pepper ; preparation:

name: skillet minestrone meal ; ingredients: ground beef, diced tomatoes, beef broth, red wine, italian seasoning, elbow macaroni, kidney beans, garbanzo beans, green beans, salt and pepper ; preparation:Drain and rinse beans. Set aside. Brown the beef in a large skillet. Drain fat. Add the tomatoes, broth, wine, seasoning, macaroni and beans. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover and simmer until macaroni is tender and most of the liquid is absorbed. About 15 minutes. ; name: ranch baked potatoes ; ingredients: baking potatoes, ranch dressing, sour cream, bacon bits, cheese ; preparation:Bake potatoes at 400f for 1 hour. Slice in half and scoop out insides, leaving a small amount in shell. Mash potatoes, add sour cream, dressing and bacon bits. Beat until fluffy. Stir in 1 cup of cheese. Spoon into potato shells, top with remaining cheese. Bake at 350f for an additional 20 minute. ; name: balsamic glazed salmon fillets ; ingredients: salmon fillets, garlic cloves, white wine, honey, balsamic vinegar, dijon mustard, salt, ground black pepper, fresh oregano ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f line a baking sheet with aluminum foil, and spray with non-stick cooking spray. Coat a small saucepan with non-stick cooking spray. Over medium heat, cook and stir garlic until soft, about 3 minutes. Mix in white wine, honey, balsamic vinegar, mustard, and salt and pepper. Simmer, uncovered, for about 3 minutes, or until slightly thickened. Arrange salmon fillets on foil-lined baking sheet. Brush fillets with balsamic glaze, and sprinkle with oregano. Bake in preheated oven for 10 to 14 minutes, or until flesh flakes easily with a fork. Brush fillets with remaining glaze, and season with salt and pepper. Use a spatula to transfer fillets to serving platter, leaving the skin behind on the foil. ; name: warm spinach and basil salad ; ingredients: spinach leaves, fresh basil, olive oil, garlic, pine nuts, prosciutto, salt and pepper, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Combine the spinach and basil in a large salad bowl. Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and pine nuts. Mix well. Saut until the pine nuts are brown. Add the prosciutto. Mix well. Cook just until heated through, stirring constantly. Pour over the spinach mixture, tossing to coat. Season with the salt and pepper. Sprinkle with the parmesan cheese. ; name: chocolate swirl scone loaf ; ingredients: self raising flour, sugar, butter, milk, dark chocolate ; preparation:Preheat oven to 180 c. Place flour and sugar in bowl, mix to combine. Add butter and rub into flour till like breadcrumbs. Make a well in the centre and pour in milk. Gradually mix in milk with a knife till just combined. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface, gently bring dough together. Roll out to 18cms x 24 cms, sprinkle with chocolate. Roll up to enclose, place in a loaf pan 19cms x 9cms. Brush with extra milk, bake 30 minutes. Cool in tin 5 minutes the turn onto rack, slice to serve. ; name: french canadian baked beans ; ingredients: white pea beans, onion, dry mustard, ground black pepper, pure maple syrup, salt pork, salt ; preparation:Pour the beans onto a plate, and pick-over looking for bad beans, or stones. Place beans in bowl, cover with water by at least 2 inches, and soak overnight. Preheat oven to 250 degrees f. Drain beans and place in 4-quart bean pot. Add onion, dry mustard, pepper, salt, and maple syrup. Add water to cover. Cut salt pork into 1-inch pieces and place on top of beans. Bake covered, approximately 8 hours. Check each hour to see if water needs to be added. You can add more maple syrup in place of water for flavor, if desired. Serve the beans with brown bread, franks, or ham. For breakfast, serve with eggs, bacon, and home-fries. ; name: sweet savory nuts ; ingredients: pecans, almonds, walnuts, pure maple syrup, extra virgin olive oil, mixed herbs, cayenne pepper, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a bowl, toss the nuts with the maple syrup, olive oil, herbs and cayenne. Spread the nuts on a rimmed baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes., stirring occasionally, until browned. Season the nuts with salt and pepper and toss frequently until cooled. ; name: chicken in lemon sauce ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, butter, salt and pepper, sherry wine, fresh lemon rind, lemon juice, heavy cream, parmesan cheese ; preparation:

name: salsa tex mex style ; ingredients: rotel, whole tomatoes, fresh jalapeno pepper, garlic clove, onion, fresh cilantro, fresh lime juice, white sugar, cumin, salt ; preparation:First blend the cilantro, onion, jalapeno and garlic clove in a couple ounces of water. Add the rotel and canned tomatoes and continue to blend. Finally, add the rest of ingredients and keep adjusting the seasonings to your liking. After all the ingredients are blended, pour into a saucepan and let it come to slow boil. This will blend the flavors of each ingredients. Refrigerate. Goes well with white corn tortilla chips. ; name: yakisoba ; ingredients: boneless steak, birds eye frozen japanese-style vegetables, ramen noodles, soy sauce, salt and pepper, oil ; preparation:Cut semi-frozen steak into thin bite size pieces and stir-fry over medium heat until thoroughly browned, heat 2 quarts water to rapid boil while stir-frying meat. Add 1 to 2 seasoning packets of seasoning mix from noodles to steak. Add ramen noodles to water and boil 3 minutes. While cooking noodles, add vegetables and soy sauce to taste to steak and heat thoroughly. When noodles are done, drain and add to steak and vegetable mixture. Salt and pepper to taste. ; name: refreshing pina colada cake ; ingredients: yellow cake mix, eggs, oil, water, instant coconut cream pudding mix, milk, cream cheese, crushed pineapple, cool whip ; preparation:Bake cake as suggested on box in a large sheet-cake pan. Cool. Combine puddings, milk, and cream cheese and beat with electric mixer. Refrigerate pudding mixture for an hour. Spread pudding mixture on cake then add a layer of drained pineapple. Top with a layer of cool whip. Store in fridge. ; name: hamburger steak with gravy ; ingredients: ground beef, lipton onion soup mix, egg, worcestershire sauce, seasoning salt, black pepper, garlic powder, self rising flour, beef broth ; preparation:Combine all hamburger ingredients except flour. Shape into patties and dredge in flour. Brown patties in oil in heated skillet over medium high heat. Remove from skillet. Combine all gravy ingredients in a bowl, mixing well with a whisk. Pour into skillet, stirring constantly until thickened. Taste and adjust salt and pepper. Can also add a little more seasoned salt. Place patties into gravy and turn to coat. Cover, reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes or until done. ; name: rutmus ; ingredients: potato, turnips, butter, cream, salt and pepper ; preparation:Boil potatoes until tender. In second pot boil turnips until fork tender. Drain well. Combine all ingredients in mixer. Blend until smooth. Serve hot. ; name: u wing it pork loin chops ; ingredients: pork loin chops, olive oil, onion, garlic cloves, sour cream, horseradish, grainy mustard, ranch dressing, dry red wine ; preparation:Brown chops in oil in a frying pan. Remove to casserole dish. Saute onion and garlic over high heat for 2 minutes. Add sour cream, horseradish, mustard, dressing and wine. Heat for 3 minutes. Pour over chops. Bake in preheated 350f oven for 1 hour or until done. ; name: browned butter frosting ; ingredients: butter, powdered sugar, salt, milk, vanilla extract ; preparation:In a small saucepan over moderately low heat, melt 1 stick of the butter. Continue heating, swirling the pan to prevent burning, until the butter turns nut brown. Transfer the butter to a medium bowl. Using an electric mixer on low speed, gradually blend in the powdered sugar and salt alternately with the milk and vanilla, until the frosting is smooth. Beat in the remaining butter, bit by bit. Refrigerate until mixture is cool and thick enough to spread. Keep frosted cake or cupcakes refridgerated, since the frosting has a tendency to soften and drip off the sides if it gets too warm. ; name: raspberry cordial ; ingredients: frozen raspberries, sugar, boiling water, lemons ; preparation:

name: fire escape flank steak ; ingredients: vegetable oil, lime juice, garlic, ground cumin, chili powder, jalapeno pepper, fresh cilantro leaves, flank steak, salt ; preparation:Whisk oil, lime juice, garlic, cumin, chili powder, jalapenos, and cilantro together in a small bowl. Pace the meat in a zip lock bag pour the marinade over the meat cover and refrigerate for at least one hour but i do it over night. Light the grill. Generously sprinkle both sides of the steak with salt to taste. Scrape the hot grill surface clean. Grill the steak, turning once, until done the way you like it, 8 to 10 minutes for medium rare. Transfer steak to platter and carve, cutting meat into thin slices across the grain. ; name: creamed ham ; ingredients: butter, onion, flour, milk, swiss cheese, dry sherry, cooked ham, tomatoes, parsley ; preparation:Sautee onions in butter over medium heat until onions are transparent. Add flour and stir until well combined. Remove pan from heat and add milk slowly while stirring. Return pan to medium high heat, stirring until sauce thickens, reduce heat to low, stir in cheese until melted. Add sherry and ham and simmer until ham is heated through. Add garnish, before serving. ; name: garlic lime shrimp ; ingredients: butter, fresh lemon juice, worcestershire sauce, garlic cloves, white sugar, lime peel, cayenne, shrimp, parsley ; preparation:Melt butter in a medium-heave skillet over medium heat. Mix in the next six ingredients. Saut for 30 seconds and add shrimp. Saut shrimp until they are opaque in centre, about 3 minutes, turning occasionally. Stir in parsley and serve over rice or pasta. ; name: chocolate cherry cobbler ; ingredients: dark sweet cherries, brownie mix, water, egg, vegetable oil ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degree oven. Lightly grease a 13 x 9 pan, i use cooking spray. Place cherries in pan. In a large bowl combine brownie mix, water, egg and oil. Mix until well combined. Spread over the cherries. Bake for 50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the middle comes out with moist crumbs. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream or whipped cream or cool whip. ; name: ukrainian christmas kutya ; ingredients: wheat berries, water, poppy seed, honey, sugar, hot water, walnuts ; preparation:Wash wheat in cold water and soak overnight in the 3 to 4 quarts of water. The next day, bring the water to a boil then simmer for 4 to 5 hours, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking. The wheat is ready when the kernels burst open and the fluid is thick and creamy. Chop the poppy seed in a food processor and set aside. Mix honey, sugar and hot water. Mix the honey mixture, poppy seeds, and chopped nuts and wheat. More honey can be added to taste. Keep in refrigerator. ; name: peach and pecan upside down cake ; ingredients: butter, brown sugar, peach, baking powder, baking soda, eggs, vanilla, flour, buttermilk, pecans ; preparation:Spread melted butter in baking dish. Sprinkle with brown sugar. Arrange peach slices on top. In bowl beat butter, sugar, baking powder, and baking soda together. Add eggs and vanilla. Beat in flour, butter milk and pecans. Pour batter over peaches and bake at 350 for 50 to 70 minutes. ; name: almond crunch ; ingredients: almonds, butter, sugar, light corn syrup ; preparation:Line bottom and sides of an 8 or 9-inch pan with aluminum foil. Spray lightly with non stick spray. Set aside. Combine all ingredients in a 10-inch skillet. Over medium heat, bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Boil until mixture turn golden brown, 5-6 minutes. Quickly spread in prepared pan. Cool 15 minutes and break into bite sized pieces. ; name: vegetarian beanies n weenies ; ingredients: white beans, tofu hot dogs, ketchup, brown sugar, water, molasses, mustard powder, garlic powder ; preparation:

name: shrimp and mixed green dinner salad ; ingredients: walnut halves, water, balsamic vinegar, sugar, mixed greens, zucchini, baby shrimp, strawberries, feta cheese, hard-boiled eggs ; preparation:Toss the walnut halves with water and vinegar. Place in a heavy skillet over medium heat and toast until water and vinegar have evaporated. Sprinkle with the sugar and warm, stirring frequently until the sugar melts and coats the nuts. Set aside to cool. Divide the baby greens between two well chilled salad plates. Assemble the salad by distributing each plate with zucchini slices, 6 of the strawberries sliced and feta cheese. Top with shrimp, quarter the boiled eggs and divide evenly on each of the plates. Cut the reserved strawberries from bottom to stem without cutting through stem. Fan out slices and place on top of salad. Drizzle each salad with prepared dressing of your choosing and enjoy. ; name: weight watchers sauteed shrimp ; ingredients: olive oil, shrimp, fresh lemon juice, salt-free lemon & herb seasoning, table salt, black pepper, fresh parsley ; preparation:Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add shrimp and saut 1 minute. Add lemon juice, lemon herb seasoning, salt and pepper. Stir to coat shrimp. Saut until shrimp are bright pink and cooked through, about 3 minutes more. Remove from heat and stir in parsley. Yields about 3 ounces of shrimp per serving. ; name: biscotti di pepe taralli italian pepper biscuits ; ingredients: dry yeast, warm water, flour, salt, black pepper, olive oil ; preparation:Dissolve yeast in water. Sift flour salt and pepper onto mixing board. Make a well in the center and add yeast and oil. Blend together and gradually incorporate into flour. The dough will be stiff. Knead 10 minutes. Place in oiled bowl, turn to coat, cover with towel and let rise until doubled in bulk. Preheat oven to 375. Break off small pieces of dough and roll into ropes about 6 inches long. Form a ring and pinch edges together. Place on baking sheet and let rise 20 minutes. Brush with oil and bake 12 to 15 minutes or until lightly browned. ; name: healthy marinara sauce ; ingredients: italian plum tomatoes, extra virgin olive oil, garlic, tomato paste, oregano, salt, pepper, fresh parsley, cooking wine ; preparation:Puree tomatoes and tomato paste in a blender or food processor. In a medium saucepan, heat oil briefly, and add garlic. Saute 15 seconds, being careful not to let it brown. Add pureed tomatoes, oregano, salt, pepper, and wine. Bring sauce to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer for 20 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in parsley. Makes 13 servings. ; name: grilled fish in foil ; ingredients: fish fillet, margarine, lemon juice, parsley, dill weed, salt, pepper, paprika, onion ; preparation:On 4 large buttered squares of heavy-duty aluminum foil, place equal amounts of fish. In small saucepan, melt margarine. Add lemon juice, parsley, dill weed, salt and pepper. Pour equal amounts over fish. Sprinkle with paprika. Top with onion slices. Wrap foil securely around fish, leaving space for fish to expand. Grill 5 to 7 minutes on each side or until fish flakes with fork. Refrigerate leftovers. ; name: low fat yogurt hollandaise sauce ; ingredients: plain yogurt, egg yolks, lemon juice, dill, salt, dijon mustard, fresh ground pepper ; preparation:Beat eggs, yogurt, lemon juice in double boiler. Cook for about 15 min or until thickened. Remove from heat and stir in dill, salt, pepper and mustard. Serve warm. Can be refrigerated for up to 1 week. Reheat over hot not boiling water. ; name: oatmeal nut pie crust ; ingredients: rolled oats, brown sugar, salt, vanilla, butter, walnuts ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Toast oatmeal in a shallow pan for 10 minutes to brown, watch carefully. Remove from oven and in small mixing bowl combine oatmeal with remaining ingredients. Press into 9-inch pie plate. Fill with desired filling and bake or bake crust empty for later use. ; name: chocolate toffee crunch candy ; ingredients: walnuts, brown sugar, butter, semi-sweet chocolate chips ; preparation:

name: filled frankfurters ; ingredients: macaroni, milk, dry mustard, salt, pepper, cheddar cheese, frankfurters ; preparation:Cook the macaroni in boiling salted water until tender. Drain and rinse in hot water. Combine the milk, mustard, salt, pepper and 2 cups of the cheddar cheese in the top of a double boiler and cook until the cheddar is melted and sauce is smooth, stirring frequently. Add the macaroni and blend well. Split the frankfurters lengthwise, without separating them, and fill with the macaroni mixture. Sprinkle with the remaining cheddar and bake in a hot oven for 15 minutes. Serve hot. ; name: spicy broccoli salad ; ingredients: broccoli florets, red bell pepper, miniature corn cobs, red onion, rice wine vinegar, sesame oil, light brown sugar, red pepper flakes, salt and pepper ; preparation:Steam broccoli florets for 2 minutes, then rinse quickly in cold water. Drain well. Place broccoli in serving bowl, adding the onions, bell peppers, and miniature corn. In a small bowl, whisk together the vinegar, oil, brown sugar and red pepper flakes. Just before serving toss dressing with vegetables. Season with salt. ; name: nana s chocolate chip cookies classic toll house cookies ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, kosher salt, baking soda, unsalted butter, light brown sugar, granulated sugar, eggs, pure vanilla extract, semi-sweet chocolate chips, walnuts ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly butter two baking sheets. In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, salt, and baking soda. In a large bowl, using an electric mixer, beat the butter and sugars on medium-high speed until fluffy, 2 to 3 minutes. One at a time, beat in the eggs, then the vanilla. Reduce speed of mixer to low and gradually add the flour mixture, mixing until just combined. Mix in the chocolate chips and nuts, if desired, by hand. Drop heaping tablespoons of the dough onto the 2 prepared baking sheets, spacing them 2 inches apart. Bake, rotating the baking sheets halfway through, until golden around the edges but still soft in the center, 12 to 15 minutes. Cool slightly on the baking sheets, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. Store the cookies in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 5 days. ; name: stove top sirloin ; ingredients: top sirloin steak, canola oil, onion, water, chicken bouillon cube, yellow mustard, worcestershire sauce, adobo seasoning, garlic powder ; preparation:Cut steak in half. Brown in skillet on medium heat with canola oil. Remove steak from skillett. Add the rest of the ingredients. Bring to a boil. Add the steak and let simmer for 20 minutes or until steak is done to your liking. Remove and serve with onions and sauce on top of the steak. ; name: couscous and cherry tomato salad ; ingredients: couscous, red chili pepper, cherry tomatoes, green onion, extra virgin olive oil, lemon juice, cilantro, salt, fresh ground pepper ; preparation:Place the couscous in a bowl and pour over 300ml boiling water. Leave for 30 minutes until the water has been completely absorbed, allow to cool. Add the olive oil, lemon juice, cilantro and seasoning to taste. Add chili pepper, tomatoes and onions and stir gently to combine ingredients. Allow to chill for at least an hour. It allows the flavours to mingle. Keeps well in the fridge for 2 or 3 days. ; name: extra creamy fluffy white frosting ; ingredients: crisco shortening, salt, vanilla, icing sugar, heavy whipping cream ; preparation:In a bowl using an electric mixer, beat together the shortening, salt, vanilla and half of the icing sugar. Beat until very smooth. Add in whipping cream. Beat well. Add in remaining icing sugar to desired texture. Beat until fluffy and creamy. ; name: hearty german farmer s breakfast bauernfruhstuck ; ingredients: bacon, potatoes, green pepper, onions, salt and pepper, cheddar cheese, eggs, milk ; preparation:In a skillet over low heat, cook bacon until crisp. Remove to paper towel. Reserve 2 tablespoons drippings. Add potatoes, green pepper, onion, salt and pepper. Cook and stir over medium heat until the potatoes are golden brown. Stir in eggs and milk, and cook and stir until eggs are almost set, about 2 minutes. Reduce heat to low. Add cheese and bacon, stirring gently until heated through and eggs are set. Serve immediately. Leftovers are tasty the following day. Good wrapped in a flour tortilla for a breakfast burrito, breakfast on the go. Serves 4 to 6. ; name: zippy tomato soup ; ingredients: crushed tomatoes, onion, celery rib, garlic cloves, chicken stock, smoked paprika, cayenne, rosemary, dried marjoram, sour cream ; preparation:

name: ice cream torte ; ingredients: chocolate cookies, butter, vanilla ice cream, strawberry ice cream, fudge sauce, strawberry ice cream topping, whipped topping, strawberry ; preparation:Set aside 1 cup of cookie crumbs. Mix together remaining crumbs with melted butter. Press mixture into the bottom of a large pan. Spread vanilla ice cream evenly on top of crumb mixture. Freeze pan for 30 minutes. Spread warmed hot fudge evenly on top of vanilla ice cream. Freeze pan for 30 minutes. Spread strawberry ice cream evenly on top of fudge in pan. Freeze for 30 minutes more. Top strawberry ice cream with strawberry topping and freeze for 30 minutes more. Cover top of torte with whipped topping and sprinkle with reserved crumbs, and place strawberries on top. Freeze for 30 minutes more before serving. ; name: roasted chickpeas ; ingredients: olive oil flavored cooking spray, canned chick-peas, garlic powder, red pepper flakes ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly coat a rimmed cookie sheet with the pam. Spread chickpeas on baking sheet. Mix the seasonings and sprinkle it on the chickpeas, toss to coat. Roast on the bottom rack of the oven, shaking pan every 15 minutes or so, until brown and crunchy, about 45 to 50 minutes. Store in a tight lidded container. ; name: crock baked soybeans ; ingredients: dried soybeans, water, yellow onion, light brown sugar, molasses, salt, dry mustard, toasted sesame oil ; preparation:Rinse beans in colander under cold water. Pick over for damaged beans and small stones. Transfer to the slow cooker. Cover with cold water by 2 inches, soak overnight, and drain. Cover with the 4 cups water. Cover and cook on high until tender, about 4 hours. The beans need to be covered with liquid at all times to cook properly. Drain the cooked beans and return to the slow cooker. Add the onion, brown sugar, molasses, salt, mustard, and sesame oil. Stir to combine. Cover and cook on low for 5 to 6 hours, until soybeans are flavorful but still moist and the onion is soft. Stir gently so as not to mash the beans and serve hot. ; name: spicy iced thai coffee ; ingredients: coffee, dried coriander, cardamom pods, cinnamon, condensed milk, ice cubes, heavy cream ; preparation:Make a cup of strong hot coffee. Add the coriander, cardamom and cinnamon to the condensed milk and mix well. Next add the spicy condensed milk to the hot coffee, making sure to blend really well. Now taste the coffee, if you would like it sweeter add more of the condensed milk. Pour the spiced coffee into a jar, cover and put into the fridge to chill. When ready, place three or four coffee ice cubes into a tall glass and pour the spiced chilled coffee over top. Using a spoon carefully rest it on top of the coffee and slowly pour the heavy cream into the spoon. This will help the cream float on top of the coffee, instead of sinking immediately into it. Garnish with remaining cinnamon and enjoy. ; name: baked honey mustard garlic drumettes ; ingredients: garlic cloves, honey, dijon mustard, light soy sauce, lemon juice, olive oil, salt, pepper, chicken drummettes ; preparation:Combine garlic, honey, mustard, soy sauce, lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper in a non-reactive bowl. Add chicken toss to coat each piece well. Cover and refrigerate at least one hour or up to one day. Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place chicken in a singe layer on a wire rack over an oven tray. Bake 45 minutes until well browned and cooked through. ; name: kiwi cookies ; ingredients: butter, white sugar, sweetened condensed milk, baking powder, flour, chocolate chips ; preparation:Combine butter and sugar until creamy. Add milk, and stir. Add baking powder and flour and combine until just mixed. Add chocolate chips and mix all together. Roll dough into balls and place on an ungreased cookie sheet. Press down with fork tines. Bake in a moderate over at 350 and remove when the bottoms become golden brown. Makes approximately 14-16 cookies. ; name: ww southwestern frittata ; ingredients: olive oil, eggs, egg whites, salt, pepper, onion, red bell pepper, green bell pepper, reduced-fat cheddar cheese, salsa ; preparation:Heat the olive oil in a medium sized skillet. In a small bowl, beat the eggs and whites, salt, and pepper. Saute the onion and bell peppers about 5 minutes. Slowly pour the mixture from the bowl into the skillet and sprinkle with cheese. Gently stir until the mixture becomes slightly firm. Then turn over the frittata and cook the other side about 2 minutes longer. After taking the frittata from the skillet, cut it in half, and roll it like a burrito. Serve with salsa. ; name: westphalian tortellini ; ingredients: tortellini, sweet butter, westphalian ham, heavy cream, parmesan cheese, fresh chives, frozen peas, salt and pepper ; preparation:

name: the coffee frappe ; ingredients: strong coffee, kahlua, vanilla vodka, milk, cocoa ; preparation:To a pitcher, add cold strong coffee and kahla. Stir to mix. Pour into a 14-cube ice cube tray. Freeze for at least 2 hours, or overnight. To a blender, add vanilla vodka, milk or cream and 5 cubes. Blend until slushy. Pour into martini glasses and sprinkle with cocoa, if desired. ; name: southern biscuits mufffins ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, sugar, baking powder, milk, butter ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
