In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar & baking powder. Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in milk just until flour mixture is moistened. It will be very thick and pull away from the sides of the bowl. Spoon into greased muffin pan. Bake 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from pan and let cool. ; name: pear cardamom bread ; ingredients: flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, ground cardamom, pears, vegetable oil, milk, eggs, cardamom ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Grease bottom of loaf pan. Mix all ingredients, except topping, in a large bowl. Pour into loaf pan. Mix topping ingredients and sprinkle on top. Bake 55-65 minutes, until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean cool 10 minutes. Remove to wire rack to cool completely, 1 hour. ; name: spicy bread discs ; ingredients: bread, green chilies, fresh coriander leaves, plain low-fat yogurt, semolina, red chili powder, fresh lemon juice, garam masala powder, garlic, salt ; preparation:Soak the bread slices in water for 30 seconds. Squeeze out the water by squeezing the bread between the palm of your hands. Mix all the ingredients together with the bread and knead into a dough. Divide the dough into 1 tbsp. Sized equal parts. Flatten and fry in hot oil until golden brown on either side. Drain on clean paper kitchen napkins. Serve hot with tomato ketchup or mint chutney. ; name: peanut butter sweet potatoes ; ingredients: sweet potatoes, butter, brown sugar, cinnamon, creamy peanut butter, pecans ; preparation:Slice the sweet potatoes and put them into a 2 quart buttered casserole dish. In a large saucepan, melt the butter. Add the brown sugar, cinnamon and pecans and mix well. Cook until the sugar is dissolved. Add the peanut butter and stir until it is well blended and the peanut butter blends inches. Once it is well blended, add the pecans and stir well. Pour this mixture over the potatoes. Bake at 350 degrees for 25-30 minutes. ; name: cocoa meringues ; ingredients: egg whites, vanilla, cream of tartar, sugar, unsweetened cocoa powder, miniature semisweet chocolate chips, semisweet chocolate ; preparation:Preheat oven to 300f. Beat egg whites, vanilla and cream of tartar on high speed using an electric mixer, until soft peaks form. Combine sugar and cocoa. Gradually add sugar mixture, one tablespoon at a time, continuing to beat until stiff peaks form. Gently fold in chocolate chips. Drop by spoonfuls onto lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake for 20 minutes, or until meringues are firm and they are very lightly browned underneath. Allow to cool on wire rack. Drizzle melted chocolate over cookies. ; name: rhubarb ginger marmalade ; ingredients: rhubarb, oranges, sugar, lemon, preserved gingerroot ; preparation:In heavy saucepan or metal bowl, mix rhubarb and sugar. Let stand all night or all day. Cut rind from oranges and lemon into 1 inch pieces or smaller. Cover with cold water and bring to a boil and simmer for 15 minutes or until tender. Drain and set aside. Remove pith from oranges and lemon and chop pulp, add to rhubarb. Bring to full rolling boil. Reduce heat and cook about 10 minutes, until jam stage is reached. Remove from heat and add ginger and rind. Stir 5 minutes, skim foam. Pour in sterile hot jars, put hot lids on and screw tight. Makes 7 cups. ; name: quick easy and yummy apple tart ; ingredients: puff pastry, apples, brown sugar, salt, caramel topping, whipped cream, powdered sugar, vanilla ice cream ; preparation:

name: cheesy potato beef bake ; ingredients: ground beef, mushroom stems and pieces, au gratin potato mix, boiling water, milk, butter, salt, seasoning salt, pepper, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Place ground beef in a greased 9x13 baking dish and top with mushrooms. Combine potatoes and contents of sauce mix packets, water, milk, butter, salt, seasoned salt and pepper. Pour over beef and mushrooms. Cover and bake at 400 for 30 minutes or until heated through. Sprinkle with cheese and bake, uncovered for 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Let stand 10 minutes before serving. ; name: bistro catfish ; ingredients: sun-dried tomato packed in oil, garlic, catfish fillets, salt and pepper, fresh spinach ; preparation:Heat 2 tablespoons reserved oil in a large skillet, over medium heat. Saute garlic for 1 to 2 minutes or until golden. Sprinkle both sides of the fish with salt and pepper. Place fish in the skillet. Cover, and cook for 8 to 10 minutes, or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Add the spinach and sun-dried tomatoes to the skillet. Cover and cook for 1 to 2 minutes, or until spinach is wilted but still bright green. Place the spinach on a serving plate. Top with fish fillets. Drizzle pan drippings on top and serve. ; name: pudding au chomeur ; ingredients: flour, sugar, baking powder, milk, light brown sugar, boiling water, butter, vanilla ; preparation:Mix first 3 ingredients. Then add the milk. Pour into ungreased 9x13 pan. Mix final 4 ingredients. Let butter melt. Pour over back of wooden spoon over cake batter. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. ; name: salmon with cucumber salad ; ingredients: cucumber, salmon fillets, plain yogurt, dill, sourdough bread ; preparation:Halve the cucumber lengthways and scoop out the seeds. Slice into half moons and put in a sieve, sprinkle with a little salt and leave to drain for 10 minutes. Season the salmon fillets and put on a plate. Steam for 6 minutes or cover and microwave for 4 minutes or until cooked through. Rinse the cucumber and pat dry. Flake the salmon, mix with the cucumber, yogurt and dill and season with black pepper. Serve with toast. ; name: quick chocolate chip scones ; ingredients: flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, baking soda, egg, skim milk, lemon juice, butter, chocolate chips ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f. Place wax paper on a large baking sheet. Combine dry ingredients in a large bowl. Combine other ingredients in a second bowl. Blend the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients. Add chocolate chips. Drop by large spoonfuls onto the baking sheet. Bake 15 minutes. ; name: easy plum sauce ; ingredients: plum jam, vinegar, onion powder, ginger powder, allspice, garlic salt, water ; preparation:Mix the ingredients together well. Bring to a boil on low heat. Boil about 2 minutes stirring constantly. Cool the sauce and store in a jar in the refrigerator. Use within a few days. ; name: wasabi popcorn ; ingredients: popped popcorn, butter, wasabi, salt, sugar ; preparation:Place popcorn in a large bowl. Microwave butter 20 seconds or until melted. Stir in wasabi until well blended. Drizzle wasabi butter over popcorn and stir to distribute. Sprinkle with salt and sugar, if desired, and stir again. ; name: classic club sandwich ; ingredients: white bread, mayonnaise, lettuce leaves, tomatoes, cooked bacon, cooked chicken breasts, sticks ; preparation:

name: blue cheese and rosemary mashed potatoes ; ingredients: russet potatoes, blue cheese, whole milk, fresh rosemary, pepper ; preparation:Cook potatoes in a large pot of salted boiling water until very tender about 15 minutes. Drain potatoes and return to pot. Add cheese and milk mash until smooth adding more milk if necessary. Stir in rosemary. Salt and pepper to taste. ; name: dijon mushroom potatoes ; ingredients: onion, carrot, mushrooms, vegetable stock, dark soy sauce, dijon mustard, cornstarch, fresh ground black pepper, potatoes ; preparation:Chop the onion, peel and grate the carrot and slice the mushrooms, halving them across the other way first if they are large. Saute the vegetables in the water or stock, in a large frying pan, until most of the liquid is gone and the vegetables are soft. Mix the remaining ingredients together in a bowl, adding a bit of water if you wish and add to the vegetables in the pan. Mix well and cook, stirring, over low heat for about a minute until thickened. Pour over hot, split baked potatoes. Serve with a crisp green salad on the side. ; name: weight watchers chocolate chip blondies 3 points ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, baking powder, table salt, brown sugar, light butter, egg whites, vanilla extract, mini chocolate chip, water ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f in a small bowl, combine flour, baking powder and salt. In a large bowl, beat brown sugar and butter until fluffy. Add egg whites and vanilla. Gradually beat in flour mixture alternating with water. Stir in chips. Spread into a foil-lined 9- x 13-inch baking pan. Bake until golden, about 20 to 25 minutes. Cool on wire rack. Remove foil and cut into 24 two-inch squares. ; name: edible cookie dough for ice cream no eggs ; ingredients: flour, brown sugar, white sugar, butter, vanilla, milk, mini chocolate chip ; preparation:In a medium bowl mix together both sugars and butter until smooth. Stir in vanilla and milk. Mix in the flour until well blended. Add in chocolate chips. Shape into a log and freeze for about 1-2 hours or until firm. Cut or break into small chunks. Mix into softened ice cream. Return the ice cream to freezer. ; name: pork chops with tangy creole mustard pineapple sauce ; ingredients: olive oil, pork chops, salt, pepper, chicken broth, pineapple preserves, creole mustard, cider vinegar, tabasco sauce, light brown sugar ; preparation:In a large skillet over medium heat, heat the olive oil. Sprinkle pork chops with salt and pepper and add to the skillet. Cook the chops, turning, until well browned. Add the chicken broth. Cover and continue cooking for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, combine remaining ingredients. Add the sauce to the pork chops, turning to coat well. Cook the chops, uncovered, for 15 minutes longer, turning occasionally. ; name: mimi s lasagne chili soup ; ingredients: zucchini, onion, sweet italian turkey sausage, garlic cloves, spaghetti sauce, beef broth, water, pasta, basil ; preparation:Coarsely chop zucchini and set aside. Coarsely chop onion and put into pot with turkey sausage which has been crumbled up as best you can. Heat pan to medium and cook till sausage is done continuing to break up sausage, adding the garlic while it is cooking. Drain. Add spaghetti sauce, broth, and water. Bring to a boil. Stir in pasta. Reduce heat cook covered for about 7 minutes. Stir in zucchini and cook for 2-4 more minutes or till zucchini is done. Stir in basil. Ladle soup into bowls and enjoy. ; name: potato and carrot salsa ; ingredients: carrots, potatoes, tomatoes, fresh oregano, jalapeno chiles, orange, juice of, salt ; preparation:Wash and peel the carrots and potatoes. Cook separately in boiling water until tender. Dice and put into a bowl. Set aside. In blender, liquify tomatoes, oregano jalapeos, and salt. Add to carrot and potato mixture along with the orange juice. ; name: eggnog quick bread ; ingredients: eggs, white sugar, butter, eggnog, rum extract, vanilla extract, all-purpose flour, baking powder, salt, ground nutmeg ; preparation:

name: chunky rustic style home fries ; ingredients: unsalted butter, russet potatoes, salt & freshly ground black pepper, onion, green bell pepper, red bell pepper, chili powder, fresh chives ; preparation:Warm the butter in a 10- to 12-inch cast-iron skillet over medium-low heat. Stir in the potatoes, and when coated with a bit of butter, season them with salt and pepper and cover the skillet. Cook for 20 minutes, during which you should hear only a faint cooking sound. Uncover the potatoes and cook for 30 minutes longer, turning them at 10 minute intervals and patting them back down. When you turn them the first time, stir in the onion, bell peppers, and chili powder if desired. As the potatoes soften, pat them down more lightly, bringing as much of their surface in contact with the skillet as possible without mashing them. Cook the potatoes for about 20 minutes longer, turning them at 5-minute intervals. During the last 10 minutes, bring the heat up to medium and, if you wish, add more salt and pepper. The home fries are ready when the potato cubes are richly browned and clearly crisp with tender, melting centers. Plate them up immediately, scatter with chives if you wish, and serve. ; name: baked cinnamon bread custard ; ingredients: cinnamon-swirl bread, eggs, egg yolks, sugar, milk, half-and-half, vanilla, powdered sugar ; preparation:Arrange bread in a double layer in a lightly greased 9-by-13-inch baking pan. Whisk togather eggs, egg yolks and sugar. Gradually add milk, half and half and vanilla. Pour mixture over bread. Bake in a 375-degree oven for 25 to 30 minutes, or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Dust with powdered sugar while warm and serve. ; name: armenian zeppole bishi ; ingredients: yeast, warm water, sugar, eggs, flour, salt, vegetable oil ; preparation:Dissolve yeast in warm water with sugar. Whisk in eggs. Add flour and salt to make a batter a little thicker than pancake batter. Allow to rise in a warm spot until double in bulk. Heat oil to 375 degrees. Drop by spoonfuls in hot oil. Keep them rolling around until browned. Drain and serve with powdered sugar or maple syrup. ; name: parmesan creamy dressing ; ingredients: mayonnaise, parmesan cheese, white wine vinegar, sour cream, fresh parsley, dijon mustard, fines herbes, salt & freshly ground black pepper, vegetable oil ; preparation:In a small bowl, mix together the mayonnaise, parmesan, vinegar, sour cream, parsley, mustard, herbs, and salt and pepper to taste. Whisk well. Slowly add the oil, whisking constantly, until the dressing is emulsified. Cover and chill the dressing until you are ready to use it. Let stand at room temperature for 5 minutes before serving. This dressing will keep for up to 5 days in an airtight container in the refrigerator. ; name: cucumber and avocado salad ; ingredients: english seedless cucumber, sweet red pepper, salt, lettuce, chili pepper, avocado, fresh lime juice, fresh parsley, onion ; preparation:Peel and slice the cucumber paper-thin. Season with salt, chili pepper and lime juice. Sprinkle with onion and red pepper slices. Arrange lettuce on 6 serving plates. Pile cucumber mixture in center of each plate. Add avocado slices and parsley. 6 servings. ; name: savory vegetable rice casserole ; ingredients: basmati rice, cauliflower, chili pepper, eggs, fresh mushrooms, onion, tomatoes, olive oil, paprika, salt and pepper ; preparation:Cook the rice according to the method that you prefer. Steam the cauliflower until tender. Heat the oil in a saucepan, add the mushrooms and onions and saute until soft. Add the chile pepper and tomatoes, continue sauteing until completely cooked through. Mix the rice with the sauteed vegetables. Add the eggs and mix well. Add the paprika, and the salt and pepper to taste. Pour into a greased baking dish. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 40 minutes. ; name: potato galette ; ingredients: unsalted butter, vegetable oil, potato, dried rosemary ; preparation:In a small bowl stir together the butter and the oil. In a food processor fitted with a 1-millimeter slicing blade or with a mandoline or similar hand-held slicing device, slice the potatoes thin. Working quickly to prevent the potatoes from discoloring, brush the bottom of a 9-inch cast-iron skillet with some of the butter mixture and cover it with a layer of the potato slices, overlapping them. Brush the potatoes with some of the remaining butter mixture, sprinkle them with some of the rosemary, and season them with salt and pepper. Layer the remaining potatoes with the remaining butter mixture and the rosemary in the same manner. Heat the mixture over moderately high heat until it begins to sizzle, transfer the skillet to the middle of a preheated 450f oven, and bake the galette for 25 minutes, or until it is golden and the potatoes are tender. Cut the galette into wedges. ; name: thai green curry salmon ; ingredients: skinless salmon fillet, unsweetened coconut milk, green curry paste, brown sugar, fish sauce, fresh lime juice, red bell pepper, mushroom, fresh basil, jasmine rice ; preparation:

name: stout corned beef ; ingredients: brown sugar, corned beef brisket, guinness stout, potato, carrot ; preparation:Discard the seasoning packet from the corned beef. Rub the brown sugar over the corned beef and place in a slow cooker. Pour the beer over the top. Cook, covered, on low for 8 to 10 hours. Add chopped potatoes and baby carrots, if desired, and increase the heat to high. Cook until the vegetables are tender and the corned beef is cooked to the desired doneness. Serve with cooked cabbage or over mashed potatoes. ; name: pistachio and lemon cake naturally gluten and lactose free ; ingredients: lemons, pistachios, sugar, eggs, salt, baking powder, icing sugar ; preparation:Boil the whole lemons in boiling water for 1 hour. Pre heat oven to 180c grease and line a 22cm cake tin with baking paper drain the lemons and cool. Cut the cooked lemons in half and remove the pips. Puree in a blender until smooth. Blanch 200g of the pistaccios in boiling water for 30 seconds then blend with the other 100g. Sererate the egg yolks from the egg whites. Whisk the yolks with the sugar until light then fold in the pistaccio cream, the lemon cream and baking powder. Whisk the egg whites with a pinch of salt till stiff. Fold into the lemon pistacchio mixture. Pour th emixture int th eprepared cake tin and bake for about 40-45 minutes. Cool, remove from cake tin and dust lightly with icing sugar. Decorate with some candied peel. ; name: low fat pesto sauce ; ingredients: chicken broth, garlic cloves, fresh basil, parmesan cheese, pine nuts ; preparation:Combine stock and garlic and heat in the microwave on high for 5 minutes. Allow to cool. Chop basil in food processor. Add cooled stock, parmesan cheese and pine nuts. Whirl until everything is finely chopped and blended. Meanwhile, cook pasta of your choice. Toss sauce with pasta. Serve with additional parmesan cheese if desired. Use as a topping for fish, chicken or potatoes also. Makes 4 servings. ; name: sugar free pickle relish ; ingredients: dill pickle spears, onion, splenda sugar substitute, celery seed, mustard seeds, cider vinegar ; preparation:Drain liquid from pickles into a non reactive pan. Throw in the onion, splenda, celery seed and mustard seed. Bring to a simmer for about 20 to 30 minutes. While that is simmering chop the pickles either by hand or in the food processor to the consistancy you like your relish to be, fine or coarse. Add the 2 tablespoons of cider vinegar to the chopped pickles. Put the chopped up pickles back in the jar and pour the brine back over the whole thing. Store in the fridge and use like store bought relish. ; name: chicken enchiladas with red sauce ; ingredients: chicken breasts, enchilada sauce, cheddar cheese, sour cream, refried beans, cilantro, diced green chilies, taco seasoning, tortillas ; preparation:Pre heat oven at 350 degrees. Combine the chicken, cheese, sour cream, refried beans, chiles, taco seasoning and cilantro in a mixing bowl. Fill each tortilla with 2 spoonfuls of filling mix. Fold tortillas and place in baking pan seam side down. When the pan is filled, pour enchilada sauce over the top of all the filled tortillas. Cover the pan and bake for 20-40 minutes. ; name: brillant sunset ; ingredients: ice, grenadine, orange juice, maraschino cherries, orange slices ; preparation:Add ice to four glasses. Pour 1 tablespoon grenadine over ice in each glass. Slowly add 1 cup orange juice to produce sunset affect. Garnish with an orange slice and a cherry. Stir if desired before drinking. ; name: crock pot beef marsala ; ingredients: olive oil, beef stew meat, flour, garlic cloves, marsala wine, chicken stock, cream of mushroom soup, baby portabella mushrooms, salt and pepper ; preparation:Heat olive oil in a medium skillet over medium heat. Add beef cubes and saute until browned. Add garlic. Saute until garlic is lightly browned. Add flour and stir until well coated. Transfer meat into the crockpot and add marsala, broth, soup and sliced mushrooms. Mix well. Cover and cook on low for 8 to 10 hours or on high for 5 to 7 hours or until meat is tender. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve with or over rice, egg noodles or mashed potatoes. ; name: open face salmon and egg scandinavian sandwich ; ingredients: smoked salmon, eggs, salt, black pepper, fresh dill sprigs, butter, miniature party rye rounds ; preparation:

name: best cream of broccoli soup ; ingredients: butter, onion, garlic clove, celery, chicken broth, broccoli, flour, milk, pepper, velveeta cheese ; preparation:Melt 2 tablespoons butter in medium sized stock pot, and saut onion, garlic and celery until tender. Add broccoli and broth. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Pure soup or mash with potato masher. Return to heat. In small saucepan, over medium heat melt 3 tablespoons butter, stir in flour and add milk. Stir until thick and bubbly, add to soup. Add cheese. Stir until melted. Season with pepper and serve. ; name: mint iced tea ; ingredients: water, peppermint tea bags, orange pekoe tea bags, orange, zest of, mint leaves, whole cloves, superfine sugar, pink grapefruit juice, ice cube, mint sprig ; preparation:Bring water to boil in a tea kettle. In a large tea pot, place tea bags, orange zest, mint leaves and cloves and then pour boiling water over all. Add sugar and stir until dissolved. Cover and let steep until cool. Strain tea through mesh strainer into a large pitcher filled with ice. Stir in grapefruit juice. Serve over ice in large glasses, garnished with mint sprigs, if desired. ; name: pork chops with caramelized orange sauce ; ingredients: pork chops, olive oil, sweet paprika, garlic powder, salt, black pepper, orange juice, brown sugar, orange marmalade, apple cider vinegar ; preparation:Drizzle olive oil into a medium skillet over medium-high heat. Meanwhile, season pork chops with paprika, garlic powder, salt and pepper. Once oil in skillet is glistening, brown pork chops on both sides. In a small bowl, whisk together orange juice, brown sugar, orange marmalade and apple cider vinegar. Lower skillet heat to medium-low. Pour liquid mixture over chops and cover skillet. Simmer for 10-15 minutes, occasionally flipping chops and scraping the bottom of the skillet with a wooden spoon to keep them from burning or sticking. Just before serving, increase skillet heat to medium-high for 3-5 minutes until the sauce caramelizes to your preference. Watch closely in order to prevent from burning. Serve chops over hot, cooked rice with sauce spooned over all. ; name: italian wedding cakes ; ingredients: flour, shortening, sugar, vanilla extract, eggs, baking powder ; preparation:Combine flour and shortening as if for pie crust. Add baking powder and combine. In a separate bowl, beat eggs and then add sugar and vanilla. Add flour mixture to egg mixture. To shape cookies, you can simply roll them into 1-inch balls or you can roll them into logs and fold them into pretzel shapes. They will puff up some but will mostly retain whatever shape you form them into. Bake at 350 degrees for 12 to 14 minutes. They will not brown much. Cool and frost with your favorite glaze and add sprinkles. For convenience, you can melt store-bought frosting. ; name: rob morrison s meatloaf ; ingredients: onion, garlic cloves, ketchup, egg, ground pork, ground beef, italian seasoned breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese, bacon ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place the onion, garlic, ketchup and egg in a large bowl. Stir to combine. Add meat and mix until well combined. Add breadbrumbs and cheese and continue mixing until thoroughly incorporated. Transfer meat mixture to a loaf pan. Top with bacon strips, if desired, and cover with aluminum foil. Transfer to oven and bake until meat is no longer pink, about 55 minutes. Uncover, and continue baking an additional 30 minutes. Let meatloaf stand, loosely covered, about 10 minutes, before slicing and serving. ; name: scandinavian rotmos side dish with rutabagas and potatoes ; ingredients: rutabaga, whole allspice, peppercorns, salt, rutabagas, carrots, potatoes, ground cinnamon, butter ; preparation:In a large pot, bring water, allspice, peppercorns, and salt to a boil. Peel and finely chop the rutabagas and carrots. Add to the pot. Reduce temp to a low boil and cook for 15 minutes. Meanwhile, peel and finely chop the potatoes. After the 15 minutes is up, add the potatoes and cook an additional 20 minutes, or until the potatoes are fork-tender. Use a slotted spoon to remove the potatoes to a mixing bowl. Mash the potatoes rutabagas, and carrots, adding just enough cooking water to get a creamy pure. Place in a serving bowl, sprinkle with cinnamon or nutmeg, and top with butter. ; name: fire escape flank steak ; ingredients: vegetable oil, lime juice, garlic, ground cumin, chili powder, jalapeno pepper, fresh cilantro leaves, flank steak, salt ; preparation:Whisk oil, lime juice, garlic, cumin, chili powder, jalapenos, and cilantro together in a small bowl. Pace the meat in a zip lock bag pour the marinade over the meat cover and refrigerate for at least one hour but i do it over night. Light the grill. Generously sprinkle both sides of the steak with salt to taste. Scrape the hot grill surface clean. Grill the steak, turning once, until done the way you like it, 8 to 10 minutes for medium rare. Transfer steak to platter and carve, cutting meat into thin slices across the grain. ; name: omg raspberry dream bars ; ingredients: graham cracker crumbs, sugar, butter, sweetened condensed milk, seedless raspberry jam, flaked coconut, cashews, white chocolate chips ; preparation:

name: spicy crusted salmon over spinach ; ingredients: cooking spray, chili powder, ground cumin, paprika, ground oregano, sugar, salmon fillets, olive oil, spinach ; preparation:Coat grill with cooking spray. Preheat grill. Combine chili powder, cumin, paprika, oregano, and sugar. Rub salmon with spices and then drizzle with oil. Grill salmon over medium heat, about 5 to 6 minutes per side. Serve with spinach. ; name: pomegranate and poppy seed salad ; ingredients: romaine lettuce, red onion, pomegranate seeds, mayonnaise, sugar, milk, white vinegar, poppy seeds ; preparation:In a large bowl, mix the romaine, onion and pomegranate seeds. In a small bowl, mix the remaining ingredients until well blended. Pour over salad. Toss to coat. Serve immediately. ; name: chava s thin and crispy potato kugel ; ingredients: potatoes, onion, eggs, matzo meal, baking powder, salt and pepper, oil ; preparation:Grate potatoes in the food processor. If you can grate with a large hole, use the largest. Grate onion. Place in large bowl. Add eggs, beat them first. Add rest of ingredients including oil. Mix well. Place in a greased, large pan in a thin layer. Bake at 375 till brown and crispy. For extra crunchy kugel, add about 2 extra tablespoons of oil to the pan and place the pan in the oven to heat the oil, then put in the kugel. ; name: apple sweet potato scallop ; ingredients: apples, sweet potatoes, orange juice, orange, zest of, cinnamon, corn flakes, nonstick cooking spray ; preparation:Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with non-stick cooking spray. Place alternate layers of sweet potatoes and apples in baking dish, ending with apples. Pour orange juice and zest over mixture and sprinkle with cinnamon. Bake, covered with foil, in preheated 375 degree oven for 40 minutes. Remove foil, top with crushed cereal or bread crumbs, and spray with non-stick cooking spray. Bake 15 to 20 minutes more until brown. ; name: coconut curry chicken strips ; ingredients: chicken breasts, flour, curry paste, egg, breadcrumbs, coconut flakes, olive oil ; preparation:Dust chicken strips with flour. Rub chicken strips with curry paste. Crack egg into bowl, dip chicken in quickly. Mix breadcrumbs and coconut flakes in bowl. Roll chicken in mixture to coat. Heat oil in non-stick pan on medium-high. Cook chicken strips in pan, about 4 minutes per side or until cooked through and crispy on the outside. ; name: pineapple cheesecake squares ; ingredients: yellow cake mix, butter, pecans, egg, crushed pineapple in syrup, cream cheese, powdered sugar, eggs ; preparation:Mix first four ingredients of bottom layer well. Press mixture in a well greased 9x13 pan. Top with pineapples. Mix remaining ingredients well and pour over pineapples. Bake at 350 for 35-40 minutes until slightly browned. Cool completely and cut into squares. Serve cold, frozen or warm. ; name: old fashioned scrapple ; ingredients: boneless pork loin, cornmeal, chicken broth, dried thyme, salt, all-purpose flour, pepper, vegetable oil ; preparation:In a large saucepan combine pork, cornmeal, chicken broth, thyme and salt. Bring to a boil, stirring often. Reduce heat and simmer about 2 minutes or until mixture is very thick, stirring constantly. Line an 8x8x2-inch baking pan or a 9x5x3-inch loaf pan with waxed paper, letting paper extend 3-4 inches above top of pan. Spoon pork mixture into pan. Cover and chill in the refrigerator 4 hours or overnight. Unmold. Cut scrapple into squares. Combine flour and pepper. Dust squares with flour mixture. In large skillet brown scrapple on both sides in a small amount of hot oil. Serves 12. ; name: twix bar cookies ; ingredients: club crackers, margarine, milk, sugar, brown sugar, graham cracker, chocolate chips, crunchy peanut butter ; preparation:

name: bacon wrapped venison tenderloin with portabella mushrooms ; ingredients: venison tenderloin, bacon, yellow onion, portabella mushrooms, olive oil, garlic cloves, ground pepper, salt, water ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Combine t olive oil, garlic, pepper, and salt. Rub seasonings onto the tenderloin. Wrap the tenderloin in bacon and place into the roaster. Add the remaining oil to a frying pan and cook the onions and mushrooms until theyre tender. Put onions and mushrooms into the roaster with the tenderloin and add the water. Bake for 30-40 minutes. ; name: cinnamon apple waffles ; ingredients: flour, salt, cinnamon, baking powder, sugar, eggs, milk, butter, apple ; preparation:Sift flour, salt, cinnamon, baking powder, and sugar together. Separate eggs. Beat egg yolks. Add milk and melted butter. Combine wet and dry ingredients. Beat until smooth. Add apples. Beat egg whites until stiff. Fold into batter. Bake until done. ; name: berry mini loaves ; ingredients: butter, sugar, eggs, all-purpose flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, buttermilk, whole berry cranberry sauce, blueberries ; preparation:In a mixing bowl, cream the butter and sugar together. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Combine the dry ingredients together with a whisk. Add the dry ingredients to the creamed mixture alternately with the buttermilk, beginning and ending with the dry ingredients. Stir in cranberry sauce and blueberries by hand. Pour into four greased mini loaf pans. Bake at 350f for 25-30 minutes or until bread passes a toothpick test. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pans and cooling completely on a wire rack. ; name: cucumber shrimp tea sandwiches ; ingredients: green onion, light cream cheese, fat-free mayonnaise, plain low-fat yogurt, fresh dill, garlic salt, black pepper, small shrimp, cucumber, bread ; preparation:Combine first 7 ingredients in a bowl. Trim the crusts from the bread slices. Spread the cream cheese mixture over the bread slices and cut into 4 triangles until you reach the number of shrimp you have. Arrange shrimp on each bread triangle. Arrange the cucumber evenly over shrimp. Chill, covered until serving. ; name: roasted garlic mashed sweet potatoes ; ingredients: garlic, olive oil, sweet potatoes, butter, whipping cream, white pepper ; preparation:Cut the top off unpeeled garlic head. Drizzle with olive oil, place in baking pan & bake & 250 degrees for 30 - 40 minutes. Bake the potatoes at 400 degrees for 1 hour or until tender. Cut potatoes in half, scoop into saucepan and mash. Squeeze roasted garlic into the mashed potatoes. Add butter, mash while adding cream a little at a time. Add salt & pepper to taste. ; name: go go greek tilapia ; ingredients: tilapia fillets, lemons, olive oil, salt and pepper, baby spinach, pasta sauce, feta cheese ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 450 degrees. In a glass baking dish, squeeze the juice of one lemon. Add the olive oil. Put the fillets in the dish and rub the lemon oil mixture on both sides. Add salt and pepper to taste. Take large spoonfuls of the spinach, sauce and cheese and place in the center of each fillet. Roll up each fillet and secure with a toothpick. Add remaining ingredients in between and on top of the fillets. And squeeze the second lemon on top. Bake uncovered for 20 minutes. ; name: boozy beef steaks ; ingredients: steaks, whiskey, soy sauce, dark muscovado sugar, pepper ; preparation:Make a few cuts into the edge of the fat on each steak-it stops the meat curling up as it cooks. Place the meat in a shallow, on metallic dish. Mix together the remaining ingredients, stirring until the sugar dissolves. Pour mixture over steaks, cover and marinate for at least 2 hours. Barbecue meat until cooked to your liking. ; name: slow cooker guinness roast ; ingredients: chuck, carrot, red potatoes, frozen pearl onions, lipton beef and onion soup mix, guinness stout ; preparation:

name: little meat rolls ; ingredients: ground round, sweet onion, teriyaki sauce, parmesan cheese, egg, bread, salt and pepper, pie crust ; preparation:Mix the meat with the onion, egg, bread, cheese, sauce, salt and pepper. Mix very well. Roll out the crust and cut into a 3-inch square. Take a walnut or egg size bunch of meat mixture in your hand, and roll into an oblong shape, put on the center of the crust and pinch the top together. Bake at 350f for 35 minutes or until browned. Makes about 20. ; name: black angus teriyaki glaze and dipping sauce ; ingredients: soy sauce, toasted sesame seeds, hot sauce, garlic, ginger, black pepper, toasted sesame oil, white sugar, brown sugar, cornstarch ; preparation:Heat first 8 ingredients until sugar dissolves. Add brown sugar, cornstarch and water mixture. Simmer until thickened. Simmering time will be 10 to 15 minutes depending on thickness of sauce desired. I found the sesame seed got a little soggy so i just will toast them and sprinkle on finished product instead of incorporating them in the sauce. If you are using all the sauce immediately go ahead and follow original directions. I made a double batch since i wanted to keep this on hand in the fridge. ; name: french chicken with sherry nutmeg sauce ; ingredients: skinless chicken thighs, onion, chicken broth, dry sherry, nutmeg, cayenne pepper, salt and pepper, parsley, skim milk, flour ; preparation:Put the chicken in a non-stick frying pan. Cook slowly over moderate heat with no fat added until well browned. Drain off melted fat. Add the onion, broth and sherry. Sprinkle with seasonings. Cover and simmer over very low heat until nearly tender, 40 to 50 minutes. Uncover. Continue to simmer uncovered until the liquid is reduced by half. Whisk milk and flour together and stir into the pan. Cook and stir until sauce is bubbling and thick. ; name: red onion confit ; ingredients: red onion, olive oil, red wine vinegar, marsala wine ; preparation:Slice the onion very thin and evenly. A mandolin is perfect for this. Sweat the onions in olive oil on low till very soft. Add the red wine vinegar and marsala. Simmer till all the liquid has reduced. ; name: sweet and sour brussels sprouts ; ingredients: apple cider vinegar, honey, chicken broth, fresh bay leaf, red onion, red bell pepper, mustard seeds, brussels sprouts, celery salt, black pepper ; preparation:In a deep skillet, combine vinegar, honey and broth with a whisk. Stir in bay, onion, pepper, mustard seed and turmeric, stir and bring to a boil. Defrost brussel sprouts and halve them. Add to broth mixture and season with celery salt and pepper. Cover, reduce heat and simmer 10 minutes, uncover and cook 5 minutes more. ; name: wipe the bowl clean salad ; ingredients: lemon, juice of, garlic cloves, oil, bacon, romaine lettuce, cherry tomatoes, swiss cheese, slivered almonds, parmesan cheese, crouton ; preparation:Blend the lemon juice, oil and garlic. Refrigerate overnight. Wash, dry and tear romaine into bite size pieces. Toss the romaine in a large bowl with the tomatoes, both cheeses, toasted almonds, bacon bits and croutons. Mix with the dressing and serve. ; name: fresh and sun dried tomato salad with parmesan ; ingredients: tomatoes, salt, fresh ground black pepper, sun-dried tomato packed in oil, balsamic vinegar, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Arrange the tomatoes in a single layer on 4 salad plates. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Scatter the sun-dried tomatoes over the fresh tomato slices. Drizzle with oil and vinegar. Use a vegetable peeler to shave the cheese over the salad. ; name: cantaloupe spinach salad ; ingredients: cantaloupe, fresh spinach leaves, pistachios, raspberry vinaigrette dressing ; preparation:

name: italian meat sauce ; ingredients: ground beef, sausage, onions, tomato paste, crushed tomatoes, basil, oregano, crushed red pepper flakes, black pepper, water ; preparation:Cook ground beef, sausage together in large pot. Use a potato masher to break up the meat into fine pieces. Drain the fat into a skillet, cook onions in fat. Drain fat and return onions to meat mixture. Add tomato paste, crushed tomatoes, basil, oregano, crushed red pepper, black pepper, and water. Simmer on stove for two hours or till the sauce reduces,. Serve with pasta, ravioli, etc --. ; name: spinach and cheese casserole ; ingredients: frozen spinach, onion, garlic cloves, butter, eggs, cottage cheese, flour, sharp cheddar cheese, salt, pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease a 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Drain spinach well. Saute onion and garlic in 2 tbsp of the melted butter until onion is translucent. Mix spinach with the eggs, cottage cheese, cheddar cheese, flour, and the remaining butter. Add the sauteed onions and garlic. Season with salt and pepper. Pour into prepared dish and bake for 1 hour. ; name: tomato jelly ; ingredients: tomato juice, lemon, pectin, sugar, tabasco sauce, clove, cinnamon ; preparation:Boil toomato juice if making spicy. You can add the spices in a boil bag or use ground. Add lemon juice and fine zest. Stir in pectin. Bring to a boil. Stir in sugar until dissolve. Bring to a rolling boil. Boil 4 minutes. If making hot jelly add tabasco now. Let stand a minute. Skim. Pour into jars. ; name: grilled rosemary pork chops ; ingredients: olive oil, red wine vinegar, garlic clove, fresh rosemary, coarse sea salt, fresh coarse ground black pepper, worcestershire sauce, center-cut pork loin chops ; preparation:Mix oil, vinegar, garlic, rosemary, salt, & pepper, and brush on chops. Refrigerate at least 30 minutes or as long as overnight. Preheat grill. Grill 5-8 minutes on each side, depending on thickness. Let rest 1-2 minutes before serving. ; name: garlic cheese biscuits ; ingredients: bisquick, milk, cheddar cheese, butter, garlic salt ; preparation:Mix bisquick, milk and cheddar cheese until a soft ball forms. Beat vigorously for 30 seconds. Drob by balls onto ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 450 degrees for 8-10 munutes. Melt butter. Mix butter and garlic salt. Brush garlic butter on rolls while still hot on the pan. ; name: a very special gnocchi ; ingredients: gnocchi, bacon, leeks, unsalted butter, all-purpose flour, skim milk, parmesan cheese, cheddar cheese, cooked boneless skinless chicken breasts, baby spinach leaves ; preparation:Cook gnocchi according to package directions. Set aside. Saut bacon until crisp. Set aside. Saut leeks in bacon fat. In medium saucepan, melt butter. Over medium heat, whisk in flour. Whisk in milk, stirring constantly until boiling. Add cheeses & stir until melted. In large bowl, combine all components & stir well, adding spinach last. ; name: three dollar baked beans ; ingredients: pork and beans, black beans, onion, smoked bacon, catsup, barbecue sauce, brown sugar, white sugar ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Brown bacon until crisp then drain on paper towels. Cook onions in bacon drippings until translucent. Drain any excess fat from pan. Add beans, catsup, barbecue sauce, sugars and bacon to pan. Stir and pour into a baking pan. Bake for 1 hour. ; name: sandy s holiday mashed potato casserole ; ingredients: idaho potatoes, cream cheese, butter, sour cream, cream, eggs, salt, garlic salt ; preparation:

name: pacman punch ; ingredients: pineapple juice, fresh orange juice, kalamansi juice, white rum, dark rum, sugar, water ; preparation:In a large bowl or pitcher, combine the fruit juices with the rums and stir to combine. In a smaller bowl, combine the reserved kalamansi rinds with the sugar and then muddle with a muddler or wooden spoon until sugar soaks up citrus oils. Bring a cup of water to a boil, pour into the sugar and citrus peel mixture, and then stir until sugar dissolves. Strain and discard the kalamansi rinds, then pour the kalamansi syrup into the juice and rum mixture. Taste the punch. Depending on your pineapple and orange juice, sweetness will vary. Add more kalamansi juice if needed, or more sugar if needed. Chill the punch well, make the night before you serve it if you have time. ; name: avgolemono egg lemon soup ; ingredients: chicken stock, fresh dill, rice, eggs, lemon juice, salt and pepper ; preparation:In a large saucepan, bring the stock, with the dill added, to a boil. Add rice. Reduce heat and simmer, covered, for about 15 to 20 minutes-- just until the rice is tender but still firm. In the bowl with the beaten eggs, slowly stir about 2 cups of the soup in, beating constantly. Once combined, slowly pour this mixture back into the soup-pot. Increase the heat to medium and cook, stirring constantly, for about 5 minutes or until the soup has slightly thickened. Remove from heat and stir in lemon juice. Taste and add salt and pepper. Serve immediately. ; name: caramelized corn with onions and red bell peppers ; ingredients: fresh corn kernels, olive oil, red bell peppers, onion, garlic clove, fresh cilantro, chili powder ; preparation:Heat large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add corn. Stir until beginning to dry and brown, about 8 minutes. Transfer to small bowl. Add oil to skillet. Heat over medium-high heat. Add bell peppers, onion, and garlic. Saut until peppers are tender, about 8 minutes. Mix in cilantro and chili powder, then corn. Stir until heated through, about 2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. ; name: diabetic strawberry jam sugar free ; ingredients: strawberries, white grape juice concentrate, lemon juice, lemon rind, unflavored gelatin ; preparation:Place berries juices and lemon rind in saucepan. Mash berries slightly to release juice. Heat berries to boiling. Sprinkle with unflavored gelatin, and stir gelatin in well. Remove from heat, skim top and pack into hot jars with hot lids. Cool to room temperature before freezing. ; name: creamy bean tortilla soup ; ingredients: bacon, onion, celery, salt, red pepper, garlic powder, rotel tomatoes, chicken broth, refried beans, water ; preparation:Saute onion and celery in bacon grease you get from frying your bacon strips. Combine all ingredients including the crumbled bacon and heat till hot. Add water to desired consistency. Soup should be creamy. Serve with tortilla chips. ; name: green bean cherry tomato and basil salad ; ingredients: green beans, shallot, red wine vinegar, salt and pepper, extra virgin olive oil, cherry tomatoes, fresh basil leaves ; preparation:Bring large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the green beans and cook about 4 minutes. Drain and set aside on a towel to cool. In large bowl, stir together shallot, vinegar, salt and pepper. Set aside for 15 minutes, then whisk in oil. Add cherry tomatoes and toss. Add beans and basil and toss again. Adjust seasoning. ; name: mixed bean and tomato salad ; ingredients: fresh green beans, balsamic vinegar, extra virgin olive oil, kosher salt, black pepper, cherry tomatoes, fresh basil, red onion, feta cheese ; preparation:Cook green and yellow beans in boiling water for 5 minutes. Drain beans and put in a bowl of ice water to stop the cooking, then drain. Combine vinegar, oil, salt and pepper with a whisk in a large bowl. Add beans, onion and tomatoes and toss gently. Cover and refrigerate. Right before serving, add basil and feta cheese and toss. ; name: wheat n oat pancakes ; ingredients: quick-cooking rolled oats, skim milk, whole wheat flour, raw sugar, baking powder, salt, ground cinnamon, egg whites, canola oil, vanilla extract ; preparation:

name: roasted brussels sprouts with pine nuts ; ingredients: brussels sprouts, dried thyme, dried oregano, pine nuts, kosher salt, black pepper, extra virgin olive oil, balsamic vinegar ; preparation:Heat oven to 425. Cut the bottoms off the brussels sprouts and trim any damaged leaves. Cut in half. Add the rest of the ingredients into a bowl. Mix to combine. Add brussels sprouts and mix until coated. Put in a roasting pan in the oven for 45 minutes, stiring once after about 25 minutes, until brown and caramelized. ; name: greens and apples ; ingredients: soy margarine, granny smith apples, frozen apple juice concentrate, greens, salt and pepper ; preparation:In large saucepan, melt margarine over medium heat. Add apples and cook, stirring, until lightly browned. Add remaining ingredients. Cover and cook, stirring occasionally, until greens are tender. Serve immediately. ; name: basil and zucchini soup ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, garlic, boiling water, chicken stock cubes, zucchini, fresh basil, evaporated low-fat milk ; preparation:Heat the oil in a large saucepan and lightly cook the onion and garlic untilgolden. Add the water, stock, zucchini and basil. Bring to the boil, lower heat and simmer for about 10 minutes or until vegetables are soft. Process in a food processor until smooth return to pan, add the milk. And heat do not boil. ; name: garlic butter spice shrimp with mashed potatoes ; ingredients: simply potatoes traditional mashed potatoes, frozen cooked shrimp, cumin, taco seasoning mix, chicken broth, garlic cloves, butter, salt & pepper ; preparation:Heat mashed potatoes according to package directions. Cook garlic in butter on low heat for 1-2 minutes just until they release their oil. Add garlic and butter to a pot with chicken broth, taco seasoning, cumin, garlic, & the rest of the butter. Heat to boiling. Add shrimp & heat through. Spoon a mound of mashed potatoes high into the center of a soup bowl. Fill surrounding area with shrimp and broth. Serve with crusty french bread. ; name: chicken enchiladas with red sauce ; ingredients: chicken breasts, enchilada sauce, cheddar cheese, sour cream, refried beans, cilantro, diced green chilies, taco seasoning, tortillas ; preparation:Pre heat oven at 350 degrees. Combine the chicken, cheese, sour cream, refried beans, chiles, taco seasoning and cilantro in a mixing bowl. Fill each tortilla with 2 spoonfuls of filling mix. Fold tortillas and place in baking pan seam side down. When the pan is filled, pour enchilada sauce over the top of all the filled tortillas. Cover the pan and bake for 20-40 minutes. ; name: rich butter pecan cookies ; ingredients: butter, sugar, egg, water, vanilla, all-purpose flour, salt, pecans ; preparation:Separate white of egg from yolk and set aside. Cream butter and sugar. Beat egg yolk with water and add to creamed butter mixture. Add vanilla, flour and salt. Lightly grease a cookie sheet. Patting dough with hands, thinly spread onto cookie sheet, covering only a three-fourth area of the sheet. Cut white of egg to keep it from being too stringy and smear over top of batter by hand. Sprinkle finely chopped pecans on top and press inches. Bake in a 350 degree oven for approximately 15 to 20 minutes until lightly browned on edges. Do not overcook. When cool, cut into squares. ; name: pudding snack neapolitan parfaits ; ingredients: fresh strawberries, prepared chocolate pudding, prepared vanilla pudding, whipped cream ; preparation:Slice 7 of the strawberries. Spoon chocolate pudding evenly into two dessert glasses. Cover with layers of strawberry slices and vanilla pudding. Top with whipped topping and remaining two strawberries. Serve immediately. ; name: mother and child reunion ; ingredients: oil, boneless skinless chicken breast halves, ranch dressing, italian breadcrumbs, butter, eggs, bacon, american cheese, rolls ; preparation:

name: honey apple pork chops ; ingredients: boneless pork loin chops, apple juice, lemon juice, gluten-free soy sauce, honey, garlic clove ; preparation:Place chops in a shallow dish. Combine remaining ingredients and mix well. Pour marinade over chops. Cover and refrigerate overnight, turning occasionally. Remove chops from marinade. Place on grill, approximately six inches from medium-hot coals. Grill for 10-15 minutes, turning once and basting with remaining marinade. Discard remaining marinade when meat is grilled. ; name: dijon crusted pork chops ; ingredients: pork chops, dijon mustard, fresh rosemary, seasoned bread crumbs, salt and pepper, olive oil ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Spread dijon on chops. Sprinkle rosemary, salt and pepper. Turn to other side and repeat. Place breadcrumbs on shallow dish. Coat chops on both sides in crumbs. Heat skillet on medium high heat. Drizzle small amount of olive oil. Heat. Brown chops for a couple of minutes on each side. Place chops in oven. Cook for 20 minutes. ; name: madeline s chardonnay shrimp ; ingredients: butter, garlic cloves, chardonnay wine, worcestershire sauce, salt, oregano, thyme, crushed red pepper flakes, fresh parsley, large raw shrimp ; preparation:Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook for one minute. Stir in wine, worcestershire sauce, and seasonings and bring to a boil. Reduce to simmer and add the shrimp. Cook for about 3 to 4 minutes until shrimp becomes pink and tender. Serve shrimp in wide shallow bowls with cooking juices. A crusty bread goes nicely to soak up the yummy juices. ; name: chocolate rum bananas ; ingredients: butter, semisweet chocolate, bananas, rum, sour cream ; preparation:Take 4 10-inch squares of aluminum foil and brush them with butter. Make a careful slit lengthwise in the peel of each banana, and open wide enough to place the chocolate pieces inside the bananas then close them up. Wrap each stuffed banana in the foil then barbecue over hot coals about 5-10 minutes or until the chocolate has melted inside the bananas. Remove from the bbq and place on individual serving plates. Pour some rum into each banana. Serve at once with sour cream mascarpone cheese, or ice cream, topped with nutmeg. ; name: turkish scrambled eggs menemen ; ingredients: eggs, cream, cubanelle pepper, roma tomatoes, extra virgin olive oil, feta cheese, salt and pepper ; preparation:Place the olive oil and cubanelle peppers in a large pan. Cook for about 2 minutes over medium-high heat. Take the seeds out of the tomatoes and squeeze slightly to remove excess juice. Then chop and add the tomatoes, salt and pepper. Cook for another 7-8 minutes, stirring occasionally. Mix the eggs with the cream in a bowl, and pour into the pan. Then add the feta cheese. Keep stirring periodically until the eggs are done. Make sure you dont overcook, otherwise it will be dry. Serve with bread. ; name: green chili rice casserole ; ingredients: uncooked rice, butter, sour cream, milk, monterey jack cheese, diced green chilies, salt, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Cook rice first, as per directions on the package, usually two parts water, one part rice bring to a boil, reduce heat until water is gone. Preheat oven to 350f. Add butter, sour cream, milk, jack cheese, chilies, and salt to cooked rice. Mix well. Put in a casserole dish, sprinkle top with cheddar cheese, and cook until center is hot. ; name: the black eyed peas baked squash ; ingredients: yellow squash, eggs, whole wheat rolls, butter, sugar, salt, pepper, onion ; preparation:Cut squash and onion in pieces, boil together, then reduce heat until tender. Drain & mash squash some. Combine squash, onion, eggs, bread bits, butter, sugar, salt. Put into a 3 quart dish that has been oiled. Bake at 350 until lightly browned. Sometimes i toss in some velveeta - when the kids were small they liked it with the cheese. ; name: potato skins t g i friday s potato skins ; ingredients: baking potatoes, sour cream, fresh chives, butter, cheddar cheese, cooked bacon ; preparation:

name: jalapeno corn grits ; ingredients: butter, jalapeno, fresh corn kernels, onion, grits, water, fresh thyme, kosher salt, cracked black pepper ; preparation:Melt the butter in a medium saucepan. Add the jalapeno, corn and onion. Saute until the vegetables are tender. Stir in the grits. Add the water gradually, stirring constantly. Cook over medium heat until the grits have absorbed all the water, stirring constantly. Stir in the thyme and season with salt and pepper. ; name: peppery beef tenderloin ; ingredients: oregano, paprika, thyme, salt, garlic powder, onion powder, basil, cracked black pepper, cayenne pepper, beef tenderloin ; preparation:Mix all the spices together well. Rub into the tenderloin. Place on rack in a roasting pan. Bake at 400 for 45 minutes----rare. 60 minutes---medium rare. 65 minutes---medium. 73 minutes---well done. Let stand for 10 minutes before slicing. ; name: quick turkey pot pie ; ingredients: mixed vegetables, cooked turkey, cream soup, bisquick, egg, milk ; preparation:Place turkey and vegetables in a 8 inch pie pan. Cover with soup. Mix egg, milk and bisquick. Pour over top. Bake at 400f 30-35 minutes or until golden. Serve with favorite salad. ; name: animal crackers ; ingredients: oatmeal, honey, salt, flour, baking soda, butter, buttermilk ; preparation:Blend oatmeal in blender. Add next 4 ingredients in bowl with oatmeal. Cut in butter and mix in buttermilk. Roll thin layer and cut in shapes. Bake at 400 10 minutes. Yum yum. ; name: amaranth pie crust gluten free ; ingredients: arrowroot, flour, amaranth flour, sea salt, cinnamon, vegetable oil, water ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f and lightly oil a 9-inch pie pan. Set aside. Combine dry ingredients and blend well. Combine oil and 3 tablespoons water and blend with fork. Add all at once to flour. Stir only until a ball forms. If ball appears dry and crumbly, add a little more water, one teaspoon at a time, until ball hangs together. Pat or roll crust to fit into pie pan. Dough tears easily, but mends easily using extra bits to patch. Prick with fork. Bake 3 minutes at 400f, fill pie and finish baking the time required for filling or bake about 15 minutes until brown and crisp. Cool and fill. ; name: fig and crispy prosciutto salad ; ingredients: prosciutto, spinach, fresh basil, figs, balsamic vinegar, truffle oil ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Place slices of prosciutto flat on parchment paper over a baking sheet. Bake about 13 minutes, or until fairly crisp. Remove from oven and let cool slightly. Break the prosciutto up into pieces and set aside. Assemble salad with the spinach and basil on the bottom. Top with figs and crispy prosciutto, and dress with balsamic vinegar and truffle oil, to taste. ; name: chili corn ; ingredients: whole kernel corn, green chilies, cream cheese, margarine, milk, garlic salt, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Combine milk, cream cheese, and margarine in a medium sauce pan. Stir over low heat until melted. After melted, add corn. When heated through, place in dish and sprinkle with garlic salt. Bake for 30 minutes at 325 degrees. Garnish with cheddar cheese. ; name: pomegranate tapioca ; ingredients: pomegranates, sugar, grenadine, water, tapioca, whipped cream ; preparation:

name: petrini s italian pot roast ; ingredients: chuck roast, salt, black pepper, olive oil, garlic, italian seasoning, tomato sauce, apple juice, apple cider vinegar, button mushroom ; preparation:Season beef to taste with salt and pepper. Heat a large pot over medium to medium high heat. Coat bottom of pre-heated pan with olive oil. Sear meat well on both sides. Once the meat is seared remove to a plate. In a bowl or large measuring cup, mix together the tomato sauce, garlic, italian seasoning, apple juice and vinegar. Pour liquids into pot and deglaze, being sure to scrape up all the yummy goodness on the bottom of the pan. Add back the meat and also add the mushrooms. Lower the heat so that the liquids are at a simmer and cover the pot. Let simmer for 2-3 hours until the meat is falling apart. Serve in shallow bowls over pasta cooked al dente. ; name: chilies chutney ; ingredients: lime, salt, white wine vinegar, red chilies, green chilies, shallots, lemon juice, sugar, vegetable oil ; preparation:In a bowl, combine the lime slices and salt, and let set for 30 minutes. In a separate bowl, pour the vinegar over the chilies, let sit for a moment, then drain. Rinse the shallots in cold water, then drain. Mix the chilies, shallots, lemon juice, sugar and oil, then stir in the salted limes. Serve immediately, or refrigerate. This make approximately 1 cup of spicy chutney. ; name: mealie soup south african corn soup ; ingredients: butter, onion, tomatoes, frozen corn, creamed corn, fat-free evaporated milk, chicken broth, salt, black pepper ; preparation:In a large saucepan, melt the butter over moderate heat. Add the onions and saut for 5 minutes. Stir in the tomatoes and cook for about 5 more minutes. Add the corn, creamed corn milk, chicken broth, salt, and pepper. Simmer for about 15 minutes. Serve with crackers. ; name: dr kim s egg roll ; ingredients: ground beef, onion, sweet peppers, butter, eggs ; preparation:Saut beef, onions, and pepper until crumbly. Season with salt and pepper and set aside to drain. Put butter in omelet pan or skillet with heat on medium high and wait for butter to sizzle. Pour beaten egg into pan, tilting to cover entire bottom of pan, and turn heat to medium low. Sprinkle meat mixture on egg as it begins to set. When egg is firm enough, roll gently, as in jelly roll, browning lightly on the bottom as you roll it. When egg roll is done, turn out onto serving platter, and cut into pinwheel sections. ; name: ham cheese ball ; ingredients: cream cheese, mayonnaise, ham, parsley, dry onion, dry mustard, tabasco sauce ; preparation:Beat cream cheese and mayonnaise until smooth. Stir in remaining ingredients. Cover and chill several hours to blend flavors. Serve with assorted crackers. When chilled, you can shape into a ball, then roll in chopped walnuts to give an elegant appearance if serving to guests. Place on lettuce leaves or garnish with parsley sprigs. ; name: dale earnhardt s fish and vegetable rolls ; ingredients: asparagus spears, carrots, mayonnaise, seasoned dry bread crumbs, country-style dijon mustard, fresh dill, tabasco sauce, flounder fillets ; preparation:In a 12-inch skillet over high heat, combine asparagus, carrots, and enough water to cover vegetables. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer 2 to 3 minutes or until vegetables are crisp-tender. Drain. Preheat oven to 450 degrees f. In a small bowl, combine mayonnaise, bread crumbs, mustard, dill and tabasco sauce. Spread half of mixture on top sides of fish fillets. Top each fillet with one-fourth of cooked asparagus and carrots. Roll fish around vegetables and place seam side down in a greased 12 x 8 x 2-inch baking dish. Spread remaining mustard mixture on tops of fish rolls. Bake 12 to 15 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Makes 4 servings. ; name: fried liver curry lamb pork or chicken ; ingredients: liver, onion, mustard, oil, turmeric, chili powder, ground black pepper, ground ginger, salt, garlic cloves ; preparation:Heat the oil in a pan and add the mustard, stir well to blend them together, add the onion and fry till just golden. Mix together the turmeric, chilli powder, black pepper, salt and the ginger with a little milk to make a thin paste. Coat the liver with the spice mix and add to the pan with the garlic. Cover the pan and cook over low heat till the liver is tender. Serve with rice or noodles. ; name: reasonable beef stir fry ; ingredients: beef, olive oil, bell peppers, onions, seasoning, hoisin sauce, water ; preparation:

name: chicken wings in honey bbq sauce ; ingredients: chicken wings, salt and black pepper, honey, soy sauce, barbecue sauce, oil, garlic cloves ; preparation:Cut off and discard wing. Cut each wing at joint to make two sections. Season wings with salt and pepper, to taste. Place wings on broiler pan and broil about 6 inches from heat for 10 minutes on each side or until brown. Transfer wings to slow cooker. Combine remaining ingredients in a bowl. Pour over chicken wings. Cover and place slow cooker on high for 2 hour or low for 4 hours. ; name: ham and manchego panini with dipping sauce ; ingredients: country bread, ham, manchego cheese, olive oil, apricot jam, dijon mustard ; preparation:Divide ham and cheese evenly between two pieces of bread and top with remaining bread. Brush tops of sandwiches with 2 teaspoons oil. In a large nonstick skillet, heat remaining oil over medium-low heat. Place panini in skillet, oiled side up. Cover and cook until golden and cheese has melted, 5-8 minutes per side, pressing down with spatula occasionally. For sauce, mix together jam and dijon. ; name: bacon cheddar ranch pull apart bread ; ingredients: dinner rolls, cheddar cheese, bacon bits, ranch dressing mix ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375. Lightly spray a small baking tin with vegetable oil spray. Seperate dough into 8 inch rolls. Cut each roll into quarters. In a bowl mix cheese, bacon bits and ranch. Toss each piece of dough into mixture until coated. Place each piece, slightly overlapping into baker. Ae 22 minutes or until top is golden brown. ; name: instant rice pudding ; ingredients: white rice, milk, sugar, salt, vanilla extract, cinnamon, nutmeg ; preparation:Combine cooked rice, milk, sugar and salt in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil, then lower the heat to a simmer and stir in the vanilla. Cook until just about all of the milk is absorbed, stirring occasionally. Stir in cinnamon and nutmeg. Serve warm or chilled. ; name: chicken tenders w balsamic vinegar glaze ; ingredients: olive oil, chicken tenders, black pepper, garlic, balsamic vinegar, honey, low sodium chicken broth ; preparation:Heat oil over med-high heat. Add chicken season with pepper. Cook 3 to 4 min on each side. Remove chicken and set aside. Reduce heat to low-medium, add garlic and saute. Then add vinegar, honey and chicken broth. Scrape bottom of pan and heat 1 minute. Return chicken to pan, mix ingredients and heat through. ; name: edible cookie dough for ice cream no eggs ; ingredients: flour, brown sugar, white sugar, butter, vanilla, milk, mini chocolate chip ; preparation:In a medium bowl mix together both sugars and butter until smooth. Stir in vanilla and milk. Mix in the flour until well blended. Add in chocolate chips. Shape into a log and freeze for about 1-2 hours or until firm. Cut or break into small chunks. Mix into softened ice cream. Return the ice cream to freezer. ; name: crispy parmesan ranch chicken breasts strips or tenders ; ingredients: corn flakes, parmesan cheese, garlic powder, black pepper, dry ranch dressing mix, boneless skinless chicken breasts, butter ; preparation:Grease a 13 x 9-inch baking dish. Set oven to 350 degrees f. In a shallow dish mix together the cornflake crumbs with parmesan cheese, garlic powder black pepper and dry ranch dressing mix. Place the melted butter in a shallow dish. Coat the chicken breast or strips into the melted butter, then roll into the cornflake mixture. Place in prepared baking dish. Bake uncovered for about 30 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through. ; name: honey corn flake crumb chicken ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, honey, dijon mustard, salt, pepper, garlic powder, paprika, corn flakes ; preparation:

name: poppy seed lemon pie ; ingredients: sweetened condensed milk, lemonade concentrate, frozen whipped topping, graham cracker crust, poppy seed, yellow food coloring ; preparation:In a mixing bowl, beat mild and lemonade concentrate until smooth. Fold in 2 cups whipped topping. Spread half into the crust. Add poppy seeds and food coloring to the remaining lemon mixture. Stir until blended. Spoon over first layer. Spread with the remaining whipped toping. Refrigerate until ready to serve. ; name: lolly s chinese fried rice ; ingredients: cooked white rice, onion, scallion, mushrooms, oil, soy sauce, garlic salt ; preparation:Dice onion and scallions. Saute in oil. Take an egg and scramble quickly. Mix well. Add mushrooms to rice, soy sauce and seasoning. Heat thoroughly. ; name: apple braised pork chops ; ingredients: boneless pork chops, onion, garlic clove, olive oil, flour, salt, pepper, apple juice, dried tart cherry ; preparation:In a heavy skillet, saute onion and garlic in olive oil until just about ready to carmelize. Remove vegetables from skillet and set aside. Season chops with salt and pepper. Dredge with flour on both sides. Brown chops for about five minutes on each side. After browning both sides, pour apple juice over chops. Let the chops cook in the juice for another five minutes over med-low heat. Do not cover. Remove chops and add onion and garlic back into the pan. Reduce sauce slightly, adding dried cherries in last 2-3 minutes of cooking. To serve, plate chops with wild rice and spoon a bit of the sauce over each chop. Depending on thickness of the chops, you may need to adjust cooking time slightly. ; name: hot mulled crock pot punch ; ingredients: cranberry juice, apple juice, brown sugar, salt, cinnamon sticks, whole cloves ; preparation:Pour cranberry and apple juices into crock pot. Add brown sugar and salt. Stir until dissolved. Tie cinnamon sticks and cloves in cheesecloth or put them in a tea ball and add to crock pot. Heat on low for 2 hours. Remove cinnamon and cloves. Serve hot. ; name: california crock pot dandy brandy apple butter ; ingredients: fresh unsweetened applesauce, brown sugar, calvados, orange blossom honey, ground cinnamon, ground cloves, ground nutmeg, ground mace ; preparation:Add sugar to prepared applesauce to taste, depending on the sweetness of your apples. Combine with all other ingredients and cook in crock pot on low until thickened and brown, 8-10 hours. Stir occasionally, scraping sides with a rubber spatula. I remove the cover for the last hour or two and stir it more often. Pour into hot sterilized jars, leaving inch head space. Vacuum seal. Alternately, cool, put in plastic containers and freeze. ; name: my chopped chicken liver ; ingredients: chicken liver, chicken fat, onion, hard-boiled eggs, salt, pepper, onion powder, garlic powder ; preparation:In microwave, cook chicken livers and fat until done, about 5 minutes. Remove livers with a slotted spoon, add onions and microwave until cooked, about 3 minutes. Meanwhile hard boil eggs in saucepan until done. Add livers, fat and onions to food processor. Pulse until all ingredients are chopped fine. Mash eggs and add seasoning. Add liver mixture to egg mixture. Serve chopped liver on greens, surrounded by tomatoes, and lettuce. Serve with toast points or crackers. ; name: my back ribs ; ingredients: back ribs, lemon, seasoning salt, water, barbecue sauce ; preparation:Rub the ribs with seasoned salt on all sides. Place in long casserole meat side down and place lemon on top. Fill casserole with about an inch of water. Cover with tin foil and bake at 325 degrees for about 2 hours periodically checking to make sure there is enough water and that they are not falling off the bone to the extent that they cannot go on the bbq. Baste with your favorite bbq sauce and grill on your bbq for about 5 minutes per side. Serve but no knife. ; name: brit s cheesy onion home fries ; ingredients: russet potatoes, butter, salt, fresh ground black pepper, sharp cheddar cheese, onion, parsley ; preparation:

name: sweet peach tea ; ingredients: tea leaves, lemon, gingerroot, boiling water, ice cubes, peaches, sugar, mint, fresh peach ; preparation:Place tea, lemon and ginger in a heatproof container and add boiling water. Let tea steep 7 to 8 minutes. Place 4 cups of the ice in a pitcher, then pour in tea. Blend diced peaches and sugar in a blender until smooth. Mix into tea. Serve in glasses over remaining ice and garnish with mint and peach slices. ; name: kim s midnight brownie recipe as seen on dr oz ; ingredients: black beans, agave nectar, self-rising flour, egg white, unsweetened cocoa, vanilla, baking powder, chocolate chips ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Lightly spray a 8x8 baking dish with nonstick cooking spray. In a food processor, or blender, mix all brownie ingredients together. Chop on high, until smooth. Clean off sides and blend for another 20 seconds. Add the chips in and stir well. Spread into the 8x8 baking dish. Cook for 20 minutes, until toothpick comes out clean. Cool for about 1 hour in dish at room temperature. ; name: bangkok burgers ; ingredients: ground beef, brewed coffee, salt, soy sauce, butter, poppy seed rolls ; preparation:Mix ground beef lightly with coffee and salt - shape into 4 patties. Patties should be about 1 inch thick. Brush patties with soy sauce. Pay fry over medium heat in butter for 8 minutes turn and brush again with soy sauce. Cook 8 additional minutes for medium. Serve on rolls. ; name: lynne s cheesecake ; ingredients: cream cheese, marshmallow creme, eggs, flour, graham cracker crust ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 f degrees. Beat cream cheese, marshmallow creme, eggs, and flour until smooth. Pour into graham cracker pie shell. Bake for 45 minutes or until edges are brown. Turn oven off and let cheesecake cool in oven for 1 hour. Remove to wire rack to cool. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours before serving. ; name: smoky chipotle salsa with tomatillos ; ingredients: garlic cloves, tomatillo, chipotle chiles in adobo, water, seasoning, sea salt ; preparation:Preheat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add tomatillos cut side down. Brown on both sides, turning over halfway through, about 7 minutes total. Transfer tomatillos to a blender or food processor. Add garlic, chiles, water, salsa seasoning and salt. Process to a coarse puree. Let cool before serving. ; name: easy double chocolate nut clusters crock pot ; ingredients: chocolate almond bark, german chocolate, semi-sweet chocolate chips, dry roasted peanuts, roasted almonds, almond flavoring ; preparation:Turn crock pot on high and ad the first six ingredients. Cook for 45 minutes. Reduce heat and cook for one hour or until all chocolate is melted, stirring every 15 minute add almond flavoring and stir. Put by spoonfuls into mini muffin liners. Store in an airtight container. ; name: baked vanilla peaches ; ingredients: butter, peaches, vanilla bean, honey, white wine, ice cream ; preparation:Pre heat oven to 160 c. Grease small baking dish with the butter. Cut a cross in the bottom of each peach. Place cross side up in dish. Top each peach with vanilla seeds. Drizzle evenly with honey. Pour wine into dish around peaches. Bake 45 minutes or till tender. Serve with ice cream. ; name: jamaican baste ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, garlic cloves, chili, ground allspice, ground cinnamon, lime, sugar ; preparation:

name: chicken fettuccine in bourbon sauce ; ingredients: cooked chicken, onion, garlic clove, butter, flour, ground red pepper, chicken broth, half-and-half, bourbon, fettuccine ; preparation:Cook the fettuccine according to package instructions, but do not drain until just before serving. Melt the butter in a frying pan and saute the onions until transparent, then add the garlic. Add the flour and ground red pepper, stir and then add the half and half, followed by the chicken stock. Take the pan off the cook top briefly while adding the bourbon. Return the pan to the cooktop and add the chicken. Stir until the sauce has thicken and the chicken is hot. Place the cooked and drained fettuccine into a serving bowl, and pour the chicken and sauce over the top. ; name: carrot potato and onion gratin ; ingredients: butter, russet potatoes, onions, carrot, salt, fresh ground black pepper, chicken stock, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350f generously butter a medium-size gratin dish. Make a layer of one-third of the potato slices in the bottom of the prepared gratin dish. Add a layer of half the onions and then half the carrots. Dot with 2 tablespoons of the butter and season well with salt and pepper. Repeat the layers and finish with the remaining one-third of the potato slices. Dot with the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter and season with salt and pepper. Pour in the stock. Cover with aluminum foil and bake until the vegetables are tender, about 45 minutes. Uncover and sprinkle with the cheese. Bake 10 minutes longer, until the cheese is golden brown. Serve very hot. Makes 6 to 8 servings. ; name: nikki s health cookies ; ingredients: bananas, vanilla extract, coconut oil, rolled oats, almond meal, coconut, cinnamon, sea salt, baking powder, dark chocolate bars ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In large bowl combine bananas, vanilla and coconut oil. In another bowl wisk oats, almond meal, coconut, cinnamon, salt and baking powder. Add dry ingredients to wet ones. Fold in chocolate chunks. Drop small dollops on parchment or silpat lined baking sheet. Bake 14-18 minutes, as long as possible without burning. ; name: yummy low fat french toast ; ingredients: egg beaters egg substitute, skim milk, ground cinnamon, vanilla extract, margarine, french bread, maple syrup ; preparation:In shallow bowl, combine egg beaters original, milk, cinnamon and vanilla. In nonstick skillet, over medium heat, melt 2 teaspoons margarine. Dip bread slices in egg mixture to coat. Transfer to skillet. Brown about 3 minutes on each side. Top with syrup if desired. ; name: primavera fish fillets ; ingredients: celery ribs, carrot, onion, garlic clove, white wine, dried thyme, dill, old bay seasoning, cream of mushroom soup, cod ; preparation:In a large skillet, combine the first eight ingredients. Bring to a boil and then reduce heat and cover and simmer for 5-7 minutes or until vegetables are crisp-tender. Stir in soup until blended. Bring to a boil and then add fillets. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 5-7 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. ; name: penne with vodka cream and smoked salmon ; ingredients: penne pasta, marinara sauce, fresh dill, vodka, smoked salmon, frozen peas, heavy cream ; preparation:Cook pasta in salted water according to package directions to al dente. Drain and keep warm. Meanwhile, in a large saucepan over medium heat, simmer the marinara sauce, dill and vodka for 15 minutes. Add the salmon pieces, peas and cream and heat through. Pour sauce over pasta and serve. ; name: greek green beans braised with mint and potatoes ; ingredients: olive oil, margarine, tomato juice, fresh green beans, fresh parsley, potatoes, salt & freshly ground black pepper, of fresh mint ; preparation:Combine olive oil and margarine in a non-reactive pan. Heat through. Add tomato juice or sauce, green beans, parsley and enough water to almost cover. Tuck the potato slices in between, partially cover pan with lid, and simmer for 25 minutes. Stir and season with salt, pepper, and 2 tbsp chopped mint. Cook uncovered until green beans and potatoes are fork tender, about 10 more minutes. If the sauce has not thickened, pour it into a small pan, and reduce to one cup, then combine with the beans and potatoes in a warm serving bowl. Sprinkle with a little additional fresh mint and serve warm. ; name: a molasses ginger snaps ; ingredients: molasses, sugar, egg, crisco shortening, flour, salt, cinnamon, clove, ginger ; preparation:

name: chocolate cheesecake pie ; ingredients: cream cheese, butter, powdered sugar, vanilla extract, milk chocolate chips, frozen whipped topping, chocolate cookie pie crust ; preparation:In large mixing bowl, beat cream cheese, butter, sugar, and vanilla. Beat in melted chocolate. Fold in whipped topping. Spoon into crust. Cover and chill until serving. ; name: asia nora mint raita ; ingredients: low-fat yogurt, cucumber, ground cumin, mint, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:If you have time, put the yogurt in a cheese cloth-lined colander and drain it in the refrigerator for at least one hour, preferably more. This will produce a thick yogurt, which when mixed with the cucumber will produce a thicker and less watery raita. Squeeze the grated cucumber very well between your fingers to drain it. This prevents the raita from being too watery. Mix the cucumber with the yogurt, cumin and mint. Season to taste with salt and pepper. ; name: potato soup with crispy bacon ; ingredients: oil, bacon, brown onion, garlic clove, potatoes, fresh thyme, chicken stock, water, cream ; preparation:Heat 2 teaspoons of oil over high heat and add 4 rashers of bacon and cook for 2-3 minutes or until crip and then set aside. Heat another 2 teaspoons of oil in the pan and add chopped brown onion and garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add potatoes, 2 sprigs thyme, chicken stock and water and bring to the boil and then reduce heat and simmer for 15-20 minutes. Blend until smooth and stir through cream. Divide into serving bowls and top with crispy bacon to serve. ; name: kicked up bacon cheese mashed potatoes ; ingredients: baking potatoes, salt, half-and-half, butter, pepper, bacon, sharp cheddar cheese, sour cream, chives ; preparation:Place potatoes and 1 tsp salt in a saucepan, cover with water, bring to a boil. Reduce heat to simmer. Cook until potatoes are tender, about 20 minutes. Drain, return to pot. Add half and half, butter, remaining salt, pepper. Place pan over medium low heat, mash for 4-5 minutes. Add bacon, cheese, sour cream, chives and stir. ; name: melon in passionfruit ginger syrup ; ingredients: passion fruit, sugar, water, ginger in syrup, of fresh mint, cantaloupe, watermelon, honeydew melon ; preparation:Combine passionfruit, sugar, water and ginger in medium pan. Stir over low heat without boiling until sugar has dissolved. Bring to boil, reduce heat, simmer 10-15 minutes or until slightly thickened. Remove from heat. Add mint and allow to cool completely. Remove seeds from melons. Using a melon baler, scoop out balls from fruit. Arrange fruit attractively in large, cut-glass bowl or individual serving glasses. Pour syrup over. Chill for atleast 30 minutes before serving. May be served with freshly-whipped cream or ice cream. ; name: pasta macaroni salad ; ingredients: dry pasta, mayonnaise, buttermilk, fresh dill, garlic powder, salt, black pepper, cucumber, sweet red pepper, scallion ; preparation:Cook pasta to package. Drain and rinse with cold water. Set pasta to the side make sure all water is removed. In a big bowl combine mayo, buttermilk, dill, garlic powder, salt and pepper. Stir to combine. Stir in pasta, celery, cucumber, scallions and sweet pepper. Cover and chill for 2 - 24hours. If a little dry just before serving add small amount of buttermilk. ; name: ham and peas casserole ; ingredients: milk, breadcrumbs, cheese, butter, onion, parsley, eggs, ham, peas ; preparation:Put peas and ham in a buttered casserole.
