While warm, sprinkle with more sugar. ; name: tereasa s spicy marinara sauce ; ingredients: tomatoes, onion, garlic, louisiana hot sauce, salt, oregano ; preparation:In a blender, puree drained diced tomatoes. Set aside. In a large deep fry pan, saute onions with garlic until onions are tender but not browned. Add tomato puree, salt, oregano and hot sauce. Simmer on medium-low and either store the sauce in a jar or use on pasta or meats. ; name: pumpkin pie french toast baked ; ingredients: eggs, milk, pumpkin puree, vanilla, pumpkin pie spice, brown sugar, texas toast thick bread ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Mix the eggs, milk, pumpkin puree, vanilla, pumpkin pie spice, and brown sugar in low flat bowl for easy dipping. Line two cookie sheets with foil and spray with pam. Dip the bread into the egg mixture on both sides and place on cookie sheet. Bake for 25 minutes, flipping them over half way through. Serve with maple syrup, powdered suger, or eat them plain if you are on the go. ; name: fat freddie s beet horseradish ; ingredients: red beet, salt, horseradish, water, vinegar, pepper, sugar ; preparation:Grate beets and horseradish. Combine vinegar, sugar, salt, pepper and water. Bring to a boil. Pour over grated beets and horseradish. Mix thoroughly. Store in jar in refrigerator. ; name: easy applesauce cookies ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, clove, margarine, brown sugar, unsweetened applesauce ; preparation:

name: apple graham cracker dessert ; ingredients: light apple pie filling, butter, splenda sugar substitute, eggs, vanilla extract, graham cracker crumbs, baking powder, salt, nonfat milk, walnuts ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a 9x9-inch cake pan with non-stick spray. In a large bowl, cream butter and splenda. Beat in eggs and vanilla. In a separate bowl, mix graham cracker crumbs, baking powder, salt. Add dry ingredients to wet, mix well to combine. Add milk and walnuts, stirring until just combined. Spread half of mixture into prepared cake pan. Spread half of pie filling over top. Spread remaining batter carefully over apples and arrange remaining apple pie filling over top. Bake for 45 to 50 minutes. Place cake pan on a wire rack and let set for at least 10 minutes before removing from pan. ; name: moroccan spiced olives ; ingredients: green olives in brine, garlic cloves, olive oil, tomato paste, water, harissa, fresh thyme sprigs, lemon slices ; preparation:Cover olives with water in a small saucepan and bring to a boil, then drain. Cook garlic in oil in a 10-inch heavy skillet over medium heat until garlic is golden, about 2 minutes. Add tomato paste and cook, stirring, 1 minute. Stir in water, harissa, thyme, and olives and simmer briskly, stirring occasionally, until liquid is thickened and coats olives, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in lemon slices. Transfer to a shallow dish and marinate, chilled, at least 24 hours. These will keep for 1 month if kept in an airtight container in the refrigerator. ; name: key west smoked fish dip ; ingredients: white fish fillet, cream cheese, cream, lemon juice, garlic salt, onion ; preparation:Flake white fish, making sure there are no bones, into food processor. Add everything else and pulse until smooth. Serve with good crackers. We had them with cuban crackers that i had to order after i returned home. The longer you make it in advance, the better the flavors meld. ; name: santa fe shrimp martini cocktails ; ingredients: mild salsa, avocado, cayenne pepper sauce, lime juice, fresh cilantro leaves, large shrimp, french-fried onions, lime ; preparation:Combine salsa, avocado, cayenne pepper sauce, lime juice and cilantro. Alternately layer shrimp and salsa mixture in 6 margarita or martini glasses. Microwave french fried onions for 1 minute until golden. Sprinkle over shrimp. Garnish with lime. ; name: duchess potatoes ; ingredients: mashed potatoes, butter, salt, eggs ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450f and butter a baking dish. Combine the mashed potatoes, butter and salt with the beaten egg yolks. Pipe into balls, hearts, or other shapes using a pastry bag. Place in dish and brush with slightly beaten egg whites. Brown in oven. ; name: pasta salad peas ham and cheese ; ingredients: small shell pasta, sharp cheddar cheese, cubed ham, frozen tiny peas, mayonnaise, salad dressing, seasoning salt, black pepper, garlic salt, fresh dill ; preparation:Place cooled cooked pasta, ham, cheese, peas and cheese in a large bowl. Mix well. Add mayonnaise, miracle whip, seasoning salt, pepper, garlic salt and dill. Mix until everything is well coated and evenly distributed. Chill well before serving. ; name: white bean guacamole with cumin dusted chips ; ingredients: whole wheat tortillas, olive oil, salt, small white beans, red onion, avocado, lime, jalapeno, cilantro ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cut the tortillas into 8 triangles each. Brush each side with olive oil and sprinkle with salt, pepper and cumin to taste. Arrange in a single layer on two baking sheets and bake until golden brown and crispy, about 10 minutes. While the chips are baking, combine the remaining ingredients in a mixing bowl and mash with a potato masher until you reach a desired consistency. ; name: caramelized carnitas ; ingredients: pork shoulder, brown sugar, tequila, molasses, salt, pepper, garlic cloves, water, green onion ; preparation:

name: gold cookies ; ingredients: butter flavor shortening, sugar, egg yolks, milk, vanilla, flour, baking powder, salt, pecans, cinnamon ; preparation:Mix together shrtening, sugar and egg yolks. Stir in milk and vanilla. Add in flour, baking powder and salt. Chill dough. Roll into balls the size of walnuts and roll balls in mixture of nuts and cinnamon. Place 3 inches apart on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 400 degrees for 12-15 minutes, until golden brown, but still soft. Yields 5 dozen 2-inch cookies. ; name: peas chickpeas and cumin ; ingredients: chickpeas, peas, garlic cloves, cumin, butter, black pepper ; preparation:Melt butter in a pan. Add garlic and cumin and saut for 1 minute. Add chickpeas and saut until heated through. Add peas. Season with black pepper and serve hot. ; name: swiss steak mozzarella ; ingredients: beef round steak, flour, margarine, tomatoes, salt, cream of mushroom soup, mozzarella cheese ; preparation:Cut meat into serving size pieces. Coat with flour. Melt margarine in skillet. Brown meat slowly on both sides. Put into a 9x13 inch baking dish. Combine tomatoes, soup and salt. Pour over meat. Bake covered at 350 degrees 1 hour, or until meat is tender. Remove cover and sprinkle with cheese. Bake an additional 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. ; name: vegetarian green chili ; ingredients: butter, garlic, onion flakes, flour, diced tomatoes, green chili pepper, salt, cilantro, water ; preparation:In a large sauce pan, melt butter or margarine. Add garlic and onion and cook until onion is re-hydtrated. Add flour and stir to make a roux. Add tomatoes, green chili, salt and cilantro. Add water. Simmer for 30 minutes. This can also be made in a crock pot. ; name: asia nora mint raita ; ingredients: low-fat yogurt, cucumber, ground cumin, mint, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:If you have time, put the yogurt in a cheese cloth-lined colander and drain it in the refrigerator for at least one hour, preferably more. This will produce a thick yogurt, which when mixed with the cucumber will produce a thicker and less watery raita. Squeeze the grated cucumber very well between your fingers to drain it. This prevents the raita from being too watery. Mix the cucumber with the yogurt, cumin and mint. Season to taste with salt and pepper. ; name: slow cooker pulled pork ; ingredients: pork tenderloin, root beer, barbecue sauce, hamburger buns ; preparation:Place the pork tenderloin in a slow cooker. Pour the root beer over the meat. Cover and cook on low until well cooked and the pork shreds easily, 6 to 7 hours. Drain well. Stir in barbecue sauce. Serve over hamburger buns. ; name: two potato mash ; ingredients: potatoes, sweet potatoes, milk, cheddar cheese, sour cream, green onions, salt, nutmeg ; preparation:Peel and quarter regular potatoes. Peel and cut sweet potatoes into eighths. In a large saucepan, cover regular potatoes with cold water. Bring to a boil and cook 5 minutes. Add sweet potatoes and cook another 15 minutes or until fork tender. Drain potatoes, and return to low heat for 3 minutes to dry, shaking occasionally. Mash potatoes until smooth. Continue mashing while gradually adding milk. Stir in remaining ingredients. ; name: jewish coffee cake ; ingredients: shortening, sugar, eggs, flour, baking powder, salt, milk, vanilla, cinnamon ; preparation:

name: savory chicken sandwiches from the crock pot ; ingredients: chicken breast halves, chicken thighs, onion soup mix, garlic salt, italian salad dressing, water, hamburger buns ; preparation:Place chicken in crockpot. Sprinkle with soup mix and garlic salt. Pour dressing and water over chicken. Cover and cook on low for 8-9 hours. Remove chicken and cool slightly. Skim fat from cooking juices. Remove chicken from bones and cut into bite-size pieces and return to crockpot. Serve with a slotted spoon on buns. I have also used boneless chicken pieces and cut them up before placing in the crockpot. You just need to adjust cooking time if doing it this way. ; name: cheeseburger cups ; ingredients: refrigerated biscuits, catsup, mustard, ground beef, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Set oven at 425f. Spray muffin cups with non-stick vegetable spray. Roll out biscuits until each is big enough to fit into muffin tins with enough dough to cover. Mix together catsup and mustard with ground beef. Fill each biscuit cup with meat mixture. Sprinkle cheese over all. Fold dough over top. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until golden brown. ; name: shalom bayit kugel potato kugel ; ingredients: potatoes, onions, eggs, salt, oil ; preparation:Preheat oven to 500f. Grate the potatoes and onions on the middle sized hole of a grater. Either by hand or by food processor. If you grate the potatoes and onions together, the potatoes will not turn grey right away. Put into a large bowl or soup pot, and mix well with remaining ingredients. Grease your baking pans, and pour mixture evenly into the pans. Bake for 15 minutes at 500f, then lower the oven to 400f until done. Eat and enjoy. ; name: raisin french toast casserole ; ingredients: cinnamon raisin bread, eggs, milk, vanilla, powdered sugar, maple syrup ; preparation:Put the bread cubes in a greased 13x9 inch baking dish. In a mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, and vanilla. Pour egg mixture evenly over the bread cubes. Cover and refrigerate 2 hours or overnight. Remove from refrigerator 20 minutes before baking. Preheat oven to 350. Bake, uncovered, for 45-50 minutes or until golden brown. Sprinkle with powdered sugar. Serve with maple syrup, if desired. ; name: lemony shredded brussels sprouts ; ingredients: olive oil, brussels sprouts, sea salt, fresh ground pepper, fresh lemon juice ; preparation:In a large nonstick skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add brussels sprouts and 2 tablespoons water. Season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, until crisp-tender, 8 to 10 minutes. Remove from heat, and stir in lemon juice. Serve immediately. ; name: potted kippers ; ingredients: kippered herring fillets, shallot, anchovy fillets, fresh lemon juice, cayenne pepper, olive oil, scotch, unsalted butter, fresh dill sprig ; preparation:In a food processor puree the kippers with the shallot, the anchovies, lemon juice and the cayenne. With the motor running add the olive oil in a stream. Add the scotch and the butter cubes. Blend the mixture until it is combined well. Pack the mixture into small ramekins or a crock, and chill it, covered until it is firm, preferrably at least overnight. Garnish the potted kippers with the fresh dill. ; name: whiskey lemonade ; ingredients: fresh lemon juice, crown royal whiskey, simple syrup, ice ; preparation:To make simple syrup, combine 2 cups of sugar and 2 cups of water over medium-high heat in a saucepan until the sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat and let cool completely before using. To store, refrigerate up to 2 months. In a glass, combine lemon juice, whiskey and simple syrup over ice. Add a splash of water if desired. Enjoy. ; name: nanas macaroni salad ; ingredients: macaroni, mayonnaise, baby shrimp, beef bouillon powder, season salt, garlic powder, sweet pickles, sweet onion, pickle juice ; preparation:

name: mint chocolate chip ice cream no ice cream maker ; ingredients: sweetened condensed milk, peppermint extract, green food coloring, water, whipping cream, semisweet mini chocolate chips ; preparation:In a large bowl, combine condesed milk, peppermint extract, food color and water. Blend well. Gradually fold in whipped cream. Add chocolate chips and mix well. Pour into a 9x5-inch freezer container. Cover and freeze at least 6 hours. ; name: sunny cornbread muffins ; ingredients: flour, yellow cornmeal, sugar, baking powder, salt, egg, buttermilk, canola oil, whole kernel corn ; preparation:In large bowl, combine the flour, cornmeal, sugar, baking powder, and salt. In a small bowl, whisk the egg, buttermilk and oil. Stir into dry ingredients just until moistened. Fold in corn. Fill greased muffin cups three-fourths full. Bake at 400 for 18-22 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from pan to a wire rack. Serve warm. ; name: abby s rice pudding ; ingredients: white rice, water, whole milk, sugar, cinnamon ; preparation:In a medium saucepan add rice and water. Cook until the rice in tender. Add milk and simmer 60 min or until the milk is almost cooked out. Remove from heat and add sugar and cinnamon to taste. Place in fridge for 4 hours. ; name: hearty baked bean casserole ; ingredients: bacon, lean ground beef, onion, pork and beans, stewed tomatoes, brown sugar, chili powder, celery salt, salt and pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 300f degrees. In a large skillet, cook bacon until crisp. Remove and drain fat from skillet. Crumble bacon and set aside. In the same skillet, brown the ground beef and onion. Drain off any fat. Combine all ingredients in a casserole dish and bake for 2 hours. I keep it covered during the first hour, then remove the cover and stir, and leave the cover off for the last hour of cooking, although the original recipe did not specify this. ; name: mandarin orange dessert ; ingredients: orange gelatin, boiling water, mandarin orange, orange sherbet ; preparation:Dissolve the orange jell-o gelatin powder in the 2 cups of boiling water. Stir in orange sections with the juice. Add the sherbet icecream by spoonfuls. Stir until melted. Pour into serving size dessert cups. Chill well. ; name: three potato salad ; ingredients: russet potatoes, red potatoes, sweet potato, onion, miracle whip, sugar, white vinegar, salt, dill weed, pepper ; preparation:Place all the potatoes in a large pot and cover with water. Cover and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and cook for 20-30 minutes. Drain and cool. Place potatoes in a large bowl and add onion. In a small bowl combine all the remaining ingredients and stir well. Pour over potato mixture and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate for 24 hours before serving. ; name: mom s cube steak ; ingredients: cube steaks, onion, flour, vegetable oil, beef stew seasoning, water, salt and pepper ; preparation:Heat oil in skillet. Preheat oven 375. Sprinkle salt and pepper on cube steaks. Coat cube steaks with flour. Cook cube steaks in skillet until both sides are brown. Transfer to baking dish. Cook onion in skillet that you used for cube steaks until tender. Place onion on the cube steaks. Mix beef stew seasoning with 2 cups hot water or hot beef broth. Pour over cube steak. Add the other 2 cups of water to the pan until cube steaks are just covered. Cover pan with aluminum foil and bake 1 hour. ; name: lipton no fuss pork chops ; ingredients: boneless pork chops, mayonnaise, parmesan cheese, onions, lipton onion soup mix, salt and pepper, pam cooking spray ; preparation:

name: impossible blender pie ; ingredients: eggs, sugar, butter, flour, salt, baking powder, milk, coconut, vanilla, ground nutmeg ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Put all ingredients in a blender. Blend until all ingredients are well blended. Pour mixture into a 10-inch, slightly greased, pie pan. Bake for 1 hour. May be eaten warm, but refrigerate any leftovers. ; name: easy peasy quick chocolate orange cake ; ingredients: caster sugar, margarine, flour, egg, baking powder, cocoa powder, vanilla essence, orange, juice and zest of ; preparation:Cream the butter and sugar together. Add the egg and the flour and baking powder. Add the orange rind and juice coco powder and vanilla essence. Mix well and pour into microwavable dish. Zap for five minutes in the microwave on medium. Serve with custard. ; name: beef and cheese wraps ; ingredients: 10-inch flour tortillas, chive & onion cream cheese, carrot, monterey jack cheese, roast beef, salt and pepper, lettuce leaf ; preparation:On one side of each tortilla, spread cream cheese. Layer carrots and cheese evenly on each tortilla. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Layer beef slices and lettuce next. Roll up each tortilla tightly and wrap in plastic wrap. Place in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour. Cut in half or in 1-inch slices. ; name: oprah s classic mashed potatoes ; ingredients: red potatoes, idaho potatoes, butter, creamy pureed horseradish, heavy cream, kosher salt, fresh black pepper ; preparation:Wash potatoes well, leaving the skins on. Cut the potatoes in half lengthwise. Place in a kettle and fill with enough water to cover potatoes. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer until potatoes are very tender. Drain well and add butter while potatoes are hot. Begin to hand mash. Add all remaining ingredients and mash well leaving them just slightly lumpy. Makes about 10-12 cups or 6 to 8 servings. ; name: jazzed up frozen green beans ; ingredients: frozen green beans, bacon, chicken broth, onion powder ; preparation:Cook frozen green beans according to package directions, using the lowest time given. In a large skillet, fry bacon until desired doneness. Drain on paper towel and return to skillet. Add cooked green beans, chicken broth, and onion powder to the skillet. Stir to combine. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium and cook for ten minutes or until most of the liquid is evaporated, stirring occasionally. ; name: chvre with pistachios and honey ; ingredients: fresh goat cheese, half-and-half, orange blossom honey, roasted pistachios, crackers ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. In a bowl, whisk goat cheese and half-and-half until smooth. Spoon into a small, shallow gratin dish, spreading level. Bake until cheese is hot in center and beginning to firm up at edges, about 15 minutes. Drizzle cheese with honey and sprinkle with pistachios. Serve with crackers. ; name: wonderful parmesan zucchini strips ; ingredients: seasoned bread crumbs, parmesan cheese, zucchini, egg ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450 degrees. In a bowl, combine bread crumbs and cheese topping. Dip zucchini strips into egg, then into crumb mixture. Place on baking sheet coated with nonstick cooking spray. Bake at 450 degrees for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown and tender. ; name: chocolate chip mug cookie ; ingredients: butter, white sugar, brown sugar, vanilla, salt, egg yolk, flour, semi-sweet chocolate chips ; preparation:

name: cranberry pumpkin muffins ; ingredients: eggs, sugar, cooking oil, pumpkin, flour, pumpkin pie spice, baking soda, salt, fresh cranberries ; preparation:Combine eggs, sugar, oil and pumpkin, mix well. Combine flour, spice, soda, and salt in a bowl. Make a well in the center and pour pumpkin mixture into well. Stir just until dry ingredients are moist. Stir in cranberries. Spoon into greased muffin pans. Bake at 350 degrees for about 30 minutes. I start checking for doneness around 20 minutes. ; name: portabella mushrooms filled with almonds and dry tomatoes ; ingredients: portabella mushrooms, vegetable oil, gouda cheese, fresh breadcrumb, fresh parsley, almonds, sun-dried tomato packed in oil, chives, fresh black pepper ; preparation:Remove the stems from the mushrooms brush the top of the mushrooms with the oil. In a bowl, mix remaining ingredients and set aside. Set the barbecue to medium-high heat. Put the mushrooms, top side up on an oiled grill. Close the cover and cook for about 4 minutes or until mushrooms begin to release their juice. Flip the mushrooms and filled them with the cheese mixture you set aside. Close the cover and keep cooking for about 4 minutes or until cheese has melted and mushrooms are tender. ; name: trio of t s salad tuna tomato and tarragon ; ingredients: red onion, light mayonnaise, kosher salt, salt & freshly ground black pepper, chunk light tuna, celery, fresh tarragon leaves, lettuce, fresh tomato, lemon ; preparation:Place onion in a small bowl and cover with cold water. Refrigerate for 20 minutes. Drain. Whisk mayonnaise, salt and pepper in a medium bowl. Add tuna, celery, tarragon and the drained onion. Stir to combine. Serve on a bed of lettuce with tomato and lemon wedges. ; name: amish lime salad ; ingredients: marshmallows, milk, lime gelatin, cream cheese, crushed pineapple, salad dressing, whipped cream ; preparation:Melt the marshmallows and milk in a double boiler. Pour that mixture over the gelatin, stirring it until the gelatin is dissolved. Stir in the cream cheese until it dissolves. Add the pineapple and cool the mixture. Add salad dressing and whipped cream and chill until firm. ; name: chili sweet potatoes ; ingredients: sweet potatoes, hickory smoked bacon, chili powder, butter, salt and pepper ; preparation:Place sliced potatoes in an oven going glass dish in one layer, overlapping potatoes. Sprinkle chili powder over potatoes. Dot with butter. Lay strips of bacon on top. Bake in a 350 oven until bacon is crisp. ; name: peanut butter chip chocolate cookies ; ingredients: butter, sugar, eggs, vanilla, flour, cocoa, baking soda, salt, peanut butter chips ; preparation:Cream butter, sugar, eggs, and vanilla. Add flour, cocoa, baking soda, and salt. Mix well. Stir in peanut butter chips. Bake at 350 degrees for 8 - 10 minutes. ; name: sweet bread bread pudding ; ingredients: sweet bread, raisins, butter, milk, sugar, eggs, apple pie filling, cinnamon, vanilla ; preparation:Grease a 9x12 pan. Scald milk. Add sugar and butter. Mix until butter is melted. Cool. Break sweet bread into pieces. Spread apple pie filling on top of the sweet bread. Sprinkle raisins over the filling. Combine cooled milk mixture with beaten eggs. Pour liquid over the bread. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 to 30 minutes. ; name: sweet spicy cucumbers over tomatoes ; ingredients: pickling cucumbers, vidalia onions, cider vinegar, sugar, salt, mustard seeds, garlic, dried red chilies, fresh tomatoes, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:

name: autumn two potato scallop ; ingredients: butter, sweet potatoes, small red potatoes, heavy cream, milk, garlic, salt, ground red pepper, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Heat oven to 375. Butter a 13 x 9 x 2 glass baking dish. Arrange sweet and red potatoe slices, overlapping, in alternating layers in baking dish. There should be about 3 layers of each. Combine heavy cream, milk, garlic, salt and red pepper in a small saucepan. Bring to boiling and then carefully pour over potatoes in baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes and press with spatula. Spoon cream mixture over potatoes. Sprinkle with parmesan and bake 30 more minutes or until potatoes are tender and top is brown. Let stand 15 minutes before serving. ; name: beer battered fish ; ingredients: vegetable oil, cod fish fillets, salt and pepper, all-purpose flour, garlic powder, paprika, salt, ground black pepper, egg, beer ; preparation:Heat oil in a deep fryer to 365 degrees f. Rinse fish, pat dry, and season with salt and pepper. Combine flour, garlic powder, paprika, 2 teaspoons salt, and 2 teaspoons pepper. Stir egg into dry ingredients. Gradually mix in one beer until a thin batter is formed. You should be able to see the fish through the batter after it has been dipped. Dip fish fillets into the batter, then drop one at a time into hot oil. Fry fish, turning once, until both sides are golden brown. Drain on paper towels, and serve warm. ; name: grilled bacon and bleu sandwiches ; ingredients: cream cheese, blue cheese, bacon, italian salad dressing, rye bread ; preparation:Combine cream cheese, blue cheese, bacon and 2 tablespoons italian dressing. Spread cheese mixture evenly onto 4 bread slices. Top with remaining bread. Brush sandwiches on both sides with remaining italian dressing. Grill sandwiches in non-stick skillet over medium heat until golden brown on both sides and filling is melted. ; name: pizza salad pita pockets ; ingredients: pita bread, romaine lettuce, cherry tomatoes, red onion, sliced mushrooms, pepperoni slice, pizza sauce, mozzarella cheese, red wine vinegar, garlic powder ; preparation:In a medium mixing bowl, stir together the cherry tomatoes, red onion, mushrooms, pepperoni, pizza sauce, mozzarella cheese, vinegar and garlic powder. Warm in the microwave for 1 minute. Cut each pita in half and warm in the microwave, about 30 seconds. Stuff each with a lettuce leaf. Fill each pita with the pizza salad and serve. ; name: peppery beef tenderloin ; ingredients: oregano, paprika, thyme, salt, garlic powder, onion powder, basil, cracked black pepper, cayenne pepper, beef tenderloin ; preparation:Mix all the spices together well. Rub into the tenderloin. Place on rack in a roasting pan. Bake at 400 for 45 minutes----rare. 60 minutes---medium rare. 65 minutes---medium. 73 minutes---well done. Let stand for 10 minutes before slicing. ; name: ww 4 points grilled mushroom sausage pizza ; ingredients: prepared pizza crust, yellow tomatoes, wild mushrooms, red onion, chicken sausage, mozzarella cheese, fresh basil leaf ; preparation:Spray the grill rack with nonstick spray and set to medium-high fire. Place the crust on a pizza paddle or rimless baking sheet. Layer with the tomato slices, mushrooms, onions, chicken sausage, and mozzarella. Using the paddle or baking sheet, slide the pizza onto the grill, away from the heat source. Cover and cook, rotating the pizza a half turn after 8 minutes, until it is hot and cheese is melted. Garnish with basil before serving. 4 points per serving. ; name: oregon blueberry pie ; ingredients: blueberries, sugar, cornstarch, lemon juice, butter, double crust pie crusts ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees fahrenheit. Drain the berries and reserve the syrup from one can. Stir the syrup in to the combined mixture of the cornstarch and half of the sugar. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until thickened. Remove from heat. Gently stir in remaining sugar, blueberries, and lemon juice. Let stand while preparing pastry. Line a 9-inch pie pan with pastry and fill with the filling. Dot with butter or margarine. Adjust top crust on pie, cuttin slits for the steam to escape, and seal. I recommend adding some sugar over the top after sealing. Bake for 30 minutes or until filling is bubbly and crust is brown. ; name: hoisin marinated chicken ; ingredients: hoisin sauce, sambal oelek, scallions, dry red wine, gingerroot, garlic, pepper, chicken breasts, chicken pieces ; preparation:

name: roast skate with malted caramelized garlic sauce ; ingredients: skate, olive oil, garlic cloves, malt vinegar, paprika, sea salt, black pepper ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 425f. To make the sauce take a small saucepan and fry the garlic in 3 tbsp of olive oil until it is dark nutty brown in colour. Add the vinegar and a pinch of paprika. Bring to the boil and reduce by half. Season well with salt & pepper and remove from heat. Drizzle the remaining olive oil into the pan to cover the bottom of large oven safe pan and heat on the stove top until very hot. Season the skate with salt & pepper on both sides. Turn off the heat and slide in the skate, being careful of oil splatter. Put the skate into the oven for about 10 minutes or until cooked through. Remove and serve immediately with the warmed sauce spooned over the fish and a sprinkling of paprika. ; name: cilantro fries ; ingredients: cooking spray, fresh cilantro, garlic cloves, steak-style french fries, olive oil, kosher salt ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 450 degrees f. Grease a baking sheet with nonstick cooking spray. Combine the cilantro and garlic in a food processor and process until combined. Toss the potato wedges with the cilantro-garlic mixture and the olive oil, coating evenly. Spread the potatoes wedges onto the prepared baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes, flipping the potatoes after 10 minutes to crisp on the other side. Season the potatoes with the salt and serve. ; name: carrots with raisin sauce ; ingredients: carrots, brown sugar, cornstarch, water, cider vinegar, raisins, butter ; preparation:Cook carrots in salted water until tender, drain. While carrots are cooking, mix brown sugar and cornstarch in a small saucepan. Stir in water, vinegar and raisins. Cook over low heat until sauce is thickened. Remove from heat, add butter, stir until melted and pour over carrots. ; name: roasted garlic dipping sauce ; ingredients: garlic, mayonnaise, sour cream, olive oil, salt and pepper ; preparation:Cut off top of garlic bulb to expose most of the garlic cloves. Put the bulb in an oven-safe small dish or on top of a sheet of foil. Drizzle olive oil on the tops of the garlic cloves, add more if needed to drench the tops and sides of the whole bulb. Sprinkle some salt on the top of the bulb on the oil. Wrap or seal up the garlic bulb with foil. Roast in oven at 400f for 30-40 minutes, until tops and sides are browned and roasted. Take out of the oven and cool for 10 minutes. When cooled enough to handle, squeeze out the garlic cloves from the root or the bottom of the bulb, into a small bowl. Add mayonnaise and sour cream, using a fork, stir until blended. Add pepper to taste, and salt if needed. ; name: hope s amazing margarita s aka rigamarta s hiccup ; ingredients: frozen limeade concentrate, tequila, triple sec, limes, salt ; preparation:In large pitcher mix limeade with 2 cans water. Fill empty can once with tequila and add to pitcher and then again with triple sec. This will give you a measure equal to 12 oz. Juice three of the limes and add juice to pitcher and stir well. Garnish with remaining lime, sliced, and salt if desired. ; name: strawberry n cream roll ups ; ingredients: strawberry preserves, cream cheese, refrigerated crescent dinner rolls, powdered sugar ; preparation:Add the preserves and cream cheese to a small bowl. Stir to mix well. Separate the crescent roll dough into 8 triangles. Spread the cream cheese mixture evenly over each triangle. Roll up each triangle from the wide end to the point and place seam side down on an ungreased cookie sheet. Curve into crescents. Bake at 375 for 12-15 minutes or until golden. Let cool slightly. Sprinkle with powdered sugar and serve warm. ; name: fat free banana crunch muffins ; ingredients: whole wheat flour, white flour, grape-nuts cereal, sugar, baking soda, baking powder, salt, vanilla, egg substitute, bananas ; preparation:In a small bowl mix all dry ingredients together. In a larger bowl mix all wet ingredients together. Add dry ingrediants to wet ingredients. Mix just until combined. Do not overmix. Bake for 20-25 minutes in a 350 degree oven. ; name: simply seafood sauce ; ingredients: chili sauce, horseradish sauce, fresh lemon juice, worcestershire sauce, salt, pepper, hot sauce ; preparation:

name: low fat cherry loaf ; ingredients: milk, lemon juice, flour, brown sugar, baking soda, salt, non-fat vanilla yogurt, egg, vanilla, fresh cherries ; preparation:Mix together the milk and lemon juice. Set aside for 10 minutes. Mix together the dry ingredients. Lightly beat the egg, then add it, the yogurt, the milk mixture, and the vanilla to the dry ingredients. Fold in the cherries. Pour batter into greased 9 x 5-inch loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 50 to 60 minutes. ; name: hot faux crab dip ; ingredients: cream cheese, albacore tuna in water, mayonnaise, old bay seasoning, garlic, onion ; preparation:Mix all. Pour into a heatproof dish and top with breadcrumbs or cheese. Bake at 350 degrees f. For 15 to 20 minutes or until bubbly. Serve with crackers or thin slices of french bread. ; name: best cream of broccoli soup ; ingredients: butter, onion, garlic clove, celery, chicken broth, broccoli, flour, milk, pepper, velveeta cheese ; preparation:Melt 2 tablespoons butter in medium sized stock pot, and saut onion, garlic and celery until tender. Add broccoli and broth. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Pure soup or mash with potato masher. Return to heat. In small saucepan, over medium heat melt 3 tablespoons butter, stir in flour and add milk. Stir until thick and bubbly, add to soup. Add cheese. Stir until melted. Season with pepper and serve. ; name: barbara s hot salsa ; ingredients: lime, juice of, tomatoes, onions, jalapeno peppers, hot peppers, sugar, cumin, coriander, kosher salt ; preparation:Sprinkle salt in bottom of crock. Add tomatoes, onions, peppers, sugar, spices, and lime juice. Daily, sprinkle just a little salt into crock and stir. On the 4th or 5th day, pack into hot sterile pint jars. Process in boiling hot water bath for 10 minutes. ; name: tropical pineapple salad ; ingredients: pineapple, honey, passion fruit, dark rum ; preparation:Halve the pineapple, cut away and discard the core, and scoop out the pineapple flesh. Reserve the shell. Roughly chop the flesh and toss with enough honey to sweeten. Halve the passion fruit, spoon out the pulp, and combine with the pineapple. Stir in the rum and chill for 30 minutes so the flavors marry. Spoon the fruit back into the shell and serve. ; name: brillant sunset ; ingredients: ice, grenadine, orange juice, maraschino cherries, orange slices ; preparation:Add ice to four glasses. Pour 1 tablespoon grenadine over ice in each glass. Slowly add 1 cup orange juice to produce sunset affect. Garnish with an orange slice and a cherry. Stir if desired before drinking. ; name: tuna spring rolls ; ingredients: tuna, ketjap manis, sesame oil, garlic clove, salt and pepper, spring roll wrappers, peanut oil ; preparation:Cut tuna in 2cm wide x 6 cm long batons. Combine soy sauce, sesame oil and garlic. Brush onto tuna strip. Season with salt and pepper. Lay spring roll wrapper on work bench. Place piece of tuna at one end, roll up and half way fold in sides then roll up completely. Seal ends with water. Repeat. Heat oil in wok and shallow fry a few at a time until golden brown. Drain on paper towel and serve. ; name: javanese peanut sauce ; ingredients: onion, peanut oil, cardamom, smooth peanut butter, brown sugar, soy sauce, lemon juice, liquid red pepper seasoning ; preparation:

name: dave s special black forest cake ; ingredients: chocolate cake mix, sweetened condensed milk, cream of coconut, cherry pie filling, whipped topping ; preparation:Mix cake according to package directions and bake in a 9x13 inch pan. As soon as you remove from the oven, poke holes in the cake with the handle of a wooden spoon. Pour the sweetened condensed milk and cream of coconut over the cake. Make sure the milk& cream of coconut go down in the holes. Refrigerate cake for 20-30 minutes. Remove cake from refrigerator and spread the can of cherry pie filling on top. Refrigerate again for 30 minutes and then spread the carton of whipped cream over the top of the cake. Refrigerate several hours or overnight before serving. ; name: pizza steak ; ingredients: plain flour, salt, pepper, boneless eye of round beef steak, onion, canola oil, pizza sauce, parmesan cheese, mozzarella cheese ; preparation:Combine flour, salt, & pepper. Pound into steaks. In large skillet, brown onions in oil over medium heat. Remove & set aside to drain. Add steaks to skillet, & brown well on both sides. Return onion to skillet, piling them on top of steaks. Pour pizza sauce over all. Cover skillet, reduce heat to medium low, and simmer 10-12 minutes, until steaks are cooked through. Uncover and top evenly with parmesan and mozzarella. Cover, and cook 3-5 minutes until cheeses are melted. ; name: mustard glazed meatloaf ; ingredients: eggs, dijon mustard, breadcrumbs, dried thyme leaves, lean ground beef, apple jelly, green onions ; preparation:Heat oven to 350f in large bowl, beat eggs. Stir in all remaining meatloaf ingredients. Press mixture in ungreased 8x4-inch loaf pan. Bake at 350f for 40 minutes. Meanwhile, in small microwave-safe measuring cup, combine all glaze ingredients. Microwave on high for 1 to 2 minutes or until jelly is melted, stirring every 30 seconds. Remove pan from oven. Using pancake turner to hold meatloaf in pan, drain off fat. Spoon glaze over meatloaf. Return to oven. Bake an additional 20 to 25 minutes or until meat thermometer inserted in center reads 160f let stand 5 to 10 minutes before serving. ; name: broccoli cheese soup ; ingredients: onion, margarine, flour, salt, white pepper, chicken broth, milk, broccoli, cheddar cheese, celery ; preparation:Saute onion and celery in butter in saucepan over medium heat until tender. Add flour, and salt and pepper, cooking and stirring until mixture is smooth and bubbly. Add broth and milk, stirring constantly until mixture comes to a boil and begins to thicken. Add cooked broccoli, stirring until all is heated through. Remove from heat and stir in cheese until melted and smooth. ; name: mint chocolate shake ; ingredients: peppermint tea bag, water, ice, chocolate protein powder, low-fat plain yogurt, flax seed oil, dark chocolate chips ; preparation:Steep mint tea in hot water for 5 minutes, squeeze remaining from tea bag and discard. Add ice to tea. Combine all ingredients in blender. Blend on high until mixture is smooth and creamy. Transfer to a tall glass and serve. ; name: buckwheat griddlecakes ; ingredients: flour, buckwheat groats, baking soda, salt, sugar, eggs, sour milk, butter ; preparation:Sift dry ingredients together. Beat eggs, add buttermilk or sour milk. Add to dry ingredients gradually. Add butter, beating to obtain a smooth batter. Drop from a spoon onto a hot greased griddle and brown on both sides. ; name: balsamic duck breasts and asparagus pure ; ingredients: duck breasts, salt & pepper, balsamic vinegar, asparagus, yukon gold potato, olive oil, mesclun, radicchio ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f. Prick the breasts with a knife to make some holes. In an ovenproof skillet cook the breasts fat side down to render the fat, about 10 minutes, drain. Turn over and cook in the oven 5 minutes. Add balsamic vinegar and cook 5 minutes more. Reserve the asparagus. Add steamed asparagus to a processor and puree. Add the puree, olive oil, salt & pepper to the potatoes, mix well. Slice duck breasts. Add puree to 4 plates, arrange duck breasts alongside. Garnish with mesclun, radicchio and asparagus. ; name: weight watchers pumpkin cupcakes ; ingredients: spice cake mix, water, canned pumpkin, vanilla extract, cinnamon ; preparation:

name: easy awesome guacamole ; ingredients: avocados, salsa, sour cream, mayonnaise, onion powder, pepper, salt, garlic, lemon juice, fresh chives ; preparation:Cut avocados in half and take out the seed, scoop out meat with a spoon and place in bowl. Mash the avocado with a fork. Add the salsa, mayonnaise, sour cream, salt, pepper, garlic and onion powder. Mix together well. Add lemon juice, mix and serve. Garnish with fresh chives. ; name: pesto chicken with sun dried tomatoes and squash ; ingredients: boneless chicken breast halves, olive oil, zucchini, basil pesto, parmesan cheese, sun-dried tomatoes packed in oil ; preparation:In a large nonstick pan cook chicken in hot oil over medium heat for 4 to 5 minutes. Turn chicken and add zucchini. Cook for 4 minutes or until chicken is tender and no longer pink and squash is tender. Spread pesto over chicken and sprinkle with cheese and sun dried tomatoes. Let that just warm and serve onto plates. ; name: avocado bacon and tomato salad ; ingredients: garlic cloves, olive oil, balsamic vinegar, dijon mustard, bacon, salad leaves, red onion, avocados, tomatoes, salt and pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 180deg. Place garlic on baking tray and roast for 30 mins, allow garlic to cool and then squeeze out the flesh and mash in a small bowl. Add the olive oil, balsamic vinegar and dijon mustard and whish well together. Season with salt and pepper. Chop bacon into bite sized pieces, then grill or dry fry for 3-5 mins or until crisp. Place salad leaves into bowl and add bacon, onion, tomato and avocado. Toss well. Whisk the dressing ingredients again to ensure they are mixed well and then pour over salad. ; name: baked cheese grits ; ingredients: chicken broth, quick-cooking grits, extra-sharp cheddar cheese, monterey jack cheese, whipping cream, hot sauce, black pepper, cayenne pepper, worcestershire sauce, eggs ; preparation:Bring chicken broth to a boil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Gradually whisk in grits. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer, stirring occasionally, 10 minutes or until grits are thick. Stir in cheddar cheese, next 5 ingredients, and, if desired, worcestershire sauce, stirring until cheese melts. Remove from heat. Stir in eggs. Pour grits into lightly greased 2 quart baking dish. Bake, uncovered, at 350 degress for 40-45 minutes. Stone ground grits maybe substititued. Increase liquid to 6 cups and increase cook time to 50 minutes. ; name: honey barbecue chicken skewers ; ingredients: oil, liquid honey, soy sauce, barbecue sauce, fresh garlic cloves, green onion, black pepper, boneless skinless chicken breasts, wooden skewer ; preparation:Slice the chicken breasts in half or into thirds or whatever size you you desire to thread on the skewers. In a large glass bowl whisk together oil, honey, soy sauce, barbecue sauce and black pepper until well combined. Add in garlic pieces and green onion. Add in the chicken strips and toss with the marinade to combine well. Cover and refrigerate for a minimum of 8-24 hours. Remove the chicken strips and discard the marinade. Thread chicken strips on the wooden skewers piercing at least 3 times through the skewers. Grill over medium heat. ; name: tuna rice casserole ; ingredients: brown rice, cream of mushroom soup, water, tuna fish, frozen peas, mozzarella cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 and put rice and tuna into casserole dish. On the stove, heat soup, adding the water to it. Bring to a boil. Add peas, stir and bring to boil again. Pour on top of rice. Lay cheese on top. Bake at 400 degrees for 20 minutes. ; name: sophia lorens tiramisu ; ingredients: eggs, sugar, mascarpone cheese, ladyfingers, orange liqueur, espresso coffee, bitter chocolate, unsweetened cocoa powder ; preparation:Combine egg yolks and sugar in a medium-sized bowl and beat well. In a separate bowl, beat the egg whites to stiff peaks. In a third, larger bowl, combine the egg yolk mixture with the mascarpone, then fold in the egg whites to produce a creamy mixture. Arrange a tight layer of ladyfingers in a 9-by-12-inch serving dish. Using a spoon, drizzle about half the liqueur and half the espresso over the ladyfingers. Cover the ladyfingers with the mascarpone mixture and the grated chocolate, and dust it with a little more than half the cocoa. Cover the filling with a second layer of ladyfingers and drizzle with the remaining liqueur and espresso. Place the dish in the refrigerator for at least 12 hours. Top with the remaining cocoa before serving. ; name: unleavened whole wheat bread ; ingredients: whole wheat flour, salt, honey, vegetable oil, egg yolk, milk ; preparation:

name: ham and cheese bars ; ingredients: bisquick, ham, cheddar cheese, onion, parmesan cheese, sour cream, salt, garlic powder, whole milk, egg ; preparation:In a bowl, combine all the ingredients in a mixing bowl, and mix by hand. Spread in a greased 9x13 inch baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until lightly brown. Cut in rectangles, about 2 inches by 1 inch. Serve hot or at room temperature. ; name: penne with sun dried tomatoes and asiago cheese ; ingredients: dry penne pasta, sun-dried tomatoes, oil, asiago cheese, dried basil, garlic cloves, red pepper flakes, kosher salt ; preparation:Cook pasta according to directions. Closer to the end of the pasta cooking, heat oil in pan and add garlic. Saut for about 1 minute. Reduce heat to medium-low. Do not brown garlic. Combine sun dried tomatoes, basil, pepper flakes, salt and cheese for about 1 to 2 minutes. Pour oil mixture over pasta and mix. Serve with additional shredded asiago cheese on top. For additional flavour you can add kalamata olives to the pan and saut with sun dried tomatoe mixture. ; name: jello pie ; ingredients: water, sugar-free jello, cold water, ice cube, fat-free cool whip, reduced-fat 9-inch graham cracker crust ; preparation:Stir boiling water into gelatin for at least 2 min, and completely dissolved. Mix cold water and ice to measure 1 cup. Add to gelatin, stirring until all ice melts. Stir in cool whip with wire whisk until smooth. Refrigerate until mixture is thick and can mound well. Spoon into graham cracker crust. Refrigerate 4 hours or overnight. ; name: barbecued spiced lime corn on the cob ; ingredients: corn cobs, limes, salt, cayenne pepper ; preparation:Pull the husks back from the corn, then remove and discard the silks. Rub each cob with a wedge of lime the fold back the husks to cover the kernels. Cook over medium hot coals for about 10 mins turning frequently until the corn is dark golden and the kernels tender. Mix together the salt and the cayenne pepper. Pull the husks away from the corn and sprinkle over the salt mixture. Serve with a wedge of lime for extra rubbing. ; name: cashew golden rice ; ingredients: hot water, chicken bouillon cubes, onion powder, ground turmeric, long grain rice, unsalted cashews, golden raisin, candied ginger, fresh chives ; preparation:In a medium size pot, add water, bouillion cubes, onion powder and turmeric. Bring to a rapid boil. Remove from heat and add rice, stir gently. Cover and return to stove and simmer on low heat till all water is absorbed. Once all water has been absorbed remove pot from stove and let sit covered for 5 minutes. Fluff rice with a fork and add nuts, raisins, candied ginger and chopped chives. ; name: zucchini with bacon corn peppers ; ingredients: bacon, zucchini, frozen corn, red peppers, onion, garlic, parmesan cheese ; preparation:In a wide frying pan, cook your bacon until crisp. Drain bacon drippings, but leave 3 tablespoons of bacon drippings in the frying pan. Add zucchini, corn, bell pepper, onion, and garlic to the fry pan with the reserved bacon drippings. Cook over medium heat stiriring often, until most of the vegetable liquid has evaporated and the vegetables are crisp tender. Add the cooked bacon and heat through. Add salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle grated cheese on top. Cooking time does include cooking the bacon. ; name: cassoulet soup ; ingredients: onion, smoked sausage, thyme, white wine, chicken broth, white beans, dark chicken meat, fresh parsley ; preparation:Saut onion and sausage in large saucepan until browned. Add thyme, stir one minute. Add wine, boil until slightly reduced, about 2 minutes. Stir in broth, 1 cup of the beans, and the chicken. Mash the rest of the beans and add to pot. Partially cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper, garnish with chopped parsley. ; name: rosemary chicken breasts ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, balsamic vinegar, extra virgin olive oil, rosemary, salt, coarse black pepper, garlic cloves ; preparation:

name: coarse ground mustard ; ingredients: white mustard seeds, red wine vinegar, dry red wine, dry english-style mustard, salt, ground allspice, water ; preparation:Place mustard seed, wine vinegar and wine in a small bowl and let stand for 3 hours. Process in a blender on pulse until seeds are bruised and broken. Add dry mustard, salt, allspice, and water, mix well. Cover loosely, and allow to stand overnight. Refrigerate unused portions. ; name: twice baked ; ingredients: frozen cauliflower, fat-free half-and-half, margarine, cheddar cheese, bacon bits, chives, salt and pepper ; preparation:Nuke cauliflower to death 4 minutes--stir 5 more minutes. Transfer cooked cauliflower to work bowl of food processor. Add half and half and margarine and pulse until you get a mashed potato consistency. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer mixture to a pie plate. Sprinkle with cheese, bacon, and chives. Bake at 350f for about 10-15 minutes. ; name: mint swirl fudge ; ingredients: white vanilla chips, vanilla frosting, peppermint extract, red food coloring, peppermint candies ; preparation:Line 8in square pan with foil, extending over edges. Butter the foil lightly. In lg saucepan, melt chips, stirring until smooth. Remove from heat. Stir in frosting and extract. Spread in pan. Drop coloring over fudge and swirl in with knife. Sprinkle with crushed candies. Chill. ; name: grilled eggplant with ricotta and tomato ; ingredients: eggplant, olive oil, cherry tomatoes, garlic cloves, capers, ricotta cheese, salt & freshly ground black pepper, fresh basil leaves ; preparation:Heat the grill to high. Brush the eggplant slices with some of the oil. Grill the eggplant slices on both sides until brown, then place them in the bottom of a lightly greased, small shallow baking pan that will fit under the grill, and set aside. Over a medium heat, add the rest of the oil to a small saut pan, add the cherry tomatoes and garlic and saut for a couple of minutes, stirring occasionally, until the tomatoes begin to soften. While still stirring, add the capers and leave the pan over the heat for an additional minute. Remove the pan from the heat. Cover the eggplant slices with the tomato, garlic and capers, season to taste and spoon the ricotta over the tomatoes. Place the baking pan under the grill until the ricotta starts to bubble. Scatter the basil leaves over the top and serve. ; name: aunt ginny s thanksgiving stuffing ; ingredients: long grain and wild rice blend, onion, celery, butter, cornbread, bread, salt, dried sage, dried thyme, ground black pepper ; preparation:Prepare rice mix according to package directions. Set aside to cool. Cook onion and celery in butter in a large skillet until tender, stirring occasionally. Combine breads, salt, sage, thyme and pepper in a large bowl. Add butter mixture to bowl and mix lightly but thoroughly. Add about two-thirds of the prepared rice mixture to the bowl and toss lightly to combine. Stuff turkey just prior to roasting. Or place stuffing in a greased casserole, cover and bake at 325f for 45 minutes or until heated through. Do not use a sweet-type cornbread. ; name: cod with onions and chives kabeljau mit schnittlauch zwiebeln ; ingredients: cod fish fillets, onions, chives, oil, white wine, lemon juice, salt ; preparation:Lightly fry onions and chives in oil and lightly salt. Salt the fish and sprinkle with lemon juice. Place the fish on the onions and pour the white wine over. Simmer over low heat for 5 minutes. Serve with boiled potatoes. ; name: grilled placerville sandwiches ; ingredients: chicken breasts, fuji apple, cheddar cheese, sourdough bread, butter ; preparation:Assemble sandwiches like so to get the best results -- bread, chicken first then the apple slices and last the cheese, bread again. Spread butter over the top slice of bread then lay the sandwich butter side down on a cold grill or frying pan. You will want the cheese side to be closest to the heat so it has a chance to thoroughly melt. Turn grill or stove on to medium heat. Butter the other slice of bread and with a spatula flip the sandwich once one side has turned a nice golden brown color. The second flip wont take as long so take care not to burn. Serve immediately and enjoy. ; name: potato crusted snapper ; ingredients: salt and pepper, low-fat buttermilk, garlic, instant potato flakes, red snapper fillets, butter, lemon wedges ; preparation:

name: metric jester s famous homemade bread ; ingredients: warm water, sugar, salt, fast rising yeast, extra virgin olive oil, flour ; preparation:Dissolve sugar and salt in warm water, then stir in yeast. Allow yeast mixture to sit for 5 to 10 min. Place flour into mixing bowl, making a hole in the centre. Drizzle oil over flour, and then combine yeast and flour mixes. Knead on a floured surface until it creates a ball. Place in bread pan and allow to rise 2 hours. If dough is double in size, preheat oven to 350f. Bake until golden. If using a breadmaker, be sure to follow the proper directions for your bread maker, however i suggest you dissolve the sugar and salt in the water first. ; name: tempeh shish kebabs ; ingredients: tempeh, green peppers, sweet onions, fresh mushrooms, tomatoes, barbecue sauce ; preparation:Place all your veggies& tempeh in a large bowl and pour in the bbq sauce. Mix gently so the sauce covers all the veggies& tempeh. Refrigerate at least 2 hours or leave overnight. Alternate the veggies and tempeh on skewers bbq over mebium heat, turn& baste frequently with the bbq sauce that you marinated the veggies etc inches. They are done when the peppers& onions are nicely browned apprx 15 minutes. ; name: cider braised cabbage ; ingredients: butter, onion, green cabbage, apple cider, apple cider vinegar, salt and pepper ; preparation:Melt butter in large pot over medium-high heat. Add onion. Saute until beginning to soften, about 5 minutes. Add cabbage. Saute until slightly wilted, tossing frequently, about 6 minutes. Stir in apple cider. Reduce heat to medium. Cover and cook until cabbage is tender, stirring occasionally, about 6 minutes. Uncover. Simmer until almost all liquid in pot evaporates, about 3 minutes. Stir in vinegar. Season with salt and pepper. ; name: chicken estufao ; ingredients: chicken, garlic cloves, onion, rice vinegar, salt, fresh ground black pepper, peanut oil, soy sauce, water ; preparation:Combine chicken, garlic, onion, vinegar, salt, and pepper in a bowl and mix well. Remove chicken, reserving liquid. Heat oil in a large skillet over high heat. Add chicken and cook 3 minutes. Reduce heat and add soy sauce, water, and reserved liquid. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes, or until chicken is falling off the bones. ; name: the coffee frappe ; ingredients: strong coffee, kahlua, vanilla vodka, milk, cocoa ; preparation:To a pitcher, add cold strong coffee and kahla. Stir to mix. Pour into a 14-cube ice cube tray. Freeze for at least 2 hours, or overnight. To a blender, add vanilla vodka, milk or cream and 5 cubes. Blend until slushy. Pour into martini glasses and sprinkle with cocoa, if desired. ; name: cumin coriander crusted salmon ; ingredients: cilantro, shallot, olive oil, cumin, ground coriander, kosher salt, black pepper, salmon fillets, lemon wedges ; preparation:Combine cilantro shallots, oil, cumin, coriander, salt and pepper in a small bowl, stirring to form a paste. Place fish, skin side down, in a shallow baking dish. Coat with cilantro mixture. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour. Preheat oven to 400. Arrange fish on the rack of a roasting pan coated with cooking spray. Bake at 400 for 10 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork or until desired degree of doneness. Serve with lemon wedges. ; name: sugared walnuts ; ingredients: walnut halves, sugar, water, cinnamon, salt, vanilla ; preparation:Spread the walnuts out on a large cookie sheet. Bake at 275 for about 15 minutes, stirring frequently. Remove from oven and set aside. Combine the sugar, water, cinnamon and salt in a 3 quart saucepan and cook to 236, soft-ball stage, without stirring. You get much better results. Remove from heat and stir in the vanilla and the nuts. Stir gently until the nuts are well coated and mixture has begun to cool down. Turn out onto a greased cookie sheet, separating any pieces that have clumped together. Cool completely. ; name: motanjen khoreshe ; ingredients: lean lamb fillets, onion, salt, pepper, oil, beef broth, split peas, almonds, dried apricot, prune ; preparation:

name: celery parmesan ; ingredients: celery, onion, garlic cloves, diced tomato, bacon, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Prehaet oven to 325 degrees. Lightly spray a 2-qt casserole dish with nonstick cooking spray. Cook celery, onion and garlic in small amount of boiling salted water until tender. Drain. Pour into prepared casserole dish. Top with tomatoes and bacon, then sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake at 325 degrees for 30 minutes. Serve. ; name: bacon cheese snacks ; ingredients: bacon, cheese, garlic powder, sugar, onions, miracle whip, celery salt, miniature party rye rounds ; preparation:Fry bacon and crumble fine. Add remaining ingredients except rye bread. Mix well. Spread on party rye. Broil until hot. ; name: sweet potato mash with caramelised onions ; ingredients: onions, oil, sweet potato, butter, salt and pepper ; preparation:Peel onions, cut in half and finely slice so you have half moon shaped circles. Put into a medium frypan and drizzle with oil and massage the oil in to break up the half rings. Cover frypan and cook over a low to moderate heat giving a stir occasionally until a nice golden colour, the longer you take the sweeter the onion will be. Put sweet potatoes in a pot of cold water and season with a little salt and bring to the boil and cook till tender. When potatoes are cook, drain and give a good shake, put in butter and mash till you get the consistency you like. Add your caramelised onions and mix in well and season with salt and pepper to taste. ; name: chocolate crumb cake ; ingredients: crumb cake mix, sugar, milk, vanilla extract, dutch process cocoa, canola oil, eggs, butter, neufchatel cheese, powdered sugar ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Spray a non-stick 8 inch round cake pan with non-stick cooking spray and set aside. Add cake mix and remaining ingredients for the cake to a medium sized mixing bowl. With electric mixer, beat on medium speed 2 minutes or until thoroughly mixed and batter is smooth. Pour batter into prepared pan and bake in preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes or until toothpick inserted off center comes out clean. Cool on a rack for 10 minutes, invert onto wire rack and cool completely before frosting. For the frosting, add all ingredients except milk to a medium size bowl. Beat until creamy adding milk 1 teaspoon at a time until desired spreading consistency. Garnish as desired, strawberries make a nice garnish. ; name: bob evans peanut butter pie ; ingredients: pie crusts, instant vanilla pudding, milk, whipping cream, creamy peanut butter, cool whip ; preparation:Mix together pudding and cold milk until creamy. Add whipped, whipping cream and peanut butter. Mix well. Pour into baked pie crust,. Top with cool whip whipped. Freeze for 1 hour until set. Top with chocolate shavings and nuts chill till ready to serve. ; name: cousin judys deviled eggs ; ingredients: hard-cooked eggs, mayonnaise, prepared mustard, worcestershire sauce, old bay seasoning, distilled white vinegar, black pepper, salt, paprika ; preparation:Combine the thoroughly mashed yolks with the mayonnaise and mustard. Add in worcestershire sauce, old bay, vinegar, and pepper. Stir to combine. Taste and if needed, add salt. Fill the whites evenly with the mixture and garnish each egg half with a sprinkle of paprika. ; name: quick and easy chicken cordon bleu rolls ; ingredients: chicken breasts, prosciutto, swiss cheese, salt and pepper, cream of mushroom soup, milk, dry white wine ; preparation:On each chicken breast, place one piece of prosciutto and cheese. Roll up each chicken breast and secure with a toothpick. Season each roll with salt and pepper. Place in the crock-pot slow cooker. In a small bowl, whisk together the soup, milk and white wine. Pour half of this mixture over the chicken breast rolls, placing the other half in the refrigerator for later. Cover and cook on low for 4 to 6 hours or on high for 3 to 4 hours. Before serving heat up the remainder of your sauce and put over the chicken breast when serving. ; name: garlic and rosemary green beans ; ingredients: frozen green beans, olive oil, garlic clove, dried rosemary, salt ; preparation:

name: swedish creme ; ingredients: heavy cream, sugar, unflavored gelatin, imitation vanilla, almond extract, sour cream, fresh raspberries ; preparation:In a saucepan, combine cream and 1 cup sugar. Cook and stir constantly over low heat until candy thermometer reads 160 or steam rises from pan. Stir in gelatin until dissolved. Add extracts. Cool 10 minutes. Whisk in sour cream. Pour into eight dessert glasses or small bowls. Chill at least 1 hour. Before serving, combine raspberries and remaining sugar. Spoon over each serving. ; name: maple roasted root vegetables ; ingredients: yukon gold potatoes, sweet potato, parsnips, beets, sweet onions, olive oil, maple syrup, garlic ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 400. Place the cut root vegetables in a single layer on one or two large baking sheets. Stir together the oil, maple syrup and garlic cloves and drizzle over the vegetables. Stir to combine the oil with the veggies and then spread once again in a single layer on the baking sheet. Season with salt and pepper. Bake for about 1 hour until the vegetables are done and a little caramelized from the syrup. Serve immediately. ; name: pork chops with mustard sauce capers ; ingredients: pork chops, olive oil, shallot, dijon mustard, cream, fresh lemon juice, capers, salt and pepper, water ; preparation:Pan fry pork chops in olive oil. In separate skillet, heat shallot in olive oil until softened. Add mustard, cream, capers, lemon juice, salt, pepper and flour mixture. Cook until heated through. Spoon sauce over pork chops. ; name: spiced rum breakfast coffee ; ingredients: ground coffee, cinnamon stick, cardamom seeds, rum extract, water, milk, sugar ; preparation:In basket of drip coffee make place coffee grounds, cinnamon stick, and the 3 cardamom seed pods broken open. Add 10 cups of water and brew. When done brewing add 1 teaspoon rum extract to brewed coffee. Serve. Can add milk and sweetener if you like. ; name: chili roasted chicken breasts or thighs ; ingredients: barbecue sauce, chili powder, dried oregano, salt, chicken thighs ; preparation:In a large bowl, mix together first 4 ingredients. Add chicken and turn to coat. Place on foil-lined, rimmed baking sheet. Spread with any remaining sauce. Bake in preheated 425f degree oven for about 25 minutes for breasts and 35 minutes for thighs. ; name: south dakota s own venison lamb or beef chislic ; ingredients: italian dressing, french dressing, beef, garlic salt, hot sauce ; preparation:Soak wooden skewers in water for 20 minutes. Cut meat roast into bite size pieces. Marinate meat in the dorothy lynch and zesty italian dressing for 30 minutes to overnight. Drain dressing off meat. Place meat evenly on wooden skewers. Grill chislic at a high temperature until cooked to desired temperature. The chislic can also be broiled in the oven or placed in a deep fat fryer. Serve with garlic salt and hot sauce. ; name: buffalo style stuffed eggs ; ingredients: eggs, blue cheese, mayonnaise, parsley, tabasco sauce, salt, pepper, celery salt, celery rib ; preparation:Hard cook eggs. Cool, shell, then cut in half. Mash yolks and mix well all other ingredients except diced celery. Spoon yolk mixture back into egg white halves. Garnish with diced celery. ; name: bamya alich a ethiopian style okra ; ingredients: okra, olive oil, red onions, tomatoes, garlic, ginger, cardamom, jalapenos ; preparation:

name: avocado stuffed with dates portuguese cape verde ; ingredients: avocados, sugar, port wine, dates, ice ; preparation:Cut avocados lengthwise in half and remove seeds. Remove the meat carefully with a spoon so as not to tear or puncdture the shells. Place the meat in a large bowl. Mash with a fork until smooth. Add sugar, port and dates. Mix well. Cover the filling with plastic wrap. Chill at least 2 hours. Stuff the shells. Place the filled avocado halves over crushed ice and serve. ; name: oven roasted tilapia with tomatoes pesto and lemon ; ingredients: cherry tomatoes, garlic cloves, extra virgin olive oil, pesto sauce, lemon, tilapia fillets, salt and pepper, lemon wedge ; preparation:Gently combine the tomatoes, garlic and olive oil with a little salt and pepper if desired and roast in a preheated 425 degree oven for about 10 minutes. Juice the lemon and mix some of the juice with the pesto, adding more if desired or needed keeping the pesto a nice spreadable consistency and not runny. Spread mixture on top of the fish which has been seasoned with a little more salt and pepper if desired. Cut the juiced lemon halves in half again so that you have two pieces of lemon to support each filet. Place a filet on top of two pieces of juiced lemon so that the fish is somewhat out of any liquid that accumulates, allowing it to roast rather than boil. Return to oven for about 10 minutes or until the fish is flaky and no longer opaque. Plate the fish along with the tomatoes and garlic and serve with more lemon wedges if desired. ; name: great garlic beer steaks ; ingredients: steaks, beer, oyster sauce, lemon, juice of, garlic cloves, black pepper, seasoning ; preparation:In a shallow glass dish, combine the beer, garlic, pepper, oyster sauce and lemon juice - mix well. Rub steaks on both sides with the grill seasoning and place them in the marinade. Be sure to coat the steaks well. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Preheat the grill to high, and lightly oil the grate. Remove steaks from the marinade, and discard marinade. Grill steaks for about 5 min on each side, or to desired doneness. ; name: tortellini alfredo with prosciutto artichoke hearts ; ingredients: cheese-filled egg tortellini, whipping cream, parmesan cheese, prosciutto, marinated artichoke hearts ; preparation:Prepare tortellini according to package instructions. Drain. Heat cream in a large skillet over low heat. Gradually sprinkle in cheese, stirring constantly, until blended. Simmer, stirring occasionally, 15 to 20 minutes. Add tortellini, prosciutto, and artichoke hearts. Simmer, stirring occasionally, 5 to 10 minutes or until sauce is slightly reduced. Serve immediately. Serve with crusty italian bread, if desired. ; name: tomato soup spaghetti sauce ; ingredients: tomato soup, garlic powder, oregano, basil, vinegar, hamburger, onion, water ; preparation:Cook hamburger and onion til burger is done. Add everything else but water - combine. Add water until slightly thinner than you want sauce and simmer until desired thickness. Serve. Once you try this, adjust spices to suit your own taste. ; name: cream of shiitake and corn soup ; ingredients: olive oil, leeks, vegetable broth, potato, celery, frozen corn kernels, shiitake mushroom, unsweetened soymilk, salt and pepper ; preparation:In a big pot, over medium heat, put half of the oil. Add the leeks and cook until they are tender. Add the broth, the potato, the corn and the celery. Cover and let cook until the vegetable are tenders. Meanwhile, in a frying pan, saut the mushrooms in the rest of the oil. Season to taste. Cream the soup with a blender. Put the soup in bowls. Make a nest of mushrooms over and serve piping hot. ; name: orange witches brew punch ; ingredients: orange gelatin, sugar, boiling water, apricot nectar, pineapple juice, lemon juice, ginger ale ; preparation:In a large bowl, dissolve gelatin and sugar in water. Stir in the apricot nectar, pineapple juice and lemon juice. Freeze in two 2-qt. Freezer containers. Remove from the freezer 2-3 hours before serving. Place contents of one container in a punch bowl. Mash with potato masher. Stir in ginger ale just before serving. Repeat. ; name: tahnabour hot yogurt soup ; ingredients: wheat, yogurt, water, egg, flour, salt, onion, butter, mint, parsley ; preparation:

name: creamy corn and broccoli chowder ; ingredients: butter, onion, garlic clove, gold medal all-purpose flour, coarse salt, pepper, reduced-sodium chicken broth, frozen broccoli cuts, frozen sweet corn, half-and-half ; preparation:In 4-quart saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Cook onion and garlic in butter 2 to 3 minutes, stirring frequently, until tender. Stir in flour, salt and pepper. Cook, stirring constantly, 1 minute. Stir in broth, broccoli and corn. Heat to boiling over high heat. Reduce heat. Simmer 5 to 7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are tender. Stir in half-and-half. Cook 2 to 3 minutes, stirring occasionally, until hot. ; name: pesto hots ; ingredients: fresh basil, parmesan cheese, mayonnaise, garlic clove, french baguette ; preparation:Combine the basil, cheese, mayonnaise and garlic in a bowl and mix well. Arrange the baguette slices in a single layer on a cookie sheet. Broil the slices until light brown. Turn the slices and spread with the mayonnaise mixture. Return to under the broiler and broil until light brown and heated through. Serve immediately. ; name: amy s beer ranch cheese ball ; ingredients: green onion, cream cheese, ranch dressing mix, sharp cheddar cheese, beer, cracker ; preparation:Reserve one cup of cheese. In a medium bowl, combine remaining ingredients. Push mixture together in the center of the bowl, making a ball shape, cover bowl, and refrigerate 2 hours or longer. Place a large strip of plastic wrap on the counter top. Sprinkle remaining cup of cheese over the center of the plastic wrap. Place cream cheese mixture in the center of the shredded cheese, and use plastic wrap to mold into a ball. Roll the ball to completely cover in shredded cheese. Wrap the formed cheese ball in plastic wrap and refrigerate one hour or until serving. Serve with hearty crackers such as wheat thins or triscuits. ; name: barley bake ; ingredients: celery, sliced mushrooms, green onion, garlic clove, butter, barley, fresh cilantro, chicken broth, salt and pepper ; preparation:Saute celery, mushrooms, onions and garlic in butter until soft. Add barley and cook until light brown. In a 2 quart buttered casserole combine barley mixture, parsley or cilantro and chicken broth. Cover and bake at 350 for 30 minutes and then uncover and bake for 45 minutes more or until barley is tender and liquid is absorbed. If necessary, add more broth. Season with salt and pepper to taste. ; name: roast salmon with lime salsa ; ingredients: limes, red onion, cilantro, jalapeno, canola oil, sugar, sea salt, salmon fillets, fresh ground pepper ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 425. Using a sharp knife, carefully peel the limes. Be sure to remove all of the bitter white pith. Working over a bowl, cut in between the membranes to release the lime sections into the bowl. Cut each section crosswise into quarters. Return the limes to the bowl and stir in the onion, cilantro and jalapeo. Add 1 tablespoon of the oil, the sugar and a pinch of salt and toss well. Heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil in an ovenproof skillet until shimmering. Season the fillets on both sides with salt and pepper and add to the skillet, skinned side up. Cook over moderately high heat until golden brown on the bottom, about 2 minutes. Transfer the skillet to the oven and roast the salmon for 5 minutes, or until just cooked through. Transfer to 4 dinner plates, spoon the salsa on top and serve. ; name: nanny s tomato soup ; ingredients: tomatoes, tomato juice, potatoes, onion, milk, butter, salt and pepper ; preparation:Dice potatoes and onions. Place in soup pot and just cover with water. Add butter. Boil until potatoes are tender but not too soft. Add tomatoes and juice. Reduce heat to low and cook for 15 minutes. Just before serving, stir in milk, salt and pepper. Serve with hot corn bread. ; name: meatball vegetable stew in crock pot ; ingredients: meatballs, frozen mixed vegetables, mushroom beef gravy, diced tomatoes, water, dried basil, garlic powder, frozen corn, mushroom, parmesan cheese ; preparation:In 4-quart crock pot, place frozen meatballs and frozen vegetables. In a bowl, stir together tomatoes, gravy, water and seasonings. Pour over meatballs & vegetables. Cover and cook on low-heat for 6-8 hours or high-heat for 4 hours. Add corn and mushrooms, if using about 30 min before serving. I usually sprinkle a little parmesan cheese on top of each serving. ; name: traditional bean soup ; ingredients: beans, white onion, avocado, tortillas, cream, chiles guajillos, white cheese, garlic ; preparation:

name: asparagus crab dip ; ingredients: sour cream, cream cheese, asparagus spears, parmesan cheese, green onions, prepared horseradish, dijon mustard, crabmeat ; preparation:Combine sour cream, cream cheese and asparagus. Add parmesan cheese, onions, horseradish, mustard and crabmeat. Spread in ungreased 1 quart baking dish. Bake 375 20-25 mins till thoroughly heated. Serve warm with crackers and cut up fresh vegetables. ; name: miss minda s super sunshine cake ; ingredients: yellow cake mix, applesauce, eggs, mandarin oranges in light syrup, cool whip, vanilla instant pudding mix, crushed pineapple ; preparation:Ignore the directions on the box cake mix and instead, in a medium bowl, add the cake mix, applesauce, eggs and mandarine oranges. Bake at the temperature on box and for the suggested length of time. After cake is cooled, combine cool whip with instant pudding and pineapple with the juice. Let it rest for 10 minutes and frost the cake. Serve. ; name: agua de valencia ; ingredients: orange juice, gin, vodka, sparkling wine, sugar, lemons, ice cube ; preparation:To a pitcher add orange juice, gin, vodka and cava or champagne. Add sugar, a pinch at a time. Stir and taste until desired sweetness is acheived. Refrigerate until chilled. Fill a glass with 2 or 3 ice cubes and fill. Garnish with lemon or lime wedges. ; name: giblet gravy microwave ; ingredients: turkey giblets, water, celery, onion, turkey drippings, all-purpose flour, salt, pepper ; preparation:Pierce membranes of giblets and place in a 1 quart casserole with water, onions, & celery. Cover& microwave on medium for 45-50 minutes or until giblets are tender. Reserve liquid. Chop giblets and set aside. Pour drippings from roasted turkey into a 4 cup microwave safe measure and microwave on high for 1 to 2 minutes, or till hot. Stir in flour, salt, and pepper until smooth. Gradually, blend in reserved giblet broth and cover. Microwave on high for 3 to 4 minutes, stirring occasionally to prevent lumps. Add chopped giblets and microwave on high for 1-2 minutes or until thickened. ; name: alton brown s ice cream ; ingredients: vanilla sugar, egg yolks, half-and-half, vanilla extract, heavy cream ; preparation:In a medium sauce pan combine the half and half and heavy cream, stir over medium heat until just boiling. Blend the egg yokes and slowly add the sugar until all mixed. Temper in the heated milk mixture. Return to saucepan and over low heat bring mixture to 170 degrees. Move to chilled metal bowl. After slight cooling, add vanilla extract. Chill until mixture reaches 40 degrees. Add mixture to machine and add any additional flavorings. Enjoy. ; name: a lighter croque monsieur ; ingredients: french bread, honey mustard, reduced-fat ham, lowfat swiss cheese, nonfat milk, egg whites, cooking spray ; preparation:Cut a slit in each bread slice to form a pocket. Spread 1 teaspoon honey mustard into each bread pocket. Divide ham and cheese evenly among bread pockets. Combine milk and egg whites in a shallow bowl, stirring with a whisk. Dip sandwiches, 1 at a time, in milk mixture, turning to coat. Heat a large nonstick skillet coated with cooking spray over medium-high heat. Add 2 sandwiches and cook 3 minutes on each side or until sandwiches are golden brown. Repeat the procedure with the remaining sandwiches. ; name: the one only wild rice chicken casserole ; ingredients: wild rice mix, condensed cream of chicken soup, cooked chicken, celery, onion, water chestnuts, soy sauce, chicken broth, seasoned stuffing mix, butter ; preparation:Cook rice according to package directions. Blend in soup and next 6 ingredients. Mix gently. Add broth and mix. Spread in a 9x13x2 inch dish. Sprinkle with topping. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 1 hour. ; name: apple and cranberry pie ; ingredients: pastry for double-crust pie, fresh cranberries, sugar, minute tapioca, water, orange zest, baking apples ; preparation:

name: tex mex spaghetti ; ingredients: turkey bratwursts, onion, garlic, chili powder, ground cumin, rotel tomatoes, picante sauce, dried oregano, cheese, spaghetti ; preparation:Crumble sausage into a large skillet, discard casings. Add onion, garlic, chili powder, cumin and cook over medium-high heat 8 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add tomoatoes, picante sauce, and oregano. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 15 to 20 minutes or until thickened. Add cooked spaghetti and stir well. Serve with shredded cheese at table. ; name: spanish style potato salad ; ingredients: russet potato, mayonnaise, smoked paprika, yellow onion, salt-free garlic powder, salt, white pepper ; preparation:Wash and peel potatoes. Cut up into chunks. Bring a large pot of water to boiling and cook potatoes until fork tender. Drain. Set aside to cool briefly. Transfer potatoes to a large serving bowl. Combine the mayonnaise and smoked paprika. Add to the potatoes. Add the remaining ingredients and stir to combine. Cover and chill. Before serving, adjust seasonings if necessary and garnish with fresh parsley if desired. Tastes better the second day. ; name: miss amies french chocolates ; ingredients: chocolate chips, sweetened condensed milk, vanilla, nuts, candy sprinkles ; preparation:In a saucepan over medium low heat add chocolate chips and condensed milk. Stir until chips are melted and condensed milk is completely blended with chocolate. Mixture should be creamy. Mix in vanilla. Let cool 5 minutes and roll mixture into balls. Roll balls into chopped nuts or sprinkles. Let cool completely and enjoy. May want to keep refrigerated. ; name: chipotle chili lasagna ; ingredients: chicken chilli, corn tortillas, low fat cottage cheese, low-fat cream cheese, chicken broth, low-fat cheddar cheese, lowfat mozzarella cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Soften corn tortillas in the microwave for 30 seconds. In a small bowl mix cottage cheese, cream cheese, mozzerella, cheddar, and chicken broth. Spray a square baking dish with cooking spray, then spread a few tables spoons of chili onto the bottom. Place one layer of corn tortillas on top. Layer about a third the jar of chili onto tortillas. Top with half the cheese mixture. Repeat layer begining with 3 more tortillas, another third of the chili, and the rest of the cheese. Top with the final layer of tortillas. Cover with remaining chili and sprinkle more cheese on top. Bake for 20-25 minutes. ; name: poppy seed bundt cake ; ingredients: butter recipe cake mix, sour cream, sugar, oil, eggs, poppy seeds ; preparation:Mix all ingredients together.
