Combine the meat, vegetables reserved broth and cornstarch in a large bowl and mix well. Spoon the mixture into the pie shell. Top with the second crust, press the edges to seal and cut vents in the top for steam to escape. Bake at 350 degrees until crust is browned, about 1 hour. ; name: creole poached chicken breasts ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, celery, carrot, stewed tomatoes, low sodium chicken broth, ground thyme, salt, cayenne pepper, boneless skinless chicken breasts ; preparation:

name: cajun fried cucumbers ; ingredients: cucumbers, salt and pepper, cajun seasoning, eggs, breadcrumbs, bacon drippings ; preparation:Season cucumbers with salt, pepper and cajun seasoning. Dip the slices in the beaten eggs. Coat the slices with breadcrumbs. Heat the bacon drippings and fry the cucumbers until brown on both sides. Drain and serve hot. ; name: pear and blue cheese pork chops ; ingredients: pork chops, vegetable oil, salt, black pepper, pears, butter, green peppercorn, blue cheese ; preparation:Brush chops lightly with oil. Season with salt and pepper. In a large skillet, cook chops 4-5 minutes per side or until juices run clear. Remove chops from the skillet and keep warm. In the skillet used to cook the pork, cook the pear slices in the butter for 1 minute, stirring gently to coat. Stir in peppercorns. Cook and stir about 2 minutes. Spoon pears over the chops. Sprinkle with blue cheese and serve. ; name: smoked cod in parsley sauce ; ingredients: smoked cod, evaporated milk, onion, plain flour, butter, fresh parsley, salt, pepper ; preparation:Melt butter in a saucepan. Add onion and cook until tender. Stir in flour, and cook for about 1 minute, stirring constantly. Slowly stir in milk. Add fish and parsley, and simmer until sauce thickens and fish is cooked through. ; name: sweet cucumber and mandarin orange salad ; ingredients: cucumber, mandarin oranges, sweet onion, granulated sugar, white vinegar, fresh tarragon, salt & pepper ; preparation:In a serving bowl, combine the cucumbers, oranges, and onion rings. In a small bowl, stir together the sugar and vinegar until the sugar dissolves. Pour the vinegar mixture over the cucumber salad. Toss well. Add chopped tarragon. Season with salt and pepper. Chill 1 hour before serving. ; name: scrambled egg and bacon sandwich ; ingredients: bread, mayonnaise, egg, water, salt and pepper, bacon ; preparation:Slice the 2 slices bacon in half and cook to a crisp. Drain on paper towel, and pour drippings out of pan. Whip egg with water, add salt and pepper and scramble eggs in same pan in which the bacon was cooked. Remove egg to cool. After bread has toasted, spread with mayo and layer on eggs and bacon. Slice and serve with favorite breakfast beverage. ; name: steak supper special ; ingredients: flour, salt, cube steaks, oil, french bread, chili sauce, water, worcestershire sauce, lemon juice, prepared mustard ; preparation:Mix flour and salt. Coat steaks. In skillet, heat oil and cook steaks until browned on both sides. Place each steak onto a piece of bread and keep warm. Into drippings in pan, stir in chili sauce, water, worcestershire sauce, lemon juice and mustard. Stir to mix well and heat to boiling. Spoon sauce over steaks. ; name: carrot potato and onion gratin ; ingredients: butter, russet potatoes, onions, carrot, salt, fresh ground black pepper, chicken stock, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350f generously butter a medium-size gratin dish. Make a layer of one-third of the potato slices in the bottom of the prepared gratin dish. Add a layer of half the onions and then half the carrots. Dot with 2 tablespoons of the butter and season well with salt and pepper. Repeat the layers and finish with the remaining one-third of the potato slices. Dot with the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter and season with salt and pepper. Pour in the stock. Cover with aluminum foil and bake until the vegetables are tender, about 45 minutes. Uncover and sprinkle with the cheese. Bake 10 minutes longer, until the cheese is golden brown. Serve very hot. Makes 6 to 8 servings. ; name: marinated tomatoes with lemon ; ingredients: fresh tomatoes, fresh lemon juice, sugar, extra virgin olive oil, fresh savory, salt, ground red pepper, garlic clove ; preparation:

name: spinach rice casserole ; ingredients: onion, spinach, brown rice, low-sodium tamari, cumin, tomatoes ; preparation:Saute onion in a small amount of water until translucent. Add spinach and steam until barely tender. Remove from heat. Mix the rice with the onions, spinach and tamari. Press into non-stick baking dish. Layer sliced tomatoes over the top. Bake 30 minutes at 350 degrees. ; name: old fashioned tuna potato chip casserole ; ingredients: noodles, cream of mushroom soup, milk, canned tuna, potato chips, onion, cheese ; preparation:Cook noodles in unsalted water. Drain noodles. Mix soup, milk and tuna with noodles. Add shredded cheese and onion. Pour into casserole dish. Crush potato chips and sprinkle on top. Bake 15 minutes at 425 degrees. ; name: pineapple banana muffins ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, granulated sugar, nuts, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, eggs, mashed bananas, pineapple, vegetable oil ; preparation:In large bowl, stir together flour, sugar, nuts, baking soda, salt and cinnamon. In separate bowl, beat eggs. Stir in bananas, pineapple and oil until blended, add all at once to dry ingredients. Stir just until moistened. Spoon into large greased muffin cups filling two-thirds full. Bake at 375 f over for 20-30 minutes or until tops are firm to the touch. ; name: corn muffins with sweet red peppers ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, yellow cornmeal, sugar, baking powder, salt, pepper, buttermilk, vegetable oil, egg, sweet red pepper ; preparation:In large bowl, combine flour, cornmeal, sugar, baking powder, salt and pepper. In small bowl, beat together buttermilk, oil and egg, stir into dry ingredients just until moistened. Stir in red pepper. Spoon batter into well greased or paper lined muffin cups, filling each two thirds full. Bake in 425f degree oven for 15 minutes or until tester inserted in centre comes out clean. Or bake in 8 inch square baking pan in 425f degree oven for 20 minutes or until firm to the touch. Cut into squares to serve. ; name: grandma georgias molasses cookies ; ingredients: vegetable shortening, sugar, molasses, egg, baking soda, all-purpose flour, ground ginger, cinnamon, table salt ; preparation:Melt the shortening and let it cool. Mix the dry ingredients together. Add the sugar, molasses, and egg to the shortening. Stir in the dry ingredients and mix until combined. Chill until firm. Preheat the oven to 375f. Form the dough into balls about 1 inch in size. Place a little white sugar in a small bowl and roll each ball in the sugar. Place the balls about 2 inches apart on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes. Leave the cookies on the cookie sheet for 3 to 5 minutes. The cookies will be soft but they will harden as they cool. ; name: limon chicken ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breast halves, salt, pepper, vegetable oil, garlic, yellow onions, chilies, fresh lemon juice ; preparation:Season both sides of the chicken liberally with salt and pepper. Heat the oil in a deep saucepan, add the chicken and sear on both sides until golden brown, about 2 minutes on each side. Remove the chicken and add the onions and garlic and cook at medium-low heat until the onions are golden brown, about 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in the yellow chile and return the chicken to the pan. Spoon some of the onions over the chicken, cover and cook for 10 to 15 minutes, until chile sauce has completely infused the mixture and the chicken is cooked through. Add the lemon juice and cook another 10 minutes, to allow flavors to meld. Slice breasts to serve. ; name: christmas minties ; ingredients: semi-sweet chocolate baking squares, peppermint extract, ritz crackers, candy cane ; preparation:Microwave chocolate in a glass bowl. Stir until melted, then stir in peppermint extract. Dip the crackers singley into the chocolate, shaking off any excess. Place on wax paper-covered baking sheets and sprinkle with crushed candy cane before the chocolate sets. Chill until firm. ; name: pineapple apricot cheese spread ; ingredients: crushed pineapple, dried apricot, mango chutney, apricot brandy, ground ginger, reduced-fat cheddar cheese, fat free cream cheese, reduced-calorie stick margarine ; preparation:

name: polish stir fry ; ingredients: kielbasa, potatoes, carrot, onion, cabbage ; preparation:Lightly grease big, iron skillet, with canola oil. Brown the kielbasa. Take it out and put it aside. Drain excess grease. Fry potatoes and carrots, stirring often, until half-cooked. Add onion and keep frying, stirring frequently. When the onion is half-cooked, add the cabbage and continue until everything is completely cooked. Return kielbasa to the pan, mix well, and serve once it is reheated. This dish travels well and reheats well. ; name: brown butter pasta ; ingredients: salted butter, nutmeg, turmeric, gouda cheese, coarse unseasoned bread crumbs, pine nuts, fresh fettuccine ; preparation:Bring a large saucepan of lightly salted water to a boil. While the water heats, in a small saucepan over medium-low heat, combine the butter, nutmeg and turmeric. Heat, stirring frequently, until the butter has melted and browned slightly, about 8 to 10 minutes. Meanwhile, use a food processor to finely grate the cheese. Add the bread crumbs and pine nuts, then pulse several times, or until the mixture resembles coarse sand. Set aside. Once the water has boiled, add the pasta and cook according to package directions. Drain and return to the pot. Pour the butter mixture over the pasta and toss to coat. Transfer the pasta, along with any butter in the pan, to a large serving bowl. Sprinkle the bread crumb mixture over the pasta. ; name: cathy s garlic dipping sauce ; ingredients: oil, garlic cloves, liquid honey, cornstarch, water ; preparation:Add 1 tablespoon oil to pan. Add the finely minced garlic and lightly brown. Be very careful not to burn the garlic. Add 3 tablespoons honey. Dissolve 1 tablespoon corn starch in 1 tablespoon water to thicken sauce. Thicken and stir til nice and shiny. I often make ahead, refrigerate and warm in micro wave just before using. Keeps well at least a week. ; name: fijian pork pineapple curry ; ingredients: pork, red curry paste, coconut milk, fresh pineapple, red capsicum, cashew nuts ; preparation:Stir fry the curry paste in a saucepan for 1-2 minutes, until fragrant. Add pork and stir until well coated in the spice paste. Add coconut milk and stir well to combine. Add diced pineapple and capsicum, cover and simmer for 20-30 minutes until pork is tender. Served on mashed kumara or steamed rice and top with a few roast cashew nuts. Serves 2. ; name: roasted chickpeas ww core ; ingredients: chickpeas, garlic powder, salt, pepper, nonstick cooking spray ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Rinse and drain chickpeas. Lightly coat baking sheet with nonstick spray. Spread chickpeas on baking sheet and sprinkle with garlic powder, salt and pepper. Toss to coat. Bake on bottom rack of oven, shaking pan every 15 minutes. Bake 45 to 50 minutes, until browned and crunchy. Cool completely before serving. ; name: rice with almonds raisins ; ingredients: butter, onion, white rice, raisins, chicken broth, salt and pepper, sliced almonds ; preparation:Melt butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Saute onion, stirring, until tender. Stir in the rice, raisins, broth, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer 15 to 20 minutes, or until rice is cooked and liquid is absorbed. Stir in almonds before serving. ; name: rice paper wrapped fish ; ingredients: fish fillets, green chilies, sesame oil, coriander, basil, cumin seed, rice paper, oil, black sesame seed ; preparation:Wash fish, pat dry on absorbent paper and cut into 12 pieces. Place chillies, sesame oil, coriander, basil and cumin seeds in a spice grinder or mortar and pestle, and grind until they form a rough paste. Spread paste over fish. Brush rice papers with warm water and set aside for 4 minutes or until they are soft. Place a piece of fish on each round, fold in sides and roll to enclose. Heat a little oil in a frypan over medium heat. Cook fish parcels for 2-3 minutes on each side, or until rice paper is golden and crispy, and fish is tender. Drain on absorbent paper. Sprinkle fish with sesame seeds, and serve with steamed asian greens drizzled with oyster sauce and steamed jasmine rice. ; name: fiesta corn bake casserole ; ingredients: sour cream, flour, sugar, mexican-style corn, ground beef, onion, cheddar cheese, seasoning ; preparation:

name: pesto havarti grilled eggplant burgers ; ingredients: eggplant, olive oil, havarti cheese, pesto sauce, sandwich bread ; preparation:Cut the eggplant into hamburger-sized pieces. Brush each piece, front and back, with olive oil. Shred the havarti cheese. Grill the eggplant until almost done. Sprinkle the shredded havarti cheese on each eggplant. Remove the eggplant when the cheese is melted. Spread the pesto on each eggplant. Serve on the bread of your choice. ; name: yummy roasted garlic mashed potatoes ; ingredients: garlic, olive oil, russet potatoes, butter, milk, salt and pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Drizzle garlic with olive oil, then wrap in aluminum foil. Bake in preheated oven for 1 hour. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add potatoes, and cook until tender, about 15 minutes. Drain, cool and chop. Stir in butter, milk, salt and pepper. Remove the garlic from the oven, and cut in half. Squeeze the softened cloves into the potatoes. Blend potatoes with an electric mixer until desired consistency is achieved. ; name: jazzed up frozen green beans ; ingredients: frozen green beans, bacon, chicken broth, onion powder ; preparation:Cook frozen green beans according to package directions, using the lowest time given. In a large skillet, fry bacon until desired doneness. Drain on paper towel and return to skillet. Add cooked green beans, chicken broth, and onion powder to the skillet. Stir to combine. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium and cook for ten minutes or until most of the liquid is evaporated, stirring occasionally. ; name: sauteed broccoli rabe with parmesan garlic ; ingredients: broccoli rabe, extra virgin olive oil, garlic clove, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cut an x in the bottom of the stems of the broccoli rabe and place in the boiling water. Cook until tender but still firm, about 5 minutes. Drain. In a large heavy skillet over medium heat, heat olive oil and saute garlic for 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in the broccoli rabe and saute 10 to 15 minutes, or until desired doneness. Dust with parmesan cheese, if desired. ; name: curried shrimp with cilantro ; ingredients: olive oil, shallots, garlic cloves, curry powder, reduced-sodium vegetable broth, shrimp, fresh lime juice, low-fat sour cream, fresh cilantro, salt and pepper ; preparation:Over medium heat, heat oil in skillet. Add shallots and garlic. Cook and stir about 2 minutes until tender. Add curry powder. Cook and stir about 1 minute until the mixture becomes fragrant. Add the broth and bring to simmer. Add the lime juice and shrimp. Simmer until the shrimp are cooked through, about 3 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in sour cream and cilantro. Season with salt and pepper, serve immediately. ; name: pan seared halibut with black bean sauce ; ingredients: black bean garlic sauce, rice vinegar, cornstarch, water, skinless halibut fillets, vegetable oil, fresh ginger, scallions, fresh cilantro ; preparation:Whisk together black bean and garlic sauce, vinegar, 1 teaspoon cornstarch, and water in a bowl. Pat fish dry with paper towels. Place remaining cornstarch in shallow dish. Coat fish with cornstarch, shaking to remove excess. Heat oil in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until just smoking. Add fish and cook until browned and cooked through, about 3 minutes per side. Transfer to a platter. Add ginger and scallion whites to empty skillet and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add black bean mixture and simmer until slightly thickened, about 1 minute. Pour sauce over fish and sprinkle with scallion greens and cilantro. Serve. ; name: redi burger patty melt ; ingredients: veggie burgers, rye bread, fat-free swiss cheese, sweet onion, vegetable broth, butter ; preparation:Slice redi-burger into 8 equal patties. Spray non-stick skillet with cooking spray and fry redi-burger over medium heat until lightly browned on each side. Remove patties from skillet and saut sliced onion in skillet until lightly browned. Add vegetable broth cover skillet. Steam onions until tender. Assemble sandwiches by placing 1 slice of redi-burger and 1 slice of cheese on slice of rye bread. Top with onions and another slice of rye bread. Lightly butter outside surfaces of bread and fry in skillet over medium heat until both sides of bread are toasted and cheese has melted. Serve immediately. ; name: raw broccoli salad reduced calorie low fat ; ingredients: broccoli florets, red onion, artificial sweetener, cider vinegar, light mayonnaise, sunflower seeds, seedless raisins ; preparation:

name: chicken sweet and spunky ; ingredients: soy sauce, honey, water, cinnamon, boneless skinless chicken breasts, frozen spinach, baby carrots, butter, onion ; preparation:In a small saucepan heat water to simmer. Add in honey and stir til combined, turn off heat. Add in cinnamon and soy sauce stirring til incorporated. In a 9x12 casserole dish put frozen spinach, baby carrots in first. Place chicken on top of vegetables. Pour sauce over top of chicken and veggies. Put onion slices and butter pats on top. Cook in 350 oven for 45 minutes or until juices run clear from chicken. Check chicken at 20 min mark and baste with juices. ; name: cinnamon crusted coffee cake ; ingredients: yellow cake mix, eggs, oil, brewed decaffeinated coffee, brown sugar, cinnamon, shredded coconut, walnut pieces ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Beat cake mix with eggs, oil and coffee in large bowl with electric mixer on medium speed until well blended. Pour evenly into 2 greased round cake pans. Mix brown sugar and cinnamon in medium bowl. Stir in coconut and walnuts. Sprinkle evenly over cake batter. Bake 30 minutes. Cool completely on wire racks before removing cake layers from pans. ; name: dutch baked beans ; ingredients: bacon, onion, white kidney beans, salt, brown sugar, catsup, garlic powder, chili powder ; preparation:Cook bacon until not quite done. Drain and set aside. Saute onions in 2 or 3 tablespoons bacon fat. Take 1 can of beans and rinse and drain well. Use other can as is. Pour the unstrained can into large frying pan. Add brown sugar. Stir until sugar is melted. Add onions and rest of the beans. Chop bacon. Add to mixture, along with catsup, spices and salt. Simmer for 15 to 20 minutes. ; name: best pie crust ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, sugar, salt, vegetable shortening, unsalted butter, egg yolk, ice water, cider vinegar ; preparation:To make the crust, mix the flour, sugar, and salt in a medium bowl. Using a pastry blender, cut in the shortening and butter until the mixture resembles coarse meal. Stirring with a fork, add just enough of the egg yolk mixture to moisten the dough so it holds together when pinched between the thumb and forefinger. Gather up into a thick disk and wrap in waxed paper. Refrigerate at least 30 minutes, or up to overnight. ; name: hominy salad ; ingredients: white hominy, green pepper, onions, celery, sweet pickle relish, salt, celery seed, cheddar cheese, mayonnaise ; preparation:Rinse hominy and drain well. Chop green pepper, onion and celery. Toss hominy and veggies together. Stir in pickle relish, celery seed, salt cheese and mayonnaise. Chill and serve cold. ; name: garlic balsamic and rosemary roasted potatoes ; ingredients: potatoes, olive oil, balsamic vinegar, garlic cloves, rosemary sprigs, coarse sea salt, fresh ground pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f. Combine all ingredients on a large greased baking sheet. Arrange in a single layer. Roast in preheated oven for about 50 minutes, turning once during cooking, until potatoes are tender. Serves 6. ; name: top secret recipes version of heinz ketchup ; ingredients: tomato sauce, tomato paste, corn syrup, vinegar, water, sugar, seasoning salt, onion powder, garlic ; preparation:Combine all ingredients in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Stir and bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer for 30 minute. Stir often. Remove from heat and cover til cool. Keep in a covered container in fridge. ; name: fantastic cinnamon raisin bread ; ingredients: oil, warm water, honey, maple-flavor syrup, salt, cinnamon, oatmeal, bread flour, raisins, active dry yeast ; preparation:

name: best potluck pasta salad ; ingredients: wagon wheel macaroni, summer squash, frozen peas, red pepper, cheddar cheese, pitted ripe olives, cherry tomatoes, red onion, fresh oregano, balsamic vinaigrette ; preparation:Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. Rince with cold water. Drain again. In a large bowl combine, pasta, squash, peas, sweet pepper, cheese, olives tomatoes, onion, and oregano. Add dressing to pasta mixture. Toss gently to coat. Cover and chill for 2 to 24 hours. ; name: easy hamburger stew ; ingredients: lean ground beef, garlic, onion, potatoes, carrots, kernel corn, cream of mushroom soup, water, salt and pepper, worcestershire sauce ; preparation:Saute ground beef, garlic and onion. Add potatoes, carrots and corn. Stir in soup, water and seasonings. Cover and simmer until veggies are tender. Serve over steamed white rice. ; name: lainie s wahoo marinade ; ingredients: butter, extra virgin olive oil, fresh garlic cloves, fresh cilantro, seafood seasoning, lemon, juice of, wahoo fillets, lemon wedge ; preparation:Spray grill with nonstick spray or brush with vegie oil to prevent sticking. Preheat on high for about 10 minutes. Mix first six ingredients in a blender. Pure into a smooth sauce. When ready to cook, brush both sides of fillets with sauce. Place fillets on grill and cook, turning once or twice. Brush more sauce as needed. Fish is done when it flakes easily. Serve with lemon wedges. ; name: weight watchers ww strawberry mousse ; ingredients: strawberries, low-fat cream cheese, sugar-free strawberry jell-o gelatin dessert, egg whites ; preparation:Mix the strawberries with the cream cheese until the berries are slightly broken up and the cheese in pinky in hue. Make up the jello according to the packet and pour over the strawberry mix. Stir well and leave until just starting to set. Whisk the egg whites until stiff peaks and fold into the strawberry mix. Spoon the mix into glasses and chill for one hour. ; name: easy sweet and sour red cabbage saute ; ingredients: oil, onion, apple, red cabbage, apple cider vinegar, sugar, celery seed, salt and black pepper ; preparation:Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add in onion and saute until golden. Add in sliced cabbage, cider vinegar, sugar, celery seeds and black pepper. Mix to combine and cook until the cabbage if crisp-tender and the liquid is reduced to a glaze. Season with salt. ; name: celery parmesan ; ingredients: celery, onion, garlic cloves, diced tomato, bacon, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Prehaet oven to 325 degrees. Lightly spray a 2-qt casserole dish with nonstick cooking spray. Cook celery, onion and garlic in small amount of boiling salted water until tender. Drain. Pour into prepared casserole dish. Top with tomatoes and bacon, then sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake at 325 degrees for 30 minutes. Serve. ; name: christmas package cheese snack ; ingredients: cream cheese, dried dill, garlic powder, salt, scallion, red bell pepper ; preparation:Mix the dried dill, garlic powder, and salt into the softened cream cheese. Pack the mixture into a rectangular container lined with plastic wrap. Refrigerate it for at least 3 hours. Before serving time, set the unwrapped block of cheese on a platter and decorate it with a scallion bow and red pepper polka dots and give tag made from cut red pepper. Serve with choice of crackers or veggies. ; name: tuscan sausage vegetable soup ; ingredients: italian sausage, zucchini, summer squash, onion, tubettini pasta, water, pasta sauce, garbanzo beans, beef bouillon cube ; preparation:

name: chicken and corn tortilla bake ; ingredients: cooked chicken, green chilies, chicken broth, cream of mushroom soup, cream of chicken soup, onion, corn tortillas, cheddar cheese ; preparation:In bowl, combine chicken, chilies, broth, soups and onion. Set aside. Layer half of the tortillas on the bottom of a greased 9x13 baking pan, cutting to fit pan if desired. Top with half of the chicken mixture and half of the cheese. Repeat layers. Bake uncovered at 350 for 30 minutes. ; name: calabicitas squash casserole ; ingredients: oil, garlic clove, onion, zucchini, corn, green chilies, salt, cheddar cheese ; preparation:In a large heavy skillet, saute the onion, garlic, and zucchini in oil. Discard the garlic. Mix in drained corn, chopped chiles, and salt. Cover tightly and heat through. Mix in cheese and serve. There is also another way to use above ingredients but with a little flour and a cup of either canned or whole milk added to the mixture. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs and bake. 350 degrees for 20-30 minutes. I like this one best. ; name: low carb fudge ; ingredients: margarine, unsweetened chocolate, equal sugar substitute, vanilla extract, cream cheese, nuts ; preparation:Melt butter over low heat. Add chocolate and stir until melted. Remove from heat and stir in sweetener and vanilla. Combine the chocolate mixture with the cream cheese and beat until smooth. Stir in nuts and spread in lightly greased 8-inch square pan. Refrigerate until firm. ; name: tex mex chicken pot pie ; ingredients: chicken breasts, frozen corn, black beans, cheddar cheese, monterey jack pepper cheese, salsa, pie crusts ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400. Mix all ingredients together except pie crusts. Line pie plate with first crust, deep dish is best. Add chicken mixture. Top with second pie crust. Cut slits into top crust. Bake for 45-50 minutes, until golden. Serve with sour cream and guacamole. ; name: vegetarian mushroom gravy ; ingredients: vegetable oil, mushroom, tamari soy sauce, fresh ground black pepper, hot water, cornstarch ; preparation:Saut mushrooms, tamari and black pepper in oil until mushrooms are tender. Add water and bring to a boil. Slowly add cornstarch and cook at a low boil, continuing to stir until the gravy is thick and clear. Adjust seasoning as necessary. Serve. ; name: chocolate hazelnut truffles ; ingredients: milk chocolate, chocolate hazelnut spread, thickened cream, slivered almonds ; preparation:Place the cream and chocolate in a medium heatproof, microwave-safe bowl. Heat, uncovered, stirring every minute, for 2 minutes or until smooth. Stir in the spread until well combined. Cover with plastic wrap and place in the fridge for 1 hour or until firm enough to roll into balls. Place the slivered almonds in a shallow bowl and line a tray with non-stick baking paper. Scoop out a teaspoonful of the chocolate mixture and use your hands to roll it into a ball. Roll the truffle ball in the almonds until it is completely covered and then place it on the lined tray. Repeat with remaining chocolate mixture. Refrigerate for 45 minutes or until firm and set. ; name: pheasant on rice ; ingredients: pheasants, cream of chicken soup, water, long grain and wild rice blend ; preparation:Place clean pheasants breast down in slow cooker. Mix 2 cans of soup and water. Pour over pheasants and cover. Set slow cooker on high and cook for 6 to 7 hours. Remove pheasants from soup mixture and cut meat from bones and place in soup mixture and mix together. Prepare long grain and wild rice. Place rice serving on plate and ladle pheasant and soup mixture over rice and serve immediately. ; name: beefy seitan log ; ingredients: vital wheat gluten, nutritional yeast, ground cumin, onion powder, garlic powder, mushroom stock, soy sauce, vegetarian worcestershire sauce ; preparation:

name: yo ho ho rum raisin sorbet ; ingredients: water, sugar, evaporated milk, unsweetened applesauce, golden raisin, light rum, ginger, honey ; preparation:Boil water and sugar until water is dissolved. Simmer for five more minutes without stirring. Pour in a 9 by 9 inch pan. Freeze for two hours. Stir from edges to middle. Return to freezer. Stir every hour from outside in, until it is slushy. Process in food processor. Return to pan and freeze for about six hours. Garnish and serve. ; name: a quick and easy white cake ; ingredients: flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, vegetable shortening, milk, vanilla, egg whites ; preparation:Heat oven to 350f degrees. Grease and flour 9x13 pan. Combine dry ingredients in mixing bowl. Beat in shortening. Add milk and vanilla. Beat for 2 minutes. Beat in egg whites, beat until very smooth. Bake for 35 minutes, or until done. ; name: yellow angel food cake ; ingredients: egg yolks, cold water, salt, sugar, lemon extract, cake flour, cream of tartar, baking powder ; preparation:Beat water and egg yolks and salt for 15 minutes. Fold in sugar and lemon extract. Sift dry ingredients together 5 times. Fold into egg mixture. Bake as for angel food cake. ; name: hearty breakfast casserole ; ingredients: bacon, biscuits, eggs, cheese, sour cream, salt, pepper, green onion ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly spray a 9x13 inch pan with cooking spray. Quarter biscuits, and place at bottom of pan. Layer with cooked bacon and shredded cheese. In a mixing bowl, whisk together eggs, sour cream, salt, and pepper and pour over cheese and biscuits. Bake for 30-40 minutes or until golden brown. Allow to cool 5-10 minutes before serving. Garnish with onions, if desired. ; name: zucchini and sumac fritters with tomato and mint salsa ; ingredients: zucchini, brown onion, breadcrumbs, eggs, fresh oregano, sumac, olive oil, tomatoes, of fresh mint, greek yogurt ; preparation:Squeeze the excess liquid from the zucchini using absorbent paper until it is as dry as possible or literally squeeze-dry a handful at a time in your hand. Combine the zucchini in a medium-sized bowl with the onion, breadcrumbs, eggs, oregano and sumac. Heat the oil in a large, preferably non-stick pan. Drop rounded tablespoons of the zucchini mixture in batches, into the pan. Cook until browned on both sides and cooked through. Meanwhile, combine the tomato and mint in a small bowl. Serve the fritters with the tomato and mint salad, accompanied by yoghurt. ; name: sour cream bread bread machine ; ingredients: water, sour cream, bread flour, light brown sugar, gluten, salt, fast rising yeast ; preparation:Add all ingredients to the pan according to the order in the manufacturers directions, with the water and the sour cream put in first, and adding the dry ingredients in on top. Set crust on medium and program for the basic cycle. Press start. When the baking cycle ends, immediately remove the bread from the pan and place it on a rack. Let cool to room temperature before slicing. ; name: kid friendly tuna noodle casserole ; ingredients: spaghetti noodles, condensed cream of mushroom soup, milk, tuna in water, onion, garlic cloves, cheddar cheese, parmesan cheese, salt and pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a large bowl, combine mushroom soup, milk, tuna, onions, garlic and cheddar cheddar cheese. Toss with cooked pasta. Transfer to greased 9-inch square casserole pan. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake uncovered for 30-45 minutes. ; name: spanish garlic soup ; ingredients: olive oil, garlic cloves, chicken broth, salt, pepper, bread cubes, egg ; preparation:

name: crisp sage and parmesan pork ; ingredients: pork loin steaks, white bread, sage leaf, parmesan cheese, black pepper, egg, oil ; preparation:Lay the pork steaks between two sheets of cling film and bash them with a rolling pin until approximately 1 cm thick. Whiz the bread in a food processor to make bread crumbs. Add the sage leaves. Pulse a few times to roughly chop the leaves. Mix in the grated parmesan. Pour onto a large plate. Season with black pepper. One by one, dip the steaks into the beaten egg, allowing the excess to drip off. Press steaks into the bread crumb mixture on both sides. Heat the oil in a large non stick frying pan. Fry the steaks for 3 to 4 minutes on each side until cooked through. ; name: leah s made up blueberry scones ; ingredients: flour, baking powder, salt, sugar, butter, blueberries, sour cream ; preparation:Mix dry ingredients. Crumble in butter. Add blueberries. Add sourcream. Form into ball, flatten out, cut into ten-twelve pie shape slices, bake at 425 for 15 or so minutes. ; name: spicy cajun crab and greens soup ; ingredients: vegetable oil, all-purpose flour, cajun seasoning, bottled clam juice, diced tomatoes with sweet onions, baby spinach leaves, fresh thyme, garlic clove, lump crabmeat ; preparation:Whisk oil and flour in heavy large saucepan over medium-high heat until smooth and golden brown, about 3 minutes. Add enough cajun seasoning to season to taste and stir 30 seconds. Add clam juice and stir until smooth. Add tomatoes with juices. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer 3 minutes. Add spinach, thyme, and garlic and simmer until spinach is just wilted, about 1 minute. Add crabmeat and simmer until heated through, stirring gently. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Ladle soup into bowls and serve. ; name: watermelon lemonade ; ingredients: watermelon, frozen lemonade concentrate, fresh lemon juice, lemon ; preparation:Puree watermelon in food processor, in batches, until smooth. Transfer to a large pitcher. Add undiluted lemonade concentrate and lemon juice stir until combined. Cover and refrigerate until chilled. Serve in tall ice filled glasses and garnish with a lemon slice. ; name: shrimp and chips ; ingredients: cooked shrimp, beer, flour, baking powder, salt, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:Mix all ingredients except shrimp in a mixing bowl to make batter. Dust shrimp in flour. Dip shrimp into batter. Fry shrimp in deep fryer set at 375 degrees or in a skillet with 2 inches of vegetable oil, until golden brown. Drain shrimp on paper towels or on brown grocery bags from the market. Serve with french fries and cole slaw or creamy cucumber salad. Also serve with cocktail sauce and tartar sauce. ; name: glorified rice dessert salad ; ingredients: cooked white rice, crushed pineapple, sugar, miniature marshmallow, whipping cream, vanilla, maraschino cherry ; preparation:Mix rice, pineapple, sugar and marshmallows in a bowl. Whip cream with additional sugar and vanilla until stiff. Fold into rice mixture. Chill. Decorate with maraschino cherries or slices of fresh pineapple or strawberries. Serves 6-8. ; name: captain d s batter dipped fish ; ingredients: pollock fillets, flour, dry yeast, egg, beer, hot water, salt, black pepper, cayenne pepper ; preparation:In a bowl mix the yeast and beer. In another bowl beat together the egg, hot water and salt. Add the egg mixture to the beer. Slowly beat in the flour until batter is consistency of light pancake batter. Roll or dust fish with flour. Drop fish into batter and cover thoroughly. Fry in hot oil. Drain on baking rack or broiling pan. ; name: sour cream and chive potato bake ; ingredients: potatoes, sour cream, cream, parmesan cheese, cheddar cheese, chives, salt and pepper ; preparation:

name: everyday banana cake ; ingredients: sugar, all-purpose flour, baking soda, water, banana, mayonnaise, cinnamon, salt, walnuts ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease cupcake, 9 x 13, or 2 layer pans. Dump all ingredients into large bowl. Mix by hand using a wire whisk or wooden spoon just until the dry ingredients are combined. Do not overmix. If using walnuts, mix with a teaspoon of flour and then fold into batter. Bake 350 degrees about 30 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool on wire rack and frost with favorite frosting, if desired. ; name: summer spanish sangria get the party started ; ingredients: peach, lemon, lime, orange, rum, white sugar, dry red wine, orange juice ; preparation:Have the fruit, rum, wine, and orange juice well chilled. Slice the lemon, lime and orange into thin rounds and place in a large glass pitcher. Pour in the rum and sugar. Chill in refrigerator for 2 hours to develop the flavors. When ready to serve, crush the fruit lightly with a wooden spoon and stir in the wine and orange juice. Adjust sweetness to taste. ; name: quick n easy curried shrimp ; ingredients: butter, curry powder, onion, celery, garlic, fresh shrimp, all-purpose flour, sour cream, whipping cream ; preparation:In a large non-stick fry pan, melt butter, stir in curry powder and cook and stir for 5 minutes to develop flavor of the curry powder. Add the onion, celery and garlic. Cook and stir until onion is softened. Add shrimp and cook for 3 to 4 minutes until shrimp have turned pink and are almost cooked. Stir in the flour until it has been absorbed. Add sour cream and whipping cream, stirring all the time until mixture comes to a boil and thickens. Seve immediately over rice. ; name: quick berry crisp ; ingredients: berries, farina, sugar, baking powder, salt, egg, vanilla, butter ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 375f. Butter a round, 2-quart baking dish and pour in the fruit. Mix the farina, sugar, baking powder and salt together in a medium bowl. Beat the egg with the vanilla and add it to the farina mixture. Mix well with a fork or finger. Sprinkle the topping evenly over the fruit and pour the butter evenly over it. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until the top is lightly brown. Serve warm or at room temperature. ; name: slap yo mama pancakes ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, baking powder, sugar, salt, eggs, milk, water, vegetable oil ; preparation:Sift flour and baking powder together. Add remaining ingredients to flour mixture. And whisk togetether until smooth. Add to hot griddle or heavy skillet and cook until golden brown. For the small family or just smaller batches recipe can be done in half, and will make approx 9 small pancakes. ; name: fire baked bananas ; ingredients: bananas, cream, amarula cream liqueur, dark baking chocolate, walnuts, honey ; preparation:Heat up the bar-b-que grill. Whip the cream until stiff peaks are formed. Fold the amarula liqueur into the mixture. Cover and refrigerate until needed. Over medium coals place the bananas, still in peel, onto the grill. Heat bananas until the peel turns black. Remove the bananas from the grill and split the skin of the banana open. In a saucepan, melt the chocolate over medium heat. Once melted, add the walnuts and honey stirring constantly. Pour chocolate sauce over bananas and top with whipped cream mixture. ; name: crunchy trail mix ; ingredients: corn chex, rice chex, pretzel, almonds, raisins, cinnamon, sugar-free syrup, vegetable oil, vanilla extract ; preparation:Preheat oven to 325 degrees f. In large bowl, combine cereal, pretzels, almonds, raisins and cinnamon. Mix well. In small bowl, combine syrup, oil and vanilla. Slowly pour over cereal mixture. Stir will to coat evenly. Spread on 15x10-inch baking ban coated with vegetable cooking spray. Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until golden brown, stirring frequently. Cool. Store in airtight container. ; name: two sisters chicken salad ; ingredients: cooked chicken, celery, onion, salt, lemon juice, seedless grapes, mayonnaise, mandarin oranges, toasted almond, romaine lettuce ; preparation:

name: bell pepper relish ; ingredients: red bell peppers, green bell peppers, onions, sugar, white vinegar, celery seeds, salt ; preparation:Grind or otherwise process peppers and onions into finely chopped, even mushy, consistency. Cover with boiling water and let stand 10 minutes. Drain well. Save juice to add to vinegar mixture if needed to cover vegetables. Add sugar, vinegar, celery seed and salt. Boil 15 minutes. Pour into sterilized canning jars and seal. ; name: simmered sirloin with gravy ; ingredients: boneless beef top sirloin steaks, onion, sliced mushrooms, garlic, butter, beef stock, worcestershire sauce, all-purpose flour, cold water ; preparation:In large nonstick skillet, cook beef, onions, mushrooms and garlic in butter over medium heat for 5-7 minutes or until meat is brown and no longer pink. Add the beef broth, worcestershire sauce and bring to boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for one hour. Combine flour and water until smooth. Add to beef mixture. Bring to a boil. Cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened. ; name: eleanor s oven fried haddock ; ingredients: milk, haddock fillets, fine dry breadcrumb, parmesan cheese, thyme, butter, paprika ; preparation:Preheat oven to 525 degrees. Add salt to milk. Cut filets into serving pieces, dip into milk, then in the bread crumbs, cheese and thyme. Arrange fish in well-greased dish and pour butter over evenly. Bake on top rack 12 minutes. Garnish with paprika. Serve with lemon slices. ; name: keema style curry ; ingredients: oil, green pepper, onion, salt, ground black pepper, ground cumin, garam masala, ground cinnamon, ground beef, tomatoes ; preparation:Heat the oil in a large pan and lightly fry the peppers for 1 min, remove them from the pan. Fry the onions till golden, add the salt, pepper and all of the spices, stir and fry for 2 minutes. Add the meat to the pan and cook for 15 minutes. Stir in the peppers and cook for 10 minutes. Serve with the tomatoes as a garnish. ; name: brown swedish cookies ; ingredients: butter, white sugar, honey, flour, baking soda ; preparation:Cream together butter, sugar and honey. Then add flour and baking soda to make dough. Roll the dough into small balls and place on a baking sheet. Use a cookie press or the bottom of a drinking glass dipped in sugar to flatten the dough balls. Pre-heat an oven to 300f. Bake cookies for about 10 minutes. When cookies are light brown, remove from oven and place on a wire rack to cool. ; name: crock pot ham cola ; ingredients: brown sugar, dry mustard, prepared horseradish, cola, ham ; preparation:Thoroughly combine brown sugar, mustard and horseradish. Moisten with enough cola to make a smooth paste. Reserve remaining cola. Run entire ham with mixture. Place in crock pot and add remaining cola. Cover and cook on high for one hour. Turn to low setting for 6-7 hours. ; name: curried string green beans ; ingredients: onion, oil, garlic cloves, string beans, tomatoes, tomato paste, curry powder, sugar, salt and pepper ; preparation:Saut onion in oil until lightly browned. Add garlic and saut briefly. Add remaining ingredients. Add water to just barely cover string beans. Mix well. Partially cover and cook on low flame for approximately 40 minutes, until string beans are tender and liquid is partially absorbed. ; name: milo choc chip cookies ; ingredients: butter, brown sugar, eggs, vanilla essence, self-raising flour, chocolate chips, milo ; preparation:

name: slow cooker creamy chicken noodle soup ; ingredients: condensed cream of chicken soup, condensed cream of mushroom soup, chicken, frozen mixed vegetables, seasoned pepper, egg noodles ; preparation:In a 3. 5-4 quart slow cooker gradually stir 5 cups water into the soup. Stir or whisk till smooth. Stir in chicken, vegetables, and seasoned pepper. Cover. Cook on low-heat setting for 6-8 hours or high-heat setting for 3-4 hours. If using low-heat setting, turn to high-heat setting. Stir in noodles. Cover and cook for 20 to 30 minutes more or until noodles are just tender. ; name: tortilla tomato soup ; ingredients: olive oil, tomatoes, onion, corn tortillas, jalapeno, cilantro, chicken stock, salt and pepper ; preparation:Saute tomatoes, onion, tortillas, jalapenos, cilantro in olive oil in heavy pot. Cook until tortillas and tomatoes are soft. Add chicken stock and seasonings. Bring to boil and reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Pureee soup in small batches using either a blender or imulsion type tool in the pan. Strain. Pour back in pan and reheat. Serve with crispy tortilla strips, sliced avacado, grated cheese. ; name: buttered noodles with garlic and sun dried tomatoes ; ingredients: egg noodles, butter, garlic cloves, sun-dried tomatoes packed in oil, tomato paste, fresh parsley, salt and pepper ; preparation:Melt butter in small sauce pan. Add garlic and cook under low heat for about five minutes. Add tomatoes and tomato paste and stir until well blended. Combine noodles, sauce and chopped parsley in a large bowl. Toss until well mixed. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately. ; name: tasty sausage patties ; ingredients: sausage meat, spring onions, minced meat, fresh pineapple, salt, thyme, sage, flour, parsley ; preparation:Pre-heat grill. Finely dice the spring onions. Add them to a bowl with sausage meat, ground beef, pineapple, salt, thyme and sage, mixing well. Shape into patties approximately 6 cm in size. Mix together the flour and finely chopped parsley on a plate and coat each patty. Grill for about 4 minutes until golden. Lower the heat and cook for a further 6-8 minutes. ; name: pancake syrup increaser ; ingredients: granulated sugar, brown sugar, water, maple extract, vanilla ; preparation:In a large saucepan combine the white sugar, brown sugar and water. Bring to a boil, lower heat and simmer stirring for 3 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla and maple extract. Cool to almost room temperature then add to your bottle of store-bought syrup. Seal tightly and refrigerate. This will last as long as your bottled pancake syrup. ; name: hot olive cheese puffs ; ingredients: sharp cheddar cheese, butter, all-purpose flour, salt, paprika, pimento stuffed olives ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 400f. To make dough, blend the cheese with the butter. Stir in the flour, salt, and paprika. Mix well. Wrap 1 teaspoon of dough around each olive overlapping completely. Bake until light brown, 12 to 15 minutes. ; name: honey i m home bread ; ingredients: milk, honey, egg, bread flour, butter, salt, instant yeast ; preparation:Put these ingredients in your bread machine as your model of machine calls for, and let the machine do the work to mix. I let it rise once then take it out and knead a little on the cutting board. Put in greased loaf pan to raise again. When raised as much as you want, put in 325 degree oven for 30 to 35 minutes, or until center is 190. Let cool. ; name: white cranberry peach banana smoothie ; ingredients: cranberry-peach juice, banana, vanilla yogurt, ice ; preparation:

name: pear yeast bread bread machine ; ingredients: pear halves, almond extract, butter, brown sugar, salt, ground cinnamon, ground nutmeg, bread flour, active dry yeast ; preparation:In a blender or food processor, combine the pears and extract. Cover and process until pureed. Pour into bread machine pan. Add the remaining ingredients in order suggested by manufacturer. Select basic bread setting. Choose crust color and loaf size if available. Bake according to bread machine directions. ; name: easy stuffed meatballs ; ingredients: ground beef, evaporated milk, stove top stuffing mix, cream of mushroom soup, ketchup, worcestershire sauce ; preparation:Mix stove-top mix as directed. Mix ground beef with evaporated milk. Form into thin patties about 3 to 4 inches in diameter. Place a spoonful of prepared stuffing in center of each patty, then form into meatball. Place meatballs in oven-proof glass pan. Combine mushroom soup, ketchup and worcestershire sauce and pour over meatballs. Bake uncovered 350 degrees f. 1 hour. ; name: maple beans from quebec ; ingredients: dry white beans, pork fat, onions, maple syrup, molasses, tomato paste, black pepper, salt, mustard powder, water ; preparation:Wash the beans and drain. Set aside. In a big oven-proof saucepan, melt the pork lard. Add onions and cook at medium heat, stirring, 2 to 3 minutes or until soften. Add maple syrup, molasses, tomato paste, pepper, salt and mustard powder. Stir. Add the beans and cover with water. Cover and cook in a preheated oven of 250 f overnight or at 350 f for at least 7 hours. ; name: potato burgers ; ingredients: onion, potatoes, whole wheat flour, water ; preparation:Mix all ingredients in a bowl. Ladle onto non stick pan at medium heat. Form into burger size and thickness. Cook for 8-10 minutes, flip and cook 5-8 minutes. Use a food processor to grate potato and onion. Onion will be gooy but this is ok. ; name: tunisian potato olive salad ; ingredients: baby potatoes, salt, sugar, paprika, cumin, cayenne pepper, garlic cloves, oil-cured black olives, extra virgin olive oil, lemon, juice of ; preparation:Place the potatoes in a pot with water to cover. Add 1 teaspoon salt and the sugar. Bring to a boil over high heat then reduce heat and simmer for about 15 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender. Drain the potatoes, return them to the pan and shake in the dry pan for a few minutes, until thoroughly dry. Cut the potatoes into thick slices, several per potato, or into quarters. Place in a bowl and toss with the cumin, paprika, cayenne, garlic and olives. Dress with the olive oil, lemon juice and salt. Refrigerate until ready to serve, or serve at room temperature. ; name: gingersnap oatmeal ; ingredients: old-fashioned oatmeal, skim milk, water, molasses, ground ginger, ground cinnamon, ground cloves, vanilla extract, kosher salt ; preparation:In a small pot, heat oatmeal, skim milk, and water over medium heat. As oatmeal mixture is warming, add all the other ingredients. Stir thoroughly to combine. Let cook until most of the liquid is absorbed, and the oatmeal reaches yknow an oatmealy consistency. Serve warm. ; name: cabbage and sausages braised in beer ; ingredients: butter, kielbasa, mustard, beer, cabbage, salt and pepper ; preparation:Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the sausages and brown on all sides, about 5 minutes. Add the beer and mustard and simmer until slightly reduced, about 3 minutes. Add the cabbage, stir to combine, cover and simmer for 5 minutes. Stir again and cook for an additional 2-4 minutes until the cabbage is wilted but still green. Season with salt and pepper to taste. ; name: noel pecan logs ; ingredients: powdered sugar, marshmallow cream, vanilla, caramels, margarine, pecans ; preparation:

name: italian rice and peas ; ingredients: fresh peas, long grain rice, onion, celery, dry white wine, boiling water, chicken stock cubes, butter, parmesan cheese, salt and pepper ; preparation:Melt 2 oz of butter in a saucepan. Add chopped onion and celery, cook until just translucent. Add rice, cook a few minutes more, stirring to coat the rice with butter. Add wine, 1 cup of boiling water and crumbled stock cubes. Bring to a boil, add peas. Reduce heat, simmer uncovered until the water has evaporated. Add another cup of boiling water, cook until evaporated. Add the final cup of boiling water. Keep cooking until the water is almost absorbed. Overall cooking time is about 20 minutes. Stir in the parmesan cheese and 1 oz butter. Add salt& pepper to taste. ; name: molded corned beef spread ; ingredients: cream cheese, corned beef, dijon mustard, prepared horseradish, mayonnaise ; preparation:Spray mold of your choice with non-stick cooking spray. In food processor, combine cream cheese, corned beef, mustard, horseradish and mayonnaise. Pulse until all ingredients are fully combined, then pour into mold. Chill the mold least 6 hours. To serve, unmold onto serving dish and line with crackers to serve. ; name: strawberry pasta ; ingredients: fresh strawberries, spaghetti, parmesan cheese, butter, heavy cream, mint sprig ; preparation:Pure strawberries in blender. Drain to remove seeds. Cook spaghetti according to package. Drain and toss with cheese. Heat butter and cream in a small saucepan. Place pasta in a sealable container, then add strawberries, followed by the butter sauce. Serve with additional cheese and garnish with mint, if desired. ; name: sugarplums ; ingredients: whole almonds, honey, orange zest, ground cinnamon, ground allspice, nutmeg, dried apricot, dates, almond oil, icing sugar ; preparation:Preheat oven to 180c. Place nuts on a baking tray and toast in the oven for about 10 minutes, then cool. Process nuts in a food processor until quite fine, but not to dust. Add remaining ingredients except the oil and the icing sugar. Pulse a few times to mix. Turn mix into a bowl and rub your hands with a little of the oil. Pinch of walnut sized pieces and roll into balls. Sift the icing sugar over the rolled balls, enough to coat well. Store in an airtight container. Refrigerate in hot weather. ; name: hostess peas with mushrooms ; ingredients: frozen peas, onion, sliced mushrooms, butter, flour, half-and-half, salt, black pepper, sugar ; preparation:Cook peas according to package directions and drain. Saute onion and mushrooms in butter. Blend in flour and gradually add half and half, stirring constantly. Cook until thick. Add remaining ingredients, mix lightly and heat through. Stir occasionally. ; name: healthy salad ; ingredients: artichokes, cucumbers, cilantro leaf, laughing cow cheese, cherry tomatoes, pita bread, lemon juice, olive oil, ground black pepper, chives ; preparation:1preheat the oven 325 degrees f. Toast the pita cubes for five minutes. Let it cool completely. 2in a salad bowl, combine the baby cucumbers, canned artichokes, cilantro, cherry tomatoes, and cheese and toss. Add the pita cubes, which should not be hot or it will melt some of the cheese and warm the vegetables, which should not happen. 3in a small bowl combine the lemon juice, olive oil, black pepper and chives. Add to the salad and combine well. 4refrigerate for 30 minutes before serving. ; name: golden banana punch ; ingredients: water, sugar, bananas, frozen orange juice, frozen lemonade, pineapple juice, ginger ale ; preparation:Combine water and sugar. Heat until sugar is dissolved and then cool. Blend bananas and lemonade in blender. Combine all ingredients except ginger ale. Freeze mixture in freezer bags. Set frozen mixture out 2-3 hours to thaw before ready to serve. Add chilled ginger ale when ready to serve. Serves 20. ; name: spinach cheese casserole ; ingredients: frozen spinach, onion, garlic cloves, butter, eggs, low fat cottage cheese, all-purpose flour, low-fat sharp cheddar cheese, salt and pepper ; preparation:

name: cornish game hens with pineapple pepper sauce ; ingredients: cornish hens, cornstarch, dry mustard, water, red wine vinegar, honey, soy sauce, pineapple chunks in juice, green bell pepper, red bell pepper ; preparation:Remove giblets. Rinse hens inside and out. Pat dry. Cut each hen in half lengthwise. Place skin side up on broiler pan or in shallow roasting pan. Broil 4 to 6 inches from heat 8 to 10 minutes or until skin is crisp. Drain. Heat oven to 325 degrees f. Place halves skin side up in ungreased 13x9 inch baking dish. In medium bowl, combine remaining ingredients. Spoon over hens. Bake 45 to 50 minutes or until tender, basting occasionally. ; name: spruiten puree puree of brussels sprouts ; ingredients: brussels sprouts, water, salt, nutmeg, heavy cream ; preparation:Trim and wash brussels sprouts. Cook until tender in salted water. Press brussels sprouts through a sieve or whirl in a blender. Or place in food processor and pulse till coarsely chopped if you would like some texture. Add 1 teaspoons. Salt and the nutmeg. Stir in cream. Reheat if necessary, and serve with chicken or fish. Makes 4 servings. ; name: cheap and easy swedish meatballs dinner ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, garlic cloves, fresh basil, bay leaves, red wine, brown gravy mix, cold water, sliced mushrooms, turkey meatballs ; preparation:Saut onions in olive oil on a medium high heat, let cook for about 5 minutes than add garlic and cook for another 2 minutes or until onions and translucent. Add can of mushrooms, red wine, basil and bay leaves. Let simmer for 5 minutes. Mix cold water and gravy mix per instructions on package and add to pan. Add meatballs and let simmer until gravy thickens to lightly coat the back of a spoon. Serve with plain white rice or buttered noodles. ; name: grilled pizza sandwich ; ingredients: bread, pizza sauce, mozzarella cheese, pepperoni slice, butter ; preparation:For each sandwich butter outside of bread. Lay in pan, butter side down. On top of bread, spread pizza sauce, 1 ounce of mozzarella cheese, thin pepperoni slices and more pizza sauce. Add another slice of bread, buttered side up. Cook until brown on both sides and cheese melts. ; name: cheesy beans rice ; ingredients: velveeta reduced fat cheese product, diced tomatoes, black beans, instant rice, tortillas, sour cream ; preparation:Gather up all ingredients, a knife, a can opener, measuring cups, a crock pot, and a spoon. Turn crock pot on high. Cube velveeta. Add all ingredients except tortillas to crock pot. Simmer until cheese is melted, stirring regularly. Warm tortillas. Add sour cream if desired and spoon into tortillas. ; name: foothills blackberry muffins ; ingredients: flour, brown sugar, baking powder, blackberry, milk, vegetable oil, egg, yogurt ; preparation:Mix flour, sugar, and baking powder in a large bowl. Add the berries and toss to coat them. In a smaller bowl, whisk together milk, oil, egg, and yogurt. Stir into dry ingredients, just until moistened. Divide evenly into a jumbo muffin pan, lightly greased. Bake at 350 degrees for 20- 25 minutes, or until they test done. ; name: cinnamon apple oatmeal ; ingredients: old fashioned oats, water, apple juice, dried apples, ground cinnamon, salt, pure maple syrup, flax seed oil, walnuts ; preparation:Place all the ingreients except the maple syrup, flaxseed oil, and nuts in a medium saucepan and stir to combine. Bring to a boil. Cover and reduce heat to low. Simmer for 5 minutes, stirring once or twice. Remove from heat and let sit, covered, for 2 to 5 minutes. Stir in maple syrup and flaxseed oil, if using. Sprinkle one tablespoon nuts over each serving, if desired. ; name: healthy spinach and cannellini bean dip ; ingredients: extra virgin olive oil, garlic cloves, spinach, cannellini beans, lemon juice, balsamic vinegar, salt, ground black pepper ; preparation:

name: cos salad boats ; ingredients: cos lettuce, avocados, plum tomatoes, alfalfa sprouts, eggs, mayonnaise, water, dijon mustard, fresh dill, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Arrange the salad leaves on a large platter with the edges facing up so that they look like boats. Combine the avocados, tomatoes, and sprouts in a bowl, then fill each of the salad leaves with this mixture. Sprinkle each one with some chopped egg. Whisk all the salad dressing ingredients together in a small bowl. Check and adjust the seasoning to taste, then spoon over salad and serve at once. ; name: cheesy twice stuffed baked potatoes ; ingredients: baking potatoes, sour cream, roquefort cheese, green onions with tops, paprika, salt and pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425f. Wash, dry potatoes, bake until soft. About 45-60 minutes. Cut a slice from the top of each potato being careful not to break skin. Scoop out insides. Mash well. Beat in sour cream, cheese, salt and pepper. If necessary, add more sour cream to make light and fluffy. Stir in onions. Spoon mixture back into shells. Place potatoes on a baking sheet. Dust tops with paprika and return to oven until lightly browned. ; name: chicken jerusalem ; ingredients: chicken thighs, butter, green onions, white wine, water, mushroom, salt, artichoke hearts, parmesan cheese ; preparation:In a large skillet, melt butter. Brown chicken pieces. Add green onions, water and wine. Simmer for 45 minutes. Add the mushrooms, salt, and artichoke hearts. Simmer for an additional 15 minutes. Before serving top with grated parmesan cheese. ; name: menemen ; ingredients: potatoes, white onion, green bell peppers, tomatoes, eggs, salt, nutmeg, frying oil ; preparation:Wash potatoes thoroughly, dry, peel and dice small. Dice onion and peppers into very small pieces. Beat eggs slightly in a pan and set aside. Skin tomatoes and cut into very small pieces. Heat oil in deep frying pan. Add onion and peppers, and saute until soft. Add potatoes and cook until crisp. Add tomatoes and let cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir salt into frying mixture and mix well. Add beaten eggs quickly into frying pan, stir briskly and cook until hardened uniformly. Place over toasted bread slices immediately. Grate a few shavings of nutmeg. ; name: super cheap yogurt pasta ; ingredients: dry pasta, greek yogurt, garlic clove, of fresh mint, salt, pepper ; preparation:Boil water. Add pasta and boil following packet directions. Remove from heat, strain and place back in the pot. Finely dice garlic and mint. Add the yoghurt, garlic, mint, salt and pepper to the pot and stir. Place pot back onto low heat and the moment it starts to simmer, turn it off and serve. ; name: peanut butter bars taste like reese s cups ; ingredients: powdered sugar, butter, peanut butter, graham cracker crumbs, milk chocolate chips ; preparation:Mix together powdered sugar, butter, peanut butter and graham cracker crumbs. Line cookie sheet with parchment paper. Pat the peanut butter mixture on to the parchment paper. Melted chocolate chips in microwave 20 sec at time stir and microwave more until melted. Pour over peanut butter mixture. Refrigerate till set and cut into bars. ; name: spanish rice oamc ; ingredients: cumin, chili powder, salt and pepper, low sodium chicken broth, brown rice, onion, garlic, green bell pepper ; preparation:In a large saucepan bring the broth, rice, onion, garlic and bell peppers to a to a boil. Add the rest of the spices to the saucepan and stir. Cover. Reduce heat to simmer and cook until rice is fluffy and tender. Remove pan from heat and allow the contents to cool. Place cooked rice mixture into a 1 gallon freezer bag. Gently squeeze out any air then seal the bag. Place the filled bag into a 2nd freezer bag and with this printed recipe and seal it. Thaw and reheat rice in the microwave. ; name: salt cod with scrambled eggs ; ingredients: salt cod fish, bacon, green pepper, tomatoes, eggs, black pepper ; preparation:

name: walt disney world s glazed almonds ; ingredients: butter, egg whites, salt, sugar, almonds, cinnamon ; preparation:Place butter on 15- x 10-inch jellyroll pan and heat in 325f oven until butter melts, about 7 minutes. Meanwhile, beat egg whites with dash of salt until frothy, then gradually add sugar, beating to stiff peaks. Gently fold in almonds and cinnamon. Pour almond mixture into jellyroll pan and stir, coating with butter. Bake, stirring every 10 minutes, until almonds are crisp, about 40 minutes. Serve warm or at room temperature. ; name: grilled bacon and bleu sandwiches ; ingredients: cream cheese, blue cheese, bacon, italian salad dressing, rye bread ; preparation:Combine cream cheese, blue cheese, bacon and 2 tablespoons italian dressing. Spread cheese mixture evenly onto 4 bread slices. Top with remaining bread. Brush sandwiches on both sides with remaining italian dressing. Grill sandwiches in non-stick skillet over medium heat until golden brown on both sides and filling is melted. ; name: parmesan garlic breadsticks ; ingredients: biscuit mix, parmesan cheese, butter, garlic powder, milk ; preparation:Combine first 4 ingredients in a large bowl. Stir in milk until blended. Roll dough into a 10 x 9 inch rectangle on a floured surface. Cut dough into 10 strips. Place on a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake at 400 for 13 to 15 minutes. ; name: chocolate old fashioned pie ; ingredients: 9 inch pie shell, sugar, salt, cornstarch, flour, cocoa powder, butter, milk, vanilla extract ; preparation:Bake pie crust according to directions and let cool. Combine all remaining ingredients in a large pot and heat to a simmer, stirring constantly until thickened. Remove pan from burner and place a piece of plastic wrap directly on top of chocolate filling. Let pan stand until cool. Spoon filling into pie crust. Serve with whipped cream. ; name: honey nut cake ; ingredients: hazelnuts, dried apple, honey, eggs ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 175c. Finely chop the hazelnuts and apple. Mix the nuts, apple and. Honey in a bowl. Whisk in the eggs. Spread the mixture into a large circle on a greased baking tray. Bake on the middle shelf for approximately 15 minutes. ; name: quick chocolate chip scones ; ingredients: flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, baking soda, egg, skim milk, lemon juice, butter, chocolate chips ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f. Place wax paper on a large baking sheet. Combine dry ingredients in a large bowl. Combine other ingredients in a second bowl. Blend the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients. Add chocolate chips. Drop by large spoonfuls onto the baking sheet. Bake 15 minutes. ; name: curried shrimp with brown rice ; ingredients: shrimp, onion, garlic, frozen green pea, chicken broth, curry paste, cooked brown rice, sesame oil ; preparation:Coat a large, nonstick skillet with cooking spray and preheat over medium heat. Add the shrimp, onion and garlic and cook, stirring frequently, for about 4 minutes or until shrimp turn pink and are thoroughly cooked. Add the peas, broth and curry paste, reduce heat to medium. Cover and cook for a minute or two or just until the peas are thawed and heated through. Add the rice and sesame oil. Toss the mixture gently over medium heat for a minute or two or until heated through. Add more broth if mixture seems too dry. Serve hot. ; name: roasted eggplant dip with thai flavors ; ingredients: eggplant, palm sugar, soy sauce, salt, chili paste, lime juice, fresh cilantro, green onions, cilantro leaf ; preparation:

name: peanut butter and jelly smoothie ; ingredients: creamy peanut butter, jelly, milk, vanilla ice cream ; preparation:Combine peanut butter and jelly. Place in blender container. Add milk and ice cream. Cover. Blend until smooth. Pour into tall glass. Serve immediately. ; name: easy swiss apple pie ; ingredients: egg, sugar, flour, baking powder, salt, apple, nuts ; preparation:In a bowl mix together egg and sugar. Add flour, baking powder, salt, apple, and nuts. Fold into a greased pie plate. Bake at 350 for 25-30 minutes. Serve with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream. ; name: baked old fashioned rice pudding ; ingredients: long grain rice, evaporated milk, butter, sugar, water ; preparation:Boil rice until done. Place cooked rice in a baking dish. Add milk, water, butter, sugar. Stir all of it together and bake until done about 1 hr at 350 degrees. The water measurement is done with the can from the milk so 1 cup is a guess. ; name: lemon grilled salmon or chicken ; ingredients: dill weed, lemon-pepper seasoning, salt, garlic powder, brown sugar, chicken broth, olive oil, soy sauce, salmon ; preparation:Combine all ingredients except the salmon or chicken in a container that can be sealed. Mix together well. Add the salmom or chicken and marinate at least 1 hour, turning once. Drain and discard marinade. Place salmon skin side down on grill for 15-20 minutes. You may also broil salmon or chicken for 20-30 minutes. ; name: solo chicken mushroom pilaf ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, diced onion, canned mushrooms, uncooked rice, chicken broth, butter, olive oil ; preparation:Melt the butter with the olive oil in a frying pan that has a tight fitting lid. Add the diced onion and saute until nearly transparent. Dice the chicken breast and add to the pan, stirring until all sides of the meat have turned white. Add the uncooked rice and stir until all of the grains are covered with the cooking fat. Add the mushrooms, and stir. Add the chicken broth, stir and bring up the heat until the liquid starts to simmer. Put on the cover, reduce the heat to the minimum setting and set your timer for 15 minutes and walk away. Do not peek. After 15 minutes, turn off the heat, do not peek and set your time for another 15 minutes, and walk away. Fluff with fork or spoon. Service options might include a small side salad and a cool beverage. ; name: candy coated carrots ; ingredients: baby carrots, butter, brown sugar, lemon juice, hot pepper sauce, salt ; preparation:Cook carrots to crisp tender, drain. Set carrots aside and keep warm. In same pan cook butter and sugar until bubbly. Stir in lemon juice, hot sauce and salt. Return carrots and heat through. ; name: fried scallops chinese style ; ingredients: scallops, rice wine vinegar, salt and pepper, cornstarch, salt, egg, fine breadcrumbs, oil ; preparation:Wash scallops pat dry with paper towel. Mix together marinade and let scallops stand in marinade for 15 minutes. Combine cornstarch and salt in a plastic bag. Shake several scallops in bag dip in egg then in bread crumbs. Heat oil in wok to 350. Lower heat some and lower scallops into oil and fry until brown about 2 minutes. Drain on paper towels. ; name: roasted asparagus shiitake mushrooms ; ingredients: fresh asparagus, shiitake mushroom, extra virgin olive oil, coarse salt, balsamic vinegar, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:

name: pasta with shrimp in garlic sauce fideos con gambas ; ingredients: olive oil, salt, spaghetti, garlic clove, baby shrimp, fresh lemon juice, veal, red chili pepper, fresh parsley ; preparation:Bring pot of water to boil with 1 tablespoon oil and salt. Add the spaghetti and stir occasionally with fork. Cook until tender, but still firm. Drain, return to pot, mix in another tablespoon oil, and keep warm. Heat the last tablespoon of oil in skillet and add the garlic. Just as the garlic starts to turn color, add the shrimp. Stir for about 2 minutes until the shrimps turn pink. Add the lemon juice, broth, red pepper, parsley and dash of salt. Cook for one more minute. Mix in noodles and serve once noddles are hot. ; name: stuffed vegetables ; ingredients: mushrooms, tomatoes, zucchini, ground pork, onion, diced tomatoes, mozzarella cheese ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 375 degrees f. Prepare the vegetables for stuffing by removing the stalks of 4 of the mushrooms. Halve the tomatoes and discard the seeds. Halve 2 of the zucchini lengthwise and scoop out the centers with a spoon. Arrange the prepared vegetables on a greased baking sheet, season lightly with salt and pepper. Mince or grate the remaining 3 mushrooms and the leftover stems. Dice the remaining zucchini. Saute the ground pork with the onions over medium heat and add the minced mushrooms. Then add the diced zucchini plus the remaining centers. Cook until soft, then add the can of tomatoes and continue to cook until very little liquid is left, about 10 minutes. Pile the filling into the prepared vegetables on the baking sheet and sprinkle with mozzarella cheese. Bake for 35-45 minutes. ; name: hearty vegetable and sausage bake ; ingredients: new potato, sweet onion, smoked sausage, baby carrots, salt, pepper, margarine, garlic powder, dried thyme ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f and spray a 9x13-inch baking pan with cooking spray. Combine all ingredients except smoked sausage in a large zipper type plastic bag, mixing well. Place ingredients from bag into prepared pan, bake uncovered for 30 minutes. Add sausage to vegetables mixing well. Bake for 20 minutes or until potatoes are tender and golden browned. ; name: sauteed ripe plantains ; ingredients: plantains, butter, whole cloves, cinnamon sticks, brown sugar, hot sauce ; preparation:Peel ripe plantains and ensure the pulp is firm and smells sweet. Heat butter or margarine. Saute in at medium heat until browned about 10 minutes. Sprinkle with brown sugar, if desired. Serve immediately as a side dish or dessert. ; name: almond sugar cookies ; ingredients: flour, butter, sugar, milk, baking powder, almond extract, salt, eggs ; preparation:Cream butter and sugar. Add eggs and almond extract. Combine dry ingredients, add to sugar mixture. Drop onto cookie sheet. Bake 350 for 1012 minutes. ; name: lemon myrtle biscuits cookies ; ingredients: white sugar, butter, self raising flour, eggs, ground lemon myrtle ; preparation:Cream together sugar and butter. Add the eggs one at a time. Mix together the sifted flour and lemon myrtle. Once the eggs are combined stir in the flour and lemon myrtle mix until combined. Do not over mix the dough. Roll dough mixute into small balls about the size of a walnut. Place on to greased biscuit baking trays. With a floured fork, press each ball slightly. Bake in a moderate oven for 12 to 15 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on a tray. Store in an airtight container. ; name: tarragon shallot egg salad sandwich ; ingredients: eggs, sour cream, shallots, fresh tarragon, white wine vinegar, salt, black pepper, whole grain bread, baby spinach leaves, tomatoes ; preparation:Cover eggs with cold water by 1 inch in a 2-quart heavy saucepan and bring to a rolling boil, partially covered. Reduce heat to low and cook eggs, covered completely, 30 seconds. Remove pan from heat and let eggs stand in hot water, covered, 15 minutes. Transfer eggs with a slotted spoon to a bowl of ice and cold water and let stand 5 minutes. Peel eggs and finely chop. Stir together eggs and remaining salad ingredients in a bowl with a fork. Spoon egg salad onto bread and spread evenly. Top with favorite garnishes. ; name: coconut cream oatmeal ; ingredients: flaked coconut, morton lite salt, water, quick-cooking oats, fat-free sweetened condensed milk, coconut extract ; preparation:

name: capirotada ; ingredients: piloncillo cones, water, cinnamon sticks, green onions, french bread, soft margarine, raisins, pecans, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Combine water, piloncillos, cinnamon sticks and green onions in large pot or dutch oven. Bring to a boil and cook until the piloncillos are dissolved and the syrup is dark from the spices. Taste- you may want to add additional brown sugar or spices depending on your personal tastes. Remove from heat and take out onions and cinnamon sticks. Toast the french bread. Spread margarine liberally on both sides of toast. Layer toast, cheese, raisins, and nuts in 2 9x13 pans, repeating until both pans are full, ending with a layer of cheese, raisins and nuts. Pour the syrup over the top, dividing evenly between both pans, and making sure that all the bread is moistened. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 30 to 40 minutes. Serve hot or cold. Store in the refrigerator. ; name: kossman chicken rice ; ingredients: cream of chicken soup, cream of mushroom soup, water, rice, whole chicken, lipton onion soup mix ; preparation:Mix cream of chicken soup, cream of mushroom soup, water, and rice together. Put a layer of soup mixture in a baking dish. Add the chicken. Add the rice mixture. Sprinkle the top with the lipton onion soup mix. Cover with tin foil. Bake at 375 degrees fahrenheit for 2 hours. Uncover for the last 30 minutes of baking. ; name: rich topping for steaks or veal ; ingredients: cheddar cheese, tomato ketchup, sour cream, tabasco sauce, black pepper, grainy mustard, worcestershire sauce, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Mix first 7 ingredients with a fork. Roast or grill meat until nearly done as you like it. Spread the cheese mixture over each portion of meat. Sprinkle over the parmesan. Grill carefully -- watching -- until the cheese melts. Serve immediately on warmed plates. ; name: sugar free fudge with stevia ; ingredients: water, stevia powder, evaporated milk, unsweetened chocolate, nuts ; preparation:Put aluminum or plastic foil around an 8x8 pan with high rim. Butter foil and set pan aside. Combine water and stevia in a large saucepan. Put over medium heat and stir until stevia dissolves. Add in evaporated milk and clip candy thermometer to side of pan. Keep stirring until mixture boils and temperature reaches 235f. Take the pan off the heat and stop stirring. Let mixture cool to 110f, then stir in the grated chocolate until it melts. Beat the mixture with a wooden spoon or spatula until it thickens. When you start to hear popping noises while stirring, add in the nuts and stir until spread out evenly. Pour mixture into prepared pan and refrigerate for several hours until fudge has hardened. Cut into 1 inch squares and serve at room temperature. ; name: sesame bok choy ; ingredients: bok choy, green onion, ground ginger, rice wine, light soy sauce, brown sugar, canola oil, sesame seeds ; preparation:Wash bok choy. Cut stems and tops into about 1-inch pieces. In a large bowl, combine last 7 ingredients and mix well. Add bok choy to the dressing and toss to coat. Place in a hot wok or large pan and stir-fry over med-high heat for about 8 minutes or until desired tenderness is reached. ; name: ham hash browns casserole ; ingredients: frozen hash brown potatoes, cream of mushroom soup, ham, dried thyme, sharp cheddar cheese, sour cream, onion, french-fried onions ; preparation:Pre-heat oven to 350f. In a bowl, add all ingredients and mix until well combined. Pour into a 13x9 casserole dish. Bake for 1 hour or until top is slightly golden. Sprinkle top with french fried onions and bake an additional 10 minutes or until golden brown. ; name: scallop saute ; ingredients: butter, onions, garlic, salt, pepper, bay scallops, fresh parsley, red pepper flakes, lemon juice ; preparation:Heat butter in 12in skillet. Add onion, garlic, salt and pepper. Stir and saute 1 minute. Add scallops. Stir and saute 4-6 minutes, until scallops are opaque. Add parsley, red pepper flakes, and lemon, heat through. ; name: chicken saffron risotto low fat ; ingredients: arborio rice, chicken stock, chicken breasts, leek, saffron strands, lemon, zest of, lemon juice, frozen peas ; preparation:

name: khumbi aur besan kibhaji ; ingredients: white mushrooms, cooking oil, garlic, salt, chili powder, coriander, lemon juice, besan flour, water ; preparation:Wash mushrooms and cut them in quarters. Heat the oil on a medium heatand add the garlic. Allow the garlic to turn slightly brown and add the mushrooms. Stir and and cook for 2 minutes. Add the salt, chilli and coriander stir and cook for 1 minute. Add the lemon juice and mix well. Sprinkle the flour over the mushroom mixture, stir and mix immediately. Cook for a few seconds then add water mix well till you have a nice sauce. ; name: malaga gazpacho ; ingredients: tomatoes, cucumbers, green pepper, garlic clove, water, extra virgin olive oil, sherry wine vinegar, salt, white bread ; preparation:Combine all the ingredients in the container of an electric blender. Blend at high speed, pausing now and then to scrape down with a rubber spatula as necessary. Pour the mixture through a large strainer placed inside a mixing bowl. Press and stir with a wooden spoon to extract as much liquid as possible. Discard the solids. Taste soup for seasoning and add more salt if desired. Chill thoroughly, as much as 24 hours, before serving. ; name: shrimp in mustard sauce ; ingredients: butter, large shrimp, garlic clove, shallots, all-purpose flour, dry white wine, chicken broth, dijon mustard, salt and pepper ; preparation:In a large skillet, melt 1 tbs butter over medium high heat.
