Add the shrimp and garlic. Cook, tossing, until the shrimp starts to turn pink on the outside but is stil translucent on the inside, about 2 min. Transfer to a plate and set aside. Reduce the heat to medium and in the same skillet, melt the remaining butter. Add the shallot and cook until softened, 1-2 minute. Add the flour and cook for 30 secs, whisking constantly. Gradually add the wine, broth, and mustard - whisking constantly. Simmer until it is as thick as heavy cream, about 5 minute. Return the shrimp to the skillet. Bring to a simmer and cook until the shrimp are opaque throughout, about 2 minute. Season with salt and pepper to taste. ; name: sausage stroganoff korv stroganoff ; ingredients: smoked sausage, yellow onions, paprika, butter, tomato puree, mustard, bouillon cube, water, salt & pepper, sour cream ; preparation:Slice sausage into strips. In a skillet, brown over high heat. Add chopped onion and paprika to the skillet. Add tomato puree, mustard, bouillon cube, and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to simmer and let simmer briefly over low heat. Season with pepper and salt to taste. Garnish with sour cream just before serving. Serve with rice. ; name: orange rice and barley pilaf ; ingredients: fresh orange juice, chicken broth, long grain brown rice, barley, dry white wine, dried thyme, salt, fresh ground black pepper, parsley, walnuts ; preparation:In a saucepan over med-high heat, bring orange juice and broth to a boil. Stir in rice and barley. Add in wine, thyme, salt, and pepper. Decrease heat to low and simmer, covered, until liquid is absorbed and rice and barley are tender, about 55-60 minutes. Add in parsley and nuts. Fluff with a fork. Serve. ; name: turkey cranberry bites ; ingredients: light mayonnaise, honey mustard, pepper, turkey breast, celery, fresh parsley, dried cranberries, swiss cheese, walnuts, miniature phyllo cups ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Measure mayo, mustard and black pepper into bowl. Add chopped turkey, chopped celery, chopped parsley, chopped cranberries, shredded cheese, and walnuts. Stir to combine. Spoon into mini phyllo cups and bake for 12 to 15 minutes until heated through. ; name: great brats when you can t grill ; ingredients: bratwurst, beer, onion, hot dog buns, mustard ; preparation:Slice onion and place in 9 to 10 inch skillet. Pour in bottle of beer. Add brats and simmer until onion is tender and brats are firm and cooked through. When beer has evaporated, allow brats and onions to brown while turning frequently, adding a little oil if the pan needs it. When the onions turn golden, remove. When the brats are browned on all sides, plate them. Wrap the buns in paper towels and microwave on high for about 30 seconds until soft and warm. Serve with baked beans and or chips. ; name: chicken and cheese pie ; ingredients: chicken breasts, cooked rice, cream of chicken soup, sharp cheddar cheese ; preparation:

name: ramen skillet supper ; ingredients: lean ground beef, water, oriental-flavor instant ramen noodles, stir-fry sauce, frozen broccoli carrots cauliflower mix ; preparation:Brown meat in large skillet. Drain. Add water and 1 of the seasoning packs, stir fry sauce, and frozen veggies. Mix well. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low cover and cook for 5 minutes or until veggies are tender. Break up the noodles and add to the skillet. Cover, cook 5 to 8 minutes or until sauce is as thick as you like it. Stir occasionally separating noodles. Any stir fry or mixed type veggies that you like can be substituted. ; name: old bay steak fries ; ingredients: baking potatoes, oil, old bay seasoning, salt ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Coat baking sheet with cooking spray. In a large bowl, combine potato wedges with oil, seasoning, and salt. Toss to coat well. Spread potatoes in a single layer on the baking sheet. Bake without turning until tender and browned, about 40-45 minutes. ; name: spinach ricotta frittata ; ingredients: baby spinach leaves, green onions, button mushrooms, roasted red pepper, fresh basil, butter, eggs, ricotta cheese, parmesan cheese, salt and pepper ; preparation:Spray a non-stick 9 or 10 inch omelet pan with cooking spray. Place over medium high heat, add butter. When butter is melted add the prepared vegetables and basil. Cook stirring often just until spinach is wilted. Whisk together the eggs and ricotta cheese. Pour egg mixture over cooked vegetables, cook until almost set, lifting edges frequently to allow uncooked portions to run to bottom of pan. When almost set, reduce heat, cover and allow to cook covered for 1 to 2 minutes. Invert onto a large plate and slip back into pan to finish cooking, top with grated parmesan cheese. Cut in half and serve on warmed plates. ; name: onions in red sauce for hot dogs ; ingredients: sweet onions, olive oil, garlic cloves, ketchup, cayenne, red pepper flakes, paprika, vinegar, salt ; preparation:Saut garlic and onions in olive oil. When onions are tender add ketchup, choice of cayenne or pepper flakes and paprika. Simmer over a low heat for about 15 minutes. Add vinegar and simmer 30-45 minutes. Add salt to taste. Serve over grilled hot dogs in steamed buns. ; name: southern tea punch ; ingredients: orange juice, tea bags, of fresh mint, water, sugar, lemon juice ; preparation:Boil water. Add to large teapot with 5-6 teabags and fresh mint. Steep until cool. Add to orange juice. Add sugar to taste. Add squeeze of lemon juice. ; name: spinach with raisins and pine nuts ; ingredients: raisins, fresh spinach, olive oil, garlic cloves, pine nuts, salt, pepper ; preparation:Place the raisins in a small bowl, add very hot water to cover and soak till plump, 10-15 minutes. Drain well and pat dry with a paper towel, and set aside. If using fresh spinach - rinse but do not drain spinach, place in a medium saucepan over medium heat and cover the pan. Cook the spinach in the water that clings to the leaves till wilted 4-5 minutes, stirring a few times. Transfer the spinach to a colander and squeeze out the excess moisture by pressing on the spinach with the back of a spoon. Chop coarsely. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet or wok over low heat. Add the garlic, pine nuts and soaked raisins and cook till the nuts and the garlic are light golden, 3-5 minutes. Increase the heat to medium add the chopped spinach and cook for about 1 minute, stirring to combine evenly. Season with salt and pepper to taste, transfer to serving bowl. ; name: asparagus with sesame oil vinaigrette ; ingredients: asparagus, garlic, salt, fresh ground white pepper, dijon mustard, fresh lemon juice, sesame oil ; preparation:Boil the asparagus in a large quantity of water for 3 to 5 minutes, depending on thickness, then drain and run under cold water to stop the cooking. Dry thoroughly. Combine the garlic, salt, pepper, mustard and lemon juice in a bowl and whisk to blend. Whisk in the sesame oil. Pour over the asparagus, toss and serve. ; name: easy lemon sponge cake ; ingredients: butter, sugar, eggs, self-raising flour, lemon juice, lemon, rind of ; preparation:

name: simple cumin basmati rice ; ingredients: basmati rice, water, peanut oil, cumin seeds, fresh coarse ground black pepper, salt, fresh cilantro ; preparation:In a medium bowl, soak the rice in the water about 30 minutes. Heat the oil in a large saucepan over med-high heat. Add in the cumin seeds and black pepper. They should sizzle upon contact with the hot oil. Quickly add in the rice with the water it was soaking in. Mix in the salt and bring to a boil over high heat. Decrease heat to the lowest setting, cover the pan, and cook until the rice is done, 10-15 minutes. Do not stir the rice while it cooks. Remove from heat and let the rice rest undisturbed about 5 minutes. Transfer to a serving platter, garnish with cilantro, and serve. ; name: lime cilantro grilled steak ; ingredients: boneless beef chuck steaks, fresh lime juice, water, fresh cilantro leaves, jalapeno pepper, garlic clove, ground cumin, salt and pepper ; preparation:Combine lime juice, cilantro, water, jalapeo pepper, garlic and cumin and pour into a large zip-top plastic bag. Add steaks, seal and shake bag to coat meat. Let marinate in refrigerator 1-2 hours, shaking bag every now and then. Toss marinade when ready to grill steaks. Grill steaks over medium heated until cooked to your liking, turning once. Once cooked, season to taste with salt and pepper. Carve steaks into thin slices and serve. ; name: blackberry liqueur ; ingredients: water, vodka, white sugar, blackberries ; preparation:Shake together the water, vodka and sugar to dissolve sugar. Gently mix together with the blackberries, taking care not to cut or crush the berries. Leave to infuse about 10-12 days until the berries have lost most of their color. Pour thru a fine strainer and discard the berries. Pour into decorative bottles. ; name: mexican white rice arroz blanco ; ingredients: long-grain white rice, white onion, garlic cloves, vegetable oil, chicken broth, water ; preparation:Bring about 6 cups water to a boil and pour over rice in a bowl. Soak rice until it has turned a more opaque white, 2 to 3 minutes. Drain well and spread out on a kitchen towel to dry, at least one hour. Cook onion and garlic in oil in a wide 4-5 quart heavy pot or deep skillet over med. Heat, stirring, until softened, about 3 minutes. Add rice and cook over med-high heat, stirring, until pale golden, about 5 minute add broth, water, and 2 teaspoons salt and bring to a boil. Cover tightly and cook over low heat until rice is tender, 18-20 minutes. Let stand covered 5 min., then fluff with fork and serve. ; name: baked chicken with garlic and rosemary ; ingredients: chicken portions, olive oil, lemon, juice of, chicken stock powder, salt, pepper, lemon, garlic, fresh rosemary ; preparation:Wipe chicken with damp cloth and place in casserole dish. Mix oil, lemon juice, stock powder and seasoning together and drizzle over chicken. Add lemon slices, garlic cloves and rosemary. Roast in a preheated 200c oven for about 35 minutes. You will need to shake the pan from time to time during the cooking process to prevent sticking. ; name: chicken olive bake ; ingredients: rotini pasta, olive oil, onion, bell pepper, cooked chicken, italian-style diced tomatoes, black olives, italian seasoning, mozzarella cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Spray non-stick spray in cassarole pan. Cook pasta and drain. Heat oil in deep skillet. Add onion & bell pepper. Cook and stir for a few minutes. Add pasta, chicken, tomatoes, olives, italian seasoniong. Mix to blend. Put mozzarella on top. Cook in oven for about 35 minutes. ; name: yummy french onion soup ; ingredients: spanish onions, low sodium beef broth, beef broth, butter, teriyaki sauce, french bread, swiss cheese, provolone cheese, muenster cheese ; preparation:Thinly slice onions. In 3 quart pot, melt butter. Saute onions until translucent. Add cans of broth and teriaki sauce. Bring to boil, simmer for 45 minutes. Fill crock with hot soup, float a 1 inch slice of french bread, put 1 slice of each, swiss, provolone and munster cheese. Put in a 400 degree oven until cheese is melted and soup is bubbly. ; name: super suppers beef and noodles ; ingredients: thin egg noodles, ground beef, onion, green pepper, garlic, crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, salt, pepper, cheddar cheese ; preparation:

name: basic cake mix batter ; ingredients: unsalted butter, sugar, baking powder, vanilla extract, eggs, all-purpose flour, milk ; preparation:Beat butter, sugar, baking powder, and vanilla in a large bowl with mixer on high 3 minutes or until fluffy. Add eggs, 1 at a time, beating well after each. On low speed, beat in flour in 3 additions alternately with milk in 2 additions, just until blended, scraping sides of bowl as needed. Bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pans on a wire rack for 10 minutes. ; name: andrea immer s chicken breast with prosciutto sage ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breast halves, sage leaves, prosciutto, olive oil, dry sherry ; preparation:Pound chicken to an even thickness. Lay 5 sage leaves on top of each chicken breast halve. Wrap a slice of prosciutto around each sage-topped chicken breast and secure with toothpick. Heat oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium. Place chicken breasts in skillet, sage side down. Cover skillet and cook chicken for 10 minutes. Remove cover. Turn chicken over and cook uncovered for another 4-5 minutes. Add sherry and stir, scraping up any extra bits from bottom of pan. Plate chicken and spoon sauce over top,. ; name: pumpkin garlic soup ; ingredients: chicken stock, pumpkin, garlic cloves, dry white wine, butter, heavy cream, salt & pepper, dried mustard, worcestershire sauce ; preparation:Melt butter in pot and cook garlic. Pour in pumpkin. Stir in chicken stock until smooth. Add dried mustard and worcestershire sauce if desired. Cook for approximately 20 minutes. Add white wine. Stir in heavy cream in the last 1-2 minutes and cook only until warmed through. Season to taste. ; name: zepz ; ingredients: hoagie roll, smoked ham, swiss cheese, bacon, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Put 1 slice of ham on bottom. Put swiss cheese over ham. Put both slices of bacon top of swiss. Put chedder on top of bacon. Put 1 slice of ham on top of chedder. Last, put in a microwave for 10 seconds. ; name: apple cinnamon oatmeal ww points 4 5 ; ingredients: quick-cooking oatmeal, low-fat milk, unsweetened applesauce, raisins, cinnamon, splenda sugar substitute ; preparation:Combine oatmeal and milk in microwave safe bowl. Give it a quick stir to make sure oats are covered. Make sure the bowl is wide or deep enough so the oatmeal does not overflow. Put it into the microwave for 3 minutes. Remove bowl from microwave. Add apple sauce, raisins, cinnamon and splenda. Mix it all together. The oatmeal may be stiff until the apple sauce is incorporated. ; name: easy apple pudding ; ingredients: apples, self raising flour, cinnamon, butter, sugar, egg ; preparation:Peel, core and slice apples into bite-size pieces. Wash and place them in a saucepan. Combine the dry ingredients with the egg and sprinkle the mixture on top of the apples. Melt butter and pour over the topping. Cover and heat the pan over medium heat for 15-20 minutes. Reduce heat and cook for 15 minutes. This yummy pudding can be served hot or cold. ; name: pecan pie award winning ; ingredients: pie crusts, eggs, sugar, light corn syrup, dark corn syrup, butter, vanilla, pecans ; preparation:Defrost frozen pie crust. Combine eggs and next 5 ingredients. Stir in pecans. Pour into pie shell. Bake 350 degrees for 50 minutes. Cool on a rack. 1 frozen deep-dish pastry shell may be substituted. ; name: noodles herbs ; ingredients: egg noodles, thyme leaves, basil leaves, parsley, chives, butter ; preparation:

name: raisin pie ; ingredients: eggs, vinegar, margarine, vanilla, sugar, raisins, salt ; preparation:Melt margarine. Beat eggs. Add sugar, vinegar to the eggs. Then add margarine vanilla, salt and raisins. Pour into unbaked pie shell. Bake 1 hour at 350. ; name: batata harra with ras el hanout ; ingredients: potatoes, red bell peppers, garlic cloves, coriander, ras el hanout spice mix, olive oil, flaked sea salt, dried red chilies, lemon, juice and zest of ; preparation:Plunge the potatoes in a pan of boiling water for five minutes. Drain and leave to cool. Mix the oil, salt and ras el hanout in a large bowl. Toss the potatoes in the mixture and. Stick this in the oven at 220c for 15 minutes. Remove from the oven and add the peppers, garlic and chilli flakes. Mix it up a bit and return to the oven for 25-30 minutes, until the potatoes are nicely browned and the peppers are starting to blacken around the edges. Finally,. Add the coriander, lemon juice and zest, stir it all through and serve it warm as a side dish, a starter, an alternative to falafels, a bowl of finger food to share during the football. ; name: fudgie scotch squares ; ingredients: sweetened condensed milk, graham cracker crumbs, chocolate chips, butterscotch chips, walnuts ; preparation:Mix condensed milk, graham cracker crumbs, chocolate chips, butterscotch chips, and walnuts together well. Press into pam sprayed then well buttered 9 inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees fahrenheit for 30 minutes. Cool 45 minutes. Cut into squares. ; name: baked orange roughy italian style ; ingredients: seasoned bread crumbs, parmesan cheese, romano cheese, garlic powder, salt, orange roughy fillet, butter, fresh parsley ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f. Coat a medium size baking dish with non-stick cooking spray. In a shallow bowl, mix bread crumbs, parmesan, romano, garlic powder and salt. Brush both sides of the fillets with butter, and dredge in the bread crumb mixture. Arrange fillets in a single layer in the prepared baking dish, and sprinkle with parsley. Bake in pre-heated oven 10-15 minutes, or until the fish flakes easily with a fork. ; name: sweet n sour deviled eggs d v o ; ingredients: hard-boiled eggs, mayonnaise, sugar, cider vinegar, prepared mustard, salt, pepper, paprika ; preparation:Slice eggs in half lengthwise. Gently remove yolks to small bowl. Set whites aside. Mash yolks with a fork. In a separate small bowl, whisk mayonnaise, sugar, vinegar, mustard, salt, and pepper until smooth. Mix into mashed yolks and stir to blend well. Stuff or pipe yolk mixture into egg whites halves. Sprinkle with paprika and minced parsley as desired. ; name: low carb pizza soup ; ingredients: no-sugar-added spaghetti sauce, low-fat milk, low-fat cream cheese, canadian bacon, mushrooms, salt, pepper, italian seasoning, mozzarella cheese, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Place the first 8 ingredients in a medium dutch oven. Heat thoroughly. Simmer on low heat until the cream cheese is well blended. Remove from heat. Serve and sprinkle with mozzarella and parmesan. ; name: grape truffles grape and bleu cheese ; ingredients: white grapes, cream cheese, blue cheese, port wine, ground nuts ; preparation:Mash the cream and bleu cheese in a bowl until they are combined well. Add the port. Mix until all ingredients are very well combined. Chill the cheese mixture for about an hour or two. Using a regular spoon, scoop some cheese into the bowl of the spoon and using a grape, scrape the cheese out of the spoon. Press the cheese around the grape and roll in your hands to completely cover it well. Roll the cheese-covered grape in the ground nuts. Continue with remaining grapes. Chill until ready to serve. ; name: cinnamon crackers ; ingredients: flax seed meal, almond flour, splenda granular, cinnamon, water ; preparation:

name: slammin salmon ; ingredients: salmon fillets, sesame dressing, panko breadcrumbs, roasted unsalted peanuts, sweetened flaked coconut ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400. Place fish in plastic bag or glass dish with marinade. Let sit in fridge for at least 1 hour. Mix panko, peanuts and coconut in a shallow dish. Dredge on side of the fillets in the panko mixture. In an oven safe skillet, heat 1 tbsp olive oil on medium high heat. Place fish in skillet, panko side down, but be careful--it will splatter a bit. Leave the fish to sizzle away for 3 minutes. Do not move it. Flip the fish over and place entire pan in the oven for 15 minutes. Enjoy. ; name: deep dish apple pie really deep ; ingredients: lemons, juice and zest of, apples, sugar, salt, cinnamon, unsalted butter ; preparation:Prep the lemons and set juice and zest aside. Peel and slice apples, tossing to mix. Add the juice and zest. Mix well. Stir in sugar, cinnamon and salt. Pour into bottom portion of prepared pie shell. Cut butter up into cubes and dot across the apples. Top with remaining pie dough, cutting slits in top for steam to escape. Sprinkle with 1 teaspoon sugar and dashes of cinnamon over top. Bake in preheated 400f oven approximately 50-60 minutes. ; name: sage pork ; ingredients: boneless pork chops, plain flour, dried sage, olive oil, butter ; preparation:Mix 3 tbsp of plain flour and 1 tsp of dried sage on a plate. Wash the chops and coat them in the flour and sage mixture. Melt the butter in a medium skillet. Add the olive oil and heat until hot. Add the pork chops, cook for 6 minutes moving occasionaly to avoid sticking. Turn over and cook for a further 6 minutes. Server with salad and baked potatoe. ; name: sicilian broccoli ; ingredients: frozen broccoli, extra virgin olive oil, red onion, garlic, salt, pepper, asiago cheese ; preparation:Fill medium saucepan half full of water and cover and bring to boil on high for the broccoli. Stir broccoli into the boiling water and boil 3-4 minutes, stirring occasionally, or until desired tenderness. Drain broccoli thoroughly. Return saucepan to the stove. Reduce heat to medium-high. Place olive oil in pan and swirl to coat. Add onions and garlic and cook 2-3 minutes to brown. Stir in broccoli until coated with oil. Cook 3-4 more minutes, stirring occasionally, until flavors are well blended. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle the cheese over the broccoli and serve. ; name: thai peanut dressing from cpk s thai crunch salad ; ingredients: creamy peanut butter, rice vinegar, honey, water, soy sauce, sugar, kosher salt, cayenne pepper, crushed red pepper flakes, canola oil ; preparation:Whisk together peanut butter, vinegar, honey, water and soy sauce. Stir in sugar, salt, cayenne and red pepper flakes. Add oil and continue whisking until smooth. Use immediately or refrigerate for up to five days. Bring to room temperature and whisk before using. ; name: fresh corn quiche ; ingredients: eggs, onion, all-purpose flour, sugar, salt, half-and-half, butter, fresh corn kernels, deep dish pie shell ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Combine eggs, onion, flour, sugar and salt in processor. Blend until onion is finely chopped. Add half and half and butter. Process just until blended. Transfer to large bowl. Mix in corn. Pour into crust. Bake until filling is slightly puffed and top is golden, about 50 minutes. Transfer to rack. Cool slightly. Serve warm. ; name: chickpea garbanzo bean and mint soup ; ingredients: olive oil, garlic, onion, celery, chickpeas, mint, vegetable broth, tahini, black pepper ; preparation:Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan and fry the garlic, onion and celery for 4-5 minutes. Add the chickpeas to the pan and cook for a further 10 minutes. Now add the finely chopped mint, stirring well, and then pour over the vegetable broth and tahini. Bring to the boil, reduce heat to low and simmer for at least 30 minutes. Season to taste with salt and freshly ground black pepper. ; name: sweet bbq chicken thighs ; ingredients: chicken thigh, honey, garlic cloves, ginger, soy sauce ; preparation:

name: tamarillo sauce ; ingredients: tamarillos, brown sugar, water, beef stock, five-spice powder ; preparation:Peel and chop tamarillos, combine with sugar and water in pan, simmer, covered, about 5 mins. Or until tamarillos are soft. Blend or process mixture. Strain. Return mixture to pan, stir in stock, spice, extra water and extra sugar, simmer, uncovered, 5 minutes. Freezes well. Cheers, doreen doreen randal, wanganui. New zealand. ; name: garden green beans ; ingredients: fresh green beans, fresh mushrooms, onions, garlic, olive oil, sliced water chestnuts, italian seasoning, salt, pepper, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Place beans in a saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer until crisp-tender. Meanwhile, in a skillet, saute mushrooms, onion and garlic in oil until tender. Stir in water chestnuts and seasonings. Heat through. Drain beans and stir into skillet. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve immediately. ; name: easy cheesy mexican rice ; ingredients: chicken broth, chunky salsa, instant rice, velveeta cheese ; preparation:Mix broth and salsa in medium saucepan. Bring to boil. Add rice and velveeta. Stir. Cover and remove from heat. Let stand 5 minute. Stir until velveeta is melted. ; name: tuna italian ; ingredients: onion, condensed cream of mushroom soup, evaporated milk, cheddar cheese, tuna, sliced mushrooms, parsley, lemon juice, noodles ; preparation:Cook onion until tender but not brown. Add soup, milk, and cheese. Heat and stir. Break tuna in chunks and add to remaining ingredients. Pour into 2 quart casserole dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 25-30 minutes. ; name: grandma katies famous sausage rice ; ingredients: jimmy dean sausage, celery, onions, lipton soup secrets noodle soup mix, boiling water, long grain rice, soy sauce, salt, pepper ; preparation:Use a food processor to finely chop the onion and celery. Brown sausage, celery and onions in a large skillet, drain off fat. Place in large casserole dish. Mix dry soup mix with the 9 cups of boiling water and cook for 5 minutes. Mix all ingredients together and bake covered at 325f for 1-2 hours. ; name: banana sour cream waffles ; ingredients: flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, salt, egg, sour cream, milk, butter, banana ; preparation:Sift together dry ingredients and set aside. Mix together beaten egg yolk, sour cream, milk, butter and banana. Add to flour mixture, mixing well. Fold in egg white which has been whipped until stiff. Pour into oiled waffle iron and bake until brown. ; name: sauteed confetti asparagus ; ingredients: fresh asparagus, yellow bell pepper, red bell pepper, green bell pepper, red onion, roast garlic vinaigrette dressing, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Heat cup of the dressing in large nonstick skillet. Add peppers and onion. Cook and stir on medium-high heat 3 to 5 minutes or until tender. Add asparagus to skillet. Pour remaining cup dressing evenly over asparagus and cover. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook 5-7 minutes or until asparagus are tender. Spoon onto serving platter and sprinkle with cheese. ; name: chic broc chee rice ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, frozen broccoli, onion, butter, instant rice, cream of chicken soup, milk, garlic salt, pepper, provolone cheese ; preparation:

name: amarillo cheese fries and dip like the lone star copycat ; ingredients: ranch dressing, taco seasoning, frozen french fries, bacon, monterey jack cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven and bake the fries according to package directions. Meanwhile, combine ranch dressing and taco seasoning. Set aside. When fries are done, turn off oven. Sprinkle the cheese and bacon over the top of fries. Return to hot oven only until the cheese is melted. Serve with the sauce mix for dipping. ; name: golden grahams treats ; ingredients: miniature marshmallows, karo light corn syrup, butter, vanilla, peanut butter chips, golden grahams cereal ; preparation:Grease an 11x7 baking pan. Heat corn syrup, butter or margarine and chips just to boiling, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla. Pour over cereal in a large bowl. Toss quickly. Fold in marshmallow and press into pan. ; name: twice baked ; ingredients: frozen cauliflower, fat-free half-and-half, margarine, cheddar cheese, bacon bits, chives, salt and pepper ; preparation:Nuke cauliflower to death 4 minutes--stir 5 more minutes. Transfer cooked cauliflower to work bowl of food processor. Add half and half and margarine and pulse until you get a mashed potato consistency. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer mixture to a pie plate. Sprinkle with cheese, bacon, and chives. Bake at 350f for about 10-15 minutes. ; name: shrimp and croissant brunch casserole ; ingredients: plain croissants, monterey jack cheese, small shrimp, green onions, eggs, milk, dried thyme, salt, white pepper ; preparation:Place half the croissant cubes in the bottom of a lightly greased 11 x8 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with half the cheese, all the shrimp and green onions. Top with remaining croissant cubes. In a mixing bowl, whisk the eggs, milk, thyme, salt, and pepper together. Pour pour over mixture in baking dish. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Cover and refrigerate for several hours. Bring to room temperature. Bake in a 350 degree oven, uncovered, for about 40 minutes or until set. Let stand for 10 minutes. Cut into squares and serve. ; name: easy yummy creamy chicken tetrazzini ; ingredients: cream of mushroom soup, chicken breasts, noodles, onion salt, milk, american cheese, salt and pepper ; preparation:Cook noodles as directed on box. Partially thaw chicken, then dice. Cook chicken in skillet. In a separate small sauce pan, add cream of mushroom soup, milk, and cheese. Stir over low heat until melted. When noodles are done, strain, and return to sauce pan. Add the cooked chicken breast and cheese sauce mix. Stir together and simmer uncovered, on low heat about 10 minutes. Add salt and pepper at end to taste. ; name: green salad with shrimp and feta ; ingredients: extra virgin olive oil, red wine vinegar, fresh lemon juice, rosemary, salt, mixed salad greens, green onions, shrimp, cherry tomatoes, feta cheese ; preparation:For dressing, combine oil, vinegar, lemon juice, rosemary, salt and pepper in a small jar with a tight-fitting lid. Cover and shake to combine. Dressing can be made several days in advance and refrigerated, shake well before using. Combine remaining ingredients in a large salad bowl. Chill until serving time. To serve, add dressing and toss lightly to combine. Add additional freshly ground pepper to taste. ; name: ethiopian sauteed lamb or beef ; ingredients: lean lamb, garlic clove, olive oil, sweet onion, hot peppers, red bell pepper, salt, butter, mixed spice ; preparation:Cut meat into thin 2 inch long strips and mix with garlic. Heat oil over medium-high heat. Saute onion and hot peppers until onion is light golden. Add red pepper ans salt. Saute until red pepper is tender. Transfer onion mixture to bowl. In same pan, melt butter over high heat and saute meat mixture until seared all over. Stir in berbere spice mix to taste. Saute for 30 seconds. Serve with injera bread and tomato & cucumber salad. Keep extra berbere spice mix on table to sprinkle over meat as desired. ; name: red skin potato and dill salad ; ingredients: red potatoes, sour cream, mayonnaise, fresh dill, celery, onion, garlic, cracked black pepper, salt ; preparation:

name: papaya boats ; ingredients: papayas, banana, kiwi, strawberry, mandarin oranges, vanilla yogurt, honey, of fresh mint, almond granola ; preparation:Cut papaya in half lengthwise. Scoop out seeds. Place each half on a medium plate. Place an equal amount of banana, kiwifruit, strawberries, and oranges in each papaya half. Combine yogurt, honey and mint if using. Mix well. Spoon over fruit before serving. If you would like a little crunch sprinkle with some granola. ; name: warm chanterelle salad ; ingredients: chanterelle mushrooms, butter, salt, fresh ground black pepper, dill, romaine lettuce, lettuce, rocket, olive oil, white balsamic vinegar ; preparation:Clean the mushrooms, place them in a saucepan and sweat them dry. Strain them and allow them to drip completely dry through a sieve. Then saut them golden brown in butter and season them with salt and black pepper. Wash the lettuces and let them drip dry. Tear them up into a bowl and dress them with olive oil, salt and balsamic vinegar just prior to serving. Put the mixed salad in mounds on the plates and lay the mushrooms on them directly from the pan. Garnish with onion flowers, crown dill, dill sprigs or chopped dill. ; name: festival sausage crock pot ; ingredients: kielbasa, pineapple chunks in juice, pineapple juice, lemon juice, cornstarch, brown sugar, salt, green pepper, onion, maraschino cherry ; preparation:Combine juices, brown sugar and cornstarch. Boil until thick. Stir in salt. Spray the crock pot with non-stick cooking spray. Put sausage, fruit and veggies in the crock pot, add the juice mixture. Cook on low 4 hours. ; name: easy bruschetta chicken bake ; ingredients: diced tomatoes with basil and garlic, chicken flavor stuffing mix, water, chicken tenderloins, mozzarella cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400. Spray 9x13 pan with non-stick cooking spray. Arrange tenderloins in pan and sprinkle with mozzarella. In seperate bowl, mix tomatoes, chicken stuffing, and water. Mix until stuffing is moistened. Spread evenly over chicken. Bake for 30 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through. ; name: creamy cheeseburger macaroni ; ingredients: lean ground beef, dried onion flakes, water, ketchup, prepared yellow mustard, macaroni, velveeta reduced fat cheese product ; preparation:Brown ground beef and onion in large skillet. Drain well. Whisk together water, ketchup, and mustard in a bowl. Pour over meat and bring to a boil. Add macaroni and turn heat to medium low. Cover and simmer for 10-12 minutes or until macaroni is cooked and almost all of the liquid is absorbed. Stir in cubed velveeta cheese until melted and distributed evenly. ; name: rice pudding with sultanas spain ; ingredients: white rice, granulated sugar, milk, vanilla extract, sultana, brandy, cinnamon, ground cinnamon ; preparation:Put sultanas in a bowl & cover them with the brandy, then allow them to sit & soak up some of the liquid, about 30 minutes. In a heavy sauce pan, combine rice, sugar, milk, the drops of vanilla & the cinnamon stick. When the milk starts to boil, turn heat to low & simmer slowly, about 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally to prevent rice from sticking to the bottom of the pan. When sultanas have soaked up some of the brandy, drain them & add the sultanas to the rice & milk mixture. Continue cooking for another 10-15 minutes, & once rice has cooked, remove pan from the heat & remove the cinnamon stick. Spoon into a serving bowl & let cool a bit before sprinkling a little ground cinnamon over the top & serving. ; name: cajun fish croquette ; ingredients: flour, cornmeal, cajun seasoning, salt, ground black pepper, light mayonnaise, fresh dill, lemon juice, tilapia fillets ; preparation:In a not too deep bowl, mix flour, cornmeal, cajun seasoning, salt and pepper. In another bowl not too deep, mix mayonnaise, dill and lemon juice. Soak fish fillets in the mixture of mayonnaise, then in the mixture of flour flipping them to coat well. Put fish fillets on a greased baking sheet. Cook in a preheated oven of 450 f for about 10 minutes or until croquettes are golden. Keep cooking under the broiler for about 4 minutes or until crispy. Serve with the mixture of mayonnaise that you set aside. ; name: hot white bean salad ; ingredients: butter, shallots, garlic clove, white beans, fresh parsley, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, salt, black pepper ; preparation:

name: nassau grits ; ingredients: bacon, ham, onions, green bell peppers, grits, fresh tomatoes ; preparation:Fry bacon, drain and set aside. Saute ham in bacon grease about ten minutes. Add onions and peppers to ham, and saut ten more minutes. Cook grits according to package directions. Stir ham, onions and peppers into grits. Toss tomatoes with grits mixture. Crumble bacon over top and serve immediately. Serve hot. Do not add bacon and tomatoes until time to serve the grits. ; name: old fashioned split pea soup ; ingredients: oil, onion, carrots, celery, dried split peas, chicken broth, cold water, salt, black pepper ; preparation:Heat the oil in a heavy 4-quart saucepan over med-high heat. Add in the onion, carrots, and celery. Cook, stirring, until the vegetables begin to soften, 2-3 minutes. Add in the split peas, broth, and water. Bring to a boil. Partially cover pan, decrease heat to med-low, and simmer until the soup is thick, about 45 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. You can add fresh herbs. Fresh dill is recommended. Also can add meat and ham bones to make it richer. ; name: orange teriyaki chicken ; ingredients: vegetable oil, boneless skinless chicken breast, frozen vegetables, quick-cooking tapioca, chicken stock, orange marmalade, teriyaki sauce, dry mustard, ground ginger ; preparation:In a skillet, heat oil to medium-high heat. Add chicken and brown. Put chicken in crockpot. Add frozen vegetables and tapioca. Mix well. In a small bowl, mix all remaining ingredients. Pour on the chicken. Cover and bake at low heat for 4 hours. ; name: venison maple bacon burgers ; ingredients: venison, bacon, onion, salt, pepper ; preparation:Put in food proscessor. Mix togethar, so bacon is mixed well with venison. Make into burgers. And fry on grill or frying pan. Salt and pepper. ; name: tony roma s original barbecue sauce recipe ; ingredients: ketchup, vinegar, dark corn syrup, sugar, salt, garlic powder, onion powder, tabasco sauce ; preparation:Combine all of the ingredients for the barbeque sauce in a saucepan over high heat. Use a whisk to blend the ingredients until smooth. When the mixture comes to a boil, reduce the heat and simmer uncovered. In 30-45 minutes, when the mixture thickens, remove it from the heat. If you want a thicker sauce, heat it longer. If you make the sauce too thick, thin it with vinegar. ; name: perfect dosa ; ingredients: urad dal flour, rice flour, buttermilk, salt, fenugreek seeds, vegetable oil ; preparation:Mix the urad dal flour and rice flour. Slowly add in buttermilk until it drops from the spoon smoothly. A blender will ease this process. Add salt and fenugreek seeds to taste. Refrigerate batter overnight in an air-tight container. Heat oil in pan. Pour the dosa into the pan quickly. Use the bottom of a ladle to spread it thin and gently smooth it out in a circle motion. Too hard and you will tear the dosa. ; name: bacon potato bundles ; ingredients: baking potatoes, onions, green peppers, bacon, salt and pepper ; preparation:Place the potatoes on four pieces of greased heavy duty aluminum foil. Place onion and green pepper between potatoes to quarters. Top with bacon. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Wrap in foil. Grill, covered. Over med-high heat for 40-50 minutes or until potatoes are tender, turning once. ; name: shiitake mushroom soup ; ingredients: shiitake mushrooms, fresh ginger, olive oil, chicken stock, water, soba noodles, spinach, soy sauce, lime juice ; preparation:

name: easy coleslaw with a kick ; ingredients: coleslaw mix, mayonnaise, sugar, apple cider vinegar, crushed pineapple, pineapple juice, wasabi, salt, pepper ; preparation:Mix everything but the coleslaw together. Pay special attention to be sure the wasabi is well blended. A trick i learned that works very well, is to put all the ingredients but the coleslaw mix into a big ziploc bag, then squish, shake, and massage the ingredients into a nice smooth blend. Then add the coleslaw mix and the ingredients together in a large bowl and mix well. Cover and put it in the fridge for a couple hours to overnight to allow all the flavors to blend inches it will be soupy on the bottom, but the salad will be crisp. ; name: speedy chili with macaroni ; ingredients: lean ground beef, onion, diced tomatoes, kidney beans, tomato sauce, elbow macaroni, chili powder, salt, ground cayenne pepper, paprika ; preparation:Preheat skillet to 350f. Spray skillet with vegetable spray. Add ground beef and onions and cook until beef is no longer pink. Add remaining ingredients and mix well. Cover and reduce heat to simmer for 20 to 30 minutes. ; name: tuna stuffed piquillo peppers tapas ; ingredients: piquillo pepper, tuna in vegetable oil, green onions, parsley, sherry wine vinegar, garlic clove, olive, egg, sweet smoked paprika ; preparation:Drain tuna and flake with a fork. Mix all ingredients except peppers into tuna, lightly. Stuff peppers with tuna mixture. Refrigerate at least 20 minutes. Serve cold. For the egg, put egg in pot of cold water on high heat. When it comes to a boil, cover and turn off heat. Let sit 10 minutes. Peel under cold running water,. ; name: jalapeno spread dip ; ingredients: mayonnaise, jalapeno peppers, jalapeno juice, ground cumin, sugar, paprika, cayenne pepper, garlic powder, salt ; preparation:Add all together into a food processor. Turn on for approximately 2 minutes to make sure everything is well mixed. Pour into a bowl and serve immediately or cover and chill in the refrigerator until ready to serve. If it tastes too much like mayo, add more jalapenos and more jalapeno juice. Its up to you. ; name: creamy carrot puree ; ingredients: carrots, garlic, chicken stock, salt, pepper, ground ginger, whipping cream, fresh parsley ; preparation:Peel carrots and cut into coins. Put the carrots, garlic, stock, salt, pepper, and ginger in a pan and bring to the boil. Reduce heat and simmer until the carrots are tender, 25-30 minutes. Uncover and simmer until the liquid is evaportated, about 10 minutes more. Puree in a food processor. Add the cream and process until smooth. Transfer to a casserole dish. Cover and heat at 400 degrees until hot. Alternately, microwave at medium power until hot. Swirl in parsley and serve. ; name: grilled zucchini with cumin ; ingredients: zucchini, olive oil, cumin, salt, pepper ; preparation:Cut zucchini in half lengthwise. Make criss-cross hatches into the cut side of the flesh. Season with salt and pepper. Drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with cumin. Grill on medium hot grill for about 5 minutes on each side, or until desired tenderness. ; name: double chocolate kisses ; ingredients: almonds, chocolate frosting, butter, graham cracker crumbs, almond extract, milk chocolate kisses ; preparation:Pulse almonds in a food processor until very finely ground, like coarse sand. Pour ground almonds into a pie pan or other shallow bowl and set aside. Beat chocolate frosting and butter in large bowl with a hand mixer until well blended. Stir in graham cracker crumbs and almond extract. Shape chocolate mixture into 1-inch balls. Roll each ball in almonds to coat. Place balls on a cookie sheet. Using your finger, make a deep indentation in the center of each ball. Fill the indentations with chocolate kiss candies. Refrigerate for 30 minutes, or until cold. ; name: sausage and summer squash ; ingredients: italian salad dressing, garlic cloves, polish sausage, summer squash, italian bread, oregano leaves, parmesan cheese ; preparation:

name: ginger hot thighs ; ingredients: chicken thighs, olive oil, onion, garlic cloves, red wine, gingerroot, ground cumin, chili powder, fresh parsley ; preparation:In large, nonstick skillet over medium heat, heat oil. Add chicken. Cook 7 to 8 minutes on each side, or until browned. In small bowl, combine onion, garlic, wine, ginger, cumin and chili powder. Add mixture to skillet. Partially cover and reduce heat to medium low. Cook about 20 to 30 minutes, or until chicken is fork tender and liquid has been reduced to a glaze. To serve, sprinkle with parsley. ; name: surprisingly superb weeknight taco salad ; ingredients: lean ground turkey, lettuce, tomatoes, cheddar cheese, sour cream, salsa, salt, pepper, garlic, tortilla chips ; preparation:Brown ground turkey or beef and garlic in skillet over medium heat. Drain any grease away. Meanwhile shred the head of lettuce into small pieces and dice tomatoes to desired size. When meat and garlic mixture is done, add salt and pepper, stir. Break tortilla chips up into desired size and place in individual serving bowls. Add desired amount of meat to bowls, followed by desired amounts of lettuce, tomato, cheese, sour cream and salsa. Serve and enjoy. ; name: easy chicken cordon bleu pockets ; ingredients: refrigerated reduced-fat crescent rolls, cooked chicken, ham, swiss cheese, egg ; preparation:Heat oven to 350. Combine chicken, ham and cheese in a bowl. Separate dough into 8 rectangles. Firmly press perforations to seal well. Evenly divide mixture between rectangles. Pull up corners of rectangles to center and twist. Pinch edges to seal & place on a cookie sheet lined with foil and sprayed with olive oil spray. Brush pockets with egg & bake for about 20 minutes or until golden brown. ; name: baked alaska ettes ; ingredients: flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, egg, light cream, vanilla, ice cream, marshmallows ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f and grease muffin pan. Sift dry ingredients together. Beat the egg and cream together. Add vanilla. Pour into the dry ingredients, beating thoroughly. Bake until cakes test done and remove to a cooling rack. When cupcakes are cold, hollow out center and fill with ice cream. Level off with the back of spoon and completely blanket the top with halves of marshmallows. Preheat broiler. Place cake under hot broiler for 30 seconds, or until marshmallows are puffed and brown. Serve at once. ; name: mushroom alfredo ; ingredients: cream of mushroom soup, milk, red pepper, parmesan cheese, garlic, parsley, linguine ; preparation:In saucepan, combine soup, milk, red pepper, cheese, garlic and parsley. Bring to boil at medium heat, stirring often. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 mins. Pour sauce over noodles and sprinkle with pepper and additional cheese if desired. I usually increase the garlic to 2 plus cloves. ; name: mashed chipotle sweet potatoes ; ingredients: sweet potatoes, butter, chicken stock, brown sugar, chipotle chile in adobo, adobo sauce, salt, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:Place the prepared potatoes in a large saucepan with cold water and bring to a boil. Once boiling add a touch of salt and cook until tender, about 10 minutes. Drain the potatoes and return to saucepan, add 2 tablespoons butter, chicken stock, brown sugar, chipotle pepper and adobo sauce. Mash the potatoes until combined, i like to leave them slightly lumpy. Season with salt and black pepper and serve. ; name: mushroom flatout pizza ; ingredients: wrap, mushrooms, diced onion, garlic cloves, pizza sauce, mozzarella cheese, sunflower seeds ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400. Place the flatout on a baking sheet spray top side with cooking spray. Bake for 7 minutes. Remove from oven. Put all your goodies on the flatout. Bake again for 5 minutes or till cheese melts. ; name: parsleyed rice with peas ; ingredients: butter, onions, rice, water, bay leaf, salt & freshly ground black pepper, hot pepper sauce, frozen peas, fresh parsley ; preparation:

name: apple crisp a la mode ; ingredients: apples, rolled oats, brown sugar, flour, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt, butter, whipped cream ; preparation:Heat oven to 375 and lightly butter a 8 or 9 inch baking pan. Peel, core and slice the apples and arrange them evenly in the prepared pan. Place the oats, brown sugar, flour, spices and salt in a sealable bag, close and shake until combined. Cut the butter into 1 inch pieces and add to the oat mixture. Close the bag again and knead or squeeze until the mixture holds together. Open the bag and crumble the topping over the apples. Bake the apple crisp 40 to 45 minutes or until the toping is golden and juices are bubbling around the sides. Serve with ice cream, or whipped topping. ; name: summer slumgullion ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, tomatoes, zucchini, yellow squash, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Heat olive oil in large skillet. Add onions and saute until just a little soft. Add zucchini, tomatoes, and yellow squash and cook, stirring occasionally, until the squash is soft and the tomatoes liquefying. Top with parmesan cheese and allow to melt. Serve, perhaps with brown rice or as a side dish. ; name: loaded potato fries ; ingredients: waffle-shaped french fries, steak seasoning, cheddar cheese, green onions, bacon bits ; preparation:Arrange waffle fries in a greased 15 x 10 inch baking pan. Bake at 450 for 20-25 minutes or until lightly browned. Sprinkle with steak seasoning. Toss to coat. Top with cheese, onions, and bacon bits. Bake 2-3 minutes longer or until cheese is melted. ; name: st anselm s garlic steak ; ingredients: skirt steaks, kosher salt, black pepper, unsalted butter, garlic clove, coarse sea salt, flat leaf parsley ; preparation:Build a medium hot fire in a charcoal grill. Season steak generously with kosher salt and black pepper. Melt butter in a small skillet over medium heat until foamy. Remove skillet from heat. To clarify the butter, use a spoon to skim the foam floating on the surface of the butter. Discard the foam. Add the garlic to the clarified butter and let it infuse while the steak is cooking and resting. Grill the steak, turning once, until cooked to desired doneness, about 5 minutes per side for medium rare. Transfer steak to a cutting board and let it rest for 10 minutes. Thinly slice the steak against the grain. Divide the steak between plates and spoon the garlic butter over the top of the steaks. Season with sea salt and garnish with parsley if desired. ; name: coffee chiller ; ingredients: ground coffee, water, sugar, half-and-half, milk, vanilla extract ; preparation:Brew coffee using 12 cups of water. Stir in sugar until dissolved. Stir in half-and-half, milk, and vanilla. Chill. Serve over ice. ; name: oatmeal banana muffins ; ingredients: flour, rolled oats, baking powder, baking soda, egg, white sugar, butter, mashed bananas, raisins ; preparation:Mix all together well. Place in muffin liners. This recipes is very easily doubled and tripled. You can add nuts or chocolate chips too for a change. Mix all together, place in x-large muffin liners. Bake for 20-25 minutes at 325. Makes 12 big muffins. ; name: texas pete warm buffalo potato salad ; ingredients: texas pete original hot sauce, vinaigrette dressing, vegetable oil, red potatoes, garlic, italian seasoning, kosher salt, pepper, celery, blue cheese ; preparation:Combine vinaigrette and hot sauce. Set aside. Mix vegetable oil, garlic, italian seasoning, salt and pepper in large bowl. Add potatoes. Mix to coat potatoes with mixture. Transfer to sheet pan. Bake potatoes at 375f for 55 minutes or until tender. Cool slightly. To make salad, toss potatoes, celery and onion with the hot sauce vinaigrette mixture. Top with bleu cheese crumbles. ; name: weight watchers ww roasted squash risotto ; ingredients: butternut squash, fresh rosemary, red onion, risotto rice, vegetable stock, garlic cloves, light cream cheese, balsamic vinegar, cooking spray ; preparation:

name: crock pot winter vegetable casserole ; ingredients: dry cider, vegetable stock, leeks, carrots, parsnips, turnip, swede, potatoes, bay leaves ; preparation:Pour cider into ceramic cooking pot with stock. Cover with lid and switch to high. Add prepared vegetables and bay leaf. Cover and cook for 4 hours. Serve in warmed deep soup plates. ; name: baked fish with orange sauce ; ingredients: white fish fillets, orange juice, butter, orange rind, parsley ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f degrees. Place fish in baking pan. Mix orange juice and butter. Pour half this mixture over the fish. Sprinkle the rind over. Bake for 10 minutes. Pour remaining orange mixture over. Bake another 10 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley. ; name: heavenly crunch cookies ; ingredients: graham crackers, butter, sugar, pecans ; preparation:Spread crackers in a single layer on a large jelly roll pan. Sprinkle pecans over crackers. Melt butter in a saucepan. Add sugar and boil 3 minutes. Pour over crackers. Bake in 350 degree over for 10 - 15 minutes or until very lightly browned. Remove from pan before they cool completely. Break into sections. ; name: blackberry liqueur ; ingredients: water, vodka, white sugar, blackberries ; preparation:Shake together the water, vodka and sugar to dissolve sugar. Gently mix together with the blackberries, taking care not to cut or crush the berries. Leave to infuse about 10-12 days until the berries have lost most of their color. Pour thru a fine strainer and discard the berries. Pour into decorative bottles. ; name: italian barbecued steak ; ingredients: olive oil, red wine vinegar, balsamic vinegar, garlic, onion, fresh rosemary, salt and black pepper, sirloin steaks ; preparation:Mix together all ingredients in a plastic bag and add steak. Refrigerate and marinate for 4 to 8 hours, flipping the steaks occasionally. Remove steaks from refrigerator 30 minutes before grilling. Drain and discard marinade from steaks. Grill over medium heat until steaks reach your desired doneness. Remove from grill and let rest for 10 minutes before slicing and serving. ; name: white choc chip cookies ; ingredients: brown sugar, white sugar, butter, egg yolk, vanilla essence, self-raising flour, white chocolate chips ; preparation:Preheat oven to 180 c. Grease or line cookie tray. Mix together sugar and butter. Add egg yolk and vanilla, mix well. Stir in flour and choc chips. Place teaspoonfuls onto tray and bake for 12 minutes. ; name: bacon chicken alfredo fettuccine ; ingredients: fettuccine pasta, bacon, boneless skinless chicken breasts, salt, black pepper, alfredo sauce, frozen chopped spinach, italian seasoning, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Cook fettuccine according to package directions. Meanwhile, in a large skillet cook bacon over medium heat until crisp. Remove from pan using a slotted spoon. Set in on paper towels to soak up the grease and drain the skillet reserving 3 tablespoons of drippings. Season the chicken with salt and pepper. Cook chicken in the bacon drippings over medium high heat until juices run clear. Drain fettuccine, stir into skillet with the chicken. Add the alfredo sauce, spinach, italian seasoning, and bacon. Cook and stir occasionally until heated through. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. ; name: chocolate turtle pie ; ingredients: eggs, sweetened condensed milk, butter, pecans, milk chocolate, graham cracker pie crusts, caramel ice cream topping ; preparation:

name: kielbasa and sauerkraut ; ingredients: low-fat kielbasa, onion, red delicious apples, sauerkraut, reduced-sodium chicken broth, caraway seed ; preparation:In 4 or 5-quart sauce pot, cook sliced kielbasa and onion over medium-high heat 5 minutes. Stirring frequently or until browned. Add apples and cook stirring frequently about 1 minute. Stir in sauerkraut, chicken broth and caraway seeds. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes or until apples are tender and flavors blended. ; name: mustard potato salad ; ingredients: potatoes, green onions, dill pickles, mayonnaise, mustard, salt and pepper ; preparation:Boil potatoes for 20 minutes. In the meantime mix the rest of the ingredients together in a bowl. Peel potatoes and chop into bite size pieces. Add chopped potatoes to mixture in bowl and carefully combine until everything is mixed up. Either chill in fridge or serve at once. ; name: grilled ham and cheese sourdough sandwiches ; ingredients: sourdough bread, cheddar cheese, garlic powder, deli ham, swiss cheese, butter ; preparation:On six slices of bread, layer swiss cheese and half the ham. Sprinkle with garlic powder. Top with rest of ham, cheddar cheese and remaining bread. Spread butter over the top and bottom of each sandwich. Cook on an indoor grill or panini maker for 3-4 minutes or until bread is toasted and cheese is melted. ; name: oriental sticky chicken wings ; ingredients: soy sauce, sugar, accent seasoning, ginger, onions, garlic salt, butter, chicken wings ; preparation:Melt butter in skillet and brown wingers well. Combine the rest of ingredients in a bowl. Pour over wings. Put wings on baking sheet or casserole dish with sides. Bake 1 hour at 350 degrees or until tender and sauce is sticky. ; name: filet mignon stack ; ingredients: filet mignon, portabella mushroom, sweet potato, white mushrooms, garlic, burgundy wine, heavy cream, cajun seasoning, butter, green onion ; preparation:Saute portabella mushroom and set aside. Grill filet mignon to desired temperature. In a separate skillet saute quartered mushrooms and roasted garlic for approximately one minute and add cajun seasoning. Add heavy cream and reduce. Stack filet on the portabella, top with the sauce and crown with the sweet potato hay. Garnish with green onions. ; name: anthony s french bread pizza ; ingredients: french bread, pizza sauce, mozzarella cheese, pepperoni slices ; preparation:Slice the french bread lengthwise in half. Spread the pizza sauce on each half with cut side up. Sprinkle the cheese equally between the two halves. Layer the pepperoni slices. Bake in a preheated oven at 375 degrees for 10 minutes. ; name: bobbie q sauce barbecue sauce ; ingredients: heinz ketchup, water, garlic clove, worcestershire sauce, chili powder, sugar, prepared yellow mustard ; preparation:Combine ingredients, bring to a boil and simmer over low heat for 5 minutes. Use this as a basting sauce for barbecue, or combine with chopped or shredded beef, chicken or pork, and simmer until heated throughout and flavor is well through the meat. If you want to make up a batch of this to keep in the freezer, leave out the water, and it will not freeze solid. You can take out the container and just scoop out however much you need. I sometimes make it up by the gallon just to have it on hand for easy meals. ; name: ranch style lentils ; ingredients: dry lentils, salt, water, lean ground beef, garlic cloves, onion soup mix, ketchup, prepared mustard, vinegar, pepper ; preparation:

name: wildcat scramble ; ingredients: diced onion, tortilla chips, green chili, canned black beans, sour cream, chorizo sausage, eggs, cilantro, salt and pepper, cheese ; preparation:Mix eggs, sour cream, salt and pepper and set aside. Saute onions and sausage. Drain fat. Add all ingrediants to eggs except cheese. Pour into greased, oversized, muffin tins, makes 12 large. Sprinkle grated cheese on top. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes or until set. ; name: balsamic pork garden salad ; ingredients: cooked pork, balsamic vinegar, red wine, worcestershire sauce, roasted garlic, butter, sugar ; preparation:Melt butter in sauce pan. Add all other ingredients, stirring. Bring to a boil and immediately reduce heat. Stir in pork, coating well with sauce. Cover pan, and cook on medium low until well heated. Remove from heat and allow to cool. Place pork on top your favorite garden salad, drizzle remaining sauce as salad dressing and serve immediately. ; name: chocolate pudding deluxe for pies trifles etc ; ingredients: milk, sugar, cocoa, cornstarch, eggs, semi-sweet chocolate chips, butter, vanilla ; preparation:Put milk in sauce pan. Add the cocoa, sugar, and cornstarch together, mix well add to the milk. Now add eggs. With a whisk, whisk till all is smooth and blended. Over medium heat, heat till a soft boil, add chocolate chips. Continue to stir for about another 2 minute or till nice and thick. Take off the stove and add the vanilla and butter. Pour into small pudding dishes or bowl or pie crust or what ever you want. ; name: tomato and maple meatballs ; ingredients: ground veal, green onion, garlic cloves, milk, bread, olive oil, maple syrup, salt and pepper, tomato sauce ; preparation:In a large bowl, mix veal, green onion and garlic. In a medium bowl, put milk and soak the bread then incorporate to the veal mixture. Shape in 10 large meatballs. At medium heat, in a small skillet, heat olive oil and brown the meatballs a few minutes. Add maple syrup, salt, pepper and let cook around 3 minutes more. Remove the skillet from the heat. In a saucepan, put tomato sauce and bring to boil. When it comes to boil, add meatballs, cover and simmer around 25 minutes. Serve on a bed of pasta. ; name: chicken adobo aloha ; ingredients: chicken, pineapple tidbits, water, garlic, cooking oil, vinegar, salt, soy sauce, peppercorn, pineapple syrup ; preparation:Marinate chicken meat for 1 hour. In a medium pot, simmer meat in marinade for about 5 minutes. Remove. Heat oil in a skillet and cook chicken until golden brown. Return to marinade and simmer until chicken is tender. Add pineapple tidbits. Top with browned garlic. ; name: ice cream party loaf ; ingredients: white cake mix, chocolate ice cream, strawberry ice cream, whipping cream, sugar, maraschino cherry ; preparation:Preheat over to 350. Prepare cake as directed, b ut bake in a 9x5x3 inch loaf pan. Bake 55-60 minutes or until done with a toothpick. Cool 20 minutes then remove from pan. When completely cool, split into 3 layers using long serrated knife. Spread softened chocolate ice cream between bottom and middle layers. Spread softened strawberry ice cream between middle and top layers. Freeze until ice cream is hard. Whip cream until stiff then add sugar. Spread on sides and top of loaf. Garnish with cherries. Serve at once or stor in freezer up to 4 weeks. ; name: cider vinegar chicken ; ingredients: olive oil, chicken breast halves, black pepper, onion, fresh thyme leaves, honey, garlic cloves, apple cider vinegar, chicken broth, unsalted butter ; preparation:Preheat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add 2 tablespoons of the olive oil. Season the chicken with salt and pepper and add to the hot skillet. Brown the chicken on both sides, 3 minutes per side. Remove and reserve the meat, covered with foil. Add another tablespoon of the olive oil, and then add the onions, garlic, thyme and honey. Season with salt and pepper and cook, stirring frequently for 7-8 minutes. You want the onions to get really brown and caramelized. Add cup of the cider vinegar and the stock. Turn up the heat to high and bring up to a simmer. Once at a simmer, return the chicken to the pan. Cook the chicken in the sauce for about 10 minutes, flipping halfway through the cooking time. ; name: kilasara potato bake ; ingredients: potatoes, condensed cream of chicken soup, sour cream, cheddar cheese, butter, onion ; preparation:

name: fruit or berry cobbler ; ingredients: oleo, berries, sugar, flour, baking powder, cinnamon, milk ; preparation:Melt 1 cup oleo in a 9x12-inch cake pan. Put 4 of the 6 cups of berries or fruit in the pan. Spread out evenly. Combine sugar, flour, baking powder and milk. Pour batter over berries or fruit. Sprinkle remaining berries or fruit over top of the batter. Sprinkle cinnamon over top. Bake at 375 for 40 minutes. ; name: marco polo salad ; ingredients: marco polo noodles, fresh snow peas, green onions, fresh bean sprouts, carrots, soy sauce, balsamic vinegar, fire oil, sesame oil, fresh ginger ; preparation:Prepare noodles as package instructions and toss with other salad ingredients. Mix dressing ingredients and pour over salad and toss till well mixed. Let salad marinate in refer at least 2 hours. Lightly toss the salad a couple of times to redistribute salad dressing during marination. Garnish with reserved whole pea pods. ; name: easy bake oven english muffin pizza ; ingredients: english muffin, tomato sauce, mozzarella cheese, pepperoni, sliced mushrooms ; preparation:Separate the english muffins and place on a baking sheet. Top each with about 1 tbs. Of prepared sauce. Top with any additional pre-cooked toppings. Top with shredded cheese. Bake in your easy-bake oven for about 15-20 minutes. ; name: black bean burger ; ingredients: black beans, onion, rolled oats, chili powder, cumin, salt, black pepper, egg, liquid ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425f. Combine the beans, onion, oats, chili powder, cumin, salt, pepper, and egg in a food processor. Pulse until chunky, but not pureed. The mixture should be moist, but not sticky. Add a little liquid if needed. Grease a baking sheet. Use your hands, a spoon, or an ice-cream scoop to make patties. Drop these onto the baking sheet. Bake for about 15 minutes, or until the bottoms are nicely colored and lift easily from the baking sheet. Flip and bake for 15 more. You can also broil these burgers, or cook them in a hot cast iron skillet, or on the grill. They cook a lot faster using these other methods, so just be sure to keep an eye on them. ; name: squash delight ; ingredients: squash, maple syrup, onion, oil, carrot, sour cream, cream of chicken soup, chicken flavor stuffing mix ; preparation:Prepare squash, either by peeling and boiling or bake in oven until tender. Cool and mash. Yield for cooked squash is about 2 cups of puree. Saute onion and carrot in frying pan with tsp oil. Cool. In small bowl combine cooled onion, carrot, sour cream, maple syrup and soup. Fold in squash. Prepare stuffing according to package directions. Spread half of stuffing in bottom of prepared 8x8 baking dish. Spoon squash mixture on top, sprinkle with remaining stuffing. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. ; name: tartar sauce for all tastes ; ingredients: mayonnaise, sweet pickle relish, baby dill pickle, dried onion flakes, dried dill, dried mustard, old bay seasoning, kosher salt, black pepper ; preparation:Add to the work bowl of you food processor the relish, the rough chopped dill pickles, dried onion, mustard powder, dill and the old bay. Give it ten good pulses to chop and mix everything. Dump the relish mixture into a mixing bowl with the mayo and the salt and pepper. Stir to combine. Let it sit in the fridge for at least 30 minutes so all the flavors can combine and the onion can rehydrate. ; name: layered mexican chicken salad ; ingredients: ranch salad dressing, taco seasoning mix, lettuce, black beans, deli chicken, tortilla chips, cheddar cheese, cherry tomatoes ; preparation:In a small bowl, mix dressing and taco mix. On a large serving platter or individual serving pates, layer remaining ingredients except tomatoes. Drizzle with dressing. Sprinkle with cherry tomatoes that have been sliced in half. You can also top with olives and add a bit of canned corn if you like. I only use a portion of the can of black beans. Use as much as you prefer. ; name: caribbean grilled tuna ; ingredients: tuna steaks, lime juice, olive oil, jamaican jerk spice ; preparation:

name: moroccan broad fava bean salad ; ingredients: broad beans, olive oil, lemon juice, garlic cloves, ground cumin, paprika, coriander, preserved lemon, black olives ; preparation:Bring a large pan of salted water to the boil. Meanwhile pod the beans, put beans into boiling water and boil for 2 mins. Drain and refresh under cold running water. Slip off and discard the outer skin of the bean. Put beans into heavy pan with the olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, cumin and paprika, cook gently over low heat for about 10 mins. Season to taste with salt and pepper and leave to cool in the pan. ; name: valentine cookie pops ; ingredients: refrigerated sugar cookie dough, wooden popsicle sticks, vanilla frosting, decorative candies, ribbon ; preparation:Heat oven to 350f on ungreased cookie sheets, place cookie dough pieces 2 inches apart. Into side of each piece of dough, insert wooden stick 1 inch, overlapping wooden sticks as necessary. Bake 12 to 16 minutes or until edges are light golden brown. Cool 2 minutes. Remove from cookie sheets. Cool completely, about 10 minutes. Spread frosting on one side of each cookie. Decorate with candies. Tie 18 inches of red ribbon into bow around each stick next to cookie. ; name: roasted parsnips with shallots ; ingredients: parsnips, garlic cloves, shallots, olive oil, honey, kosher salt, cracked black pepper, of fresh mint, fresh sage ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Toss together all the ingredients except for the mint and sage. Place in a roasting pan and roast 30 minutes, or until the parsnips are fork tender. Stir in the herbs and toss. Adjust seasoning if necessary. ; name: soupy black beans ; ingredients: olive oil, scallions, garlic cloves, green chilies, black beans, water, salsa, salt and pepper ; preparation:In a medium saucepan, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add scallions and garlic cloves and saute until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add black beans and water. Increase heat and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for about 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add salsa and stir until heated through. Add salt and pepper to taste. ; name: special gourmet christmas eggnog ; ingredients: eggs, sugar, milk, whipping cream, bourbon, cognac, dark rum, ground nutmeg, maraschino cherry ; preparation:Beat the egg yolks until they are light. Gradually beat in the sugar until the mixture is thick& light colored. Beat the egg whites until stiff. Pour the egg mizture into a punchbowl that is sitting in crushed ice. Blend in the milk and the beaten cream slowly pour in the bourbon& cognac. Fold in the egg whites. Sprinkle the punch with the 2 tbsp of dark rum. ; name: creamy asparagus leek and potato soup ; ingredients: leeks, butter, potatoes, asparagus, chicken stock, salt, pepper, evaporated milk ; preparation:Cut leeks in half lengthwise, wash and thinly slice. In large pan lightly saut leeks in butter. Add potatoes. Saute for about 3 minutes. Add asparagus, chicken stock, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Lower heat and simmer gently for about 20-30 minutes, until all vegetables are soft. Put contents in blender or processor and pure. Add evaporated milk and adjust salt and pepper for seasoning. Serve warm with garlic or herb flavored crutons, or toasted bread slices. ; name: one pot macaroni and cheese by consumer reports ; ingredients: water, salt, elbow macaroni, sharp cheddar cheese, margarine, heavy cream, paprika, white pepper, cayenne ; preparation:Using a two-quart saucepan, bring salted water to a boil. Stir in the macaroni and return the water to a boil. Stirring occasionally, continue boiling for four minutes. Then lower the heat to medium and continue to boil the macaroni with frequent stirring for seven more minutes. Add the remainder of the ingredients, stirring well until the cheese is melted. To modify and reduce saturated fat and salt, eliminate the salt, substitute low-cholesterol cheese and skim milk for the cheddar and the cream and add two teaspoons of fried onions. ; name: margaret lefever s wonderful baked beans ; ingredients: dried navy beans, brown sugar, catsup, barbecue sauce, dry mustard, bacon ; preparation:

name: miss minda s super sunshine cake ; ingredients: yellow cake mix, applesauce, eggs, mandarin oranges in light syrup, cool whip, vanilla instant pudding mix, crushed pineapple ; preparation:Ignore the directions on the box cake mix and instead, in a medium bowl, add the cake mix, applesauce, eggs and mandarine oranges. Bake at the temperature on box and for the suggested length of time. After cake is cooled, combine cool whip with instant pudding and pineapple with the juice. Let it rest for 10 minutes and frost the cake. Serve. ; name: casco bay lemonade ; ingredients: citrus-infused vodka, prepared sweet-and-sour mix, cranberry juice, carbonated lemon-lime beverage ; preparation:Pour the citrus vodka, sweet and sour mix and cranberry juice into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into a collins glass almost filled with ice cubes. Top with lemon-lime soda. Float a lemon slice on top, and serve. ; name: chocolate ecstasy pecan pie ; ingredients: semisweet baking chocolate, butter, 9 inch pie shell, eggs, brown sugar, light corn syrup, vanilla extract, pecan halves ; preparation:Preheat your oven to 350 degrees farenheit. In a large, microwave-safe bowl, microwave 4 squares of chocolate and butter on high power until melted. Meanwhile, brush the bottom of the pie crust with beaten eggs using a pastry brush remove the bowl from the microwave and blend in eggs, brown sugar, corn syrup and vanilla. Add the pecans and chopped chocolate, combining evenly. Pour the mixture into the pie crust and pop the pie in the oven bake for 55 minutes or test for doneness by inserting a knife 2 inches from the edge-it will come out clean if the pie is done. Cool the pie on a wire rack before slicing. ; name: salmon cutlets in indian creamy sauce ; ingredients: salmon fillets, onions, garlic cloves, coconut milk, chopped tomatoes, spices, salt and pepper, olive oil ; preparation:Chop onions and garlic. Heat 4 tablespoons of olive oil in a saucepan. Add the onions and fry at medium heat for about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and the spices to the onions. Mix well and leave to cook for another 5 minutes. Add the chopped tomatoes and the coconut milk. Season the sauce. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes. 10 minutes before the end, fry the salmon cutlets in a separate fry pan until slightly golden season the salmon. Serve with the sauce and basmati rice. ; name: easter pizza ; ingredients: frozen bread dough, mozzarella cheese, ham, provolone cheese, genoa salami, swiss cheese, capicola, parmesan cheese, eggs, pepper ; preparation:Oil bottom & sides of lasagna size pan. Knead & roll doughs 2 inches longer than pan. Place dough in pan, stretch it 2 inches past sides. Layer ingredients, meat, cheese, meat, cheese. Pour the beaten eggs over the top of layers. Cover top with other kneaded, rolled, stretched dough. Pinch together, all around pan. Brush top with egg wash. Bake 375 degrees 40 minutes. ; name: antipasto salad stack ; ingredients: rotini pasta, tomatoes, pepperoni, red kidney beans, green olives, parmesan cheese, italian salad dressing, romaine lettuce leaves ; preparation:Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. Cool slightly. While pasta is cooking, arrange tomatoes and half of pepperoni around bottom edge of 3 quart glass serving bowl. Layer cooked pasta, remaining pepperoni, beans, olives and cheese in bowl. Drizzle with salad dressing. Top with lettuce. Cover and chill at least 1 hour or up to 24 hours. To complete recipe, toss salad gently just before serving. ; name: blueberry honey jam ; ingredients: blueberries, sugar, liquid honey, lemon juice, liquid fruit pectin ; preparation:Place blueberries, sugar, honey and lemon juice into a non-reactive saucepan and bring to a boil, stirring. Boil hard for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Take off the heat, stir in the pectin and ladle into hot sterilized jars. Seal and process in a hot water bath for 10 minutes. Place hot jars on a towel on your counter and let cool overnight. Check seals. ; name: tangy avocado orange salad ; ingredients: oranges, red leaf lettuce, avocado, white balsamic vinegar ; preparation:

name: spinach pumpernickel dip ; ingredients: low-fat sour cream, low-fat mayonnaise, herb salad dressing mix, frozen spinach, pumpernickel rounds, water chestnuts, green onion ; preparation:Combine the sour cream, mayonnaise and salad dressing and mix well. Squeeze the spinach to remove water. Add to the mixture and mix well. Add optional ingredient. Hollow out the bread and fill with the sour cream mixture. Cube the bread that was removed from the loaves. Arrange assorted cut up veggies and bread cubes around loaves. ; name: lemon baked chicken ; ingredients: skinless chicken breast halves, butter, salt, paprika, fresh lemon juice, parsley ; preparation:Heat oven to 425. Place chicken breasts in ungreased baking pan, 9 x 9 x 2. Spread 1 tsp butter on each of the four chicken breasts. Sprinkle salt and paprika on the breasts. Drizzle all with the lemon juice. Bake uncovered 35- 45 minutes or until tender. Sprinkle with snipped parsley and serve. ; name: halloween cheddar fondue for the adults ; ingredients: dry cider, sharp canadian cheddar cheese, cornstarch, butter, dry english-style mustard, worcestershire sauce, cayenne pepper, whole wheat bread ; preparation:Heat the cider or beer to a simmer over medium-low heat. Toss together the cheese and the cornstarch. Add cheese in large handfuls to the simmering liquid. When the fondue is creamy, combine the butter, mustard, & worcestershire and add to the fondue. Stir constantly with a wooden spoon until silky& smooth. Season with cayenne and place in a table top fondue dish and place over heater. Keep the fondue at a gentle simmer. Guests then spear the bread dip in the hot fondue and mmmmmmmm. ; name: yankee potato salad ; ingredients: red potatoes, sour cream, mayonnaise, red wine vinegar, fresh dill, salt, black pepper ; preparation:Boil the potatoes whole for about 20-30 minutes or until easily pierced with a fork. Drain and cool completely. Large dice the potatoes. Plece in a bowl with enough room for stirring. Add the remaining ingrdients, using salt and pepper to taste. Stir and chill until ready to serve. Feel free to add more sour cream if salad seems dry. ; name: blueberry sauce ; ingredients: blueberries, grape juice, ground cinnamon, lemon, rind of, cornstarch, water ; preparation:Combine first 4 ingredients in a medium saucepan& bring to a boil. Reduce heat& simmer gently for 3 to 4 minutes until blueberries become tender. Combine cornstarch& water in a small bowl until smooth. Add to blueberry mixture& cook, stirring until thickened, about 5 more minutes. Serve warm or cold. ; name: grilled ginger chicken ; ingredients: soy sauce, lime juice, liquid honey, fresh ginger, garlic, tabasco sauce, boneless skinless chicken breasts ; preparation:In a small bowl, stir soy sauce, lime juice, honey, ginger, garlic and tobasco. If you want this as a marinade, make this several hours in advance, pour into a ziploc bag, add chicken and marinate in fridge for several hours shaking often. Alternatively, you can brush both sides of the chicken after making the sauce for a quick meal. Lightly oil grill and then heat bbq to medium. Bbq with lid closed, turning and basting halfway through with remaining marinade. Remember not to baste chicken before taking off grill since raw chicken was in it. Make sure the baste is fully cooked before removing from grill. Grill for 12- 16 minutes until juices run clear. ; name: spicy bacon tomato brunch ; ingredients: ginger, onion, garlic cloves, plum tomatoes, bacon, salt, pepper, toast ; preparation:Cut the bacon into small strips and add to saucepan. Cook over medium heat. Finely chop the onion and garlic. Add to saucepan and fry with ginger until soft and translucent. When vegetables are cooked, open tomatoes and cut into small pieces. Add tomatoes and juice to saucepan with salt and pepper. The secret of this recipe is to keep cooking over a medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the tomato juice has reduced to a thickish sauce. When desired thickness is reached, serve on toast -- it certainly wakes those taste buds up. ; name: crock pot chicken cordon bleu ; ingredients: chicken breasts, swiss cheese, deli ham, cream of chicken soup, milk, italian seasoned breadcrumbs, garlic powder, onion powder ; preparation:

name: my ground cherry ketchup ; ingredients: cape gooseberries, onions, apples, bell peppers, white vinegar, white sugar, pickling spices, black pepper ; preparation:Mince the onions. Cut green and red mild peppers into pieces as big as a stamp. Pass the spices and the black pepper through the blender to obtain a spice powder. Peel, take away the core and cut the apples in 1 inch pieces. Peel and wash the ground cherries thoroughly. Mix all the ingredients in a big thick cooking pot and bring to a boil, then reduce to medium heat. Let cook until the liquid acquire a syrupy consistency, stirring often to prevent sticking at the bottom of the pot. Pour into sterilized mason jars and close the lids. Verify that the jars are vacuum-sealed. ; name: old fashioned pralines ; ingredients: sugar, light brown sugar, milk, butter, pecans, vanilla ; preparation:Combine all ingredients and bring to soft ball stage, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Stir until mixture thickens, becomes creamy and cloudy, and pecans stay suspended in mixture. Spoon out on aluminum foil or parchment paper. Makes approximately fifteen to twenty pralines, depending on size. ; name: black coffee chocolate cake ; ingredients: flour, sugar, cocoa, baking soda, baking powder, eggs, strong black coffee, buttermilk, grapeseed oil, vanilla ; preparation:Beat it all together in one big bowl. The batter will be very thin. Pour into a greased and floured 13 x 9 inch pan or two 9-inch layer pans. Bake 350f for 35-40 minutes.
