This is great when filled with creamy peanut butter and frosted with dark chocolate frosting. ; name: bacon spinach and egg scramble ; ingredients: egg, egg whites, fresh spinach, bacon, milk, shredded cheddar cheese, salt and pepper ; preparation:Fry chopped bacon in a non stick skillet. Beat together egg, egg whites, milk, salt, and pepper. When bacon is almost done, add chopped spinach and saute until just wilted. Add egg mixture and scramble. Top with cheddar cheese. ; name: bottoms up cherry limeade ; ingredients: lime juice, sugar, lime-flavored soda water, maraschino cherry juice, maraschino cherries, lime slices ; preparation:In a bowl, combine lime juice and sugar. Cover and refrigerate. Just before serving, stir carbonated water into lime juice mixture. For each serving, place 1 tablespoon cherry juice in a glass. Add crushed ice and about 1 cup of lime juice mixture. Garnish with a maraschino cherry and a lime slice. ; name: fasta pasta ; ingredients: linguine, onion, oil, ham, button mushrooms, coarse grain mustard, heavy cream, salt & freshly ground black pepper, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Cook pasta in lightly salted boiling water until just tender. Drain and keep hot. Meanwhile cook onion in oil over a gentle heat until softened, but not brown. Stir in the ham and mushrooms and cook for two minutes more. Add mustard and cream. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Toss through the pasta ribbons, coating well. Serve in four warmed bowls topped with parmesan shavings. ; name: mom s peanut butter criss cross cookies ; ingredients: shortening, peanut butter, white sugar, flour, brown sugar, baking soda, eggs, salt, vanilla ; preparation:Thoroughly cream shortening, sugars, eggs, and vanilla. Stir in peanut butter. Sift dry ingredients. Stir into cream mixture. Drop by rounded teaspoon on ungreased cookie sheet. Press with back of fork dipped in flour to make crisscrosses. Bake in 350 degree oven about 10 minutes. ; name: broccoli mandarin orange salad ; ingredients: broccoli florets, sliced almonds, mandarin orange sections, orange, juice and zest of, green onions, vinegar, sugar, olive oil ; preparation:

name: make perfect ice tea ; ingredients: tea bags, baking soda, boiling water, cold water, sugar, lemon ; preparation:Place tea bags and baking soda in a large heat resistant glass measuring cup. Add 2 cups of boiling water. Cover and steep for 15 minutes. Remove tea bags and pour tea into a 2 quart pitcher. Add 6 cups of cold water. If you have hard water, use filtered water or bottled water. For sweetened tea, put approximately 1 cup of sugar in 2 quart pitcher. Then pour tea concentrate from step 2, and after sugar has dissolved, add 6 cups of cold water. To avoid cloudiness, cool to room temperature before refrigerating. Garnish with lemon or mint and serve over ice. Store in refrigerator for up to 2 days. ; name: celeriac mash ; ingredients: celeriac, potatoes, onion, butter ; preparation:In a small sauce pot place celeriac, add water to cover. In separate pot place potato with water to cover. Place half the onion in each pot and simmer until each is fork tender. Strain liquid and place all ingredients, including butter, in a food processor or blender. Puree until mash has a smooth consistency. Season with salt and pepper to taste. ; name: chocolate crispy biscuits ; ingredients: butter, sugar, egg, vanilla extract, rice bubbles, self raising flour, chocolate chips ; preparation:Preheat oven to 180 degrees celsius. Line a baking tray with baking paper. Cream butter and sugar together till pale and creamy. Add egg and vanilla and beat till smooth. Add remaining ingredients. Stir till well combined. Place heaped tablespoons of mixture on trays. Allow room for spreading. Bake 15 - 17 minutes, then cool for 5 minutes. Transfer to wire rack. ; name: reese s peanut butter chocolate chip crescents ; ingredients: peanut butter and milk chocolate chips, nuts, refrigerated crescent dinner rolls, powdered sugar ; preparation:Heat oven to 375 degrees f. Stir together chips and nuts in small bowl. Unroll dough to form 8 triangles. Lightly sprinkle 1 heaping tablespoon chip mixture on top of each. Gently press into dough. Starting at shortest side of triangle, roll dough to opposite point. Place rolls, point side down, on ungreased cookie sheet. Curve into crescent shape. Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until golden brown. Sprinkle with powdered sugar. ; name: jane austen s regency toasted cheese welsh or scotch rarebit ; ingredients: cheddar cheese, cream, dry english-style mustard, worcestershire sauce, salt, pepper, thick bread, butter, chutney ; preparation:Melt the cheese over hot, but not boiling, water and then gradually stir in the rest of the ingredients. Mix well and set to one side. Taste and adjust seasonings. Toast the bread on one side only and then butter the untoasted side. Spread the melted rarebit mixture over the top of the bread - on the untoasted side - make sure the mixture is spread upto the edges. Place under a hot grill and cook until the rarebit mixture is bubbling hot and brown in patches, about 3 to 5 minutes depending on the heat of your grill. Serve immediately with a selection of chutneys, relishes and pickles. ; name: peanut macaroons 1924 ; ingredients: eggs, sugar, roasted peanuts, flour, salt, vanilla extract ; preparation:Preheat oven to 325f. Combine flour, salt and peanuts. Set aside. Beat eggs. Add sugar and mix well. Add peanut mixture to egg mixture. Mix in vanilla extract. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto greased baking sheets. Bake for 15 minutes. Cool on rack. ; name: quick drop cookies ; ingredients: sugar, salt, butter, milk, peanut butter, rolled oats, vanilla extract, instant chocolate drink mix ; preparation:Combine sugar, salt, butter and milk in a medium size sauce pan. Bring to a boil and let boil for 1 minute. Stir in peanut butter, oats, vanilla and chocolate drink mix. Drop by rounded teaspoons full onto waxed paper. Let set until cool. Store in airtight container. ; name: caramel mud cake gluten free ; ingredients: unsalted butter, white chocolate, brown sugar, golden syrup, milk, gluten-free flour, baking powder, eggs, thickened cream ; preparation:

name: no bake citrus cheesecake ; ingredients: graham cracker crumbs, butter, lemon gelatin, boiling water, philadelphia cream cheese, fresh lemon rind, lemon, juice of, cool whip topping ; preparation:Combine graham crumbs with melted butter. Press on bottom of 9 in. Springform pan. Dissolve jelly powder with boiling water in large glass bowl. Make sure jelly powder is completely dissolved before adding cream cheese. Blend in cream cheese with a hand mixer on low speed. Whisk in juice and rind of lemon and whipped topping. Pour over prepared crust. Smooth top. Chill 4 hrs. ; name: fresh key lime salsa ; ingredients: tomatoes, fresh jalapeno pepper, fresh cilantro leaves, red onion, fresh garlic, granulated sugar, salt, black pepper, key limes, juice of ; preparation:In a medium size glass bowl mix together the tomatoes, jalapeno pepper, cilantro, onion, garlic, sugar, and salt and pepper. Combine well. Add in the juice. Cover and refrigerate for 3-4 hours before serving. Serve with fresh tortilla chips. ; name: easy mix and match stir fry ; ingredients: italian dressing, soy sauce, garlic, boneless chicken breasts, olive oil, red bell pepper, yellow bell pepper, green onion ; preparation:In a small bowl combine italian dressing, soy sauce and minced garlic to make the sauce. In a plastic baggie add the meat of choice and 1 to 2 tbs. Of the sauce. Toss to coat and let stand 5 minutes. Heat oil in a large wok or skillet on medium -high heat. Add the meat mixture and stir fry 10 to 15 minutes or until no longer pink inside. Add the red and yellow bell pepper strips and green onions. Stir fry 4 minutes. Add remaining sauce to mixture and simmer 2 to 3 minutes. Serve over rice. ; name: greek style green beans ; ingredients: diced tomatoes, water, onions, fresh parsley, garlic, of fresh mint, oregano leaves, salt, black pepper, green beans ; preparation:Wash,. Place in pan with water to cover beans. Simmer uncovered until beans are just tender, stirring a few times. Meanwhile, combine undrained tomatoes with water, onions, parsley, garlic, mint, oregano, salt and pepper in a saucepan. Cover. Bring just to a boil, reduce heat and let simmer 10 minutes, stirring frequently. When tomato sauce is thick, drain green beans and top with sauce. Serve promptly. ; name: skillet italian herbed country potatoes ; ingredients: potatoes, onion, butter, olive oil, garlic clove, rosemary, sage, thyme, salt, black pepper ; preparation:In a large non-stick skillet over medium heat, melt butter and olive oil together. Add the remaining ingredients to the skillet. Stir until potatoes are evenly coated with spice mixture and onion slices are evenly distributed. Cook covered on medium heat for 15 minutes, tossing and turning the potatoes every few minutes. Potatoes will be done when slightly browned and fork-tender. ; name: chicken stuffed with smoked salmon ; ingredients: chicken breasts, oil, onion, red pepper, chicken soup, smoked salmon, sweetcorn, water, salt, pepper ; preparation:Pre heat oven to gas 4, 350f, 180c. Make a pocket in the chicken breasts and stuff with smoked salmon leaving a little of the salmon left over for the sauce. Place in a ovenproof dish. Fry onions in oil until golden, then add red pepper and cook for a further minute. Add soup, water, remainding salmon and sweetcorn and mix well. Pour over the chicken. After 20 mins cooking in oven give the sauce a stir and baste chicken breasts with the sauce, cook for further 20 mins and serve. ; name: cuban garlic sauce mojo cubano ; ingredients: olive oil, garlic cloves, onion, sour orange juice, oregano, salt, black pepper ; preparation:For the mojo, you will need a large bowl. In a large bowl, pour the sour orange juice or lime juice, oregano, salt, pepper, garlic and sliced onion into the bowl and stir. Heat the olive oil over medium-high for 2 minutes, then when hot, pour olive oil into bowl. Be careful not to get burned, since some of it might splatter out. Mix the mojo ingredients, then let sit for 30 minutes. ; name: falafel croquettes ; ingredients: canned chick-peas, garlic cloves, ground coriander, ground cumin, fresh chives, salt and pepper, oil ; preparation:

name: summer peach pudding dessert ; ingredients: fresh peaches, sugar, flour, salt, margarine, baking powder, milk ; preparation:Preheat oven at 350 degrees. Spread peaches in a well greased 13x9 baking dish. Blend flour, sugar, baking powder and salt. Add milk, beating until a batter forms. Pour over peaches. Drizzle margarine over top of mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes. Let cool and refrigerate about 4 hours prior to serving. ; name: brined turkey breast with maple glaze ; ingredients: turkey breast, kosher salt, brown sugar, hot water, apple juice, ice, maple syrup, butter ; preparation:Stir the kosher salt and brown sugar into hot water until dissolved. Mix in apple juice and ice. Place the turkey breast in a 2 gallon resalable plastic bag. Pour the brine over, seal and place in refrigerator for about 2 hours. Preheat oven to 375 degrees and roast the turkey breast side up on a rack over a shallow roasting pan. After the first hour begin basting the breast with the maple-butter glaze. Baste every 15 minutes until the temperature of the breast reaches 165 degrees. Remove from the oven, tent with foil and allow to rest for 15 to 20 minutes before slicing. ; name: bucatini with pancetta and tomatoes ; ingredients: bucatini pasta, olive oil, onions, pancetta, canned tomatoes, bocconcini, green onion ; preparation:Add pasta to large pot of boiling water. Boil uncovered until tender. Drain. Heat oil in pan, add onions and pancetta. Cook, stirring until onions are soft. Add tomatoes, stir over heat for 2 minutes then add cheese and pasta. Stir until heated through. Top with chopped green onion. ; name: candied acorn squash ; ingredients: acorn squash, butter, brown sugar, maple syrup, cinnamon ; preparation:Cut squash in half lengthwise. Scoop out and discard seeds. Cut squash crosswise into 1-inch slices. Arrange slices slightly overlapping, in a buttered 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish. Bake, covered, in a 375 degrees oven for 35 minutes or until almost tender. Combine melted butter, brown sugar, syrup and cinnamon. Spoon over squash. Continue baking, uncovered, 15 minutes or until squash is tender, basting occasionally with syrup mixture from bottom of pan. ; name: chicken feta baguettes ; ingredients: feta cheese, scallions, cherry tomatoes, baguette, balsamic vinegar, extra virgin olive oil, cooked chicken ; preparation:In a small bowl, combine feta and scallions and mix well. Add tomatoes and toss gently. Slice open baguette or rolls and drizzle vinegar and oil over cut sides of bread. Arrange sliced chicken on bottom half and cover with feta mixture. Close bread, slice and serve. ; name: ciambella della nonna italian breakfast cake ; ingredients: flour, margarine, sugar, salt, eggs, baking powder, vanilla, liqueur, lemon zest, milk ; preparation:Preheat the oven at 220c. Grease your mold and dust with four. Work all the ingredients with the kneading machine until smooth. Spread the batter in the mold. Top with sugar. Bake for 30 minutes at 220c. ; name: hot cross buns and roasted strawberries ; ingredients: strawberries, brown sugar, ground cinnamon, buns, nutella, reduced-fat vanilla yogurt ; preparation:Preheat oven to 230c. Line a small roasting pan with baking paper and add. Strawberries to the pan. Sprinkle strawberries with sugar and cinnamon and toss to coat. Roast strawberries for 10 minutes until strawberries collapse a little and a syrup forms. While strawberries are towards the end of cooking, toast the bun slices in toaster or under a grill. Spread 1 side of each slice with nutella. Place 2 bun slices on each serving plate. Spoon strawberries and syrup over bun. Top with a dollop of yoghurt and serve. ; name: fried apples stekte epler ; ingredients: apples, butter, brown sugar, cinnamon, cardamom, raisins ; preparation:

name: healthy breakfast burrito ; ingredients: low-carb flour tortillas, reduced-fat cheddar cheese, egg whites, frozen southern style hash brown potatoes, bacon bits, onion, garlic powder, pepper, salt, worcestershire sauce ; preparation:Scramble the egg whites with a little pam. Remove. Dice onion and saute with with a little pam till golden brown. Add the hash browns, cover and cook for 10 minutes, stirring once. Add salt, pepper, garlic powder and worcestershire if using. Add the scrambled egg white, cheese and bacon. Divide filling evenly between the tortillas. Roll up and place seam size down in an empty pan and heat on medium till a little brown. Flip over and brown the other side of the tortilla. ; name: chicken and watercress soup ; ingredients: chicken breast, shiitake mushrooms, watercress, chicken stock, salt, cornflour, rice wine, pepper, sesame oil ; preparation:Marinate chicken with salt, cornflour and rice wine, pepper and sesame oil. Bring chicken stock to boil in a saucepan. Add in the mushrooms and cook for 2 minutes. Add in the chicken and stir to separate the chicken slices. When soup starts to boil, add in the watercress and stir. Cook for 1-2 minutes. Remove and serve in a soup bowl. ; name: moroccan broad fava bean salad ; ingredients: broad beans, olive oil, lemon juice, garlic cloves, ground cumin, paprika, coriander, preserved lemon, black olives ; preparation:Bring a large pan of salted water to the boil. Meanwhile pod the beans, put beans into boiling water and boil for 2 mins. Drain and refresh under cold running water. Slip off and discard the outer skin of the bean. Put beans into heavy pan with the olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, cumin and paprika, cook gently over low heat for about 10 mins. Season to taste with salt and pepper and leave to cool in the pan. ; name: sweet potato apple toss ; ingredients: apples, sweet potato, liquid honey, salt and pepper, oil, water, sesame seeds ; preparation:With a grater with large holes, shred apples and sweet potato. In a large bowl combine apples, sweet potato, honey, salt and pepper. Toss to mix. Heat oil in a large nonstick frypan over medium heat until hot. Add sweet potato mixture and water. Cook 13-18 minutes or until sweet potatoes are tender, turning mixture over occasionally. Add seeds or nuts and serve. ; name: cumberland sauce ; ingredients: orange rind, currant jelly, port wine, orange juice, dry mustard, ground ginger, cornstarch, lemon juice, cayenne pepper, salt and pepper ; preparation:Blanch the rind in boiling water. Combine jelly, wine, juice, mustard, and ginger and bring to a boil. Combine cornstarch with reserved juice and add to boiling mixture. Add lemon, cayenne, salt, and pepper and cook, stirring, until thickened. Strain the sauce and add the blanched orange rind. ; name: fresh cream of mushroom soup ; ingredients: fresh mushrooms, butter, flour, stock, half-and-half cream ; preparation:Lighly saute mushrooms in butter. Add flour and stir constantly for about 5 minutes. Slowly add stock, stirring until all is incorporated. Simmer about 10 minutes. Add cream, stir and serve. ; name: shrimp caesar sandwich ; ingredients: french bread, extra virgin olive oil, shrimp, salt and pepper, romaine lettuce, caesar salad dressing, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Slice bread in half long ways and lightly butter center. Heat in 350f oven for 10 minutes. While bread warms, heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add shrimp and saut briskly, cooking through, for approximately 4-5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. In a bowl, toss lettuce with dressing. To assemble sandwich, place cooked shrimp on one half of toasted bread, then top with dressed lettuce and grated parmesan cheese. Top with other half of bread and slice into 4 to 6 portions. ; name: russ s ploughman s lunch style toasted jaffles ; ingredients: bread, butter, chutney, ham, cheddar cheese, pickled onion ; preparation:

name: bbq peanuts ; ingredients: egg white, liquid smoke, salted peanuts, sugar, chili powder, ground cumin, garlic powder, cayenne pepper ; preparation:Pre-heat oven to 250f. Grease a 15x10x1 inch baking pan. In a bowl, whisk egg white until foamy. Add liquid smoke and peanutes. Toss to coat. Combine the remaining ingredients. Sprinkle over nuts. Toss to coat. Spread in a single layer in on to well greased baking pan. Bake at 250f for 1 hour, stirring once half way through. Spread on wasxed paper to cool. Store in an airtight container. ; name: brussels sprouts with mustard sauce ; ingredients: frozen brussels sprouts, butter, onion, flour, salt, ground mustard, black pepper, lemon juice, sugar, worcestershire sauce ; preparation:Cook brussels sprouts in boiling salted water according to package directions. Drain. Meanwhile, melt butter in a small saucepan over med. Heat with onion. Cook for 2-3 minutes. Stir in flour and remaining ingredients, stirring and heating until mixture is bubbly. Pour sauce mixture over cooked brussels sprouts and toss gently to coat. Serve. ; name: creamy peppercorn steaks ; ingredients: black peppercorns, white pepper, new york strip steaks, salt, butter, worcestershire sauce, tabasco sauce, half-and-half ; preparation:Mix the peppercorns and white pepper. Rub over both sides of meat. Chill 1 hour. Sprinkle salt in large skillet, heat on high until salt starts to brown. Sear steaks on both sides. Add butter, reduce heat to med and cook for 2 minutes per side. Add worcestershire sauce and tobasco, cook each side 2 more minutes, or until desired doneness. Remove steaks. Add cream, cook and stir until smooth. ; name: cheddar broccoli bake ; ingredients: frozen broccoli, garlic salt, pepper, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Spray 9 by 13-inch casserole dish with pam. Put broccoli, garlic salt and pepper in a bag and toss. Place in casserole dish and top with cheddar cheese. Cover and bake for 20 minutes. ; name: crispy chicken schnitzel ; ingredients: shake-n-bake, parmesan cheese, miracle whip, milk, boneless skinless chicken breasts ; preparation:Combine shake and bake parmesan cheese in glass pie plate. Mix miracle whip and milk in another pie plate. Pound chicken breasts until flat. Dip in dressing mixture then coat with shake and bake mixture. Place on foil lined sheet and bake at 400f for 15 minutes or until done. ; name: broccoli with indian spiced yogurt ; ingredients: broccoli, extra virgin olive oil, cumin seeds, fennel seeds, cardamom pods, plain yogurt, lemon ; preparation:Wash the broccoli, and break it into its florets, and cook 4 to 5 minutes at the most in salted water. Drain. Heat oil in a skillet, and add the drained broccoli. Meanwhile, in a small skillet, toast the cumin, fennel and cardamom until fragrant, about 3 to 4 minutes, and then grind them in a mortar and pestle. Stir most of the spice mixture into the yogurt with the juice of the lemon. Drizzel the spiced yogurt over the broccoli, and garnish with remaining spice mixture and some zest of the lemon. ; name: yummy cincinnati chili ; ingredients: ground sirloin, onion, tomato sauce, diced tomatoes, dark red kidney beans, chili powder, salt and pepper, cooked spaghetti, cheddar cheese, sour cream ; preparation:Brown meat and onion together and drain off fat. Add tomato sauce, undrained beans, undrained tomatoes, chili powder and salt and pepper to taste. Simmer for 20 minutes. Serve over hot spaghetti. Sprinkle cheddar cheese and sour cream on top. Enjoy. ; name: grilled white asparagus with egg topping ; ingredients: white asparagus, lean ham, eggs, butter, salt ; preparation:

name: cranberry cole slaw ; ingredients: miracle whip, red wine vinegar, honey, craisins, packaged coleslaw mix ; preparation:In a bowl with a lid, and large enough for the finished product, mix well the first 4 ingredients. Add the slaw. Put the lid on and shake, shake, shake. Refrigerate at least 2 hours before serving. The cook time is fridge time. ; name: cheesy chicken breasts ; ingredients: boneless chicken breasts, reduced-fat cheddar cheese, plain flour, ground black pepper, unsalted butter, reduced-sodium chicken broth, dry white wine, dried oregano ; preparation:Beat fillets between 2 sheets of waxed paper until 5mm thick. Cut each slice of cheese in half and place 1 half on top of each fillet. Starting with short end tightly roll up fillets. Tie with kitchen string. On waxed paper, mix flour and pepper. Add chicken and toss gently. In a non-stick fry pan melt butter over medium heat. Add chicken fillets and fry turning occasionaly until golden about 3 minutes. Add chicken stock, wine and dried oregano. Increase heat and bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low simmer until chicken is cooked through and sauce has thickened about 10-12 minutes. ; name: honey soy broiled salmon ; ingredients: scallion, reduced sodium soy sauce, rice vinegar, honey, fresh ginger, salmon fillet, sesame seeds ; preparation:Whisk scallion, soy sauce, vinegar, honey and ginger in a medium bowl until the honey is dissolved. Place salmon in a zip bag and add 3 tablespoons of the sauce and refrigerate for 15 minutes. Preheat broiler and spray a baking dish with cooking spray. Transfer the salmon to the pan skinned side down and broil until cooked through. Drizzle with remaining sauce and garnish with toasted sesame seeds. ; name: shirley mom s cheese strata ; ingredients: bread, white cheddar cheese, milk, salt, dry mustard, eggs, butter ; preparation:Butter and cube each slice of bread. Alterante cubed bread and cheese in well greased 9x13 pan. Mix the remaining ingredients together. Pour over top. Sprinkle pepper or paprika over top. Cover and refrigerate overnight. To bake, preheat oven 325 degrees. Place pan in pan of water. Bake covered for 25 minutes. Uncover and bake for 20 more minutes. ; name: portabellas with leeks and spinach ; ingredients: portabella mushroom caps, olive oil, balsamic vinegar, leeks, fresh spinach, goat cheese, salt, pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450. Place mushroom caps, gill sides up, on a rimmed baking sheet. Drizzle with oil and vinegar, then season with salt and pepper. Bake until caps are just tender, approximately 15 minutes. Top with leeks, spinach and cheese. Bake until spinach begins to wilt and cheese starts to brown. ; name: portuguese chicken with peas frango com ervilhas ; ingredients: chicken pieces, salt & freshly ground black pepper, olive oil, butter, onions, chicken stock, port wine, fresh oregano, green peas ; preparation:Season the chicken with salt and pepper. Heat the oil and butter in a large heavy baking dish over moderate heat and brown the chicken on all sides. Transfer the chicken to a plate and set aside. Saute the onions in the same baking dish until tender but not brown, about 10 minutes. Stir in the stock, wine, and oregano and return the chicken to the skillet. Cover and simmer over low heat until the chicken is tender, 45 to 60 minutes. Adjust the seasoning with salt and pepper and add the peas about 15 minutes before serving. ; name: cheddar apple ham sandwich ; ingredients: light mayonnaise, mustard, liquid honey, multi-grain bread, cheddar cheese, ham, apple ; preparation:In a small bowl, combine mayonnaise, mustard and honey. Spread on one side of each slice of bread. Layer cheese on 4 bread slices. Top each with 2 slices of ham, apple slices and remaining bread. Cut sandwiches in half. Use any apple slices left to garnish. ; name: cool rise bread dough ; ingredients: dry active yeast, warm water, oil, sugar, salt, eggs, flour ; preparation:

name: broccoli cauliflower bacon salad ; ingredients: broccoli floret, cauliflower floret, cheddar cheese, bacon, mayonnaise, white sugar, white wine vinegar ; preparation:Place bacon in a large, deep skillet. Cook over medium high heat until evenly brown. Crumble and set aside. In a medium sized salad bowl, layer in order the broccoli, cauliflower, cheese and bacon. Prepare the dressing by whisking together the mayonnaise, sugar and vinegar. Drizzle dressing over top and serve. ; name: mushroom bacon burgers ; ingredients: ground beef, sliced mushrooms, bacon, green onions, worcestershire sauce, soy sauce, salt, pepper, hamburger buns, cheese slice ; preparation:Mix together first 8 ingredients in a bowl. Shape mixture into 4 patties. Grill over medium-high heat for 10-12 minutes or until done, turning once. Just before taking off the grill, place cheese slice on each patty. Serve on buns with lettuce, tomato, etc. ; name: zucchini rice pilaf ; ingredients: dried basil, butter, fat-free low-sodium chicken broth, long grain rice, carrot, zucchini ; preparation:In a skillet, saute basil and butter for one minute. Then add chicken stock and bring to a boil. Stir in the rice and carrot. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Add zucchini slices and simmer another 10 minutes or until zucchini is tender. ; name: celestial french toast ; ingredients: croissants, eggs, milk, cinnamon, cream cheese, nutmeg, vanilla, butter, strawberry, blueberries ; preparation:Slice each croissant almost in half, so that when they open they resemble a butterfly shape. Beat the eggs, milk, and spices together. In a seperate bowl, whip the cream cheese until soft and smooth. Spread the cream cheese on both sides of each croissant, and top with strawberry slices and blueberries, pushing the fruit slightly into the cream cheese. Fold the croissant back into full shape. Melt the butter in a large frying pan over medium to high heat. Dip the filled croissants into the egg mixture - allowing both sides to soak up the egg mixture. Gently lift the filled croissants out of the egg mixture and place onto frying pan. Fry on one side until golden, turn over and fry the other side until golden, about two minutes per side. Serve warm with fresh fruits, flavored syrups, honey, or preserves. ; name: oven baked white rice perfect every time ; ingredients: butter, onion, long-grain white rice, chicken stock, salt, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. In a medium stovetop-to-oven pot melt butter or olive oil over medium heat. Add chopped onions and cook 3 to 5 minutes, stirring until softened. Add rice and stir until well coated. Add chicken or vegetable stock, salt and pepper to taste. Bring to a boil. Cover and bake until the rice is tender and the stock is absorbed, about 20 to 25 minutes. Let stand, covered for 5 minutes before serving. ; name: garlic lime shrimp ; ingredients: butter, fresh lemon juice, worcestershire sauce, garlic cloves, white sugar, lime peel, cayenne, shrimp, parsley ; preparation:Melt butter in a medium-heave skillet over medium heat. Mix in the next six ingredients. Saut for 30 seconds and add shrimp. Saut shrimp until they are opaque in centre, about 3 minutes, turning occasionally. Stir in parsley and serve over rice or pasta. ; name: butter pecan sugar snap peas ; ingredients: butter, garlic clove, sugar snap pea, pecans, brown sugar, lemon juice, cracked black pepper, salt ; preparation:Melt the butter in a large saute pan over medium heat until starting to foam. Add the minced garlic and cook for about 1 minute. Add the remaining ingredients except for the salt. Cook for approximately 6 minutes, stirring often until the pea pods are crisp-tender. Season with salt to taste and serve. ; name: sliced tomatoes with lemon caper sauce ; ingredients: tomatoes, mayonnaise, plain nonfat yogurt, capers, lemon juice, lemon zest ; preparation:

name: cheesy cheddar mock lasagna ; ingredients: macaroni and cheese mix, ground beef, spaghetti sauce, mozzarella cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f. Prepare dinner according to package directions. Meanwhile, brown meat in large skillet. Drain. Add spaghetti sauce to meat. Mix well. Layer half each of the meat mixture and prepared dinner in 8-inch square baking dish. Repeat layers. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese. Bake 15 minutes or until heated through. ; name: kfc macaroni and cheese ; ingredients: elbow macaroni, velveeta cheese, cheddar cheese, whole milk, salt ; preparation:In a pot bring water to a boil with salt to taste, once the water comes to a boil add the macaroni and cook for 12 to 15 minutes. When the noodles are cooked drain but do not rinse. To make the cheese sauce in a pan over low heat combine the velveeta cheese, shredded cheddar and the milk. Cook the cheeses till they are melted and then add the salt. Add the noodles and mix through. Place in a casserole dish and bake at 400 degrees for 10 to 15 minutes. You may want to broil the top to make a brown top. ; name: raspberry currant jam ; ingredients: red currants, water, red raspberries, sugar ; preparation:Wash the currants and put them in a sauce pan with the water. Cover the pot and bring to a boil, stirring gently, until the currants are all popped. Press them through a sieve, and reserve the puree. Discard the skins, stems and seeds. Gently rinse the raspberries and drain them well. Mix the currant puree, raspberries and sugar in a large pot. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly, until the sugar dissolves. Boil hard until the mixture almost reaches the gell stage, about 20 minutes. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking. Remove from the heat and skim. Seal in sterilized jars. Put in a boiling water bath for 5 minutes. ; name: caramel frosting for angel food cake ; ingredients: butter, brown sugar, milk, powdered sugar ; preparation:Melt the butter in a saucepan and then add the brown sugar. Boil and stir for at least one minute. Take the saucepan off the heat and add the milk. With a hand mixer beat in the powdered sugar, one cup at a time until the spreading consistency is right for you. It should not be a very thick consistency for angel food cake, because it will harden as it cools. ; name: roasted chicken with blueberry peppercorn sauce ; ingredients: chicken, white sugar, white wine, chicken stock, balsamic vinegar, pink peppercorns, blueberries, butter, salt ; preparation:Cut the roasted chicken into quarters. In a warmed saucepan, add the sugar and stir until it melts. Add the wine, chicken stock, vinegar, peppercorns and blueberries. Increase the heat to medium high and reduce the sauce by half. Whisk in the butter to thicken the sauce, taking care not to let it come to the boil. Season with salt to taste. Arrange quartered chicken on serving plates and top with sauce. ; name: granola chocolate chip cookies ; ingredients: butter, sugar, brown sugar, eggs, vanilla, flour, salt, baking soda, granola cereal, semi-sweet chocolate chips ; preparation:In large mixing bowl. Combine butter and both sugars and beat until creamy. Add eggs and vanilla, beating until fluffy. Combine flour, salt and soda. Add to creamed mixture and stir until blended. Stir in granola and chocolate chips. Drop by heaping teaspoonfuls onto a non-stick baking sheet. Bake at 350f for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown. ; name: papaya boats ; ingredients: papayas, banana, kiwi, strawberry, mandarin oranges, vanilla yogurt, honey, of fresh mint, almond granola ; preparation:Cut papaya in half lengthwise. Scoop out seeds. Place each half on a medium plate. Place an equal amount of banana, kiwifruit, strawberries, and oranges in each papaya half. Combine yogurt, honey and mint if using. Mix well. Spoon over fruit before serving. If you would like a little crunch sprinkle with some granola. ; name: chocolate amaretto bars ; ingredients: unsalted butter, sugar, eggs, all-purpose flour, cocoa, amaretto, ground almonds ; preparation:

name: smoked sausage potato chowder ; ingredients: smoked sausage, beef broth, water, scalloped potatoes mix, frozen mixed vegetables, salt, lemon pepper, whole milk, fresh chives ; preparation:Brown sausage in a soup pot over medium high heat. Add broth and water, potatoes and mixed vegetables, bring to a boil. Reduce heat, whisk in sauce mix, salt and lemon pepper until blended. Cover and simmer over low heat 10-15 minutes or until potatoes are tender, stirring occasionally. Stir in milk, cook uncovered, over medium heat until heated through. Remove from heat, stir in chopped chives and serve. ; name: meatballs with tomato with juice gravy ; ingredients: ground beef, ground sausage, salt, pepper, chili powder, onion, saltine crackers, egg, cornstarch, tomato juice ; preparation:Mix the ground beef, sasuage, salt, pepper, chili powder, onion, crackers, 1 beaten egg and 1 cup tomato juice. Shape into balls about the size of walnuts and bake at 350 about 30 minutes, turn and bake about 20 more minutes. You can drain the drippings off or leave them, sometimes i leave them if there is not too much grease. Mix remaining juice, cornstarch, a little chile powder and some of the dripping from the pan, i warm the sauce up in the microwave just a little before putting in the hot pan. Put back in the oven till juice thickens or is good and bubbly. ; name: francie s tasty mince tray ; ingredients: canola oil, onion, garlic, beef mince, tomato paste, dried herbs, canned spaghetti in tomato sauce, frozen peas, cheese, breadcrumbs ; preparation:Preheat oven to 180 degrees celcius. Chop onion finely. Heat oil in a frying pan, cook onions and garlic until soft. Add mince and cook until browned. Add tomato paste and mixed herbs, cook another five minutes. Layer a casserole dish with the mince, then the canned spaghetti, then the frozen peas. Top with the grated cheese and breadcrumbs. Bake in the oven for 20 - 30mins until nicely browned. ; name: chicken in peanut curry ; ingredients: coconut milk, red curry paste, creamy peanut butter, sugar, fish sauce, chicken breasts, garlic, onion, cornstarch, salt ; preparation:In a medium sauce pan heat coconut milk, curry paste, peanut butter, sugar, and fish sauce until they come to a very small boil. Set aside and cool adding cornstarch to thicken. While the sauce is cooling, stir fry 1 chopped onion and 1 t minced garlic. Cut up chicken into small pieces and stir fry with the onion and garlic until chicken is cooked through. Combine the garlic, onion and chicken with the sauce and heat. Spoon the chicken peanut curry over rice and enjoy. ; name: easy loaded baked potato salad ; ingredients: red potatoes, salt & pepper, sour cream, cheddar cheese, green onions, bacon bits ; preparation:Cut potatoes into bite sized pieces. Boil for about 12 minutes or until fork tender. Drain potatoes and allow to cool completely. Add remaining ingredients. All of which can be adjusted to your liking. ; name: olive garden capellini pomodoro ; ingredients: pasta, garlic cloves, salt, pepper, romano cheese, olive oil, fresh tomatoes, fresh basil leaves ; preparation:Boil pasta in salted water and drain. You may process garlic, olive oil, basil leaves, salt and pepper whole in mini chopper or food processor and then stir into drained noodles. Or add garlic, olive oil, and basil. Stir well. Add salt, pepper, and tomatoes. Adjust seasonings to taste. Top with parmesan, romano, or asiago cheese. ; name: raspberry pear crisp ; ingredients: pears, fresh raspberries, sugar, quick-cooking oats, honey, margarine, ground cinnamon, ground nutmeg ; preparation:Place pears in an 8-inch square baking dish coated with non-stick cooking spray. Sprinkle pears with raspberries and sugar. In a bowl, combine the remaining ingredients. Sprinkle over berries. Bake, uncovered, at 350 degrees for 30-35 minutes or until pears are tender and mixture is bubbly. Serve warm. Excellent with vanilla ice cream, especially if you drizzle the juice over the ice cream. Diabetic exchange is 2 fruits. ; name: cheeseburger zucchini pie ; ingredients: lean ground beef, onion, zucchini, salt, pepper, italian cheese blend, bisquick reduced-fat baking mix, milk, eggs ; preparation:

name: squash snackers ; ingredients: yellow squash, olive oil, balsamic vinegar, fresh garlic, fresh basil, celery salt, asiago cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Coat the bottom of a casserole dish with olive oil. Line the bottom of the dish with the squash making sure that they are laid out evenly and sprinkle with vinegar. Top with even amounts of garlic, basil and celery salt. Bake uncovered at 350 for 20 minutes. Remove from oven and add about one cube of cheese per slice. Cook for another 15 minutes remove and let cool for five minutes and serve on crackers or eat by themselves. ; name: apple celery salad ; ingredients: tart apples, lemon juice, celery ribs, mayonnaise, dijon mustard, cider vinegar, sugar, dried tarragon, salt ; preparation:Toss the diced apples with the lemon juice. Add the diced celery. In a small bowl, whisk together mayonnaise, mustard, vinegar, sugar and tarragon. Pour mayo mixture over salad and toss to coat. Season with salt if desired. Chill and serve. ; name: cheesy chicken pot biscuit cups low fat low cal ; ingredients: refrigerated biscuits, cooked chicken breast, reduced-fat cream of chicken soup, low-fat cheddar cheese, dried parsley flakes, black pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Separate biscuits and place each biscuit in a cup of an ungreased 12-hole muffin pan, pressing dough up sides to edge of cup. In a medium bowl, combine chicken, chicken soup, cheddar cheese, parsley flakes, and black pepper. Mix well to combine. Evenly spoon chicken mixture into prepared biscuit cups. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven. Place muffin pan on a wire rack and let set for 2-3 minutes. Serve at once. ; name: baby shrimp scampi with angel hair pasta ; ingredients: extra virgin olive oil, butter, shallot, lemon, baby shrimp, dry vermouth, grape tomatoes, angel hair pasta, salt and pepper, fresh chives ; preparation:Get your pasta water going. Start the scampi sauce when you drop your pasta into boiling water to cook. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat. Add extra-virgin olive oil and melt the butter into it. Add shallots and cook a minute or 2, stirring constantly. Add lemon zest and shrimp and heat shrimp through, another minute or two. Add vermouth or wine and tomatoes. Toss another minute to heat the tomatoes through. Add cooked pasta to the pan and toss to coat evenly in sauce and to distribute the shrimp. Season liberally with salt and pepper and serve with chives to garnish. ; name: to die for fettuccine alfredo ; ingredients: fettuccine pasta, butter, heavy cream, salt and pepper, garlic powder, romano cheese, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Bring a large pot of slightly salted water to a boil. Add fettuccine and cook for 8 to 10 minutes until al dente. Drain. Meanwhile, in a large saucepan, melt butter into cream over low heat. Add salt, pepper and garlic powder. Stir in cheeses over medium heat until melted. This will thicken the sauce. Add pasta to sauce. Use enough of the pasta so that all of the sauce is used and the pasta is thoroughly coated. Serve immediately. ; name: birthday cookie ; ingredients: butter, brown sugar, sugar, egg, vanilla extract, all-purpose flour, baking soda, salt, chocolate chips ; preparation:Cream butter and sugars. Add egg and vanilla. Mix on low speed, add dry ingredients. Mix well. Stir in chocolate chips or m&ms. Spray a 12 inch round pizza pan with pam and spread cookie dough evenly to the edges. Bake at 325 degrees f for 15 to 20 minutes, or until light golden brown. When cool, decorate as desired. ; name: orange shortbread ; ingredients: unsalted butter, superfine sugar, orange zest, salt, all-purpose flour, coarse sugar ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f. Blend together butter, superfine sugar, zest, and salt in a bowl with a fork. Sift flour into butter mixture and blend with fork until mixture forms a soft dough. Transfer dough to an ungreased large baking sheet and pat into a 10- by 5-inch rectangle. Prick dough all over with fork and sprinkle with coarse sugar, pressing it gently into dough with your finger. Score dough crosswise with back of a knife into 6 rectangles, then score each rectangle into 2 triangles. Bake shortbread in middle of oven until edges are golden but center is pale, 12 to 17 minutes. Cool on baking sheet on a rack 10 minutes, then cut into 12 triangles along scored lines while still warm. Transfer triangles with a long spatula to a rack to cool completely. Shortbread keeps 1 week. ; name: oakhill potatoes ; ingredients: potatoes, bacon, butter, salt, milk, onion, eggs, flour, cheese, dried breadcrumbs ; preparation:

name: sirloin steak bites for two ; ingredients: salt and pepper, butter, oil, top sirloin steak, onion, green pepper, beef bouillon cube, water ; preparation:Salt and pepper the steak pieces. Heat butter and oil in lg skillet. Add steak pieces and cook on med-hi, stirring, for 4 minutes. Remove steak and keep warm. Add onions and peppers to skillet. Cook and stir for 2 minutes. Add the crushed boullion and water. Let mixture come to a boil. Spoon onto top of steak bites. ; name: wato s chilli sauce ; ingredients: fresh chili peppers, white vinegar, white sugar, ginger, sultanas, salt, garlic ; preparation:Roughly chop chillies. Take out the seeds before chopping if you like a mild chilli sauce. Place the chopped chillies in a blender with a little bit of vinegar, blend on high speed for a minute. Then place all the ingredients, including the chillies, into a sauce pan and bring to the boil, reduce to a simmer. Simmer for approximately 30 minutes or until the chillies and sultanas are very soft. Let cool. Then in a clean blender blend the chilli sauce until smooth and creamy. You should end up with approximately 1. 5 litres of chilli sauce. Bottle into sterilised jars. ; name: marbled eggs with crabmeat filling ; ingredients: water, tea bags, hard-boiled eggs, mayonnaise, fresh tarragon, crabmeat, yellow mustard ; preparation:Bring water to boil, turn off heat, add tea and steep for 5 min. Roll eggs on counter to crack shells all over. Do not peel. Place eggs in tea, simmer 10 min. Remove from heat, let eggs cool in tea. Refrigerate eggs in cooled liquid at least 1 hour. Drain eggs, peel and blot dry. Cut in half, scoop out yolks. Mash and mix with remaining ingredients. Refill egg halves with yolk mixture. ; name: dairy free alfredo sauce ; ingredients: olive oil, garlic clove, plain soymilk, all-purpose flour, nutritional yeast, oregano, salt, black pepper, nutmeg ; preparation:Heat oil over medium heat in a large skillet. Add minced garlic and lightly saute just until fragrant. Stir in the flour and stir for about one minute. This will be thick. Slowly pour in the milk. Add salt, pepper, oregano and nutmeg. Stir until creamy and thick. Turn off the heat and stir in nutritional yeast. Serve over your choice of pasta. ; name: dulce de leche cream cake ; ingredients: yellow cake mix, eggs, oil, water, sweetened condensed milk, caramel ice cream topping, heavy whipping cream, powdered sugar, vanilla, pecans ; preparation:Prepare cake mix according to directions for a 13 x 9 baking pan, cool completely in pan on wire rack. Place sweetened condensed milk in a large, microwave safe bowl. Micro on med. For 4 minutes, stirring half way through. Reduce to med-low power, micro for 16 to 24 minutes, whisking every few minutes, until thick and light caramel color. Stir in caramel topping. Cool for 15 minutes. Spread evenly over cake, cool completely. Beat whipping cream in a large mixing bowl until soft peaks form. Add sugar and vanilla, beat until stiff peaks form. Spoon over cake, sprinkle with nuts. Refrigerate for 1 to 2 hours. ; name: french chicken with sherry nutmeg sauce ; ingredients: skinless chicken thighs, onion, chicken broth, dry sherry, nutmeg, cayenne pepper, salt and pepper, parsley, skim milk, flour ; preparation:Put the chicken in a non-stick frying pan. Cook slowly over moderate heat with no fat added until well browned. Drain off melted fat. Add the onion, broth and sherry. Sprinkle with seasonings. Cover and simmer over very low heat until nearly tender, 40 to 50 minutes. Uncover. Continue to simmer uncovered until the liquid is reduced by half. Whisk milk and flour together and stir into the pan. Cook and stir until sauce is bubbling and thick. ; name: balsamic duck breasts and asparagus pure ; ingredients: duck breasts, salt & pepper, balsamic vinegar, asparagus, yukon gold potato, olive oil, mesclun, radicchio ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f. Prick the breasts with a knife to make some holes. In an ovenproof skillet cook the breasts fat side down to render the fat, about 10 minutes, drain. Turn over and cook in the oven 5 minutes. Add balsamic vinegar and cook 5 minutes more. Reserve the asparagus. Add steamed asparagus to a processor and puree. Add the puree, olive oil, salt & pepper to the potatoes, mix well. Slice duck breasts. Add puree to 4 plates, arrange duck breasts alongside. Garnish with mesclun, radicchio and asparagus. ; name: deviled oven fried chicken ; ingredients: buttermilk, dijon mustard, garlic, ground red pepper, boneless skinless chicken breasts, cracker crumb, parmesan cheese, dried sage, dried rosemary ; preparation:

name: strawberry banana ice box pie ; ingredients: graham cracker pie crust, bananas, fresh strawberries, cream cheese, sweetened condensed milk, lemon juice, vanilla flavoring ; preparation:Line pie crust with sliced bananas and strawberries. Whip cream cheese until light and fluffy. Gradually beat in milk. Add lemon juice and vanilla. Blend well. Pour over bananas and strawberries. Chill for 2 hours or until firm. ; name: peanut butter no bakes ; ingredients: sugar, light corn syrup, creamy peanut butter, vanilla, crisp rice cereal ; preparation:In a large saucepan, bring sugar and corn syrup to boil. Remove from heat. Stir in peanut butter and vanilla. Mix in cereal. Drop by large spoonful onto wax paper. Let cool before removing from wax paper. ; name: three colours chocolate crme ; ingredients: dark chocolate, white chocolate, chips, eggs, milk, sugar ; preparation:Break up each type of chocolate separately. Separate the eggs and place the egg whites in a measuring jug and keep in a cool place. Place the egg yolks in a bowl and stir. Heat the milk to boiling point, remove from the hob, and stir into the egg yolks. Pour everything back into the pan, and heat to boiling point, stirring all the while. Divide the crme into 3 portions. Dissolve one of each of the chocolate types into one each of the hot crme mixtures. Allow to cool. Beat the egg whites to a froth them gradually add the sugar to the beaten egg whites. Continue to beat until the mixture forms stiff peaks and is shiny. Fold the stiffly beaten egg whites in equal parts into the cooled chocolate mixtures. Place equal amounts of each chocolate in espresso coffee cups and keep cool until serving. ; name: quinoa corn and tomato salad with chive infused oil ; ingredients: water, quinoa, fresh corn kernels, cherry tomatoes, fresh flat-leaf parsley, oil, fresh lime juice, white wine vinegar, salt, garlic clove ; preparation:Combine water and quinoa in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer 10 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Remove from heat. Let stand 10 minutes. Fluff with a fork to separate and let cool a bit if time. While quinoa is cooking, combine corn, tomatoes, and parsley in a medium bowl. In a small bowl, whisk together oil and remaining ingredients. After quinoa has stood for 10 min., add to vegetable mixture, toss to combine, then drizzle dressing over it. Toss well to coat. Let stand 10 minutes before serving. ; name: orange fudge sauce ; ingredients: evaporated milk, semi-sweet chocolate chips, sugar, margarine, orange-flavored liqueur ; preparation:Combine milk, chocolate chips, and sugar in saucepan. Heat just to boiling over medium heat, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Stir in butter and liqueur. Serve warm or cold. Store in airtight container in refrigerator up to 1 month. ; name: rosti dauphinoise ; ingredients: floury potatoes, garlic cloves, gruyere, double cream, butter, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 180 degrees centigrade. Peel and coarsely grate the potatoes, ideally using the grating blade on a food processor or by hand using a sturdy box grater. Lightly butter a 1. 2 ltr deep ovenproof dish, such as a souffle dish. Mix together all the ingredients, then. Dot the top with butter and bake for 40 minutes until golden and cooked through. ; name: simply scalloped potatoes sp5 ; ingredients: simply potatoes homestyle slices, heavy cream, salt, chicken broth, shredded cheddar cheese ; preparation:Arrange layer over potatoes in greased casserole dish. Sprinkle with salt. Repeat layering, ending in potatoes. Mix cream and broth, pour over potatoes. Sprinkle cheese over top and cover dish with foil. Preheat oven to 400 degrees and bake for 30 minutes. Remove foil and continue baking for another 10 minutes. ; name: refrigerated rolls cinnamon twists ; ingredients: sugar, ground cinnamon, refrigerated biscuits, butter, nuts ; preparation:

name: taverns ; ingredients: water, onion, ground beef, ketchup, chili powder, yellow mustard, hamburger buns ; preparation:Add onions to water in medium saucepan. Boil on medium heat until onions are transparent. Add ground beef and ketchup. Continue cooking on medium heat for 15 minutes. Add mustard and chili powder. Serve on hamburger bun. ; name: sweet potatoes from the carolinas ; ingredients: olive oil, shallots, sweet potatoes, fresh parsley, salt and black pepper ; preparation:Heat oil in saucepan over medium heat. Add shallots and sweet potatoes. Season well. Cover and cook for 18 to 30 minutes, stirring 3 to 4 times. When vegetables are cooked sprinkle with parsley. Serve. ; name: famous red lobster shrimp scampi ; ingredients: medium shrimp, pure olive oil, garlic, white wine, fresh lemon, italian seasoning, butter, parsley, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Heat cast iron skillet and add olive oil. Add shrimp and cook until tender and no longer translucent, reduce heat. Remove shrimp and set aside. Add garlic and cook 2-3 minutes. Do not allow garlic to brown - it will make it bitter. Add white wine, and lemon juice. Cook until wine is reduced by half. After it is reduced, add italian seasoning. Reduce heat to low, and add butter. If pan is too hot, the butter will separate. Add shrimp back into sauce, add parsley, and season to taste with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with grated parmesan cheese. ; name: baked eggplant melt sandwich ; ingredients: unseasoned breadcrumbs, fresh basil, parmesan cheese, salt, egg, eggplants, olive oil, buns, pasta sauce, part-skim mozzarella cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. Combine breadcrumbs, basil, parmesan and salt in shallow bowl. Whisk egg in another shallow bowl and dip eggplant slices, then coat each slice in the breadcrumb mixture. Place eggplant on parchment paper-lined baking sheet, drizzle with olive oil and bake for 15 minutes. Transfer baked eggplant to clean plate and discard parchment paper. Set toasted buns halves, cut side down, on baking sheet. Divide eggplant slices evenly among bun halves, spoon on sauce and top with cheese. Place under broiler for 2 minutes until cheese is bubbling. ; name: seafood supreme ; ingredients: cream cheese, mayonnaise, sour cream, seafood cocktail sauce, shrimp, mozzarella cheese, green onions, green pepper, tomatoes ; preparation:Blend the first 3 ingredients. Mix well. Spread mixture over a large decorative glass dish. Top with enough cocktail sauce to cover the dish. Chop enough shrimp to scatter around the dish. Top with mozzarella cheese, green onions, green pepper and tomatoe. Chill for 2 - 3 hours before serving. Serve with assorted crackers. ; name: blue cheese corn bread ; ingredients: jiffy corn muffin mix, egg, milk, blue cheese, green onions, pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f grease 8-inch square baking pan. Combine all ingredients in medium bowl and mix until blended. Spread in prepared pan. Bake until firm to touch and golden brown, about 30 minutes. Cool slightly. Cut into squares and serve hot. ; name: quinoa with oyster mushrooms and adzuki beans ; ingredients: olive oil, carrot, green onions, oyster mushroom, vegetable broth, adzuki beans, quinoa, salt, ground black pepper ; preparation:Crushed the oyster mushrooms slightly and remove the tough stems. Saut carrots, onions, and mushrooms for 3 minutes. Add broth, beans and quinoa. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes or until all liquid is absorbed. Fluff with a fork. ; name: cocoa chocolate mousse with egg whites ; ingredients: egg white, nonfat sour cream, brown sugar, unsweetened cocoa, instant coffee granules, vanilla extract ; preparation:

name: tuna noodle salad my way ; ingredients: egg noodles, tuna in water, green onion, hard-boiled eggs, mayonnaise, season salt, ground pepper, dill relish, celery ; preparation:Boil water in a 5 quart pan and cook egg noodles to al dente. Drain and let cool. Drain tuna and combine with onion, celery mayonnaise, dill pickle relish add chopped boiled eggs. Mix well. Add season salt and ground pepper and mix well. Taste. Add more seasoning or mayonnaise to your liking. Best if chilled for at least 1 hour. Serve cold. ; name: tropical pineapple salad ; ingredients: pineapple, honey, passion fruit, dark rum ; preparation:Halve the pineapple, cut away and discard the core, and scoop out the pineapple flesh. Reserve the shell. Roughly chop the flesh and toss with enough honey to sweeten. Halve the passion fruit, spoon out the pulp, and combine with the pineapple. Stir in the rum and chill for 30 minutes so the flavors marry. Spoon the fruit back into the shell and serve. ; name: mini meatloaf low carb ; ingredients: low-sugar ketchup, splenda brown sugar blend, apple cider vinegar, colby-monterey jack cheese, lean ground beef, egg whites, breadcrumbs, salt, black pepper, onion powder ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350f spray a baking dish with cooking spray. Cut the 4 oz of cheese into 4 equal parts, longways. Mix together the ingredients for the sauce. Set both aside for later. Using your hands, mix the remaining ingredients together in a large bowl. Divide the mixture into 4 equal parts. Take the divided amount & shape it around 1 chunk of cheese, making it into a loaf shape. Place into the baking dish then repeat with the other 3. Brush the sauce over all 4 meatloaves. Bake in the oven for 35-40 minutes then drain off any excess grease. Serve immediately or let cool then freeze in individual containers for later use. ; name: egg and vegetable pie ; ingredients: eggs, bacon, zucchini, red capsicum, carrot, cheese, vegetable oil, self raising flour ; preparation:Whisk eggs together. Add flour and oil gradually and beat until smooth. Add all other ingredients. Place in a greased pie dish. Bake at 200 celcius for 30 minutes. Serve hot with tomato sauce. ; name: auntie s no bake cookies ; ingredients: white sugar, cocoa, milk, butter, light corn syrup, vanilla extract, peanut butter, shredded coconut, oats ; preparation:Combine sugar and cocoa in a medium sauce pan. Whisk in milk and corn syrup. Add butter. Cook and stir until mixture has boiled for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla, peanut butter, oats, and coconut. Allow to cool in pan for 10-15 minutes. Scoop out with a cookie scoop and drop onto waxed paper. They will keep their shape. Allow to cool completely and store in airtight container. ; name: spinach dip pinwheels ; ingredients: frozen chopped spinach, knorr vegetable soup mix, sour cream, mayonnaise, water chestnuts, green onions, flour tortillas ; preparation:Stir together soup mix, sour cream, and mayo until well blended. Stir in spinach, water chestnuts and green onions. Spread tortillas with dip, not quite to the edges. Roll up tightly. Slice into 1 inch pieces. Arrange on serving platter and refrigerate until ready to serve. ; name: mom s pecan pie ; ingredients: white corn syrup, sugar, eggs, butter, vanilla, pecans, unbaked pie shell ; preparation:Boil syrup and sugar together for about 2 minutes. Pour over eggs gradually, stirring well. Add butter, vanilla and pecans. Pour into pie shell. Bake in preheated 375 oven for about 50 minutes, or until knife inserted in center comes out clean. ; name: figs with marsala and orange ; ingredients: figs, marsala wine, oranges, orange, honey, orange blossom water, creme fraiche, mint leaves ; preparation:

name: caesar tortellini ; ingredients: refrigerated cheese tortellini, caesar salad dressing, parmesan cheese, cherry tomatoes, olives, salad greens ; preparation:Cook and drain tortellini according to package directions. Toss with dressing and cheese. Refrigerate approximately 4 hours, stirring occasionally. Toss tortellini with tomatoes and olives. Serve in a bowl lined with salad green. Serve with toothpicks, for an appetizer. ; name: spaghetti alla carbonara mario batali ; ingredients: extra virgin olive oil, pancetta, spaghetti, parmigiano-reggiano cheese, eggs, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:Bring 6 quarts of water to boil in a large pot, and add 2 tablespoons salts. Meanwhile, combine the olive oil and pancetta in a 12- to 14-inch saut pan set over medium heat, and cook until the pancetta has rendered its fat and is crispy and golden. Remove from the heat and set aside. Cook the spaghetti in the boiling water until just al dente. Scoop out cup of the pasta cooking water and set aside. Drain the pasta. Add the reserved pasta water to the pan with the pancetta, then toss in the pasta and heat, shaking the pan, for 1 minute. Remove from the heat, add 1 cup of the parmigiano, the egg whites, and pepper to taste, and toss until thoroughly mixed. Divide the pasta among four warmed serving bowls. Make a nest in the center of each one, and gently drop an egg yolk into each nest. Season the egg yolks with more pepper and sprinkle the remaining cup parmigiano over the top. Serve immediately. ; name: cazuela chilean chicken stew ; ingredients: chicken drumsticks, butternut squash, potatoes, corn on the cob, carrots, chicken broth, cooked rice, hot pepper sauce, salt and pepper, fresh cilantro ; preparation:In a large soup kettle or dutch oven, place chicken, squash, potatoes, corn, carrots and broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 25 minutes or until chicken is done and vegetables are tender. Serve over rice in a shallow soup bowl. Pass hot pepper sauce, salt, pepper and cilantro or parsley. ; name: sweet and tangy chicken ; ingredients: roasting chicken, mayonnaise, dry onion soup mix, russian salad dressing, apricot-pineapple preserves, cooked rice ; preparation:In a 12x8x2 inch dish, arrange chicken pieces with the thickest, meaty pieces to the outside edges of the dish. In a small bowl, stir together the mayonnaise, soup mix, dressing and preserves. Spread this mixture over the chicken, coating each piece well. Cover with wax paper. Microwave on high for 18-22 minutes. Let stand 5-10 minutes before you serve it so the chicken absorbs the flavor of the sauce. Serve over rice. ; name: lemon pizza ; ingredients: pizza dough, heavy cream, mozzarella cheese, ham, onion, fresh lemon juice, baby arugula, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:Place a pizza stone on the floor or the lowest rack of your oven. Preheat the oven to 500 degrees f. Pat the pizza dough into a 12-inch diameter circle and place it on a peel. Spread on the heavy cream, then the mozzarella. Place the ham slices on evenly and scatter the onions over the top. Sprinkle the lemon juice over everything. Slide onto the stone and bake for 8 to 10 minutes. Cover the pizza with the baby arugula and grind on some black pepper. ; name: sugar free holiday nog ; ingredients: sugar-free instant vanilla pudding mix, skim milk, vanilla extract, sugar substitute, evaporated skim milk ; preparation:Combine pudding, 2 cups milk, vanilla and sugar substitute in a bowl. Mix according to pudding directions. Pour into a half gallon container with tight fitting lid. Add 3 cups milk. Shake well. Add evaporated milk and shake. Add remaining milk. Shake well. Chill. ; name: onion soup with a crust kuoritettu sipulikeitto ; ingredients: onions, butter, beef stock, bay leaf, salt, pepper, french bread, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. In a heavy pot over medium heat, brown the onions in the butter. Add the beef broth and bay leaf. Add salt and pepper to taste. Cover and simmer 30 minutes. Remove bay leaf. Pour the soup into an ovenproof casserole and cover with the bread slices. Sprinkle cheese over bread slices. Bake in preheated oven until the cheese has melted and is slightly browned. Serve immediately. ; name: souper rice ; ingredients: rice, water, onion soup mix, margarine ; preparation:

name: oatmeal beer bread ; ingredients: rolled oats, flour, salt, sugar, baking powder, water, beer, butter ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 5x9 loaf pan. Combine oats, flour, salt, sugar, baking powder, water and beer and put into the prepared loaf pan. Bake for 30 minutes. Generously brush top of loaf with melted butter, reserving some for a second brushing. Return to oven and bake for 30-40 minutes more until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean. Remove from the oven and brush with reserved butter. Serve warm. ; name: golden eggplant aubergine rounds ; ingredients: eggplant, dry breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese, italian dressing ; preparation:In shallow bowl, mix crumbs with parmesan cheese. Put dressing in another bowl. Dip eggplant slices in dressing, then into crumbs. Put in a single layer on sprayed baking sheet. Bake at 450 for 15 minutes, until golden brown. Turn rounds once while baking. ; name: basic french toast ; ingredients: eggs, milk, sugar, salt, white bread, butter, maple syrup ; preparation:Put the eggs in a shallow bowl and whisk them until well mixed. Add the milk, sugar and salt. Mix well. Place one slice of bread at a time in the mixture until the egg mixture is absorbed. Transfer bread slices to griddle or skillet, heating slowly until bottom is golden brown. Turn and brown the other side. Serve french toast hot with butter and syrup. ; name: marinated green olives ; ingredients: green olives in brine, fresh rosemary, fennel seed, peppercorn, dried chilies, preserved lemons, olive oil ; preparation:Crush the fennel and peppercorns in a pestle and mortar. Chop the chillies into smallish pieces. Discard the flesh of the preserved lemon and rinse the skin to remove excess salt. Cut into fine strips. Drain the olives and give them a rinse off in water. Place the olives in a clean jar and add the remaining ingredients. Cover with olive oil and leave to marinate. I have left them as little as a couple of hours and up to a few weeks. Pop them in the fridge, but bring back to room temperature before serving. ; name: baked chicken with yogurt crust peaches ; ingredients: herb-seasoned stuffing cubes, skinless chicken breasts, plain yogurt, peaches, cinnamon sugar ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a food processor or blender, reduce the stuffing mix to coarse crumbs. Pour them onto a sheet of wax paper. Coat one piece of chicken breast with yogurt as thickly as possible, then dip it into the crumbs to coat. Lay the chicken in an oiled baking dish large enough to hold chicken and peaches in one layer. Repeat with the remaining chicken. Surround the chicken with the peach halves, cut side down. Sprinkle the peaches with cinnamon sugar. Bake for 20 minutes, or until the breasts are just cooked through but not dry. ; name: amazingly delicious toffee squares ; ingredients: unsalted butter, light brown sugar, egg yolk, vanilla, flour, milk chocolate, pecans ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Lightly butter a 9x13 inch pan. Place the butter and brown sugar in a bowl and blend until creamy and light colored. Add the egg yolk, vanilla and flour, blending well after each addition and scraping down the sides of the bowl. Spread into the prepared pan and pat down with your hands or a wide spoon. Bake until golden brown, about 15-20 minutes. Spread the chocolate over the warm batter, and let sit for 3-5 minutes. Sprinle with the pecans. Cut when warm into 24 pieces with a knife dipped in cold water. ; name: deviled eggs with fresh tarragon and capers ; ingredients: hard-boiled eggs, extra virgin olive oil, mayonnaise, dijon mustard, celery, fresh tarragon, capers, shallots, salt, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:Boil the eggs, shell and cut in half lengthwise. In a small bowl mash the eggs yolks with a fork. Mix in the olive oil, mayonnaise, and dijon mustard. Stir in the celery, fresh tarragon, capers and the shallots. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Divide and spoon the mixture into the egg halves. Garnish each egg half with 1 or 2 slices of celery. If not eating immediately, cover well and refrigerate. ; name: double cherry crumble ; ingredients: cherry pie filling, dark sweet cherries, quick oats, bisquick baking mix, brown sugar, nuts, butter, cinnamon ; preparation:

name: tomato bacon and onion fettuccine ; ingredients: fettuccine, bacon, onion, tomatoes, dried basil ; preparation:Cook pasta to desired doneness. Drain and cover to keep warm. In medium skillet, cook bacon until crisp. Remove and set on paper towels to drain. Reserve 1 tbsp drippings in the skillet. Add onion and cook until crisp-tender. Crumble bacon, add bacon, tomato and basil to the onions. Cook until just heated. Add to cooked pasta and toss well. Add salt and pepper if you want. ; name: pecan truffles ; ingredients: brown sugar, butter, eggs, chocolate chips, pecans, pie crust ; preparation:Mix first 5 ingredients together. Unroll pie crust and cut into small rounds. Place in bottom of mini muffin pan. Put 1 teaspoons pecan and sugar mixture on each. Bake at 350f for 30 minutes. ; name: ham and smoked gouda salad ; ingredients: rotini pasta, mayonnaise, honey, dijon mustard, cooked ham, celery, smoked gouda cheese ; preparation:Cook pasta according to package directions. Rinse in cold water. Drain. In a small bowl, mix together the mayo, honey and mustard. In a serving bowl, add the pasta, ham, celery, and cheese. Stir to combine. Add the dressing mixture. Toss to coat. Season with salt and pepper if desired. Serve now or chill and serve later. ; name: sweet iced peach tea ; ingredients: brewed tea, peaches in juice, water, sugar ; preparation:Make the tea in a 3 or 4 quart pitcher. Set aside. Pour peaches and water into a blender. Blend on high speed until well blended. Add sugar and blend for a few more seconds. Add more water until there is 1 quart. Blend for a few seconds-- pulse. Pour this mixture into the pitcher of tea and stir until well mixed. Chill before serving. Serve over ice or warm up for a hot drink. ; name: apricot scones ; ingredients: bisquick baking mix, dried apricot, sugar, whipping cream, egg, milk ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Grease cookie sheet. Mix baking mix, apricots, sugar, whipping cream and egg until dough forms. Turn onto surface dusted with baking mix, roll in baking mix to coat. Shape into ball, knead 10 times. Pat into 8 inch circle on cookie sheet. Brush with milk, sprinkle with sugar. Cut into 8 wedges. Bake 12 minutes or until golden brown, separate carefully. Serve warm. ; name: george washington pie dessert ; ingredients: graham cracker crumbs, butter, cream cheese, powdered sugar, walnuts, cool whip, cherry pie filling ; preparation:Mix the melted butter with the graham crackers and press into a 8x8 dish. Bake for 8 minutes in a 350 degree oven. Cool. Cream the cream cheese and powdered sugar and spread over the cooled crust, sprinkle with chopped nuts and spread the cool whip over this and chill for about an hour. Spread the cherry pie filling over the cool whip. Keep refrigerated. Will keep several days in the refrigerator. ; name: hot salami chicken stroganoff ; ingredients: onion, garlic clove, mushrooms, salami, chicken strips, tomato paste, sour cream, ground pepper ; preparation:Saute onions and garlic in a large frypan until brown. Add mushrooms and salami to the pan with the chicken strips. Cook for 6-8 mins and add tomato paste, simmer for 2 minutes. Turn heat to low and stir in sour cream, simmer for another 2 minutes. Season with ground pepper and serve over rice or noodles. ; name: jalapeno white sauce ; ingredients: whipping cream, sour cream, chicken base, clarified butter, flour, jalapeno, jalapeno juice, monterey jack and cheddar cheese blend ; preparation:

name: rose scented geranium lemonade ; ingredients: water, sugar, rose-scented geranium leaves, fresh lemon juice ; preparation:In a small pot boil water with sugar. Remove from heat, add leaves and let infuse until cold. Squeeze out leaves well. Add lemon or lime juice. Pour it into bottle and refrigerate. To serve, add 1 tablespoon of this concentrate to each cup of chilled water and mix well. Serve over ice in a goblet garnished with a small scented geranium leaf of rose petals. Store refrigerated for at least two weeks. ; name: fruit shake ; ingredients: fresh peaches, strawberry, apple juice, vanilla frozen yogurt ; preparation:Combine peaches, strawberries, and apple juice in container of blender or food processor, process until smooth. Add frozen yogurt, and process until blended. Serve immediately. Can exchange fresh peaches with frozen ones. Use 2 cups frozen peach slices. ; name: cabbage and sauerkraut for the crock pot ; ingredients: green cabbage, sauerkraut, sweet onion, diced tomatoes, garlic, celery seed, butter, brown sugar, salt and black pepper ; preparation:Place chopped cabbage into crock pot. Place sauerkraut and onions over top. In a mixing bowl, combine all remaining ingredients and mix well. Pour into crock pot. Cover and cook on low for 4-6 hours, or until cabbage is as tender as you want. Stir well before serving. ; name: chocolate chip feather pancakes ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, egg, milk, cooking oil, chocolate chips ; preparation:In mixing bowl thoroughly stir together flour, sugar, baking powder and salt. Combine egg, milk and cooking oil. Add all at once to dry ingredients, beating until blended. Pour in chocolate chips. Mix well. Bake on hot lightly greased griddle. Makes about 32 dollar-size pancakes or 6-8 4-inch pancakes. ; name: easy whole wheat pie crust ; ingredients: whole wheat flour, light brown sugar, shortening, cold water, sea salt ; preparation:Place flour, sugar, salt, sugar, and shortening in large tupperware or other plastic container with lid. Seal tightly. Shake 3 minutes. Open & make sure mixture is uniform. Add water. Shake 3 more minutes & open to see if mixture is large dough ball of uniform consistency. Roll out on floured surface. Can be frozen for later use. ; name: granny smith cake ; ingredients: walnuts, spice cake mix, instant butterscotch pudding mix, eggs, canola oil, cold water, granny smith apples, golden raisin, icing sugar ; preparation:Preheat oven to 325f. Grease and flour a tube or bundt pan, then sprinkle walnuts in the bottom. Set aside. In a large bowl, combine cake mix, pudding mix, eggs, oil and water. With mixer at medium speed, beat for 3 minutes or until well blended. Stir in chopped apples, plus raisins if desired. Pour batter into prepared pan and bake in preheated oven for 55 to 65 minutes or until a tester inserted in centre comes out clean. Cool in pan for 15 minutes, then turn out onto a rack and cool completely. Dust with icing sugar, if desired. ; name: chocolate chip cheesecake cookies ; ingredients: cream cheese, sugar, eggs, lemon juice, vanilla, refrigerated chocolate chip cookie dough ; preparation:Mix cream cheese, sugar, eggs, vanilla, and lemon juice until smooth. Cut one package of cookie dough into about 24 slices. Line bottom of a greased 13x9 inch pan with sliced cookie dough. Pour cream cheese mixture into pan to cover cookie dough. Cut remaining cookie dough into slices and cover mixture. Bake at 350 for 35 to 40 minutes. Cool, then chill for 1 hour or more, until very cold. Slice into small squares. ; name: norwegian almond sticks ; ingredients: butter, egg white, almonds, flour, baking powder, eggs, sugar ; preparation:

name: fast and easy corn flake candy ; ingredients: sugar, light corn syrup, peanut butter, corn flakes ; preparation:Combine sugar and corn syrup in a dutch oven. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Stir in peanut butter. Add corn flakes and stir until all are coated with syrup mixture. Drop by tablespoon onto waxed paper. You can add 1 tsp of vanilla for a slightly different flavor. Or you can spread the mix out into a 13 x 9 dish and cut into squares. ; name: zack s slow cooker baked beans and sausage ; ingredients: center-cut bacon, baked beans, smoked sausage, hickory flavored barbecue sauce, steak sauce, brown sugar ; preparation:Fry bacon and drain on paper towels. While frying bacon slice smoked sausage on the bias and place all remaining ingredients in crock pot or slow cooker. Using a small amount of the bacon grease brown the smoked sausage. Crumble bacon and place in cooker. Stir in smoked sausage. Cover and cook on low 4hrs. To save time i sometimes use the precooked bacon bits, bacon is a must for my family in this dish. ; name: potatoes with mustard and honey ; ingredients: mustard, honey, corn oil, potatoes, onions, salt and pepper ; preparation:Peel the potatoes and cut into cubes of about 3 centimeters cut up the onions. Mix the mustard, honey, oil, salt and pepper. Then stir the mixture into the potatoes. Grease a large rectangular pan and spread the mixture into it. Bake at 200c for 50 minutes. After about 25 minutes, stir up the mixture. ; name: pot o greens ; ingredients: water, turkey legs, collard greens, salt, sugar ; preparation:Place the water and turkey legs in an 8-quart pot over medium-high heat. Cover, bring to a boil, and allow to simmer for 10 minutes. In the meantime, remove any large stems from the greens and wash them thoroughly. Do so in a sink with at least 5 inches of water. Moving the leaves around in the water and allowing them to sit for a few minutes to allow the sand or dirt to fall to the bottom of the sink. Once clean, chop priecs in half. You should have 2 pounds of greens once they are stemmed. Once the turkey legs have simmered for 10 minutes, add the greens, salt and sugar, reduce the heat to low, cover, and allow to simmer gently for 45 minutes or until the greens are tender. Move the greens around every 10 to 15 minutes. Taste and season with additional salt, if desired. Serve immediately. ; name: dirt cake ; ingredients: oreo cookies, cream cheese, powdered sugar, margarine, whipped topping, instant vanilla pudding, milk, vanilla ; preparation:Mix cream cheese, sugar, margarine and whipped topping. Set aside. Mix pudding, milk and vanilla according to pudding directions. Combine mixtures to make filling. Layer crumbs, filling, crumbs, etc. In 9 x 13 inch dish. Refrigerate overnight. ; name: chef dee s crock pot stuffing ; ingredients: margarine, chicken broth, hot water, bread cubes, celery, diced onion, poultry seasoning, parsley flakes, salt, pepper ; preparation:Combine melted margarine, chicken broth and hot water. In a large bowl, combine the remaining ingredients. Pour the water mixture over the crumb mixture and stir. Spray crock pot with pam, then spoon stuffing into it. Cook on low for 5-6 hours, scraping the sides and stirring once, half way through. Check the moisture once or twice, add a little hot water if necessary, but it should be nice and moist as is. ; name: broccoli california style 1958 ; ingredients: broccoli, oil, garlic clove, onion, dried cayenne pepper, water, salt ; preparation:Heat oil in large skillet. Add garlic, onion, and pepper. Cook until onion is tender, stirring occasionally. Remove pepper and discard. Add broccoli, water and salt. Cover and simmer until tender-crisp, 12-15 minutes. ; name: tempeh chicken salad ; ingredients: tempeh, celery, red bell peppers, dill pickle, scallions, fresh parsley, soy mayonnaise, yellow mustard, lemon juice, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:

name: couscous with peas and parmesan ; ingredients: couscous, chicken broth, butter, parmesan cheese, frozen peas, salt, fresh ground pepper ; preparation:Bring chicken broth to a boil. Add butter, parmesan and cous cous and return to a boil. Remove from heat. Add peas and cover for five minutes. Fluff with fork and add salt and pepper to taste. ; name: pumpkin nacho cheese ball ; ingredients: cream cheese, salsa, cumin, onions, jalapeno, cheddar cheese, nacho cheese flavored tortilla chips, bell pepper ; preparation:With a mixer, blend 16 ounces room-temperature cream cheese with 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese, 3 tablespoons minced onion, 3 tablespoons salsa, 2 teaspoons ground cumin and 1 teaspoon minced jalapeno. Scoop the mix into plastic wrap and form into a ball. Chill approximately 1 hour. Once chilled unwrap and roll into crushed nacho tortilla chips, then press a bell pepper stem into top of ball. Serve with pepper slices and tortilla chips. Prep time does not include chilling time. ; name: lemon ice cream without ice cream maker ; ingredients: lemon juice, lemon zest, sugar, whole milk, heavy cream, salt ; preparation:Combine lemon juice, lemon zest, and sugar in a mixing bowl. Gradually stir in milk, heavy cream and salt. Pour into an 8 inch glass baking dish, cover and freeze until firm.
