Roll out on a floured board 1cm thick and cut out with fancy cookie cutters. Brush with remaining well beaten egg and sprinkle heavily with sesame seeds. Place on a greased baking sheet. Bake in a 325 degree oven for 10 minutes. Cool and enjoy with a good cup of tea. ; name: kittencal s parmesan egg noodles ; ingredients: wide egg noodles, butter, garlic, crushed red pepper flakes, parmesan cheese, green onions, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Cook the egg noodles in a large pot of boiling salted water until tender. Drain and set aside. Heat the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add in garlic and chili flakes. Cook stirring for 2 minutes or until the garlic is softened. Add in the cooked noodles and toss to heat through. Mix in the parmesan cheese and green onion, then season with salt and fresh ground black pepper. Serve with more parmesan cheese. ; name: easy rice main dish ; ingredients: onion, garlic cloves, ground beef, stewed tomatoes, garbanzo beans, tomato juice, water, long-grain white rice ; preparation:Cook ground beef with onions and garlic in skillet till cooked through. Drain fat. Add all other ingredients except rice and heat to boiling. Add rice and cover. Allow to simmer for 15 minutes until the rice is tender. ; name: white asparagus with mushrooms in brown butter ; ingredients: white asparagus, sugar, unsalted butter, mushroom, shallots, fresh thyme, fresh lemon juice, parsley ; preparation:Bring a large pot of sugar-salted water to a boil. Add asparagus and cook until tender, 5 to 6 minutes. Drain and pat dry with paper towel. Melt the butter in a large skillet. When the butter begins to turn brown, add the mushrooms, and cook over fairly high heat, stirring often, until just tender, about 8 minutes. Add shallots and fresh thyme and stir until softened, for about 2 minutes. Add the asparagus and continue to cook until warmed through. Add lemon juice, chopped parsley and whole parsley leaves. Season with salt and pepper. ; name: rice with coconut milk ; ingredients: jasmine rice, coconut cream, sugar, salt, coconut milk ; preparation:Rinse rice in several changes of water. Drain, discard water and set aside. In a medium pot, over medium heat, bring coconut cream to a boil. Add rice, sugar and salt. Add coconut milk and return to a boil. Cook, partially covered, stirring occasionally, about 3 minutes. Reduce heat to low and simmer, covered, stirring occasionally, 15 to 20 minutes, or until all the liquid has been absorbed and the rice has fluffed. ; name: thai green chicken curry with spaghetti ; ingredients: chicken breast, coconut milk, sweet basil, eggplants, green curry paste, fish sauce, sugar, thai chile, kaffir lime leaf, spaghetti ; preparation:

name: amaretto rum cherry cream pie ; ingredients: 10-inch deep dish pie crust, cherry pie filling, egg yolks, sugar, unflavored gelatin, water, whipping cream, amaretto liqueur, rum, semisweet chocolate ; preparation:Beat egg yolks til light, gradually slowly adding the 1 cup sugar, til thick, light and fluffy. Soften gelatin in water in small sauce pan, then bring it to a boil. In a very slow ribbon stream slowly beat into egg yolk mixture. Set aside. Beat whipping cream til thick and stiff, fold into egg yolk mixture. Slowly fold in amaretto and rum. Spread pie cherries on bottom of prepared shell. Fill with egg-cream mixture. Top with grated chocolate. Chill over night or several hours til firm. ; name: brussels sprouts extraordinaire ; ingredients: onion, butter, flour, sugar, tomato juice, salt, pepper, frozen brussels sprouts, shredded cheddar cheese ; preparation:In a skillet, saute onion in butter until tender. Remove onion and set aside. Blend flour into the drippings. Add tomato juice. Cook and stir over low heat until thickened and smooth. Stir in the sugar, salt, pepper and onion. Arrange the brussels sprouts in a greased 1 quart baking dish. Top with the tomato sauce. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake, uncovered, at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. ; name: cookies cream banana pie ; ingredients: oreo cookies, unsalted butter, cookies & cream ice cream, banana, hot fudge ; preparation:Grind the cookies in processor. Place 2 tablespoons of crumbs into a small bowl. Set aside for now. Add the melted butter to crumbs in the processor. Blend until moist crumbs form. Press mixture onto bottom and sides of 9-inch metal pie pan and freeze until firm, 10 minutes. Spread half of the ice cream into the crust. Top pie with slices of banana and spread remaining ice cream over. Sprinkle remaining 2 tablespoons of crumbs over pie. Freeze until firm. Serve with fudge sauce. ; name: squash with onions and parmesan ; ingredients: squash, olive oil, onion, minced garlic clove, salt, crushed red pepper flakes, black pepper, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Thinly slice the squash. Heat oil over medium heat. Add squash, onion, and garlic and cook until tender, stirring occasionally, about 4 minutes. Remove from heat and add salt, pepper, red pepper, and black pepper. Toss gently then sprinkle with cheese. ; name: beefy barbecue macaroni ; ingredients: lean ground beef, onion, garlic cloves, elbow macaroni, barbecue sauce, pepper, milk, butter, cheddar cheese, cheese ; preparation:In a skillet brown beef with onions and garlic until no longer pink. Drain. Add macaroni, bbq sauce and pepper. Mix well. In a saucepan, heat milk and butter until butter is melted. Stir in cheese until melted. Pour over the macaroni mixture and mix gently. Sprinkle with additional cheese. ; name: broccoli tofu and peppers in orange sauce ; ingredients: broccoli, red bell pepper, onions, garlic clove, firm tofu, vegetable oil, cornstarch, orange juice, dijon mustard ; preparation:Saut onion, broccoli, tofu and bell pepper in oil. In a bowl, combine the sauce ingredients. Add to the veggies. Cook until thickened and bubbly. Serve with rice. ; name: macaroni cheese deluxe ; ingredients: elbow macaroni, small curd cottage cheese, sour cream, egg, salt, pepper, sharp cheddar cheese, paprika ; preparation:Cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain well. Combine cottage cheese, sour cream, egg, salt, and pepper. Add shredded cheese, mixing well. Stir in the cooked macaroni. Pour into a greased 9 x 9 x 2 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with paprika. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. ; name: smashed loaded potatoes low fat ; ingredients: new potatoes, smart balance light butter spread, nonfat milk, nonfat sour cream, bacon bits, fresh chives, salt and pepper ; preparation:

name: couch potatoes ; ingredients: red potatoes, mozzarella cheese, pepperoni, dried oregano, garlic salt ; preparation:In 12x8 baking dish, arrange potato halves, cut side up, around edges of dish. Add 1 tablespoon water and cook, covered, on high, 8-10 minutes until tender, rotating dish halfway through cooking time. Drain. Meanwhile, combine all remaining ingredients. Place this mixture on cut sides of potatoes and cook on high 1-2 minutes until cheese melts. ; name: garden taco rice ; ingredients: ground turkey, onion, taco seasoning mix, water, zucchini, frozen corn, stewed tomatoes, instant rice, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Brown meat with onion. Drain. Stir in remaining ingredients except rice and cheese. Bring to a boil. Stir in rice, reduce heat to low, cover, simmer for 5 to 7 minutes or until all the liquid is absorded, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with cheese. Cover and let stand 3 minutes or until cheese is melted. ; name: white choc chip cookies ; ingredients: brown sugar, white sugar, butter, egg yolk, vanilla essence, self-raising flour, white chocolate chips ; preparation:Preheat oven to 180 c. Grease or line cookie tray. Mix together sugar and butter. Add egg yolk and vanilla, mix well. Stir in flour and choc chips. Place teaspoonfuls onto tray and bake for 12 minutes. ; name: honey barbecue chicken skewers ; ingredients: oil, liquid honey, soy sauce, barbecue sauce, fresh garlic cloves, green onion, black pepper, boneless skinless chicken breasts, wooden skewer ; preparation:Slice the chicken breasts in half or into thirds or whatever size you you desire to thread on the skewers. In a large glass bowl whisk together oil, honey, soy sauce, barbecue sauce and black pepper until well combined. Add in garlic pieces and green onion. Add in the chicken strips and toss with the marinade to combine well. Cover and refrigerate for a minimum of 8-24 hours. Remove the chicken strips and discard the marinade. Thread chicken strips on the wooden skewers piercing at least 3 times through the skewers. Grill over medium heat. ; name: keebler cherry crunch pie ; ingredients: graham cracker pie crusts, cherry pie filling, cornstarch, water, granulated sugar, light brown sugar, all-purpose flour, quick-cooking oats, butter ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Mix cornstarch and water to form paste. In a bowl, mix paste and pie filling, then spoon into prepared crust. Combine sugar, flour and oats in another bowl. Mix in melted butter, then spoon this onto filling. Bake on baking sheet for 40 minutes. Cool for at least four hours before serving. Refrigerate leftovers. ; name: honeycomb cheesecake ; ingredients: honey snap biscuits, butter, gelatin, water, cream cheese, caster sugar, vanilla essence, cream, chocolate candy bars ; preparation:Melt butter, add biscuit crumbs, mix well. Press mixture into a base of 22cm spring form tin. Refrigerate while making filling. Place water in a small bowl, sprinkle with gelatine, heat on medium in microwave for 30-40 seconds, do not boil. Place cream cheese in a mixing bowl, add sugar and vanilla essence, beat until smooth with electric mixer. Beat cream in a seperate bowl until soft peaks form. Stir gelatin mixture into cream cheese mixture, add cream and crushed honeycomb bars mix well, pour into crust. Refrigerate until set. ; name: a simple harissa ; ingredients: tomatoes, onion, fresh parsley, hot paprika, extra virgin olive oil, fresh lemon juice, salt and pepper ; preparation:Cut the tomatoes in half and gently wring out the seeds and liquid over the sink. Grate each tomato half on the coarse side of a grater into a bowl by holding the cut side of the tomato half against the grater and grating the flesh just to the skin. Discard the skin. Grate the onion into the bowl. Stir in the parsley, paprika, oil, and lemon juice, salt and black pepper to taste. The mixture should be highly seasoned. Serve immediately, or no longer than 4 hours after making, at room temperature. ; name: campfire spaghetti ; ingredients: hamburger, whole mushrooms, onion, dried basil, dried italian seasoning, garlic powder, chicken broth, tomato paste, water, spaghetti noodles ; preparation:

name: chocolate cream pie dairy free ; ingredients: bittersweet baking chocolate, non-dairy whipped topping, margarine, eggs, vanilla extract, chocolate pudding, sugar, chocolate wafer pie crust ; preparation:Over a double boiler or super low flame melt baking chocolate. Add sugar, pudding and vanilla until dissolved. Add eggs one at a time and stir continuously until incorporated. In a separate bowl whip up the topping until stiff with a tablespoon of sugar. In a separate bowl add chocolate mixture to margarine stick and beat well. Add topping until all is well combined. Pour into prepared cookie pie crust and refrigerate or freeze. Cut into slices and serve with whipped cream and chocolate shavings. Enjoy. ; name: cos salad boats ; ingredients: cos lettuce, avocados, plum tomatoes, alfalfa sprouts, eggs, mayonnaise, water, dijon mustard, fresh dill, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Arrange the salad leaves on a large platter with the edges facing up so that they look like boats. Combine the avocados, tomatoes, and sprouts in a bowl, then fill each of the salad leaves with this mixture. Sprinkle each one with some chopped egg. Whisk all the salad dressing ingredients together in a small bowl. Check and adjust the seasoning to taste, then spoon over salad and serve at once. ; name: atkin induction friendly crustless quiche ; ingredients: bacon, yellow onion, eggs, cream, spinach, gruyere cheese, salt, black pepper ; preparation:Heat oven to 350 and butter your deep pie pan or your muffin tins. Cook bacon until crisp, drain and coarsely chop. Use one tbsp of drippings to saute onions for 5 minutes until soft but not brown. Combine eggs, cream, spinach, cheese, salt and pepper. Stir in bacon and onion. Pour mixture into prepared pan. Bake 1 hour 15 minutes. ; name: zesty cheerios diet snack ; ingredients: egg white, chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, salt, ground pepper, cheerios toasted oat cereal, nonstick cooking spray ; preparation:Pre-heat oven to 325f. Whisk egg white until foamy. Mix in spices. Stir in cheerios or chex. Coat a large cookie sheet with vegetable spray, and spread mixture on it. Spray the cereal with a light coating of more vegetable spray. Place in oven and stir every 5 minutes, for a total of 15-20 minutes. Cool completely enjoy. ; name: baked garlic parmesan potatoes ; ingredients: garlic, butter, baby red potatoes, fine breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese, salt and black pepper, paprika ; preparation:Mince garlic and combine with melted butter in a large mixing bowl. Add potatoes and toss well to coat. Mix remaining ingredients and add to potato mixture and toss well. Turn potatoes out onto greased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 for 1 hour or until cooked through, turning 2 to 3 times while baking. ; name: christmas pepper chutney ; ingredients: red bell peppers, jalapeno peppers, garlic cloves, cider vinegar, light brown sugar, granulated sugar, golden raisin, crystallized ginger ; preparation:Place all ingredients in a large pan, stir. Turn down heat and simmer uncovered until thickened. This may take up to an hour. Cool slightly, spoon into jars. Close jars, cool completely, then keep refrigerated. ; name: chili citrus chicken ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breast halves, chili powder, ground cumin, garlic salt, cayenne pepper, vegetable oil, fresh lemon juice, fresh lime juice, jalapeno jelly ; preparation:In small dish, mix the chili powder, cumin, garlic salt, and the cayenne pepper. Rub the mixture on each chicken breast half. In frypan, place the oil and heat to medium temperature. Cook the chicken in pan, turning. Cook the chicken until juices are clear when pierced with a fork. Remove the chicken and keep warm. Combine the juices and jelly in the frying pan. Bring to a boil and cook for 2 min or so. Spoon sauce over the chicken. ; name: olive bread ; ingredients: flour, baking powder, sugar, salt, egg, milk, walnuts, stuffed green olive, chopped pimiento ; preparation:

name: parma wrapped chicken ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, salt & freshly ground black pepper, sage leaves, sun-dried tomatoes, parma ham, white wine, creme fraiche ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350f. Lay out the chicken breast and season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Spread the sun-dried tomatoes evenly between the two breasts and top with 2 sage leaves on each. Wrap 2 slices of parma ham around each chicken breast and transfer them to an ovenproof dish. Pour over the wine and cover with kitchen foil. Cook for 30 minutes. If you prefer a golden top, remove the foil for the last 5 minutes of cooking time. Remove the chicken from the foil and keep warm. Stir the crme frache into the cooking juices, to give a loose creamy sauce. Season and serve immediately with the chicken breasts. ; name: white chocolate cranberry muffins ; ingredients: flour, baking powder, nutmeg, cinnamon, egg, sugar, oil, milk, white chocolate, cranberries ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 180 c and line a muffin pan. In a bowl mix flour, baking powder, white chocolate and the spices. In a second bowl beat the egg. Add sugar, oil and milk and blend in well. Give the flour mixture to the egg mixture. Add the cranberries and blend in only until a smooth dough has formed. Pour into the muffin tin and bake for 20-25 minutes. ; name: chocolate jelly roll ; ingredients: eggs, white sugar, water, baking powder, salt, cocoa, cake flour, vanilla ; preparation:Prepare a large cookie sheet with lining it with wax paper. Mix together sugar, whole eggs and water. Beat in remaining ingredients. Pour into prepared cookie sheet and bake at 375 degf for 12-15 minutes. Remove from oven and turn out onto a clean, moist teatowel springled with icing sugar. Quickly remove the wax paper and trim off crisp edges. While still warm, roll cake into tea towel into a roll, rolling the towel with the cake. When cool, unroll the cake carefully and spread with jelly, or ice cream or your favorite filling. Roll up again. If using ice cream, store in the freezer until ready to serve. Slice into serving pieces. ; name: town house chicken ; ingredients: boneless chicken breasts, cracker, parmesan cheese, parsley, egg ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Cut fat off chicken and cut in half. Crush crackers into tiny pieces and them mix with cheese and parsley. Dredge chickens in egg, then in the cracker mix. Lightly fry in skillet. And then bake for 25 minutes. ; name: delicious homemade chicken salad wraps ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, sweet onion, fresh cilantro, slivered almonds, mayonnaise, ranch dressing, water, salt, whole wheat tortillas ; preparation:Place water and salt in a large, broad pan. Boil chicken breasts on medium high for 15 minutes on each side. Next, turn off heat and place lid on pan. Let steam for about 10 minutes until the chicken is cooked through. In a small saucepan, heat almonds on high until lightly browned. In a large bowl, combine onion, cilantro, almonds, mayonnaise and ranch dressing. Once chicken is cooked through, chop into small chunks and add to the mixture in the bowl. Completely combine mixture and split the chicken salad between 4 whole wheat tortillas. ; name: won ton dipping sauce ; ingredients: onion, jalapenos, garlic cloves, oil, soy sauce, rice vinegar, brown sugar ; preparation:Combine onion, peppers and garlic in food processor and chop to a medium-fine consistency. Heat oil in skillet on low heat and add the vegetables from the food processor. Stir, continuing to cook on low heat until the oil takes on the color of the peppers. In a bowl, pour the vinegar, soy sauce and brown sugar and stir to dissolve the sugar. Taste the mixture, adjust to taste. Mix, then add the mixture from the skillet. Serve warm or at room temperature with freshly steamed or fried won tons. ; name: better than best waffles with white chocolate ; ingredients: egg, flour, baking powder, salt, sugar, milk, vanilla, butter, white chocolate chips ; preparation:Beat egg whites in a small bowl until stiff. Set aside. Sift together dry ingredients. Combine egg yolk, milk, butter and vanilla in a separate bowl. Add mixture to dry ingredients and mix until just blended. Add white chips and egg white. Fold in till just mixed. Do not overmix batter. Use griddle according to directions. ; name: oreo pudding ; ingredients: cream cheese, powdered sugar, milk, vanilla, cool whip, oreo cookies, butter, instant vanilla pudding ; preparation:

name: saucy salisbury steak ; ingredients: ground beef, onion, salt, pepper, condensed golden mushroom soup, water, worcestershire sauce, carrot, frozen green beans ; preparation:Mix beef, onion, salt and pepper well. Shape into oval patties. Brown patties, pour off fat. Stir in remaining ingredients. Cove and cook on low for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally. ; name: mincemeat fruitcake cookies ; ingredients: vegetable oil, granulated sugar, egg, almond extract, mincemeat, all-purpose flour, baking powder, salt, candied red cherries, green glazed cherries ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f, & lightly coat baking sheet with cooking spray. In large bowl, beat oil & sugar until light. Beat in egg & almond extract until smooth. Stir in mincemeat. In medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder & salt. Beat into egg mixture until blended. Stir in cherries. Drop by rounded teasoonfuls onto parchment paper lined baking sheets. Bake 12-14 minutes, or until lightly brown & firm. Cool on wire rack. ; name: veal medallions with blueberry citrus sauce ; ingredients: blueberries, orange juice, lemon juice, vermouth, orange rind, lemons, rind of, fresh ginger, butter, veal medallions, salt and pepper ; preparation:Combine blueberries, orange juice, lemon juice, vermouth, orange peel, lemon peel and ginger. Stir to blend and set aside. Melt butter in a large, heavy skillet and saute until brown and just cooked through. Transfer veal to platter and keep warm. Add blueberry mixture to skillet and cook until mixture thickens, scraping up any browned bits. Spoon blueberry mixture over veal and serve. ; name: barbecue prawn ; ingredients: king prawns, garlic, gingerroot, green chili peppers, turmeric powder, red chili powder, salt ; preparation:Clean and devein prawns. Add turmeric powder, salt, mix and set aside. Grind together green chilies, garlic, ginger, and red chili powder. Add the prawns from step 1, mix thoroughly and set aside for 30 minutes. 3barbeque in a charcoal fired grill or oven. Preheat the oven to 350 deg. Put prawns in skewers. Keep the skewers on the separator in the oven. Place a tray below the separator. Bake at 350 deg for 10 to 15 minutes. Serve hot. ; name: easy black beans ; ingredients: olive oil, garlic clove, black beans, onion, sour cream ; preparation:Saute garlic in olive oil over low heat. Add black beans and bring the heat up to medium to begin cooking out liquid. Stir frequently and mash beans as you stir. Cook 10-15 minutes. Top with sour cream and chopped onions. ; name: easy sausage bake ; ingredients: hot water, pork stuffing mix, italian sausage, red pepper, green pepper, onion, tomato sauce ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Add hot water to stuffing mix. Stir till blended. Set aside. Saute italian sausage in a large nonstick skillet over med-high heat until nicely browned. Add vegetables to skillet, saute until crisp tender. Drain any oil in skillet. Place sausage mixture into a 13 x 9 pan. Cover with tomato sauce. Cover with prepared stuffing. Bake 25 minutes or until heated throughout. ; name: brazen brie soup ; ingredients: cream cheese with garlic and herbs, brie cheese, vegetable stock, single cream, cornflour, dry white wine, fresh parsley, french baguettes, cranberry sauce ; preparation:Put all soup ingredients in a blender and whizz. Strain. Soup can now be stored for upto 1 day. When ready to serve toast bread and top with cranberry sauce. Heat soup in a heavy based saucepan, stirring well. Gradually bring to boil and simmer for one minute. Serve sprinkled with parsley and with a cranberry boat floating in the soup. ; name: choc chip bread butter pudding ; ingredients: butter, bread, eggs, caster sugar, vanilla essence, chocolate chips, cinnamon, nutmeg ; preparation:

name: cornmeal cookies ; ingredients: butter, sugar, egg, pure vanilla extract, cornmeal, baking powder, salt, flour ; preparation:Mix softened butter and sugar until creamy. Add the egg and vanilla and beat well. In a separate mixing bowl, mix together the cornmeal, baking powder, salt and flour. Add to the creamed mixture. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto a greased cookie sheet. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven about 15 minutes or until lightly brown. ; name: raspberry cream dressing ; ingredients: frozen raspberries, olive oil, whipping cream, sherry wine vinegar, salt ; preparation:Place raspberries in a blender and process until smooth. Pour through a strainer into a bowl and press the mixture with the back of a spoon against the sides of the strainer to squeeze out liquid. Discard seeds. Combine the raspberry puree, olive oil, & remaining ingredients, whisking until smooth. Chill. ; name: korean beef ; ingredients: soy sauce, cayenne, garlic powder, vinegar, sesame oil, black pepper, sesame seeds, green onion, boneless beef cube, long-grain white rice ; preparation:Mix all ingredients in container to marinate. Cover and refrigerate overnight. To barbeque, bbq on high heat one minute each side. Or indoors, get skillet very hot. Toss in meat and cook over high heat 2 minutes each side. Quick fry the onions and add marinade. Serve over rice cooked as usual using two cups uncooked rice. ; name: one pan banana bread ; ingredients: vegetable oil, bananas, vanilla extract, eggs, bisquick baking mix, sugar, nuts ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Generously grease the bottom only of a 9x5x3-inch loaf pan. Stir all ingredients in pan with a fork until moistened. Beat vigorously 1 minute. Bake 55 to 60 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool 5 minutes. Run knife around sides of loaf to loosen, remove from pan. Cool completely. ; name: hot slaw cabbage in mustard pecan butter ; ingredients: chicken broth, cabbage and carrot coleslaw mix, green onion, salt, black pepper, pecans, butter, dijon mustard ; preparation:Heat the chicken broth in a large saucepan over med-low heat. When broth is hot, add the cole-slaw mix, the green onions, and the salt & pepper. Cover and cook over med-low heat, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes. Mix together the melted butter and the dijon mustard, and stir in the chopped pecans. Pour the mustard-pecan butter over the cabbage, and toss well to coat. ; name: buckwheat griddlecakes ; ingredients: flour, buckwheat groats, baking soda, salt, sugar, eggs, sour milk, butter ; preparation:Sift dry ingredients together. Beat eggs, add buttermilk or sour milk. Add to dry ingredients gradually. Add butter, beating to obtain a smooth batter. Drop from a spoon onto a hot greased griddle and brown on both sides. ; name: barley bake ; ingredients: celery, sliced mushrooms, green onion, garlic clove, butter, barley, fresh cilantro, chicken broth, salt and pepper ; preparation:Saute celery, mushrooms, onions and garlic in butter until soft. Add barley and cook until light brown. In a 2 quart buttered casserole combine barley mixture, parsley or cilantro and chicken broth. Cover and bake at 350 for 30 minutes and then uncover and bake for 45 minutes more or until barley is tender and liquid is absorbed. If necessary, add more broth. Season with salt and pepper to taste. ; name: bacon and sun dried tomato alfredo pasta ww recipe ; ingredients: multi-grain penne, low-fat alfredo sauce, sun-dried tomato, bacon, fresh basil, black pepper ; preparation:

name: nora ephron s mashed potatoes ; ingredients: potatoes, heavy cream, butter, salt, pepper ; preparation:Put potato in a large pot of salted water and bring to a boil. Lower the heat and simmer for 20 minutes, until tender. Drain and place potatoes back in the pot over low heat and shake the pan to remove excess moisture. Peel. Put through a potato ricer and immediately add 1 tablespoons of heavy cream and add as much melted butter and salt and pepper as you feel like. Eat immediately. ; name: oven baked chicken thighs ; ingredients: chicken thighs, ground cumin, paprika, ground turmeric, garlic powder, cayenne pepper, salt, ground cinnamon, olive oil ; preparation:In a shallow dish, stir together all spices and 1 teaspoon salt. Coat chicken thighs with spice mix. Warm the oil in a skillet and pan-fry chicken thighs, making sure each side is nicely browned. Transfer chicken thighs to a greased 9x5 baking dish. If you have any remaining spice mix, feel free to sprinkle it over the thighs, as this will reduce to a nice gravy. Put in pre-heated oven at 375 for 45 minutes, or until juices run clear. Serve with basmati rice or couscous. ; name: tuna croquettes ; ingredients: canned tuna, wheat germ, eggs, tomato juice, fresh dill, black pepper, cooking oil ; preparation:In a large bowl, combine all the ingredients. Nix well. Shape the mixture into 4 equal size patties. Heat 1 to 2 tablespoons oil in heavy frying pan add the formed patties and fry on both sides until golden brown. Drain on paper towels to absorb excess oil. ; name: dad s chicken soup ; ingredients: low sodium chicken broth, onion, celery, carrots, garlic, long-grain white rice, fresh thyme, cooked chicken, salt and pepper, fresh parsley ; preparation:Bring first five ingredients to boil in heavy large pot or dutch oven over high heat. Mix in rice and thyme. Return soup to a boil. Reduce heat to medium and simmer uncovered until rice is tender, stirring occasionally, about 30 minutes. Add chicken and simmer until heated through, thinning with additional broth if desired. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer soup to large bowl. Garnish with parsley and serve. I like corkscrew pasta in this. ; name: chicken yellow squash casserole ; ingredients: chicken, yellow squash, broth, carrots, onion, sour cream, cream of mushroom soup, salt and pepper, chicken flavor stuffing mix, butter ; preparation:Cook chicken, cool and remove from bone. Bring squash to boil in broth and cook 8 minutes. Drain and combine all vegetables. Combine sour cream, soup and salt and pepper. Add chicken and veggies. Spoon into lightly greased 9x13 baking dish. Combine stuffing and butter. Sprinkle over casserole. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes. ; name: cinnamon blueberry crumble ; ingredients: rhodes anytime cinnamon rolls, blueberry pie filling, butter, flour, brown sugar, pecans, cream cheese frosting ; preparation:Remove rolls from pan. Spray pan with non-stick cooking spray and replace rolls. Spread blueberry pie filling evenly over and between rolls. Combine butter, flour, brown sugar and pecans and sprinkle over pie filling. Bake at 350f 45-50 minutes. Drizzle with cream cheese frosting while still warm. ; name: popeye s fried chicken copycat ; ingredients: chicken, white pepper, cayenne pepper, salt, tabasco sauce, vegetable oil, all-purpose flour, paprika, eggs, milk ; preparation:Mix all ingredients except the oil, flour, paprika, and eggs & milk, marinate overnight in an airtight container. In a large bowl, combine flour, salt, peppers, and paprika. Break the eggs into a separate bowl and beat until blended slowly adding the milk. Dip each piece of chicken into the egg and milk mixture, then coat generously with the flour. Once the chicken is coated, place on a rack to allow the pieces to dry, 20 to 30 minutes. Allowing the pieces to dry will provide for more even browning of the chicken. To fry, heat oil in dutch oven or deep fryer to medium. Place the chicken pieces in the oil, skin side down, one piece at a time. Leave enough space between pieces so that they are not crowded. This allows the pieces to cook and brown more evenly. Continue to cook over a medium heat, turning until all sides are golden brown and the meat is cooked thoroughly. When the pieces finish cooking, they should be removed and placed on a paper towel to allow grease to drain. ; name: cherry ripe crackles ; ingredients: desiccated coconut, rice bubbles, glace cherries, dark chocolate chips, margarine, golden syrup, coconut essence ; preparation:

name: cos salad boats ; ingredients: cos lettuce, avocados, plum tomatoes, alfalfa sprouts, eggs, mayonnaise, water, dijon mustard, fresh dill, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Arrange the salad leaves on a large platter with the edges facing up so that they look like boats. Combine the avocados, tomatoes, and sprouts in a bowl, then fill each of the salad leaves with this mixture. Sprinkle each one with some chopped egg. Whisk all the salad dressing ingredients together in a small bowl. Check and adjust the seasoning to taste, then spoon over salad and serve at once. ; name: english muffin chicken ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, salt and pepper, plain yogurt, dijon mustard, english muffins, parmesan cheese, parsley, cayenne pepper ; preparation:Season chicken with salt and pepper. Combine yogurt and mustard. Marinate chicken in mixture for about 20 minutes. Combine crushed muffins, cheese, parsley and pepper. Remove chicken from yogurt mixture shaking off excess. Dredge chicken in english muffin crumbs. Place breaded chicken on cookie sheet and bake at 450 degrees for about 25 minutes. Chicken will be golden brown. ; name: cream delight with whiskey irish recipe ; ingredients: oatmeal, almonds, whipping cream, honey, irish whiskey, lemon juice ; preparation:Using a baking tray with baking paper on it, toast the oatmeal and almonds at 300 fahrenheit for 5 to 10 minutes, mixing repeatedly, making sure not to let the mixture burn. Whip the cream but not overly so and stir in the honey. Next, mix in the whiskey, oats, almonds and lemon juice. Mix well and then pour the mixture into long serving glasses. Chill and serve cold. ; name: cheesy tuna pasta ; ingredients: pasta, cream cheese, cheddar cheese, milk, granulated garlic, tuna ; preparation:Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, melt cream cheese in milk in med saucepan over low heat. Add cheedar and garlic. Add tuna and mix well. Once pasta is cooked, drain and pour tuna mix on top. Mix well and serve. ; name: somewhat special grilled london broil ; ingredients: dry red wine, worcestershire sauce, tomato paste, red wine vinegar, prepared horseradish, fresh thyme leaves, garlic cloves, steak, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Whisk red wine, worcestershire sauce, tomato paste, vinegar, horseradish, thyme leaves, and garlic in small bowl until well blended. Place steak on large platter. Sprinkle with salt and pepper, then brush with half the marinade. Turn steak, season, and brush with remaining marinade. Cover with plastic wrap and let marinate at room temperature 2 hours or in the refrigerator at least 4 hours. Prepare grill or heat broiler. Grill or broil steak, basting occasionally with juices in platter, 6-8 minutes each side for medium-rare. Transfer to cutting board and thinly slice on sharp diagonal. Serve. ; name: edible cookie dough for ice cream no eggs ; ingredients: flour, brown sugar, white sugar, butter, vanilla, milk, mini chocolate chip ; preparation:In a medium bowl mix together both sugars and butter until smooth. Stir in vanilla and milk. Mix in the flour until well blended. Add in chocolate chips. Shape into a log and freeze for about 1-2 hours or until firm. Cut or break into small chunks. Mix into softened ice cream. Return the ice cream to freezer. ; name: grandma katies famous sausage rice ; ingredients: jimmy dean sausage, celery, onions, lipton soup secrets noodle soup mix, boiling water, long grain rice, soy sauce, salt, pepper ; preparation:Use a food processor to finely chop the onion and celery. Brown sausage, celery and onions in a large skillet, drain off fat. Place in large casserole dish. Mix dry soup mix with the 9 cups of boiling water and cook for 5 minutes. Mix all ingredients together and bake covered at 325f for 1-2 hours. ; name: ma s gnocchi ; ingredients: ricotta cheese, flour, eggs, tomato sauce, parmigiano-reggiano cheese ; preparation:

name: splenda oatmeal cookies ; ingredients: butter, splenda brown sugar blend, splenda sugar blend for baking, eggs, vanilla, all-purpose flour, cinnamon, quick-cooking oats ; preparation:Preheat oven 350. Cream butter and both sugars. Add eggs one at a time. Add vanilla. Combine dry ingredients. Add to butter mixture. Stir in oats. Drop by tablespoon full onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake 10-12 minutes. ; name: baked seafood dip ; ingredients: cream cheese, butter, green onion, white wine, seafood, swiss cheese, sharp cheddar cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place cream cheese in a medium sized mixing bowl. Saute onions in butter until softened. Add onions, seafood, wine and swiss cheese to cream cheese. Stir until combined. Spread into a greased 2 quart baking dish and top with cheddar cheese. Bake for 25-30 minutes until bubbly and golden brown. ; name: strawberry asparagus salad ; ingredients: asparagus, strawberries, lemon juice, vegetable oil, honey ; preparation:Toss the asparagus and strawberries together in a bowl. Set aside. In a small bowl, combine the dressing ingredients and mix well. Pour dressing over salad and toss. Chill before serving. ; name: ground turkey stew ; ingredients: lean ground turkey, potatoes, carrot, celery, onions, frozen corn, chicken broth, bay leaves, thyme, salt and pepper ; preparation:Saute ground turkey in stock pot. Add remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil. Cover and reduce heat. Simmer for 45 minutes - 1 hour. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve. ; name: dogs kraut and taters ; ingredients: sauerkraut, white potatoes, hot dogs, beer, dill, caraway seed, dried onion flakes, cracked black pepper ; preparation:In a large frying pan over medium heat, place the kraut with juice, potatoes, and hotdogs. Pour beer over top. Sprikle with dill and caraway seeds if using them. Top off with some cracked black pepper. Cover and let it simmer for 7-10 minutes until hot. ; name: nutella italian rice pudding ; ingredients: whole milk, nutella, ground cinnamon, arborio rice, eggs, egg yolks, granulated sugar, hazelnuts ; preparation:Preheat oven to 325f coat 13- by 19- inch glass pan with vegetable spray. Over medium heat, whisk together milk and nutella in a heavy bottomed 4-quart saucepan. Add cinnamon and rice and bring to a boil. Cover and reduce heat to a simmer and cook for 15 minutes. Whisk together eggs, egg yolks and sugar. Temper a small amount of the hot liquid into the eggs. Combine egg mixture with remaining milk mixture, add nuts and bake in a water bath for 40 minutes. Cool 15 to 20 minutes. Serve hot or cover and refrigerate. ; name: chinese brussels sprouts ; ingredients: brussels sprouts, minced garlic cloves, ginger, onion, red pepper flakes, soy sauce ; preparation:Stir fry sprouts in hot oil with garlic, onion and ginger until nearly done. Mix slurry ingredients together and add to sprouts. Sprinkle with crushed red pepper. Stir-fry for 2 minutes more. Serve hot with char siu ribs and steamed rice. ; name: amish cream pie ; ingredients: sugar, cornstarch, salt, half-and-half, butter, brown sugar, vanilla, 9-inch baked pie crust, ground cinnamon ; preparation:

name: barbecue chicken quesadillas ; ingredients: red onion, bell pepper, butter, cooked chicken, barbecue sauce, monterey jack cheese, cilantro, flour tortillas ; preparation:Saute onions and bell peppers in pan with butter. Remove from pan and set aside. In another pan heat through shredded chicken with bbq sauce. Lightly butter one side of a tortilla. Place butter side down in saute pan. Quickly add some of the cheese, chicken and onions to one half of tortilla. Then quickly fold in half forming a semi-circle. Continue to cook until bottom side is golden brown, then carefully flip quesadilla over. Brown other side and remove from pan. Repeat with remaining ingredients. Cut quesadilla into wedges and serve with additional barbecue sauce. ; name: roasted root vegetable ; ingredients: olive oil, garlic cloves, thyme, salt, pepper, small red potato, onion, carrots, turnips ; preparation:Preheat to 425f. Combine the oil and garlic in a large roasting pan and place in the oven for 2 minutes until the garlic starts to sizzle. Remove the pan from the oven and stir in the thyme, salt and pepper. Add the potatoes, onion, carrots, and turnips, toss until well coated. Cover and bake for 30 minutes. Increase oven temp to 450f, and bake, uncovered for 30 minutes until the veggies are lightly browned and can easily be pierced with a fork. ; name: simmered sirloin with gravy ; ingredients: boneless beef top sirloin steaks, onion, sliced mushrooms, garlic, butter, beef stock, worcestershire sauce, all-purpose flour, cold water ; preparation:In large nonstick skillet, cook beef, onions, mushrooms and garlic in butter over medium heat for 5-7 minutes or until meat is brown and no longer pink. Add the beef broth, worcestershire sauce and bring to boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for one hour. Combine flour and water until smooth. Add to beef mixture. Bring to a boil. Cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened. ; name: cheddar cheese soup with zucchini broccoli and carrots ; ingredients: butter, garlic cloves, zucchini, carrot, onion, broccoli, chicken broth, flour, milk, shredded cheddar cheese ; preparation:Melt butter in large saucepan. Add garlic, zucchini, carrots, and onion. Saute until veggies are tender. Stir in broccoli and broth. Simmer until broccoli is tender. Meanwhile, melt butter in large pot. Whisk in flour and cook for a minute or two. Whisk in milk until smooth -- simmer until thickened. Whisk in cheddar cheese. Pour vegetable mixture into cheese sauce and whisk until smooth. Serve immediately. ; name: low carb no bake cheesecake ; ingredients: cream cheese, unflavored gelatin, splenda sugar substitute, boiling water, vanilla ; preparation:Mix gelatin and splenda. Add boiling water, stirring until dissolved. Beat the cream cheese with the vanilla. Slowly add the gelatin until well-mixed. Chill until firm. ; name: mini caramel apples ; ingredients: granny smith apples, butterscotch chips, peanut butter chips, milk chocolate pieces, candy sprinkles, coconut ; preparation:Cut the lollipop sticks at an angle on one end to create a small point to insert into the mini apple. With the melon baller, scoop little balls out of the apple making sure to have a section of apple peel on each ball. Push half the lollipop stick into the peel of each ball and pat the apple dry. Melt the butterscotch, peanut butter and chocolate pieces according to the package directions. Dip and swirl the mini-apples in the melted chips, then roll them into the sprinkles, coconut or chopped nuts if desired. Place the mini apples in paper candy cups to set. ; name: coconut chocolate bars ; ingredients: graham crackers, sweetened condensed milk, flaked coconut, semi-sweet chocolate chips ; preparation:Preheat over to 350f grease 9-inch square baking pan. Combine all ingredients. Stir until well blended. Press mixture into pan. Bake for 30 minutes until set. Let cool before cutting into pieces. ; name: creamy peach freeze ; ingredients: vanilla ice cream, fresh peaches, brown sugar, salt ; preparation:

name: ed s south of the border marinated shrimp ; ingredients: fresh shrimp, limes, red onion, garlic cloves, olive oil, fresh jalapenos, cilantro, sugar, salt and pepper ; preparation:Bring a large pot of heavily salted water to boil and add the shrimp. Bring to a boil again and cook for 3 minutes. Drain the shrimp and rinse to stop the cooking. Peel as soon as the shrimp are cool enough to handle. Mince the onion, garlic, and jalapenos, chop the cilantro and add to the olive oil in a large bowl. Squeeze the limes and add to the bowl along with the shrimp and sugar, salt and pepper. Cover and refrigerate for a few hours. Serve with toothpicks and plenty of napkins. ; name: torgotta cheese or torgo s vegan tofu ricotta ; ingredients: firm tofu, lemon juice, garlic powder, salt, pepper, dried basil, dried oregano, olive oil, nutritional yeast ; preparation:Crumble tofu in large bowl. Add lemon juice, garlic powder, saltnpeppa, basil & oregano. Use your favorite hand to squeeze ingredients together. Add oil & yeast. Utilize utensil to combine. The end. ; name: scalloped zucchini yellow squash ; ingredients: butter, onion, zucchini, yellow squash, tomatoes, sugar, salt, oregano, pepper, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Mix sliced vegetables. Mix melted butter with sugar, salt, oregano, and pepper. Mix butter with veggies. Spread in pan. Bake hour. Remove from oven. Spread parmesan over top. Bake hour more. ; name: crab and shrimp dips ; ingredients: cream cheese, mayonnaise, ketchup, worcestershire sauce, tabasco sauce, onion, crabmeat, baby shrimp ; preparation:In a mixing bowl, using an electric mixer, beat cream cheese and mayonnaise until well blended. Add ketchup, tabasco sauce, worcestershire sauce and beat again until well incorporated. Add onions and mix well using a fork. Adjust tabasco sauce to taste. Divide mixture equally into 2 serving bowls. Add crab to one bowl and mix well using a fork. Add shrimp to the other bowl and mix well using a fork. Serve with potato chips or vegetable crackers. Refrigerate any unused portions. ; name: dear abby s famous pecan pie ; ingredients: unbaked 9-inch pie crust, light corn syrup, dark brown sugar, eggs, butter, salt, vanilla, pecan halves ; preparation:Heat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl, combine corn syrup, sugar, eggs, butter, salt and vanilla. Mix well. Pour filling into unbaked pie crust. Sprinkle with pecan halves. Bake for 45- 50 minutes or until center is set. Cool. You can top it with a bit of whip cream if desired. ; name: brussels sprout salad with walnuts ; ingredients: brussels sprouts, walnuts, gruyere cheese, olive oil, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, sea salt, ground black pepper ; preparation:Slice brussels sprouts across in 2 mm strips, using a food processor or slicer. Discard cores. Chop walnuts into 1 cm chunks. Grate cheese. Toss cheese with sprouts and nuts. Whisk together mustard, oil, vinegar, salt and pepper, until blended. Pour over salad, toss lightly, and serve. ; name: uncle bill s special cranberry sauce ; ingredients: fresh cranberries, frozen concentrated orange juice, cold water, granulated sugar, pineapple-orange marmalade, cinnamon sticks, nutmeg, lemon zest, orange zest ; preparation:Wash the cranberries thoroughly in cold water. If using frozen cranberries, thaw first. In a medium size saucepan, add cranberries, orange juice, water, sugar, orange-pineapple marmalade, cinnamon stick, nutmeg, lemon zest and orange zest. Bring mixture to boil. Reduce heat and simmer for about 10 minutes or until most of the cranberries pop, stirring occasionally. When cooked, discard cinnamon stick. Let cool and then store in a glass container with lid or a dish covered with plastic wrap. Keep refrigerated. Use as required. This is for adults only who accept liquor. This gives the cranberry sauce a whole new taste. This is yum, yummy good. ; name: easy braunschweiger party spread ; ingredients: braunschweiger sausage, cream cheese, green onions, milk, worcestershire sauce, garlic powder ; preparation:

name: south african samp and beans umngqusho ; ingredients: samp, black-eyed peas, onion, potatoes, tomatoes, canola oil, salt, vegetable bouillon cube, curry powder ; preparation:Mix and wash the samp and beans together. Put them in a large pot with 5-6 cups water and cook samp and beans until they start becoming soft. Check on it every 30 minutes or so to see if the samp and beans need more water and to see when they are start to soften. Once the samp and beans are slightly soft, but not done drain some of the water if there is more than a few cups of water still cooking with it and add everything else. Cook the remainder of time it takes until the beans are very soft. ; name: shimmer tini ; ingredients: vanilla vodka, unsweetened pineapple juice, cream of coconut, key lime juice, ice cube, lime slice ; preparation:In a cocktail shaker, combine vodka, pineapple juice, cream of coconut, and key lime juice. Add ice. Cover and shake vigorously until very cold. Strain into a chilled martini glass. Garnish with lime slice. ; name: chicken tuscany ; ingredients: chicken, green bell pepper, sliced mushrooms, lipton onion soup mix, whole canned tomatoes, orange juice, brown sugar, vegetable oil ; preparation:In 13 x 9-inch baking pan, arrange chicken,. Red pepper and mushrooms. Blend remaining ingredients. Pour over chicken. Bake 50 minutes at 425 degrees or until chicken is thoroughly cooked. ; name: tahini chicken ; ingredients: fat-free chicken broth, tahini, soy sauce, honey, garlic, fresh ginger, hot pepper sauce, cooked chicken breasts, cooked brown rice ; preparation:Bring the broth to a boil in a 2 quart saucepan over medium heat. Reduce heat to low. Whisk in tahini, soy sauce, honey, garlic, ginger, and hot-pepper sauce until smooth. Stir in the chicken and heat through. Serve over rice. ; name: lime and lemonade ; ingredients: frozen lemonade concentrate, ice cubes, lime juice, limes, carbonated lemonade ; preparation:Place ice cubes, lime juice and frozen lemonade concentrate in a blender, and blend until ice is very fine. Place this lemon slush in a freezer safe tray, cover and freeze for at least two hours. Slice the 8 limes very thin, reserve a few for glasses and the top of the pitcher. Put the remaining limes in a large pitcher. Layer the slush over the sliced limes. Just before serving add the carbonated lemonade. ; name: greek ribs ; ingredients: pork rib rack, garlic salt, onion salt, salt, oregano, lemon juice, lemon pepper ; preparation:Cut ribs into serving size pieces. Place on cookie sheet in single layer. Sprinkle spices and lemon juice on top. Turn over and repeat the process. Bake at 375 degrees for about 20 minutes. Turn ribs. Cook another 20 minutes or until nicely done. ; name: sam s baked risotto ; ingredients: olive oil, onions, garlic clove, risotto rice, vermouth, chicken broth, whipping cream, butter, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Heat oven to 350 degrees. Cook onion and garlic in olive oil and teaspoon of butter until softened. Add risotto and stir until rice has absorbed all the oil and butter. Add vermouth and cook for another minute or two. Stir in chicken broth and whipping cream, mix well and bring to a boil over high heat. Remove, cover and place in the oven for 18-20 minutes remove from oven and stir in butter and parmesan. Drizzle lightly with extra virgin olive oil and sprinkle with a little more parmesan and fresh cracked pepper. ; name: tortilla campesina potato pudding ; ingredients: olive oil, onions, smoked bacon, garlic powder, potato, cream, paprika, salt and black pepper, eggs ; preparation:

name: grilled salmon with peanut hoisin sauce ; ingredients: creamy peanut butter, hoisin sauce, onion, rice wine vinegar, water, garlic, salmon fillets, salt and pepper, scallion ; preparation:Combine all sauce ingredients in a saucepan. Bring to a boil then reduce the heat and simmer for about 5 minutes, stirring often. Sauce can be made several days ahead of time and refrigerated. If it is too thick, just add a little water when heating it before serving. Season the salmon filets with salt and pepper. Grill until done to your liking. Top each grilled salmon filet with warm peanut hoisin sauce and sprinkle with chopped scallions, just before serving. ; name: tomato florentine ; ingredients: frozen chopped spinach, parmesan cheese, olive oil, japanese-style bread crumbs, onion, garlic cloves, salt, pepper, ground nutmeg, whole tomatoes ; preparation:Drain spinach well, pressing between paper towels. Combine parmesan cheese, 1 tablespoons olive oil, and 2 tablespoons breadcrumbs in a small bowl. Cook onion in remaining 1 tablespoons hot oil in a medium skillet over medium heat 5 minutes or until tender. Add garlic, and cook 1 more minute. Stir in spinach, and cook 2 minutes or until thoroughly heated. Remove from heat, and stir in salt, pepper, and nutmeg. Place tomatoes in a 9-inch square baking dish. Spoon spinach mixture evenly over tomatoes. Sprinkle with breadcrumb mixture. Bake at 400 for 25 minutes or until golden brown. Serve immediately. ; name: tarragon chicken packets for two ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, baby carrots, yellow squash, fresh mushrooms, cherry tomatoes, onions, butter, fresh tarragon, seasoning salt ; preparation:Cut each chicken breasts into thirds lengthwise. Cut the squash in half and cut each half into 6 even strips. Divide the chicken between two pieces of heavy duty foil, approximately 18 in square. Top each with half the vegetables, butter, tarragon, and onion. Season to taste with a seasoned salt. Close packets and grill, covered over medium heat for 15 to 20 minutes or until chicken jices run clear. ; name: berry margarita pie ; ingredients: pie crusts, frozen strawberries, cream cheese, margarita mix concentrate, tequila, frozen whipped topping ; preparation:Prepare pie crust as directed on package. Blend strawberries, cream cheese, and margarita mix concentrate until well blended. Pour into a bowl and fold in whipped topping. Pour into pie crust. Cover and freeze 1-2 hours, or until firm. Let stand briefly before slicing and serving. ; name: lehmonade ; ingredients: lemons, brown sugar, water, white sugar, ice ; preparation:Pour water into a pot. Squeeze the halved lemons into the water. Drop the already-squeezed lemons into the pot. Put in brown sugar and mix well. Start boiling the mixture. Boil for about 2 minutes. Leave to cool. Add white sugar. Serve over ice. ; name: julie s chicken and greens soup for sickies ; ingredients: water, instant chicken bouillon, garlic, angel hair pasta, mixed salad green ; preparation:Combine the water, bouillon, garlic, and pasta pieces. Let simmer for 5 minutes. Add greens and simmer for another 3 to 5 minutes or until greens are to the texture you like. Serve to the sickie and try to get them to eat as much as they can. Makes about 2 servings. ; name: savory slow cooker beef roast ; ingredients: boneless beef roast, onion, vegetable juice, brown gravy mix, garlic cloves, pepper, thyme ; preparation:Place beef in slowcooker. Add sliced onions. Mix together the vegetable juice, brown gravy mix, garlic, pepper and thyme. Pour liquid mix over beef in slowcooker. Cover with the lid and cook on low for about 7-8 hours or until desired doneness. ; name: easy bisquick bread ; ingredients: bisquick, granulated sugar, egg, milk, walnuts ; preparation:

name: double bran muffins ; ingredients: all-bran cereal, oat bran, flour, baking soda, salt, eggs, buttermilk, honey, vegetable oil, prune ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Grease muffin tins or line with paper cups. Combine bran cereal, oat bran, flour, baking soda and salt. In a separate bowl beat the eggs. Beat in buttermilk, honey and oil. Add to dry ingredients and stir just enough to blend. Fold in prunes. Pour into muffin cups and bake 20 minutes. ; name: ham asparagus strata ; ingredients: english muffins, cooked ham, asparagus, swiss cheese, egg substitute, fat free sour cream, skim milk, onions, dijon mustard, black pepper ; preparation:In a greased 2-quart baking dish spread half the muffin pieces. Top with ham, asparagus, and cheese. Top with remaining muffin pieces. In bowl whisk together eggs and sour cream. Stir in milk, onion, mustard, and black pepper. Pour over layers in dish. Cover, chill for 2 to 24 hours. Baked, uncovered in 325 degrees f oven 60 to 65 minutes or until internal temperature registers 170 degrees f on an instant-read thermometer. Let stand 10 minutes before serving. ; name: maple tofu pudding ; ingredients: soft tofu, corn oil, maple syrup, salt, vanilla extract, walnuts ; preparation:Drain the tofu and cut it into small pieces. Place the pieces in a blender. Add the oil, maple syrup, salt and vanilla. Put the lid on the blender. Process the mixture for a minute or two, or until the pudding is quite smooth. If necessary, turn off the blender, and scrape down the sides of the blender jar. Then put the lid back on and process some more. When the mixture is smooth, turn it into 4 small, resealable, half-cup containers. Chill until serving time, or serve right away if desired. If you like, you can sprinkle a tablespoon of finely chopped walnuts on top of each serving of pudding. I prefer black walnuts, but any type will do. ; name: crunchy peanut butter wraps ; ingredients: flour tortillas, peanut butter, granny smith apple, granola cereal ; preparation:Spread peanut butter over each tortilla. Warm in the microwave for 10-15 seconds. Sprinkle with chopped apple and granola. Roll up tortillas and cut in half. Enjoy. ; name: savory egg casserole ; ingredients: cheddar cheese, butter, cream, prepared mustard, salt, pepper, eggs ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Sprinkle cheese in 9x9 inch square baking dish. Dot with butter. Mix cream, mustard, salt, and pepper, and pour half of the mixture over the cheese. Pour eggs on top. Pour remaining cream mixture over the eggs. Bake 25 minutes. Serve immediately. ; name: italian wedding soup with 5 ingredients ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, chicken broth, thin spaghetti, black pepper, meatballs, baby spinach ; preparation:In a large pot, combine oil and onion. Cook over medium heat for 1 minute, or until sizzling. Add broth, pasta, and pepper. Bring to a boil. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes. Add meatballs and spinach. Reduce heat to low. Cook for 5 minutes or until pasta is tender. ; name: sugar crusted almond pastries ; ingredients: refrigerated crescent dinner rolls, butter, almonds, sugar ; preparation:Heat oven to 375 degrees f. Unroll dough into large rectangle on ungreased baking sheet. Seal perforations. Melt butter in saucepan, cooking and stirring until light golden brown. Add almonds and sugar. Stirring to coat. Spoon and spread this mixture evenly over the dough. Bake for 12 to 16 minutes until crust is deep golden brown. Cool 10 to 15 minutes. Cut into triangles and serve. ; name: a quinoa pilaf that you ll love ; ingredients: vegetable oil, onion, carrot, dried oregano, quinoa, chicken broth, salt, frozen peas, lemon juice, black pepper ; preparation:

name: mike timlin s jerked chicken ; ingredients: teriyaki sauce, ground ginger, salt, cayenne pepper, garlic, chicken pieces ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f. Grease a rimmed baking sheet and set aside. In a large bowl, stir together the teriyaki sauce, ginger, salt, cayenne and garlic. Add chicken to bowl, quickly turning pieces to coat them well with the sauce. Using tongs, place chicken pieces on prepared baking sheet, skin side down. Reserve any remaining sauce. Bake chicken, turning once and basting with the leftover sauce, for about 45 minutes or until chicken is browned and juices run clear when meat is pierced. ; name: deep dish turkey pot pie ; ingredients: hot water, chicken stuffing mix, cooked turkey, frozen mixed vegetables, turkey gravy ; preparation:Heat oven to 375 degrees f. Add water to stuffing mix. Stir just until moistened. Set aside. Place turkey and vegetables in 2-quart casserole. Pour gravy over turkey mixture. Stir gently, then top with prepared stuffing. Bake 30 minutes or until heated through. ; name: oatmeal nut pie crust ; ingredients: rolled oats, brown sugar, salt, vanilla, butter, walnuts ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Toast oatmeal in a shallow pan for 10 minutes to brown, watch carefully. Remove from oven and in small mixing bowl combine oatmeal with remaining ingredients. Press into 9-inch pie plate. Fill with desired filling and bake or bake crust empty for later use. ; name: coconut melon ; ingredients: unsweetened coconut milk, sugar, lime juice, coconut, honeydew melon ; preparation:In bowl, mix milk, sugar and lime juice. Stir well. Chill until ready to use. Place melon in lg bowl. Add coconut and stir gently to combine. Add coconut milk mixture and toss to coat. ; name: one pot pork chops ; ingredients: pork loin chops with bone, all-purpose flour, potatoes, baby carrots, water, worcestershire sauce, salt, dried oregano, condensed tomato soup ; preparation:Coat the pork chops with the flour and cook in large skillet until brown on both sides. Add the potatoes and carrots. Combine the water, worcestershire sauce, salt, and oregano in a small bowl. Pour over the pork and vegetables, cover and simmer for 25 minutes. Stir in the soup, recover, and simmer for an additional 10-15 minutes. ; name: twice baked potatoes with bacon and ranch ; ingredients: potatoes, butter, ranch dressing, cheddar cheese, green onion, bacon, salt and pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425. Cut cooked potatoes in half and scoop out the insides, leaving the shell intact. Combine the potato with remaining ingredients, except extra cheese. Mash and mix well. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Fill potato skins with mixture and top with the extra cheese. Bake at 425 until cheese melts and is golden brown. ; name: couscous for breakfast ; ingredients: milk, couscous, salt, rose water, dried fruit, sugar, ground cardamom, toasted almonds, strawberry ; preparation:Bring the milk to the boil without scorching. As soon as the milk starts to boil, stir in the couscous with a fork. Add a pinch of salt. Reduce heat, cover and cook on low for 4 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in the rose water or almond extract. Garnish couscous with dried fruit, sugar, cardamom and nuts. If you wish, add a few slices of strawberries to each serving. Also, you can pour a little bit of milk or cream on top. Serve hot. ; name: beef patties in gravy ; ingredients: ground beef, dry breadcrumbs, cheddar cheese, garlic powder, egg, mushroom soup, mushrooms, salt ; preparation:

name: smoked salmon fettuccine ; ingredients: butter, sour cream, flour, scotch, milk, smoked salmon, parsley, pasta ; preparation:Melt butter and whisk in flour. Gradually add milk and sour cream. Season with salt and pepper. Stir until thick. Add scotch or bourbon, salmon and parsley. Cook pasta and drain. Combine salmon mixture with pasta. Sprinkle with paprika and parmesan cheese. ; name: best ever hot chocolate ; ingredients: milk, water, instant nonfat dry milk powder, semi-sweet chocolate chips, sugar, cornstarch, chocolate whipped cream, cookie ; preparation:In pot, combine milk, water, dry milk powder, chocolate chips, sugar and cornstarch. Over medium-high heat, bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Reduce heat to low. Cook, whisking occasionally, until slightly thickened, 1-2 minutes. Top each serving with whipped topping and a cookie. ; name: kim s bruschetta ; ingredients: olive oil, tomatoes, roasted garlic, basil, romano cheese, asiago cheese, parmesan cheese, french bread, balsamic vinegar ; preparation:I use one large tomato, deseed it and chop it up. Add 2 tbs of olive oil, 1 tbs balsamic vinegar, garlic, and basil to this and set aside in a strainer. I usually put the french loaf in the oven for a few minutes before adding all the toppings, because i like it a little crispier. Let the bread come back to room temp, and brush with olive oil. Spoon on the tomatoes, and sprinkle on the 3 cheeses. I usually add a little more basil and pop in the oven until cheese is very hot, not melted. Bake at 375f. ; name: asparagus with gorgonzola sauce ; ingredients: asparagus, leeks, gorgonzola, parmigiano-reggiano cheese, sage, whipping cream, extra virgin olive oil, breadcrumbs ; preparation:Thoroughly clean the asparagus, cutting the tougher edge off. Bind them in small bunches and blanch. Let cool. Meanwhile, grease a baking pan and place the asparagus with the edges to the center of the pan. Finely slice the leek. Heat some olive oil in a pan, pour the leek in and gently saut over medium heat for 10 minutes. Add the sage, the whipping cream and the gorgonzola cheese and cook for 2-3 minutes or until the sauce begins to thicken. Pour the gorgonzola sauce on the asparagus, dust with a mixture of grated parmigiano and breadcrumbs and broil under the grill for 10 minutes. Serve immediately. ; name: katie s chocolate chip cookies ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, baking soda, butter, sugar, brown sugar, vanilla extract, instant vanilla pudding, eggs, chocolate chips, baking powder ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f. Mix dry ingredients with wire whisk. Add butter, eggs, and vanilla to dry mix. Stir in chips with your hands. Roll into 1-inch balls and place on ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 375f for 8-10 minutes. ; name: dates in spiced wine ; ingredients: dates, blanched almonds, walnuts, red wine, honey, pepper, cheese, coarse sea salt, lemon, zest of ; preparation:With a sharp knife, make a small cut lengthwise in the top of each date and remove the pit. Lightly toast the almonds and walnuts over medium-low heat. Using a teaspoon, fill the datees with the nut mixture. Simmer the wine, honey and pepper over medium heat for about 15 minutes. Place the dates, cut side up, in the pan and continue to simmer until warm or about 5 minutes. Serve the warm dates with the cheese wedges and top with a sprinkle of sea salt and lemon zest. ; name: grilled cheddar and bacon on raisin bread ; ingredients: unsalted butter, raisin bread, extra-sharp cheddar cheese, bacon ; preparation:Butter one side of each raisin bread slice and turn slices over. Arrange cheddar on unbuttered sides of bread and top 4 slices with bacon. Flip remaining bread onto bacon. Heat a nonstick sillet over moderate heat until hot and cook sandwiches in batches, pressing lighly with a spatula, until undersides are golden, about 1 minute. Turn sandwiches over and cook, pressing lightly until undersides are golden and cheese is melted about 1 minute. ; name: jug jug barbados ; ingredients: water, pigeon peas, meat, pork, seasoning, fresh thyme, fresh marjoram, cornflour, salt and pepper, butter ; preparation:

name: krispies chocolate caramel bars ; ingredients: flour, powdered sugar, margarine, vanilla caramels, evaporated milk, semi-sweet chocolate chips, shortening, crispy rice cereal ; preparation:Heat oven to 350f. Mix crust ingredients with fork until crumbly. Press mixture in ungreased 13x9-inch pan. Bake for 10-12 minutes. Cool slightly. In saucepan melt filling ingredients over low heat, stirring constantly. Spread over crust. Cool slightly. In saucepan over low heat, melt chocolate chips and shortening, stirring constantly. Stir in cereal. Carefully spread over filling. Cool completely. ; name: honey glazed hickory chicken ; ingredients: chicken, hickory chips, honey, lemon juice, salt, pepper ; preparation:Soak the wood chips in cool water for atleast 30 minutes and then place them in a shallow foil pan. Place the pan in the center of your grill while it is preheating. Meanwhile, in a large bowl mix together the honey, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Add the chicken pieces and toss to evenly coat. Place chicken on grill and cook until no longer pink on the inside, the time may vary depending on how big your chicken was. ; name: chicken penne with basil chilli parsley ; ingredients: penne pasta, chicken breasts, olive oil, chili, mushroom, baby spinach, asparagus, sun-dried tomatoes, basil, parsley ; preparation:Cook penne pasta following packed directions until tender. Drain. Heat olive oil in large, deep fry pan. Add chicken breast and fry until golden. Add mushrooms and gourmet garden chilli to pan and cook until mushrooms are tender. Add penne pasta, baby spinach, asparagus and semi sun-dried tomatoes to pan and squeeze in gourmet garden basil & parsley. Toss to combine and serve with grated parmesan cheese if desired. ; name: eggnog caramels ; ingredients: sugar, brown sugar, butter flavor shortening, light corn syrup, eggnog, ground nutmeg ; preparation:Line an 8x8-inch baking pan with a double-thickness of foil. Coat well with cooking spray. Place all ingredients in a heavy, deep-sided saucepan. Attach a candy thermometer to the side of the saucepan. Bring mixture to a boil over high heat, stirring constantly. Lower heat to medium and continue cooking, stirring constantly, until mixture reaches 245 degrees f. Immediately pour caramel mixture into prepared pan. Cool and refrigerate for 3 hours or more, until completely firm. Using foil, lift caramel slab from prepared pan. Pull the foil down from the sides of the caramel. Using a long knife, trim the edges off the caramel slab, and then cut the block of caramel into 8 rows. Cut each row into 8 squares. ; name: caramel apple bars ; ingredients: whole wheat flour, quick-cooking rolled oats, brown sugar, baking soda, butter, mini marshmallows, apples, caramels, water ; preparation:Combine flour, oats, sugar and baking soda. Cut in butter until mixture is crumbly. Set aside 1 cup of crumb mixture. Press remainder on bottom of greased 13 x 9 pan. Spread half of the marshmallows on top and sprinkle with apples. Top with reserved crumb mixture. Bake at 375 for 20 to 25 minutes. Sprinkle remaining marshmallows on top and place under broiler just until marshmallows are lightly golden, 1 to 2 minutes. Cool. Place caramels and water in small microwaveable bowl. Microwave on high for 1 minute, stir until smooth. Drizzle on top, chill to set caramel. ; name: authentic german potato salad ; ingredients: red potatoes, bacon, onion, water, white vinegar, sugar, salt, pepper, parsley ; preparation:Place the potatoes in a pot, with enough water to cover. Bring to a boil, and cook for about 10 minutes, or until easily pierced with a fork. Drain, set aside to cool. Place the bacon in a large deep skillet over medium-high heat. Cook until browned and crisp. Remove and set aside. Add onion to the bacon grease, and cook over medium heat until browned. Add the vinegar, water, sugar, salt and pepper to the pan. Bring to a boil, then add potatoes and parsley. Crumble half the bacon into the mix. Heat through, transfer to a serving dish. Crumble the remaining bacon over the top and serve warm. ; name: easy peanut blossoms ; ingredients: sweetened condensed milk, smooth peanut butter, biscuit mix, vanilla extract, white sugar, hershey chocolate kiss ; preparation:Mix milk and peanut butter until smooth. Add biscuit mix and vanilla. Shape into 1 inch balls. Roll in sugar. Place 2 inches apart on ungreased pan. Bake at 375 degrees for 6-8 minutes or until light brown. While cookies are baking, unwrap hersheys. Press kisses into center as soon as cookies are out of oven. ; name: south african curried eggs ; ingredients: butter, onions, curry powder, cake flour, salt, fresh ground black pepper, sugar, apple cider vinegar, water, hard-boiled eggs ; preparation:

name: drumstick dessert ; ingredients: graham wafers, peanuts, butter, peanut butter, cream cheese, white sugar, vanilla, eggs, cool whip, chocolate syrup ; preparation:Mix first 4 ingredients and press into a 9x13 pan. Cream next 3 ingredients together. Add vanilla, the eggs, and cool whip. Spread filling into crust. Dribble on sauce and marbilize with a knife. Sprinkle remaining crumbs on top. Freeze. Thaw before eating. ; name: different deviled eggs ; ingredients: hard-boiled eggs, cream cheese, sweet pickle relish, dry mustard, salt and pepper ; preparation:Peel eggs and halve lengthwise. Place yolks in a mixing bowl and set whites aside. Mash yolks with the cream cheese, then add the relish and the dry mustard. Substitute 2 tsp prepared yellow mustard if dry mustard powder is not available. Stir well. Taste filling and add salt and pepper to taste. Fill whites, either with a teaspoon or get fancy and use a pastry bag with a star. Traditional garnish is a sprinkling of paprika. ; name: radonsky for the new millennium by alton brown ; ingredients: littleneck clams, flour, seasoned bread crumbs, parmesan cheese, kosher salt, fresh pepper, bacon fat, fresh parsley, malt vinegar ; preparation:Half shell the clams and set them aside. Mix the flour, bread crumbs, parmesan, salt, and pepper. In a large pan over high heat, render the bacon fat. Sprinkle a generous coating of the flour mixture over all the clams and carefully place them flesh side down, using a spoon, into the fat. Cook for about two minutes and remove to serving plates flesh side up. Top them with fresh parsley and malt vinegar. ; name: strawberry refrigerator pie ; ingredients: vanilla pudding mix, milk, strawberry jell-o gelatin dessert, frozen strawberries, graham cracker crust ; preparation:Cook the vanilla pudding according to pkg. Directions. Remove from stove and stir the package of jello into the hot pudding. Add the frozen strawberries. Stir until the strawberries are well melted. Pour into pie crust and refrigerate. ; name: grilled or broiled rosemary chicken ; ingredients: whole chickens, garlic cloves, extra virgin olive oil, dijon mustard, fresh lemon juice, fresh rosemary, ground black pepper, salt ; preparation:Mix together the garlic, oil, mustard and lemon juice in a blender and porcess until smooth. Add rosemary and pepper. Brush over chicken pieces, cover, and chill 6 hours or overnight. Discard any excess marinade. Prepare grill by brushing grates lightly with oil andheating to medium heat. Grill chicken 12 minutes, flip over and cook another 20-25 minutes or until fully cooked. Or, if broiling, preheat broiler to the broil setting and place chicken on an oiled broiling pan. Broil about 7 inches from the heat source for about 25 minutes, flip over and broil another 20 minutes or until fully cooked. ; name: fresh pasta shrimp salad ; ingredients: mayonnaise, plain yogurt, fresh basil, scallion, garlic clove, red wine vinegar, medium pasta shell, frozen peas, shrimp, avocado ; preparation:In blender or food processor, puree the first 6 ingredients until smooth. Pour into serving bowl. Add cooked pasta, peas, shrimp, and avocado. Toss to coat well. Salt and pepper to taste. ; name: basil green beans ; ingredients: fresh green beans, spring onion, margarine, dried basil leaves, garlic powder, pepper ; preparation:Trim and snap green beans into thirds. Mince the onion. Put water on to boil to steam beans. As soon as water boils, steam beans for 12 to 17 minutes or until tender. Melt margarine for beans and saut onions until tender. Add steamed beans, basil, garlic powder and pepper. Toss beans with basil sauce to coat evenly and serve. ; name: low fat bay shrimp and swiss omelet ; ingredients: egg whites, egg, skim milk, bay shrimp, scallions, extra virgin olive oil, low-fat swiss cheese ; preparation:

name: auntie em s easy chicken pot pie ; ingredients: deep dish pie shells, chunk chicken, mixed vegetables, french fried onion rings, condensed cream of chicken soup, salt ; preparation:Prick bottom of pie shell all over with fork. Bake, uncovered, at 375 for 10 minutes. Combine chicken, vegetables, onion rings, soup, and salt. Fill bottom pie shell with mixture. Place second pie shell on top. Prick with fork in 6 places. Set on a foil-covered oven rack to catch spills. Bake uncovered at 375 for 40 minutes. ; name: apple vichyssoise with bleu cheese ; ingredients: butter, sweet onion, apples, white wine, chicken stock, heavy cream, blue cheese, salt and pepper, apple ; preparation:Melt the butter in a heavy saucepan. Sweat the onions over low heat until they are clear and soft, but not brown. Add the diced apples and cook until they are soft. Add the wine and chicken stock and cream and bring to a simmer. Add the bleu cheese, to taste. Check the seasoning, and add salt and pepper if desired. Puree the soup in a blender and then refrigerate overnight or until well chilled. Serve chilled, top with a garnish of finely diced apples. ; name: herb grilled corn ww ; ingredients: corn, butter, salt, fresh cilantro stems, dried rosemary, dried thyme ; preparation:Preheat grill to medium high. Tear off 4 sheets of tin foil. Brush corn evenly with melted butter and sprinkle with salt, cilantro sprigs and with the rosemary and thyme. Wrap corn with the tin foil. Place wrapped corn on the grill and grill covered until corn in tender. ; name: frog hollow chicken sandwiches ; ingredients: chicken breast fillet, white wine, celery, celery leaves, fresh chives, mayonnaise, lemon, juice of, salt and pepper, bread ; preparation:Preheat oven to 180 c. Place chicken in baking dish with celery leaves and wine. Cover dish with foil and cook chicken 20 - 30 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool. Drain. Roughly chop chicken. Mix in a large bowl with with all other ingredients, adding enough mayonnaise to moisten chicken and bind ingredients. Cut crusts off of bread and spoon mixture on the centre of half the bread and spread to the edge with knife. Top with remaining half of bread, pressing down gently. Cut each sandwich into 3 fingers. Place in baking dish cover with a damp tea towel and seal with plastic wrap. Sandwiches can be stored in refrigerator up to 6 hours. ; name: ranch marinated pork chops ; ingredients: pork chops, ranch dressing, worcestershire sauce, dry mustard, garlic cloves, onion powder ; preparation:Wash and pat dry pork chops with paper towel. Poke several holes in them with a fork. In a shallow baking pan, mix together rest of ingredients. Place pork in marinade, turning to coat completely. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour, turning at least once. Preheat oven to 275 degrees. Remove cover from pan, bake chops for about 30 minutes, turning at least once during cooking. Serve with baked potatoes, using cooked marinade and pan drippings to top. ; name: cranberry sauce cake ; ingredients: flour, sugar, mayonnaise, whole berry cranberry sauce, orange juice, orange rind, baking soda, salt, powdered sugar, milk ; preparation:Mix all cake ingredients well. Place in sprayed tube pan, i put waxed paper in the bottom before i spray it. Bake at 350 for 60-70 minutes or until pick comes out clean. Cool in pan 10 minutes, turn over onto plate. Cool completely. Mix icing ingredients well and drizzle over cooled cake. ; name: cheesy green chile corn ; ingredients: whole kernel corn, cream cheese, diced green chilies, colby-monterey jack cheese, seasoning ; preparation:In a medium saucepan, combine corn, cream cheese and green chiles. Heat over medium high heat until the cream cheese is melted and smooth. Add shredded cheddar cheese and seasonings. Heat until cheese is melted. Pour into greased casserole dish and top with additional cheddar cheese, as much as you like. Bake in a preheated 350-degree oven until cheese is melted and bubbling, about 25 minutes. You may prefer to drain both cans if you want less sauce. ; name: homemade butternut squash soup ; ingredients: butternut squash, vegetable broth, onion, carrots, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, ground black pepper, half-and-half ; preparation:

name: buttercrumb parsnips ; ingredients: parsnip, milk, fine dry breadcrumb, salt, dry mustard, fresh ground pepper, butter ; preparation:Peel and trim parsnips. Boil whole until just tender in lightly salted water, about 10 minutes. Drain, pat dry. Pour milk into a small, shallow bowl, combine breadcrumbs with salt, mustard, and pepper in shallow pan. Melt butter in a medium frying pan over medium heat. Roll each parsnip first in milk, then in the breadcrumbs and place in butter. Fry, turning four time, until parsnips are golden and crisp all round. Watch carefully so as not to burn the butter and adjust heat as necessary. ; name: turkish sulu patates watery potatoes ; ingredients: potatoes, chicken breasts, tomatoes, onion, red pepper paste, oil ; preparation:Cut the tomatoes in half, dividing the top from the bottom. In a medium-large pot use a grader to shred the tomatoes until all that is left is the skin. Discard the skin. Adding onions, pepper paste, and oil to pot, stir over high heat until onions are soft. Add potatoes, cook 5-10 minutes stirring occasionally. Add chicken, cook until just white. Add hot water until food is covered. Cook until potatoes are done. Serve with red pepper flakes to season. ; name: easy homemade chicken salad ; ingredients: cooked chicken, celery, green onion, lemon juice, pepper, mayonnaise, sweet pickle relish, prepared mustard, hard-boiled eggs ; preparation:In medium mixing bowl combine first three ingredients. Stir in the lemon juice and pepper. Combine the mayo, pickle relish and prepared mustard. Add this sauce to chicken and gently stir in the eggs. Cover and chill until ready to serve. ; name: bacon and bagels low fat ; ingredients: miniature bagels, turkey bacon, fat-free cream cheese, whole tomato, cooking oil ; preparation:Add a bit of oil in a frying pan at medium high heat.
